reviews.text: Always satisfied when I eat here, but the price seems to be getting higher and higher.  The wait for their outdoor dining was an hour and half long so we ordered togo and had a picnic style lunch which was perfect!  But back to the price...ordered Chicken Samosas, Korean Fried Cauliflower and TexMex Eggrolls for appetizer, Kids Flatbread Cheese Pizza and Lunch Miso Salmon as entrees, with the seasonal Pumpkin Pecan Cheesecake for dessert...$73!  WOW!  Didn&#39;t even order drinks!  The Miso Salmon and TexMex Eggrools have been my goto for at least 10 years now and I still love it just as much.  Tried the Chicken Samosas for the first time and I highly recommend it if you enjoy the Indian flavors without the heat.  I did not particularly enjoy the Korean Fried Cauliflower!  Too much batter and dripped in sweet sauce that it takes away from the crunch of the actual veggie!    They did pack the food up beautifully and provided the utensils.   It&#39;s one of those places that you go to every now and again.  The menu is very extensive so you&#39;ll never not find anything to eat, of anything, it will be hard to decide!
Food is always great here! I get the miso salmon , chicken Madeira, and sweet tamales! Grant H is an excellent server and very attentive! Would just come for his service! Thank you!

The truth about reviewing The Cheesecake Factory is that it is just white noise. This Factory of cheese and cake has been around for 12 years, and it won&#39;t be leaving the Americana anytime soon. <br><br>But, I choose to review it all the same. I cannot say I am a fan. To put it simply, I am always wary of restaurants that try to do too many things at once. Cheesecake is the poster child of this shotgun approach to cuisine. If it&#39;s a food on Earth, it has probably lived on a Cheesecake menu at some point. And that&#39;s exactly my issue. The result of trying to make too many different kinds of foods is that none of them end up being very high quality. Sure they have decent appetizers, yes they have a variety of entrees and salads and desserts, but I would much rather go to a Yard House or BJ&#39;s. Cheesecake just feels too commercial, too chintzy. I only really come to the CF when my wife forces us to because she adores it with a reverence that boggles my brain.<br><br>On top of allll that, years ago the Center for Science in the Public Interest named the CF the winner of its Xtreme Eating survey. This is one accolade I&#39;m sure the Factory doesn&#39;t want you knowing about. At the time, Cake of Cheese had 3 of the 9 most calorie-laden dishes in the country. In fact, I&#39;m sure if you browse with a careful eye, you&#39;ll see the behemoth calorie cows on the menu ALL over the place. <br><br>I&#39;ve never had any issue with the staff, nor have I found anything obscenely wrong with my meal, but Cheesecake is one restaurant I will gladly give a hard pass, whenever I can.

My sister was in town and my family wanted to celebrate by going to the Cheesecake Factory. We went on a Monday night at 6:00 p.m. and were surprised by the 30-minute wait because I&#39;ve been multiple times during a work week and the wait has been very minimal, if any. I understand that wait times will vary, but I wanted to provide context because by the time we were seated at 6:30 p.m., we had to wait another 15-20 minutes for someone to take our order at 6:50 p.m., and then another 45 minutes for our meals to come at 7:45 p.m.! It took almost 2 hours to begin to eat. At this time, it was already getting late and we were hungry. So just to emphasize, the waiter takes our order at 6:50 p.m. 30 minutes pass by and we still haven&#39;t received our food. Then it&#39;s 45 minutes later and still no food. It&#39;s completely not acceptable and something is wrong if we come at 6:00 p.m. and we don&#39;t eat until almost past 8:00 p.m. That is absolutely crazy. <br><br>The worst part is when parties who arrive significantly later than us start receiving their meals before us. That is one of my biggest pet peeves. I had noticed that other parties were getting their orders taken right away and the food was served right after. It was terribly not consistent. What&#39;s worse is that no one checked-in with us. WTF. The waiter checks-in with other tables and not us. I was most annoyed when 30 minutes pass by and the other tables who arrived after us are already wrapping up their meals. It should not haven taken 45 minutes since we placed our order--period. I had to express to the wait staff that this is way too long to be getting our food. I had ordered the Parmesan crusted chicken and my family had ordered a simple Caesar salad and Chinese chicken salad, but it should not have taken 45 minutes to make a salad! My chicken was also a lot tinier than in my previous visits. At this point, we were all hungry after a long day and we just wanted to eat and leave.<br><br>Overall, it was completely unacceptable and there was nothing to remedy our situation. It left a really sour taste in my mouth and makes me not want to go back to Cheesecake Factory or recommend this place to anyone. What was suppose to be a celebratory night turned into a terribly disappointing one at this Cheesecake Factory. Do not recommend at all.

So I went to the Cheesecake Factory yesterday afternoon, while I was waiting on my car to get service. I ordered the crispy Brussels sprout (amazing), the small plate crab balls (pretty good) and some kind of tater tots that was pretty blan but crispy (thumbs up for crispy). I&#39;m giving it a one star because my glass was filthy and I didn&#39;t realize it until I was on my second cup os seltzer water. Someone disgusting finger print was on my glass along with smeared food. It was dark in there so I couldn&#39;t see it at fIrst. I went to the the host and asked for the mangers business card. I was sooooo upset that I just wanted to leave! I&#39;ll follow with my review once I talked to the manager!

It was a very hot day in Glendale, and I was waiting for a friend. I walked inside to check-in 20 minutes before his arrival and I felt I was not welcome and could not get a single person to speak with. So a short Hispanic lady which happened to be host came up and asked how many people are in your party? I said 2 but he is not yet, she said to check with me when your friend is here. It was very odd had to walk around and wait when I could sit down and start with ordering drinks or food. Cheesecake service has gone down every sign time I visit them.

I&#39;ve never really been a big fan of cheesecake because the flavors seemed always so...blah, BUT we recently ordered and they really made an effort to make food delivery taste delicious!<br><br>It was well prepared and the sauces I requested were all there!<br><br>Keep it up!

If the weather is nice be sure to ask for an outdoor table facing the fountain. Need to use the restroom? Be careful. You&#39;ll most likely almost run into about four different people with the crowds and sharp corners. The lighting inside at night is very, very dark. I love it here during the day. Recently, the poke has changed and is really spicy. They left the avocado off recently with no explanation. Be sure to checK your to go box if they box things up for you. They left out our mashed potatoes and my boyfriends vanilla bean cheesecake was actually banana cream.

In her book, &#34;Don&#39;t Kill the Birthday Girl: Tales from an Allergic Life,&#34; Sandra Beasley details how The Cheesecake Factory servers refused to make substitutions, couldn&#39;t state what ingredients were in the food, and were not familiar with the menu at all.  This made for a dangerous combination for someone with allergies like Ms. Beasley, but just translates to a major annoyance and time suck for the rest of us.<br><br>Tonight, we went to get take-out, which took us a little under an hour and a half.  We ordered the following:<br><br>Salmon with mashed potatoes<br>Lemon Garlic Shrimp <br>Sliders with a side of fries off the kids&#39; menu for my son<br>Blackout cake<br><br>Instead of the Lemon Garlic Shrimp, they put in Shrimp Scampi.  They also charged us for 2 orders of sliders which cost $25 instead of the kids&#39; menu version which cost $7.95.  After overcharging us, they couldn&#39;t figure out how to undo it, and had to get the manager involved.  The manager lost our receipt, and had to reprint it so that we could review it for further errors due to the previous two.<br><br>We were told it would be ready in 20 minutes, so we walked around outside, and then went back to pick up our order.  When we tried to go back inside, we were stopped by the host, Van.  Van is what happens when your mother does meth when she&#39;s pregnant.  He informed us we had to wait outside to be seated.  We explained that we were picking up our order, and held up our receipt, which felt especially strange since Van had literally just seen us 20 minutes prior.  He insisted we had to wait outside.  We weren&#39;t the only one Van inconvenienced, so I don&#39;t take it personally.  Van had two brain cells left, and they were saying goodbye to each other.  He had people 10-deep waiting in line just to claim our food.  While our food got cold, Van split his time and limited brain space taking names for those wanting to dine indoors and allowing those of us who had already placed our orders inside to pick them up.  To say that this was an exercise in incompetence would be an understatement.<br><br>When we finally got inside to get our food, my son&#39;s fries were missing from the order.  We had to wait again while the same girl who had originally messed up our order and overcharged us ran to the back to get the fries that had been left out.<br><br>The picture of the blackout cake is below.  As you can see, they smashed the plastic holder down so hard, the icing on the case got stuck on the top, peeling off when we opened it, which was a fitting end to this hellish experience.<br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is facing bankruptcy allegedly due to the COVID-19 pandemic.  You may have seen their cheesecake ice cream in the freezer section of your local grocery store or their special &#34;bread&#34; in the bakery section.  This is their last desperate effort to save their drowning company.<br><br>With their heinous customer service, brainless hosts, overpriced meals, and subpar food, I will watch with delight as they go down in flames.  Good riddance.

The cheesecake factory is Is always amazing and the one at the Glendale Galleria is no exception. The view is amazing and next-door is a Tesla store the Apple store and so many amazing stories including the Amazon store. Make sure to check out the cheesesteak factory at the Americana if ever in the area.
I love it &amp; enjoined the food as always.. yes I love their pastas like spaghetti  &amp; other pasta.. I even like taco steak etc.

I ordered my takeout meal two days ago on line.  <br>The process was easy, effortless and I was able to pay on line prior to leaving the house.<br><br>I selected the time I wanted my meal to be ready for pick up which gave me the necessary time to respond.<br><br>I was met by an employee at the door who directed me to the appropriate line inside for meal pickup.<br><br>A manager approached me once in line asked me my name and if I prepaid, which I did.<br><br>He then responded to the area behind the bakery section, found my meal, which had my name and receipt attached to the bag, and handed it to me.<br><br>Again an easy, well thought out process which seemed effortless, but I know they put a lot of hard work and consistency to achieve. <br><br>I also noticed that their outside dining was open and bustling with customers.<br><br>All the wait staff where wearing appropriate face covering and everything seemed to be very clean in a nice enjoyable outside environment.<br><br>Oh yes, that&#39;s right I enjoyed my meal as well once I arrived home.<br><br>All items were separately packaged, appropriate sanitary utensils were supplied and the meal was scrumptious.<br>And yes, their excellent bread came with as well.<br><br>Keep up the GOOD WORK.<br>Much Appreciated.

Came to cheesecake for the first time with my friend, vanessa the cashier had a bit of an attitude when I realized I wasn&#39;t in line,  I didn&#39;t know where the line was cause no one told me anything, look I get it I get frustrated too cause I work as in dining as well, but I never take it out on my customers, people make mistakes, don&#39;t be so rude.  Horrible first experience, so uncomfortable

The female manager here is extremely rude. <br><br>I came here with my girlfriend and upon being seated I was asked to wear a mask so I clarified about the rules for wearing a mask that we have to be wearing a mask while standing and can remove them while sitting? <br><br>The lady got super emotional and said &#34;Technically, you are required to wear one as soon as you step into the building, even when you are in the bathroom&#34;... with an attitude and stern voice, then we were sat at the back of the restaraunt in the corner at a small table. It seemed as though she was bothered by my mask question so as payback she sat us in the worst table.<br><br>I love to eat at cheesecake factory and I don&#39;t fault them for this lady&#39;s anger issues.

6/23/20: We were glad to see Cheesecake factory  reopen for dine-in. We understand restarting a dine-in operation takes organization, training, and time.<br>The food was great as usual; the drinks were weak though- were they leftovers from happy hour?<br>Service could be greatly improved. That is reflected in the restaurant&#39;s hospitality, at this point - a failure. You got to re-earn those higher ratings. Having to ask for salad plates, not getting outside sitting even with a reservation,<br>not being asked if all the food was well, no acknowlege about our anniversary celebration. <br>We waited so long we had to put on our walking masks for the waiter  to reappear. By that time it was too late to enjoy ordering some of your delicious cheesecakes. Get with it, please- there are other places to dine.

I went here with Debra R and Jose R for lunch. I got the stuffed cheeseburger. Debra R got the salmon and Jose R got the fish tacos. We also got the hummus appetizer and the apple dessert. The food was really good and the customer service was good too.
I come here for all birthdays !! The food is good and the service is as well due to Covid there&#39;s no on door winking

Update. <br>So they gave me petty 50$ gift card. <br>I used it just now and guess what <br>Huge chunk of dirt in my cezar. THEY DONT WASH THEIR GREENS AT ALL. <br>I&#39;m going to contact health control in Glendale and my lawyer. You guys don&#39;t deserve to be open.<br><br>Never going there anymore

This place isn&#39;t terrible but not amazing either. Good place to go as a staple when you don&#39;t want to go anywhere expensive. Food is great but service is pretty average. Very long wait sometimes.

They need to hire non-racist hosts. My boyfriend and I decided to go eat there today and we waited 2 hours to be called since it was pretty busy. We didn&#39;t mind because we really wanted to eat there. As soon as we got a text we headed to the restaurant where the person in the front was very kind and respectful who sent us inside where there was this rude as girl who looked at my boyfriend and I as if we entered into a place where we don&#39;t belong. She wasn&#39;t even looking at us in the face! I&#39;m always quiet and tried to avoid making the moment more tense but she got me really upset so I gave her an attitude back and that&#39;s when she  started to be nice because she noticed I had notice her attitude towards us. Her only job as a host is to make us feel welcome not unwanted.

After going here for a birthday, I noticed why this is my least favorite place to eat. I rather eat at McDonald&#39;s than here. Wait times vary between 30-45 mins if your lucky. Sometimes its even more. The staff seem very bored and tired of their job and they don&#39;t really bother coming to your table often to ask if you need anything. And the food... I mean every time I eat here I get food poisoning. I ordered orange chicken and I wished I had gone to Panda Express because it was so disgusting. Nothing here tastes good. And then after being told its a friends birthday, they brought a cake and charged us for it without mentioning it before hand. I mean even iHop offers free pancakes on your birthday but apparently this restaurant is too good for that. <br><br>Long story short, if your in the mood for long wait times, food poisoning, rude staff, and disgusting food pay this place a visit !

No words. <br>I ordered Impossible taco salad soon through web site and I was really disappointed with they put some cheese into the salad bc I chose NO CHEESE. I&#39;m allergic with dairy products and I was busy and didn&#39;t eat whole day and eventually I got the salad which I couldn&#39;t eat! I was too far with I found they did my order wrong so I couldn&#39;t replace it. <br>Next time but I wish it will never happen I&#39;ll put an additional comment NO. FKN. CHEESE! <br>By the way their food is overpriced anyway and most people are complaining about on their taste and quality

Oh brown bread, sweet brown bread. <br><br>My co-workers were determined for me to taste this wheaty goodness and the waitress knew what we were after too. <br><br>She brought four bins of just the wheat bread (no sourdough) for the three of us. And extra butter. What a champion. <br><br>Also, the lamp looks like the Eye of Sauron.

Surprisingly, the wait to get seated on a Saturday afternoon during the holidays was surprisingly short. Fifteen minutes for a party of 8 is short for me for a place like this. <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is located inside the Americana at Brand. There is a large waiting area and an even larger-than-expected (of course) dining area.<br><br>Water and bread came swiftly after we ordered. Bread is so soft and still warm!<br><br>Their SHRIMP SCAMPI PASTA is full of butter and garlic: I love it!

Where is the leadership? The team clearly needs it. I ordered six cheesecake slices online for a birthday celebration and went in to pick up. When I came home I realized one of the slices is missing. I called and the woman fumbled around on hold for 15 minutes, couldn&#39;t find the order while she had the order number and offers a $10 giftcard that is supposed to make me happy because &#34;it&#39;s more than the cheesecake you ordered.&#34; I offer my number so she can call me back when she finds the order instead of wasting more time. She says uh huh and hangs up the phone. I get a call back that the 7.95 plus tax will be refunded in three days and that it will take another 7 days to process. Thanks for wasting my time, messing up the order, and neglecting to offer any form of customer service.

Jesus Christ. I used to love Cheesecake Factory from the food to the service. You&#39;d think that during COVID19, they would implement changing gloves regularly ESPECIALLY when handling food but apparently to them, mashed potatoes go great with red velvet cheesecake (yeah, they cross contaminated mashed potatoes with my mums red velvet birthday cheesecake). Super disappointed and grossed out. <br>Also, when I called to let them know, the manager tried to argue with me that because the plastic was still wrapped around the cake, that it wasn&#39;t possible for the mashed potato that got inside the box to ALSO be in the cake. What the hell is the bloody mashed potato DOING INSIDE THE BLOODY CAKE BOX IN THE FIRST PLACE MATE? I&#39;d expect a manager to start off by apologizing for the inconvenience and provide some kind of compensation for the shitty experience but instead, I&#39;m interrogated by the placement of the potatoes inside the box. Lmao <br>IT TAKES ALOT OUT OF ME TO WRITE A BAD REVIEW for a restaurant I&#39;ve loved since day 1. Disappointing.

I have been to CKF many times in the past and have never been disappointed. Today is no exception. The reservation was very easy to make and the restaurant was not crowded. We were at the one at the Americana in Glendale. Our server Jennifer was very friendly and respectful. It was nice to be dining in once again.
This is the closest location to me. Still accepting online order and it&#39;s not too far off the way.  Good service and good food at fair prices.

This cheescake factory has nostalgic feelings in my heart. Perfect for birthday celebrations, graduation celebrations, or just a fancier dinner in the Americana in Glendale. <br><br>FOOD: We got the avocado fries as a starter... it was okay. It was basically just avocado dipped in a very thick batter and fried. The sauces were like thousand island and aioli. The the salad we got was some type of kale salad that was very fresh and HUGE as is the norm with CheeseCake Factory portion sizes. SHARE everything. And the farfalle pasta we got was delicious... a lot of quantity with a lot of toppings. Cheescake desserts can be ordered at the end or to-go at a separate stall near the front. <br><br>SERVICE: Service was pretty quick. We were sitting outdoors when we usually sit indoors but our servers came quickly and we were able to make our orders at a reasonable pace. We went on a Friday lunch time, so I&#39;m not sure if the weekend would be different (actually, it will be very different on Saturday and Sunday weekends). The line is out the door on these days to even GET SEATED. Usually you put your name down at the front kiosk and they give you a buzzer and you wait and wait until they call your name or your buzzer buzzes. <br><br>AMBIENCE: Nosiy, with families. Very busy pace. But always giving out that delicious brown free bread with butter does make for a busy establishment. Really beautiful inside, high ceilings with booths and outside you can have a nice view of the fountain. <br><br>Overall, would come again with a large family or group of friends. :)

Very disappointed in our service. We ordered 4 meals and this is what we received. <br>1. Breakfast. Ketchup not delivered per request <br>2. Chicken salad. No chicken <br>3. Carbonara was fine<br>4. Chicken salad sandwich with side salad.  I paid extra for the Ceasar salad with dressing on the side. They sent no dressing. I know it&#39;s Easter Sunday. But I&#39;m not an Easter bunny.  I need dressing with my lettuce. <br>5. For four meals they sent one serving of the bread and butter. Geez<br><br>Update. They credited us $9. We would s preferred our food.  But we definitely appreciate  Cheesecake Factory acknowledging our disappointment. Kudos! <br><br>On the plus side...the food we actually received is yummy. I&#39;m going to change my rating from 2 Stars to 5 Stars.

Today was a rainy day in LA and not the best time to go to Cheesecake Factory because the restaurant had a lot of leaks happening, especially by the front entrance. All the managers and waiters were panicking and running around putting buckets so the water will go everywhere. Our waitress was very kind and she was trying her best to get the orders in as quickly as possible and get them on the table the same way. We were a big group and two kids were with us and our waitress did a good job getting the kids&#39; orders out fast as well. I ordered the Brulé French toast, which fit that description-  It really was the best French toast I had an a very long time. I also ordered that Huevos Ranchero breakfast. They were amazing! The black beans and the eggs were perfectly cooked. <br>Over all out experience was great here and the food was wonderful as well.

This review is based only on taste and quality of the food and not on service or wait time. <br>I got the crispy fried chicken sandwich and the taste was below average in the sense that the chicken really had no taste. All of the flavor was coming from the coleslaw and some other ingredients. I even took the chicken out of the sandwich to eat it by itself and it was bland. The french fries tasted like generic frozen french fries you find it at small diners. Even worse actually. For how big this restaurant is they should really make their own fresh cut french fries since a good amount of their dishes offer fries.

Still no progress here unfortunately.  No system in place. This place is constantly changing where to line up, who takes the order.... wow cheese cake is supposed to be a well oiled machine. Not this one. Sorry,I wish I can give you more stars....

Shit food, crappy service, forced waiting, and they don&#39;t even let dogs in strollers even when seated outside.   Fuck these people. At least have a decent restaurant and food before you put dumb restrictions like that.<br><br>Never again will I go to this establishment and will make doubly sure everyone I know doesn&#39;t either.

I love Cheesecake Factory, but Glendale at Americana was disappointing. First, the place was freezing; 66 degrees in the dining room on a Friday, summer night. Why?  Who wants to lug jackets around in summer?  We&#39;re in nice summer clothes and the place is an icebox. I mentioned it to two waiters and the front desk and they said they&#39;d look into it, and the manager was no where to be found. <br>Food was decent, but this management team could care less so don&#39;t bother. <br>Our last trip to CF was in a San Diego by the Gaslight and that place was great. Oh well, it&#39;s hit or miss.

The servIce is awful. My husband I decide to have a late dinner before the movies on Friday, it was around 10pm they weren&#39;t busy and had full staff. They sat us down right away and I was super surprised and thankful for that. <br><br>30 minutes passed and no one walked over to get our order for drinks or anything. So I walked up to the waitress nearby and asked if someone can take our order. <br><br>We missed the movie because they were working on snail  pace and the food was just awful and poorly prepared.<br><br>I&#39;ve had a bad experience at this particular location  in the past , but because we are local I thought they might have improved. I am done giving them a chance , with the poor quality service and food you get, you&#39;re better off just going to a quick drive-through and picking up something fast.

Sassy ass motherfuckers. Petty as shit. First they leave me on fucking hold for 10 fucking minutes then wanna give me attitude okay. Have fun with your $26 dollar ass cheesecakes. You&#39;re gonna end up like Outback Steakhouse.

Who doesn&#39;t like Chessecake for lunch or brunch? Should be against the law lol this place always delivers. Normally sit with my main man Justin at the bar. <br><br>Great atmosphere, good food and always go above &amp; beyond for their patrons. <br><br>Why you gotta fight with me at Cheesecake, girl you know I love to go there
Excellent food as always! Great service. <br>We came at 11:30am, so there was no wait. It&#39;s one of my favorite restaurants, so of course I will return! I&#39;m glad they have so many locations

We were shopping at Americana when we decided to have dinner at Cheesecake Factory. We were well aware of the high volume of people present at Americana and Glendale galleria mall. We were quoted an hour wait which we found reasonable for the high volume of people also waiting for a table. <br><br>We were quoted an hour and 15 minutes and were sat exactly at our quoted time. I really appreciate when restaurants have accurate wait times. We were sat with Puja G. and we are so grateful she was our server. <br><br>We understand how long it may take for drinks and food to be ready during the holidays so we tend to be more patient. We ordered tea and a martini. The tea was immediately delivered because our server prepares it. The martini took a bit longer which is understandable. <br><br>We then ordered the ahi tuna tartare to start off with and we then split the shrimp scampi. <br><br>The shrimp scampi arrived before our appetizer. As bad as we felt about returning the main plate until our appetizer arrived we had to. I can&#39;t imagine having a pasta plate followed by the ahi tuna tartare. Puja very politely explained she did place our appetizer first but the main plate unfortunately arrived before. However, she made sure to fix the whole mistake swiftly. She brought out our appetizer. As soon as we finished the scampi plate was brought out. Both plates were great, we had tried the shrimp scampi plate before. <br><br>It was our first time trying the ahi Tuna tartare and it was so great!! Very light and delicious. <br><br>At the end of our meal PUJA G. came up to us and gifted us a loaf of their brown bread. She apologized for the timing mishap and told us she noticed how much we loved the brown bread and was more than happy to give us a loaf to apologize. We found her initiative so inspiring. She truly understands the meaning of what amazing customer service is! It does not mean flawless timing. It means caring and sympathetic service. <br><br>Puja is an amazing addition to the Cheesecake Factory company. We look forward to frequenting this location again and requesting Puja as our server. She truly cares about your dining experience. She will do whatever she can to make up for mishaps. <br><br>THANK YOU PUJA.

I like the pop up to take in consideration the COVID when reviewing the restaurant. I would agree not to say anything negative, if my concern was not serious. I am a Glendale resident and appreciate we still can count on food  delivery. Our delivery arrived quick. First bite on burned fried macaroni and cheese, something is not right. It is a piece of green, hard, thin wire. I was so discussed and nauseated that the only thing I could do was to trash the whole order out (153.25). By the way, a year ago when dining in, I was awarded a piece of glass in my shake. At that time, they  apologized and replaced it with a new drink. As I worry what to expect on my next attempt, I would rather stop patronizing the establishment. As a customer, I did my part trying to eat good food and help out local restaurant during this difficult times.  This location should be monitored by their corporate office and City of Glendale Health Department for health hazard.
I don&#39;t like the service <br>They star serving one by one went they finished the last the first plate was cool <br>I make a reservation for 6  they give me small table

I miss their factory burger, that used to be my go-to. I tried the Mac &amp; Cheese burger and it was just so-so, not really worth the extra stuff, just get a regular burger.<br><br>I really like their orange chicken though and should have gotten that for my entree this go around.<br><br>And as usual the best thing here is the CHEESECAKE! I love their Reese&#39;s cheesecake and we tried their pineapple upside down cheesecake which was AMAZING!

Trust the other negative reviews. Mediocre food, horrible service. <br><br>Came here for breakfast this morning; we&#39;re told by the front desk it would be two minutes to be seated, ended up being over ten, with only three other parties waiting to be seated at the time. Another party of four arrives in the interim and they are seated immediately as we continued to stand there and wait. The restaurant was not busy. <br><br>Finally seated, it took another 10-15 minutes for a waitress to show up (Courtney D), who took the drink order of two waters, then disappeared for another 15 minutes. She returned with the water, we were ready to order, yet she shares she needs to return her tray before she can, and disappears for another 15 minutes. Meanwhile, we sit and watch her take and place orders from other tables that arrived after we did. <br><br>Our order is finally placed, and delivered to the table within 7 minutes; the Huevos Rancherosis is stone cold, and the Chiliquiles luke warm. Partner complains, a new order is offered, yet declined. Can she get us anything else? Yes, I would like my water glass refilled; acknowledged, yet never filled. I have to ask for a second time when the check is delivered. <br><br>I use a stall in the bathroom, lifting the seat, only to discover the bottom of it covered in splashed feces from a prior user. And it didn&#39;t appear to be recent. Disgusting. <br><br>We are asked if the Manager stopped by the table to apologize for the cold food; No he didn&#39;t. They &#34;comp&#34; the Huevos Rancheros on the bill, but that in itself will never bring me back to this place. <br><br>Enough said.

The service sucks!!!! We were told 20-30 minutes. It took 45 minutes to be seated. Another 5 minutes for the table to be cleaned, while we stood in the aisle waiting for our table. Then another 10 minutes before anyone even bothered acknowledging our presence! Even for NYE, this is awful customer service. Totally took the fun out of going out for dinner and ruined our NYE!<br><br>Happy New Year! First resolution - never come to Cheesecake Factory at the Americana again!

I love that I live near a Cheesecake Factory in the heart of Glendale. The check in wait time can be a little long but it&#39;s like this all the time, it has to be expected from such a popular restaurant. So plan ahead of when to go. And try to go with smaller groups than bigger. The food and the desserts are always why we come back. Especially their damn bread. I love that bread. I always ask for extra so I can take it home and eat it on the way home. The service is always great. Everyone always goes the extra mile no matter how busy it is. They really make sure your time there is well spent.
Food is great .<br><br>Only the restroom is horrible <br><br>And this is not the first time the lady&#39;s restroom so bad .<br><br>Is there a manager in charge ?<br><br>Terrible

A friend and I went for my birthday yesterday. She told the hostess that it was my birthday (Andreea) but no one ever said Happy  Birthday or asked if i wanted a special dessert. That was disappointing so maybe they don&#39;t do that anymore?? <br><br>However, service was good and the food was great. They have my favorite salad -a chopped salad that is so incredibly delicious!! My friend got a vegetable salad and loved hers as well. <br><br>The bread is yummy and we both got some peach blended drinks that were sooo good! <br><br>So, stop on by but don&#39;t go for your bday because they don&#39;t help you celebrate :(

Really like this place. There is always something thayou can order and enjoy every time!!! It&#39;s a grewt place for the family or to gi out with friends. <br>My favorite location is the Americana one. Although line is alway long and it&#39;s at least 20-40 min wait but almost always they call early!! I highly recommend this place and would definitely come back!!!!

The worst take out experience in my life. I would give zero stars if that were an option. I came in to pick up my order and was instructed to stand in the lobby. There were no signs posted as where to stand in the lobby. The orders were all backed up and too many people were allowed in so I was instructed to go back outside after being told to stand in the wrong line for pick up. Then I had to wait another 50 minutes until my order was ready. The fair assumption would be that my order was at least warm but that was not the case. My food was cold when they finally brought it out to me. <br><br>Let&#39;s also not forget to mention the abundance of people that were allowed in without masks while waiting in the lobby that was overcrowded.

Normally we love this location. Today, however, we were seated, the silverware on the tables were gross and dirty. Some even had crystal and leftover food on them. When we showed the hostess, she rolled her eyes. They were gross. The mini bread plates had fresh napkins on it but when we took the napkins off. The plates were grimey and rubbing with our fingers could wipe residue off. It&#39;s almost like the dishwasher was broken or didnt run properly.<br><br>We had a group of 4. All 3 of my party got their food and we were waiting and waiting for mine. I finally asked and was told my salmon was burnt so they were remaking it. My whole party had finished their meal before mine even came out. And they still charged us for it. The only reason I&#39;m giving 2 stars is one was for the food taste and one for the good waiter. <br><br>Overall very disappointed today.
Loved my tropical smoothie and avocado toast! Waited about 45 minutes on a busy night for a table but it was worth it in my opinion. My boyfriend also enjoyed his meal.

Had brunch here for the first time. They have the tables spread at. We sat outside and felt completely safe. <br>Every other table was occupied. They have the lobby area spread out and are only allowing ten at a time in.<br>My only issue was the wait line outside which was not marked and people were not social distancing.<br>We ordered the Monte Cristo sandwhich with potatoes. Amazing and hot. Our waitress this morning was wonderful too. Great service.

This is not the closest location to me, but the others were not available due to the &#34;high volume&#34; online orders with the special promotion going on. We thought it was good to found one that&#39;s still accepting online order and it&#39;s not too far off the way, and guess what? They forgot my lemonade. I told my friend that he could have both of the cokes from the promotion but I didn&#39;t get the lemonade I paid extra for. Fine, whatever, as we opened the not-as-good burgers and saggy fries after a long drive, no utensils for the salad. Why bother to even have the option to request for utensils if you just failed to give them repeatedly? It&#39;s a hard time for everyone but you still get to manage to have everyone line up for a pick-up line outside in this location waiting when the text shows my order was ready 15 min ago. But no you have to wait in the sun and wait for your fries to go soggy. Why is this location not being able to do what other locations are doing; put a table out there, have the people approaching when their names are called for and make sure you give them the cucumber lemonade and utensils? My friend says it&#39;s even labeled, so what&#39;s the point for having options available for online orders when they couldn&#39;t fulfill them?<br><br>This is gotta be the worst location that I&#39;ve been to considering small incidents like this would happen almost every time when I had to dine there.

Went is last night and whoever the lady manager was in the front was extremely rude.. Yes it was busy, but you don&#39;t have to be rude to your customers..<br><br>Our pager vibrated, we still waited in front of the servers for almost ten minutes. We asked the front desk to see if we can get seated since we were already ready waiting literally right in front of them. (They were still calling others before us). She said yes they will call me next. <br><br>One, two, three parties got called before us yet our name was right in front (next).. and they still skipped up. <br>I asked (was trying to ask) the manager &#34;hey are we able to get seated since we&#39;ve been ready?&#34; <br>She Literally cut me off as I was asking and said) &#34;we&#39;re figuring it out!&#34; And turned back around. <br><br>I&#39;m a manager in retail, and am VERY big on customer service, and know that she did not give us great customer service what&#39;s so ever, felt like she wanted to get rid of us and did not even acknowledge us after that... not to mention the front was very chaotic felt like she did not seem to have anything under control.. <br><br>As chaotic as my store gets, I would not treat customers in that way. Nor would I hire anyone in that way.

After a few failed attempts to make it to an actual Cheesecake to dine in (my boyfriend and I both work long hours) we finally agreed upon ordering in. We LOVE The Cheesecake Factory and actually met there waiting table 10 years ago. We went straight to the Cheesecake  Factory site and were stoked to see that they partnered with DoorDash for deliveries. We ordered our food and got back to work. About an hour later, we received a text stating that our order was ready for pick up. WHAT?!?! I immediately called the restaurant to contact them to let them know that there was a mistake. A manager named Ashley just so happened to pick up. She said, &#34;You must&#39;ve accidentally pushed something. Unfortunately, there&#39;s nothing we can do. You need to contact DoorDash.&#34; I explained that I did not accidentally push anything and I ordered directly from the CCF website. I asked for a Manager and she said &#34;I am one.&#34; When I asked for her full name she said,  &#34;Ashley, I don&#39;t have to give you my last name.&#34; Her tone was quite shocking considering the CCF culture. It&#39;s unfortunate that there was no sort of empathy or even regard for my concern. At least I know to avoid the Glendale CCF. If a Manager has that tone, I can only imagine the staff. A positive attitude starts from the top. Get a better leader on board. Thumbs down for this experience.

Maria the hostess was GREAT!  My review was going to be a great one,  but our server Jamar S.  just ruined my night. First thing he stop by our table I said hello and he didn&#39;t say anything just drop off the silverware and left. I was like ok maybe he didn&#39;t hear me. Then he came back still didn&#39;t introduce himself just said what can I get for you. Then when he came out and drop off our bread my little 2 year old girl told him Thank you more then 3 times and he just ignored her and was looking somewhere else. I don&#39;t know what kind of person ignore a child. It took so much for me not to tell him something. Ignore me fine! But not my child! And on top of that I don&#39;t know why would he put my alcoholic drink in front of her and not in front of me or my wife. He needs to go back to training and learn to care and pay attention to his customers. I think Maria your hostess should train him, she knows how to take care of customers and go the extra mile. I would hire her in my restaurant as a shift leader or a manager. Also I don&#39;t think your bussers should take away stuff away from our table when we just just got there. I like my candle light on the table when I&#39;m having dinner with my family. Just FYI. So thanks again Jamar!!!!!! For your great customer service.
Went Saturday around 5pm to have dinner with my friends for my birthday and the hostess was very rude. The wait time was about 1 hour and thirty minutes.
Very delicious attended very well waiter was very attentive to the whole section he was assigned to would definitely come back

I would like to thank the Corporate Office for following up with the experience I had in the Glendale, CA branch.  Especially to John who made an effort to call and apologize for my experience and resolved the issue.<br>Thanks again John!

We wanted to sit outside but the hostess said there was a 15 minute wait (even though there were open tables). I&#39;ve been to this location at least 4 times and EVERY TIME one of the hosts/hostesses has had a bitchy attitude. Is this taught in the Cheesecake Factory handbook?<br><br>Upon sitting down, we made acquaintances with our server Ashley. She was pretty and smiling and had some conversation with us. Very pleasant. She made some recommendations which were on point. We were specifically having trouble with choosing dessert because that&#39;s what one comes here for right?<br><br>It was between key-Lime cheesecake and the Godiva brownie. We ultimately chose the Godiva and it was AMAYZING! (Basic bitch here) the only suggestions I&#39;d have to improve it, is to drizzle it with something other than chocolate, like strawberry glaze or something. That would be a nice touch!<br><br>Thanks Ashley!!

I loveeeeeee sitting outside and getting the water fountain view. Everytime, when I come to this location for lunch, I would sit outside and people watch. Yeah, I am creepy like that.<br><br>Customer service at this location is wayyy better compared to Arcadia and Pasadena. The hostess is always very nice and friendly, our waiters are always super nice and helpful. My bread and butter is always stocked, beverage is always filled. <br><br>To me the food is pretty much the same as the other location. But the customer services here place a very big role in my return. They are always so welcoming and nice, always checking up on me. Once! The waitress gave me extra bread and butter to take home, totally made my day.

Went to have late lunch yesterday with a friend. Cheesecake has been a great spot in Americana when you&#39;re running out of options and don&#39;t want to drive war. I can honestly say this is by far one the best locations with great service. I, as per usual, got my Mexican tortilla salad (if I remember the name correctly) which is only 560 calories with a huge portion and my friend got the salmon option from the same menu (this is the menu with calorie control). We were happy with our server and the food tasted good and fresh.<br>One thing that I have to mention, their utensils are never ever clean and I have to always ask for extra water on the side to clean them.

If you are reading this review take my advice and RSVP a table thru YELP.  I go to dinner after church and tried it this weekend bc I have a gift card to use and it was amazing.  Walked right into the restaurant at 6:30 on a Saturday night to be seated.  Not even handed a buzzer just told to hold on a min and I was the next to be seated.<br><br>The food is good and offers a variety for everyone to find something so it&#39;s always busy. Little loud and dark inside but the food is good and I love how the menu now denotes what is available Gluten-free.<br><br>Take out from this location is also super easy and convenient if your at the Americana and heading home.

What can I say. Its Cheesecake Factory. Its just like every other Cheesecake Factory everyone has ever been to. I will say that the front seating/waiting area is large and spacious. And due to its location being at a mall, there is plenty of parking available. <br><br>Also shout out to the Banana Cheesecake. It tasted like fresh bananas and didnt feel as heavy as some of the other cheesecakes. And the Celebration Cheesecake tasted like neapolitan ice cream. Yum!

So, <br>I ordered online for Mother&#39;s Day, I opted to pay on store because I didn&#39;t know what cheesecake to get,.<br>When I got there to pay for my food it was chaos, ppl outside waiting big line inside I mean u name it. We finally figure out that the big line inside was to pay for online orders so we waited, and waited some more and waited even more, this was a 20-30 min wait, for my food that was already made just waiting for me to pay. <br>When we were almost to the front of the line, THIS ENTITLED PERSON (can&#39;t even called her a lady because ladies don&#39;t act like that) skip the whole line and wanted her order to be payed, when everyone started complaining about it the MANAGER DIDNT DO ANYTHING, he still had the audacity to ask who was there to just pay for the food ( mind you everyone was there to do that) he went ahead and took care of the person and went about his business, while a bunch of us were screaming and telling him that she had just gotten in. That&#39;s not how a manager should of handle it at all, he should of known that it was going to be crazy and should of prepared for the day, and he should t of taken that entitles person order. <br>By the time I got home it had been a whole hour after my food was ready so as u can imagine it was cold. What ever that was suppose to be crispy wasn&#39;t. The cheesecakes were all mushy because they had been out the lobby of the restaurant for a whole hour or so.

This is my family&#39;s go to restaurant. It serves good food and is quite a staple. I go here for many occasions (family dinners, hangout with friends, etc). They even offer vegetarian and gkuten free options. It has all the works here! My go to order has got to be the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta with Angel Hair noodles and extra sauce. It&#39;s big enough to serve 2-3 people so it&#39;s a great deal. Unfortunately especially during quarantine the wait times to get a table are insane. Sometimes you have to wait two and a half hours just to be seated. Otherwise Cheesecake is a great restaurant.

I went in with my family and what I encountered was a bunch of unfriendly hostess ..why don&#39;t managers spend more time training employees on people skills or yet send undercover patrons to see how they treat incoming customers and should be able to Elina te personnel that just don&#39;t belong in certain parts of the restaurant...I had a lousy experience visiting this location ..

I feel like they have so many items on the menu but most are not memorable. <br><br>I like the sweet potato fries and their bread. I like cheesecake but hardly eat them these days. I don&#39;t really have a sweet tooth and the crazy calories scares me off as well. They had one item that was over 1700 calories per slice. That is what some people eat during their entire day. I would not recommend coming here during a cut. You can easily eat over 5000 calories during your meal. <br><br>Came here a few times with coworkers and last night the service was excellent. So I gotta give the server a shout out. <br><br>I think this place is what it is. They won&#39;t wow you but they should have something for everyone. I do recommend the combo Chicken Madeira and Steak Diane. <br><br>I believe their rating is accurate and I&#39;m rounding up from 3 and 1/2 stars.

I went with my friend, she got the skinnilicious steak dish and I got the bone in steak. Instead of the mashed potatoes and gravy, I substituted it for garlicky spinach.<br><br>I must say, that garlicky spinach....shocking. It was unrealistically DRENCHED in garlic. I spent 3 minutes peeling off all the garlic cause it was just too much. She said her steak dish was bland and uneventful. No taste, just a basic plain steak that has been cooked. I don&#39;t think salt was even added to it.<br><br>My bone in steak was boring. Absolutely NOTHING special or appetizing about it. Truly anyone at home could&#39;ve made it, there was no flavor and definitely no beauty to it. <br><br>The presentation of the plates are laughable. For a place so gorgeously decorated, the presentation of a $21 steak was exactly the same of what you&#39;d get at Home Town Buffet.<br><br>The only thing that tasted good was the bread they serve before hand, and the string beans that came with my steak. The portion size of it was LAUGHABLE, and after I complained about my &#34;garlic with a hint of spinach&#34;, my kind waitress brought me more string beans, that had stems still attached to them. Unfortunately the only reason the strings beans were good was because of the oil and salt. Again, no art in the making of the food, no taste or signature style, just basic. <br><br>I had to ask for A1 sauce to add SOMETHING to my full meal. I was so bored with it all!<br><br>My friend and I left and agreed we need to find a new spot with better food to create as &#34;our spot&#34; to go to, because Cheesecake Factory use to be it, but quality food is not an option there anymore.

Very bland pasta and the chicken tasted and felt like rubber. Being that the food was less than adequate, the prices were outrageous for such quality (or lack thereof). Due to covid, seating was a bit odd but with that said, I was seated in the extension area to their outside dining where there were no patio heaters so it was very cold. The normal outside dining had patio heaters. Not impressed.

I know it&#39;s Mother&#39;s Day and it&#39;s hectic but REALLY?! Very disappointed on how it was not managed. Everyone was very confused on where to go for ppl that had already paid or needs to pay. <br>No one was keeping social distancing and no Manager in site to keep ppl from crowding the place. Order was ready at 4:30 but since it was so poorly disorganized couldn&#39;t get to the cashier until 5! So not only did I pay almost $200 but I have to eat cold food!?! This is not the workers fault but very bad management. Sucks our Mother&#39;s Day was disappointing and didn&#39;t get quality food. <br>Who wants to eat a cold steak? A cold salmon!?! <br><br>At times like this, we try to be understanding but with the amount of ppl crowding the place I was very anxious and now nervous as some ppl did not even have masks on and again no manager in site to tell them they can&#39;t be here without it. Nor where the employees wearing the masks correctly as it was NOT covering the nose and most of them where not wearing gloves. I pray we do not get sick for wanting to support this restaurant.
This is my favorite cheesecake factory location because they always have good quality and can&#39;t beat the location.

Haven&#39;t sat down to eat at the restaurant but have definitely tried the cheesecakes and they are delicious!! The first time I tried the whole chocolate red velvet and got hooked, which was surprising because I never go for red velvet. This next time I got the Oreo and it was good, but I liked red velvet better. Another heavenly thing about it is their whip cream! It is so good and compliments the cheesecake perfectly! It is a bit pricey though, it was $9 a slice and about $60+ for the whole cheesecake, that&#39;s a bit insane to me (and the reason for the 4 stars). Taste gets a 5 star, as well as the service. Everyone there is very nice!

Okay man. I probably been to this place twice ever in my life and to say the least I&#39;m still not impressed at all. Once I was seated they had me waiting for like 30 Minutes without even water, menus or anything. I finally got an opportunity to flag down someone anyone who works there to tell them like hey I&#39;ve been sitting here and waiting. Finally got a waiter. She took my order and food came out roughly 20 Min and it wasn&#39;t even all that. Again I should have learned from the past but it is what it is....

I&#39;ve been here to this specific location numerous times prior to COVID. The staff is always nice, friendly  and professional. The food is great my daughter loves the bread also the kids menu pasta is her fav. And the Godiva chocolate cheesecake is amazing. I always make sure to make a reservation on yelp before arriving so the wait time is not long however Due to COVID they don&#39;t take reservations which makes it an hour wait to get a table for 2. Hopefully that&#39;ll change soon. Overall this place is great we love the food and the atmosphere.

Had outside seating windy day but tolerable. I expected a long wait for food because they had a decent amount of people. Waited 45 minutes for the food which was a longer wait time than normal. When the food arrived it was good but it was warm. Wasn&#39;t hot at all like it was sitting out. Next thing is I found hair in my food. So she offered to get me another plate which was another 20 minutes to make. She didn&#39;t even seem to care! As a customer I felt like they didn&#39;t care at all.. This place use to be amazing but sadly not anymore..

Beware that this restaurant&#39;s Wait time can be extensively long reaching up to an hour and 50 minutes. But what makes the wait tolerable is the fact that it strategically located in the americana at the brand. You could easily add your name to the waitlist and walk around this beautiful artistic entertaining area until you are called. <br>The menu consist of a wide variety of American and Italian food as well as gourmet sandwiches and your classic steakhouse type meals. I would say that there is pretty much Something for everyone. One of their most popular dishes includes the chicken Madera but my second favorite is the Spicy chicken chipotle pasta  .. Their portions are huge and can make possible for a family style dinner. I particularly enjoyed their macchiato and hot espresso drinks even though they might be a little on the sweeter but again this is the cheesecake factory; wouldn&#39;t expect anything less. If the weather allows I highly recommend outdoor seating because the patio overlooks the beautiful view of the main fountain display which is the centerpiece of the Americana. The cheesecake selection is quite extensive, again this is the cheesecake factory. Personal favorite is the tiramisu (not tiramisu cheesecake but the tiramisu itself). The inside of the restaurant can be quite loud which is probably the only downfall of this restaurant. Busiest nights are Friday and Saturday night particularly before 9 PM. Keep in mind that they do not take reservations but you can call ahead to get an estimate of the wait time.

After months of being closed, got the coldest reception ever at the door this evening just because I had a dog. There were several parties waiting to get in so I patiently waited to get my name down. The hostess saw me, ignored me and proceeded to take the name of a guest who showed up after me onto the wait list. I got in front of her and asked how long the wait was for the patio since I had a dog. She said an hour for the patio if with a dog. Then she looked at my dog and said but only for service animals. I respect that restaurants don&#39;t allow pets but ignoring me just because I had a dog was a waste of my time for making me wait. I ended up at Trattoria Amici where I got seated right away in the patio and they even made chicken for my pup. Waiter bright him water without me asking. Derive is amazing and they love dogs!!!
Great service...a bit of a wait but very understandable taking in mind the situation. Very clean and attentive staff .

I love this restaurant , once a month I have to go <br>And enjoy the food specially  avocado egg rolls <br>Customer service excellent.<br>Highly recommend the Cheesecake Factory <br>My favorite one is in Marina Delray.

If I was the last man on earth and this was the only restaurant with food left, I would go inside and eat their toilet paper. It most likely has a better taste than the food. The food is so plain and way overpriced. I regret not going to Olive Garden or In n out {which are just about two blocks away}. We waited an hour to be seated. Then we waited 30 min for our server to attend us. 10 min to finally get our drinks and have them take our order. Another 45 min until we finally got our food. When you look at it, you right away have a feeling you should call in sick for work the next day. Tasteless, plain, simple, and boring. Overpriced. I came to eat at 7pm . Left at 11pm. <br>I won&#39;t ever come back. Don&#39;t say I didn&#39;t warn<br><br>P.S: I am very dehydrated in the toilet

Shout out to Stephanie P for doing such a phenomenal job waiting our table.  Her energy was on 100, her attentiveness was on 100 and anytime a hostess can smile, multitask and check in to make sure all was well, deserves  a review!!!   Showing that I appreciate Stephanie and the CheeseCake factory today!

Cheescake Factory is my favorite restaurant.  Everything I have ever eaten here is delicious!    My favorite is the chicken picatta, tex-mex egg rolls. (my mouth is watering!)   Portions are hearty.<br><br>Go for the Dulce De Leche cheesecake.  You wont be disappointed.

I really hate to expose this place but........<br>EVERYTHING COMES IN FROZEN!!!!!!! <br>Meaning, lots of preservatives and high sodium. Yes, the food may taste good, it doesn&#39;t mean its good for you.<br>Tender Greens down the street is a MUCH healthier option if that&#39;s what your interested in. You could get some much needed steps in just walking to tender greens too!!

Shawn was our waiter and he gave us an amazing service and checked up on us the perfect amount of times (: <br>He was extremely kind to all  4 of us and we all complimented him for his positive attitude he brings to work and attentiveness. He recommended this chicken plate to me and it was very delicious! <br>Honestly he&#39;s one of the best waiters I&#39;ve had. I&#39;m extremely  happy. All of us left happy

Let me start by saying, I&#39;m a huge fan of The Cheesecake Factory as a chain restaurant! Although I will FOREVER be UPSET with them for removing the shrimp and bacon club sandwich from their menu and ALL of their CHEFs act like they don&#39;t know how to make it since it&#39;s removal, I still enjoy this place. I will not frequent it as much because of their removal of the shrimp and bacon club sandwich. I mean, it was the BEST SANDWICH EVER! Had to get that off my chest. <br><br>Now, about the Glendale location. It&#39;s situated in a pretty convenient spot inside of The Americana. I love that the parking lot is steps away and if you get a good parking spot, even better! From the hosts/hostesses to the busboys/girls, I&#39;ve always had hospitable experiences at this location.<br><br>The Food: Because they no longer have my favorite sandwich, I had to try something ELSE on the menu, my ongoing dilemma with each visit. This time, I tried their Chicken Parmesan (CP) sandwich with extra cheese and extra sauce. OH, MY GOODNESS!! This sandwich was much bigger than expected. Actually, way bigger than expected and GOOD! It wasn&#39;t good enough to replace my love for their shrimp and bacon club sandwich but it was indeed a close 2nd!!! VERY CLOSE!! My friend kept asking me, &#34;Are you going to finish all of that?&#34; I finally told her, &#34;I will make it my sole goal to finish TONIGHT! This can&#39;t be reheated and taste the same.&#34; I also ordered their Crispy Crab Bites. They are SO good. However, if I plan to order the CP sandwich again (and I do), I will not order the crab bites. I need all stomach space possible. <br><br>The CP sandwich isn&#39;t so big in size as much as it is in girth. They give you two chicken patties so that&#39;s a lot of meat between two non-thin pieces of bread. THANK YOU and I am NOT complaining about this sandwich. The side salad was a joke, to say the least. I tried to eat the side salad but ummm, it was just a waste of greenery. <br><br>I asked for extra sauce because I expected the sandwich to be a little dry. Oh, to my surprise, it was nothing near dry. So moist. I hardly touched my extra sauce on the side. The extra cheese added to the moistness and the ooey gooey with each bite. Yep, HAPPY! I had THEE best sleep and no alcohol was in my system. I was full for most of the following day. No breakfast the next morning and no lunch either, lemme tell ya!

We reached 6 adults and 2 children.  The waitress tried hard to find us a suitable place.  Unfortunately, even though we asked for games or a drawing for the children, they said they had nothing for the children.  In most other places we eat, they always have a solution for children.  The food was bland.  The portions are doubled.  There is a parking permit.
Great location in the Americana outdoor shopping district. You can sit indoors or out on the patio, where you can watch the dancing waters.

My husband had put in a online order and payed $39 for me to pick up after work.They just handed me the bag stapled with his name on it without checking to confirm if it was the right order.The tag label on the order had the correct name and order.When I got home, which is 30 minutes away we saw that the order was wrong.They gave us some smelly seafood dish that looked like chicken strips or something instead of the orange chicken.He can&#39;t eat seafood.He called to speak to a manager politely and they transferred him to someone who said his name was Lee.He made him feel horrible and questioned our integrity.Asked him to in detail tell him what he got and to send pics (to an email address which was invalid btw)so they could ask another manager and follow up(for training purposes)BS It&#39;s like we shouldn&#39;t be going through all these steps, you guys f*****up.My husband has to end up calling back and this time spoke to the other manager to get the right email.Look I work in retail and with people all day that&#39;s not how you do customer service,we are the paying customers.I work in that mall structure and we order there all the time.I should&#39;ve knew something was up when I got there and was waiting in line there was some sort of issue with the customer in front of me and they apologized to her about something.We definitely didn&#39;t get that treatment.You screwed up our experience and now no dinner for the night and we&#39;re out of the $39 we paid.This needs to be resolved promptly.

This review is long due. This is the worst Cheesecake Factory across the States. I tried to put my name on the wait list to get a table and since one of my friends was feeling bad I made a specific request, and surprisingly one of the hostess said they weren&#39;t going to be able to accomodate us. It wasn&#39;t the answer that bothered us, it was the way she responded. Really rude, we deserve better. Never coming back here.

I have gone to this Cheesecake Factory location for years. I have always loved dining in. However, tonight I couldn&#39;t dine in so I ordered pick up. When I came home I looked at my tray and noticed it was more tray than food. I paid $20 for my pasta that wasn&#39;t even there. This is extremely disappointing. After this I am not sure I&#39;d want to go back if they only provide you with a decent portion when you dine in.
awesome food horrible prices. Had the mango coconut chicken. Husband had the chicken angel pasta.

One of my best restaurants. <br>Today we found it out that they have very good brunch tas well. I ordered cinnamon roll pancakes with extra banana and it was so good but a little bit so sweet. But after all I&#39;d give them 5 star for their good customer service.

Love this place! I came when it wasn&#39;t packed at all. I was immediately greeted and seated. My food came fast. We ordered the Crab Cakes, Nashville Hot Chicken Nuggets (I think that&#39;s what it&#39;s called), I got the Tuscan Chicken from the Skinnylicious menu and the Shrimp Pasta lunch portion. I loved all the food! Loved our waiter! He was super nice and attentive! Will definitely be back again.

Girl at the cheesecake part of the restaurant was soooo rude. No &#34;hello&#34; she said &#34;yes&#34; and all I did was be grateful and thank her three times for putting my order through and then she walked away and left my cheesecake sitting there and she didn&#39;t even take down my name or give me a receipt even though she printed three copies very bad service. DONT COMEEEEE

Told the wait was 20 minutes was nearly 50 minutes! When we asked what was going on we were told to stand aside and wait EVEN longer watched people who had just walked in be seated before us. Very Disappointed.. extremely unorganised. We let the server know how disappointing the service had been and she LITERALLY JUST SAID &#34;okay... are you ready to order<br><br>The restaurants response to this is actually pathetic I&#39;m mad cause I&#39;m hungry??? Seriously? I was expecting a professional response but I guess nothing about this company is professional or well run ‍

Never had a bad experience here. The servers are usually very nice and it&#39;s clean. The wait is sometimes way too long but it&#39;s not that bad when you go with a party of 2. I&#39;ve had their burgers before and they are good. This time, I had the brussels sprouts (delicious) and the spicy chipotle pasta. We substituted mushrooms for the chicken and asked for extra sauce but it still wasn&#39;t that great. I don&#39;t recommend this dish. As everyone knows, their bread is amazing too.

Foods here never disappoint. The outdoor seating area is perfect to hangout, watching people walking by, music and dancing fountain. Love the vibe!<br>Get there early so you don&#39;t get hangry with the wait line. Everything on the menu has sky high calories but at least they are honest about it.
This dish was really good and our server Aaron was great! I love the atmosphere and environment and how well he treated us. Thank you, Aaron for the wonderful customer service.

Come for dinner at 4pm, skip the seafood chicken jambalaya, get the chicken piccata <br>-------------------<br><br>This basically sums up our recent experience here. The line at 4 PM on Saturday (admittedly, the weekend before Christmas) was tolerable at 40 minutes. If you come after that then you are screwed and be prepared to wait for upwards of 90 minutes or more.<br><br>Anyway our party of four adults one kid and one toddler was seated in a seemingly large booth. However the seats felt like an airplane seating - meaning if one of us had to exit to the aisle it required a major reshuffling of people sitting in the same row. Probably because of the toddler highchair but still this felt really tight even without the highchair.<br><br>The only dish worth mentioning today was the lemon chicken piccata that wifey got. It had the perfect balance of tender chicken breast, citrus zest, and just the right amount of cream without being overbearing. Meanwhile the seafood chicken jambalaya pasta was a complete hot mess and should be burned alive LOL! I mean seriously why put Jambolaya with pasta and furthermore the Jambolaya had no southern seasoning nor spice. Pass!<br><br>Thank God they did not screw up the cheesecake - both the key lime cheesecake and the strawberry cheesecake were excellent - as they should be from a restaurant who&#39;s name sake is cheesecakes LOL.<br><br>Last tip: they validate Americana parking for up to two hours. Assuming you find Americana parking the weekend before Christmas.

I ordered to go and the guy who gave me my order was too busy talking to his coworkers he forgot to give me my drink and receipt. I had to go back to pick up my drink and receipt nearly 3 hours later. <br><br>Kid&#39;s pasta was pretty generous but flavorless.

I loved how there&#39;s variety of other foods to choose from beside cheesecake. This is a great location to go to. You can shop and walk around while waiting for your table. There are the dancing water works right outside the front windows and a perfect outside seating area to wait for your table. Perfect place to go on a date or a night out with some friends. A little pricey but they serve big portions. Good food and their calamari is delicious.

The best restaurant!! Go every weekend, if u want service and quality go to The Cheesecake Factory. Also what I love about The Cheesecake Factory is that it&#39;s only 10 minutes away from where I live. Recommend!!!!!!

Going here for years but I don&#39;t think I ever wrote a review! I&#39;m always happy and satisfied with the food, drinks and service! They offer indoor and outdoor seating. For this visit me and my husband decided to sit at the bar! I enjoy watching them make different drinks and have conversation. We love the complimentary bread and butter and you can ask for refills and they will bring more happily. I have tried Lemon drop martini almost every place I have visited and no one has been able to beat theirs. The barman was Mohsen, hopefully I&#39;m spelling his name correctly, was very nice and friendly and provided great service. I ate chicken Madeira which is one of my favorite dishes and it was great. Portions are generous so you get what you pay for. We usually visit the one located in Americana which is a nice open shopping center with a parking lot which they validate. There are shops, movie theater, and other restaurants and a very nice water fountain in the same area. Their menu will accommodate everyone because of the variety of food. They also have a skinny menu for food and drinks! Great place!!

I&#39;m a big fan of cheesecake factory and this one is not much different from all the other ones.  I find this location to be pretty useful when i get dragged to go shopping, i just come here and watch football and have a drink or two.<br><br>The only bad thing about this location is that i don&#39;t get service inside this restaurant and i have verizon!    I hope they get WiFi at this location.<br><br>Also, $14 for an old fashioned is a bit steep in my opinion.  But it was delicious tho.

Getting a table was quick, but made sense as they sat my daughter and I at a table with what seemed to be without a waiter/waitress. After 20 mins of waiting, I had to stop a waiter walking by to ask if he knew who was my waiter, in which he replied, &#34;No, but what do you need?&#34;<br><br>I explained I wanted to place an order and we had been waiting a while. He took my order and maybe 10 mins later, a waitress picked up our menus and said, &#34;sorry for that.&#34; Not sure if she was our waitress. <br><br>Disappointed to say the least as I&#39;ve had good experiences with other Cheesecake Factory&#39;s. This one, not so much.

Let me start off by telling you that I love Cheesecake Factory. I love coming here with friends or my husband because there is such a variety of food and guaranteed, there is always something for everyone. So this was a perfect spot for a Christmas get-together with friends. One of my friends called ahead to try to make a reservation for 12 people. She was told to use the Yelp page to make a reservation for 6 people (since that was the max available through Yelp) then the day of the reservation, just let the person at the front know the reservation is actually for 12 people. Sounds like a plan and a reservation was set for 6pm. Upon arrival, the line was so long that it was almost out the door. By the time I put my name in to claim the reservation, it was a little after 6pm. I was told by the girl at the front and the manager that they would NOT honor the reservation for 12 people even though my friend had spoken to the manager. The manager we spoke to that evening said that was a lie and none of their managers would say that. It&#39;s Saturday night. I understand it&#39;s busy but I could have done without the condescending tone. The agreement was that we would just have to make 2 reservations for 6 people and there was no way we could sit together. Half of my party was running late anyways so the first 6 sat together in the bar area. There was a table to my right that could have easily accommodated the remainder of my party but the manager was adamant that we could not have that table also. He was doing it on purpose to just be an a jerk. But whatever... I was there with my friends and I will still hoping to salvage the evening and still have a good time. <br><br>Our waiter passed by a few times and I noticed that the place was extremely understaffed for a busy Saturday evening. We had to flag him down for drinks. Since it was understaffed, drink refills were very scarce. <br><br>My friend was raving about the seared tuna tataki salad. I don&#39;t usually order salads but she was selling me on how fresh and delicious the salad is and how she felt it was like eating &#34;sushi.&#34; So I ordered it. It was a halfhearted mix of greens with a few pieces of tuna and sliced hot house tomatoes on the side which was weird that it wasn&#39;t chopping into smaller pieces and mixed in. The wasabi vinegarette was very good. It was a tasty salad, but it&#39;s not something I would order if I was starving. I just didn&#39;t have that satisfied feeling of fullness. I felt like it should be more of an appetizer dish.I had a banana cheesecake for my dessert and that was wonderful. Their banana cheesecake is one of my all time favorites. <br><br>Would I come back? Not to this location.

Unfortunately my experience at the Cheesecake Factory in Glendale was less than optimal. Not only was the facility dirty- I ate my dinner with half eaten food bits at my feet, the food and drinks lacked as well. My pizza was almost inedible, because the center was soft and uncooked, and then the crust was so hard I couldn&#39;t even bite into it. The mojito was also not good at all, tasted like simple syrup poured over ice. The one redeeming factor of this location was the award-winning customer service.

We go to cheesecake very often , love the food, ambience, but our sever PJ was so good she was very attentive , friendly and prompt in her service. She made our dining experience so wonderful, i feel usually servers dont pay that great attention unless you in fine dining, and PJ gave us better than fine dining experience in cheesecake factory.. thanks PJ<br>,

OVERALL: just get the cheese cake and get out. I&#39;ve had a few different things here besides cheesecake and for the most part it&#39;s just a wacky menu. Nothings bad about their food it&#39;s all made pretty well! I just think their cheesecake is WAY better than their food. There food isn&#39;t even bad either! I love the fact that they are open until 2am and have delicious appetizers! ACTUALLY! Here&#39;s what you do! GET APPS! And then a slice of cheesecake! BOOM! Perfect! I would skip getting the authentic general tsos or soba noodles from an American restaurant come on! Lol get a burger if your gonna get a meal!

If anyone tells you that they don&#39;t like the Cheesecake Factory, they&#39;re liars. I mean the menu can be a bit overwhelming since they have 1,224,245,892 items on it, but damn is it tasty.<br><br>I love that they always start the meal off with their pumpernickel and sourdough bread. Geese, that could be a meal in of itself.<br><br>My favorite item on the menu, regardless of location, is the BBQ chicken salad. Corn, black beans, diced tomatoes, grilled chicken, fried onions, ranch dressing--oh yes!

I have been coming to this establishment for over 10 years now and have never had a negative experience here.. but today was different. I understand you&#39;re busy and understaffed.. but there&#39;s no excuse for poor customer service. <br><br>The manager at the hostess booth at the front, made a mistake by mixing up our pager numbers with another customers and we ended up getting lost in the system. Instead of apologizing though.. she just said we would be seated at the next available table inside. I&#39;m thinking that meant ANY table... but no.. we kept getting passed up by small and bigger groups. So we asked again what was going on, (we were only a group of 2) the manager Shannon, was rude and said if we wanted to sit at a dirty table and had one of the hostesses take us there. I was completely in shock. <br><br>The hostess was also rude and snappy when we asked why we were brought to a dirty table. She said &#34;my manager said you wanted to sit there&#34; and when I asked to be seated at a different and slightly bigger table.. she said we couldn&#39;t sit there because it was meant for 4 and she didn&#39;t want us there. LOL this hostess was about 5&#39;4, blonde, Caucasian with heavy makeup, and skinny as a pole. She started arguing with me and I told her she had poor customer service skills. Another hostess had to take over. Mind you other pairs have been seated at bigger tables.. she was just biased to us. <br><br>We talked to the GM Leslie about the whole situation and I really hope she handles it. Like I said, I understand it is the holidays and everyone is stressed out.. but if you work in customer service.. you should be trained to handle all kinds of situations with care... NOT the way SHANNON and the blonde hostess handled it. <br><br>UPDATE: We were never contacted about our experience or apologized to! Clearly the GM Leslie did not handle the situation, since other reviewers have had almost identical experiences! Listen to the negative reviews and STAY AWAY!

This is going to be a bizarre review as I initially was going to give them a negative one, but this just goes to show what type of service they have going on.
