My boyfriend and I are HUGE fans on The Cheesecake Factory, always dine-in, but due to the circumstances we have been just doing pick-up. Recently they announced outdoor dining and we decided to give it a go. On our way, we decided to call to inquire about the wait time. When they said 2-2.5 hours, my jaw dropped. I was in complete disbelief, but we both agreed that we weren&#39;t starving and with the restaurant being in the Americana, we agreed to just come in, put our names down and go for a walk. As expected, the woman at the front told us what we already knew, 2 hour wait. We put our name and number down and left. Upon the 1.5 hour mark, I decided to call the restaurant and ask how much longer when someone abruptly answered the phone and was extremely abrasive with me. I was totally stunned and EAGER to get in there to speak to a manager. Quickly after we were called to be seated and what do you know, the one on the phone who I couldn&#39;t wait to speak to the manager turns out to be the manager, go figure. Anywho, my boyfriend and I proceeded to speak to him about our concerns and he was just extremely apologetic, SUPER polite and attentive with us. I know  a lot of people are under tons of stress due to the insane circumstances we&#39;re in, but LEE (manager) handled it very well and very professional. The waiter (didn&#39;t get his name) was also great! Lee definitely left an impression on us. He needs a raise ASAP. Lee if you&#39;re reading this, thank you for our amazing dinner experience. We hope to see you soon.

Just don&#39;t go to this shit Cake Factory the one in Arcadia is so much better the staff is normal cake taste better parking is easier there isn&#39;t a 15 story parking structure that&#39;s eight miles away trust me Arcadia is just better

The food is always good, my last visit was no exception. The service however was a cascading series of missteps. Overall a really bad experience. After waiting approximately the time quoted for a table, we were seated on the patio. The server (Micheal) greeted us within a reasonable amount of time. He brought water. It was surprisingly chilly and we asked twice that the heater adjacent to our table be lit. On the second request, he advised us that it was broken. We then asked a host if we could be moved near one that worked, and he quickly accommodated us. <br><br>Although the new table was only 2 tables away from the one we left, we were now in another server&#39;s (Sonya, I believe) station. Here&#39;s where it went off the rails. She took forever to come to the table. The food was served. She finally greeted us and we ordered another round of cocktails. We requested some hot sauce and a wedge of lemon. Then almost immediately we were introduced to Alex, who would be taking over for Sonya. <br><br>The drinks took about 20+ minutes to arrive and one was wrong, but we kept it since we didn&#39;t want to wait again. Had to request the hot sauce again from another passing server. And requested the lemon again, and Alex brought that.<br><br>Alex was good and tried his best, but I suspect he had his hands full cleaning up Sonya&#39;s service issues. When he presented the check, he told us that the tip would go to Sonya, so I just gave him a $20 bill and left a tip on the check for the elusive Sonya, who really deserved nothing, but it&#39;s bad karma to stiff a server. <br><br>In looking at other Yelp reviews, it seems the service really needs attention from management, our experience was horrible.

So there was a long wait time but they told me we take Yelp reservations which is your best shot of getting service quicker was seated promptly service was excellent everything was yummy  Highly recommend making reservations thru Yelp

This is probably the most crowded Cheesecake Factory place I&#39;ve been to. Upon arrival you are greeted by the front desk. We were told our wait would take between 30-40 minutes! Surprisingly, we only waited 10 minutes!!! Our server took our orders immediately and gave us bread and butter to hold us over until our meal came. We didn&#39;t wait long for our meals, no more than 10 minutes once again. <br><br>We ordered the bang bang chicken and shrimp and the flavor never fails. One of my go to dish whenever I dine here! <br><br>Parking can take some time to find, but there&#39;s plenty of it.

I have always been a big fan of CF and have held many group meetings and celebrations at several locations. Lately though at this Glendale location, the service has gotten worse and now is very bad, so bad that it makes me question returning to eat there.<br><br>Positives: Extremely diverse menu and they deliver on taste big time for each item. Anything you can order is truly great! <br><br>Negatives: Really terrible service- must be understaffed. First, it took 15 minutes for a server to greet us. Then 15 minutes later, we got our food before we even got our drinks. The glasses were filthy with hard water spots crusted all over them, for my $16 drink!! We ordered dessert and our server did nothing special for us, despite it being our anniversary and us telling her this at the beginning of the meal. And when I finally got our check, it wasn&#39;t even ours!! Then once I got the right check, the server ended up losing my credit card for 20 minutes until the manager helped her find it!<br><br>Worse Part: The cheesecake slices we got were WAY, I mean WAY, smaller than they used to be! Literally half the size!! The cheesecake slices used to be 6 inches in length. These could not have been more than 3 or 4. We paid $9 for 5 bites of cheesecake, straight up. <br><br>What a horrible experience for our anniversary. Honestly, this used to be one of my favorite places to go for any big night out, but these days, the service resembles Denny&#39;s more than CF. I spent $200 on a dinner my wife and I wish we could forget. We both agreed we should have just left after the first 20 minutes of bad service, gotten In-N-Out and gave the $170 difference between those meals to charity. Next time, I think that&#39;s what we will do.

Food was ok, I had the skinnylicious turkey burger. <br>Server very eager to get our table back. Don&#39;t know if there&#39;s some kind of incentive to turn tables over quickly. <br><br>Brought out our mains while still eating the appetiser. Tried to clear my main before I had finished. Offered dessert menu whilst members of my party were still eating. <br><br>I asked if we could finish our mains before we look at the dessert menu then we didn&#39;t see our server again for a while. <br><br>Unsure if just staff training issue or the server was due to go on break.

Great looking restaurant. Menu is huge! My favorite appetizer is the fried mac and cheese. The fish and chips are my favorite lunch/dinner item. The chilaquiles on the weekend brunch menu are top notch as is the starter bread. My favorite cheesecake is the Snickers brand. Linda&#39;s chocolate cake is also amazing. Service is good.

I used go to cheesecake all the time. This time, I was completely shocked. I paid $18 for my favorite salad and usually I get a good size piece of salmon on the Almond Crusted Salmon Salad. I order one tonight  to go, and the salmon was a quarter of my normal portion, and burnt almost to a crisp and dry with no sauce on it and a fishy flavor. This has never ever happened to me before. I absolutely love this salad but after tonight I am extremely upset.
This place is infamous for horrible customer service. People seem uninterested in helping customers out in any way possible.

The Cobb salad is 95% Romaine lettuce.<br>The very small amount of chicken is crappy quality.<br><br>There was about 1/4 of a hard-boiled egg and 1/4 of an avocado.<br>If you love Romaine lettuce, this salad is well worth the hefty price tag.<br><br>As usual, the cheesecake was excellent, but pass on the Tiramisu cheesecake, not one of their best.<br><br>The raspberry/lemon meringue cheesecake is next level.<br><br>I&#39;d only come here for dessert, they&#39;re robbing you with the regular food.<br><br>Reply to Guest Services: <br>How about ALL THE TIME, you give people their money&#39;s worth.

First and foremost im a loyal cheesecake factory fan. I love everything in the menu from chicken madera to evelyn&#39;s pasta BUT when it comes to their CUSTOMER SERVICE.... WORST EXPERIENCR EVER! Today i decided to eat outdoors and I was served by IAN. last week i was served by a big caucasian lady. Both gave me a BAD experience. I always come out to bring my dog to eat outside but IAN brought to my intention all KIDS MENU DOES NOT COME WITH A DRINK. i asked another server and he said it did. 2nd IAN told me dogs are not allowed to eat there!!!? Worst experience ever. the week before we had a big caucasian lady gave my wife an ATTITUDE because she did not want sauce on her pasta. She took the chicken and the server demanded to give her back our chicken or she will charge us!!? WTF is THAT!!? Word to Cheesecake management? Why are your Servers that serve minorities TREAT US  BAD? Theres a lot more storiees from my family and they WILL ALL BE HAPPY TO POST there experience from their WHITE SERVERS.

I usually like Cheesecake Factory but today&#39;s visit was not good at all.  I already wrote them a nice letter so I will keep this short and sweet.<br><br>1) When you page someone, don&#39;t wait 20 minutes to seat them.  Print the paper and place it in the slot like everyone else&#39;s.  And when you see me standing by the column, waiting like everyone else...Ask me if I&#39;ve been taken care of...<br><br>2) Don&#39;t let dogs who are not seeing eye dogs or legitimate comfort dogs into the restaurant.  It&#39;s just not necessary.<br><br>Food was mediocre, but consistently mediocre.  Lucky for you my kid likes your pasta...Why, I have no idea.

Lolll it&#39;s Cheesecake Factory, you expect them to care about the food they serve and quality. They forgot my fries in my to go order (I paid full price for the sandwich with the side) and when I got home, the sandwich is all soggy and falling apart. Disgusting and WAY OVER PRICED. $35 for a soggy sandwich and no fries? Lol, Will not be going back here

I forgot how amazing the food was at Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>After years of living without it, my husband and I had our date night dinner this past Friday at this location. The minute we walked in, we were greeted and seated. The service was wonderful from start to finish. <br><br>That&#39;s exactly what I love to experience whenever I visit an establishment. Fantastic service and delicious food. What more can make anyone happy?! (yeah, I know there is more but let&#39;s keep it humble) <br><br>I suggest if you dine here, you don&#39;t go without trying a cheesecake - I mean for obvious reasons (hint, hint: it&#39;s called the CHEESECAKE factory) <br><br>I tried the classical cheesecake slice and it&#39;s the best little slice I&#39;ve ever had. I hope all establishments are this amazing so I can list Cheesecake Factory as a top pick.
This place is amazing, service is always good a well. Would be a five star but there is always a wait time and they do no take reservations

So I&#39;ve been to the cheesecake factory many times before but decided to go to this location because I&#39;ve had bad service at others. Let me just say that this location was very clean the bathrooms were clean table seating everything was very clean. <br> We were provided very good customer service we had a very large party we only had one waiter Drake A. and he was very good very respectful &amp; very good service and I&#39;ll definitely be returning to this location

Went here on a date with my girlfriend today. The servers were friendly, but weren&#39;t as open with us as the other customers. Which made us kinda sad. But overall it was still okay because most of the food came pretty much on time, and they at least tried to put on a smile for us.<br><br>Prices were of course expensive due to the area and the overall gist of the location. But perhaps still set a little high for the location. 18 bucks for a mushroom burger seems to be pushing it a little far. The beef in the burger wasn&#39;t absolutely amazing, and it didn&#39;t give me that wow factor that I expected from a near $20 burger.<br><br>Also the chicken picatta pasta wasn&#39;t too amazing too. It was a little too oily and the flavoring missed the point by a little overall. But the good thing about a place like this is that they&#39;ll almost never do anything so wrong that people will blatantly just return or throw out the food. I would come back maybe once a year or so when I&#39;m feeling spendy but not sure what to eat. Of course, I&#39;ve only tried 7-8 of their selections so I can&#39;t judge their repertoire of food too harshly. Plus, I&#39;ve never left this place still feeling hungry thanks to the complementary bread. I personally would give 3.5 stars if that&#39;s an option. Simply because this place sits on the very thing edge of &#34;pretty good food&#34;, yet &#34;not really worth its price&#34; line.

Went back again because the food is good and I&#39;m in the area but a friendly reminded to all is to always check your pick up orders for accuracy. After a particularly exhausting day I got home to find items missing from my order. I was told I could drive back to pick up my cheesecake without apology. I asked to speak to a manager, Lawrence, who offered to refund me for the cheesecake, replace it and offer two additional slices for the my troubles. I ordered the additional slices for my girlfriends and drove back to Glendale. I was tired so I sent my son in and told him to ask for Lawrence. He returned with two cheesecakes (one missing). I was completely over it by then and left irritated. The offer was generous and not one I felt entitled but it definitely took the sting out of driving back and forth. I&#39;m baffled by the lack of attention to detail. An extra star for effort but there&#39;s a lot of room for improvement here.

Terrible service. Last night we ordered there for to go with WHITE RICE. We made it clear it should be WHITE RICE. But when we got home upstairs, we found out they gave us BROWN RICE. The guy we spoke to told us &#34;but we are closing &#34;. Not even an apology or anything to make it up with. Tsk tsk tsk.

Where do I begin? Do I start with the franchise going downhill with their dirty silverware or terrible service? Or should I elaborate on the disgusting way they serve their food? Let me start from the beginning. <br><br>It was about a week ago and it was my grandma&#39;s birthday. We asked her where she wanted to eat and she said Cheesecake Factory in Glendale. First thought that came to mind was the dirty silverware, plates, cups, and everything else that I see EVERY SINGLE TIME I go there. My brother and I told our parents that we didn&#39;t want to go here because of our previous experiences and didn&#39;t want to experience this on my grandma&#39;s birthday, especially. They insisted it was her choice so we decided to go. We got there and they told us about a 10-15 minute wait and as soon as I got my buzzer I told my dad that I still didn&#39;t feel good about this place and that we should go somewhere else. As soon as I was telling him about it, our buzzer rang. No turning back now. We get seated outside for a table of 5.<br><br>First thing I do is check my silverware. And not to my surprise, my fork had a ketchup stain on the back of it and the silverware was dirty. There were stains all over it, like it usually was every single time we went. The silverware was like this for 3/5 people. We told our waiter and he told us that he would bring us PLASTIC forks, knives, and spoons. PLASTIC. Sorry, but if a waiter goes straight to fixing your utensil problem from silverware to PLASTIC then he should already know there is a problem and knows none of them will be clean no matter how many he gives us. That is problem #1. We accept it because we know this is the cleanest resort.<br><br>My brother and I already complaining to leave, our parents and grandma told us that it was fine and that we should just enjoy it. Not for long. <br><br>My brother opens up his napkin and a pasta noodle is stuck to it. Obviously not washed. First off, that is disgusting and you don&#39;t have the time to thoroughly wash your utensils AND napkins? Ridiculous. <br><br>My brother asks for another napkin and our waiter brings out another napkin. He opens it and there are LIPSTICK STAINS all over the napkin. I&#39;ve had enough at this point and lost my appetite. It was already 1PM and I hadn&#39;t eaten anything all day and already felt sick. We decided to leave the napkin and complain to the manager after we were done with our meal to not make that big of a scene. <br><br>My mom orders the Artichoke Dip and Calamari for appetisers. After getting our appetisers after 25 minutes, I decided to eat a little bit or else I was going to pass out. My mom is getting some of the artichoke dip and putting it in her plate. To her surprise, she thought there was an artichoke heart in the bowl and decided to cut it. But it wasn&#39;t. It was a PIECE OF PAPER INSIDE THE DIP.<br><br>That was it. We were done and we demanded to see the manager. We showed him everything and he didn&#39;t flinch one bit. He just nodded and said &#34;Yeah I&#39;m sorry I&#39;m sorry&#34;. Not even apologizing profusely or showing any concern. Just a blank face saying the cued &#34;I&#39;m so sorry&#34;. We walked out of the restaurant and went across the Americana to Katsuya. &#34;I&#39;ll make sure something is done about this.&#34;? Yeah, you better! Are you serious? That&#39;s f****** disgusting. Should call the FDA on this place. <br><br>Never come to The Cheesecake Factory unless you want used paper in your appetisers and terrible service with stained utensils and plates that has used food on it. Ridiculous.

Glendale location ATTACHED to the Americana mall.   Visited for lunch at 1:30pm on a Thursday.  Parking via parking garage.  Easy to find location as it was visible from the street but parking was slightly confusing.  It turned out working just fine.<br><br>1.  Wait was quoted to be 20 minutes but we waited less than 10 minutes for a table.<br>2.  Service was friendly, prompt, and accurate!<br>3.  Food was tasty as expected.  We had the roasted artichokes which were a tad undercooked but everything else was cooked well.<br>4.  We celebrated my mom&#39;s birthday and they brought her a decorated plate and mini sundae.<br>5.  Parking was free with validation.<br><br>Overall it was a pleasant experience.  Nice location although a bit busy for a weekday afternoon!<br><br>***Odd Fact*** we noticed a couple get seated with their dog inside the dining room.  Dog was not a service dog but a small grey/white fluffy little lap dog.  They did nothing to conceal his presence.  It seemed odd but I wasn&#39;t necessarily bothered by it.  Just a first seeing a Resturaunt accept a dog inside like that!
Love this place, they have wide range of dishes. Must try the hamburgers. The avocado egg rolls are the best.

For anyone to rate this place less than 5 stars try running a business like this. Chances are you will fail miserably. No matter what part of the country you are in when you visit this place the service and the food is consistent.
My favorite place!  The bread is sooooo good... I could just have the bread and the lemonade, but then of course the cheesecake with strawberries! Ahhh

Whenever I go to and eat at The Cheesecake Factory, I feel like I&#39;ve stepped into a spa of food. A spa because it makes me feel so good and am comfortably catered to, and the food is usually absolutely delicious. The cheesecake, ALWAYS delicious! Honestly, there was just one dish on the Skinnylicious menu that I wouldn&#39;t recommend, but I can&#39;t even remember the name of the dish. Who cares! After 15+ years of coming here with only one so-so dish? That deserves a 5-star review in my book. Going to The Cheesecake Factory is a real treat for all your senses and tastebuds. So go, now.
Love this place. My salad was good. I finished the entire thing. Usually the salads are a huge portion so I can share but not this one. It&#39;s tasty but the shrimp was cold. Way too much cheese.

The customer service definitely got worse after Covid-19. I have nothing to say about cleaning, it&#39;s good, food is also good. But the workers at desk are rude and don&#39;t communicate with customers politely.
They had a food delay, waiter did not inform us. Manager stopped by and was so rude instead of just apologizing.
Fun to come to. Food is alright. Cheesecake seems a bit old. Not as soft as I expected and super caloric--over 1,000 calories for a small slice. Yikes

I always have mixed feelings when it comes to the Cheesecake Factory. Either it&#39;s really good or really bad. And for the most part there is no in between. My girlfriend and I are both not big on the Cheesecake Factory. We said since we&#39;ve never had it together that we should try it.  After our meal there we are sticking to our no Cheesecake Factory rule. <br><br>This location is pretty cool and big. They have a lot of patrons that frequent here. The staff seemed to be on it and they seated us rather quickly even with them being busy. As you know they have a huge menu. Which can be kind of a down side because that leaves no room for pictures and too many different dishes for the chefs to make. But it is what it is. <br><br>I orders the truffle honey chicken which sounded amazing but it was blah. It reminded you chicken fried steak with a honey glaze. The coating on the chicken was overly sweet and falling off. So I had to scoop the mash, chicken n the coating to the effect. The mash potatoes were the savior of that dish. <br><br>My girlfriend ordered some other chicken dish which was not to bad but heavy on the lemon sauce. That was was ok. We also had the sweet corn tamale cakes. Those are so good. They like made up for the blah meals. <br><br>All in all I&#39;m not gonna trash the restaurant because they have a good clientele and rep but it&#39;s not for me. Like I said this chain is a hit and miss. If I go back it will just be for the desserts.

I love Cheesecake Factory! This was my first time at the Americana. Beautiful location. Clean and so chic. We were seated on the outside patio and the weather was perfect but a little sunny. <br>All of the food was fresh and delicious. Service was great. We came for a lunch meeting and since they were not crowded, the wait staff pretty much just left us alone to our meeting. That was awesome. <br>This time we tried new things and they were good. We did leave a little hungry as we usually get pasta but all in all fantastic Cheesecake Factory experience.<br><br>2017 Yelp 100 Challenge <br>70/100<br>#yelpelite

This is the kind of place that makes foodies cringe, but that&#39;s only out of snobbishness. The bottom line is that they have everything every picky member of your family would want, the cheesecakes are divine, and they put the calorie counts right on the menu so you can make good decisions. It&#39;s not fine dining, but great for families.

Not great food obviously very well presented but the line was huge I had a reservation at 9 and didn&#39;t get seated till 10 and if it wasn&#39;t for their cheesecake which is what they are known for this would get 1 Star

There is nothing but good things to say about this cheesecake branch. Great employees, great service and great food.<br><br>I order from here once every month and as often as I order, I am no where near sick of it.<br><br>My go-to&#39;s are the jambalaya, of which I substitute the rice for pasta. Trust me, you&#39;ll want to have this again. Another go-to is the spicy Caesar salad with salmon. The salmon and salad portions are very generous. I am always talking my meal home with me. <br><br>Now on to the meatloaf. That&#39;s right, MEATLOAF. I get it, not many people find the concept of meatloaf appetizing because with a name like meatloaf, who would. Anyway, do yourself a favor and at least try this once. I can&#39;t even begin to describe how freaking delicious this is. All you need to know is that I vouch for it, and therefore, you should try. You&#39;re welcome in advance!

If your idea of a good time and dinner experience is being shoved in a small table and slow inattentive service then this is the place for you...Low expectations are necessary for this joint...Ignored for 15 - 20 minutes...i checked to see if I had dog poop on my shoes..i get the impression servers and staff are not happy being there...Enjoy..!!..P.S..toss in explosive diarrhea the next day...Whoopee..!!

The worst place to be celebrating any birthday. they sat us down and didn&#39;t even bring us water or bread after waiting in line for 1.5 hours. we sat there trying to keep cool but 25 minutes before getting water and bread. We still ordered expecting things to get better , since there was 3 servers coming to our table (didn&#39;t really know who was my server  since they all teamed up to ruin my order). I didn&#39;t get what I asked for after waiting that long, I just wanted to leave. I should&#39;ve walked out on the bill but nope. I paid .<br>manager was cool with the whole taking the items off the receipt butt I didn&#39;t go for a free meal. I wanted to enjoy my birthday with my family and instead I got my plate in a to bag just to reheat it in the microwave. It was dry as the service I got from this place. freaking nightmare. never has this happened. sat down at 7:45 pm, 8:10 got water (without the lemon we had asked for and bread), 8:40pm got wrong plate, 9 pm to go bag  with right order.

We went to cheese cake factory In Americana way in Glendale, to order some food to go.<br>I ordered a brick chicken meal, and asked for well done the chicken.<br>After I cut the chicken , I noticed that not only chicken is not well done, but even it&#39;s not fully cooked.<br>Have you guys heard anything about Salmonella?????

Made a reservation on Sunday night while I last minute Christmas shopped at the galleria. Upon making the reservation through Yelp, I noticed that there was only a 2 hour ahead availability. Which was fine since my party and I were not quite hungry and thought we would clear our Christmas shopping and eat in peace. When it was our reservation time we skipped the queue and checked in at the desk about our reservation. We waited an additional 10 minutes and was finally seated. Everything from the fresh hot bread, avocado rolls, and our entrees were amazing! From the staff keeping it cool during the holidays to the servers, it was a great experience at the Americana!

can never go wrong with this place<br>if ya know ya know<br>even though the wait is long it is worth it! i plan by getting my name on the list during days with long wait times (usually weekends) then going around to shop!

This review is in regards to the Cheesecake Factory in in Glendale in the Americana. The place is well organized. The staff is warm, friendly and attentive. The bathroom is always clean. And there is alfresco dining if you prefer.

Your standard beloved Cheesecake Factory. I love this one because it is located in the Americana in Glendale. My friend and I came here for a quick lunch before we went to catch a movie.<br><br>We ordered the Mexican Tortilla Salad, the Chicken Parmesan Pizza, and the Bacon and Cheese Appetizer. The appetizer was good - very, VERY heavy. I could only eat one. I enjoyed the Mexican Tortilla salad a lot - there&#39;s two tortillas at the bottom with black beans woooo what a cool surprise. The Chicken Parmesan Pizza was literally a glop of pasta on top of a pizza LOL - so basically exactly what it sounds like. Cheesecake Factory always gives the biggest whoppingest portions, so each dish you order can be eaten over 2+ meals.<br><br>Yelp 100 Challenge 2017 (80/100)

Good food well priced great atmosphere, negative is long wait and service is oh not good, they give you complimentary ice cream for birthday but don&#39;t get fooled, it&#39;s so small its ridiculous and not funny, its all whipped cream. Needed to seriously complain the corporate office.

Disappointing. My boyfriend and I came here because we were both actually craving Cheesecake Factory. To be honest, we were probably just craving the wheat bread that is served and a slice of cheesecake, but we ordered because that&#39;s what you do at dinner. It would probably be frowned upon if we just sat and ate the free bread and drank water, plus we were hungry. So, I ordered the bang bang chicken and shrimp, and he ordered the chicken fettuccini Alfredo and the Mac n cheese for his daughter. I found undercooked shrimp in my food &amp; both sauces on both pastas were completely watered down. Service &amp; bread was good, but I was sad about the quality of the food. Next time I&#39;ll probably just have the bread, an appetizer, and a slice of cheesecake. They are called Cheesecake Factory for a reason after all.

Absolutely horrible experience. My friend and I came here thinking we would just enjoy a nice lunch on a beautiful day. We waited 45 minutes for a table outside in the patio because she brought her dog, that&#39;s understandable because it was a Sunday evening. Then we waited another hour and a half, to NOT GET OUR FOOD. The server who took our order, gave us the bread and our waters but NEVER GAVE US OUR FOOD. He then told us he was leaving because his shift was over and handed us off to another server and at this point we had already asked him twice where our food was. We watched tables come and go and get their food and they were seated AFTER us. We both ordered the SAME lunch pasta plate. It&#39;s nothing complicated. That server told us it was coming. It never did. The server that he passed on to us probably has no idea what the order was. We asked him several times to check on our order. He never came back. We waved our hands multiple times just for servers to ignore us and walk past us. Even waived down a busboy to try and get a manager for us. Nothing. Absolutely ridiculous. My friend and I got tired of waiting for our food and left and went to eat across the plaza because an hour and a half is absurd for a plate of pasta. We were ignored and clearly our business isn&#39;t appreciated here. I understand things get chaotic and busy but the least they could&#39;ve done was to be upfront and honest with us. If you forgot to place the order, then tell us. We will not be back. I&#39;d rather go to other locations. There are plenty of other options to choose from in the Americana.

DO NOT GO TO THIS CHEESECAKE FACTORY!!  This is  what the website says about covid..&#34;The health and wellbeing of our staff members and guests is always our number one concern...&#34;  This is what happened.. Ordered on line, went inside. A few patrons with masks and social distancing. Two 20 something women walk in, both wearing masks down below their chins and BOTH VAPING. Greeter told them they had to wear masks and they said &#34;we are.&#34; Greeter laughed and let them stay inside. I told them to stop vaping and put their masks on and they told me to &#34;F-Off.&#34;  Doubt I&#39;ll come back here even when this is over!!

This low key has become my spot when I don&#39;t want to eat somewhere trendy or stressful. Love the avocado egg rolls ! And they have bomb bread and butter that comes out. I usually split some plates with my sis and drink soda waters.

Really wonderful place to hang out or go out with your family and friends. Really fantastic customer service. I love the bread. Lemonade is next level. Pasta is great but!!! Do not ask for steak. No flavor. Really soft but no flavor. Warning don&#39;t over eat butter with bread. It is too heavy. <br>Highly recommended but no steak.
Best server ever. He was funny and served us quickly. The food was amazing and worth every penny. We got a flat cheese bread pizza, Nashville Hot nuggets and bistro shrimp pasta.

One of the most famous restaurants in town! Oh well their food selections are wide and great! So far, all my visits were okay! They may be a bit pricey but their serving size is pretty huge so you might want to share with your peeps or you can always take your leftovers home! This branch at the Americana is big but always full! They do validate your parking tickets good for 3 hours.

Who doesn&#39;t love the cheesecake factory? I know it&#39;s a chain, but darn good one. Everything they create is fabulous. I&#39;m shocked at how broad the menu is, but everything is on point. Seriously. On point! <br><br>I love the complimentary warm bread and butter. Yes, sometimes I get refills. Don&#39;t judge!  From the strawberry lemonade to the cocktails you can&#39;t go wrong with drinks. Food. Where do I start?! Great lunch specials. Prices are great. I love the salad and pizza combo. Huge portions at a lunch special rate. I always go home with leftovers. <br><br>If you love garlic and shrimp, the shrimp scampi is the best I have ever had. You will be happy with your decision. I also love all of the salmon dishes. The miso salmon being my all time favorite. The steak, the burgers, whatever you&#39;re craving, go with your gut. Everything is yummy. <br><br>Save room for dessert or take something to go. My favorite cheesecake right now is the Nutella crunch. It&#39;s a newer cheesecake. How can anything with Nutella be bad?! It can&#39;t! Again, go with your gut. You will be happy. I may have tried almost everything when it comes to dessert. Some of my other favorites include the vanilla bean, banana cream, dulce de leche, Reese&#39;s, red velvet, and anything with chocolate.

Had dinner here on a Sunday night which it was expected to be busy.  But we waited a really long time for our food which has never happened before and having a toddler you are on a specific time frame. I got the chicken madaria which is my absolute favor dish. Love the flavors of the mushroom with the cheese and sauce on top of the chicken. Not to mention the mash potatoes are heaven. But this time I was a bit disappointed with the flavor. My chicken seemed dry and sauce wasnt wasnt enough. Still enjoyed the dish but missed the old flavors I was use too. My daughter enjoyed her mac and cheese and my husband had the combo with shrimp scampi and steak. I tried the shrimp and sauce was delicious on point. My husband enjoyed his dish.

Love love love there is nothing bad I can say ! Everthing from appetizer small plates dinner lunch and desserts are awsome. My kids enjoy the kids Menus as well. My favorite would be the tex mex egg rolls little cuban sandwiches pad tai noodles cajun pasta with chicken and shrimp and the original cheesecake with strawberries.  But the selections are endless they have a menu that comes in a sprial book!! That is how many options you have. They have to go orders you pick up at the dessert counter.  The decor is impeccable service timly friendly and I love whenvthe servers have actually tasted the items so if you are struggling with choosing they are able to give an honest opinion. Parking at this location is validated and you take an escalator to get to the restaurant plenty of seating indoor or outdoor patio with umbrella coverings. Wait time varies depending on the time you go.

Spouse is barfing right now for the 4th time and he hardy ever gets sick. He threw up his whole entire lunch and dinner which was the same meal from this place.  I have diarrhea. He ordered shrimp platter. I got the herb crusted salmon well done. <br><br>The silverware was dirty and had food stuck to it. I didn&#39;t complain and just used other silverware. <br>We are both sick and we haven&#39;t eaten out in a month. This place definitely got us sick <br>AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

I went last well it was pretty good. Better then all the other times I&#39;ve went . Calamari was awesome, good portions, lettuce wilted as hell. Cocktails were so so but all in all it was better then expected cause usually the food is burnt n sucks . I&#39;d go back if I didn&#39;t have any other options .

Always a great choice if you want that quick cocktail or small appetizer while shopping at the Americana. <br><br>Check out the small plates on the menu! The corn tamales are delicious, and you can&#39;t go wrong with the avocado egg rolls.<br><br>I&#39;m not all about their huge dinner menu.. I think it&#39;s a little over rated to be honest, and I also didn&#39;t like that they only have 3 beers on tap. Lol
Horrible customer service long lines food taste like frozen dinners cheesecake overpriced bad parking not worth the wait

This restaurant has really fast, nice customer service. Everyone was helpful and professional.  It&#39;s right where the action is so perfect for fun after. <br><br>Great drinks from the bar for sure. The food however was awful. The calamari was mushed together with some awful frying not suitable at all.<br><br>The burger presentation was sloppy as well with sweet potato fries stuck together. It tasted good, but looked messy.<br><br>Cheese Cake Factory is never one of my choices for  restaurants and this reminds me why.<br><br>Very nice outside seating, you can just seat yourself at the bar, no wait. Great cocktails
I love the cheese cake factory. <br>Food is always good and fresh. Last time I sat outside in the second patio , was very uncomfortable but everywhere else is perfect.
Food is gross. Most of everything I&#39;ve tried off the menu taste frozen, absolutely no flavor. Definitely will not eat here again, I&#39;m surprised this place is still in business.

2 stars because of location and our amazing AMAZING server. but you guys! I got food poisoning or something similar after biting a very VERY rotten piece of steak Diane. It was raw, mushy and very rancid. I took one bite  and ended up throwing up in the bathroom. It was crazy. My brother who also shared the dish with me ended up throwing up an hour later. management came up and checked in which was nice but i was basically traumatized and can&#39;t believe they let this slide in the kitchen.

Really beautiful but the place gets so loud so fast and the food is hit or miss. The jamabalaya I had had a really good flavor and is great when you&#39;re very hungry but my friends steak was so boring and basic. Only amazing thing was the pie, which thank goodness it was given the restaurants names haha.

We had a problem with our order, our main waiter goes on break, but the replaced waiter has an attitude, but luckily, the Manager, his  name is John, is very attentive to our problems and with his diplomatic charismatic approached, we will end up going home disappointed, we just live in Glendale and we&#39;re regulars here at Cheesecake. Our waiter is really nice his name is Tyler, but the  one that replaced him cuz he goes on break has an  attitude. But all ends well because of the  intervention of John the manager and Tyler who is exceptional , has a great attitude.

Came to Americana to check out some new yoga outfits from Under Armour, and of course one can get very hangry just shopping, right?<br><br>Well, just about every restaurant was full with lines, and shockingly that The Cheesecake Factory (TCF) didn&#39;t have a line, wow!  Since I hate to wait, we decided to just try this TCF, and it was delightfully good.<br><br>We shared the soup salad special (clam chowder &amp; mixed green) and the Sheila&#39;s Chicken avocado salad.  The Sheila&#39;s was excellent and of course the portions are huge as always.  So, I know that TCF is a chain that normally doesn&#39;t get much respect.  However, I&#39;ve always had pretty good experiences with TCF.  So whenever I go to the malls, I will keep on trying different locations as I run into them!!

We tried this place again yesterday around 7pm and OMG... NEVER AGAIN!!!<br><br>******* ATTENTION*******<br>Long story short my NY steak was COVERED IN BURNED PLASTIC - the whole bottom and top. I actually did Not notice until It was half way eaten. The waiter and manager apologized for this.. and took it off the bill and offered a different dish but by then I lost my appetite. Honestly you guys should of taken the entire bill off. <br><br>We agreed we would never come here again..<br>We gave this place PLENTY of chances and I&#39;m sorry but me eating burnt plastic is NOT okay. If I get sick I&#39;m sending you guys the bill.<br><br>I mean honestly how can a cook not realize there is plastic all over the steak?!!!!<br>It&#39;s probably already cooked in plastic and it&#39;s not fresh.<br><br>Extremely disappointed!!!!!

I don&#39;t like leaving bad reviews but after waiting 15min for a slice of shmores cheesecake to go. They give it to me without the gram cracker. They did not mention anything as I had to tell them myself. The food quality is good but looks like the customer service here isn&#39;t like the cheesecake in Santa Monica. No other alternative given.

We had the best dinner experience at Americanas Cheesecake Factory and it was all bc of our server Andrew. Not only did he recommend the delicious Louisiana chicken pasta but gave us fresh bread  to take home. Thank you Andrew for you&#39;re the best. We will be asking for you next time we return.

Since they don&#39;t take reservations and the wait is usually in excess of 1/2 hr., it is great that the location is in an open mall area, with a fountain outside that mimics the Las Vegas Bellagio!<br><br>If you like it a tad bit quieter ask to be seated in the bar area.  There are high-tops (open seating) as well as booth/table seating (wait-times vary).  We have a favorite server (Jeanette) so if she&#39;s working we ask for her section. If you are lucky enough to have a birthday celebration while there her voice is really lovely.<br><br>The food here is always good and plentiful. Tonight we (4 of us) shared the eggroll, the fried cheese sticks and the stuffed mushroom appetizers.  All were very good, and I especially liked the avacado dip with the eggrolls.  I had a lemon drop, which they will serve in a high-ball glass instead of a martini upon request, which is much less likely to spill!<br><br>For our main courses tonight we had: a half-sandwich and Caesar salad combo, a Caesar salad with steak (exactly medium rare as requested), fish and chips with a side of clam chowder, and the stuffed cheddar burger.  The only complaint on all the food was that the clam chowder was a little heavy on the rue.<br><br>And, of course, cheesecake for dessert. I&#39;m particularly fond of their lemon meringue cheesecake. Tonight we shared the peanut butter and chocolate and also the s&#39;mores. I added a cup of coffee which was way too strong so our fabulous server took it away and had a fresh pot brewed.<br><br>I enjoy this place approximately once each 4 - 6 weeks.  There is occasionally a celebrity dining there, which is kind of fun!

First of all I love the Cheesecake Factory but today my experience was the worst first we get seated and I notice my silver wear is dirty and sticky I ask for a new set then I order the steak Diane and shrimp scampi the steak medium well  and I get a burnt steak  oh and I gave it two stars because at least my cocktail was right I had a peach Bellini thanks to the bartenders

08/26/2019 If it were possible, i would give this place NEGATIVE stars. PLEASE take your money elsewhere, not one person in this restaurant knows what they are doing. Starting from management all the way down to the waiters. Very unprofessional and disorganized staff, this was by far my WORST experience at a restaurant EVER!<br><br>My family and i were seated around 7:50pm after 1 1/2 hours on a very slow monday evening. Once we finally got to our table, we were given a waiter (i believe his name was karl) who immediately displayed nothing but attitude while attempting to take our drink orders. Once the drink orders were placed, it took (karl) approx. 30 min to COME BACK and take our FOOD ORDER. He proceeded to non-chalantly take our orders, while TAPPING members of the table constantly with his pen in a very rude way to get their attention. Once that processes was finally over, we continued to wait 25 MORE min to finally get 2 cocktails that were ordered a total of about an hour prior.<br><br>It is at this time that our whole party is completely restless waiting for over an hour with ZERO, and i mean ZEROOOOO updates about any food, AND to top it off with only water and bread brought to the table, we were never asked if we wanted any refills on water or anything. TERRIBLE SERVICE. Now waiting for well over an hour with no updates, i decide to try and find a manger to try and get some sort of help for once. i walk to the front and at this point i am pointed to a manager ( a younger african-american male, excuse my failure to describe him as he never presented his name to me. I voice my concerns to him and he asks me to show him what table we were sitting at, i continued to explain that we all decided we were going to leave after this terrible experience, meanwhile the waiter we had (karl) continued to mock us and say rude comments under his breath. The way this whole ordeal ended was the manager giving ZERO solution to the problem and only saying sorry once.  NEVER COMING HERE EVER AGAIN. please GO ELSEWHERE they DO NOT DESERVE YOUR SERVICE.

I am so frustrated! We waited 2 hours to sit down an my whole meal was wrong and my cousin got a different meal than what she ordered!<br><br>I ordered a burger gluten free style with no cheese and they brought a burger with bread and cheese. The waitress told me my food was taken to the wrong table. They are a huge restaurant and should get things right.<br><br>Also, my cousin ordered a shrimp dish and got a chicken dish. The waitress asked her If the chicken dish was ok and My cousin was very sweet and couldn&#39;t say no. Can you imagine ordering shrimp and getting a chicken dish?<br><br>I gave them 3 stars because the manager was very sweet and comped our meals.<br><br>In addition, the burger was really delicious! I just wish they told me there was a toothpick that was holding everything together. There was paper wrapped around my lettuce style burger, so it was hard to see it, so when I bit into it I almost poked my tongue.<br><br>It was Mother&#39;s Day and crazy so I understand things can happen. If the crazy service errors didn&#39;t happen I would have given them 5 stars.

I like the atmosphere and service, waiters are always nice and attentive but, cleanliness could be better, tables and menus are always greasy, food is so so, hummus is very sour and salty, chips that comes with it are very greasy and oily, I like only deserts. Utensils are always on a table what I think is disgusting because tables are not that clean, and even if they were I think it&#39;s more hygiene when you leave them on napkins.

Went for a family Christmas dinner.  The wait was 1 and 1/2, but apparently the ticket said 7 people and we were 8.   We waited the hour and a half.  Our beeper went off , went to check in, but you still hv to wait another 10 to 15 mins for them to call your name and hv them seat you. The hosted, said 7 ! ,,, no we said 8.  Apparently that was a problem.  The hostess rudely told us wait again.  She came back after talking to her Mgr and told us she could only sit us at 2 different tables.  The booth they had for us only sat 7.  I also spoke to the manager and was told the same thing.  The Mgr then said, we could wait another 1 hour to be seated Together.  That was his only option.  I declined his option. We decided to eat somewhere else, we&#39;re we didn&#39;t wait and we we&#39;re sitting together.  Needless to say, we won&#39;t be going back to the cheesecake anytime soon.

Last time I came in I waited an eternity... I ended up having to leave because I waited so long and no one came. I returned a few days later (which is today) and has the BEST service. At first it felt like deja vu, no one came and I nearly gave up but Zamia (I think that&#39;s her name) came to the rescue. It wasn&#39;t her area or table, but she helped me nonetheless and made sure my drinks were filled and was so kind. It made me smile and made the dining experience worth every bite. The pasta was good... but the service made my taste buds feel extra enticed as I bit threw the shrimp scampi!! I only wish the shrimp were grilled instead of breaded. But, the pasta was light, butter warm and bread just right.
Gross utensils that were not properly washed. The replacements were equally as dirty. And there was hair in the food. Waitress messed up on our order and was rude. Not a good experience.

|[ b u s y ]|<br>Very busy location seeing that it&#39;s at the mall, one of the slower services ones I&#39;ve been to. They get too busy and forget about you sometimes so gotta flag down for stuff but it wasn&#39;t bad or anything. They did run out of bread at some point so there was a wait on that (I love my bread here, it&#39;s one of my fav).<br><br>|[ u s u a l ]|<br>As always though, the garlic pasta tasted great and so did the avocado egg rolls! My only complaint about Cheesecake Factory is that it&#39;s pretty pricey for the portions but it&#39;s good to have once in awhile. Always nice to dine here though.<br><br>|[ v e r d i c t ]|<br>The waiting and seating was a bit awkward, they called us up but then we still stood there waiting before finally being acknowledged. Service wasn&#39;t too attentive here, and I wish they refilled the bread without being hunted down. Average location. Nice break from shopping though.

Haven&#39;t been to Cheesecake Factory in years. Went today for happy hour with some friends. Happy hour menu has a great selection of food, and drinks. Definitely come hungry as they don&#39;t cut down on portion sizes during happy hour. Starts at 4pm. Tex mex rolls were delicious and every bite was crispy, our favorite were the sweet corn tamale cakes. Cross between corn bread, and polenta topped with salsa and sour cream. So good! Would come back just for that.

Cheesecake Factory &amp; DoorDash Spoil the 4th of July:  No Accountability/No Service<br><br>Last week, DoorDash and the Cheesecake Factory Sherman Oaks sent a notice of a &#34;7 for $20 special running through July 5 featuring two burgers, two fries, two drinks and a slice of Oreo cheesecake - all for $20.  So two days ago, I placed my order (confirmed by email) for 4:30 pm today.  I forgot to specify &#34;rare&#34; on the burgers, so I called the Cheesecake Factory around 11:30 this morning only to find out &#34;sorry, we ran out&#34; of that special yesterday afternoon at 2 p.m.   Apparently each location was &#34;allotted&#34; only a set number of those specials to make available.  The Cheesecake Factory doesn&#39;t just mean you can no longer order that special.  They also mean if you already have an order scheduled, too bad.  Not only that, no one - not the restaurant, not DoorDash - is bothering to notify customers expecting to receive their meals that they won&#39;t get them.  Not only is this bad - but today on the Fourth, some people may be counting on this burger deal as at home celebration of the Fourth of July since the State and the City still mandate no gatherings outside of the &#34;people you live with.&#34;<br>  It&#39;s amazing during this pandemic when shuttered restaurants are struggling to survive on outside tables, deliveries, and take outs, that they would alienate loyal customers this way.  Not so much as a notification or an apology or some attempt to make this right.  Both DoorDash and the Cheesecake Factory have plenty of competitors eager to take their business (and they have lost mine).
Great spot for a wide selection of food, could be better at  being properly staffed when opening in the morning.

For some reason, this place feels different than the other Cheesecake Factory Places. <br>They need way more seating and more service..<br>Everytime I come here, I wait for more than 20 minutes to take a seat. When I get seated, service takes a long time to come. The food is fine, I just don&#39;t like how time consuming it is for me to get in and out of here. If they got more tables or better service, Id give more stars

We had cocktails and a light snack before our movie. Our server was amazing and worked with us with our tight schedule. We ordered the flatbreads off their appetizer and shareable menu. Perfect to share between the 3 of us. They were amazing as you can see by the pictures. I ordered the Well-Mannered Martini with blue-cheese stuffed olives. It was perfect!

My feeling about the Cheesecake Factory is that it has dependably good food.<br>What I didn&#39;t count on was the ick factor. Dishes, glasses, and silverware were mostly all dirty. I asked our server if we could have clean ones and he replied, &#34;I hope so.&#34;<br>The topper was our visit to the restroom. DISGUSTING! They say the state of the restroom reflects the state of the kitchen.<br>I don&#39;t intend to return.

Huge shout out to a few people here for making our night special...<br><br>We came 4/17 around 8 pm. <br><br>First, Justin and Joshua were so hospitable to a diabetic family member with procuring some bread and butter while we waited.<br><br>The biggest shout out goes to PJ!<br><br>An absolutely wonderful attitude from the start to finish. She is the stuff model employees and future managers are made of.<br><br>It is absolutely imperative that she gets a raise and promotion. An attitude like hers keeps us coming back and when we return, if we find out that she has not been recognized, we will be very upset.<br><br>Sammy the manager was also clutch and very hospitable and friendly.<br><br>Incredible job, guys.

Ugh horrible. We went for happy hour and I had their chicken nachos and the chicken was dry and rubbery it really tasted old. The chips were burnt to a black crisp. Super disappointed I&#39;ve had this dish before and was always so happy with it.  Bummer. The wait staff was really great though, very nice.  Although I didn&#39;t care for what I was served this time they did apologize, take it off the bill, and offer something else.  Outstanding service. This one off experience won&#39;t deter me from going back.

When we Got seated we Got our waiter. We asked for more bread he said he will bring it out for us.THREE TIMES we ask him and on the the third he said with the worst attitude I&#39;m getting your drinks. We talked to the manager and we got the the perfect waiter.She was so nice and gave us great service she even gave us a free cheesecake from her.defiantly made the night way better

This was my first time at The Cheesecake Factory and I absolutely loved it. The staff were was very friendly &amp; patient. I ended up ordering the Factory Meatloaf- it wasn&#39;t too bad, but I would order something else in the future. The wait time for the food was quite long &amp; I completely understand that. Considering the fact they weren&#39;t packed in the afternoon, I just felt the service could&#39;ve picked up a little bit faster. Overall, I would return with my friends for sure. I highly recommend this place to everyone!

Let&#39;s start with location.  What a beautiful setting at the Americana.  It&#39;s located in a nice shopping area with plenty parking (small fee) and beautiful grounds.  It is right as you walk out of the parking garage, so easy to find.  <br><br>The food here is good.  I have been going to various locations for years and always enjoy each meal.  I have come to love the healthier options menu where the portions are still quite big.  Everything is tasty and big portions to go with the semi-pricey cost.  The bread they serve at the beginning of the meal is delicious, esp. the pumpernickel.  Now really what they are known for is the cheesecake.  With a very overwhelming menu of choices, there is something for everyone.  I recommend sharing as the cake slice is large too.  You really can&#39;t go wrong here.
It was a nice experience to be able to sit down at a restaurant.  I love being able to make a reservation through Yelp.  The food was really nice and service was great (thanks Tamara).

I haven&#39;t been to Cheesecake Factory in about 15 years when my now-wife and I first got together. I couldn&#39;t tell you how it was then but I can tell you now it was very good. this place was packed and we were not going to wait 45 minutes so we sat at the bar got served right away. It&#39;s funny no matter where you go classy, expensive, fast food or Taco Bell .... when you enter the men&#39;s restroom there is always always piss all over the floor in front of the urinals. So whether you are a rich bastard or you are  a stanky Ash bum, (sorry- homeless or person with no home but they still have a dog)...... They all still piss on the floor. So to me you&#39;re still the same people.  Bet that!<br>JRB

They change menu items every so often but for the most part great choices and delish food. Great bar menu drinks and of course cheesecake. The Bananna Creme is awesome. <br><br>New favorite are the Tex Mex egg rolls. Yum!!!
I&#39;ve ordered quite a few times and have had a few issues due to kitchen and Doordash. Ashley and team worked hard to rectify my issues and helped to make everything right! Thank you all so much!
Excellent service!! Aaron was a great server and I really enjoyed the food and atmosphere here especially coming here on my daughter&#39;s birthday. Thank you, Aaron!

This place is the best. I love it so much even though I only had it like 3 times. My waiter Elise, was so sweet and she was a very good waiter, she was nice and made sure we had what we wanted. I think she should get a raise honestly. And who can forget about their cheese cake! Even the Original is super good. I had a original cheese cake for my birthday and no regrets about that. So come to the cheese cake factory people!

If I can give this establishment a 0 I absolutely would. A 25 minute wait for a table turned out to be almost an hour. People that arrived after us were seated before us. Took forever to get our food and drinks. The food was on the same level as a fast food restaurant. I&#39;ve been to many Cheesecake factories in Norcal and Socal, but I can say that this one here by far is the most unorganized and has horrible customer service. Disappointing!!

Slow slow slow. Service is slow. We waited forever to get drinks while waitress passed by repeatedly and even stopped by next to us to talk for 10 minutes. <br><br>Food took forever. Just a slow slow experience. Waitress hardly checked on us. Bad experience.

PJ THE SERVER has got to be one of the most genuinely happy, attentive and friendly people I have ever met. She made our night extremely special and took the dinning experience to another level! <br><br>A couple minutes after she had brought the drinks, she came by our table saying that it was time for her to go home. However, she really wanted to serve us so she spoke with her manager and said she would stay longer. PJ chose to stay longer JUST to serve us! <br><br>This left me in shock, it made her stand out instantly. It was such a kind gesture for her to stay serving us and it showed her amazing work ethic and the caliber of human she is; a Leader.<br><br>The food was good and the experience was absolutely awesome thanks to PJ the server! Thanks again PJ!<br><br>From Katty &amp; Monica! :)

I&#39;ve been to many different locations and this one is on par with the others except for one thing - which I will mention in a bit.<br><br>The service is fine, attentiveness is average. <br><br>We ordered the classic burger and the lunch salad/pizza. I didn&#39;t eat the burger but it looked fine - bacon was added to the burger, and as a note it&#39;s on the less cooked side. <br><br>The Caesar salad is fine - the Caesar dressing seems to be more of an oily dressing than usual. <br><br>The Lunch pizza is where I bring attention. I ordered the pepperoni and it looked fine when it came out. I started to eat it and then I noticed that it had some sort of strange smell, so I smelled it and I thought it maybe was just a different pepperoni. I started to smell the rest of the pizza, such as the cheese and crust. I couldn&#39;t put my finger on it because the entire pizza smelled like this item. After eating half of the pizza, we realized that it probably smelled like bleach. I was worried I was going to get sick, so I kind of stopped eating it but then I thought well it means they clean but maybe they spilled bleach into the crust or something. Thank goodness I turned out OK. <br><br>Aside from this incident at this particular location, the Cheesecake Factory is probably one of my favorite places to go.
We go to Cheesecake Factory often , we love the food and love the brown bread , wait time is horrible and front desk people are not nice

Absolutely love Cheesecake Factory, always a good experience, waiters are always awesome, food is always consistent I would urge everyone to try the chipotle chicken pasta if you don&#39;t know what eles to order it delicious make sure to ask for a side or Parmesan cheese !! Cheesecake is whatever but food is great !

This place proves this company is going down the drain. Service is horrible. No communication between kitchen staff and waiters.<br><br>Food was brought out late. Wrong food brought out, quality of pasta horrible. Female manager was really nice. <br><br>Staff looks disengaged and overall horrible experience we will never go here again.

ALWAYS amazing food but mixed feelings on service.         Love coming here after I teach my Pumpfidence dance classes at The Eleven Studios with some of my dancers. My 1st time here was amazing. Our waiter truly went above and beyond. Made me WANT to come back. <br><br>My 2nd experience has been the polar opposite. We actually had to call the manager to our table to complain about the very rude host that was beyond unpleasant and how long our drinks took when finally seated. (30 minutes)  I was really disappointed when nothing was comped in compassion to make a better experience. I brought in 7 people with me. <br><br>I truly feel you can&#39;t go wrong with the food here though.

Yelp 100 Challenge 2018 - 2/100<br><br>Shout out to this place being opened during New Years day, as with most stores in the Americana!<br><br>Came here during New Years day for dinner, and found out that this place was packed! Guess everyone else also thought starting their year with some cheesecake won&#39;t be a bad idea ;)<br><br>There was a line to put your name down with the hostess, but luckily the bar and the high top area is self seating. I was lucky enough to be able to find an empty high top table and got seated right away. ALWAYS ALWAYS CHECK! <br><br>We ordered a Steak Medallion and a Pasta Napoletana off of their special menu, items on those menu in our opinion are more worth it than the other dishes on the regular menu. <br><br>Both dishes were very filly and yummy, we enjoyed both dishes very much and I still have pasta leftovers even after stuffing my face. However, as with all other dishes from Cheesecake Factory, don&#39;t expect it to be healthy since it&#39;s cooked with lots of oil/butter/flavorings. <br><br>Overall good experience, I like that the Americana CF location is in such a prime spot because Americana is the perfect date location (esp with all the festival lights). Since I got a bunch of gift cards to CF with their promotion earlier (2 slices of cheesecake when you purchase $25 gift card), I will definitely be coming back.

Figured I have a sensitive stomach and wasn&#39;t planning on updating my review, however after speaking to a few people and figuring out I wasn&#39;t alone I decided I&#39;ll go ahead and share my experience. <br><br>Had a late lunch with my family and a few hours later I felt extremely nauseous. End be all, I ended up in the hospital for food poisoning and have never felt so terrible in my life. I had one of their new Orlean style pastas and I&#39;m not sure if it was the chicken or perhaps the sauce. Let&#39;s just say I am scarred from ever eating here.. and don&#39;t want to think about chicken or pasta. <br><br>Such a terrible experience. I never thought cheesecake to be a 5 Star, but it was always convenient. Convenience is not worth anyone&#39;s well being. <br>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<br><br>Cheesecake Factory has so many options that you will find something of your liking. Those who like to watch the calories they have a &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menu. <br><br>All plates are huge; you can share!! <br><br>For those not worried about calories my favorites off the menu are:<br>The jambalaya pasta with chicken and shrimp. A bit spicy with some Cajun seasoning all over the pasta, grilled bell peppers and poultry and shrimp. <br><br>Avocado egg rolls! A fun, fried, oily appetizer that everyone just loves. <br><br>Ahi carpaccio. A plate filled with an extremely thin layer of ahi, with some ginger and sesame sauce. It&#39;s not heavy and you won&#39;t feel guilty. <br><br>Recently however, I ordered the herb crusted salmon along with a dark greens mix salad (no dressing; lemon wedges on side) and was appalled when 90% of the salad was old. I mean, it smelled old from the second they sat it down.  We ordered two of these, both the same. So, it wasn&#39;t just bad luck either. <br><br>The manager apologized and told us he would send a new plate however we argued it would be the same as their salad bunch had likely gone bad. He assured us there was fresh salad in the back. (Well, good sir, why did your kitchen staff not make sure that&#39;s what they plate?) they ended up giving us free cheesecake and comping my meal. Which is great, except I don&#39;t eat cheesecake and I would of much rather had a fresh salad to eat for lunch.

One of the host on Tuesday morning is extremely rude and snobby. Came in with my toddler in my arm and bunch of stuff in my hands just to get a quick validation. It will only take him one second to validate my ticket but instead, he look at me and opened his mouth slowly: &#34;we only validate for the customers who dine at the restaurant. I see you have Lemonade bag, you should go back to Lemonade to get your validation.&#34; Cheesecake Factory should write a big notice on the front door if they have this strict policy. And if they don&#39;t, just give me the freaking validation without being a bitch. It&#39;s not that hard to be nice to people.

Worse Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve ever been to, For starters people were staring at my 2 year old that was not acting up to their &#34;expectations&#34; it&#39;s a family restaurant for gods sake, After moving to another table because of the stares, we got our food, well kind of they forgot my 8year old chicken fingers. I found a bug in my salad, i called the busboy to get a manager witch was no use, he said he would go check on  his food....it&#39;s been 15 min since that and still no food...worse service ever from a server manager and just overall bad bad bad....Cheesecake F please hire people that actually want to work, not just any random people who don&#39;t give a damn about their job !!!!!

3 stars because of the bread.<br>Came on a Saturday afternoon, wait was under 30 min got sat down. Noticed our waiter, blonde guy with glasses who I thought seemed nice at first ,starred at my table weirdly of a party of 3. As of that moment I knew we were going to get bad service. Passed us 3 times and not yet once asked us if we wanted refills and more bread. I am only complaining because he waited on the table next to us that was 2 feet away since we sat around the bar area. <br><br>On top of that the fettuccini Alfredo is so weak, for $17.50 added with chicken is so disappointing. I think I will only go there for the cheesecake. That visit just killed it for me. I am sure they have great plates but that pasta is not good for that price, go to bjs for a better meal

I am recently on a plant-based diet, so I&#39;ve been eating a lot of beyond and impossible burgers. I&#39;m always happy just to see them on the menu. Not only does Cheesecake Factory have a  beyond burger on the menu, but it comes out of the kitchen completely vegan- condiments, cheese, and all! Most places make you specify you want it vegan.. and many don&#39;t even give alternatives (if they do, there&#39;s an up-charge), even for the sauce! I really appreciated that I could just order an item off the menu, for the price listed on the menu, knowing it fits my dietary needs, without any customizations! *whew!*<br>Above all that- THE BEYOND BURGER IS AWESOME! The aoli is definitely quite garlic-y, so you might ask for it on the side if you&#39;re on the fence about garlic. Even my boyfriend loved it.<br>Oh and make a reservation- this place is always packed, day and night! If you have a reservation or can snag a seat in the bar area, you&#39;re good to go!

Horrible, the company&#39;s  too lazy  to take reservations. So they make you open a Yelp account to make a reservations. I made for 4 when I got there is was for 2, but yet my confermation says 4. In special instructions I inicated it was a b day. Waitress  had no idea about it. Tables have Horrible lighting,  a terrible company. And a clueless night.

I love this place. I have to be very honest, I ALWAYS get the same dish: bistro shrimp pasta. Yeah, I&#39;m a true creature of habit. But I love it, idc. Of all the locations, this one is my favorite. Obviously I will have cheesecake from time to time, either the regular ass boring Cheesecake (I LOOOOVE it) or the chocolate cheesecake. Sometimes I&#39;ll have the seasonal cheesecakes that have, soooo good.<br><br>I love coming here 1)the aesthetic and feel of the Americana on Brand, and 2) outdoor seating at night. I love enjoying my delicious bread with a glass of Chardonnay outside while listening to the usual back ground music the Americana has playing. Big band or jazz usually, I love it. <br><br>I have to give a big shoutout to Gerard, the waiter (At least I think that&#39;s his name), he was our waiter last night and he was the best. He says dude a lot, but I liked it lol. He was really awesome with us. He was attentive but not annoying. We loved him. Keep it up Gerard! <br><br>Only downside is that for the reason that this Cheesecake Factory is located at the Americana, the wait is so ridiculous.
Loved the attention to our table, they didn&#39;t forget about us in the waves of people and the food was good.

The women&#39;s restroom was disgusting tonight. No toilet paper in the stall. Seat covers covered the floor. The paper towel bin so full that the paper towels were spilling out of the bin. They say you can tell a lot about a restaurant by the cleanliness of their restrooms and if that&#39;s the case then my 1 star is well deserved. I know it&#39;s a Friday night and the restaurant gets busy but that&#39;s not an excuse to overlook the restrooms.
The worst service possible at this location. The waiter was terrible, fat and with a big beard. We walked out before and did not stay to even eat. Never coming back.

The absolute worst customer service EVER. I went in with my BF, super excited to get a mini 6&#34; strawberry cheesecake. We ordered and paid, we were told it would take about 10mins to prep the toppings so we waited patiently. We were having a good time while waiting even talking about getting a chocolate cake for our little intimate future wedding for ourselves when the nicest gentleman comes up to us 15 mins after ordering stating that unfortunately they don&#39;t have the 6&#34; in stock so they&#39;ll gladly provide us with a 7&#34; at no additional cost. I can tell he was stoked that we weren&#39;t bothered by the mistake and it was kind of a win win BUT THEN this manager lady came in (not welcoming at all) saying she&#39;s just gonna charge us for the difference. We looked at her with a confused face because the nice gentleman stated otherwise. I told her I didn&#39;t want to pay for the 7&#34; since we had been waiting for 15 mins already and we never asked for the larger one. She started getting sassy saying &#34;oh no, we weren&#39;t giving it for no extra charge, I&#39;m going to charge your card for the pay difference.&#34; Um no, tf you&#39;re not because I didn&#39;t ask for it. So instead of making things right in any way, she finally gave us a refund. I refuse to spend money where I&#39;m not welcomed or disrespected. How are you a GM at a decent restaurant with absolutely NO CUSTOMER SERVICE SKILLS????!?!?!?!?!? Everyone else was fine, just doing their job especially the young gentleman who was trying to make things right but nope, she just shut him up making him look like he doesn&#39;t know what he was doing. I feel sorry for the staff having to put up with such unprofessionalism. She is the reason why I&#39;ll never come back to this location even for just a slice.

Fortunately, we didn&#39;t need to wait very long for a table. Its always so popular but i like that the restaurant can accomodate so many people especially with their large booths! The restaurant is always bustling with activity that makes it a fun place to go!<br>It&#39;s one of my daughter&#39;s favorite places to go to. But they were disappointed that they no longer have the Parmesan Garlic Cheese bread on the menu! Why? Such an easy appetizer to make plus so GOOD! :(<br>So we tried to Basil tomato flatbread which was good but when you are looking forward to something, nothing can make up for it!   I never understand why establishments get rid of popular items?<br>Luckily, they still have the Pasta Da Vinci. Excellent chicken and mushrooms cooked in a madeira wine sauce tossed with penne pasta. Absolutely delicious!!!

Our waitress Adriana was so wonderful she made this dining experience 10x&#39;s better she also brought our dog water which was a plus ... the food was good and usually what is expected of cheesecake they served us pretty quickly but everything was made better because of her and her attentiveness y the way I had three kids and they were all over the place and she managed to get their orders and drinks accordingly

Usually love Cheesecake Factory but my meal and the service today were equally horrible. The chicken salad sandwich was mostly mayonnaise with very little chicken. Gross. Our server ,wearing sunglasses, brought my daughter&#39;s meal only after we asked the bus person, 15 minutes after I was served and he said &#39;oh it was just sitting there!&#34;  We were too disappointed and asked for the check. Waited again for him to get the credit card and we finally got up and found him sitting at the bar.

More like 3.5 stars for me... I feel like CF is a jack of all trades. They have an extremely large menu so there&#39;s something for everyone, but with this variety you compromise some quality. The food is consistent and good MOST of the time, but other times the quality hasn&#39;t been great, the wait does tend to be long, and it gets very loud indoors when it&#39;s busy. It&#39;s hard to give one rating when I&#39;ve been here more times than I can remember with varying experiences but the Americana location is by far the closest and my most frequented location.<br><br>I&#39;ve had many items from their menu over the years...from appetizers: avocado egg rolls (delicious), fried mac and cheese (pretty good), tex mex eggrolls (just okay), sweet corn tamale cakes (amazing but so many calories!)... from entrees: Louisiana pasta chicken (good but heavy), pasta da vinci (decent as well), veggie burger (amazing surprisingly), Mexican tortilla salad (hit or miss but usually good)... brunch/breakfast: monte Cristo is my sister&#39;s favorite. Probably a few more I&#39;m forgetting at the moment.<br><br>The wait times can get long on the weekends. When majority of restaurants now use the texting system, I don&#39;t like how they give you a buzzer at this location so you can&#39;t walk around too far while you wait. They do validate for Americana parking. Service has always been good. Regardless of the average rating, CF is like a staple that I&#39;ll be returning to due to its a popular choice among friends and it having something for everyone.<br><br>Also, their tuxedo cheesecake is the best cheesecake I&#39;ve ever had.

Great place. I came here yesterday with my sister and we had amazing time here. The food is excellent here. The only thing that dissappointed me was the sloq service. Guys were nice and friendly, but also too slow. Except that everything was good.
This is really disgusting, we come here to have a good dinner and right before we even order we spot these dirty utensils!<br>A big loss of appetite!

Currently on my way out from an attempt to dine here at the Glendale/Americana location. We understand that Cheesecake Fac isn&#39;t a location that accepts reso&#39;s, and we waited an hour and thirty minutes to seat our 10 top. Understandable, but shocking for a Monday. I figured Monday&#39;s they don&#39;t have as many servers, so we waited with no hesitation. Our night took a bitter turn when our server did not seem so pleased to take care of our table. I understand; Monday night, you might feel like you&#39;re the only busy server in the restaurant, I noticed he did have other 4+ tops to take care of. But from the jump he had an unpleasant with our party. I understand certain issues may be out of his power, eg) kitchen getting backed up. However, we had waited 30 minutes to even place our food orders. The server forgot multiple of our guests drinks- not a problem, he eventually brought everyone&#39;s. but then it also took exactly an hour to even receive our cocktail drinks in which we were finally receiving after walking out of the door. Not once did we get water refills, or any sort of update/apology for the (unusual) Monday night delay. Waiting an hour without receiving anything besides one glass of water makes things very irritating and impatient, especially with 4 children in our group. When we decided to notify management and our server since we had not received anything, that we decided to leave instead, the server then tried to make our party feel wrong for our time we claimed we had waited. Forgive us for not getting as technical with you- 1.5hr wait, and a 1 hour wait after being seated to receive DRINKS on a moderate to slow monday night. We said 2 hours, but if we wanted to get technical it was damn near 3 hours. And no type of explanation or apology afterwards, his response was, &#34;alright&#34; and walked away. Other guests in our party said they notified the manager on duty of the issue and he seemed to have no knowledge on how to handle conflict. As someone who used to work hospitality in much more fast paced and nicer dining, I guess my expectations on conflict handling was too high for a chain place like the Cheesecake Factory. <br>I tried to be understanding at first because I know the server is not the one in the kitchen cooking. But no type of update, apology, or explanation made our experience terrible. The manager and server both stared off with blank faces like a deer in headlights. No capability on how to handle conflict; not sure what qualified him to be a manager. Will not be returning.
This used to be one of my favorite places. Not anymore.  My boyfriend likes to go there every now and then so I put up with it.  The food isn&#39;t as fresh as it used to be.
