Came here on Oct 26. Saturday night for dad&#39;s birthday and was seated outside. Very busy as expected but the servers do try their best to get your food out ASAP.

Although I have been to other Cheesecake Factories I wanted to try the new one in Oxnard. It was expectedly crowded. The food was just what I expected- large, commercially bland prepared food at a premium price. There was really nothing bad about the experience. I was just disappointed that it is just another &#34;big box&#34; mall eating establishment.

Everything was acceptable except our server. <br><br>Our server Salina T. was very short and unfriendly. My husband thought she didn&#39;t want to be there and I had to agree. No smile whatsoever. I smiled more than her and even complimented her make up but it still didn&#39;t being her smile back to life. She gave our bill without the bill cover and just left a piece of bill on our table while passing by. <br><br>I heard Cheesecake Factory trains their employees well, but I&#39;m not sure about this location.

I dont normally write reviews but I&#39;ve never had a restaurant ruin my night. As someone that went to School for culinary arts, I understand how busy the back of the house can get and am usually not to critical. Tonight is the exception. Sever was ok. He didn&#39;t know the menu well. Looking past that, the food took over 20 min to get to our table. Mind you, this is late Sunday night. It was not a busy restaurant.<br><br>I got a chicken pasta dish that had  Spaghetti noodles that were ridiculously under cooked. The chicken was as dry as my dates salmon. I ask that it be re cooked and substituted with angle hair. 20 minutes later my dish cam with once more, under cooked Spaghetti again. They didnt tell me that the angel hair was 86 for the night. By now my table is done eating and I asked for a manager. I requested that everyone including the manager try the pasta just to be sure I&#39;m not being to harsh. Everyone at my table agreed the pasta was again under cook. The manager proceeded to try to convince me that this is &#34;Al dente&#34; I&#39;m a chef I know Al dente this still had the starchy taste and texture of under cooked pasta. <br><br>Now the mood at the table is uncomfortable and everyone wants to leave but I have yet to  eat. I&#39;m hungry and up set. As a result my date no longer wants to continue our night. Thanks cheese cake factory. They did comp a cheese cake which is standard for them but on the way out I slipped on the what could only be described as nasty buttered floor and dropped my cheese cake. I swear to god the entire floor felt like it had a thin layer of  Krisko from the kitchen all the way to the main entrance<br><br>I had a bad experience with this place before and thought I&#39;d give it a go one more time at a different location. I would compare this restaurant chain to that of a fast food wannabe Italian restaurant like olive garden.
Best service ever!<br>The bartender Lorenzo was amazing very helpful and prompt. I highly recommend sitting at the bar.

This Cheesecake Factory is the BEST! They have friendly staff, great food and a fun atmosphere.  The food options are varied and the chefs pay attention to details.  The servers are courteous and take time to listen and make the experience A+!  This restaurant is just outstanding.  And just when I thought it couldn&#39;t get any better--Jasmine (a member of the Cheesecake Team) goes above and beyond to make dinning experiences here delightful.   <br>Thank you Cheesecake for hiring such wonderful staff and creating a positive environment for patrons. <br>And a huge plus (for me) is that the patio is dog friendly. :)

We all have memories of going to the Cheesecake Factory and ordering the fettuccine Alfredo only to have terrible heartburn right after and crying on your bedroom floor thinking, &#34;Wow did I really just eat 2000 calories?&#34; Oh, just me? <br><br>Let&#39;s be real, are you really American if you haven&#39;t eaten at Cheesecake factory? It doesn&#39;t matter how garbage their food can be, you still eat there. The Cheesecake factory can serve you a piece of cardboard with some parmesan and you and your boys will still go back there. Not even because you want to. Just because culture I guess? The Cheesecake Factory might as well be your garbage ex who treated you badly but you still go back to because you&#39;ve invested way too much time with them.<br><br>Now the servers have always been nice to us each time we go. They&#39;re always generous with the parmesan and extremely attentive in such a high volume restaurant. Customer service is swell. <br><br>I always either get the Fettuccine Alfredo or the Shrimp Jambalaya. Both dishes are good, however, 2 nights in a row I have a complaint with the Alfredo. The Fettuccine pasta itself was mushy like play-do. I didn&#39;t ask for my pasta to be stepped on then served to me. Then the sauce was so buttery, I threw up that night. I never throw up. The last time I threw up was at a KFC in Saudi Arabia, but that&#39;s a review for another day. I had the Margarita Pizza recently and that was good. Well seasoned, and nicely cooked. I just wished they used less butter. Or oil. We don&#39;t need america digging for oil in this restaurant&#39;s kitchen.<br><br>The atmosphere is great, it&#39;s very family friendly busy, and full of life. I&#39;m a big fan of nightlife, so it&#39;s nice to see everyone talking to each other and being with friends. If you&#39;re looking for a quiet place to sit and study, this isn&#39;t the place, you nerd. Try a cafe or something. <br><br>The cheesecake factory is alright.

Don&#39;t do delivery  this was supposed to be Cajun Jambalaya pasta... definitely not worth the $20.   there was no sauce, no spice, some bell peppers and tomatoes with weird tasting chicken and soggy shrimp ... it might be my fault for trying to do delivery but it was terrible. Lesson learned.

So our server Stacy E didn&#39;t get our order right, didn&#39;t come to our table to check on us, and was very <br> rude.. so I spoke to the Kenny the manager to help us out. Kenny said he would speak to the server about this problem and help us.. they stamp my validation and off I go.. I end up paying $18 for Parking. I called the manager back because I overpaid.. supposedly I would get a refund and that never happened... I didn&#39;t even get a I&#39;m sorry for your bad experience.. it&#39;s not like I wanted anything.. some sympathy and the validation would have been sufficient. Very rude and I inconsiderate.

Went here Sunday for Brunch, hoping that it wouldn&#39;t be that busy. So far so good, but service still sucks. They tried to seat my family three times and the table wasn&#39;t ready. Finally got a seat and the waitress took 10 minutes to get our drinks. Food is average at best. But the service makes the whole thing not worth it. Horrible experience. But unfortunately a normal experience for this place.<br>So many better places to go in the area.<br>STAY AWAY!!!

I have never taken the time to actually make an account to write about a restaurant on how poorly they preformed. I work in a kitchen and know the atmosphere on how busy it gets, but there is no way someone should wait 2 hours for their food for a party of 2. I was seated and ordered at 8:25 and was leaving by 10:40.<br>The issues starts with our waiter. Don&#39;t get me wrong, she was nice and sweet, but when it came to our food she would look at our table and notice that we have been waiting for a while and kept passing our table. She didn&#39;t make the effort to ask us anything, nor ask for refills on our drinks and bread. When we called her over she had no clue what was happening. Second, A manger came and spoke with me and talked to me like I was a child. He apologized and that was it. He didn&#39;t offer anything he didn&#39;t help in any way and we still had to wait another 20 more minutes for our food. What was suppose to be an anniversary date turned out to be terrible experience. I had to fill my hunger with the bread that was given. Once again, I get how a kitchen works as I am a kitchen manager, but the fact that they didn&#39;t offer any compensation for their mistake I was very disappointed. Out of this I hope for better quality wait staff, as well as management.

If you are going with friends, family, or a date, then I recommend this restaurant. If you are bringing your dog, think twice.<br><br>I made a mistake of not confirming in advance CF policy regarding dogs. When we went on 11/18, we were given a hard time once we were seated with Carli (4 lbs Chihuahua mix). We were told to put her on the floor - Carli is a 5 month old puppy. The manager didn&#39;t like Carli on our lap, his tone when speaking was almost as if he was shouting. Plus there was no offer of bringing water for Carli, even when we asked.<br><br>We chose to take food home vs dining at restaurant after experienced rude treatment. When we came back to the Americana on 11/22, we saw a group bring their dogs. Each small dog was on people&#39;s laps &amp; carried, management said nothing to them. Each dog at that table weighed over 4 lbs. This location has lost my business. If you like going out with your dog/dogs, you&#39;re better off going to Pasadena, whose pet policies are more relaxed.
Nice dessert,recommend to the strawberry cheese cake,delicious!<br><br>We four people enjoy the evening and the dessert and milkshake after dinner!

Great service,  good food and delicious dessert.  This prime location at the Americana offers a wait list like no other. Every time I come to this location in particular I grab a menu because the 40-50 min wait time for seating allows me to go thru the entire menu including fine print. By the time we get seated, I tell my server we are ready to order before they ask for our drinks because after waiting so long to be seated, I can&#39;t wait 10 min for my drink and another 30 for my food. Other than that, food quality has been consistent and I do come back often. <br><br>But if you&#39;re impatient and you come during regular feeding hours,  you might be better off crossing the street to the mall food court instead. Happy eating!

My first time here in years. I was able to sit at the bar right away - You can order food, even at the bar counter. I saw a guy order the steak and it looked amazing (for about $32), with Perrier water on the side. I opted for the Renee special (about $13): Turkey sand, soup and salad. Sandwich and salad did not disappoint. Fresh deli turkey and mixed greens salad (no romaine lettuce) with vinaigrette.<br><br>I inquired about happy hour and was told happy hour ends super early - I think from 4 to 6 pm or some early time like that. I asked for a Vesper but they had never heard of it. I told them it&#39;s the 007 drink but I was not sure I wanted to try it if they didn&#39;t know what it was. They had to look it up online (or somewhere internal) and was told they did not have one of the ingredients for one (they probably did not have the Kina Lillet aka Lillet Blanc)**. Feeling a bit defeated about the no, no, no (no happy hour, no vesper, no mezcal), I thanked the  bartender for asking me if I wanted something else -I told her I would not have ordered a drink had she not asked me. So, I opted for their cucumber drop which goes for about $15 I found out. No prices are listed on the drinks menu and it gets annoying to ask for every item. Oh, well. The process to see it get made and the presentation (and taste) were impressive.<br><br>Back to the soup, mushroom cream. Tastes very buttery but grainy texture feels gourmet. Some people get complimentary bread auto; I asked for bread (squaw, sourdough baguette-like rolls). Since the soup was buttery, I asked for toasted bread slices or some bread crackers to buffer it. I got toasted bread slices but it literally took over ten minutes to get - to the point that I was almost done with the sandwich and salad and was offered a fresh, hot bowl of soup which I accepted.<br><br>I paid with an AMEX gold card and received $10 off on my bank statement but paid full price at the restaurant.<br><br>I felt the drink was a bit over-priced relatively speaking - a similar drink at the Nordstrom restaurant runs for about $10. And the ambience at that place is trendy and mellow, but more desolate, as compared to this fast-paced and crowded venue. I think more could have been done regarding the long wait for toasted bread for my soup without my pointing out. At the end, I did not have the energy to say anything about it and just wanted to go enjoy my evening at the stores at the Americana. I went to the Caruso concierge desk and got reward points for my bill. Restaurant validated parking for 2 hours and 1 free hour for a total of 3 hours. I clocked nearly half that time at the restaurant.<br><br>You can sit without waiting at the bar (counter and high tables but not at the  booths).<br><br>I rate this a 3 for my overall experience.<br><br>Restrooms are roomy and relatively clean.<br><br>** Vesper, the sixth hour of the canon seven. A drink invented by Ian Fleming, the James Bond writer, in the 1953 movie Casino Royale. It&#39;s the one drink before dinner in a champagne gobblet -- only one but strong &amp; bitter -- shaken, not stirred (to dilute the strong spirits: 2oz-Gordon&#39;sGin 0.5oz-Vodka [100 proof] &amp; 0.25oz-Lillet [strong tonic wine, with bitter quinine], with lemon peel garnishment). Bond only orders this drink once, ever. Others serve him the drink or versions of it (including once with vermouth) without his ordering it. He does not give the drink a name until he relates it to Vesper Lynd in the movie. Kina Lillet, a strong quinine bitter wine, is no longer made. Using tonic water would dilute the drink too much. The original Vesper is meant to be strong and bitter ~ Shaken, not stirred ~

3 stars just for the service and polite , smiley waiters.  <br>If i could , i would rate the food at this place below zero. Can&#39;t understand what they are putting inside the dishes so the calories are jumping higher than the Eiffel Tower (the fake one at Americana or the real one , you choose). Even the skinnylicious menu was not giving me a hope for a healthy dinner. Took the chopped salad (530 calories as i remember) and the vinegar taste was so strong that I didn&#39;t feel the taste of the other ingredients. <br>My husband ordered Chipotle pasta , the waiter forgot about the order , then apologized for 1000 times and bought the pasta for my husband :) but we tipped her for the pasta and the willing to correct the little mistake. That was the only positive part on that evening. <br>Correct the food and make it healthier please...

Came here for my Godmonther&#39;s birthday. We have been coming here for years. Service is hit or miss, depending on the day, time, and (obviously) server you get. <br><br>Food is good! But very high in calories and fat. For those who are trying to watch the calories, you can choose from their skinnylicious menu (but you trade off a lot of the flavor and.. yes carbs).<br><br>The hardest thing about The Cheesecake Factory is it has 100000 things on the menu. It is so hard to choose sometimes. My favorite menu items are the chicken and shrimp gumbo, factory burger, jambalaya with pasta, and chicken romano. <br><br>We usually get an order of the calamari and avocado egg rolls to start. <br><br>Great place to indulge in food for &#39;cheat&#39; meals. Also a great place to go with people of varying taste since there is literally something for everyone. <br><br>There is a huge parking lot. Remember to validate!<br><br>Cheers.

Fully aware of the mass crowds that are usually in the front lobby of this particular Cheesecake Factory, Me and the family entered. <br><br>To my surprise we got a table right away! Server came and took drink orders, received beverages shortly after. Then dinner orders, but that took a while longer. In no rush and spending time with family that are not regularly seen, it was no biggie! <br><br>Our serve was extremely apologetic and came to give updates every few minutes. <br><br>Once food came it was perfect. Everyone enjoyed their meals and the humongous portions sizes. The Santa Fe salad is my absolute favorite thing to order. Everyone was stuffed and happy. <br><br>Had a great time spending a small piece of my day here and I&#39;m looking forward to coming back!

This place is ALWAYS the go to for my group of dudes that can never agree on where to eat. The menu is massive, and usually that translates to a dip in quality, but I&#39;ve never been dissatisfied with my appetizers, entrees, or desserts from here. Out of a dozen visits, always showing up around 930/945pm, last night was the only negative experience I&#39;ve had. We showed up at our usual time and we always sit outside, but when we asked to get a table outside the lady told us it was closed. I looked out the window and there were at least 5 different groups sitting outside, with plenty of available tables for us. But the lady kept saying that outdoor dining was closed. Which is something we had never encountered over the past 8 months or so. It sucked eating inside because it&#39;s dark, crowded, and loud due to the music and other tables. Overall, it was still a good experience, just kinda weird.
Hanging out with my boo, grubbing on some great food. Their Chipotle Shrimp Salad is awesome. And of course their cheesecake is a MUST!!!!

I would like to thank Cheesecake Factory for hiring Team members as Jack, at the Americana.<br>We were there with tourists and we really wanted specific table it took a while for the table to be ready even though we were ok with the wait but still he was coming over to check on us and making sure that we were not forgotten. Thank you Jack for your assistance.<br>And also the food is always good.

Elder abuse abounds.<br><br>Had the most difficult time here with my elderly folks. Beware, its always busy and frankly, they might want to have some sitting reserved for the disabled. Gentlemen of the past seems to be a real thing. Party of four, bill $175 plus w/ drinks and tip.<br><br>Our food was great. Our service, awful. We had ordered a salad to be split, asked twice for it before our meal to come, then said salad came with meal. Obviously, we didn&#39;t want it with our meal. So sent it back and server looked at us like we were nuts and it was our fault. What?<br><br>Then my Mom was having a tad coughing attack, I asked for water and said server asked if she didn&#39;t want a shot of whiskey instead? No, get the water, I mean, what!?<br><br>Had to ask for bread, water, salt and pepper, nothing was ready at our fingertips. On the other hand, the food was delicious. We had zero problems with the food. Then, said salad remained on bill. I was paying, or my Dad never would of noticed. Then it took like 15 minutes to get a new check and doggie bags.<br><br>We wont be back again. What an unpleasant visit after I traveled so far to see my folks.<br><br>Said server on name tag &amp; receipt: Mathew W.

Been here many times before but I had better experiences in the past. Last night was disappointing as I booked online for dinner, got to the restaurant on time with my whole party, checked-in with the host and said he&#39;ll get me seated in 5 minutes. After waiting for at least 15 minutes, we were still standing in front of his podium. After asking the same host much longer as it was clearly beyond the 5 minutes he had promised, especially because practically all parties in the waiting room had been seated, he only said &#34;I got you, party of 2 right?&#34; This upset me as clearly he didn&#39;t check me in as he didn&#39;t even know the correct number of people in my party. So I said, &#34;yah you got me just now, because I had to step up and ask again.&#34; He wasn&#39;t even apologetic other than insisting that &#34;he got me.&#34; I told the other hostess that I am not tipping on this dinner. Later the manager came up asking if I wanted to see him. So I said, no I didn&#39;t ask for the manager but sure I can talk to the manager. But instead of focusing on my disappointment other than telling me he was going to speak to the host, he was more concerned on why not tip and take it on the server. I thought he was probably right, so I asked whom he was going to suggest I should take it on? He came back a few minutes later asking how everything was but since I didn&#39;t get any apology from the host, i said there was no difference on the service we were getting so far. We finished our dinner, tipped, and left the premises with no further word from anyone. Shame on you Cheesecake Factory for employing one arrogant host.

Got a to-go order because the dinner rush was crazy and it was insanely loud inside. My food which came with asparagus only had a few of the end pieces! The steak was like rubber and i found 2 random corn kernels in my mash <br> I can only assume that this means they don&#39;t wash their station very well or they&#39;re just very unorganized either way I wouldnt ever order togo because they show 0 care

Cheesecake Factory is one of those spots that are consistent which I appreciate. You know you&#39;re going to overeat and that&#39;s ok lol for this location know that they validate if you happen to park at the Americana. Also sit outside you&#39;ll get an awesome view of the water fountain show and people watch at the same time . Waiters are usually very accommodating here, bread basket is yummy, and now with the &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menu you can see exactly how many calories you&#39;re going to have. The portions are big here too but if you come during lunch they are a bit smaller and cheaper as well. I usually always have the Tex Mex salad romaine with grilled chicken, bbq sauce, black beans, corn, avocado so so good! Their pastas are also yummy my friend had the Louisiana one and it tasted great came with breaded chicken on top.

Today it was my birthday and I invited my family to celebrate with me, but thx to the cheesecake factory management, they ruined my special day!!!!!<br>First of all, they gave me a table, after 3 hours, however, I booked at 6:30 pm, and also on this cold weather not even one hitter was working.The manager name was Sami. <br>Thx Sami for this amazing service, I have never gonna forget my 37-year-old birthday!!<br>The only good part was our waiter, Steven he was such an amazing person and nice to us.

Pros: location and vibe is great. <br>Cons: quality of the chicken/poultry has gone down. So so chewy was getting stuck between my teeth, almost gave me TMJ. Didn&#39;t finish my meal.<br>Pros: large portions and affordable.

This place is filthy. Dirty water cups, dirty utensils, food served on plates with crap leftover from previous customer... No wonder I get sick every time I come here. The managers do not care because I came here twice within the last month and nothing has changed. Health inspectors need to come and do a better job. I&#39;ll be reporting this to the corporate office as well.

Metal came out  while i was having Chicken,mango and avocado salad after i finished half of them, It came out from my mouth!!!The branch manager advised that it might be a piece of metal from Wanton fry basket whatever it was.<br>I already contacted to risk manager. He kept ignoring my request several times that i want to check up with doctor if everything is fine,when i told him that i will report to Health dept he finally advised that i can go to doctor if i want and when they see a Medical bill they will CONSIDER of reimbursement. Yea, just Consider huh? Does he think that i am stupid enough to spend my money if i am not sure they will reimburse or not?Nice try..<br>He even said there is no risk of lead poisoning since Wonton basket is plated Nickle when i mentioned him how lead is risky for human. So is that ok that human swallowed Nickle then??? I did not order nickle salads either nickle on the side and even it&#39;s nothing to do with Wonton basket obviously. I doubt how they manage kitchen products.<br>I just wanted to have professional&#39;s opinion and back to normal life as soon as possible instead of researching myself and worrying about what will happen next but they aren&#39;t really cooperative with their minimum responsibility.<br>I already reported this incident to Health Department and i will keep follow up until i get their respond.<br>Very disappointed of your service. Cheesecake factory was one of my favorite but not anymore.<br>I WILL NEVER COME BACK.EVER!
Honestly no matter how busy it has been I have never had an issue here, while there is a wait my food has always been great

Meh... Went here as part of a goodbye party for a friend&#39;s co-workers. Cheesecake factory is ok, nothing too exciting, average food and experience. <br><br>I had a steak which was decent and the drinks were ok, I had a couple of beers. I think I remember having to get up to order the beers at the bar, because it took the waitress so long to get back. <br><br>But to be fair, we were a huge table, and she may have been overwhelmed. They should have gotten a second person to help, so I won&#39;t fault her as she was really nice it seems.

I like to go to the cheesecake factory when no one knows what they want. I took my girlfriend and her family. The service was wonderful and the food was good. Prepared well and warm when it came out. My girlfriend didn&#39;t like her dish but not because it was bad, just not what she thought it was going to be. I tried her dish amd thought it was really good. Needless to say i had lunch the next day! <br><br>When you get your device that they use to let you know that your table is ready, don&#39;t be afraid to walk around the plaza. The range on that thing extends the circumpherance of the plaza. The atmosphere is nice and on weekends can be extremely packed with people spilling out into the plaza. <br><br>Parking at the American is really straight forward and parking on any level is not an issue.

If you&#39;re rich come here but there&#39;s not much good stuff here except pasta that I like, too busy a lot and wouldn&#39;t recommend if your not patient cuz this place just kept going back and forth and forgot when I asked them to bring me a straw and other stuff, service was nice but they kept changing and changing and I just got kind of disappointed
What a bad way to serve food 30 minutes for appetizers and 45 for food ...!!! And the service so sad .. and the restrooms ??? Never again
I really like the food here. I always get the barbecue chicken salad with cilantro sauce and no chicken.

I don&#39;t go to Cheesecake Factory often but when I do my experience is usually good; however today was an exception. <br><br>On a positive note, when my party arrived we were seated fairly quickly and the food was tasty as usual.<br><br>The reason why I am giving tonight&#39;s service a two star is because our waitress Muslima M. provided poor customer service. She had seen our table as we were seated then walked the opposite direction and disappeared. We waited 17 minutes before she came to our table to offer drinks and bread. At that point everyone already had ample time to review the menu so we ordered our food the same time as our drinks. <br><br>Another 15 minutes and still no drinks. The entire 15 minutes our waitress was chatting with another waitress before she decided to serve our drinks. The food came out within a reasonable time and was served by someone else who was kind and professional. <br><br>During the meal Muslima made no effort to check on us, she just looked in our direction and walked by. I should add she was quick and attentive when it was time to pick up the bill. <br><br>This experience will not permanently deter me from dining at Cheesecake Factory but if I end up with Muslima as a waitress again I will likely just ask for my food to go.
Lovely Atmosphere, very friendly staff, great service &amp; the food was delicious. The cheesecakes as always are amazing. The prices are also good as per the quality of their food!

Under no circumstances should you or your large party ever waste your time here. They will make you wait for hours. As a large party of 15 we came and were told to wait 2 hours, which we agreed given it was a Friday night. What we weren&#39;t expecting was to wait 4 hours because the other party that had taken our area refused to leave despite only have 3 members sitting around. Horrible service, I refuse to ever come back.

I got the calamari,  the southwest chicken sandwich and a salad. The calamari tasted amazing and wasn&#39;t oily at all. The texture was very soft , almost so soft it melted in your mouth. The Southwestern however was veryyyyy disappointing! The chicken was poor quality, I bit the meat about 2/3 times trying to separate it. It had no taste and the avocado didn&#39;t do it any justice. The salad however was delicious, so good that I stopped eating the sandwich and ate the salad instead. Very good place but DEFINITELY DON&#39;T GET THE SOUTHWESTERN. <br><br>I went on a Sunday at 4 and the wait time was 30 mins , noise lever was fair even with a family of 6 which 4/6 were kids sitting next to me.

I always order tuna salad with chicken farfalle, and end it with a cake. Never changed; I was happy, until today. we ordered fish taco and pork chop. Best thing eating tacos with a Mexican friend is she will tell you what sounds good. But the bad thing is, she will know when the rice is too plain and fish is flavorless. And the pork chop. Oh my, dry, not enough sauce, green bean is too hard. Completely lost my appetite after one bite of the pork and one taco.<br>I guess they offer the free bread for a reason, at least you can eat something to fill you up for free.
Came for lunch with my mom we really had a great time enjoying our meal Courtney D was the best server we ever had she made us feel comfortable &amp; welcomed.

I like this location. Have been here many times, almost always get the grilled salmon from their skinnylicious menu. It has been consistently cooked to perfection.  I hate over-cooked fish. They get this one done just right for me, each time. I&#39;ll include a picture of the fish cut in the middle so you can see. <br><br>I like to douse my salmon in lemon juice and a touch of Tabasco. Yum!<br><br>Of course, the bread goes without saying is one of the best. I do have to warn you, stop eating the bread or you&#39;ll get too full before your meal arrives. I do it every time. <br><br>They validate for parking, so make sure you get your ticket stamped before you leave.
Good service ever... Mr.jesse  take care us  a lot .. nice and kind <br><br>Will be back for sure...  <br><br>We Lv jesse

I give this place so many chances to redeem themselves, but they always forget something in my order or I am always waiting on something they forgot. I ordered food for pickup today and asked for it to be ready at a specific time, I still had to wait 40 mins for my order after the designated time. Why do I even bother??

This is the horrible service , never come back to this restaurant the one in Glendale the manager,<br>I never thought that a manager would give you a bad education to talk to me. As a client, you have to know how to speak. Find a solution and not discuss with a client that is a lack of education, all because of bad communication, they have a bad organization with the staff.

Nice located area and such a nice outdoor view of the fountain and such. Walked it and stood right at the counter and looked like all the workers purposely avoids eye contact it&#39;s something (can y&#39;all be a bit happier or at least do a greeting? Or a simple &#34;I&#39;ll be right with you!&#34;) <br><br>Nope. <br><br>I get it, things are busy and such--but mannerisms and just basic things when it comes to customer service at least.. please?<br>Our waiter was super nice and always checked up on us but wonder if he had amnesia... we asked for another French roll 4x and had to ask for plates 3x and we specifically requested for no marinara sauce on the pasta. At the end we only managed to get the plates.. and we got no French roll and marinara was still on the pasta (we returned it once and it looked like we got the same plate back..).<br><br>I&#39;m speechless.
One of the Best Restaurants I&#39;ve been to excellent customer service &amp; food was to die for was great

To succeed at Cheesecake - follow these rules:<br><br>1) Always get a side of Balsamic Vinaigrette to dip your bread in. <br><br>2) You don&#39;t need appetizers cause of the bread but - Avocado Egg-rolls are pretty bomb if you wanna swing the calories.<br><br>3) Its a big menu - there are only three main dishes I think are actually really great:<br><br>A) Chicken Madeira (get some balsamic to dip chicken) (also I switch mashed potatoes for broccoli cause wow it&#39;s a lot of calories)<br><br>B) Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp<br><br>C) Southwest Chicken Sandwich<br><br>4) If you&#39;re not into those maybe just get a bunch of appetizers and share.  <br><br>5) Most of their cheesecakes are fine/solid.  But the great ones:<br><br>A) Lemon Meringue<br>B) Hershey Chocolate (ask for almond slivers)<br>C) Kahlua (very rich but if you like coffee it&#39;s the best)<br><br>- Don&#39;t get the strawberry - they&#39;re in syrup<br>- Banana&#39;s good/simple but if you don&#39;t like that fake banana flavor stay away.<br>- Lemoncello cake is surprisingly solid

I was here with my boyfriend on June 25 and was served by Brelan. The food was okay but the service we received was not great at all. He never came up to check on us to refill our water. And when we received the check we had to ask another server to get it because he never acknowledged us.  The server we told actually told him and when we got the check he just dropped it off not saying a single word and left. I felt he was annoyed. But of what!?

One of my best restaurants. My favorite meal is Louisiana chicken pasta and Santa fe chicken pasta.<br>Today we found it out that they have very good brunch tas well. I ordered cinnamon roll pancakes with extra banana and it was so good but a little bit so sweet. But after all I&#39;d give them 5 star for their good customer service.

This has had to be one of the worst customer service experiences I have ever had. First our waiter seemed like he was too busy to wait for me to complete my sentence with everything that I wanted before he rushed off. He then cane back brought water and rushed off again. I asked for a plastic cup he said they didn&#39;t have any then said togo cup I asked him if it was plastic he said no then went to get it (which was indeed plastic) filler with water. I let him know that I didn&#39;t want water I just wanted a plastic cup. Instead of him bringing me another or going to poor it out he got the cup and poured it out next to me in the bushes. The water splashed on my feet. He then rushed off again. He took his tome at all the other tables but didn&#39;t seem to have the time to listen and wait on our table. I was very bothered and I asked him if he was busy because he keeps rushing off. He said &#34;I went to get your water&#34; and I told him I wasn&#39;t even finished talking before he decided to walk off while I was in mid sentence. He then stoops down and said ok I&#39;m listening now. It was so rude and made me feel so uncomfortable that I decided not to even order anything. He never came to check on us after this nor said anything else. I feel like if he was having a bad day or didn&#39;t want to give everybody good service he definitely should have took a day to himself and called off. It&#39;s very unprofessional and is not the kind of service I want to receive when I&#39;m spending money just like everyone else. His name was Lavar or Lavon one of the 2

Let me preface this review by saying that I&#39;m generally a huge fan of The Cheesecake Factory, but this is probably the worst Cheesecake Factory location I&#39;ve ever been to. <br><br>Wait time is average, food is not on par with other locations (much sadness!), and the worst part is the service. My party went through three different servers during one lunch, and all three thoroughly ignored our table. And the reason why we went through three servers? Extremely. Slow. Service. Our original server had time to go on lunch break before we got our drinks and returned BEFORE we got our entrees. I had one drink refill the entire meal, and sat with an empty glass. Service from start to finish took just over two hours. Took multiple tries to flag a server down to get the bill and takeout boxes. <br><br>And then they messed up our bill (wanted to put X on a gift card and the remainder on another card, made this VERY clear, and the server got it wrong--instead of just admitting it and apologizing, which would have been annoying but fine, she ran off somewhere and spent an 20 extra minutes trying to figure out how to reverse it herself, thus ignoring the other tables in her section). Honestly, if she didn&#39;t have my friend&#39;s credit card, I would have walked out. <br><br>I understand locations being busy and potentially understaffed, but at least communicate that with your customers -- particularly those who have obviously been waiting a long time! <br><br>I will not return to this location unless I want to pick a fight. Can&#39;t see it improving unless there is an attitude adjustment and stronger managerial presence in place.

Gosh, it&#39;s been years since I&#39;ve had happy hour at a Cheesecake Factory let alone happy hour but it&#39;s a nice reminder of why I liked it. We sat in the bar area and was surprised by the prices! They were reasonable! I guess generally speaking, happy hour prices are typically lower. I forgot about that. Oh details...<br><br>I had the skinny cosmopolitan which was refreshing along with the blue cheese and pear flatbread. We also ordered avocado egg rolls and Korean cauliflower. The waitress was patient with my friends as they kept asking her questions about the types of tequila, beers on tap and what not. The restaurant validates parking and shall return again when I&#39;m in the area.

The staff at this location were very accommodating. Our party size started at 6 persons. It soon grew to 9 and then 12. The hostess were kind enough to reseat us twice and move tables together to make room for all of us.<br><br>Because of the moves we had two waitresses. Both were fantastic and got our orders perfect.<br><br>All of us at the party had a great time. The food was delicious and there were no issues. Everything was served at the right temperature and the servers did not rush us. <br><br>Located in Americana of Glendale means finding a parking space.  There is a large parking structure next door to the complex and the walk to the restaurant is relatively short.

We had a great father&#39;s day lunch here. We knew the wait would be long and they quoted us an hour. However we were seated about 30 minutes later. Our server was friendly and pretty attentive. He struggled keeping up with all the drinks at the table but that is to be expected when a restaurant is slammed.<br><br>I didn&#39;t like how the food was brought out. Everyone received their plates except for the two of us. So then there was that awkward momement when no one wanted to start eating until we got our dishes...Everyone waited a bit and then finally our burgers arrived and we all dug in.<br><br>Other than that...the food was great. I always get overwhelmed with their novel of a menu. I settled on the bacon bacon cheeseburger, protein style with a side salad and blue cheese dressing. My burger was cooked perfectly, seasoned nicely and lettuce wrapped expertly. The creamy american and cheddar cheeses mixed with cripsy bacon and slab of pork belly quite nicely. Hands down a great burger.

I went with my friends to have a drink and dinner and Surprised that no waiting for out side table. Wow , the service was Great. Everything was very quick and service was great with amazing view

I appreciate the convenience of the Cheesecake Factory at a beautiful location like the Americana for a late dinner. Although the wait can be long at times, it&#39;s nice to know that it&#39;s open until late and you can peruse the stores nearby while you wait.<br><br>The food isn&#39;t the absolute Michelin-rated best, which is expected at chain restaurants, but it&#39;s good enough to go back. <br><br>Some favorites:<br>*Tex mex egg rolls<br>*Barbecue ranch chicken salad (which will be drenched in dressing if you don&#39;t specify otherwise)<br>*Nachos<br>*Of course, their cheesecakes (big enough to share with 2 people)<br><br>And in all honesty, you&#39;re safe getting any of the menu items and being happy with the food. <br><br>Perks:<br>*They validate Americana parking <br>*Plenty of indoor and outdoor seating<br>*Amazing service

One of my favorite locations, actually my favorite! This place never misses a beat or drops the ball. Service is always on point and I love the views here. <br>I love when I&#39;m able to make it to happy hour here! If you are able to make it Monday-Friday 4-6 do it!!!

Went there few days ago worst place ever food cold <br>Takes like 30 for appetizers 30 minutes for food it all came cold no more Manager Adam came but still our appetite was ruined no more cheese cake factory for us

I have to say I am very disappointed! The quality of food has declined so much it is unbelievable! Chinese chicken salad was sad looking white and green mixture  with noooo taste , no chicken, no sauce! The lemon garlic shrimp with water down sauce and 5 small shrimp !  Ladies Restrooms are always nasty! What happened to this company!!!!!!!! Not going back there

Beautiful scenery when you sit outside. Especially during the holidays  however, the SERVICE sucks! Like really bad! We had to wait over 20 minutes to get water. Another 20 minutes for bread. And another 40 minutes for food. If you have 3 hours to spare then this is the right place.

Our service was slow, the server was avoiding us and only talking to the older people in front of our table. We were there two hours because he was so slow. 30 minutes for drinks, another 20 at least to order and then that took forever. Slow slow slow and when we left at 7:30 after getting there at 5:30 your restaurant was already slowing down. Just a bad experience, last time wee had a great experience.

Loud place very late service takes half an our to serve your main meal<br><br>Order medium rare steak but was over cooked complain to supervisor but argued with me no is ok finally gave us 20 pct credit

Love getting the honey truffle chicken until today... I found a hair on my plate and I am not happy. Kitchen staff or whomever is in charge should check and tend to these things before food comes out. So disappointed

First things first: I LOVE CHEESECAKE FACTORY. I eat here any chance I get and always try a different cheesecake. I could probably say that I&#39;ve almost tried all of the different flavors.<br><br>My favorite dish is the pasta da vinci, can&#39;t really describe what&#39;s in it except that it was chicken and mushrooms and the sauce is amazing! Service is always amazing, the waiters I always get are attentive and make sure we&#39;re doing okay. <br><br>I decided to try something new and got the chicken riesling and it was delicious - it was a butter pasta with this wine sauce around it with chicken and bacon and some other stuff. I mixed the sauce into my pasta and it made it even better.<br><br>If you&#39;re looking for something to drink, I would either get strawberry lemonade as a non-alcoholic drink, or if you&#39;re looking for something with alc, then the Long Island ice tea is the way to go.<br><br>I came on a good night (Thursday around 9) and was seated within 10 minutes. Glendale has been so busy that sometimes the wait times are almost 2 hours, which is ridiculous!!! But definitely worth the wait. <br><br>Wheat bread is always amazing and soft.

Yummmyy Cheesecake Factory!  The thing I like about The Cheesecake Factory is that no matter which one I&#39;m eating at they&#39;re consistent.  The food is always good and that heavenly bread they have.  You know what I&#39;m talking about.. &#34;the brown one&#34; is what I call it!  <br><br>Came here for their happy hour and always leave satisfied.  I think I could just eat their brown bread and leave happy. Hah!  The food is pretty good and service was just okay.  A little bit slow, but oh well... we survived.  We ordered a variety of appetizers to share.  I like the Tex mex egg rolls and chicken sliders.  The chicken samosas are $5.95 and they are pretty small.  I wouldn&#39;t order them again.  The chicken buffalo blasts are okay too.  <br><br>Pretty good food, decent service...  it&#39;s The Cheesecake Factory, you know what to expect.
Excellent service! They were extremely busy, yet it didn&#39;t affect their service at all! Our server was very polite, courteous and attentive.

I came here on 3/31/19 for a nice lunch/dinner with my son and daughter. Unfortunately, due to our waiter and his sarcastic remarks my lunch was ruined. I really tried to keep my mouth shut and not let his comments get to me so I did not respond to any of his rude comments.  To add insult to injury, I ordered a soda and received my drink in a smaller glass, than my son. My son and I ordered the chicken costolleta the asparagus on both plates were freezing cold. We did not complain or made any negative comments because of the servers poor attitude. However, I do know I will not be returning to this location.<br> I felt that I was being treated in such way because of the way I looked. It&#39;s sad to be prejudged, or have to deal with racists comments. I really expected better treatment.

I always usually have a bad experience with Cheesecake Factory but in this one my experience was fantastic. I brought my mom and family here for Mother&#39;s Day. The wait was an hour ( it was no problem, it was Mother&#39;s Day) <br>We probably waited 30 to 40 min and right away we got seated our waitress was kinda slow but it&#39;s fine it&#39;s Mother&#39;s Day and it&#39;s hectic and busy so we didn&#39;t mind. <br>The food was delicious everyone enjoyed their food, our drinks were good as well. In general our experience was great. I think this is the only cheesecake we will be attending from now on.

Having been going to TCF for years, this is by far my worst dining experience ever. <br>Nothing again the waiter who served us, who was attentive.<br>This is more for the reception. After waiting for more than 45 mins for our table (being told the wait was going to be about 20 mins), we were told to wait for our table to be set up. We waited another 10 mins for our table to be ready, then was led to a 4-person table while we have a party of 7. I asked how were we supposed to have everyone sit reasonably comfortable here. I was let with a pair of white eyes and told that if I didn&#39;t like the seat, I could go out and wait for another again.<br>Seriously. If not for our waiter, I would leave ZERO tip for my service.

I mean the food is basic but I&#39;d advise to never do pick up orders because they obviously put less than you would get when sitting down. For the price you&#39;d expect a bigger portion but this pick up order is enough to fill up my 7 year old nephew not an adult like myself...<br><br>(The picture doesn&#39;t do much justice but I promise it&#39;s even smaller in person lol)

I don&#39;t even  know where to start first of alll love thhis place amazing staff and food. Ryan wAs amazing litteraly so kind and so sweet with all the kid&#39;s. Just wanted to say thank you he really was amazing and there was 9 of us so he did a fabulous job thank you Ryan

Had a great experience with the bar seating here.  Didn&#39;t have to wait too long for seats and the servers were great, especially the servers at the bar.  We went during a busy time of the day ( graduation season) but service was great.  Got a flat pepperoni flat bread and some drinks while watching the NBA finals by the bar. No complaints.

I wish I could rate this less than a star. Slow service, we bought a drink not knowing how much it was and it tasted like there was no alcohol in it. I don&#39;t like to ask for people to take stuff back so I drank it, but then came to find out it was more expensive than my burger. When we asked if we could please take it off the bill a female manager came out and confronted us like we did something wrong, the rudest person I&#39;ve ever talked to. I&#39;ve worked in customer service and restaurants and always take care of people&#39;s needs especially if they&#39;re kind about it, no matter what we said she gave us the most condescending remarks. This is my first review after using yelp for years. I hated this place that much.

The woman in the front desk didn&#39;t even place down our name to be seated so we waited for over 20 minutes as people got called up. It wasnt until we spoke to one of the people that they tried to find it and realized it was never in the system. Would not return.

If I can rate the waitress that was serving us I would not give her any stars and this is why. <br>Yesterday my friends and I had a bad experience at the cheesecake factory in Glendale. We were first greeted by a very nice asian gentleman, he served us coffee and water, but sadly his shift was over and switched over to a very rude waitress, I dont remember her name all I can remember is that she said she had been working there about 6-8 months. Since she started serving us she was rude. Idk how many times shes rolled her eyes at us when we asked for water, it felt as she wanted to get rid of us. Look my friends and I work for a big utility company in customer service, we are trained to help and assist customers, we were not rude to her, she on the other hand was not happy helping us nor the tables around us. If shes not happy she should not work there. Get happy people that love their jobs. Trust me I know how customers can be since I work for the public.<br>I gave her a $5 tip. I wish I didn&#39;t give her anything and just gave it to the asian gentleman.<br>Oh and then my friend asked for water and said do you want it TO GO!! What kind of answer is that!! Never again will I go to that cheesecake factory.

The wait was not bad until the buzzer went off. Once the buzzer went off, we realized that there was another waiting area. Seems weird for them to call us up, just to have us wait in a separate area of the restaurant. I understand it was busy, but it&#39;s confusing to be called up to wait again.

Sadly disappointed in my service last week. Went here for a late lunch and ordered 2 salads. Took about 50 mins to get our food. I&#39;m pretty sure the server forgot to put them in (which happens) however he was avoiding us and acting really awkward rather than just apologizing and giving us some kind of accommodation. Food was tasty but I was shocked in the lack Of service since Cheesecake Factory workers are usually some of the best waiters...... management needs to be more involved on the floor directly rather let servers &#34;attempt&#34; to resolve issues, especially when they don&#39;t resolve anything at all.

My husband and I stopped by to have a late lunch after donating blood at Red Cross. We both ordered chicken dishes. Chicken and biscuits and chicken Marsala. We had an issue with the dishes and complained to the manager. Later that evening we both experienced diarrhea and upset stomach. I&#39;m thinking E-Coli from the chicken. We will never go to a Cheesecake Factory again! Bad experience!

The Cheesecake Factory is probably my favorite chain restaurant. There is always a wait, but it makes it easier now that they text you when your table is ready.<br><br>One of my favorites is the Steak Diane, they tend to over cook, so I get mine medium because I like medium-well. The sauce is really tasty, yum! <br><br>I also like the Miso Salmon and the Louisiana Chicken Pasta. <br><br>I recently tried the Steak Medallions on the Skinnylicious menu and it is like a light version of Steak Diane, yummy. They also have skinny drinks, the Long Island was good.<br><br>My fave cheesecake is the macadamia nut, but they are all pretty good!

Good place in the Americana to stop by .<br>I personally love Cheesecake Factory and it is one of the places i have been to SO many times. <br>The fact that there is no reservation makes it very difficult. Restaurant should take into consideration that people come here hungry, so having them wait for SO long is going to make them upset. <br>Overall, i have tried so many different dishes i was to say my all time favorite dish is Shanghi Noodles (witch they took out of the menu) The 3 mix egg roles (great because u get to have all the different kinds vs picking only 1) and ofcourse Chicken Marsela those are my 5 Star . Customer service here is better then the other location. The cheescake ofcourse is delicious 5star but overall the place gets 3 star because of Wait &amp; the constant change in the menu

Thursday was an extremely busy night to visit this CF location. There has to be a better way for the staff to organize their patrons waiting to be seated. We all stood in the rotunda blocking walk ways and doorways. Not much to do there but the hosting staff tried their best to get everyone out of the way. <br><br>The manager was bussing tables with the other staff members and trying to pour drinks so I know that she has a great work ethic. <br><br>I was on a &#34;treat yo self&#34; date for my birthday so I was a party of one. I sat on the patio which was a little chilly since they turned off the outdoor heater for my section. Luca (Lucas?) was my starting server and was very attentive. For the remainder of meal Kohl (Cole) was my server who was slightly soft spoken but equally attentive. The dish I chose was the chicken Bellagio; the patio is right in front of the Americana water feature so it was an Inspired dining experience. <br><br>The chicken bellagio was a beautiful mound of pasta, chicken, arugula and prosciutto. The arugula was the first layer with a wonderfully tangy dressing. The second layer was the prosciutto which was thin but absolutely delicious. The final layers were the chicken breast and the pasta which was seasoned to perfection. The key to this dish is to grab a bite of all of the components to fully experience a masterpiece of flavors.<br><br>My husband who is away in Paris on business was able to call Ian at this location and organize a surprise. Kohl (Cole), Ian and another gentleman brought out a surprise birthday treat - hooray! Such a great surprise since I dined on the phone with my husband the whole time and had no idea. Slick one fellas! <br><br>Overall great service, delicious plate of food! And great surprise executed by the staff and my husband! Will return to this location since other locations seem to have differing menu options. <br><br>(If you two ever see this: to the couple that literally took my check off of my table and paid for my meal that evening-thank you so much for the birthday gift; that was truly a great way to end my adventure in Glendale. God bless you both)
The whiskey smash is amazing!! It&#39;s not too sweet. It&#39;s just right. I&#39;m so glad they added this to their menu.

Am I like the only one who is barely finding out about cheesecakes amazing happy hour? <br>Damn if I would of only knew sooner I would have so came here earlier <br>Amazing appetizers and drinks for about $6 M-F from 4-6pm <br><br>Drinks were really good my all time fav is the cosmopolitan <br>Spring rolls were gross, like you can taste that refrigerator burn smell in the ingredients gross<br>-burger was pretty bomb tho! <br><br>All and all great happy hour menu

This place is bombbbb!!! Score one for Cheesecake Factory! It felt like a sign of good things to come, and I was psyched to eat more. ... &#34;I don&#39;t know how you eat more than 2.5 bites of this,&#34; I said. &#34;It&#39;s so rich.&#34; My dining partner agreed.

Came here for our 4th wedding anniversary. On a Thursday night with full capacity crowd, we were seated within 15 minutes which is a big plus. We were seated in a small booth near the back of the restaurant. Service was ok not great.<br><br>We were greeted promptly by our waiter. Our drinks took about 15 minutes to arrive. A Margarita and a passion fruit mojito. The bread and butter looked nice but no knife for my wife to spread the butter.<br><br>Being a vegan my options were very limited. Ended up ordering &#34;Evelyn&#39;s Favorite Pasta&#34;. The dish was very tasty but definitely not filling, kinda greasy. Wife ordered the shrimp scampi. Had to flag down our waiter to spread Parmesan cheese on her pasta(10 minutes for this). <br><br>$70 is a bit pricey (not including ($12 tip) for 2 dishes and 2 drinks. Came home and still made myself dinner. After seeing the menu, wouldn&#39;t come back for personal belief(vegan) reasons.

I ordered a whole strawberry cheesecake today for Mother&#39;s Day online and my email said it was ready for pick up. I went to the Glendale restaurant and it was total chaos. There were just a bunch of people standing around outside baffled and confused about where to pick up their order. I saw a sign that said Door Dash and prepaid online orders. There was a crowd around the sign. No line. No social distancing. Total anarchy. I went inside the restaurant. Even worst. A crowd of people inches apart trying to figure out where to go. A sign said online orders that were not prepaid was hidden in the crowd. I looked at my email. It said go to the bakery to pick up order. I have my 79 year old mother with me. I told her to have a seat in the lobby. I asked other customers that looked confused about where I should go if I already paid online. They said probably outside. I use my cell phone to call the restaurant. I can hear the ringing of the bakery phone, but no one is picking up. I decided to abandon my place in line and take my chances outside. I take my mother with me. Damn, forgot how crazy it was outside. I call again. Finally someone picks up. I asked if I had to wait in the crazy chaos outside even though I already paid online. Worker stated that everyone has to wait, it is Mother&#39;s Day.  I asked for a refund and stated my name. He said sure, and hung up on me. I left the line angry. Now I do not have anything for my mother for Mother&#39;s Day. It was her favorite cheesecake. As I was driving home, I realized that the person that I talked to did not ask for the rest of my information. I call 10 more times until someone finally picked up. This time it was a female worker. She did not want to deal with me and let me speak to a manager. I asked for the manager&#39;s name. He did not want to tell me. He stated that he just got in. It is around 2pm. I told him my concern. I needed someone to be accountable for the poor organization at his restaurant. I understand it was Mother&#39;s Day. The company should have anticipated the crowd. It happens every year. Cheesecake Factory is not some mom and pop shop. It is a well established restaurant. I understand this pandemic is unique. Why was social distancing not enforced?!? Why were there no signs on the floor that had 6 foot distance marks? Why were there no ropes or tape that guided customers where to go and which lines to get into?!? It was a health hazard for myself, my 79 year old mother, and all the customers clamoring around the entrance of Cheesecake Factory trying to figure out where to pick up their orders.  I am disappointed with the lack of concern for the public and I am even more disappointed about the customer service I received over the phone.

Just had a dinner with the family , everything good until I was leaving the restaurant the waiter (George ) table 33 insults the crap out of me   for me  leaving  him $6 tip, my bill was $74 left him $90 , which is $16 tip, so I went back and ripped him a new ass for it not calculating  his tip money correctly,  I told him go back to school and learn how to do math, and the manager comes and tells me what if I heard it wrong, and I said which waiter every thanks you for the exact amount tip that you leave them , I never in my life heard that crap before and he had no answer for it either.

The food was absolutely sh** and the service was awful, not to mention the wait is bloody long. The cheesecake is awful and way too sweet. The food is also way overpriced, if you want to splurge on food go to nice restaurant, not here.

Thank you Jesse for the great service! We enjoyed an awesome dinner with close friends and bomb food. The tomato basil pasta was deliciously prepared and the starter bread and butter kept coming. I still have a food coma days later. <br>We also got the peanut butter cheesecake to go and I can&#39;t wait to go pick up some more.
They have amazing whole wheat bread ! Patient, kind employees &amp; fast service. I recommend pasta and the buffalo wings

The Herb Crusted salmon was to DIE FOR! The salmon was cooked perfectly and the lemon sauce was amazing. I was eating healthy food and it was delicious! Additionally, their chicken alfredo pasta is amazing - there&#39;s not too much sauce or cheese like some other places tend to make. Would definitely come back here! The service and ambiance was beautiful as well!

Terrible!!! SLOW SERVICE!! The host told me the wait will be 30min and I ended up waiting over an hour. If I hadn&#39;t asked for a manager who knows how much longer I would have waited. Once I was sat it took another 20min to take our drink order. Food service is extremely slow, it took about 45min to get our food. I have to admit the food was GREAT!!!!! I ordered the Salmon and it was delicious... not sure of it&#39;s worth the wait.

Service and food were great! This is probably the best location I&#39;ve been to.  None of the foods came out lukewarm or frozen tasting. See pics for what we ordered. Also got the calamari--very crunchy &amp; chewy. Perfect sauces came with it. Tuesday for lunch was a good time to go. Didn&#39;t have to wait even though it looked kinda packed!

Came here for my birthday on May 2nd and I was very surprised with the service.<br>Our server PJ was very attentive and made sure to do everything in her power for us to have a great night.<br>The overall taste of the food was great. I ordered the chicken and biscuits which was delicious <br>Will surely come again

We went here to meet our friends for lunch. Ian decided not to cooperate at the restaurant so the Mrs. did not get to enjoy the experience at all. <br><br>We ordered a Margherita Pizza, and Cajun Jumbalaya Pasta. <br><br>Pros:<br>1) Service was prompt. Waitstaff was pleasant. They boxed up our pizza for us.<br>2) There was a lot going on at the restaurant. All the tables were full, but it did not appear that anyone was left wanting for service (+1)<br>3) Portions are huge as always. Pasta was also good with adequate shrimp pieces in it :)<br>4) They validated parking. <br><br>Cons:<br>None I can think of.

The menu is huge so if you have a large group you might end up lucky. They validate for the parking structure. <br><br>Went in at 5 PM on a Saturday with a group of 10 and I think maybe two people were satisfied with their meals. <br><br>Cons:<br>-Watered down drinks across the board. <br>-Sandwiches that were mostly bread and messily assembled. <br>-Sad fries that tasted like they&#39;d been under the heat lamp for days and also undercooked. <br>-pasta with no taste at all <br><br>Pros- <br>Our service was fine.

Came in and sat at the bar at 10:11 pm on a thursday where it wasnt at all busy maybe 4 patrons at the 20 person bar, 2 bartenders were on. I wasnt greeted but had a menu placed in front of me. All i wanted was a hot toddy and hot soup as i was feeling under the weather. As i put the menu away to let the bartenders know i was ready i was overlooked not once or twice but 4 times different customers came in and were greeted and all. I sat there til 10:28 pm still waiting to be served but alas was not i got up said thanks to the bartenders for the impeccable service and they said have a great night not realizing i hadnt been waited on, talk about situational awareness. I left to speak with management i dont know of i waa judged by the way i was dressed in all sweats but as an americana resident fpr any restaurant to overlook an individual by looks is beyond me and degrading. The management said they wpuld take care of my soup if i decided to stay but why trust an establishment that can run properly on a slow day. Thanks but no thanks cheese is worth no ones time

I had an amazing experience!!! My waitress ZAKIA was absolutely amazing. She kept an amazing attitude the entire time even though it was busy. I appreciated it so much!!! Thank you ZAKIA ! ( if you see this!)
If it wasnt for the delicious dishes and cheesecakes that they offer I would have never come back, since the waiting line is always beyond long.

I came here (3/21/17) visiting from san diego &amp; of course you cant miss coming to americana so we decided to visit cheesecake here for lunch , it is bigger than ours in SD ( it gives you this feeling ) looks fancy as well , i chose smokehouse bbq burger because beside desserts the burgers is the best meal you can order its perfect , what i didnt like is customer service our server was kind of rude , the bread we got was cold and very hard ( in SD its freshly baked &amp; so soft ) and they didnt bring more , orders take long time to come .<br>I always prefer middle eastern places in LA for their excellent service &amp; food so i guess this time it was mistake changing that .<br>Cheesecake factory in SD is way better than this one<br><br>I&#39;ll cut two stars for service .<br><br>3 stars for the outstanding burger &amp; nice interior design .

We went for my dad&#39;s birthday and it was disaster. My mom and dad ordered glass of wines but the glasses were dirty, sticky and covered with all finger prints. Then my sister ordered the Bacon Bacon Cheeseburger the Bacon was burned uneatable but we didn&#39;t complain because we were hungry so we ignored it. At the end when I ordered the bill, I saw that one of our meals were double charged so I had to call to the waiter to change the bill. It&#39;s unacceptable and bad reputation for Cheesecake Factory.

Even though food is kinda pricey, the amount they give you will leave you stuffed and the deliciousness of it will make you want more. <br><br>I really like the bread they always give in the beginning, but it&#39;s not great when it&#39;s not warm. <br><br>I really like the Davinci pasta and the Louisiana chicken pasta there. I think these two dishes really have a good medley of flavors.  I&#39;m usually not a big fan of desserts, but the red velvet cheesecake was good. It wasn&#39;t overbearingly sweet as I thought it would be. <br><br>I&#39;ve also been here during happy hour. Appetizers and drinks are great during this time at an even better price. <br><br>Service is great and friendly. An enthusiastic waiter/waitress makes a real big difference. <br><br>Overall, besides the children that scream and cry out every once in awhile, and having to talk over voices since it&#39;s kinda loud in there, it has a good ambience.  People really like celebrating their birthdays here (I think it&#39;s kinda exciting). Be prepared to hear them sing &#34;happy birthday&#34; maybe a couple hundred times. Jk. But you know what I mean. Haha.

We didn&#39;t go at a bad time, we were seated almost right away. Service wasn&#39;t bad, but one of our cups still had a tag on it. Like it obviously wasn&#39;t brand new and had gone through the washing system a few times but the cup still had it on. I would have figured that at least it would have been taken off at some point in time before it reached the table. I got the pizza and salad lunch special and my pizza was so hard. Like it was so over cooked and difficult to eat. <br><br>Either way it was okay.

Love cheesecake honestly this is one of my favorite restaurants everything I have ever try has been amazing I sometimes order for my lunch and run to grave it. I&#39;ve had the Santa Fe salad amazing, the spicy chicken sandwich amaaazing and their pastas <br>Let not even talk about the cheesecakes <br>If I could rate cheesecake to a 100 I would

Have been to many Cheesecake Factory restaurants. I must say this was the worst experience ever. Never have I been treated so rudely and disrespectfully. The staff working on Black Friday was horrible. After asking for a booth we were seated in the bar, after being ignored by several wait staff we asked what was going on. We were not pleasantly informed that apparently the hostess sat us in an area that no one would be waiting on for another 10 minutes. So because we were two tables out of the section, which she did not mention, no one would even stop to offer service. When we spoke to the host Jose, he was just as unpleasant, apparently this was our fault. I asked why when we asked for a booth we were denied but they seated many after us in booths. While their food is usually great...Must say if you are looking for a cordial staff, try a different restaurant at the Americana, there are several to choose from with fantastic customer service.

How do I start? Well, I had made a 5:30 dinner reservation to celebrate my Wife&#39;s birthday. We got call that our table was ready, got their and it was not even bus yet. Waited to have it cleaned. Ok, waiter comes and doesn&#39;t even apologize about the table and process to take our drink order. He comes back with the drinks and as if we were ready to order, gave him our appetizer order and our main course menu. We waited over 20 minutes for our appetizers and he final came by and apologized for the detail. 10 minutes later with got our appetizers and in about 3 minutes later we got our main course, no TIME to enjoy our appetizers and we order two glasses of  wine with our meals and guess what, it came just about when we were half way finish eating. WORST SERVICE EVER.

I&#39;ve been dining at this location for many years and I&#39;ve been satisfied with the food and service every time however these past 3 times have been very disappointing. Nothing tastes the same. The avocado egg rolls aren&#39;t the same (soggy), the flatbreads don&#39;t taste the same, the pastas and entrees don&#39;t have the same flavor. I don&#39;t think I will be back

It was packed! We arrived at 7 pm and our  wait was approximately 50 mins. <br><br>The service was good but the food was slow to arrive. <br><br>Food was good! We had three different dishes: Thai Salmon (not on the menu), mushroom hamburger, and crispy spicy chicken sandwich. <br><br>When we left at approximately 9, there was still a lot of people waiting to be seated.

God I hate this place. The only reason I go to this ridiculously unhealthy corporate restaurant that is worse than McDonald&#39;s in terms of being bad for you is because my silly parents like this place. Then again, they used to think Sizzler was the bomb and they still eat steak well done... SMH....<br><br>Look, I just don&#39;t get why this place is so popular. Service is always shitty and wait times are almost always an hour or more for food that tastes no better than Stouffer&#39;s frozen food. And honestly, I have no idea why they bother with Asian food that tastes worse than Panda Express. Trust me when I say the Teriyaki Chicken with Rice is just deplorable - I mean, it makes Mr. Yoshida&#39;s sauce seem heavenly. My silly parents ordered this... uggh...<br><br>And their shitty pizzas taste pre-packaged since they probably are shipped to the Cheesecake Factory from a Sysco-owned distribution warehouse. And speaking of pre-packaged, you should know that despite its name, none of the Cheesecake Factory restaurants actually make any cheesecakes in-house. All that is done in a &#34;cheesecake factory&#34; over in Calabasas. So if you really go to this restaurant for the cheesecake, just stop by the frozen section at your local Ralph&#39;s because it&#39;s the same shit albeit a whole lot cheaper. <br><br>And, as if to make your experience even more &#34;cheesy&#34; (pun intended), their menus are as thick as college readers. That is because not only does the Cheesecake Factory have over 200 items to choose from, their menus are filled with more freaking advertisements than the &#34;free version&#34; of Angry Birds, YouTube, and the Sunday newspaper combined. I mean, sorry Artin, I really am not  &#34;thinking of buying or selling&#34; a home when I look at a menu. Go spend your advertisement money on a bus bench &#34;bro&#34;. <br><br>But the main reason I hate this place is because eating here is unhealthy and will take you one step closer to a heart attack since nearly every entrée here is served with exorbitant amounts of sodium and fat.<br><br>Take for instance the Farfalle with Chicken and Roasted Garlic pasta dish consisting of bow-tie pasta, chicken, mushrooms, tomato, pancetta, peas and caramelized onions in a roasted garlic-parmesan cream sauce. This deceptively healthy sounding dish comes out to 2,190 calories, 58 grams of saturated fat (three day&#39;s worth) and 1,830 milligrams (mg) of sodium. <br><br>That is more than a Big Mac combo with a large Coke (1,580 calories) and two extra cheeseburgers (300 calories each). Moreover, the current dietary guidelines for Americans recommends that adults in general should consume no more than 2,300 mg of sodium per day.<br><br>And you know those &#34;famous&#34; Avocado Eggroll appetizers? One serving is 960 calories and contains 1,130 mg of sodium. And their &#34;healthy&#34; salads are filled with exorbitant amounts of sodium that make Maruchan Instant Ramen Noodles seem healthy. Take a look at the Asian Chicken Salad, which the Cheesecake Factory lists under their &#34;weight management&#34; section of their menu. While the salad has only 570 calories, it has 2,600 mg of sodium... sneaky, deceptive, shameless.<br><br>While I apologize for going off-tangent and turning into a health nut there (I just got a blood test and my LDL cholesterol came out high), unless you want the Fattycake Fattery to kill you, you really shouldn&#39;t eat here. But don&#39;t take my word for it. <br><br><a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.cheesecakefactorynutrition.com%2Frestaurant-nutrition-chart.php&amp;s=7112af61d4fa80c2681a7e95d4cf5888cf1aa7b99870d741b952d64a9a65c55c" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">cheesecakefactorynutriti…</a><br><br>* It&#39;s funny how they have a &#34;Skinnylicious&#34; section of the menu. That means, the rest of it is Fatty-ridiculous...

Just had lunch - indoor....<br>Clean and a nice temperature - as usual ....<br>However, the Asian chicken salad that I ordered had only 5 or 6 pieces of chicken - literally finger-nail size   <br>$13.95<br>Buyer Beware !

Today is not my day in Cheesecake Factory :( I would give you two stars, one for manager acknowledgment and one for all my good experiences in past.<br><br>Very very very slow and bad service today. We ordered food and already got full just with the bread. We ordered chicken samosa and chicken nachos as appetizer and chicken piccata as main dish. We asked for having appetizer first but we didn&#39;t receive it. Instead we received our main dish so we canceled the appetizer. Although manager offered us free dessert instead but honestly I would like to have the food in the order I set in my mind and pay for them all instead of waiting and waiting and waiting and finally cancel the order and getting something else free. <br><br>Our server finally checked on us to see if manager talked to us about our appetizer and then he didn&#39;t check back on us about how main dish cooked and if we need any drinks refill. Many of other employees passed our table and none of them asked if we need any waters although our glasses were empty and nobody took the empty dishes. Finally after 15 minutes one of the ladies took our empty dish but still no refill on our waters. We received the refill when we received the free dessert.I wish I was seeing the better team work here. It&#39;s nice to help your coworkers if they are behinds or having a bad day. <br><br>And the last but not least, we asked for Tiramisu cake as a free dessert and it was still frozen. I wish I went to another restaurant today<br><br>It was not my first time in this location but it&#39;s the first time I &#39;m receiving this kind of service in Cheesecake Factory. Something is really wrong today!!!

This place is incredible! My boyfriend and I came here for a Sunday brunch and IMMEDIATELY got seated. The food is pretty good as expected and the service is INCREDIBLE. We had a waitress named Steph? Stef? Anyways she was fairly tall with long ginger hair and glasses. My goodness, she was the best waitress I&#39;ve ever had. So funny, attentive, and just flat out amazing. We made sure to leave a big tip. I&#39;ve never had such a great dining experience and I genuinely mean that.

I&#39;m beginning to think that the Cheesecake Factory may not be what it use to be.   This is literally the 2nd time in a row a t this location that the service has been mediocre.  I give up!  Waited for over 10 minutes with no service!  Then....At towards the end of dinner, I requested a manager and a manager never took the time to show up. <br><br>DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS LOCATION!<br><br>TERRIBLE.

We got attended by Demarise this last time I went and I would love to say that she had fantastic customer service. She was very helpful in getting our orders right and exactly how you wanted it. She was also checking on us here in there to make sure we were OK and was enjoying our food.<br><br>The food is always good at cheesecake if you haven&#39;t tried it you were definitely missing out.

FLY&#39;S FLY&#39;S EVERYWHERE!!!!!! Disgusting. <br>Come on management, we hear you don&#39;t care about the fly&#39;s CLUSTERED on the windows. Someone take initiative. Before you seat your guests the busser, runner, wait staff,or MANAGEMENT!!!!!!<br> get rid of the fly&#39;s. <br><br>Our servers were amazing  courteous, attentive, always looking out for us. The food was delicious.  ........ Ask the fly&#39;s they can tell you.
I went with my family for Saturday lunch. The service was great! My parents enjoyed the seared Ahi tuna. I had the four cheese pasta which was okay. Topped it all off with a carrot cake cheese cake !
Santa Fe salad and the bistro shrimp dish are my usual go-to&#39;s! The Thai chicken lettuce wraps are my absolute favorite appetizer to order !
Fast service and the wait wasn&#39;t bad only took 20 minutes to be seated during dinner time on a Saturday.

Highly disappointed with my visit here! For one, my server was extremely slow! Two, my toast came out burnt but once but twice. By the time a decent batch of toast was served my dip was cold! <br><br>Even worse, I was given TWO dirty plates and when I notified a server, he turned around and gave me the SAME DIRTY PLATES! How UNSANITARY it that?!?<br><br>I mentioned it to the manager and the server states he washed them but when I said no you did not because the plates had the same dirt stains, the server then says he wiped them. <br><br>Not only did he blatantly lie to my face but also to his manager.
