More so, he thought it was ok to give me the same DIRTY plates! OUTRIGHT DISGUSTING!

The cheesecake factory at The Grove has better customer service... The one at Americana sucks nut sacks....<br><br>The guy at the front told us it would be about a 30 min wait but &#34;probably less&#34; ...cut to an hour later.... the little beeper he handed us still hasn&#39;t vibrated, we still haven&#39;t been seated. <br><br>So we approach someone that works there and kindly asked him how much longer it would be in case we needed to find somewhere else to eat. The guy took our beeper and said wait here we will have u seated... we stood there and waited for him to come back. And when he finally did, he forgot all about us and I had to ask him again... he then got someone else to seat us.. we didn&#39;t take the menu because we already knew what we were going to order so we just waited for the waiter... the woman next to us pissed me off because she thought my boyfriend was chris pratt and started to facetime us to someone. I called her out on how rude she was in front of her children. And we continued to wait for the waiter... <br><br>Mins later still no waiter. .<br><br>Finally a waiter arrives we told her our order and she said they no longer serve that... we have been coming to cheese cake factor for a very long time and order the same thing every time.. <br><br>I lost my shit.. got up and left to go eat at shake shack..
Love this place !!!! Grate service grate food!<br>You should try Factory nachos <br>It is always a little bit more waiting time if you want to sit out door but it worth it!

I ordered the famous Louisiana chicken pasta and my boyfriend ordered the bacon-bacon burger. First and foremost, I want to say our server Andrew was THE BEST. He was super friendly and super helpful and I can go on and on about how amazing his service was. We couldn&#39;t believe how enthusiastic he was for a waiter. I&#39;ve come here before and we would always get waiters/waitresses who are either super rude or too tired to care. Anyways, the food was amazing and the cheesecake was, as always, mouthwatering. Very satisfied. WE LOVE YOU ANDREW!!

Came with my mom to enjoy mommy daughter time and our server malia (I hope that&#39;s how you spell her name) was the sweetest ever! She was extremely hospitable and gracious. She gave us honest opinions on the food and helped us choose our dessert. This factory is always busy and she was kind enough to take some time out to talk to us at our table! I work in the restaurant industry as well and it&#39;s always good to see level headed servers. Thank you so much Malia, mom and I enjoyed our dinner tonight!! Good job management for hiring a great staff member!

I was so excited to go eat here, it was my first time. But the wait was 45 minutes. Then I ordered a papaya Mojito I waited another 45 minutes for my drink. My husband ordered the New York steak with mashed potatoes. The mashed potatoes were cold the steak was also cold so disappointing for a $20 something dollars.My son ordered  spaghetti with meatballs. His spaghetti was mixed with pasta and their was only one meatball. The food is mediocre not all that to wait 45 minutes for. I&#39;m Very disappointed . Its expensive for the food they serve. Will never visit again and it&#39;s not worth the wait.

This location has been awful everytime, so bad that I never want to eat Cheesecake Factory again! Last time a call in order for shrimp scampi and my noodles were stuck together. Management took care of my bill so I decided to give them another try and dine in today.. ordered the grilled salmon and my mashed potatoes came out cold! Didn&#39;t complain initially because im pregnant and hungry but I thought I should let management know upon paying the bill and he basically told me oh well! Im done. The brown bread and the actual cheesecake is the only thing they don&#39;t mess up!

The food wasn&#39;t bad but it was overpriced. This place is very loud and busy. The servers were nice but getting a table was a bitch. Even though I made reservations I still had to wait 15 minutes for the desk people to get there head out of there a$$.

When I go to the Americana sometimes I eat Cheesecake Factory and I really like the food.I like the brown bread there and buffalo wings there to.I like the reviews and most people go there and I also thought that people like it.So that is why I made it a really good review.

The Cheesecake Factory will always be what it is -- a &#34;factory&#34;; always crowded, always busy. The Saturday after Thanksgiving wasn&#39;t going to be different. We were a group of 13 who had to wait 2 hours before we could get a table. Fortunately we had the luxury of time to wait, what with the cold weather and the sudden rains. Anyway, our server, Noa, made it worth the while for us. Once seated, Noa served us, a bunch of seniors, in her most diligent, efficient way and she did all this with a smile. She was a breath of fresh air, especially after the long wait and an obnoxious gentleman who seated us. Bravo, Noa, you are an asset for Cheesecake Factory. You may want to look for another job someplace?

I went there last week with my boyfriend and two friends, I ordered the chicken madiera with mashed potatoes and a side order of fries. I have been there before  and the food is good. This time around the food was such a disappointment, all of our mashed potatoes were hard and not tasteful, my chicken as well, it had zero flavor.<br>I wanted to complain because it wasn&#39;t fair what we paid for and the kind of food we got. <br>This has made me not want to go back. None of us were satisfied with the food.

I love Cheesecake Factory. Everything I&#39;ve tried is always so yummy. I highly recommend the Pasta Di Vinci. It&#39;s their Chicken Madeira dish. I didn&#39;t take a pic of my cheesecake slice but it was the Oreo cheesecake and you can never go wrong with Oreos...right

I absolutely love Cheesecake Factory The one in Glendale happens to be my favorite  location the staff is GREATThey are very friendly and they remembered my name. I felt very special as I Continue Celebrating my Birthday HolyDay Season. Some of the best people of ALL demographics patronize Cheesecake Factory.  From the managers, especially Sammy, to the waiters and waitresses, Gilbert, Milan, Albert, Steve, basically, the entire team works together to make each visit fulfilling. I was Blessed to have the most scrumptious Banana Cheesecake today<br><br>If you want to enjoy good vibes, delicious cuisine surrounded by an invigorating atmosphere where JOY and LOVE fills the air, visit the Americana. Be very careful not to overindulge.

I have been ordering from DoorDash and they say on their website that bread is complimentary yet it NEVER comes with the order. After numerous attempts to call both parties I have given up and just decided to leave a negative review. Would be zero stars if possible. Also the food is not that great. Cheesecake Factory you are not the same restaurant you were 10 years ago, yet your prices are more expensive. Skip it, especially at the Americana location were the customer service and food quality is awful.
Long waits no matter what day you go, no reservations bland food, I ordered Jambalaya had 5 shrimps and 4 pieces of chicken. Tried other dishes here it&#39;s just bland food and overpriced.
I&#39;m always craving their brown bread and chicken Madeira. Love their cheesecakes as well, can never go wrong with that!

I wish I could give them zero stars!! After we ordered our appetizers we noticed the spare silverware had HALF CHEWED food smothered on it. We checked the rest of the utensils and they were all sticky and clearly not washed well. I was personally repulsed by the fact that I have eaten here before!! The manager did not even seem surprised when I informed him of this issue, like it wasn&#39;t the first time he heard this....<br>I did not ask for any compensation, neither would I accept it IF offered, but he barely even apologized.<br>This is a very poorly managed restaurant.<br>I would suggest investing an extra $2 an hour and hiring dishwashers that are not literally drinking and smoking weed on their lunch break. <br>Terrible experience... Id rather eat fucking McDonalds.

I grew up going to Cheesecake Factory, and I&#39;ve been to this location a couple of times before -- once recently. <br><br>LOCATION: It&#39;s at the Americana in Glendale. It&#39;s a pretty nice shopping mall, with a similar vibe to the Grove, although there&#39;s just something about the Grove that makes it a couple notches better. One downside though is having to pay a lot for parking (at both lol), unless you&#39;re only there a few short hours and get your ticket validated (what I try to opt for -- not staying there like all day). Oh, but also, since it&#39;s at this big and popular mall, it gets busy, so be prepared to wait for a table, even thought the restaurant is huge and has both indoor and outdoor seating. 3/5<br><br>ATMOSPHERE: It&#39;s a typical Cheesecake Factory. If you know, you know haha. 3/5<br><br>SELECTION: Once again, if you know, you know. Cheesecake Factory has probably the biggest menu I&#39;ve ever seen. I like that they have something for everyone, and it always comes to mind for suggesting for a group with diverse eating interests. I just wish they had a few more specifically-labeled vegan options. I know a lot can be modified, but it&#39;d be cool if there were specifics, besides just the Vegan Cobb. 4/5<br><br>WHAT I GOT: Ever since they introduced it, I usually get the Vegan Cobb. It&#39;s pretty good overall. It&#39;s simple, but yet there&#39;s variety, and I like how they arrange it on a long plate and everything is in little sections (it&#39;s not just like in a big bowl where everything is mixed together). 3/5<br><br>SERVICE: The service is usually pretty good and reliable at most Cheesecake Factory locations, and this one isn&#39;t excluded. 4/5
The best Cheesecake Factory I always been to I always love coming her with my family never had a single issue here staff is very friendly and the food is very fresh and tasty

I&#39;m not one to ever come to American chained restaurants, but it was for a gf&#39;s late bday dinner and she wanted something very simple and casual so what bday girl wants, bday girl gets haha. Since she lives near the area we chose this location, and it&#39;s great since there are many stores, as it&#39;s right in Americana mall. You can park in the parking structure, and make sure to validate at the restaurant.<br><br>The inside is pretty big, a bit dim on the lighting. Very casual and relaxed setting and a small bar area in the entrance. As you are seated they give you complimentary breads. I love the oat bread. It&#39;s dark colored, like chocolate, and tasted sweet. Kind of remind me of the sweet oat bread from Subway. It comes out a tad warm and so soft. Along with some sourdough bread that is okay but not close to the oat bread. And lots of individual butter. We got another round of bread as we finished the first round first, and I must add it&#39;s dangerous because I already started to get pretty full and it&#39;s the perfect combo of carbs and sugar :)<br><br>The menu is pretty big, they have such a huge selection and it&#39;s great for families since they have something that everyone can enjoy, all with different taste. I also like how they have a separate low calorie food menu. My gf&#39;s and I ordered a bottle of their pinot noir. It was slightly dry, but a nice aroma and smooth.<br><br>_Endive Salad. Belgian Endive, Radicchio, Glazed Pecans, Blue Cheese and Vinaigrette. My gf usually gets this when she comes here, and I can see why. It&#39;s a perfect small salad to start off with. The salad is refreshing but really carries and overpowering and pungent flavor from the blue cheese so make sure not to grab too much as a little goes a long way. Pairs nicely with the candied pecans, for some sweetness and balances well with the cheese and slight bitterness from the radicchio. All the ingredients go well together and the dressing is nicely sweet and tossed easily, which I appreciate.<br>_Cajun Jambalaya Pasta. Shrimp and Chicken Sautéed with Onions, Tomato and Peppers in a Very Spicy Cajun Sauce. All on Top of Fresh Linguini. My 2 gf&#39;s split this. I tried a bite and it was pretty good, but way too spicy for my liking. It had a real strong pepper aftertaste. The shrimp was nicely cooked and it seemed they put good amounts of it as well. Nothing amazing but if you like spicy this is a safe pasta dish. <br>_Skinnylicious Soft Tacos. Three Soft Corn Tortillas Filled with Spicy Chicken or Shrimp, Avocado, Tomato, Onions, Cilantro and Crema. Served with Escabeche Vegetables. I ordered this from the skinnylicious menu. I got chicken. It comes with all the toppings on the tacos but I asked for it all on the side. Good amount for 1 person or 2 to share. It was okay, I&#39;ve had better tacos elsewhere, and was not really expecting much. The chicken was overcooked and dry and very bland in flavor. They barely gave enough toppings for all 3 toppings, especially the avocados, they really skimped on that. The best part of this dish was the escabeche vegetables. It was pickled cucumbers and cauliflower, that was refreshing sweet and acidic. <br>_Tiramisu. Italian Custard Made with Mascarpone, Whipped Cream, Lady Fingers, Marsala and Coffee Liqueur. Topped with Whipped Cream and Ground Chocolate. Surprsingly, pretty good. I know it&#39;s cheesecake factory but none of us were in the mood for cheesecake, but actually all agreed on tiramisu. It was great, but holly jeeeeeezzzz..... can you put any more whipped cream in the plate?! I couldn&#39;t tell if the dessert was the whopped cream or tiramisu. One whip would have been enough. Nothing like taking a classic great dessert and smothering and over killing it with cheap american sugar. There was barely any ground chocolate as they mentioned. I would get this, just ask for easy on the whip cream.<br><br>Nothing to rave about, and I would not come here again, unless someone wanted to go for their birthday haha. Service was good.

I love cheesecake factory and I don&#39;t care if you judge me! What shits me about people hating on chain restaurants is that they didn&#39;t become chain restaurants because the food sucks. They became chain restaurants because people like them! Doi!<br><br>So many good options but my favorites are:<br>Spicy chipotle chicken pasta<br>Bistro shrimp pasta<br>Shrimp scampi <br>Orange chicken<br>Mac &amp; cheese balls (app)<br>Ahi tuna (app)<br>Avocado egg rolls<br>Salads<br><br>Ok, I think that&#39;s enough. Clearly you can see I like their pasta the most.<br>This location at the Americana is really big so it makes for a shorter wait time generally.<br><br>Another thing about it is that you can always count on cheesecake factory to be really clean. From bathrooms to silverware &amp; table tops, I can&#39;t say I&#39;ve ever had a bad experience in that regard.<br><br>I&#39;ve been here a hundred times and will keep coming back!

I first went to a Cheesecake Factory in Ohio and the food made me sick, so I was hesitant to ever go back, but when I saw that this one was so close to my apartment, I decided to give them a chance. I&#39;m really glad I did. The food is amazing.<br><br>They make the absolute greatest chocolate shake I&#39;ve ever had, and I am a connoisseur of shakes, so I was thrilled. Their orange chicken is better than most Chinese food places around here, and their club sandwich is delectable. My boyfriend got a steak dinner here once - filet - and it was one of the most delicious steaks we&#39;ve had. He also enjoyed a seafood pasta dish. <br><br>And of course, the bread is so good, and the cheesecakes are quite tasty (though some are a little too sweet). This is now one of my favorite places (and I&#39;ve been buying way too many chocolate shakes from them).

The claim they have 250+ menu items, yet only very few are vegan. Even the impossible burger isn&#39;t vegan. Two stars for that and for the fact that my wife and I had a stomach ache after we ate there.

Cheesecake factory. I normally love you, but tonight you failed me. First of all, we were seated at a booth where no server made contact for drinks or bread or anything for 15 minutes. Eventually, I had to get up and go to the hostess stand to inquire about our server. A manager (I&#39;m guessing) walked me back to my booth where she promptly apologized and served us up our drinks. Okay, cool. No big deal. Then we waited again... for 10 minutes... until a server finally came over and apologized and brought us some bread. We gave her our food order (a sandwich and an appetizer) and then waited another 15-20 minutes for our food. <br><br>While we waited, no check up on our table. <br><br>We get our food and are finally finishing up when A GODDAMN ROACH crawls out from the crack between the table and the wall. A fucking german roach... so I am very sure there are more roach buddies hanging out nearby.<br><br>I searched reviews and because I love cheesecake factory, was going to suggest avoiding any and all booths and opt to eat outside, but apparently roaches are also a problem out there... so sorry guys, I&#39;m out of ideas. <br><br>I can give a pass for bad service because servers sometimes have bad days... but roaches? FUCK THAT SHIT.<br><br>PARKING: 90 minute validation with purchase.

I ordered the Steak Diane(not sure if the name&#39;s correct) medium, but when i got my dish it was clearly overcooked. I told our server about it and she apologized right away and took my dish back to prepare a new one. The manager also came over to apologize and got me a mushroom bisque to enjoy while i waited. The new steak came out pretty quick, and i was told it was made personally by the chef manager! The steak was very juicy and tender, slightly charred and golden brown on the outside with a hint of pink on the inside. I don&#39;t know how to explain this better but the food was just amazing and strikingly delicious. Plus, the service here is great!There&#39;s a reason why the waiting&#39;s so long all the time.

I live at the Americana so I speak as an expert here. <br><br>Do not EVER order takeout from this location. Honestly I&#39;d be hesitant to go at all. <br><br>My neighbor and I both got severe food poisoning from chicken here. Mine was from takeout that had chicken - they didn&#39;t bring it out until over 15 minutes after the time quoted. It was cold. I warmed it up at home, and 12 hours later I was sleeping on the floor of my bathroom with a severe fever and not even able to keep water down. My neighbor was also sick, and it lingered enough that she was tested by her doctor two weeks later and tested positive for salmonella. <br><br>Cheesecake Factory of course denied any wrong doing, but sent us each a $20 gift card for our troubles. <br><br>Tonight I was really hungry and decided to finally give them another chance so I didn&#39;t keep carrying this gift card around. I ordered the Factory Nachos - no meat, so I was hoping it was safe. <br><br>After again making me wait an extra 15 minutes after my quoted time, my Nachos came out cold. Not even lukewarm, cold. I didn&#39;t want to take the chance again so I had them give me a refund. I went there hungry and left over half an hour later with no food and a conviction that this is the level of quality anyone can expect here. <br><br>I have been going to Cheesecake Factorys since I was a child. I always thought of them as a reliable and nice place to eat. I will never eat here again, and since I live upstairs and like the sort of food they make, that&#39;s saying a lot.<br><br>Edited to add: Instead of refunding me to a new gift card, they literally fished the used gift card out of the trash and gave it back to me. Disgusting.

Went out to dinner here last night, and it literally took TWO hours to get seated. We had a group of about 10 people, and checked in at 620pm. After going in a few times for a status update, and even requesting to talk to the manager, we were finally called in to be seated at 810pm. Even on a busy night, I think that&#39;s pretty unacceptable.<br><br>Our waiter, Gilbert, introduced himself and said he was going on break. His replacement was so stone-faced that we wondered if he was having a bad day or if he was just like that every day. But when Gilbert returned just when our food was coming out, all was well again. Gilbert is honestly one of the most charismatic and caring waiters I have ever had! He was so on top of it and had the best attitude the whole time! If I could just rate the point of the dinner from when Gilbert returned to our table after his break, I would give the restaurant five stars because his service is amazing, the food tasted great (presentation is nice, and the portions are huge), and we all had a fantastic time (and practically forgot about the beginning of the night). The manager is also incredibly friendly!

They were extremely rude and when asked for a kids menu ( we aren&#39;t much older than the recommended age ) we were told we couldn&#39;t have one . Multiple times that I came here and asked for a kids menu they would at least give it to me despite their judgmental faces and voices . But she wouldn&#39;t even give us one . It makes no sense to order a meal that we can&#39;t even finish and is 10x more expensive. She had clear glasses and a ponytail and dark hair .

We went there with friends last March 10, indeed that place is always busy (especially on a Sunday night) front desk people were courteous and the server was really friendly, I can give customer service 5 stars. What disappointed me was Fettuccini Alfredo that I had, my friend&#39;s son ordered the same thing but his was a lot better, pasta itself was saggy. Not &#34;Al dente &#34;, I didn&#39;t enjoy it and to think that, that was the reason I persuade everyone to go there. I ended up going to Starbucks after that dinner. I hope to get a good one the next time I visit them. That has been my fave eversince.

Stopped  here on Saturday after an afternoon of shopping.  We sat at the bar because we were to hungry to wait for table. <br><br>A bartender took our order then quickly left.  Shortly after a super nice bartender named Vince came. He was awesome. He was well organized and giving great direction to the staff.<br><br>Our food came out all sorts of wrong due to the previous person who took our order. Vince promptly fixed the issue.<br><br>Then a server dropped more glass than i ever heard in my life right behind us. It was crazy. Props to him and the team for cleaning it up quickly and safely.<br><br>Vince is a rock star. Make sure he takes care of you at the bar!

Come here if you want to wait 3-4 hour wait time. We came here knowing about the wait time, but omg bad services, messed up order.. order a club and they bring me something else for manager to let me know they don&#39;t have club sandwiches in the cheesecake factory. Managers have to know the menu, common. Well we left with one of us uneaten because when they brought the club sandwich they got it wrong again. Not that hard to make. Lil discount they gave us but 5 hours in total and one of us got to look at us eat only. Better service elsewhere...Come here if you want to be ignored, forgotten, disrespected, and bad service.

I used to really look forward to Cheesecake Factory, but I find myself being disappointed every time. My perfect example--the Louisiana Chicken Pasta. Was dry as a bone. Strange since the menu said it had a spicy cajun cream sauce, and it was neither creamy nor spicy. In fact, I asked for hot sauce not for additional heat, but for moisture. :X  The chicken was crispy though. <br><br>I guess you could say I chose poorly, but as witness to other people at my table, I&#39;m not the only one who expected more both in quality and portion.  <br><br>Waiters and hosts were fine. I give them a star for that.<br><br>I think next year I&#39;ll vouch for a different place. Thanks for the memories!
The wait-time is a  killer. They do not do reservations and this is frustrating. But overall it is good. <br>The service is awesome.

Merry Christmas  yes I said it!!! It&#39;s a Christmas feel here at this place which is making this review a 4 stars. My utensils were immaculate this time.<br><br>The passion tea I always get was brewed on point. It&#39;s like management changed or decided to have a meeting and coordinate with their employees. Definitely a huge change from the different other times I&#39;ve come before.

Front desk incorrectly paged us and had to ask about getting seated after seeing other being seated before us.<br><br>This will be taken out in the waiters tip ($0.00). Perhaps management should share the downstream impact to earning potential. <br><br>Let&#39;s see how the rest of this goes during dinner.

Wife and I waited for 45 mins while other people who came in after us were being seated within 10 mins. Maybe 6 or 7 groups. Maybe they were being seated in the bar or on the patio? NOPE. In the dining room. When I informed the hostess and manager of the situation the female manager simply said I was mistaken and completely and coldly dismissed the matter without a care.  Incompetent hostess. Rude and arrogant manager. We eat out 4 or 5 times a week. We will NEVER go to this location again. Lola&#39;s and Granville are much better options for food quality and service. Both within 2 blocks.

We were a party of 5, 2 adults and 3 kids who came here last night (08/07/19) which was Wednesday, we waited and got called by 2 different hostesses twice when the table was not ready yet. For the record, that was my first experience getting called twice to the same table that&#39;s not ready. To think we&#39;re at &#34;Cheesecake Factory&#34;. Anyhow, we got seated, and we got the rudest waitress you can find(her name is Joy R - according to the receipt). She had no customer service skills whatsoever. How? We sat, she came several minutes later, didn&#39;t introduce herself, just asked us if we&#39;re ready to order. When typically, waiters ask if they can start you with anything to drink. When I asked if we can have water, she looked annoyed and I saw her eyes roll slightly, and then my friend said if we can get appetizers, she seemed to be uninterested and in a hurry. It was loud too(which is  obviously nothing surprising), but when the server couldn&#39;t hear what my friend was saying,  she said, &#34;What?!&#34;, as if she was just talking to her friend, can we at least say &#34;sorry I didn&#39;t get that&#34;, or something more polite. No anticipation of anything we might need, we lacked utensils, plates, straws, etc. Then when my friend asked nicely if we can have the bread, she said, &#34;Yea that&#39;ll come out&#34; in a rude tone. Towards the end she became nice but was obviously fake since it&#39;s time to pay the bill and of course let&#39;s be real, you&#39;re looking forward to the tip(which by the way, we gave more than she deserved with what she did to us). Food was also meh, I would say. Had better at other Cheesecake locations. I get it, it&#39;s busy, well yea, it&#39;s Cheesecake Factory. But c&#39;mon, if you&#39;re gonna treat customers like this, you have no business being a server anywhere. This is the very first time that I had a horrible experience at Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;ve been to many other locations, and the customer service and food has been great. But this one in Americana, is exceptional..exceptionally bad. The 1 star is only for the server of the actual food, who at least had some sense of humor and customer service and actually seemed really pleasant while serving the food. Everything else, ugh, why waste time here. Rather go elsewhere where it&#39;s actually worth it.

Excellent happy hour with a variety of food options... and let&#39;s not forget about the red velvet cheesecake!<br><br>I try to get here for the 4-6PM happy hour from time to time. It&#39;s definitely high on my last of happy hour favorites. The Vietnamese spring rolls, chicken sliders and crab wontons are a hit. Their strawberry lemonade compliments any meal well! <br><br>The service is usually prompt and the staff is attentive. I&#39;ve only ever had one bad experience with a server, but this seems to have been an outlier. If you want a happy hour that gives you more for your money, then you can&#39;t go wrong with the Cheesecake Factory.

The stars are for the food because the food never really disappoints me. The servers were terrible... At least the two who we had today.<br><br>To begin they didn&#39;t keep up with our table (only 4 guest) as far as drink refills or bringing more bread. The server had a bad attitude when she finally brought the bread and us declining-- she brought it when we were ready to leave, it was by then pointless. She also had the nerve to underline the amount of tip she thought she deserve-- I never have seen this! She was rushing towards the end, and this other server pointed at me as if I was leaving without paying. I was heading to pay upfront  so I could complained. Overall this was a terrible visit. <br>I tipped the guys serving cheesecake instead, who were more pleasant.

Stopped here tonight. Rude counter helper.  Barking, no eye contact. Spoke to the manager twice. The young lady at the cheesecake counter should work in a cubicle somewhere, safely away from people. <br><br>Here another night.   Same thing.  Rude.  Unconcerned.

Wow, being vegan they worked with us Biglake and got the impossible burger with lettuce instead of the bond as there are no buns that are vegan. However I got it with lettuce and it was outstanding. Also got tacos and substituted the chicken with the impossible burger with no cheese and those were outstanding too. As usual service was outstanding here at the cheesecake factory.

Pretty disgusting place. Sat down. Ordered. Appetizer plate was crusty and had a previous diner&#39;s food still stuck to it. Utensils were dirty. They brought another set. The new set was also dirty and crusty. Had to go in and cancel my order and left. They seem to have really low standards for cleanliness.

Love cheesecake!! <br><br>My go to spot when i want to eat something tasty but know anything will taste good off the menu. <br><br>Cheesecake Factory always has so much flavor and an extensive menu. Almost tried everything off the menu and have many favorites I always seem to choose as well.<br><br>Some of my favorites <br><br>Appetizer<br>Avocado rolls <br>Spinach artichoke dip <br><br>Pasta<br>Jambalaya pasta <br>Louisiana chicken pasta <br><br>Salad <br>Bbq chicken ranch salad <br><br>Cheesecake<br>Banana cream pie cheesecake <br><br>Can&#39;t wait to try more off the menu!

This is your typical Cheesecake Factory except that it&#39;s in a really busy area at the Americana. It&#39;s always packed here! We got lucky last night as we had an early dinner around 5 and were able to be seated right away. Since it&#39;s so busy, the service was just enough so that the waiters would give us water and bread, let us order, bring the food, and then give us the check. They are beyond busy. The food was as good as usual but for the Americana, there&#39;s definitely way more foot traffic so expect some sort of wait. Don&#39;t forget to give your parking ticket! They do validate.

This place continues to be a sure thing any time of day.  I mean the menu is so extensive there&#39;s everything from burgers and salads to pizza and pasta to steaks and ahi tuna the list goes on and on. Throughout the years there hasn&#39;t been anything I&#39;ve ordered that I didn&#39;t like.  Heck, even the kids fried macaroni balls are good.  <br><br>If you can avoid not filling up from the warm table bread that will be the first obstacle.  Good luck. It&#39;s fresh baked, soft centered yumminess.  I&#39;m salivating already. <br><br>My personal favorites are <br><br>1. Chicken Madeira- it&#39;s a specialty, hearty meal with savory chicken breasts and bomb ass mashed potatoes, asparagus and mozza.  Yes I said it! Bomb! (drops mic) <br><br>2. Chicken and shrimp jambalaya pasta- this is super delicious, enough for two people. All time favorite pasta dish that never gets old. <br><br>3. Avocado egg rolls- I can have this as a meal in itself. The tamarind cashew dipping sauce is what makes this super amazing.<br><br>4. Cheesecakes- the white chocolate raspberry truffle is to die for.  This goes well with extra whipped cream. <br><br>The fresh strawberry cheesecake with real strawberries and glaze is an all time classic.  <br><br>The key lime cheesecake gives a cool sweet and tart finish. Great palate refresher. <br><br>The marshmallow Smores galore is one my kids enjoy.  Gooey and chocolatey madness with graham crackers. <br><br>No fast food prices here. Nice, consistent establishment that has survived the test of time. <br><br>Would be nice to have longer hours of free parking to be able to walk around and shop after dining.

Sometimes you just need a cozy booth, a great dessert, and some girltalk. <br><br>That&#39;s exactly what a friend and I found at the Cheesecake Factory while doing a bit of window shopping at the Americana. Service was on point, the lemon meringue cheesecake we shared was heaven on earth, and the complimentary bread &#39;n butter was irresistible. <br><br>Pro-tip: <br>Free parking in the Galleria structure on Broadway, just west of Brand.

WORST EXPERIENCE EVER! Asked for a salad with only kale and the waiter did not communicate he could not grant the request. When the rude manager came over, she was patronizing and snarky. DONT COME HERE!

Have mixed feelings about this place. The food was alright but the service needs serious improvement. It was a pretty long wait on a weekday to get a table. When we requested a booth since we saw a couple available, our waiter tells us that they&#39;re about to be taken, which wasn&#39;t true, they got filled in til about 15 minutes later. I was bothered that they cramped 4 of us into those small tables where you&#39;re forced to sit next to complete strangers yet were seating 2 people at various booths.<br><br>Our waiter was honestly quite terrible, I&#39;m pretty sure he must&#39;ve been new or training. He spills my friend&#39;s drink all over the table and on his food and while he did apologize he never offered to bring a replacement for the food he completely ruined. Food does come in big portions but is just average, nothing special, not worth the wait &amp; service so won&#39;t be coming back.
Sheila&#39;s chicken and Avacado salad - amazing <br>Avacado egg rolls- amazing <br><br>Pasta thumbs up ! <br><br>Service was nice<br>And wait time was an hour and a bit more but it&#39;s cool :)

I literally just had the worst experience here if I could rate this no star I would so me and my family are out celebrating my daughters 7th birthday and we are going to have dinner here so first of all it was not busy at all and we still didn&#39;t get our table till an hour later but hey we brushed it off like okay maybe they have their reasons so we sit down and are ready to enjoy this amazing day with my daughter as a family and what do u know our waiter had such a crappy attitude it was not good customer service I was noticing that all the other waiters were super nice and checking up on their tables and ours was so visibly upset about something but it&#39;s not our fault we are just trying to enjoy this day so my brother and his wife order 2 cocktails easiest drinks to make 2 mojitos and we literally forgot about the drinks we ordered our food and an hour and a half has past and we are still waiting for our food and nothing I finished my drink an hour ago I was just drinking water and still not even one refill so my family was upset and we were all sad and mad that my daughters 7th birthday dinner was ruined so we got up and we talked to the manager letting him know we were leaving that the service was not good and all he said was let me check like check what we are waiting and we don&#39;t want cold food and what do u know as we are walking about waiting is brining the two cocktails barley an hour and half later for 2 cock tails I would not recommend anyone go here I seriously feel that they owe us a family dinner they robbed my daughter of her 7th birthday family dinner and I&#39;m so hurt and furious by this right now !!! I REPEAT DO NOT GO HERE

This place has slow service and nasty food. Only the bread and avocado egg rolls were good. The food took forever to come out and when it did my food was bland. I ordered the jambalaya, which is my usual order whenever I go to any Cheesecake Factory but at this location I regret choosing it. There was barely any sauce nor flavor in the chicken. There was so much noodles that my dish just tasted like bland noodles. I ate so much of the brown bread with butter waiting for my food to come. I probably won&#39;t come back to this location for a while.

Very yummy place, it was my first time and im gladly coming back again! It just sucks that we waiting over an hour to get our table which is why I brought one star down. The waiter was really nice too!

Obviously the food here is always so full of flavor! It&#39;s definitely one of my favorite restaurants! They have everything your craving, from cheese cake , to steak, to salads, to strawberry daiquiris ! <br><br>My go to meal here is the BBQ-Ranch chicken salad! The onion crispers on the salad legit MAKE THAT SALAD! Lol I&#39;m in love with it

Restaurant management, please don&#39;t reply to this review saying here&#39;s our email, we would like to further discuss this issue. I have discussed these issues, with you or a separate manager, every time I have gone to this restaurant. Nothing ever gets done here. The last time I saw a business this mismanaged, it was my nonexisting grandson&#39;s snowball company. <br><br>Once upon a time... <br><br>On my first date with my boyfriend, we came out to the Americana, back on December 7, 2017. and let me tell you, the only romantic part of that date was the walk from the parking lot to the front doors of the cheesecake factory. Once we walk in, the front waiting area is packed with people, and when I say packed, I mean it looked like the audition room for Americas Got Talent. A bunch of anxious people, waiting to be discovered...by a god damn server. <br><br>They give us a vibrating notice thingy and tell us the wait is 50 minutes. Well, we go walk around come back. nothing. We check in they&#39;re like it&#39;ll be a couple more minutes. let me be clear we had to stay there for an addition 45 minutes in the restaurant, every time checking in, they would tell us it will be a couple more minutes. Obviously we left after two hours, and I promised myself I&#39;ll never go back. <br><br>A few months later, I go in with a couple of friends, order food. I ordered some sort of flatbread or pizza, I recall. My friends order their burgers and a salad. aside from the terrible service, we all get a terrible stomachache and go back home, running to the bathroom. The survivors of the Great Plague might not have been able to survive that.<br><br>On a separate occasion, I go back and put our names in. and have a few people come back in later. I specifically ask for a table outside, as the inside sounds like the gathering of a stadium of people, who are bad at hearing and are unanimously shouting at each other. we wait and wait for about half an hour. Until I go check-in, this girl at the reception says: &#34;I mean yeah, meh, I can sit you inside right now.&#34;. and I respond that I specifically asked for a table outside, for two. She&#39;s like, well this couple that came in after you really wanted a table outside. I was thinking wtf do you mean &#34;They really wanted&#34;. I emphasized that we have been waiting far longer than the &#34;Couple after&#34; us. and she literally rolled her eyes and walked away and then she had someone sit us down. I saw her walk in and out to the patio, every time she would roll her eye at me. For the safety of her own vision, I would look away so she wouldn&#39;t feel so obligated to go through an entire eye-roll every time. <br><br>Every single time I go in, the cups and the cutlery are incredibly dirty, full of spots and marks. <br><br>However, <br><br>the chefs are hardworking and quite good at their job. Even the time I fell to my knees and ran to the bathroom, hands down the food was delicious. Nothing can beat their 4cheese pasta.

Their orange chicken isn&#39;t as tangy as the typical orange chicken recipes are, but the batter is super crunchy and the chicken is white meat but super flavorful. Usually comes w white rice but I subbed for brown !

Nothing to rave about. The food was average, wait time was short from ordering to delivery to table , my waitress was Naomi (very nice girl), don&#39;t order the cucumber lemonade, I don&#39;t understand how that&#39;s a favorite..its diabetes in a glass with sugar around the rim. I returned it for a glass of water. The bread was cold and hard...from the looks of it none of the guests ate the bread either...it may have been recycled.  I ordered shrimp pasta thing and he got the chicken fettuchini. Both dishes were okay, nothing to thank the chef  about. I&#39;ve had better at a mom and pops corner store.<br>Finally the cheesecake I got white chocolate raspberry truffle and him carrot cake cheese cake. Both were blah, again nothing I couldn&#39;t get at a bakery in the hood.<br>Am I going back, no. I just wanted to cross it off my list.

Their menu is like bible!!! Always can find different things to try. Service is very good. Oreo milkshake it&#39;s fantastic but I could finish it all because it&#39;s too sweet. Fish tacos was little bit spicy but it&#39;s on my opinion. Velvet red cake melting on tongue. Every time when I come back discover more yummy meals.

I mean, it&#39;s a chain restaurant. Having said that, there are a few things that I like here (like the Tuscan Chicken) that are reliably delicious, and the menu has something that should appeal to just about anyone, which makes it good for business lunches.

Okay, so I am not a huge fan of the Cheesecake Factory so I am rating this solely on when I do go there, which is during Christmas time. My husband, family and I have been doing this for the past 8-9 years. We sit outside and have a gorgeous view of the Christmas tree and lights. They have heating lamps so it isn&#39;t too cold. The service has always been good- so they never lack there. It was extremely hard for me to find a dish that I&#39;d actually be excited to get each time I go, versus just being excited for the view/ambiance. This past time we went (last week) I have finally found a dish that I&#39;d order again and again. The Seared Ahi Tuna. Being a big fish eater, I was always concerned getting a fish dish from a place that serves so many different types of food and doesn&#39;t really specialize in any particular entree, but I am so glad I gave it a shot. It was seared perfectly. The veggies and rice were cooked perfectly. This place is a must go to during the Christmas season. I highly recommend it.

Any time I&#39;ve been here before the service and food has been exceptional. Not tonight. <br>I ordered a rib eye medium rare. Definitely smaller than I remember. It came medium well with one of the wrong sides. After being told that the service manager had been notified I assumed, incorrectly, that I&#39;d be getting a visit from him (Ricky), and that he&#39;d do something to make it right. My usual experience with managers here in the past, if there was ever a problem with the food or wait. Ricky never showed. I had to wait quite some additional time until a second scrawny steak, correctly cooked this time, and shriveled sides, showed up. After my meal and drinks there was still no visit from the manager I had to request his presence. When he showed he was apologetic but no offers to comp the meal or go above and beyond to make the customer happy. Service at the Cheesecake Factory Glendale not what it once was. Shame. I used to like coming here. I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll bother coming back.

Worse place to dine at the Americana. My wife and I stopped in last night after shopping and let me tell you, the management team is weak therefore the service is weak. <br><br>1. After waiting about 45mins for a table for 2, the host walks us over to our table. Well the busier was still clearing it off, so the host says as soon as he&#39;s done you can sit then walks away. So my wife and I are standing around between other families and their tables looking foolish. <br><br>2. We were seated for about 4 to 5 minutes before our server stopped by. When he did stop by he simply slid a basket of bread onto the table and walked away. Then the host returned with menus. <br><br>3. After another 5 minutes after that the server comes back by drops off water and says I&#39;ll be back. <br><br>4. Another 3 minutes the server returned and says &#34;do y&#39;all want drinks?&#34; (Clearly this behavior is signed off on by his management team, since he believes when dealing in customer service/ hospitality you should probably introduce yourself)<br><br>So my wife orders a drink then he looks at me and says nothing but just gives a blank look. So I said &#34;water is fine, I&#39;m ready to order&#34;. <br><br>We place our order and almost 15 minutes later (I had my phone out and was timing him at this point) my wife&#39;s drink comes. He drops the drink off and never returned. <br><br>I see him taking with some girls in the bar so I flag him down like I&#39;m directing traffic. He comes over and says &#34;what&#39;s up&#34; (I guess we&#39;re homies now). So I asked for the check, at this point we&#39;ve been setting for about 40 minutes. He give my check to the manager (again didn&#39;t introduce herself). <br><br>So give a quick summary to the manager. She quickly offers free cheesecake. I declined and told her, I simply want to pay my check and leave. <br><br>As I&#39;m waiting for my card, the server shows up with the food and looking confused. So I had to tell him &#34;no thank you, we&#39;re done here&#34;. <br><br>Walked across the courtyard over to Katsuya and had a much better experience and time with my wife. I went from BBQ Pizza to Sushi. Not what I was craving but when I&#39;m paying for a service that what I expect simple, polite service. I understand we all have to wait, that&#39;s not the issue. The issue here was Service, Etiquette, Hospitality, and Professionalism! My wife and I got none of that. <br><br>We won&#39;t be back!

Great food as always. Grant H. was our server, the man did a fantastic job. Not only is he skilled in what he does, but he has a great personality. We would happily return to the restaurant even if just for his service again!

Brian was the worst server ever..did not come to our table and repeatedly being told to wait...the food was dry and the manager did not fix the situation.we spent $300 bucks on horrible food. My family and I will never come here again and my mom live walking distance to Americana and we received rude service will never come here again

The brunch here on the weekend is worth it alone. In the midst of the busy Americans, Cheesecake Factory never disappoints. With my family in town for the holidays, I chose this place as a great place for brunch while also viewing the great Christmas lights of the Americana. This was a Christmas Eve, so the expectation was it was going to be very busy. However, thinking ahead and coming early as Brunch started was good thinking. We waited for around 5 mins, and was promptly seated. Our server Omar was very attentive and catered to one of our party food allergies very well. I ordered the beautiful Bruleed French Toast with bacon! Oh man this was a gorgeously tasty dish, especially after being drenched in maple syrup. To top it all off, I got myself a Bloody Mary! I love dining here and never have any issue with service. I will make this a staple for brunch in the future.

2-18-18 @ 3:30pmish <br><br>Went to this particular Cheesecake Factory after spending the day at the Zoo. Was looking forward to a delicious meal. <br><br>The three of us placed our order when we ordered our drinks. <br><br>Bread and drinks came out and were delicious. Pretty much nothing better than warm fresh bread.<br><br>About 15 minutes later two of our meals came out with the promise that my miso salmon was going to be ready in a few minutes. No biggie. I could wait a few more minutes. <br><br>Over the next 20 minutes we were told three times that it would just be a few more minutes. One finished their meal (it would&#39;ve been awful had it gotten cold and it would not have been reheat-able) while the other was waiting till I got mine, their food getting cold. <br><br>At the 30 minute mark we spoke with the manager who said he didn&#39;t know what was going on as he had just started his shift (he was there when we were seated). <br><br>Instead of comping our entire ticket, the manager only comped two of the three entrées, and none of the drinks. He did offer a free piece of cheesecake but it was really too little too late. <br><br>I realize that the waiter had no control of the kitchen. What he should have done is apologize and get it taken care of. Instead, what he did was say he did what he was supposed to do but that it was someone else&#39;s fault. You work as a team. When one of you fails, you all fail. There is no excuse for throwing someone else under the bus to try to protect yourself. It made the waiter appear unwilling to take responsibility. Honestly, we had no issue with the waiter until he said this. <br><br>There is just no excuse for bringing out two meals before the third was ready. It was actually 45 minutes from time of order to me actually receiving my food to go. This tells me that it had never been made to start with. <br><br>This lack of service is unacceptable for a restaurant chain of this size.

One of my Favorite Places for Dessert! I don&#39;t eat the food much.<br><br>It says it all in the name, but many places don&#39;t live up to their name. The Cheesecake Factory consistently delivers! Their menu is pretty good, but what I really love is their cheesecake! I like their holiday flavors..especially the pumpkin! <br><br>All of them are very good and warning: often heavy. <br><br>Overview: I really like their desserts, specifically chessecake and would recommend this to a friend visiting from out of town who has never been for dessert. <br><br>I&#39;m a fellow traveler so I appreciate when other people have given me tips/recommendations while in a new city. If this information is helpful, please let me know by hitting the like button. Even if this review helps only one traveler then it&#39;s worth it to know I&#39;m contributing towards making someone&#39;s experience better, giving to the global community, and paying it forward. Safe Travels!

Saturday night at 5pm place is packed! My wife and I roll up, walk to the bar.. two bar stools are empty right on the corner. The bartenders were attentive and polite! Food was fresh and delicious! In and out of there in 30 mins.. everything was running tip top! My wife even picked up the bill! My kinda Saturday Night!

To start off, I love going to Cheesecake Factory, Especially my local restaurant in Cerritos. We decided to go to the one located at The Americana, we got to the hostesses and put in our name for 2 adults and it was a 75 min wait. We decided to walk around The Americana and waited for our table, but we ended up only waiting about 40 mins for our table. We got sat and our server came within the first 5 mins since he was going to have 2 separate tables at the same time. We were sat down before another couple next to us and they had their orders taken, drinks and food brought to them before us. We didn&#39;t mind until our server never came to check up on us not one single time. He came only to serve our food and once at the end to pick up our empty plates and he still didn&#39;t ask if we needed anything or offered anything else. We asked for the check and box for our leftover flatbread pizza, he took the plate to seem as if he was box it for us, but he he never brought it back. After paying we asked if he was going to bring us our leftover food, to find out that he threw it away. We then went to the cheesecake window to get two slices to go, we pay and wait for our slices. A couple in back of us ordered two slices as well and got them right away before us, we had to ask the workers for our slices we had already ordered and payed for. In all, the wait was longer than usual, the food was great as always but the service was beyond terrible especially with the amount of staff they had that restaurant. I am definitely not returning to this Cheesecake Factory again and stick to my local cheesecake.
We were seated fast. Our waiter was nice .Drinks , appetizer and entries came fast. Delicious Baja chicken tacos. We were impressed. Thanks.

I have to start off by saying they have one of the best menus I&#39;ve ever seen! Like literally, it&#39;s a long menu and you have soooo many options. Also, leave room for dessert because you ARE at the Cheesecake Factory so it&#39;s a must. You have to try the avocado egg rolls they are delicious! The only thing that sucks about this place is that the wait is always long. The bread they start you off with is so good too by the way.

I&#39;m a huge fan of The Cheesecake Factory, especially when it&#39;s located in a such a prominent location at The Americana --that definitely adds to the eating experience here. The boyfriend and I decided to come here for a late lunch after shopping at 3pm. It was very crowded and there was half an hour wait. We decided to seat outside because it was such a beautiful day and we had a great view of the fountain. Our server, Simon was wonderful and quick to refill our drinks and meet our requests.<br><br>We decided to share the Louisiana Chicken Pasta ($13.50) for the lunch special. Despite the dish being a smaller lunch portion, it was still plentiful. This is my absolute favorite pasta ever. The creamy sauce covering the bowtie pastas is delicious. Also, it&#39;s topped with sauteed mushrooms and chopped bell peppers. The best part is their crunchy, fried chicken on top of the pasta that&#39;s just splendid. I&#39;m also a huge lover of cheese if you haven&#39;t noticed yet, so I definitely had the waiter spend a couple of minutes covering my pasta with parmesan cheese. My pasta was basically covered with snow! To pair with the pasta, the complimentary bread is great with anything with a sauce-base. I especially enjoy their honey oat bread, which is what I crave most from The Cheesecake Factory. To end our meal, we shared the White Chocolate Macadamia Caramel Cheesecake ($7.95). I was a little disappointed with the cheesecake as the nuts were too much for me and lacked a true cheesecake texture. I&#39;d be surprise if you didn&#39;t go home with leftovers from here as to why we shared our meals. It was more than enough for the two of us, which left us in a food coma right after.<br><br>Make sure to not eat then shop, but to shop then eat!

Yay! You guys have the Impossible Burger. Sooooooo good! I am not vegan nor vegetarian. I still eat fish BUT no beef for 2 years now. <br><br>The IB is delish. Worth every penny. I can&#39;t finish it so I take the rest home or half with my partner. Your salad with greens is also worth getting. <br><br>Thank you for keeping your costs down and waste to a minimum by letting us use our stainless steel containers for leftovers. <br>I will give you a 5 star once you guys stop using plastic cups and straws and once you can really prioritize the use of less one time use containers. <br><br>Encourage your customers to think about conservation and you&#39;ll have to buy less stuff. Win win.

This is a good sized Cheesecake, but because it&#39;s at the Americana, it&#39;s always packed! If you think you&#39;re going to get a seat in under an hour, you&#39;re probably going to be disappointed.<br><br>However, once you do have your seat, service and food is on par just like all the other locations. <br><br>Oh, but just note that they don&#39;t put the price of their mixed drinks. Most of them cost $11.50. Keep that in mind.

My friend and I were really hungry! Usually we never have a problem here, however, today service was so bad!! Our waiter didn&#39;t take our order right &amp; they did not even refill our drinks. We had to constantly call another waiter to help us because ours was no where to be found. I&#39;m very disappointed, never expected this type of service.<br><br>We waited 15 minutes to sit.<br>We waited an hour for our food to arrive.<br>And we waited 15 minutes for our new order.<br>AND we waited another 15 minutes for our check..

we had the opportunity to go to dinner without the kids.  if you have kids, you&#39;ll understand. <br>we got seated quickly and it was a bit of a wait getting drinks but it&#39;s the cheesecake factory. <br>the waitstaff was well informed of their novella sized menu.  once all questions were answered, mostly since i have a food allergy, we ordered. a salad and entrees. and our waitress asked if we wanted it in any order.  we wanted the salad first. ok she went off with out order. after a while our entrees showed up and no salad. once we started to eat, of course the salad showed up. Since waitstaff don&#39;t bring out food, i informed our waitress.  not that big of a deal.  once we were almost done we wanted to order food to go, remember, we were without the kids. so we ordered 2 entries and dessert. we waited and waited. finally the togo showed up.  one entree and nothing else. well our waitress dropped it off and disappeared. we had to wait until she slowed up to ask for the rest of the order.  she looked amazed...she didn&#39;t write it down and she forgot.  and acted as if we should be satisfied with what we got. we told her we needed it all. although she said she would &#34;expedite&#34; the order and get it taken off the bill for her mistake, it took quite a while.  and the first entree was already now cold.  when it finally arrived, she took the check and recalculated the bill. adding what she said she would comp.  <br>looking at the new bill she added with another check, this one wasn&#39;t itemize so i wasn&#39;t sure what i was paying for.   no apology, no manager, no nothing.  needless to say our dinner alone was a nightmare. i signed the bill and we left, probably never to come back...ever.

Mothers Day has to be a hectic seen at any restaurant you go to. Took my mom to this CCF location because its near our home. We didn&#39;t wait no longer than 10 minutes to be seated, amazingly. Our server, Kelsie, was so sweet and hospitable, as if we were her family. As busy as it was, she never showed any frustration or any sort of discomfort with us. She always got us what we needed. <br>Overall, we had a wonderful experience. The food was great and of course our service was terrific.
Really upsetting to give one star review on this place since I really do love their food but waited 40 minutes and no one came to our table, not even to take our drink order.

As a vegetarian I order the avocado egg rolls , Korean fried cauliflower, guac and chips spicy, and the impossible burger. The avocado rolls with the sauce it comes with is a must try and is always hot. Flavor is exceptional and is the perfect appetizer. The cauliflower is always tasty due to the sauce and has a nice crunch to it. Guac and chips has a good amount of dip which I really appreciate. The impossible burger is my top 10 of impossible burgers , well done and toppings inside of it really do it justice. Though somethings I just the patty itself.

I don&#39;t even know where to begin??????!!! 2 hours to bring out a simple shrimp scampi. We went in at 7 and placed an order to share. Thank goodness they brought the kids food out in time. Chipotle pasta came out dry, was sent back and came an hour later remade. Salmon crusted never came out, shrimp scampi came out without the sauce, went back and came back 2 hours later. What a disaster??!!! My guests left without eating and extremely upset. I&#39;m so embarrassed that I invited l people to dine here. I&#39;m a frequent visitor to the Americana and this cheesecake but will no longer dine here again.

My wife and I came here for lunch on Easter. They place wasn&#39;t very crowded and we were seated immediately. The staff was friendly. <br><br>However, the bowls glasses and cutlery were dirty and they all stink of old egg yolk. Smell was so bad it was nauseating and were not able to finish our meal. We got our meal to go and left.<br><br>The food wasn&#39;t that bad. In fact the stuffed mushrooms were made very well. But, if I can&#39;t eat a restaurant without feeling sick due to the cleanliness of the place, I cannot recommend it.

Maybe because it was a Friday night...the service was pretty bad. There was a wait so I requested that my name be added to the waiting list. After about 30-40 minutes I got the text that a table was ready. We were seated outside, and the waiter pretty much ignored us. <br><br>I&#39;ve been to the Cheesecake Factory many times all over California, so of course the food is always consistent. Just not the service. <br><br>The still have the best calamari around. My entree was the Egg Plant Parmesan. Amazing as always. With an iced tea. <br><br>If the service was good. This was have been a 5 star review.
Saturday brunch was solid. Our service was good and efficient. Cheese artichoke dip and avocado egg rolls were delicious. Omelette was perfectly done, not overlooked, which I hate.

Disclaimer: We only came here because we had a gift card.<br><br>Always packed! In the Americana. Always a long wait for a table but you can get a number and walk around the Americana. They&#39;ll text you when table is ready. They have indoor and outdoor seating.<br><br>Generous portion of complimentary bread. Butter made it better. You can choose between sourdough or wheat but if you don&#39;t mention it, they&#39;ll bring whatever is available. <br><br>No vegetarian menu and only a few veg options on the &#34;skinny&#34; menu but what we ordered was good. I had the Asian lettuce wraps and margarita flatbread. Both were good. The flatbread was thin and crispy - perfect! I would have liked it with less cheese though.<br><br>Service was great. We asked for the chicken on the side for the Asian lettuce wraps and they did that for us. We also asked for a side of marinara for the pizza crust and they brought it out piping hot! <br><br>I probably wouldn&#39;t come here again because of the shortage of vegetarian items but it was still an unexpectedly good experience!

Tamara&#39;s actions lead me to believe that she&#39;s a novice manager. I&#39;m definitely disappointed with my experience here, tonight. I used to frequent this location. However, after tonight&#39;s experience, I don&#39;t know that I&#39;ll be coming back anytime real soon. Unfortunate. The dish that I ordered was supposed to come with both pasta and chicken.  The chicken was to be breaded after it was pounded to death, to make it thin and easy to cook. Anyway, the chicken was presented to me in pieces, looking like someone had taken it possibly to a different table, it being cut into and then taking it back to bring it to my table.  Anyway, it was definitely not what I&#39;d received in previous visits.  I explained to the manager that the plating alone made it very unappetizing.  So, she offered to take it back and to have a new one made.  I said that would be OK.  After a few moments, she brought my dish back to me and showed me that it was OK and that I was basically sending back a dish that was perfectly fine.  Why would you do that? I told you that I was disgusted by the appearance of the dish and yet you bring it back to me. Why? To say that I was wrong and throw it in my face? Not cool!  This was not the best performance from this particular manager.  You don&#39;t bring the dish back and try and prove to the customer that the manager or kitchen staff were right, and not you.  It took forever for my replacement to come and just before it did, I told them to forget my order and just remove it from my bill.  By the time that I&#39;d just finished saying that, the dish appeared behind the manager.  I told them I still didn&#39;t want it and that my experience there had just been miserable and embarrassing even.  I don&#39;t appreciate behavior like that. So, I told them to take the dish off my bill and to forget it. I was no longer in the mood to eat there. The manager refused. I told them that I would NOT be paying for something that had been ill prepared and that I never ate. I NEVER took a bit from the first plate or the 2nd one that FINALLY came along. I eventually was able to speak to their GM.  They had the dish removed immediately without my really having to go through the re-cap of my horrible experience. They even offered me a complimentary dessert for that night or a future night. Whatever. That didn&#39;t make it OK. I&#39;m still NOT a happy camper!  I haven&#39;t been back since early this year, February 2017.

Mediocre Cheesecake Factory experience. Decent service pedestrian food. The apps fried zucchini and the ahi tuna &#34;tartare&#34; tasty but very small to be considered shareables. The bow tie and pea  pasta we had was very boring. Very under seasoned. Cream veggies and chicken. Everything seemed like it was just thrown together and boiled in cream. The fresh bread and butter was the highlight of the meal. Please try harder Cheesecake Factory your cooks shouldn&#39;t be to shy to season their food.

The Cheesecake Factory is always a consistent and delicious meal.  I came here for lunch last week, and it was really good.  The lunch portions are perfect for a lunch-time meal, and the food was great.  I had a Spicy Chipotle Chicken Pasta, and I would for sure get it again.  Just thinking about it actually puts me in the mood for it again.  Followed by some Cheesecake and coffee, it was a perfect lunch.<br><br>Everytime I go to Cheesecake Factory, I ask myself why I don&#39;t go more often.  Hopefully that will change, and I make it a more frequent destination.
One of the best New York steak .Tasty and big.The same one of the best salad is chicken mango salad.The waiter was Briana I think soo.She was very professional .

Cheesecake factory is perfect for a time when you don&#39;t know what to eat. They have everything and anything on the menu. Let me start off by saying the bread they bring out in the beginning is super tasty. Especially the brown one! All their food is good. From pizzas, pastas, to salads. I love the four cheese pasta. Super delicious and flavorful. The chicken tequila pasta is also extremely creamy and delicious. The Luau (I believe is how you spell it) salad is incredible!!!! You MUST try that when you go there. It&#39;s an amazing sweet Chinese dressing with chips and all these good vegetables in there. Also, the fish tacos! They have a huge menu with pages and pages of food, you&#39;ll find something!<br><br>This particular one is a beautiful location in the middle of the mall so you have a lot to do before and after you eat. The only problem I have with this branch specifically is the wait. It really is just too long. The problem is not even necessarily the level of busyness, it&#39;s the way they handle it. I would see 6-7 tables empty at a time waiting to seat people for 10-20 minutes. Tables should not be left empty when there is a line out the door. Service isn&#39;t that great when they get too busy, but it&#39;s still decent. <br><br>To end your meal, they have of course their amazing cheesecake. I like the original, strawberry, or the oreo one. Those are my favorites.

So happy they added super food to their menu! <br>It would&#39;ve been better if they disclosed the calories though. Tried two salads from the superfoods section. Forgot the name but one was like a Mediterranean salad and the other was mexican inspired salad. Dressing for both salad was thick and heavy. So glad i got the dressing on the side. I also like items on their skinnylicious menu!

We waited almost 2 hrs to get seated, because the pager they gave us ran out of power.  They then sat us down right next to the outside door. It was heavy with servers going in and out. The door would stay totally open.  The cold draft would hit me and my companions.  It was a very cold night.  As we got our food my fries were cold.  They were kind enough to replace. Each server changed the speed of the closing door... then the door just stayed open.  The cold draft soon turned into a cold breeze.  I stood in front of the door and asked three different servers, and they did nothing.  Finally I had to get livid with one server who got the same manager to finally close he door.

I&#39;ve been here several times and though I enjoy the food and appreciate that this location has a Happy Hour, I&#39;m irritated that the ladies room is always a mess. Today I had to report this to the three hostesses on duty and they all seemed to be also irritated by the news. Or by me. I don&#39;t know. I got a snotty reply that was unfriendly. I followed up my news with 2 of the stalls don&#39;t have toilet tissue to encourage their sense of urgency. <br><br>I find it difficult to enjoy my food when I&#39;ve &#34;visited&#34; a restroom that appears highly neglected. I&#39;m under the assumption that all of the staff are using the same restroom that I just endured. So if they haven&#39;t felt the need to have housekeeping take care of it, they must think it&#39;s clean or acceptable for customers. Thus, I get concerned with cleanliness everywhere else. <br><br>That&#39;s all.

I came in with the family one weekday Summer afternoon. It was still pretty packed so I was kinda surprised. But I suppose it is in Americana at Brand so it&#39;s usually pretty busy, regardless of the day.<br><br>The food was good, surprisingly good, and the service was good too. Plus they validate parking. I was happy with all of that. But I do have a somewhat minor, and somewhat major gripe. Firstly, am I the only one who is irritated by the superfluous advertisements on the damn menu? What is that? Is Cheesecake Factory going out of business? Do they need to have all those advertisements for the income? It was sad. I haven&#39;t seen so many advertisements since the last time I clicked on an inappropriate website and was bombarded with pop ups. Not cool.<br><br>My major gripe is that their suggested tips on the receipts are based off the total bill, not the subtotal like it&#39;s supposed to be. To me, that&#39;s a sneaky, dishonest, devious way of doing business and I don&#39;t like it. Makes me wonder what else they are doing. Although I was happy about most of my experience, I  won&#39;t be rushing back.
Yummy breakfast. Brûlée French toast. Pancakes, eggs, bacon. Very good food. Complimentary bread and butter.

We were quoted 30 mins and were sat in 10 mins, which rocked! Our server was amazing! She took our order in a timely manner, our appetizers came out as fast as it took her to get our drinks and bread. The food came at the perfect time after the appetizers and she remembered to bring extra plates. This place really has their business together. Had an excellent experience from the minute we walked in to the minute we walked out. Visited on 9/9/18 at the peak of dinner time. I wish I remembered our servers name.<br><br>The food was amazing! Had the Loaded Baked Potato Tots from the Small Plates &amp; Snacks menu. They were perfection and were paired perfectly with Sour Cream and Sriracha Mayo. It was a pretty nice serving size for the price. We also had the Factory Combination of Chicken Madeira and Steak Diane. The chicken Madeira was so flavorful and delicious. The Steak Diane was a little red for ordering medium but had great flavor.

My family went last night, the food was decent but the entire point of going was to celebrate my uncles birthday, who actually loves this place. The waiter was informed of the occasion but didn&#39;t seem to care when she was told and no one came back or even mentioned the request which is  very disappointing. Especially when there were other parties who were in the exact area of the restaurant who had their birthdays being acknowledged by the staff...I&#39;m not sure what the issue here was or if it was due to being men of color that they were not acknowledged the same way but we will go elsewhere from now on.

The food is alright and the service is very hit or miss. I&#39;ve been coming here for years because it&#39;s an easy place to eat at the Americana with friends/family, since they have every type of food on the menu imaginable. <br><br>At my last visit, our server was great. Her name was Kelly B and she was very sweet, attentive, and overall one of the better servers that I have had while eating at this location. <br><br>Of all the things I have eaten at Cheesecake, I will say one item on the menu sticks out to me and I get it almost every time. That is the dressing on the Santa Fe Salad (it is a Peanut-Cilantro Vinaigrette). It is very delicious and I typically ask for that dressing on almost any salad I order. Definitely recommend that dressing. <br><br>One of the biggest problems I have had at Cheesecake Factory is when I adjust the specifications of a dish, it typically comes out wrong. I have no idea why? I find it hard to believe it&#39;s the servers putting in the wrong order every time (that would be just too coincidental). I like to think it&#39;s miscommunication either in the kitchen or with the expo/food runners. Whatever it is, I always expect my order to come out wrong if I change it up from what the menu has, so I pretty much try my best to either keep it very simple or just find an entree that doesn&#39;t need any adjustments. For example, I gave up on ordering a burger with the exact ingredients that I like. It&#39;s like the chef&#39;s take a look at my burger order and say &#34;well, that&#39;s cute, but I think he&#39;ll like this instead.&#34; Nah... I just want my burger the way I asked please. <br><br>Overall, the Cheesecake Factory can be a very hit or miss place with both food and service. The upside to the restaurant is that the menu is gigantic, so it&#39;s perfect for a group of people who want different foods. It&#39;s a nearly impossible feat to find somebody that wouldn&#39;t like anything on the menu. I will probably always be dragged back here by friends/family just because the convenience of the large menu, but in reality, the Americana has so many better restaurants (in my opinion).

This place used to be amazing, but I ordered some food to go tonight and the whole experience was awful. The guy at the to go counter was very rude and said very sarcastic remarks. The garlic cheese toast tasted like a burnt grill and was gross. The chicken piccata was bland. And the normal bread they added was rock hard and uneatable. It&#39;s frustrating to pay that much just to get bad service and bad food. Definitely won&#39;t go back or advise anyone to go here.

I always go to the Cheesecake Factory in Arcadia but today I decided to visit The Americana. Originally, my sister and I were going to have dinner at BACARI. But after half an hour of debating, we ended up going to Cheesecake Factory and I DEFINITELY REGRET it. We came at 3pm on a Saturday. There were 3 Hosts in the front. I immediately said Hello as we walked in. One of the hosts looked at me then looked away and chatted with the other two for a good minute. I was so confused! Was he blind? Did he really just ignore me? The two girls also did not acknowledge me and my sister. Finally, they took our name down (only waited for 5 mins for a table so yay) I brushed it off and told myself &#34;Maybe our server will be nice&#34; <br><br>When we got to our table, there was NO high chair like requested. Host also told us to leave our stroller in the front once we got there. Uhm?? Why couldn&#39;t you have told us that before we sat down. I&#39;m not about to walk back to the front so we decided to leave it next to us. (WE NEVER GOT THE HIGH CHAIR UNTIL WE WERE ALMOST DONE EATING BTW)<br><br>Fast forward - our server didn&#39;t greet us for the first 10 mins or it seemed like. Also, he never checked up on us once we received our food. If he did, he would have known my sister never got parmesan cheese on her pasta because the lady that delivered it who was wearing a black dress clearly forgot. (Manager?) He also would known that we needed more napkins because my daughter spilled her water on the table. We cleaned it up ourselves which I don&#39;t mind at all. But @ least give us new napkins! I don&#39;t know how &#34;busy&#34; our server really was because he had enough time to check up on our neighbors. <br><br>Finally, my sister had enough so she complained to him. He was not apologetic AT ALL. It seemed like he ignored us even more after that. But we didn&#39;t let it bother us so we just continued to eat. Then we asked for our check and guess what? He made us wait toooo long for it. I had to stand up and look for him because my daughter was crying already. Such an unpleasant experience! I don&#39;t know if there was some sort of misunderstanding? Maybe he didn&#39;t mean to provide horrible service? He should know now since I wrote it on the receipt. I understand The Americana can have demanding cliente in general but my sister and I were in no way &#34;demanding&#34;. We just wanted to eat. Why is it always the nice customers that get shitty service? Maybe next time I have to be mean to get help/what I need. JUST KIDDING! but on a serious note, I WILL NEVER RETURN. Plenty of restaurants at the Americana anyways! <br><br>PS: my sister also wrote a feedback on their website.

I love this restaurant.<br>Great portions.<br>Nice and friendly staffs.<br>Beautiful decor.<br>Jamaican or Cajun black bean shrimp is my favorite.<br>The drinks are awesome too.<br>Will definitely go back and also recommend to all my friends.

please don&#39;t listen to the bad reviews. This is one of my favorite restaurants not only for the delicious foods but for the customer service. All the servants here are so kind and caring. I will never forget the time I brought my boyfriend here for his birthday. They celebrated him by giving him ice cream and singing him happy birthday and right when we were leaving the employees that sang to him were wishing him a happy birthday. Like these people don&#39;t even know my boyfriend and they treated him like if they did lol

I want to start off saying Cheesecake Factory WAS my favorite restaurant until I went to this location tonight. First off as I entered the restaurant the hostess&#39; were talking to each other, looked at my sister and I and stared at us until we said &#34;hello&#34; <br>Then one of the guys didn&#39;t say one word and just stared at the table until we sat down.. handed our menus and left.. not even a greeting or anything! <br>The waitress was nice.. the food was not good! Mashed potatoes were way over cooked.. the portions were really small.. the reason I loved Cheesecake Factory was because of the huge portions!
