I love their individual cheesecake. It&#39;s so creamy and soft! <br><br>BUH FUC NEVER EVER BUY THE 7-inch cheesecake $25 <br><br>They gave me a cheesecake fresh from a freezer.. i tried eating it, and it&#39;s hard. I could also feel the ice texture.. so not worth it. I was really craving it, but they just gave me a left over hard ugly cheesecake.. i should have known since the box they gave me had scratches.. i&#39;m so sad... i&#39;m really sad

Do I really have to wait until I leave to post this.<br>I&#39;m afraid to order.  First the people in the front told us we were lying about what time we got here.  Then we sit down after 65 minutes when initially promised 30-40. And now this ..... really?

I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory sooooo many times and tried most of their dishes. One of my favs is the Louisiana chicken pasta and the other is the club sandwich. Both very yummy and worth to try. However, they don&#39;t take reservations which is very annoying. Another thing is that if you go here expect to wait for 30 minutes. They take forever to bring out your dish and that&#39;s the only thing I dislike about them! The wait! Overall I love the place but it&#39;s very irritating to wait for so long when you&#39;re starving . <br>But they do deserve 4 stars for their food and customer service!:)

This is the first Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been to in such a long time. I went on a Sunday night and packed! it was about a 40 minute wait (which wasn&#39;t bad). The bread and butter was delicious and fresh. My boyfriend ordered the catfish (it was pretty good but a bit greasy). I ordered the chucked mushroom pasta which was decent at best. The waiter was kind and attentive.

As a regular, I know how busy it can get on the weekends especially on Sundays. But here is one of my lowest experiences dining here.<br><br>Wait time was short, surprisingly. 15-20 minutes for a table of 3. We followed the hostess to our table and was seated, then assuming our waitress comes and already asks for our drinks without giving us some time. Didn&#39;t give us a name, which would of been nice. <br><br>While looking at the menu she comes back and takes our drink orders. Comes back with them and see if we&#39;re ready to order. My little brother already knew his order so he ordered first while we continued to look at the menu. Suddenly another waiter comes and doesn&#39;t introduce us, neither does the first waitress informs our new waiter. Anyway, he came in sounding like he just wants us to order already so we did.<br><br>As time went by, we noticed everyone else receiving the complimentary bread that is usually served while we wait for our food but this time around we had to ask one of the waiters/waitresses if we can have some. My brother then receives his brunch combo, I&#39;d give it a 9/10 because the waffles the substituted were spot on. My mother and I split a Kobe Burger, it was cooked the way we wanted it with sweet potato fries so I&#39;d give it 9.5/10.<br><br>Overall, I gave them a 3/5 mainly due to the service. First of all, we had a waitress at first then a waiter and never got informed their name. Second, neither asked if we needed anything else as for condiments or more water. Lastly, neither one came to our table after we received our food to see how it is. Of course, we always come here for the amazing food and I hope to have a better experience with their customer service.

What happened to the consistency of the dishes? Hmmm.... so disappointed during our last stop at this perfectly located Cheesecake... <br><br>The line is always long, especially on a Saturday, so we did the bar. BUT what a disappointing meal(s)... The chicken quesadilla seemed like it was microwaved with no tact in wrapping or presenting it... my green garden salad was OK but again the chicken looked like it was still frozen and not grilled at all... <br><br>My drink was almost lemon-y with no Bacardi in it - just like Coke and lemon~! The bartenders were more interested in talking to each other, rather than socializing somewhat with the guests, - usually that&#39;s why people sit at the bar, right? Open to &#34;hi what&#39;s going on, busy night or something...&#34; <br><br>The grilled artichokes were good... but that&#39;s it. I love going to this Cheesecake... but they gotta up their game. The experience was like, &#34;here you go, drink, eat and leave.&#34;

The Cheesecake Factory is the place I dreamt of dinning when I was a little girl, it&#39;s named after a cake, has a menu that reads like a story book and turns cheeseburgers into egg rolls. I go here when I want slow service and a waiter that tells me about their recent trip to Cancun,  a blended margarita and an order of 90&#39;s tuna tartar and an oversized portion of chicken tenders with mounds of fries. Oh, must I not forget their sweet wheat bread with butter while we wait for our meal amongst tables of grandma&#39;s 70th birthday and step dad&#39;s retirement dinner. This place is perfectly American and a delicious spectacle to me. I love it here.

You can&#39;t go wrong with The Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>THE AMBIANCE:<br><br>This is my most frequented location. The restaurant is clean, spacious, and has high ceilings. I tend to sit at the bar and there is ample room to enjoy a meal.<br><br>THE FOOD:<br><br>The Cheesecake Factory starts you off with a complimentary basket of warm white and wheat bread. The wheat bread (brown) is to die for and I usually request that we get a basket of all wheat bread because I don&#39;t like wasting food and the white bread rarely gets eaten. That is how good the brown wheat bread is. <br><br>My favorite appetizers are the Ahi Carpaccio (Thin Slices of Raw Ahi Tuna, Wasabi Pesto, Creamy Avocado and Togarashi Aioli), and Crispy Crab Wontons (Crabmeat Blended with Cream Cheese, Green Onion, Water Chestnuts, and Sweet Chili Sauce Fried Crisp in Wonton Wrappers). The Ahi Carpaccio I can eat sometimes as my lunch entree if I am not that hungry because I always eat a lot of bread and butter at the beginning *guilty* It is soooo good. I usually ask for light wasabi pesto. The Togarashi Aoili on the side is beyond delicious. You just want to drink it. The Crispy Crab Wontons are so good and so fattening but I don&#39;t care. I would literally eat them all if someone else wasn&#39;t picking at the plate. <br><br>My favorite entrees are: Chicken Madeira (Sautéed Chicken Breast Topped with Fresh Asparagus and Melted Mozzarella Cheese, Covered with Fresh Mushroom Madeira Sauce and Served with Mashed Potatoes), Miso Salmon (Fresh Miso Marinated Salmon Served with Snow Peas, White Rice (make it brown rice!!) and Miso Sauce), and the Chicken Di Pana (Lightly Breaded Sauteed Chicken Breast Served over a White Wine Butter Sauce with Mashed Potatoes and Broccoli). <br><br>The only plate I tried and didn&#39;t like was the Thai Lettuce Wraps (Satay Chicken Strips, Carrots, Bean Sprouts, Coconut Curry Noodles and Lettuce Leaves with three (3) Spicy Thai Sauces - Peanut, Sweet Red Chili and Tamarind-Cashew). I am a big fan of P.F. Chang&#39;s Lettuce Wraps and these lettuce wraps don&#39;t even compare. It is like night and day. I would never order them again.<br><br>My favorite cheesecake is the Key Lime! Perfection. All of their cheesecakes are on point.<br><br>THE TIPS:<br><br>Don&#39;t forget to validate your parking ticket!
Best service by Andrew J food was good but his service was better if you can request him I highly recommend him
We love to come to this restaurant n we order the same food.Food is ok but the service today is a bit slow,maybe because its holidays???

It&#39;s all about their salads! I love getting their entree salads. It&#39;s not cheap. However, as an entree, it&#39;s well priced. Average is $15 - $15.50. I&#39;ve tried most of their salads. My favorite 2 are the Luau Salad and the Santa Fe Salad. You get a large/huge portion with meat (usually grilled chicken). They are absolutely delicious. <br><br>Their salad dressings are so good! I especially like the spicy peanut-cilantro vinaigrette which comes on the Santa Fe Salad. It has a nice kick to it. <br><br>I&#39;ve had takeout salads from here. Their takeout containers are large sturdy plastic containers. Takeout portions are the same as eating in. Unlike CPK, their takeout salad portions are so much smaller than eating in that it&#39;s not worth it. <br><br>If you ever feel like having a nice entree salad, head over to The Cheesecake Factory.

There was absolutely no connection with our server this afternoon. She never cracked a smile throughout our visit and the anxiety displayed by her was marked. We had to ask for water, bread, and beverage refills. We had to mention the celebration of a friend&#39;s birthday several times. Usually, a birthday celebration - we ordered cheesecake- is plated and has a beautiful presentation. Instead, a small ice cream Sunday was brought out, then the cheesecake slices followed. Cheesecake Factory- let&#39;s see more quality control. The survival of a business has much to do with customer service. It can make or break a business, chipping slowly but surely.  <br><br>The luau salad no longer on the menu, we opted for the Asian chicken salad, or was that Mai fun salad?  The salad was smothered with rice sticks. 3/5<br><br>Lemon pancakes- we all shared and realized mid-way that the waitress did not bring syrup!!!   Pancakes 5/5. Waitress 0<br><br>Pasta Devinci is a go to dish. 4/5, as the portion was smaller than usual<br><br>Salmon on rice. Is a favorite 5/5<br><br>Pasta with veggies. 3/5. Pass on this dish. <br><br>The stoic waitress made it very uncomfortable for all, thus, 2 stars.
Waited over an hour for party of two, food was undercooked, table and utensils were dirty, all of that for price of a high end restaurant.

Every time I come here ( this is the 3rd time), it gets a little worse. Despite what the Cheesecake Factory Guest Relations person wrote after my last review, this is not an isolated experience. It&#39;s been 8 months and it&#39;s just as 2-star as it was back in January.<br><br>I sat at the bar, which was completely empty. I ordered a Greek salad and the bartender walked away. I had to flag him down to order the rest of my meal. The salad came promptly but for some reason had kernels of corn at the bottom of it. At first, I didn&#39;t know what it was and was almost feeling sick because there were dried yellow particles in it. I realized it was corn and felt slightly better but - gross. I asked the bartender about it, he said, &#34;wow. That shouldn&#39;t be there&#34; and walked away. I asked to speak to the manager who was apologetic and accommodating. He said, &#34;it just falls into the salads sometimes&#34;. I asked if he&#39;d take half off of the salad, since I&#39;d eaten half before I saw the corn. He took my check &amp; said he&#39;d be back.<br><br>20 mins later I asked the bartender if he knew where my check was. He said he&#39;d ask the manager but eventually just reprinted it, the manager had removed the salad. That was nice, and above what I requested, but to not come back and to keep me waiting so long was a bit.... crappy. <br><br>I can see how corn ends up in salads if the GM doesn&#39;t have the customer service etiquette to follow-through with the customers; there&#39;s a low standard of service set at this location and after reading other reviews I can see it&#39;s an ongoing problem here.
This place is great. one problem is the service. i feel like they just stopped caring at some point. they used to ve excellent but now they dont even bring you stuff you order. otherwise good place.

I never liked Cheesecake Factory foods, it is actually a food factory, too much oil and garlic and salt or cream would make anything taste ok, I always regret after eating there. Using their bar is ok though, they have ok small plates as snack, their old fashion is the worst I ever had, they had actual orange in it, and was tasting bitter. Anyway , maybe a straight shot is a safer bet, never a cocktail there.

Kevin G. was my server and he is the reason I always come here! The food is amazing, of course, but his customer service is consistently warm and genuine and it makes all the difference. He was prompt and answered all my questions on their long menu. Many people complain about their long wait, but it is obviously worth it for the quality food and even higher quality staff!!
Why does this location only have 3 stars? I was greeted by friendly staff, had an awesome waiter named Eric, and the food was exceptional as always.

This is the worst Cheesecake Factory. Just walked out of the restaurant. We eventually got to the table and The male hostess was extremely arrogant and rude, took us to the booth that was FILTHY!!!!! <br><br>When we said we no longer wanted to stay in that booth he started to wipe off the table and seats with the menu and asked if we still wanted to leave. <br><br>We eventually got another booth before we could get to sit down he handed us all the menus and walked off and never said a word. <br><br>This booth and restaurant was again so dirty we decided to leave. I&#39;ve never had an experience like this in a Cheesecake Factory.

First time at this location, but not the first time at Cheesecake Factory.  To sum it up, great food but average service.  It was a Friday afternoon so it was pretty busy.  I asked how long the wait and they told us 15-20 minutes.  That was fine and they use your mobile number to notify you of your seat so you can go out walking around if you want.  <br><br>Once we received the text, I went up to the counter and they told us to &#34;hold on&#34;.  It&#39;s odd because why send me the text if you aren&#39;t ready to take us.  I realize some people may have left the restaurant but it seems most hang around so when you send the text, I would think you would be ready.  We stood by and noticed many other people and some groups coming up and getting seated.  After watching about a half dozen other people get seated, we went back up to let them know we were texted about the seat.  They looked at us a little confused and it seemed as if they had given our seat away to another couple.  However, they finally took us back to a table that hadn&#39;t been cleared.  I certainly don&#39;t mind waiting for a table to be cleared because it&#39;s only a few minutes.  But the isle is so tight, we had to stand right over someone else&#39;s table and I felt bad for those people trying to eat.  <br><br>Ultimately we were seated and our server came out and took our drink orders.  When she came back with our drinks, we already knew what we wanted and placed our orders.  I had the club sandwich with a side salad.  I&#39;m a big club sandwich lover and when they delivered it, it simply looked spectacular.  Three slices of white bread with a generous portion of fresh turkey (not processed).  Lettuce, nice full strips of bacon and tomato.  Cut into quarters as is traditional and there was a small cup of fries that came with the sandwich.  I bit into the sandwich and it was SO good!  Normally I&#39;ll eat half the club sandwich and take the rest with me but this time I ate the whole sandwich it was that good.  If I were to make a comment, it would be the tomato.  They put too much tomato and they should try buying fresh tomato&#39;s from a farmers market or something because these were not quite ripe.  I pulled off the excess tomato and it was perfect.  <br><br>I had iced tea to drink and it was fresh brewed tea!  So great especially when so many other places use instant tea for their iced tea.  We decided to take some slices of the strawberry cheesecake to bring to our friends we were going to see after dining here.  Our server brought out the cheesecake slices in individual plastic containers (recyclable) with forks and napkins for each slice.  The only problem was when we finally got to where we were going, the cheesecake slices looked more like pudding!  The containers for the cheesecake slices are way too big for a single slice and they must have moved around quite a bit while driving.  The car was air conditioned so it wasn&#39;t a heat problem.  But it&#39;s shocking since the car is a luxury car and the ride was smooth.  Of course it tastes the same, but it just looked terrible when I went to give these to our friends.<br><br>If you were reading closely, you might have noticed I mentioned a side salad and yet didn&#39;t talk about it at all. That&#39;s because they never brought it and I didn&#39;t realize this until long after we had left.  But of course, they did charge us for it.  I hope our server is enjoying the 20% tip we left her!!!  She did provide good service but it was reflective of our overall service at this restaurant.  Cheesecake Factory is known for being slammed all the time at every location I&#39;ve ever visited so this isn&#39;t anything new for them.  But to forget about us after notifying us that our table is ready, taking us to a dirty table and our server forgetting the salad.  Very unsatisfactory.  The only reason I give the three stars and not lower was because the food was very good.  Our server was very friendly and for the most part, very attentive.  If it weren&#39;t for the missing salad, I would say she was perfect.  Frankly, I don&#39;t really mind so much except that I was charged for the salad and ended up paying for it.  If she had realized (which she should have) she could have taken it off the bill.  Last, I&#39;m so happy they use recyclable containers for the cheesecake, but try getting a bit smaller so the slices to move around so much and end up looking pudding when you get home.  <br><br>Good place to eat when you are shopping here and I would probably go back to a Cheesecake Factory just for the club sandwich.
They serve everything from orange chicken to hamburgers. This is code for &#34;run.&#34; Run very far away. But if you&#39;re in  the area and need a drink, they have a bar.

I don&#39;t know why this restaurant has so few stars. I really like it. At first, location is amazing. What the great view!! Secondly, it&#39;s the endless selection in the menu. And every dish i ordered was incredibly delicious and portion huge. Good service. <br>Thank you!

We see so many empty tables receptionist stated 15 minutes wait for two this happens all the time when we try to eat there. I have to complaint about this is going on for tooo long. My wifey wants to eat here.  If It&#39;s up to me they can shove this restaurant where the sun doesn&#39;t shine.  Food service is great no complaints talking about waiters n waitresses .Food is edible.  The busboy in our section moves so fast he make me dizzy his name is Max He should be in the receptionist. Not those lazy bums that are there now they looked so tired n  looked like there falling asleep.

I&#39;m a pretty patient person, but wow this particular Cheesecake Factory location is one of the worst. <br><br>The last time I was there, the service was pretty bad. Waiter completely disappeared after taking our order. Never got refills, had to ask another waiter to find our waiter to get the check. <br><br>Should have known getting a takeout order would have been just as bad. Long story short, I wanted to edit my order and was on the phone for 33 minutes before someone answered and hung up. My friend called on her phone and was put on hold, bam, another 20 minutes.<br><br>Terrible management, terrible service. Sorry, I wish I had nicer things to say.
Sitting at the bar for late lunch. The worst bartender I&#39;ve ever had here. Had I used to eat here twice a week. I think the GM Rick lost control of this place a couple of years ago!!

Good spot for a lunch break. The menu selection is huuuge, I mean really huge. However, this place is always overcrowded and the wait time is too long. I found ordering food online is a less stressful option, yet still there is no guarantee the food will arrive on time. Then I guess we all need to stay home and cook ourselves. Oh well, there is drive thru option at some places, too. The bottom line for Cheesecake Factory is that   It&#39;s better coming here during the week in the morning when no one is in there. Bon appetite. <br>Besides all the waiting time, my food was delicious this time I was here.

My server was absolutely amazing! His name is Kevin G and he literally went beyond his way to accommodate us in such a pleasing manner. He made sure we were satisfied with our food and even made conversation with my mom and I. Such a sweetheart. Definitely recommend him as a server if you guys wanna come eat in this location!

Definitely the best Cheesecake Factory around!<br><br>The decor is beautiful. And being at the gorgeous and classy Americana really adds a lot, with it&#39;s fountains, music, people, and so forth.<br><br>I&#39;ve been here many times and the service is always good, and the food is always really good. This place blows away the one in Pasadena.<br><br>The only thing I don&#39;t like is that they keep raising their prices, like at all Cheesecake Factorys. Everything on the menu is expensive, even appetizers and side orders. But I must say they usually give large portions here. Which I love. My wife and I took home our leftovers and had a second meal out of it the next day.<br><br>I only wish they would start offering organic food. That would be awesome. It&#39;s unfortunate that they don&#39;t.

Cheesecake Factory is a good default when you want to show your foreign guests to a good American meal. Watch out because the portions are enormous. We shared two pasta entrees among four people, and it was the perfect amount. <br><br>Atmosphere, decor, and lighting is perfect. It&#39;s a bit loud and bustling, but I love it. The waiters are always friendly and accommodating, which is a plus.<br><br>WHAT TO GET:<br>1. Spicy Chicken Chipotle Pasta - It has a little kick to it, but it&#39;s bearable, I promise! The sauce reminds me a little bit of Indian curry. Soooo good. My favorite entree.<br>2. Cajun Jambalaya Pasta - The shrimp and chicken are bursting with flavor. If you&#39;re a fan of pepper, you&#39;ll love this. It has a rich peppery taste and the sauce is also amazing. My sister&#39;s favorite.

Wow!!! Talk about awful service. @Cheesecake @AmericanaBrand. Only one person received their order. Waiter forgot to input my order.  not once did a manager come to apologize.  Service was awful.  Waiter informed us that he accidentally logged in as a trainer

This place has great food at a reasonable price. I love their chipotle chicken pasta, Chinese chicken salad, steak Dian, and their cheesecakes are amazing!!! If you&#39;re looking for a nice dinner with a large group I definitely recommend going here. The only negative thing is that there usually is a long wait so be prepared. However, there is so much to do around the restaurant so the wait time isn&#39;t too bad.

A group of us (usually 5) celebrate the holidays early in December so we can sit on the patio, listen to music, watch the fountain and have soap flakes (or who knows what) land in our food. Sadly over the last 5 years this restaurant has not just slowly gone downhill it is on a steep slope to AWFUL!!!!! Usually the restroom is disgusting so this time I avoided it!!! The servers are either untrained or management truly does not care if they work a bit or not. Our server stopped by to see if we were ready - we responded - in a minute or so. We could see her at the other end of the patio (two of my friends facing her said she&#39;s doing Yoga). Asked a manager if he could let her know we were ready and it was still a while before she came to the table. We ordered drinks and an appetizer and those were served (3 of the 4 drinks) came out the 4th was not ready yet??? I have had some amazing cocktails at other places that were not the cost of these, that were good, but not GREAT!!! Food - ugh!!!! Two ordered the pot pie. The pie was served by someone in the kitchen area telling us the &#34;bread&#34; for it would be about 10-15 minutes. The people that ordered those said &#34;we will wait for the entire dish&#34;!!!! The person that ordered the chicken picatta had the toughest overcooked chicken that could possibly be served.The pasta dish was lacking also. The server was nowhere to be found to send the dish back until everyone was finished eating. They no longer have chocolate ice cream for the hot fudge sundaes, at least that is what our server said. The location is amazing and that is all I can say that is positive. Funny when I mentioned our issues with CCF to a few friends - every single one said - the food and service has gone down significantly. One even said I would rather eat at Norms, at least the food is good!!! It makes me sad to see a restaurant that was always special, with delicious food and good service, fall into an abyss!!! Maybe they were bought by a different corporate group or no one cares. Not sure. Not planning on returning in the near future.

The food is pretty similar at most locations.<br><br>However, I was here yesterday and experienced pretty poor service. We had a server who started out well, but she was inattentive at best. We had to remind her more than once for every request. One of our waters had something floating in it, and after that the service went further downhill. She stopped coming around, and we had to ask someone to track her down so that we could put our order in.<br><br>She brought us full portions of all the lunch items that we ordered. And she asked us if we really wanted to change to lunch portions because the kitchen would have to throw the food away. I really wanted to pipe back at her that she could just readjust the order and let us keep the food instead. I felt like she was staring us down to try to change our minds. In the end we got our lunch portions, but she definitely left a sour note.

I frequent this place quite often not sure why I never wrote a review. The Cobb salad is fabulous it&#39;s the best in Glendale. The rest of the food is also amazing and comes in large family portions. Enough food to feed an army. <br><br>So if your in Glendale, this place is a must!!!!

I was craving cheesecake today so I decided to come here, especially since I hadn&#39;t been here for few months. Wait was just 30 minutes so it wasn&#39;t bad. I used to enjoy this place a lot more. Now, no matter what I eat it tastes okay and it&#39;s nothing special for the amount you pay. I had the Cajun jambalaya with chicken on the side. They literally put 4 pieces of shrimp in my pasta. If I&#39;m paying $20 for pasta I expect few more shrimps and not just plain pasta with spices. I also got their strawberry cheesecake and even though I was craving that cheesecake, it didn&#39;t hit the spot. I think I would have enjoyed it more if the cheesecake was kept at a cooler temp. My fiancé got chicken lettuce wrap and he didn&#39;t like it due to the little amounts of chicken they put in it. This used to be one of my favorite places to eat but not anymore. Everything about this place is average.

This review is going to be for both this location and the horrible Cheesecake Factory &#34;Cake App&#34; that enticed us to go there last night. The decor inside and outside of the restaurant is also quite stunning. But if I known what we were in store for, I never would have eaten here! The place was Jam Packed! The line for a table was about 20 people long, with masses of people filing up the lobby area waiting for their tables. They ran out of pagers, so we couldn&#39;t go do something else during our 20 minute wait for a table, and there was nowhere to sit while we waited. The person who was calling out names for tables was doing so in a very quiet voice, and nobody could not hear him. He was very polite and was clearly trying, but I think the manager should be training people in those positions on effective ways to get the attention of the waiting guests. When finally seated, at first the waiter was attentive and pleasant. Water and bread arrived quickly. But only one of us had a place setting, and it took 10 minutes to get the attention of our waiter to get another (and the other waiters were not making eye contact with any other diners but their own). The bread was delicious, but sadly for me, it would be the only good thing I ate that night.<br><br>That brings me to the nightmare that followed:<br><br>We had PayPal credit available, which we were hoping to use for dinner, and CF has an app for paying that will link to Paypal. I called ahead to make sure we could use the Cake App for payment, and was told yes. But here&#39;s the problem that the person on the phone failed to inform us about: to USE their app, you need a solid signal on your phone OR to connect to WiFi, BOTH of which are NOT POSSIBLE in this location!<br><br>Not only do they not provide Wifi for guests, the cell signal is non-existent not only INSIDE the restaurant, but anywhere in the huge outdoor mall courtyard surrounding it (which several employees told me was a well known issue at this location.<br><br>While waiting for our food order to be taken, I attempted to get the app set up and linked to my PayPal. But with no signal or Wifi, after placing my food order, I went outside to set up the app, hoping the signal would be better. No such luck! I had to walk 10 MINUTES outside the perimeter of the mall to get the app to connect! And then it took me about 10 more minutes to get it set up because it was SO SLOW. Not my idea of a date when you spend much of it alone on the street outside trying to get the restaurant&#39;s app to load.<br><br>When I got back to my table, I had been gone so long, that my food was there and had been sitting so long, it was all COLD. CF food is rather disgusting once it has gotten cold. So I got a few bites down and was rather grossed out. I had to leave the restaurant another TWO TIMES to get a code for using the app to pay, and to close out the bill! And we were completely abandoned by our server who went on a break, didn&#39;t bother to take our dessert order after giving us menu&#39;s again, and never told us he was leaving or that it was up to us to close out the bill on the app. So we sat a while before someone came over to tell us we were done and could leave.<br><br>There is a LOT more to say about our experience that CF corporate and managers NEED to see, but my review exceeded the Yelp word limit, and I&#39;ve already wasted enough time on CF Factory.<br><br>So, in short: No Wifi, No Cell Signal. App Won&#39;t work. Spent 52 MINUTES of my hour long &#34;dining experience&#34; walking 10+ minutes away from the restaurant to get a cell signal. Waste of money, waste of a night. And warning to parents and caretakers: Nobody can reach you in the restaurant if there&#39;s an emergency! And if you DO try to use the app, don&#39;t expect the waiter to ever come back again after you give them the code from the app. It&#39;s up to you to close it out and then leave.

The wait wasn&#39;t too long. The staff was friendly and the food was mmm, 6.8/10, BUT... I don&#39;t think it&#39;s worth the price. They also forgot my food for a while. I waited patiently and Nikki, the sweetheart, forwarded to the manager that I didn&#39;t get my food for a while after notifying me that I would get it shortly, after the other people in my table who already got their food. I don&#39;t know if that makes sense, but whatevs. I&#39;ll be generous and give the 4 stars.

The only reason this even gets 2 stars is because the service was great. Chad was an excellent server. But the food, IT WAS AWFUL. I ordered the Salmon, it came with mashed potatoes and vegetables. The mashed potatoes were a cold lump on my plate. I had a bite or two, they were gross. My son ordered the shrimp platter. He ate 1 shrimp and spit it out, I tasted it to see what the problem was and the shrimp was clearly bad. It was disgusting. My daughter got fish and chips, the fish was so over fried, she ate a piece and a half and couldn&#39;t stand how dried out it was. Never again. This is why I avoid chains. The manager removed the shrimp platter from my bill, and like a dummy, I actually paid for the rest, $80 with tip... won&#39;t be back here ever again.         <br><br>UPDATE: 11/9  NONSENSE  manager, I did notify when I was there dining. Not one manager came to my table. Your response is absolutely nonsense.

I Jussstt LOVE the cheese cake factory  The pasta is theee best, and and the complimentary brown bread is bomb. The oreo cheesecake is def my favorite, although i need to try some more stuff on the menu, i always get the shrimp angel haired pasta

My favorite place to enjoy dinner. I basically try a item on the menu that&#39;s new to me bc the taste and quality never lets me down at any location. Complimentary bread and butter upon arrival.<br>The strawberry cheesecake is to die for, they even have a sugar free strawberry  one too. <br>Cocktails here is on point, it does of course get busy on Friday &amp; sat evenings. Service is great, you don&#39;t wait long for you food, appetizers are all am A+

Honestly. The worse possible service ever. I&#39;ve been giving this place the benefit of the doubt for too long. I&#39;ve come here for a total of 3 times and I&#39;m shocked. I just left this location and the worst service ever. The waitress was incredibly rude. She wouldn&#39;t check up on my party. We waited for 45 minutes for our food to be brought until we asked to speak to the manager. Then she just tossed the dessert menu onto the table and the bill. <br>Never again will I come to this Cheesecake Factory.

Seriously their Orange Chicken is the best thing in the world. Also, this review is for their take out that I ordered from door dash. The food was SO GOOD! I ordered the orange chicken of course, and the steak Diane and it arrived hot and fresh and cooked to absolute perfection. I was seriously impressed and I&#39;ll do it again in a heart beat!
Stay away from the CHOPP Salad. It shouldn&#39;t be on the Menu, period. I could make a better salad at home! It&#39;s a joke!

The food was decent and the servers were very fast BUT there was a hair in not one but 2 of our dishes! Someone is definitely not tying their hair up in that kitchen. We first found a hair in our burger but I thought maybe it could have been mine so I didn&#39;t mention anything. I&#39;m not one to complain especially since I wasn&#39;t certain it wasn&#39;t mine. But then my brother found a hair in his dish and he does not have long hair. <br>We mentioned it to the server and she offered to replace the dish, but at that point who would want to eat more?<br>They didn&#39;t even deduct the hair dishes from our bill. Apparently you have to throw a fit about something to get better service . Nice guys finish last .

Had a such not great experience last night.  My 2 small kids and i went in around 730pm. We waited 15 minutes. We were seen right away once we did get seated. I ordered angel hair pasta with shrimp. My son got a kids cheese pizza and my daughter got kids bow tie pasta. We took a few bites of our plates and something was wrong with each plate. My pasta was overly cooked and was mushy. My sons pizza was all black on the bottom. My daughters pasta was undercooked and a bit hard. I told the waiter and we ordered different dishes. My son got sliders and i got orange chicken with rice. My sons food came out in 10 minutes. I had to wait 25 minutes for mine. I had to get it to go cause it took way too long. They said i would get to talk to a manager which never happened. When i got the orange chicken plate.  The rice was hard and chicken didnt look fresh. Looked as though it was sitting under the heat lamp for a while. <br>I love cheesecake factory but this location is the worst with customer service, quality of food and efficiency.

All right, I changed my mind. Just finished up a delightful early lunch at the bar with my husband. They have SLIDERS ALL DAY! I&#39;ve been craving sliders like crazy but most places only have them on happy hour menus so I never seem to be able to get my hands on them. <br><br>We shared the kale salad from the starters menu and it was like 6 bucks and awesome. Perfect size. Most restaurant salads are expensive and huge and you can never finish them but taking it home is rarely an option. I got the Roadside Sliders and Ernie got the Fried Chicken Sliders. All great and awesome! The order is around $9 but it comes with FOUR (count &#39;em) sliders with pickles and you can add fries for a buck. <br><br>Service was friendly at the bar, i swear, I don&#39;t know why anyone would wait for a table here when there are lovely gathering height 4-tops, booths and seats at the bar for no wait with the SAME FULL MENU! <br><br>Thanks TCCF, thanks Americana. Now I&#39;m going to drag my basic ass over to h&amp;m to find a dress for this wedding.
This place is very fancy! Our food came right on time although the bbq chicken pizza kept breaking apart and was slightly burnt still good though

Ugh, why must you tease me with that wheat bread every time?! Its soo good here. <br><br>I love the bar area, best place to go when you don&#39;t want to wait for a table. Customer Service isn&#39;t  bad, considering that there are so many patrons there. Our waitress was awesome because she was able to get us our drinks and tab quick. We told her we were trying to catch our movie, but not without a drink first. <br><br>We caught it, so thanks!! :)  <br><br>Also *** we stayed more than 4 hours after our movie and had to pay $15 for parking. Next time, I&#39;ll park in the other lots for free.

Haven&#39;t been in a while, wanted a salad but they no longer make it.i ordered lunch pizza and salad, portions are smaller now. Place is always the same, just make sure u check your silverware, I had a thick black hair wrapped around my knife.

Celebrating my good friends birthday with some delicious lunch<br>I love their oat bread with butter, avocado egg rolls<br>I got Chicken Madeira-chicken with asparagus, mushrooms in a Madeira sauce and mashed potatoes

There&#39;s good news and okay news :). Okay news is, well, it&#39;s Cheesecake Factory. I mean, it&#39;s heavy, rarely under 1000 cal/meal kind of menu. It tastes good because there&#39;s probably like two pounds of fat and sugar on your plate. And all three volumes of their menu are very informative. The good news is the service is always perfect. I mean, it&#39;s superb. The all American quality service that makes you feel (well, makes ME feel, really) happy and ready to enjoy every calorie :). I wouldn&#39;t dine there every week, but once in a while I definitely get a Cheesecake Factory crave.

Always a safe choice for a meal. I particularly like this location because of the outdoor seating that allows you to enjoy the music and water fountain of the Americana.<br><br>Today I came for lunch with my mom. We enjoyed the Ahi Tartare as an appetizer which was perfect for 2 people and very refreshing. We then ordered the Vegetable Salad and French Country Salad. Both were of good proportion and tasted great.<br><br>I&#39;m always excited to try something new from their encyclopedia-sized menu so I&#39;ll definitely be back for more!

There I found myself: adrift among a sea of tables adorned with ravenous families clad in their Tommy Bahama regalia, battered in sunscreen, flush and eager for the next round of platters like timorous expectant fathers in the hospital waiting room. These fine people had been fully depleted by the long and arduous day of parading around the Glendale Americana like prize ponies at the county fair and they deserved a hero&#39;s welcome and a hero&#39;s feast.<br><br>As the servants scurried out of their holes, their arms weak under the massive silver platters and their bodies starved and shaking from their Cheesecake Factory-prescribed daily meal of brine and amphetamine, they made their way to the tables to unleash the cornucopia. The servants presented their vessels in solemn reverence and with eyes cast down for fear of incurring the wrath of their noble guests.<br><br>The floor vibrated from the sheer turbulence of the collective feeding and could surely have been felt in all the far reaches of the Americana. Chairs buckled, tables creaked and clothing was torn asunder as the orgy of consumption came to a boil. Chunks of indiscernible organic matter burst forth in all directions like a food grenade, splattering the faces of the servants as they stood like cemetery gargoyles, guarding the frenzy, hiding their tears, and biding their time.<br><br>The eye of the storm came to the Cheesecake Factory like a morphine drip to a recent amputee. The nobles inevitably hit their critical mass and had to pause to digest and let their pre-installed insulin pumps do their job. In this blessed peaceful intermission, the servants cleaned in silence.<br><br>I used this brief moment of relative serenity to make my exit, for I dared not witness the second wave of offerings. I turned to look back upon the Factory and gave them a tearful salute.<br><br>They are doing God&#39;s work.

Great place! I don&#39;t understand the 2 star reviews. When there&#39;s great food in such a busy place be prepared for long wait time and for human mistakes. I mean some people just post unnecessary reviews. Overall it&#39;s a mega busy restaurant at the Americana with great food and views and awesome accommodation. What else can you ask for?

We where there last night with a group of 10. I ordered the chicken mango salad and specifically asked for it to be dry, no dressing. When I got my salad it look like it had dressing, so I told the waiter (Christopher S )  &#39;it seems like my salad has a dressing&#39; he said he&#39;s &#39;pretty sure it doesn&#39;t but he&#39;ll check with the kitchen to make sure it&#39;s completely dry&#39; He came back and lied saying &#39;yes it is dry&#39;. I ate 1/5 of the salad when I actually saw the dressing in my salad.  When I brought this to the waiter&#39;s attention he just said &#39;oh I&#39;m sorry about that&#39;. He offered nothing more.   We just paid  for our dinner and left. However, because of the dressing I have been sick since last night.<br><br>When I asked for no dressing it wasn&#39;t because I didn&#39;t like the taste of it or I wasn&#39;t trying to be a difficult customer   but I was trying to avoid getting sick. I can understand that there can be mistakes but for the waiter to outright lie it&#39;s unacceptable. I specifically asked him after I got my salad and he looked right into my eyes and told me it had no dressing.

This is the 2nd time I&#39;ve been to a Cheesecake Factory and can&#39;t say I was impressed. The Chicago location left a bad taste in my mouth and so I figured I&#39;d given it a second chance, and to my dismay nothing changed.  <br><br>[Server]: Our server was awesome, super nice and chill. Beard game was strong too, looked like he cut lumber for recreation. <br><br>[Food]: So I ordered the Chicken Marsala and I was slightly disappointed with the integrity of the dish. The chicken was vapid in flavor, there was absolutely no real good seasonings or rubs applied. The pasta wasn&#39;t cooked all the way so it was more chewy than what it should have been, and the sauce glazed over was bland. There was a better party in my glass of chianti than that whole dish. <br><br>[Atmosphere]: So this place throws me off. Because it&#39;s located in the Americana, so it comes off upscale but then you step inside and it&#39;s total opposite. The Cheesecake Factory needs to figure out how it wants to be perceived. The aesthetic of your restaurant comes off classy but if I step inside and close my eyes it sounds like I&#39;m in Red Robin. Maybe Cheesecake doesn&#39;t wanna be considered fine dining? Maybe I&#39;m wrong? Maybe it&#39;s Maybelline? Anyway, if you are trying to come across fine dining, you missed your mark. Between the overcrowded seating, loud ambience, and the allowance of baby high chairs in-between tables gives it that glorified Olive Garden feeling. <br><br>[Overall]: Sorry, won&#39;t be returning. Server was kickass but the food was depressing and the atmosphere was overbearing. No thanks.

Great place to go get some lunch after shopping. Was here from out of town and we went there after hitting Nordstrom&#39;s. Got a table in the outside patio. Service was good and the food was great. The only thing that I didn&#39;t like the fact that tables are red on top of each other.

The worst place ever, first we went there they told us it&#39;s gonna take 15 minutes wait but that didn&#39;t happened it took us an hour waiting no body care abou us and when we went in front of register the lady there was so rude for us

While waiting an hour for a table I started to sneeze. I heard a bark and looked over at the bar. There was some women and a full blown Australian Shepard at a table. It was not a service dog as it didn&#39;t have a vest. I ignored it and my sinuses. <br><br>Finally we were seated and got out good and drink. My strawberry martini was not up to corporate standards. It was in the wrong glass and watered down. Total waste of money. Next the hibatchi steak was kinda weirdly semi pre cut as were the asparagus. I am not a child and can cut my own meat lol I think they pre cut the steak so It looked more generous than it was. It looked gross. The mashed potatoes were bland and cold. I have had this same meal many times before, never was it like this.<br><br>Also, our female server was indifferent. I had to ask for a steak knife even though I ordered steak. Also had to ask for refills. <br><br>If this place was cheap I really wouldn&#39;t care but for the prices they charge they should get it together. Also I love dogs but unless it&#39;s a service dog it&#39;s a total health violation. Just gross.

Was here for a bday dinner and when we ordered we asked if we can get separate checks and they said yes when it came to pay waitress said no and put partial entrees all together. She was rude and didn&#39;t accommodate. Otherwise Food was great!

I had the chicken scampi pasta and the avocado chicken. It was really good with a huge portion. I came here for lunch on a Tuesday. There was no wait whatsoever and great customer service :) <br><br>I would definitely come back!

Love their lunch menu. All your favorites in a smaller portion. <br><br>Louisiana pasta- love love love. Must try pasta.<br><br>4 cheese pasta- really good if your into a lot of cheese. <br><br>Fried portobello mushroom appetizer- so good, we always order this. <br><br>They&#39;re really busy here when it gets to dinner but other than that they will seat you fairly quickly. The service is really good. <br><br>They have outdoor seating, which is a must on a not so cold day because you can see the fountain from there.

Why isnt Catherine a cashier anymore? She gave me the best service I have received in years. She was an angel with me best smile, reminded me of my late grandmother Agatha. She shows great leadership skills and I wouldnt be surprised if one day she owns her own company. In my opinion she deserves more.

Order to go all the time. Never had an order come out right yet. Literally wrong every time. I think it&#39;s just super poorly managed. No one knows what they&#39;re doing and is running around getting nothing accomplished. Takes forever to get your to-go order placed and even longer to get their mistakes corrected. Prepare to eat a cold meal that&#39;s sat around for an hour every time.

I don&#39;t really eat at the cheesecake factory anymore because I feel like their food isn&#39;t good anymore. Idk when they lost it but they definitely have. <br><br>However today we decided to eat here and it was a hit! Absolutely loved our waiter, wish I had his name so I could do a shout out! lol! <br><br>I ordered the Shrimp and Bacon Club which I had never really noticed before. Like all their other sandwiches, it was super sized and hard to eat but omg it was worth it! <br><br>The avocado egg rolls were amazing! And the red velvet cheesecake, not my favorite but still delicious!! In fact I&#39;m having the left over right now. Yum!!

Two Words: Frozen Dinner<br><br>Worst service ever. It was horrific. We had to wait an hour to be seated, and half an hour to order. I am very patient, but when I receive attitude from a waitress, that is unacceptable. <br><br>I ordered the shrimp pasta. Huh, that&#39;s odd, I never asked for my dish to be served cold. Oops, I guess they forgot to microwave mine. My friend ordered the chicken pasta and his plate was pipin&#39; hot! He claimed that his tasted like frozen dinner. <br><br>The waitress came over and said that I need to order dessert. I said, I need the check. The waitress rolled her eyes so hard, I am sure she saw her brain.<br><br>Come here if you want to wait over an hour to eat, receive a one-star &#34;service,&#34; and if you love paying for overpriced food

I have gone here, fourth times.  On my brother&#39;s bday,  we made sure that we will be seated accordingly.  Since, their policy was first come first serve.  At 1900 or 7:00, my sister came early to make sure the table is available for 9+ people. The estimated time given was until 9ish.  We were okay with it  because the arriving parties will be there.  So,  we checked in because no electronic monitor was given.  They have extended another hour and 15 minutes.  Here are negatives of this situation:  *.we were hungry. *we see others being seated before us *is suppose to be a great vibes *the waiting time was getting to us (note: I&#39;m very patient but this almost got to me)   I had to called the manager on the floor.  I stated the fact that we did the protocol according to their policy but it didn&#39;t take us NO way. I told him this was UNETHICAL in business sector.  Remember,  satisfied customers and consumers along with the great product and service will bring revenues and capitals to the corporation.  From Business management graduated perspective.   DO SOMETHING WITH YOUR FEEDBACKS AND REVIEWS...

In the middle of the Americana mall, probably the best place to eat between that and the Glendale Galleria and it&#39;s just started to rain. Of course it was going to be busy. But go to the desk, put your name down, get their estimate and mentally at 15 minutes, take the little buzzer and walk away from the immediate area. Find a quiet spot in the waiting area if you can, or break ranks and leave the family behind and do some shopping while they wait. What you don&#39;t do is constantly go to the desk asking for an update or make a big deal about how long the queue is. People got there before you, deal with it, the hostesses don&#39;t need for you to give them a hard time.<br><br>As it was for us, I managed to get a little shopping done at the Apple store and Barnes and Noble during the 30-minute wait (on the dot! No extension to their estimate). And we were taken to our booth and a high chair was brought for my niece. Good service from the waitress, not great but she did have a very busy section.<br><br>Menus were looked at and dishes chosen, a mixture of appetisers and entrees. These were ordered and delivered in good time, and the table quickly got crowded with plates, which were quickly whisked away once emptied. Their spinach and artichoke dip is great, although the nachos were slightly too big for a non double dipper. They were definitely two biters. The egg roll platter didn&#39;t do anything for me although lots of tables were ordering it.<br><br>The mains looked great and were apparently very tasty, I got the bang bang chicken and shrimp, which was great. Thai spices, peanut sauce, good amounts of chicken and quite a few shrimp (although I&#39;d have preferred more shrimp, less chicken) and a nice load of vegetables. It was a bit much though and I was happy sharing it with other members of my family.<br><br>No cheesecake eaten at the cheesecake factory, but I learned a long time ago that you can either eat a main course or a dessert there, never both if you want to continue functioning!

When we first arrived the hostess was super rude, we were seated out side by our waitress and she totally made up for the girl at the front. <br><br>Courtney our server was amazing! Made sure all of our food was on point and was super nice!

Yum. I love this place. I&#39;ve had a few bad experiences at this restaurant before but not this time. I went a few days ago and was quoted a 25 min wait time. It was much shorter. I had a drink at the bar while I waited and the bartender was a gentleman and very kind. <br>We were sat and decided on avocado egg rolls as a starter, which were delicious. I love the tamarind sauce! I got the Parmesan chicken dish and my boyfriend the salmon with mac and cheese. All delicious and HUGE portions. <br>I believe my servers name was Gordan? Or at least I believe that&#39;s what my receipt said. He was very nice and had a good sense of humor. <br>I guess my only complaint would be the small table we were sat at because I felt like I couldn&#39;t talk without the table next to me hearing every word. <br>Overall, I was pleased and I didn&#39;t even save room for cheesecake.

This is my go-to spot when I&#39;m feeling lazy. The atmosphere is casual to dressy but that just tells you that it&#39;s a place for everyone. The menu is huge (and a little exhausting) because there are pages for days... But that&#39;s also a good thing because there is something for everyone! <br>I tend to go around evening, it&#39;s less crowded than at &#34;peak meal times,&#34; but one time I went for Sunday brunch and it was CROWDED so I turned around and went elsewhere. There is a special secret I discovered about the Americana location: they can still make the BBQ SALMON if you order it! It has always been my favourite, but it was removed from the menu at all restaurants. <br>I think either the staff is always changing or they have a million servers, because I go A LOT and I have not yet gotten the same server. But they have all been pleasant and helpful and that&#39;s one of the reasons I like this place so much!

Perfection of decadence is whereby my travels thus far have lead me!<br><br>Proceeding therewith the ideal of feeding the citizens of my Empire, I decidedly so was requested by my assistant lead to venture off inwards the area of fine dining.. HENCE.. the Cheesecake Factory!<br><br>Seated politely, respected as the dignitary lead of Empires.. as thrown rose petals, fountains of rare beauty, master architecture surrounded my every footstep across marbled tile, towering glass doors reflecting oneself upon my grand entryway! Furthermore, I not only found myself baffled thereby the respectful crowds.. yet.. I found myself ASTOUNDED thereby the decor of the pristine.. nonetheless clean environment amidst hard service workers of the Cheesecake Factory!<br><br>Holding my scepter proudly towards my seated noble citizens therein my sight at such a extravagant engagement, surrounded thereby my honored guards.. I stated outright amidst the waitress&#39;s and waiters.. situating my crown atop my proud head,&#34;BEHOLD.. the taste of elegance.. crisp, delicate, tantalizing flavours, spices adorned, succulent fowl, flawless appetizing greeneries.. harvest bounty placed down therefor the enjoyment of LIFE&#39;S FEAST!.. Ahem... shall we.. begin...&#34; Immediate applause rang out amidst cheers! As.. am I.. Moreover I give gratitude therefor the chefs and fine staff of rarity, accolades for your fine performance! &#34;CHEERS!&#34; The Emperor has spoken..

You can not accept anything better then this very busy place nice staff. I love to seat out side to have some view but most of the time they dont have spot for me and family.<br>Over all if you like to wait for table go to plsce place.

As everyone already knows. The wait time here is insane. Then after you get paged there&#39;s another wait to be seated. Cmon now. <br><br>I ordered the Chicken and Biscuits. Seeing that it was about $18. I figured I was about to get a huge plate. Well technically the &#34;plate&#34; was huge lol. The chicken portions were a joke. 3 super thin sliced pieces of chicken breasts .....Really? They were almost paper thin. You know how much a piece of chicken breast costs at a local market? You guys basically gave me .50 cents worth...If that!<br><br>My only high note was the service from my waiter Orlando. He definitely is the definition of customer service.
Dear Cheesecake Factory my family and I love everything on your menu but the quality of the food has slightly gone down...  please be careful I just found a piece of plastic in my jambalaya..
Dirty plates, slow service, cold bread. Worst cheesecake factory experience ever. Not coming back again

Dropped in for lunch, were sitting for 10 minutes and completely ignored. We told the manager and went across the street to the Five Guys and grabbed a burger. Thanks for the terrible service it saved me $60 dollars on lunch. Horrible service!
Drake gave my group great service. I hope to have him as a server again! Enjoy my time here!
An hour and a half to wait for a table. Thirty mins til the server gets to your table. Thirty mins for food to come out. Thirty mins for leftover food to get boxed.<br><br>H O R R I B L E.

I always enjoy going to Cheesecake Factory because of the wide variety of food and service. However, my experience at the Americana Cheesecake meets below my expectations. The service is always slow, the waiters barely show up and seem unhappy to work, and we waited for about 30 minutes for our check. Working in customer service myself, I feel like it&#39;s so important to provide a good service to customers and this location definitely did not.

Simply just came in to get 2 slices of cake. There were 3/4 workers behind the cake stand and it seemed like none of them were doing anything. There&#39;s about 4 other people waiting to get their order. Took me 25-30 minutes just for them to have 2 slices ready. The cakes are already cut. Get it together Cheesecake Factory. Not even a &#34;sorry&#34; that they took so long.

I&#39;m sorry to the server that took over our table (Captain Jack Sparrow), while our main server went out for break, and for that I&#39;m giving this two stars rather than one. I come here all the time and never have I had such poor experience as I have today. And I understand how busy the servers can be, but it was a rather slow hour. We were immediately seated, to wait 8 minutes for the server to finally show up. And after several requests for table setting and plates, we have gotten it. We waited like another 5 minutes for the bread, with no explanation. As the main entree came along the server told us that she would be getting us plates. And we waited again for another 10 minutes, until I had to call a server from another table to get us the plates. I don&#39;t understand how long it takes for these servers to fulfill these small requests but I can assure you that when I worked at a restaurant, that it didn&#39;t take me this painfully long to get anything done. And if I did, I asked other servers for help. Even getting the check took dreadfully long. All in all, the service was absolutely atrocious. Get. Your. Shit. Together.

I am writing this review based off of a past experience, which was one of the worst restaurant experiences I have ever had. Long story short, we put our name down to eat before a dodger game, and the wait was 45 minutes roughly. Two hours later, and after an argument with the hostess and manager, we had not been seated and angrily left. Not only did we not get to eat anything before the game, but they wasted our time and blamed us for the whole ordeal. I would not recommend eating here unless they learn to treat their customers better, but until then, forget it!
Noa was a very nice hostess she took care of all my seating needs and was very nice about it. The host who walked me over was very friendly and outgoing i will definitely be coming back !!!

Love this place but very busy.  Waiting area large but limited seating.  Receptionist rude so I went to the other one.  Food very good.  The bread is very good to munch on while waiting for your meal.

The food was delicious and the portions were so huge that you definitely need to share. Service and the atmosphere were great! Prices are not cheap but not crazy either. No complaints. Definitely recommend.

My first time and last time I would ever come here!!! First off they gave us dirty silver ware not once but 3 times each roll of silverware he brought still had food particles! Food took so long I just canceled my order &amp; left  i wont  ever recommend  any one to come here just ruing my day left very upset and it was my first time being at any cheese cake factory! If I could I would give them no stars

The food is always good here. The bread and butter is always a plus as well. Pretty basic otherwise. They have a large large selection of items, they&#39;re menu is many pages. Many cheesecake flavors to choose from. Definitely some of the best cheesecake I&#39;ve ever had. Service was prompt, and the location at the Americana is very large and pretty. We showed up for lunch on a Wednesday afternoon and we waited about 5 minutes for a table. We love this location, and would return.

So I order Door Dash delivery from this Cheesecake factory. To start, I&#39;m already mad because the driver calls and says there&#39;s no parking, so we have to put on shoes, go down three flights and walk outside to get our food when he has already been tipped ahead of time.<br><br>Now for Cheesecake. The food is cold. I ordered chicken picatta with extra mushrooms instead of pasta. They give me extra pasta and no chicken. NO CHICKEN! Who orders chicken picatta with no chicken? No one that&#39;s who. Jesus.  Now I&#39;m going through it all over again and have to wait an hour to see what I get next. Grrrrrrrrrr....

Great service, great food, good portions, delicious wheat bread, and beautiful venue. <br><br>Came here for a Monday lunch birthday celebration and we were immediately seated. The venue is spacious and beautiful. Our server Natalie was very busy (we had to hunt her down a few times) but totally amazing. Excellent Service. We tried her recommendations which included: <br><br>1. Lemon Herb Roasted Chicken with extra sauce on the side $17.95 during lunch<br>2. Steak Diane  $19.95 during lunch<br><br>Both dishes came with mashed potatoes and were absolutely ON POINT. DELICIOUS. <br><br>The dessert (Kahula Cocoa Coffee Cheesecake) on the other hand tasted like diabetes. I was so excited to try it but after the first bite, I couldn&#39;t bring myself to eat another bite. Even for my friend who is a sweet tooth still thought it was way too sweet. I&#39;d skip this and try another in the future. I&#39;ll be back!<br><br>3 small cons: <br>1. The birthday freebie is a joke. It&#39;s a tiny cup of ice cream. Cute but TINY. <br>2. The regular (not wheat) bread was hard like a brick. We could not even bite into it, let alone break it into pieces. The wheat bread on the other hand was DIVINE. I&#39;d come here just for that wheat bread!<br>3. The Coffee Cheesecake is WAY too sweet.

The slowest service ever. Our waiter sucked and barely ever checked on us. The food was ok (normal Cheesecake Factory) but seriously I was fed up with our waiter. I&#39;m still sitting at our table watching the waiter walk around the restaurant with my debit card in his apron. Thought about dining and dashing but now I&#39;m held hostage because the waiter has my debit card.

Overs years living in the US, first time ever in one of their severals locations! The wait wasn&#39;t so bad only 15/20mins witch was a good start, promptly seated. Then no interest from our server for some longs minutes, I assumed they were busy at this time but you can at least say &#34;Hi, I&#39;ll be right back with you guys&#34;.. We got served in less than 10mins, fast for sure but I can tell you with the size of the menu and the number of items they are serving they are using frozen food. It really makes me feel inconfortable to say that but it&#39;s the truth, I can&#39;t understand why restaurant are keeping a huge menu just to cook frozen food to their customers. Sorry, first and last time ever.

I love this restaurant!!!! My favorite! All employees are great except the man who works the front wearing black. He has a pony tail! He&#39;s super rude!!!!! I asked to cancel my name in line and he just looked at me with no words. At least say &#34;sure&#34; or acknowledge me at least. Get it together cheesecake factory! I would&#39;ve given this place 5 stars but that man is rude. Food is great! And they do validate!
This is second time I been on Cheesecake Factory. Bread and butter was so delicious. Grilled selman was one of the best foot I ever eat in my life <br><br>Thanks

This review is of their Sunday brunch service and is written in context of my having worked in restaurant management for 4+ years.<br><br>If you&#39;re looking for a place for brunch, don&#39;t eat here.  Although Cheesecake Factory&#39;s evening service is usually passing, especially considering their high volume, their Sunday brunch service reeks of a non-committal attitude by the staff, broken management, and a dispassionate kitchen team.  In a single meal, the restaurant broke several best practice rules in restaurant operation, leaving me to believe the business is struggling with how to provide service during their non-peak hours.<br><br>Burnt food, forgotten drink orders, cold potatoes, and a confrontational waitress round out a number of cardinal sins committed by the brunch team which will go down as one of the worst I&#39;ve ever seen.  I could go into greater detail, but when the chef plates a charred english muffin under a cold eggs benedict, a server brings it to the table, and a manager still charges you for the meal, you&#39;ve got serious back-end problems plaguing what could otherwise be an enjoyable, high quality brunch.  <br><br>My advice to you is to go somewhere else.<br>My advice to Cheesecake Factory is to expect more of yourself.

Gilbert Gilbert Gilbert! This was hands down one of the best waiters I&#39;ve ever had. Came for an anniversary dinner and he was just awesome! Steak was super tender, cheesecake was amazing overall it was really a great experience and Gilbert made it even better! Thanks For the stellar service!

I love coming to &#34;the Cheesecake Factory&#34; but honestly my only problem is the wait!! Wow I&#39;ve been coming to cheesecake for many many years. I usually come here see the lines way to long and go to Pasadenas but the wait for 2 people was a 1 1/2 hours long.. the customer service is always amazing and fun.. and they have delicious food.lol

I ordered Louisiana chicken pasta which is my favorite but as I was eating I noticed the plate was covered with a thick layer of oil. I asked the waitress if this is the normal amount of oil they usually use for this dish, and she said &#34;yes, I&#39;m sorry&#34;!!! I didn&#39;t finish it cause it was so disgusting.

Laughably pretentious.  The little staff people (yes, I&#39;m doing it, now) at the front were not only not friendly, but they act superior.  You&#39;re not pretty, you&#39;re not funny, and there are no agents in here.  Get over yourselves.  It&#39;s funny, apparently, when you&#39;re not hungry.  I was pretty hungry.  One gal actually said there was no wait-time, put us in some weird line by the desserts and... we had to wait.  I think you need to take a math class, honey.  Zero means no minutes.  Standing in a line for 20 minutes means there&#39;s a 20-minute wait.  At one point we were supposed to move up by this big pole where we were actually blocking people from leaving.  So weird and rude and inefficient.  <br><br>I could overlook it if the food didn&#39;t taste weird.  It just wasn&#39;t good.  Whatever that sauce is that was on the steak just... ruined the meat.  The waiter was... meh.  He seemed to be more interested in certain tables over others, so if you wanted something, you had to wait.  If you&#39;re trying to catch a movie down the road, that&#39;s super frustrating.  And yeah, I did feel a little sick during the movie after eating there.  Not the first time.  <br><br>I&#39;m sure the cheesecake&#39;s still good.  Unfortunately, the experience, the meal, and the lack of math skills (and common courtesy) ruined my appetite for it.

Saturday night so there was a long line and the wait time was 30min.  They take your phone number and text you once your table is ready.  Foods were good and service was friendly and tentative.   Very lively and nice atmosphere.  We had a good time.  Our server Anthony was very nice and cool. We would love to come back here.
Great service. Love the location with its views. Its atmosphere gives you a nice comfortable place to be with family to celebrate a special occasion or to just spend time as family.

Remember when this place used to be good?  A place that was the obvious choice to take a first date, celebrate a birthday or even for an impromptu &#34;nice&#34; meal?  I do too and I sometimes miss those days. <br><br>This place is awful now in that they seem to freeze all of their food and microwave them as they are ordered.  What happened?  The food is awful and the service is just as bad but sometimes worst.  The prices have skyrocketed but it seems like the quality of food and service has been left in the dust.  It should be criminal to run a restaurant this bad.

To be honest, I saw the weak reviews before I go in, but I preferred to give it a chance!! I was SO WRONG ! 2 stars is even too much ):  FIRST, the waiter did not bring the bread &#34;automatically&#34; as supposed to, we even asked for it TWICE ! SECOND, the Louisiana chicken pasta was soooo baaaad (garlic was not mixed well with the pasta, it was collected in one spot, AND the pasta was undercooked (which exactly matched what I read in one previous review!!) and the Dynamite shrimp was disappointing !! THIRD, our server &#34;Who did not introduce himself and has no name tag on his shirt&#34; asked us while presenting the bill: do you want any desert? We answered: No. he said: we already closed... (ok, was that a joke or just being impolite?!!!!)<br>I was totally shocked after this experience  because I have been in another 2 branches of the cheesecake factory in the Gulf area and I loved it

Never again! Had bad experience there 2 day ago. Went to the toilet, and forgot my phone 8, 1 day old. Realizing this 5 min later, I did not find it. My friend called me non stop and I was looking around. Went several times to the staff. They just smiled and did not try to do anything. Too much people. The staff has no controll, plus this experience. The place attracts all kinda people, even the thiefs.
One of the worst service ever! Waited 45 plus min for our food and still not here! About to walk out of this shit hole!

I usually don&#39;t yelp but I had to write a review for my experience tonight. My sisters and I don&#39;t get to go out together often and our waitress Paige made our experience so wonderful. Our favorite suggestion by Paige was Adams cheesecake. If you like peanut butter and chocolate it&#39;s a must have!! We really recommend this location, and if you are going ask for her !!!

If you want gain 10 pounds in one meal, this is a good place to start.  I&#39;ve been to a million of these locations throughout my youth but have not been in years and years.  <br><br>We actually came here to try some of the cheesecakes for our wedding.  We had a small backyard wedding only 14 guests so we were not going all fancy and having a huge expensive wedding cake.  What led us here was over the holidays my mom&#39;s friend brought over a lemonchello mascarpone cheesecake from Costco that was pretty much the best dessert I&#39;ve ever had.  Costco only carries it during the holidays so it wasn&#39;t available for our wedding, so we searched and found a similar one here we wanted to check out.<br><br>It&#39;s the Lemon Raspberry Cheesecake, it was SO good, but not as good as the Costco one.  It was definitely good enough taste wise for the wedding but the way it looked whole didn&#39;t have a wedding cake look, so we went to the second runner up, the Red Velvet Cheesecake, which easily doubled as a casual wedding cake.  It was about $50 and we picked it up the day of the wedding.<br><br>As far as food, I ordered the same thing I used to get when I was a kid, the Louisiana Chicken pasta, it never disappoints, but after about 5 pieces of bread, I can never finish even half of the portion, but it makes for a great doggie bag.<br><br>The nice part about this location, which we like to refer to as the &#39;knock off Grove&#39; since it&#39;s so very similar, but not quite, the Grove in West Hollywood by our house.  The one thing I did like better about this one was that while you sit outside at the Cheesecake Factory, you can get a great view of the fountain and watch the fountain dance along to the music and rainbows.  It&#39;s quite magical if you can forget about the mega mall type shops you&#39;re surrounded by in retail hell.

Really good cheesecake factory compared to most.  I love this place and it seems like I go here every week...It&#39;s one of the few restaurants that seem to have EVERYTHING.  The only reason I didn&#39;t give it 5 stars is because it&#39;s always busy and sometimes the waiters could forget about you when you want to get out (movies is right next door).

Excellent waiter!  I wish I remembered his name.  My date and I were sat in a booth by the bar section.  This guy was amazing with his service, quick and efficient.  All recommendations were delicious.  Highly<br>Recommended!  I order salmon and shrimp and date had the orange chicken.  We also order cocktails and the chocolate fudge cake.  Excellent!

Farfale with Grilled Chicken and Roasted Garlic is fire! So bomb! That&#39;s probably my go-to entree when I&#39;m eating at cheesecake. Of course, NEVER skip out on the cheesecake! Their cheesecake is done right! The spring rolls are surprisingly good too, as well as their calamari. Only thing they fall short on is their salad. The salad is worse than soup plantation, and hometown buffet&#39;s salad bar. For anything else, this is the right place!

I ordered &#34;entrusted salmon&#34; and i got steamed salmon. There was no crust just Seamed cilantro salmon. It came with 3 spears of asparagus and a weird sour, cream sauce maybe that was all the raw tomato. Only 3 shrimp.

I read Krissy&#39;s review and I had the same experience.  He was black (he just happened to be black) and he did not even say a word - simple things like you&#39;re welcome, after I said thanks, or have a nice day after I had my ticket validated.<br><br>People like him have no business being stationed &#34;in front&#34; -  maybe he needs to be in the kitchen or stock room or some place else where basic personal manners are not required.  <br><br>I almost said something not nice to him but thankfully my wife just told me to let it go.  No manners!!!!

Got three things here: chorizo pasta, a combo pizza, and a salad that came with the pizza. Chorizo pasta was very strange, it tasted Indian and yet very, very bland. Just a weird taste, not really awful but definitely not great. Pizza was very salty and very soggy in the middle. Salad was similarly salty and sloppily drenched in dressing. The veggies looked and tasted wilted.<br><br>Our server came by 5-10 minutes after serving our food to ask us how the food was, then disappeared into the oblivion. We waited for 15 mins after we finished our food before we got impatient and flagged down another server for the check.<br><br>You pay a lot of money for crap food and crap service. Go somewhere else.

Hostess is very unprofessional and not friendly, did not want to set up the table at a preferred spot bringing different reasons like she can not drag the table than she said it is going to be too close to the heater etc... very disappointing

Waited over 50 minutes for a table for 7 and they seated us at one for 6. Server was great and attentive but the food took over 30 mins to get and wasn&#39;t up to par. My dad&#39;s salad wasn&#39;t washed it had grains of dirt in it and had watery mock-blue cheese dressing. Salad shouldn&#39;t have grit! My mom&#39;s pasta dish, Aunt Evas or somebody&#39;s aunt, was cold and it was obvious hers sat on the counter before the rest of our order was ready because the noodles got crusty. You can&#39;t screw up the warm tasty bread so we filled up on that. Basically OK food but this place is better off making cheesecakes.

The lines can already be long, but when the hostess who isn&#39;t paying attention to everyone cutting it makes it much worse.  Then she doesn&#39;t pay attention so I have to repeat my name several times.  It&#39;s not that tough lady, get it together.

We went to the Cheesecake Factory to celebrate my daughter&#39;s birthday and it was a disaster. The waiter was so inattentive that I couldn&#39;t even inform him of the special occasion. He did not check on us one time during our meal. He did not ask how our food was, refill our drinks, or ask if we needed anything. I finally got his attention when we were ready to leave and he dropped a glass of water all over my daughter, dropped a plate and ketchup went flying everywhere, and then a knife  landed on the seat next to my other daughter. He did not even apologize!! The manager gave us a discount for our meal but that did not make up for the terrible experience.

We went this Sunday and it was pretty busy. We were seated within 25 minutes which wasn&#39;t too bad. We ordered the super antioxidant salad with chicken added , falafel salad, grilled fish tacos, and carrot cake.  I can honestly say that the salads were delicious and healthy. The service was not that great. It took the server a long time to even bring us water or bread. In the middle of the dessert we got the bill. I don&#39;t think it is proper to give customers the check mid grub.

Service:<br>I went on a Wednesday and we only waited like a minute to be seated (for two my boyfriend and myself). The gentleman helped us right away and was always checking in to make sure everything was good. They brought our food pretty quickly as well. <br><br>Food:<br>They don&#39;t have a lot of vegan or vegetarian options but like for my boyfriend who eats anything he said the food and the cheesecake was great. <br><br>Overall:<br>The place was clean and very beautiful! Compared to the one at the grove this location was so much better with their customer service. Yes I would come here again especially because my boyfriend loved it :)
Food for all walks of life and all tastes.  This place is one of the best restaurants around.  Great food with great prices and service.

This a favorite of my Bestfriend and I. The food is good esp the brown bread. The serving usually is huge. I like the fact that it is open late coz our work hours usually have us coming out late so it&#39;s good to have a good restaurant to go to.

Unfortunately, we cannot stomach using the disgusting silverware and plates they have here, and ordered to go.  Whoever is in charge of dishwashing probably hates the job. Otherwise the utensils wouldn&#39;t stick to your hands.
