First off all. Some of the food is good, really good. But thats about it.<br><br>We were a party of 8. Coming from Denmark, we heard of the place and decided that this is worth a try. But what a mess we entered. 4 adults and 4 kids. (3 under 10) <br><br>We had to wait 2!!! hours before we were seated. Then after that, the first thing the waiter does. Is to spill a giant coke into my lap, lucky for me our hotel was nearby... And because og the sloooow service, I was able to get there. Change my clothes and shoes and get back... And .... Still no food. Clock was about 21 and we had 3 kids that were pretty tired.<br><br>2 hours and 30 mins our food starts arriving, but not for all at once, so some of us are done before the last ones have had any food at all. Some of the food is mixet up with others customers orders, and some of it is way overcooked and dry, probably because of the long wait. <br><br>When we left we were told we could have 2 pieces of cheesecake... And the waiter insisted on a tip... What a nerve. Everything was terrible and then still wanting extra money. American greed at its best! <br><br>Point of this story! They let WAY to many people in there. And should have have more people handling the customers... But I guess thats not an option, when money talks.<br><br>Dont go there!

Let me start off by saying I am literally obsessed with the cheesecake factories lemon herb crusted salmon. I eat it literally at least once a day. But I&#39;m very upset as a customer because this is the second time I have an issue with this specific location. <br>The first time I was at dinner and my salmon was accidentally give to another table. I had to wait over an hour for my food!!! By then I already had a stomach ache, could barely eat, and got a headache that I had to deal with all night. My meal was comped and I got a free cheesecake. Which I appreciated but this time the issue was unacceptable.  <br>While I was eating I noticed a bug in my food, the meal was again comped and I asked for a new one which I was charged for. Again I had to wait (over 20 minutes in addition to the time I waited for my first plate ) I didn&#39;t mind but I did get upset when I came home to BURNT salmon. I&#39;m sorry but that&#39;s unacceptable. I didn&#39;t mind paying for a meal that I wanted but the fact that I paid for a meal that had a bug &amp; then had it burnt does upset me as a customer.

Big mistake showing up Sunday night . I attempted to get a refund on the chocolate tuxedo I ordered since the whole top was burned . Spoke to the manager Sarah ,right off the bat no refund didn&#39;t want to listen to what I have to say . I showed her a picture of the cake , Sarah tells me it&#39;s chocolate -_-  we&#39;ll Sarah I didn&#39;t have a clue that u sold a chocolate tuxedo crispy!!! Long story short no refund left with a cake but no happy<br>Costumer service no good

This location has the best service of all Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been to. <br><br>It was jam packed on the rainy Saturday night, we had to settle with the bar area since we were starving and don&#39;t want to wait 45 minutes. The servers were tentative, and made some great suggestions on what to order. I had the skinnylicious angle hair with shrimp, my friends ordered the meat ball lasagna with prosciutto, and pamersan chic hen pasta. <br><br>The portion of the food from the regular menu is huge, I would call it family sized. The skinny menu is perfectly portioned for one, and they do use a yogurt instead of heavy cream for the white sauce. That compromised the flavor quite a bit, so I was not super happy with the taste, but it only has 500 calories. In comparison, the regular menu with full on ingredients are much tastier--I could taste the generous olive oil and heavy cream and cheese topping. The flat bread with pear and blue cheese was delicious, and of course we had to end the meal with a lovely slice of white chocolate macadamia cheese cake with a scoop of vanilla ice cream!!! Speaking of an happy ending!<br><br>Will definitely recommend the restaurant!

The service is good, food is good too, I&#39;m giving 4 stars because the music is too loud. There is a lot of noice, since tlot people talking louder because they can&#39;t hear each other. It would be more relaxing if they put at least low piano music.

This location is pretty big, very very crowded all the time, but given the location, it&#39;s nicely run.  They will take your name down and text you when your table is ready so that you can walk around freely, without a buzzer range chaining you down.  Once seated, the menu is so vast, it takes a lot to pick just one dish!  The portions are huge as always and always reliable.  The cheesecake is where it&#39;s at, lots of good choices to choose from. <br><br>Parking is either in the parking lots or street.  The staff is friendly and helpful.

Love Americana si much ! What a beautiful setting at the Amerikana ! In the middle of the Americana mall , probably the best place to at between that a Glendale Gallery and it&#39;s started to evening ! Service and food were great ! Very polite and caring staff ! i really like Cheesecake Factory!

500 Stars not 5 stars. <br><br>We obviously know about the food and many choices, but what some don&#39;t know is the unmatched integrity and service of their staff. My girlfriend and I ate here on Saturday night, we had an amazing meal and were talking about our vacation to Costa Rica the upcoming Tuesday. (We have been planning this trip for some time) <br><br>The next morning we woke and realized she had forgotten her purse in the booth we were sitting at. She had her ID, cards, $1000 in cash (for trip) and most importantly her passport inside her purse. <br><br>The ONE vacation we were able to plan/save for just came to a screeching holt. When we went the next day to ask the manager if the purse was found we weren&#39;t sure what to expect. <br><br>The cleaning crew had turned-in the purse with everything still intact and every cent there. Thank you cheesecake factory, you forever earned two customers for a lifetime and it really wasnt even for the food. <br><br>TFR

Came here on Black Friday. Understandably a bit of a wait with service and in the kitchen, right, no problem. What I didn&#39;t expect is when I advised my second side  order of sweet potato fries ( broccoli was with the meal) wasn&#39;t on my plate...that I would get them when I only had a couple of bites of my meal left. Then they were brought out by the manager and I was advised I would be comped the extra dollar that I paid for them since it was substitute. Really? Not okay.

We sat down at 10:40 AM and ordered orange juice,  water, a breakfast sandwich and spaghetti with meatballs. Service was fine at first; we got our drink orders, and bread. Our server offered us additional bread, but we said no thanks. Within 20 minutes after ordering two families arrived, were seated and ordered their meals. Forty minutes passed and the families that came after us had their meals and were already eating. Our server never checked up on us after offering bread. Only after 40 minutes and asking another employee walking by for our check did she approach us to tell us our sandwich and spaghetti with meatballs were coming out. 40 minutes for a breakfast sandwich and spaghetti with meatballs!! She said she got so busy with 2 new tables and that&#39;s why it took so long, but it does not take 40 minutes to take the orders of 2 tables. It takes less than 5 minutes to enter our orders in the computer if she didn&#39;t do so prior to taking their orders. Regardless, we politely asked for the check for the glass of orange juice and left to eat at Katsuya (where we were given our appetizers and entrees within 20 minutes). The manager at Cheesecake tried to make the situation better, but apologies and a free meal would not rectify this situation as we were grossly overlooked for nearly 1 Hour as 2 families who came at a later time were already eating and enjoying their meals. Our server didn&#39;t even approach us to apologize for the delay until we were asking for a check. Obviously, she didn&#39;t think we were important enough. I will not be dining or endorsing this Cheesecake Factory to my family, friends, or coworkers. The poor reviews as of recently are an indication of Poor management, Poor Customer Service and Lack of training of the employees.

Before I begin, I would like to start by saying that this resturant does not close until 11:00 pm. We arrived at 9:50 pm to dine. There was absolutely no reason for my group to be treated with such a lack of customer service. The doors were open and they were not closed so it is absolutely inexcusable to not tend to paying customers and make them feel as if they are a bother. <br><br>Anyway, a group of friends and I decided to dine at this cheesecake location tonight and we were very unhappy with the customer service from the moment we walked up to the counter at 9:50 pm. We politely told the hostess that we had a party of eight people and the woman told us that they sent people home so their sections were smaller due to the lack of waiters available so it would take a longer time for us to be seated. The other hostess was a man and made some bickering comments with the woman as we awaited a resolution to the problem. We asked if there was anything they could do so we could dine, so they told us they could put us in two booths. <br>We walk over to the booths and one was actually big enough to seat all of us, however, it would have been more comfortable if we were able to just put one extra chair at the end, however, they would not allow it. At that point we all just squeezed in the one big booth to make it work. Then, they came to tell us they had another booth we could all sit in with a chair on the end, so we move happily and gratefully. <br>As we sit at the new table at 10:00 pm, we order our drinks with our waitress and the original male hostess has the audacity to come by and tell us, &#34;You told me you guys were just getting cheesecake,&#34; and rolled his eyes and huffed/puffed away. First of all, we never said we were only getting dessert and it was so rude of him to interrupt us just to make that rude comment when we were genuinely just trying to have a good dinner all together. <br>Next, even though we had a very sweet waitress our drinks and food didn&#39;t come out until 10:50 pm. The waitress apologized, but it was getting ridiculous at this point due to the fact we were paying customers in their establishment BEFORE closing. There was no excuse for this, so we call the manager over to express our frustrations and disappointment, but unfortunately he was even less of a help. Truthfully, all he did was apologize and half listen to us. I wasn&#39;t expecting a meal comp or anything, however, I was definitely searching for sincere concern for our unhappiness and it was just not there. <br>Overall, after this experience I must urge people that consider going to this establishment to not visit this location. ESPECIALLY, if you have a big party or simply just want good customer service because let me tell you they are HEAVILY lacking in that department. From the manager to the hostess it was all bad. <br>Do better Cheesecake Americana, not only for your paying customers sake, but to the families and friends that choose to dine to eat your food and have a simple slice of cheesecake.

I am not giving this place a 1 star for food cuz its all standard.   I&#39;m giving it because service is always so bad.  They never get orders right and seems to me servers just don&#39;t care.  I would avoid it.

I took my two little ones out for the afternoon and took them to Americana, hoping that the grass area would be open for them to run around, but unfortunately it wasn&#39;t.  So we walked around and walked around and I had to feed my little ones, and didnt know what to get.  One of them said that they will be okay with mac n cheese, so Cheesecake Factory it was!!  I was in a huge rush cause my little ones sleep pretty early and it was already late afternoon... So I tell our waitress, Nikki, that I have literally 20 minutes to order, eat, pay and leave!  She looked worried but handled it like a champ!! (THANKS NIKKI!!) So I ordered two mac n cheese and a chicken tenders.  She brought out bread while we wait for the food (which they downed, lol... We&#39;re Armenian, we love bread! lol).  Then she quickly brought out the food and off we go... made the kids stuff their faces as fast as possible. Which the food tasted freakin awesome!!  I got whatever the kids couldn&#39;t finish and put it in a box, paid and took off!  <br>The food was awesome, the service was awesome, the ambiance/environment in this place is awesome... nothing I could complain about!  Its a wonderful spot!<br>Bread is free<br>Drinks were $6<br>Food was $18<br>Feeding my kids and getting in and out of there in time... priceless.

I love the cheesecake factory but from back in the day. the quality has gone down but still a good meal and high quality items. what I mean by the quality has gone down is this. the pasta dish I always order . use to be  wide past and chicken flavored with the flavors&#39; of the recipe.  this dish was always sooooo hot that the menu has warnings of heat and when I was pregnant and ordered this dish the informed me that it is so hot it could induce labor. <br>Now when I order this dish I have discovered... thin skinny pasta and not even spicy hot. the chicken bland and just added to the sauce. when I ask it make it spicier <br>A. they don&#39;t<br>B. The answer to that was let me bring you some pepper flakes, which he didn&#39;t bring. <br><br>but regardless pepper flakes is not the same hot as the cayenne pepper hot that the dish is made with and just needs more of. <br><br>so I guess you can not add to a dish that is already pre prepared <br><br>back in the day the dish was prepared together not place item on top and ad sauce. and very little sauce at . the waiter brought us more sauce from the start due to he said &#34; I brought you extra sauce since everybody want&#39;s more sauce&#34;  if the demand is more sauce to each customer why are you serving dry pasta on a wet pasta dish????<br>my husbands dish completely different menu item the chicken tasted just like my chicken . bland . it seems like chicken is just boiled in salt water and added to any dish as needed. <br><br>As for this location......<br> fake friendly. what  I mean is lots of OH Yes no worries. still lots of mistakes.<br> no consideration, no jump to make things better. sloooowwwwww service. we were there 2 hours just waiting. waiting for a table , waiting for food, order was no shrimp , shrimp arrived waited for new order, just too much. many times our experience is the same.<br>A ~just we are the cheesecake factory well oiled machine that is going to make our money anyway so we do not care about customer service~ <br><br>I find in the marina del ray location the ambiance and feel and customer service is more pleasant . going to try Pasadena next hope its better than Glendale location.<br>Glendale is my local stop and will still stop in but maybe just not for my favorite just drinks and appetizers.

Americana is a beautiful place that attracts all types of people. I prefer many of the other restaurants at The Americana. Cheesecake is crowded, noisy and a long wait time. Its food is okay at best, but nothing special.
I ordered a salad and the lettuce didnt seem that fresh for being a 20 dollar salad. Probably not ont eat here again for a salad

I normally love the Cheesecake Factory, but my experience here was not up to par. While waiting for our iPhones to get fixed, my sister and I popped in for a quick dinner. I ordered the chicken alfredo, like I do every time I come. When I got my food I immediately spit it out. It was EXTREMELY salty. I thought maybe it was just me, so I had my sister try it and she agreed. It was not eatable. I told the waiter about it and he asked if I wanted a new one, but we were on a time crunch so I said no. After this the manager came over to talk to me... he said that they boiled the pasta in salt...But everyone does this. That was no excuses for how ridiculously salty it was. Then he said that it was supposed to taste like the sea... totally lost me there. They obviously took the plate off our bill, but I left without eating any dinner. I definitely won&#39;t be back to this location.

I never give anyone bad reviews but I couldn&#39;t stop myself to not giving reviews on this one . Me and my friend went there for a dinner and it took them 25 minuets to come and get our orders and we had to wait an other 20 minuets to get our drinks and it wasn&#39;t even busy  . And It  take an other  30 more minuets for them to bring us our food......... I am really disappointed with the customer service they have..... since I had a really great experience with the Pasadena location and we were in Americana and I love the service they provide I thought it&#39;s going to be the same thing but I am never coming back here again

I am a fan. I have been coming to The Cheesecake Factory for over 15 years and it is rarely a disappointment. ..<br><br>I always get the Summer Rolls, and sometimes I&#39;ll get the Pork Chops. <br><br>When I&#39;m feeling like a bad girl, I&#39;ll dive into the Shrimp Scampi, Jambalaya, or the Pasta Bolognese.<br><br>On a good day, I&#39;ll get the Cobb Salad...<br><br>But that breakfast - The Breakfast Sandwich that my mom introduced me to is amazing. As is the Monte Cristo that you can land during brunch sundays.<br><br>Sit at the bar, and you can watch some sports during a nice breakfast.<br><br>For the price, it&#39;s really reasonable - You think about how much you pay at a smaller joint and the quality isn&#39;t as high, and it&#39;s not nearly as reliable.<br><br>I love pretty much everything on the menu... Down to the coffee. <br><br>My favorite cheesecakes = Vanilla Bean, Red Velvet, and Strawberry. Oreo (which they appararently renovated) - You are my next target... Until then....

Came here for a nice anniversary dinner with the family, but was very disappointed.  The server was nice, but waited over 40 minutes for 3 out of 4 orders.  My son&#39;s order came out after an hour.  Apparently his order was given to another table.  Was told the manager will come, but no show.  She finally showed when my son was done with his dinner.  <br><br>We were looking forward to sharing a couple of cheesecakes and enjoy the night.  But semi ruined.<br><br>Had other plans, so walked out.<br><br>Not the servers fault, but could have been handled a little better.

By far the worst customer service I&#39;ve ever dealt with! They put you on hold for about 10 minutes every single time. The managers are useless since it was a manager named Ashley who got our order completely wrong! Get it together management

I&#39;ve been to many Cheesecake Factory locations and the service and food is very consistent. Except for the hostess at this location. We were there at 4:00 on May 31st. And when we asked if we could sit at a table in the bar she quickly yelled, &#34;There&#39;s NO self seating there, you can&#39;t just sit down!&#34; We then asked if we can be sat there by her and with her rolled eyes, she said, &#34;Ya, sure, wait on this side the host stand.&#34; <br>The table was 12 feet from the host stand but we HAD to wait on the other side. Ridiculous and rude.<br>We turned to her and said don&#39;t bother, we are leaving. <br>She said, &#34;Ok, that&#39;s fine!&#34;  She is not a great first impression for your restaurant.

They are so packed, all the time. High calorie but high satisfaction alert!! <br><br>Their food selection is great and they have a huge menu with amazing deserts but they dont let you reserve so you have no choice but to wait 30-50 minutes evrytime you want to dine here. Sometimes you get lucky and if you ask for outdoor seating after 7:45pm you&#39;re probably going to have a chance at getting a table<br><br>Their deserts are delicious and their food is amazing, their selection of pastas is impressive and I am never usually dissapointed but I feel the last visit their food quality declined, the pastas were all glued and bundled up from undercooking and their sauce was just way too salty. I love their sphaghetti and meatballs and Ive tried their carbonara and loved it.
Very nice place; Very Polite and Caring staff; Good quality.<br>I really like CheeseCacke Factory @ Americana

The service sucked, as a party of 7, 4 of us didn&#39;t like the food, and the rest felt alright about it. I personally had the Chicken and Waffles Holandiese, the potatoes were burned, hmm I am being gracious with what is being said.
Service &amp; food is always good here! I&#39;ve honestly tried everything here haha I love their cheesecakes. It&#39;s lovely to have lunch or dinner outside the patio to watch the fountain show. :)

This was my first time to this specific location so this review is meant for this location only. Came here on an early Friday evening so we had no wait time which was nice. Our waiter was OK, didn&#39;t seem to really want to be there and wasn&#39;t too interested in serving us. Food was OK as well, both my wife and I order the combination steak Diane and herb salmon. Salmon was undercooked a bit and steak was under cooked as well being we requested well done. <br><br>Like I said, this review is for this specific location, I&#39;ve been to other locations and have had better service and better food!! Kind of disappointing being that this location is in the Americana!
Always consistently good food. For over 20 plus years!! Love Cheesecake Factory!!<br>Our waiter was exceptional! He was fast, nice, and got everything correct.

They now text you when your table is ready.<br><br>Customer service is always on point. They come whenever you need something. More ketchup? Water? Aioli? Mustard? &#34;Ok, we got you.&#34;<br><br>Ask for a table outside on a weekend - it&#39;s fun watching people posing in front of the waterworks. *peace sign*<br><br>MUST TRY: <br>Portabella Mushroom, Avocado and Zucchini Fries <br>Luau Salad <br>Pasta Carbonara<br>Pasta Da Vinci<br>Arugula Salad

We walked in and immediately sat at the open bar to avoid the wait. Our server Spencer was very nice, she continue to refill our water is without even asking, the food was also very delicious. The bathrooms were very clean and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Also you cannot forget the awesome delicious fresh bread that was given to us upon sitting down. Would highly recommend this cheesecake factory.
I love this place specially in the evenings <br>only problem is you cant make reservations

Quick &amp; Easy: Shrimp Bistro Pasta, Chicken Piccata, food took forever. <br><br>Down &amp; Dirty: I think people give The Cheesecake factory too much crap for being a chain/franchise. Although it&#39;s not my go to, it&#39;s a decent place for dinner when selections are limited.  The food here is acceptable, portions are big, but the wait time was way below par. I felt like I was on a research paper assignment while deciding what to eat. This menu is enough for 15 standalone restaurants. I couldn&#39;t imagine being a line cook here.<br><br>I ordered the Stuffed Mushrooms for an appetizer and the Shrimp Bistro Pasta, she got the Chicken Piccata.  We waited over 30 minutes for the food to arrive and then noticed that the Stuffed mushrooms never made it to the table.  I could&#39;ve grown my own mushrooms in that time. The waitress apparently forgot to put it in the system and then blamed it on the kitchen. Now that&#39;s some high-class service. But I get it, I blame my farts on the dog whenever it slides by someones nose. <br><br>Aside from that, the food was okay. The Shrimp Bistro had good flavor but the texture could&#39;ve been a bit crispier. I took a bite of the Chicken Piccata and enjoyed the citrus component of the dish. If it wasn&#39;t for the company, I&#39;d give it 2 stars but we had some good laughs about it. <br><br>Just don&#39;t bring a date here for anything special.  That&#39;d be a paramount mistake ending with a cheesecake in your face.

I give this place 3 stars because I have ordered so many things were they screwed up then I am still upset. BUT I now only order things I have tried so for that reason I would give it a 5 <br><br>I love heir buffalo blast appetizers as well as their avocado roll appetizer. As far as a meal goes, I only get the ranch bbq chicken salad or their children Alfredo pasta. <br><br>One thing I hate about this place is that heir portions are way to bigggg!!

Let me start by saying their staff at the door are arrogant when they greet you! They junk they&#39;re doing you a favor.. second, food is not that great so what I usually order is the Thai lettuce wrap, very good!... what really struck me was that they are actually suggesting a 22% gratuity when their restaurant is not even a 3 or 4 star!!!!... I have never seen a suggested 22% gratuity on any high end restaurant!.. such ass ostreros la buca, moza osteria, bestia, etc. Not even at Patina in DTLA.... if you are suggesting 22% gratuity you better make sure your service is flawless and high quality food, AND....... NOT A CHAIN RESTAURANT LIKE Mac Donald&#39;s!

My mom and sister love this place because they offer So much variety and it&#39;s close to where we work. <br>We usually get a margarita pizza and side caesar salad for the table to share which is the best pizza I&#39;ve ever had. It&#39;s so thin, crispy and just right. The salad is also crunchy and creamy enough, it&#39;s just the garlic in it is sometimes hard to digest. <br>The tex mex eggrolls are also a winner on our table, it&#39;s just a bit spicy. <br>So my favorite thing on the menu is the americana cheeseburger. It&#39;s the best cheeseburger I&#39;ve ever had, it is So cheesy, meaty and filling. Just eat this and it&#39;s all you need for the whole day lol <br>Chicken Marsala is also a nice comfort food<br>Service is also overal always 3-4/5<br>Will always be back, thanks!

Took the family out to eat dinner at this Cheesecake Factory in a Saturday night about 7:00.  As usual the wait was 1 hour for a peak night. We always are pleased with the food at CF so we put our name down. At this CF they take your phone number and send you a text when your table is ready which is nice.  This way you can roam around the Americana shopping area. Usually you are given a flashing pager and you can&#39;t leave the front lobby area so they texting method is nice. We went to Barnes and Noble for a bit and before you know it our table was ready. <br>Again the food here is great, come hungry because the portions are large. The menu usually has something for everyone in your group including kids. I had the fish and chips for the first time there and wasn&#39;t disappointed.  5 big pieces and lots of fries. The slaw was tasty too.  Service was great, our waiter kept out glasses full and checked in often even with the full restaurant. <br>Had to take some of our plates home but that&#39;s ok - lunch leftovers the next day. So much food no room for cheesecake.  Although when I do get cheesecake it&#39;s awesome. <br>So there is a wait but is you don&#39;t mind and appreciate good service and lots of delicious food I recommend cheesecake factory. If the place is crowded the food must be good enough to wait.

Never seems to fail me except when I don&#39;t order cheesecake. The other meals are good but just not their specialty. If you decide to come here, come for the cheesecake.<br>Also, Majid was a great host to my buddy and I. Very friendly and personable.

Slow, and unorganized. Had to wait for 30+mins for our pasta. Our server had an attitude. WTH?! <br>Lucky them I did not have low sugar, or else I would have flipped out! Oh yeah, loved the breads so, my sugar was in check!

I just called and tried to place an order  and a lack of customer service and  of phone  skills girl by the name of Britney answered and kept hang up the phone THREE times.  Stupid girl should just go home and  Learn how to treat customers.

I feel funny eating at the Cheesecake Factory because there so many great local places to eat but the food is consisted &amp; they do curbside which is great when I have my daughter in her car seat and I don&#39;t want to disturb her. Great views and a busy bar area.
I would never eat at this place again.  This was the second time I had food poisoning from eating there.

Worst fucking experience at a Cheesecake Factory ever in my life! I waited 2 hours for food and they did NOTHING to make up for it! I&#39;ve never seen worse customer service in my life. I have no idea how a place this horrible stays open! Totally regret ever coming here! We came to celebrate 2 birthdays and a graduation and they made it hell for me. DISGUSTING!!!

Horrible Service!!! Rude hostess. They can&#39;t give you set time. They told we will call you soon. Even after I had told them that my sister was pregnant and couldn&#39;t wait too long. Simply the worst!

I love the Cheesecake Factory for it&#39;s wide assortment of American food and of course, cheesecake!<br><br>The Cheesecake Factory also has the best kind of appetizer bread to exist, in my humble opinion. I live for the dark brown bread!! <br><br>Great place to have a fancy dinner or family brunch. Especially in the location at the Americana, it is a beautiful restaurant with a gorgeous outdoor view of the water fountain.

Closest Cheesecake factory if you&#39;re in the Glendale, Silverlake, Highland Park area.<br><br>It&#39;s located in the Americana right next to a Sprinkles Cupcakes.<br><br>If you&#39;re on a budget I definitely recommend coming on a weekday during their Happy Hour which happens 4pm-6pm.<br><br>Make sure you ask for the specific happy hour menu, sometimes they forget to do so.<br><br>The appetizers are still the same portion as if you were going to order during the normal times.<br><br>The best bang for your back are the spinach and cheese dip w/ chips and the friend chicken sliders.<br><br>Cheesecake Factory is a reliable go-to. :D

Came here for my birthday tonight with a party of six, and honestly we aren&#39;t the easiest people to tend to. But Jennifer accommodated us so well! She was very attentive despite how busy they were. The food was delicious and thanks to Jennifer we also had excellent service!

Celebration cheesecake ($8.50+tax):  Tastes like a slice of cake.  Good size &amp; nice appearance.  Decent taste but not the best cheesecake of theirs IMO.<br><br>Pumpkin cheesecake:  seasonal.  Good pumpkin flavor and smooth texture. Would get again if craving.<br><br>Overall:  the to go service here for cheesecake is horrible.  They say they&#39;ll call you when they have your cheesecake ready but I have consistently waited much longer than necessary and have to ask when their workers are not focused. Don&#39;t set my expectation by saying you&#39;ll get me if you don&#39;t follow through.  Basic customer service 101.

Used to love this location but on a recent visit the bathroom was filthy, the service was terrible and a dish was made with so much pepper flakes it ruined my appetite. Will not be returning to place at all.

Not sure if they changed cooks but everything was over-cooked! Pasta too soft, fried calamari flour was thick and hard (we&#39;ve always had it light and crunchy but not dry), chicken also overcooked and dry, and for a $20 pasta dish my husband got 4 shrimps only (the rest was pasta and tomato). Quality went down, super disappointed.

So we went here for my sister&#39;s birthday and the food was A+ (I got the Monte Cristo sandwich for Sunday Brunch) and the service was A+ but my forks were dirty. I was holding on to a piece of cheese or something crusted onto the underside of the fork??? So I was like no biggie, I got another fork here. But nope. That one was crusty at the end, too, but on the top side and not as much but still ew. LOL.<br>So yay for service and food. Ew to the dirty forks

I love Cheesecake Factory but this has to be one of the worst location. Super packed, but understandable since its in Americana. Took 2 1/2 hours for our party of 8 plus 3 kids. <br><br>We were finally sat and we ordered 3 appetizers to start. Buffalo wings, wontons and the calamari. All of the appetizers were bomb like always but one of their buffalo wings were way under cooked. They need to watch out for those type of things. Our server OW was nice enough to bring it up to management and they handled it for us. <br><br>We ordered all of our main lunch entrees, majority of us got pasta. I tried the bistro shrimp pasta and omg it was so bomb! I&#39;ve tried the pesto before but this one tasted way better! Good suggestion from my boyfriends sister in law. <br><br>Taste was delicious! Portion size was pretty big for a lunch size but worth it. Overall after a rough beginning everything ended well. Our server OW was on point, attentive and kind.

I love this place! The wait time can be a little long but it is worth the wait. Their mashed potatoes and chicken bellagio are awesome. I could never leave this place without having my S&#39;mores cheesecake. Everything is delicious and the cheesecake is to die for. Also our server Connor was on top of everything, super helpful and overall great service.

Cheesecake factory is like my second home!! Since high school, my girls and I came here every friday to eat and update each other. Perfect location for outdoor seatings, high energy of people! <br><br>We especially love this location, SHOPPING PARADISE :) Also, perfect area to visit if you have a bf or a gf, very fancy and romantic. Just be careful with all the tourists with cameras flashing at you lol<br><br>Service here has always been great, come and checks on us frequently. Theres never time where our drinks were empty. I forgot what its called but try something like strawberry lemonade :) rich with flavors. Btw, I&#39;ve been ordering the same dish for the past years. I only eat fettuccini alfredo and pasta carbonara with a lot of lemons and tabasco sauce.. Yes, I destroy the true taste of the pasta but thats how I like mine :D fantastic! Each plate is about 10-14 depending on if I order shrimp with mine.  <br><br>Should try this location for their ambience, great service &amp; food. Perfect for group of girls tired from shopping too much.

I usually avoid commercial restaurants but my husband and I were given a gift certificate to The Cheesecake Factory and decided to go for lunch this afternoon.<br><br>Upon first glance, the menu seems to have so many options! I had a hard time deciding between the firecracker salmon, Vietnamese shrimp spring rolls, angel hair pasta, and grilled avocado club, but ultimately decided on the veggie burger with a gluten free bun. <br><br>I love the company&#39;s history, mission statement, and their goal to make each meal custom how you like it. The ambience is nice and I also love the courtesy bread. <br><br>The food... Was delicious. My husband ordered a margarita pizza, and the crust was absolutely perfect. My burger was a mouthful filled with all the right fixings. I appreciate the presentation as well - with the little cups of Ketchup and separate container for the fries. <br><br>Our server was great. The only reason I&#39;m giving it 4 stars is because I was still working on my food when he snatched the plate from beneath me. I still had food in my hand thinking maybe he was going to put the rest in a box? Nope.<br><br>Overall our experience was good and I&#39;d recommend it to anyone shopping at the Glendale Galleria.
For being a chain restaurant there food is pretty dang good. I love the cheese cake obviously, specially the Godiva one. But I always come back for the Chicken Bilagio.

Terrible attitudes and the food prep to go was disgusting. I wouldn&#39;t recommend it to go at all. Definitely going on my blogs &#34;service of shame&#34; where about 235+ in the Glendale area read and share my stuff. Thanks for nothing. Two stars as one segment shouldn&#39;t shame the rest.

Had dinner the other night in the back of the restaurant and over heard a table complain of roaches. <br><br>The bathrooms were disgusting and some of the servers had attitudes.<br><br>The only good thing I could possibly say about this restaurant is that the host and hostesses are attractive and lovely to look at.<br><br>However I won&#39;t be coming here often.

First time trying this Cheesecake Factory and this did the job of what you expect from Cheesecake Factory. I had the four cheese pasta with chicken my favorite from CF and it was really good. Previous CF&#39;s I&#39;ve been to have served warm or near cold dishes but this was one was really good. Definitely recommend for quick cheap meal to visit here. Also loved the drinks served I ordered a whiskey smash and it&#39;s my new favorite.

Had the beet and goat cheese salad which was enjoyable.  I wouldn&#39;t recommend the avocado toast, too much bread; perhaps on a whole wheat or grain bread would be more suitable than a baguette. For each is their own, I guess. Overall it was a pleasant night and the service was satisfactory.

Four stars just because of the service , every time I go the waitresses or waiters are very slow with brining anything . I understand it&#39;s a very busy spot and it take time but always over an hour is too crazy . Just hire more people or get better staff that check on people&#39;s plates very often . <br>But regardless it&#39;s a must stop by place . The food is always good and drinks are overloaded with greatness ! <br>It&#39;s a little to crowed due to it being in the Americana but the good part is that you can see the stores while waiting .

I hardly ever leave any reviews but I think this incident is pretty ridiculous not to write about. I went to Cheesecake Factory with my sister and mom everything was great but as we left, my sister realized she had left her phone. When we went back,  the front desk said no one turned in any phone but they let us go check by the table that we were sitting at and still nothing. After a long search we went home we tracked her phone with find my iPhone app and location showed that it&#39;s still at Cheesecake Factory and kept moving back and fort. Clearly it was on someone who was still inside and in constant movement. Any idiot would assume its a waiter or a waitress, I doubt anyone would be there for longer than three hours unless it&#39;s someone working there. Meanwhile the entire time the phone was still on. So we drove back assuming someone had turned in the phone and this person was holding on to it. As we got back there we spoke to the supervisor and waitress who was waiting our table, we showed her that the phone location shows that it&#39;s still in here and she said she&#39;ll go look for us and then she disappeared, next thing we realize the phone magically turns off after a min we mentioned this to them. The other person I&#39;m not too sure if he was a supervisor or not but he sure was acting like he owned the place. He rudely told us you&#39;re welcome to go look for your phone on the floors and go bother the people at the tables but we don&#39;t have your phone, and told us to step away from the area. This was such a disgusting incident. Such low people. I&#39;m sure the phone won&#39;t turn up but maybe this will help the owners of the place or ones actually caring what happens to this place realize that the workers who steal from customers are more than likely stealing from their bosses.
I made a yelp account just to write this lol <br>I&#39;ve been coming here since I was a kid and they&#39;ve always been extremely nice and high quality food :)

Worst customer service, the employees passed by us 3 times and didnt even acknowledge us. Sat us in the middle where the sun was hitting us making it even more uncomfortable. Then we sit play the waiting game 15 mins and still no one attended us. Never coming again

This is my absolute favorite Cheesecake Factory location! The service we received was phenomenal! Had the best waiter! The location is also awesome beacause it&#39;s right inside the Americana! Shop, eat, watch a movie and enjoy the view! Love the happy hour specials which include the fire roasted artichoke, buffalo blasts and mini sliders!

Just wanted to separate the server her name is PJ she has exceptional customer service which I have not seen in this cheesecake for a while thank you for having employees like PJ she sure is a jem to ur team
Huge wait for rushed food. I&#39;ve been to much better run locations. This one needs a new manager

The food is great but the cleanliness of this place is terrible. My wife and I had opened two wrapped silverware and they still had food on them and one napkin had a lipstick stain. It&#39;s ridiculous that these essentials were not cleaned properly. Check your silverware and plates before you eat wherever you go.

Unprofessional staff, we walked in and requested outside seating and were told would take 30 min after waiting 30 minutes our name was called and tried seating us inside we said we had requested outside seating, we were told it would take another 20 minutes

Just stop by for a light snack. The weather is beautiful today, great atmosphere. The food was great and our waitress was amazing.  Thanks Jocelyn for the amazing customer service.. You were very attentive and moved throughout your tables very efficiently. CHEF ROB would be proud of you.  Pure awesomeness. And BOHAN  although you have little arms the Beard makes up 4 it. Haha. You have a great personality and good sense of humor. Cheesecake is lucky to have you....

You have probably already read about how great this place is. It&#39;s nearly always crowded.  Make sure you either make a reservation or get there early. <br><br>The food is appetizing.  Our main course was the Luau salad, which was awesome.  It has grilled chicken breast layered with mixed greens, cucumbers, green onions, red and yellow peppers, green beans, carrots, mango and crisp wontons with macadamia nuts and sesame seeds tossed in their vinaigrette.  Piled high- it&#39;s an impressive sight.  We started with Tex Mex eggrolls- comprised of a yummy spicy chicken, corn, black beans, peppers, onions and melted cheese served with sour cream and salsa.<br><br>And for weight watchers delight, they just added a whole menu with calorie counts at 2 levels.

Their bread still fresh n <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwarm.my&amp;s=8d6ba9082394bf06670c1effd046088e21f892b846f20670b77a37cc8b4ab81d" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">warm.my</a> Neverending jambalaya seafood pasta taste the same n original cheesecake still best as ever.

I&#39;ve been to this location 2 times and both times was great!  The first time I came I had a long, complicated take-out order yet they got everything right and were super friendly.  The second time I came (recently) was on a Saturday when they are insanely busy/packed; however, my wait time was not too bad and we didn&#39;t have to wait forever and a day for the food to arrive!<br>Great location too.

Waiter was super nice! (Gordon?) dinner was a nice time as well.... Until we spotted not only 1 roach but 2!!!! At our booth that came out In-between the booth seats and the wall. 1st roach was small and 2nd roach was bigger and waiter came around at the time we were trying to take photo of it and notified the manager. <br>I hope something is done about this. <br>Imagine? 2 roaches coming out during the busiest time of the restaurant. When it&#39;s super loud and busy. I&#39;m sure there is more in this place. <br><br>We ended up getting free dessert for everyone at the table and took it to-go but  it still got us grossed out. <br><br>Keep an eye out for those gross things!

Who doesn&#39;t like cheesecake factory! It&#39;s always my go to! They have a HUGE variety of food items.. their corn tamales are Devine so full of flavor and delish! The burgers and fries are so yummy with honey and ranch! The green mint ice tea is sooo good! <br>Of course you can&#39;t go wrong with the complimentary bread basket and butter... nom nom nom! <br>Must try dishes...<br>* Bang Bang chicken <br>*Belliago chicken <br>*Parmsean chicken sandwich <br>*Dynamite shrimp <br>*Salmon <br>They make their alcohol nice and shift!<br>Super nice servers! <br>Always a good experience!
For you Mexican food lovers, try their Baja fish tacos!<br>I got half grilled half fried and it was amazing.<br><br>Huge portions. A LOT OF FLAVOR.

I still have the food stuck in my throat from the bartenders&#39; (plural) neglect to serve me a drink - just because the entire bar wants to watch the Western Conference Finals and you guys have to switch from your precious Hockey game, doesn&#39;t mean you don&#39;t have to stop serving your reoccurring customers..<br><br>You&#39;re lucky we tipped you, ingrates.

The pyramid of flavor power. <br><br>We all know this place offers, from the top down, everything under the food chain arranged with inspiration from every corner of the globe...on one menu. Then bread and butter and/or oil and balsamic on request, and dammit if that bread isn&#39;t addicting. Tall glasses of any beverage that make bringing Europeans here a real treat. <br><br>Cheesecake pioneered gluttony in the 1980&#39;s (as far as I knew, but &#39;78 upon looking it up) when they began as a sandwich shop in Bev&#39;s Hills. Big sandwich&#39;s, then big portions became all the rage. And it was good. I&#39;m here to report it still is today. <br><br>Speaking of the bread, it was about a year or two ago I noticed they changed the yeast they were using to produce the sourdoughs, which made a HUGE difference in the structure and flavor of the bread. How the hell they implement that across 180 or so locations is probably a news segment worthy of producing, and an surprisingly interesting one to watch. <br><br>When we think of chain restaurants, the title is not one of glamour. So how is a chain restaurant defined? 5 restaurants? 10? It&#39;s technically 2 or more, with a unified architecture regarding both the type of food, and sometimes the construction of the building. Cheesecake therefor qualifies. But that does not make it bad. <br><br>In fact, the chicken parm sandwich was served on this new sourdough, with their perfect tenderized and fried chicken (yet why the fried chicken salad was taken away I&#39;ll never know), and very tomato-y marinara, making it a great sandwich.<br><br>Sitting at the bar allowed for an insight into the bartender&#39;s life in a 300+ seat restaurant pouring enormous drinks. Busy. Yet still the service was exemplary. Yes. That stupid word. Mostly because &#34;great&#34; sounds like when someone describes someone as &#34;neat&#34;, but when they mean it in a good way.<br><br>The guac was solid too. Really. Chicken wings, just right. Not reinvented, but done well. People are surprised when I say this. Why do people have to hate? Because of the butter thing?<br><br>Sure, they put butter in everything. And when it can&#39;t be butter, it is another fat the vegans and vegetarians can all agree on. But so what? Isn&#39;t this what those diners that we all love to love because we find something charming in their dinginess offer the world? Okay, I lost some of you there, but that is fine. Those left standing probably agree: It&#39;s a Jersey diner on a national level. And it&#39;s good.<br><br>Just bring back the fried chicken salad. I realize it&#39;s not a healthy salad. That&#39;s not why I go to a place named after the most fattening form of dessert ever invented - sugary cream with a buttered graham cracker crust. Or keep coming up with new dishes. <br><br>I&#39;m a fan. I&#39;ll be back.
We went there for our son birthday and we wait for an hour for our food. Really bad experience for a special day. Never go back to Cheesecake factory.
I ordered bang2 chicken and shrimp it wasn&#39;t to my liking. A bit disappointed but it was my daughters bday. But the server was awesome!
Food is amazing here, and our server Gilbert was fantastic (never had a better server!)

Their food is not bad but my fav dish is chicken bellagio. I LOVE their cheesecake its just amazing &amp; the outside patio is very cute. <br>I am a regular here &amp; never had any problems with this place,

worst experience ever...<br><br>We order 4 dishes and everything was good as usual except steak.  I asked for medium however, steak came out as outer ring was burned and fully cooked and center ring was rare. asked waitress what happened to my steak... she sighed then told me that that&#39;s perfect medium should be... um.. what?   i am not talking about outside and inside/center layer... explained again and showed her again.  she gave me &#34;look&#34; and repeat herself... that&#39;s what medium is. What??   i didn&#39;t touch all the burned 2/3 of steak.  don&#39;t order steak here or question. you will get look down.
we are waiting for more than 1 hour. there customer service was very bad. I nerver come back

Horrible! Horrible!! My family waited 1.5hrs only to be told to wait another 45mins for a table. AND I cleared it with the on site manager who agreed that I leave a negative review on their location. Wow! Talk about inexplainable service by a manager! Never again! Where is the negative star rating!?!
My meal wasn&#39;t what I expected it to be, but waitress was really nice her name is Andrea. On top of it all the plate was extremely dirty and we waited extra 10 minutes for our salad.

Pre-ordered a 6&#34; original cheesecake for a bday party. Gave them 48 hour notice. Got a call while I was on my way to pick it up (10 minutes to agreed upon pick-up time: 11a) saying they were so sorry but they sold out of the 6&#34; original. <br><br>Sold out. Of original cheesecake. At Cheesecake Factory...<br><br>And what&#39;s the point of asking people to pre-order if they can&#39;t manage the orders properly? <br><br>Thankfully this is the Americana location and I was able to get a last minute cake elsewhere.
i just ordered delivery and one of my dishes was a $17 fettucine. the portion is a joke. i can&#39;t believe they have the audacity to send this small plate and charge me $17. absolutely ridiculous

Came tonight and and every time I come the waiter is polite but NOT TONIGHT. I came with a party of 7 and was attended by a waiter which he didnt introduce himsekf by the way ,after that we saw Connor. He came and introduced himself while walking away which was rude. We let that go but once he came back and served our food, I was missing ketchup and fries. He said, &#34;let me know if you need anything&#34; and I said &#34;ketchup please&#34; but he flew. He came back for another table and i tried to flag him down but he didn&#39;t pay no attention. I had to scream and finally he turned after several attempts. I&#39;m not sure why he was being rude and having no patience. I know it&#39;s a busy night but we usually have a party of 15 and never treated this way.

The menu is ridiculous. So many pages of different dishes they created a book for their menu. The appetizers alone take up 3 whole pages! <br><br>I&#39;ve been here several times, and the food is hit or miss. I love the caesar salad, their tex mex egg rolls and the sweet corn tamale cakes are great, and of course the endless cheesecake is always a selling point. <br><br>But today I tried the chicken chipotle pasta. It was not good. It tastes like a taco, but in pasta form. I thought the peas were an odd vegetable choice, and the dish was topped with these fried tortilla chips. Just bizarre.

I used to love their factory chopped salad. It used to be made with crisp fresh lettuce. <br>Not anymore! It came to the table and most of the lettuce was brown. Like it was weeks old lettuce. <br>I wanted to tell them to take it back but  didn&#39;t but I left disappointed and thought what a waste of my money because they charge about 12.50 for the salad. <br><br>I&#39;ll never go back there. <br><br>Had a lemonade that was good though.... That&#39;s why I gave them two stars.

Went for lunch on a weekday. Seemed pretty busy but didn&#39;t wait long for a party of six. Our waitress was decent and the wait for our orders was not too long. Had the avocado toast and the chicken tacos which is always a good start. Their squaw bread is addicting and by the time I got my dinner size Chinese chicken salad i was satisfied and couldn&#39;t finish. My friend had their new Celebration Cheesecake and raved about it. Parking is usually at the structure next to the Americana and they do validate but only a certain amount of time. Love that they are consistent and their large food selection. Quality is ok.

came in and sat down for over 30 minutes without even being offered a glass of water. had to flag someone down for water, then 15 minutes later had to ask to order food, only to be ignored. y&#39;all have some serious staffing issues you need to figure out. 0/10 would never return and doesn&#39;t even qualify as a restaurant in my opinion. g a r b a g e

Currently sitting in a booth at The Shitcake Factory and I happened to say aloud that I was enjoying the song playing- ain&#39;t no mountain high enough by Marvin Gaye and Tammi Terrell- when they changed the station to some depressing 2005 music. So If you ever want to kill anybody&#39;s mood and bring them back to music that should have stayed in 2005...the Cheesecake Factory is your place. Giving 1 star because I&#39;m a generous (and now moody) ass bitch.

I&#39;ve taken my family and kids to Glendale cheesecake factory to celebrate my coming home from deployment.  Our order was taken at 2:15 but did not get our order until 3:00.  This was after reminding our server for our food and not getting an update and also asking a different server.  Finally, the manager came out and explained that they were busy at the back.  I&#39;ve mentioned that the tables around us, who arrived much later than us, had their meals served already.  Manager apologized and comp the meals that we&#39;ve been waiting for, which arrived after an additional 15 mins.  We&#39;ve decided to place everything to go since the kids had fallen asleep with an empty stomach already.  We ended up discarding the food since they&#39;re all cold and unappetizing by the time we got home.  I thank the manager for talking us.  However, I rather receive our meals on time or at least let us know what&#39;s going on.  I hope this won&#39;t happen to other families.

I love the location of this place. It&#39;s in the Americana so you can either walk around as you&#39;re waiting for a table, or you can walk around after you eat because you will be so full. This place is always busy but I know why. <br><br>This is a great place to go for a romantic dinner because the ambience is dark and there are candles on the tables and if you sit outside there is a view of the fountain with the water show. You can also come here for group events or birthdays and they will sing happy birthday to you. <br><br>I always get some sort of pasta. Of course I love their bread as well not just because it&#39;s free, but the Brown bread with oats is my favorite because it is so fluffy and delicious with butter :-) my favorite is the four cheese pasta and the chicken marsala

Its The Cheesecake Factory, everything is generic, the staff is decent, the food is decent, at the Americana specifically the parking is structured 2 hours free. If you want a decent meal but nothing special for around twenty bucks this is the place for you. <br><br>If you are looking for a wow factor this isn&#39;t the place for you.<br><br>Side note: there area few gems on the menu. See pictures.
We had an amazing time and enjoyed delicious food. Really good service from Christopher. He was really attentive and kind. Coming back soon.

The food here is sometimes good but some times not so great. All the times I had been here the service was amazing but this time I went the service was not so great. The waitress didn&#39;t smile, wasn&#39;t friendly, talked with a attitude with my friend and I and hardly came to check up on us. Maybe the whole hour we had stayed there she only came once and that was about it.
Can never go wrong with Cheesecake Factory good food with some good service. Don&#39;t leave without picking a cheesecake!!

This is my first time going to TCF &amp; my experience was great. The only thing I regret is ordering the nachos. They&#39;re American styled with very thick mixture of cheeses. I felt like I asked for that one who orders nachos at a pasta place? Aside from that the mixed drinks were amazing and so was the dessert. The service was good. We also went at an earlier time because as we were leaving it got extremely busy. I had the Vanilla Bean Cheesecake it was amazing. I had a Strawberry Daiquiri for my mixed drink and a Pink Lemonade with vodka.

It&#39;s a tradition for me to come here every year for my birthday. The portions at Cheesecake never fail to disappoint. Our favorites include the orange chicken, meatloaf, Renee&#39;s special, most of their sandwiches, and the chicken piccata. <br><br>The ambiance is nice and dimly lit for a romantic atmosphere. Be warned, during dinner hours expect to wait 30-45 minutes for a table. <br><br>A disappointing downside is that they always seem to sit us at the back of the restaurant in the brunt ends of the booths facing the kitchen. It&#39;s been off putting a few times to be situated in the poor seats. <br><br>Also, Drake has those lyrics about &#34;why you gotta fight with me at Cheesecake?&#34; Well, the last time we were there some spoiled teenagers created a commotion, yelling at the waitress and demanding service. It was distasteful and the manager had to come out and intervene. You get crowds like this sometimes.

Horrible and really bad service . Employees are very picky whom they choose to seat ! <br><br>After a long days work thought I&#39;d wind down the day by enjoying a nice dinner and enjoying the people and atmosphere . <br><br>Employees at the booth were very biggest ! After all the wait and pass ups  and other customers whom came after us that was picked to be seated ,   my wife and I were finally seated at the same cold lonely place in the restaurant again!!! <br><br>Not a recommendation to dine at Cheesecake at the Americana <br><br>It show 1 star review . How ever this rating for us has no star review AT ALL

We love Cheesecake Factory! Rosio served us today and she was very attentive, went back twice because we asked for the wrong side sauce still with a smile on her face. Love the location, if you&#39;re in a hurry I do not recommend, but their in a shopping center so it&#39;s fun to walk around after your meal. Great cheesecakes!

I love this place!!! The Cheesecake&#39;s menu is great and they have everything I like to eat. Their waiters are always nice and they try to make their customers happy. I wish every place would have such great customer service. I should say that the prices are not that high as well.

I love happy hour here! The food options and the prices are amazing. But the service not so much. Well the bartenders are cool and attentive, but when I don&#39;t sit directly at the bar I basically have to serve myself. I usually stop by on my lunch break, so I have less than an hour to eat my two appetizers and drink my water. On more than one occasion, I&#39;ve been served my food and completely left after that. I&#39;ve had to flag down other servers to bring me condiments, utensils, and even my check when I get ready to leave. At one point the manager came over to apologize. And though I appreciated that, I was surprised when he didn&#39;t offer me anything. Not a discount on my bill, a drink, or even a slice of cheesecake. I recommend corporate mandating a workshop/training course on how to make customers happy when your team constantly drops the ball.

Like what i promised, this is my updated review of my experience at Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>I went back to this place again, not to eat, but to share to the manager-on-duty my family&#39;s unpleasant experience on our 30th wedding anniversary last Saturday, January 13 at Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>I spoke to the manager, Natasya ( I hope I got the spelling of her name correct), and shared to her the details of our lunch there at Cheesecake Factory.  From the servers to the mistakes of our food, I detailed to her the specifics of what happened. <br><br>On her part, she pointed that I should had called the attention of the restaurant manager on that very minute or day. They could easily have rectified or corrected the mistakes or the complaints about the service we received.<br><br>I explained to her that I wanted to do that except that I didn&#39;t want to ruin that day because it was our anniversary. I also added that the service was already bad at the start on the moment we sat down. And that continually calling the attention of the manager or the servers would be redundant and ridiculous and would had created more tension. <br><br>I avoided to be confrontational. <br><br>Natasya was very nice and very professional. She wrote down all the details of our conversation.  I commend her for that. <br><br>She said that she will report this matter to their corporate office and that they will either call me or write me a letter on their response on this incident.<br><br>As a customer, I felt important to them during my talk to Natasya. She made me feel that Cheesecake Factory value my business. <br><br>For this reason, I give them now 3 stars. <br><br>Thank you.

Good food. Not the greatest service. Had to literally check myself to see what ingredients came in my pasta since the server told me an ingredient didn&#39;t come in it - even though it did. Had to order another side of it. Never got an apology.

I came to this restaurant with high expectation and boy was it meant thanks to Edgar our server! He recommended couple of plates for me and my girlfriend! Without a doubt they were delicious! Someone give him a raise that&#39;s what you call Great customer service! thanks again Edgar! 100%

I had an excellent dinner experience today at The Cheesecake Factory in the Americana.  My girlfriend and I came on a Saturday night around 7pm expecting it to be absolutely packed, which it was.  My wait time was anticipated to be around an hour and a half but they had found me a table within 45 mins or so!  After being seated I was still curious to see if the service would be a little slow due to volume of people they needed to cater to but our server Gilbert was right here with us for anything we needed.  The drinks, appetizers, entrees, and dessert followed after one another in a timely fashion.  I couldn&#39;t have asked for more, especially on a night as busy as this one.  The food tasted fabulous as well.  If you are looking for a pasta recommendation, my go to is always the Pasta Carbonara. <br><br>Will definitely be coming back again.   THX CHEESYCAKEZZZZ

Food is always pretty much on point. Solid veggie burger. Big portions and they tend to have very attentive and friendly waiters. The bread is great and they give you a lot. Both the white and whole wheat. And in a nice location in front of the fountain at the Americana

I got terrible food poisoning. I was throwing up and almost lost all the water in my body. I almost wound up in the hospital. Don&#39;t eat here. I ordered the chicken parm. It was the worst decision of my life. I will never be eating here again. I am extremely disappointed because I love the Cheesecake but now I can&#39;t trust this restaurant because of what happened.

Cheesecake Factory is what it is!  And while you can&#39;t expect something new or gourmet, you can always expect cheap prices and lots of food.  Their happy hour is especially a good deal!  The service is always spot on.<br><br>I don&#39;t come here to be blown away.  I just come here when I am hungry and with a big group.  It doesn&#39;t take much to get a fill.

Yummy can never go wrong with the Cheesecake Factory. What I love about this restaurant is the different culture types of food they have. I love how they&#39;re not stingy on the playing portions and always gladly bring extra of anything you request.

I love this restaurant a lot , but today , after I checked in ( which was the first time I didn&#39;t wait for ever) , our waiter didn&#39;t have any idea of customer service , no smile (looks like she is not happy with her job ) , I order avocado roll , I never got it , my child order side of fruit with his food , we didn&#39;t get it , and then we had to tell other waiter to bring it for us , she never checked how our food was or do we need any refill in our drinks .<br>I order chicken salad ( hey where is the chicken ) I count it , I count it , was less than 10 pieces in there ( I am not paying for lettuce) , I am so disappointed, I love this restaurant, why they are doing this , it is a busy restaurant, then they should hire employees that they really happy to perform services, I am not a bitch , but sometimes you know , that side comes out , specially when comes to my food
The wait is always way too long... the food is good.. they need to higher more staff... but the cheesecake is so good
Servers are attentive :) Food is good, big servings. I would suggest sharing. Only thing though is the wait for the table is kinda long.

Just finished dinner with my boyfriend. Had a ton of delicious food &amp; everything was freshly served &amp; we didn&#39;t wait a long time. Jennifer W. was our server and her service was amazing. She was also serving the table next to us &amp; she was very detailed about certain food on the menu. Her service really made our experience tonight a lovely one. Thanks so much for a nice time Jennifer! You started our year on a positive dinner note.

Located at the Americana at Brand in Glendale, this is one of the nicer Cheesecake Factory that I&#39;ve been to.  This place is always packed.  It doesn&#39;t matter what time of the day you go, there&#39;s always a wait.  Food is always yummy and service is good.<br><br>My fav dish here is Evelyn&#39;s Favorite Pasta.  It&#39;s penne pasta tossed with eggplants, broccoli, sun dried tomatoes, artichokes, bell peppers and pine nuts...Mmmmmmm healthy!  If you&#39;re not a fan of creamy and saucy pasta dishes (like I am), you will love this dish!  It&#39;s light, full of veggies and oh so yummilicious!  <br><br>Their Miso Salmon dish is quite tasty as well.  It&#39;s a grilled salmon filet drizzled with teriyaki sauce atop a bed of white or brown rice with five snap peas in a pool of creamy miso and teriyaki sauce.  The sauces were a lil too sweet for my liking but complemented well with the salmon and rice.  The salmon was very tender and didn&#39;t have that fishy smell or taste, thumbs up!  I was impressed with the presentation of the dish, very nice! :)<br><br>For cheesecakes, I love the Vanilla Bean and the Ultimate Red Velvet.  Both are so Yummy and so bad for you :)  Their slice of Red Velvet Cheesecake is massive! Don&#39;t be a pig and plan on sharing this collossal piece of yumminess.  Trust me, your body will thank me. <br><br>Cheesecake Factory:  great food, good service, reasonably priced and big portions!

I always love the set up and layout of any Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>I&#39;ve never been a fan of the food, but I think it&#39;s because I&#39;ve been ordering wrong this entire time!  They&#39;re salads are amazing, they&#39;re the pre mix kind. So forget about picking it if your just trying to be healthy.. It&#39;s the yummy, enough dressing, enough cheese and just flavorful. <br><br>And of course dessert! Yummy!!

So I went to Cheesecake Factory on Valentines night with my wife, first of all it was slightly busy but not overly crowded because we arrived at 5:30 pm, they sat us at a small table. The food was very average I had spaghetti and meatballs... the noodles weren&#39;t cooked properly and it wasn&#39;t hot, the meatballs were cold, noodles completely stiff, how do you not get spaghetti and meatballs correct that&#39;s a super easy dinner to make....Ok getting to the end of our meal, we paid and when the waiter returned my card was missing... I noticed right away and flagged down the waiter to come back... I said my card isn&#39;t here... he looked at me like I was crazy... then he looked and looked and still no card... I had to get the manager involved he couldn&#39;t find the card as well, so they lost my card and only would promise to send a gift card for a piece of cheesecake which I haven&#39;t received yet... that&#39;s pathetic... A huge company like cheesecake factory should had offered a dinner....!!!!  so they lost my card and didn&#39;t offer to pay for my dinner or offer any remedy... They just said call back or we will call you to see if we find it so now I&#39;m out of my bank card and having to change all my auto payments and go through all this hassle of my payments and all my bills are screwed up because of Cheesecake Factory... terrible night out at the Glendale cheesecake factory and they act like it&#39;s no big deal... By the way the manager did not act like this was a big deal at all and it is... this is a huge inconvenience to my bills and to the bank and my time and they only offer a piece of cheesecake what a joke never returning again...

Well, our waiter was on the  top of giving us the service that barely deserves 1 star, I wish I could give it 0! Basically after I finished my salad and asked to box it to go he took my plate with the fork on it and the fork dropped on the floor , he picked it up and put it back on the plate!!!!! He put dirty fork from the floor back on the plate with my salad! Unbelievable! I called manager and she said they will make the new one, afterwards he brought the new salad and acted like I was being a bitch and it was not a big deal to him. There were twice as less salad in the box than it was left on my plate. Very disappointed.

There Wasn&#39;t A Wait Which Is Great &amp; We Sat Outside. The Server Was Ok But My Drink Took 25 Minutes To Hit The Table &amp; It Wasn&#39;t Busy. The Apps Came At Different Times 15 Min Apart, Our Burgers Were Over Cooked &amp; My Friends Chicken Sandwich Was Burnt. The Manager Fixed Our Food &amp; Was Very Nice To Us &amp; Gave Us Cheesecake To Make Up For It. (We Still Tipped 20%) Because They Made An Effort To Fox Things!

So yes, the place where one plate can feed 3. Come with a big appetite. There food is very filling, so you might have to get you cheesecakes to go. Overall my server is always upbeat and seems to know what is going on. The wait is kinda long and they don&#39;t take reservations over the phone which is upsetting if you have a party larger than 4-6.<br>Parking only lasts for an hour before you actually have to pay, which can also be troublesome. My favorite dishes here are the avocado eggrolls, Bellagio, and the Oreo Cheesecake. All which have more calories than I want to know.

Just saw how a fork fell in the floor on the disgusting outside patio floor and the waiter grab it and put it in the utensil set and took it to a table. Also all 4 forks in my table for 2 where dirty and I am not talking about water stains I am talking about big dry food chunks. When they change our utensils the new hanker shift had a fresh stain of ketchup on it.  The main dishes were ok, the presentation was OK not great and the flavor was good. But after seeing the lack of higiene we could not eat at ease. I am definitely not eating here again.

I love the Cheesecake Factory! It&#39;s good to go on a day when it&#39;s not packed though because if you go during the holidays and shopping season you&#39;ll have to wait 45+ minutes to be seated. <br><br>The service is usually good except for this one time when I went with my family for my fathers birthday the waiter was a complete JERK! He was inattentive and rude. My dad had asked for chicken Parmesan and the waiter was being condescending and was pretending to not understand what my dad had said. So I yelled &#34;chicken&#34; and he pretended that he couldn&#39;t hear. That was the only time I&#39;ve experienced bad service at this branch. That experience tainted my image of the restaurant. Usually the staff is friendly and they provide us with great service!<br><br>That same day they forgot my sisters pasta order. So everyone had got there food and she had not. Our goat cheese salad also came out with NO goat cheese. It was just a bad experience.<br><br>On the other hand I am fond of most of their food. Like the chicken enchiladas, the jumbalya pasta, their green mint tea, burgers and their original cheesecake is good.<br><br>Not sure if I want to come here as often because of that bad experience though.
The problem with this place is it so disorganized two people were sitting here for two hours while we were waiting for our table which got messed up three times

My daughter bought a slice of cheesecake yesterday.<br>She didn&#39;t realize until today that the cashier failed to give her credit card back. She called to see if they had the credit card and was told yes. So she had to drive <br>a half hour to get the card that should have been returned to her. To make matters worse, she was sent to 3 different people, and had to wait 25 minutes to get the credit card. At one point a rude customer crowded in front of her, and although the cashier saw this, she helped him instead of my daughter. My daughter did not receive an apology. If I were the manager I would have apologized and given a complimentary gift card for the trouble that was caused by the cashier.

I am so very disappointed.  This used to be the best deal - healthy food, huge servings, reasonable prices.  We went tonight because I am recovering from the flu and behind on dishes.  I am so disappointed.  I ordered my usual Chinese Chicken Salad.  There was no wait to get a table, by the way, and I found out why.  I was served a huge plate of iceberg lettuce with a mound of tasteless Chinese noodles on top, with a few bland bites of chicken and canned mandarin orange slices.  What happened to the delicious California greens????!!!!<br><br>I asked the waiter if there had been a menu change, to which he replied simply &#34;yes&#34;.  I told him I was very disappointed in the iceberg lettuce - nobody I know likes it anymore - had anyone else complained?  &#34;No.&#34;  I asked, hypothetically, &#34;Why would they change a thing like that?!&#34;  He replied, &#34;It was a decision by corporate.&#34;<br><br>So there you have it.  Worthless non-nutrition.  Tasteless food.  Not the best way to make money -- this place used to have lines out the door - 45 minute waits - and for good reason.  Now -- well I&#39;m not giving them another chance.  It only takes one lousy meal to lose a long-time customer forever.<br><br>PS-I asked him if they still had baby greens, to which he replied, yes they did (that and romaine (which is similar to iceberg, only slightly better in nutrition) and I asked him if he could bring me a small bowl of it and then I would be satisfied.  I was given a bowl of romaine.  I don&#39;t think he or the kitchen even knew what baby greens are anymore.  I could taste the fillers in my daughter&#39;s meatballs (breadcrumbs and low-quality beef with gristle) as well.

I have been going to different cities for Cheesecake Factory. My husband and I along with our little dog  went 2 nights ago with my step daughter and her BF. ALthough it was a long wait (45 min) for table for 4, I did not mind at all. The staff, they were very nice and courteous. The wait for indoor was less. <br>I have always ordered the same pasta which is the shrimp angel hair. But that night I ordered something else for a change and it was absolutely delicious! Not to mention the amount of food for the price! I had to take 1/2 home and ate it the next day and it was still great!<br><br>The service is excellent and I will come back here again for sure! AAAA+++ rating! Love love love!

Always a crazy wait but always worth it too. Everything I come to Cheesecake Factory I enjoy myself. For me it&#39;s not about how long I wait but the overall experience instead. I love the happy hour from 4-6 amazing deals. My favorite is the Buffalo blasts from the happy hour menu only 5 dollars and huge portions. When I go for dinner I love the Louisiana pasta which has a hint of spice but also so good with the bow tie pasta. You get to walk around Americana during the wait so it&#39;s not so bad.
Always on top of their game, I have never had a problem once at this particular location.<br><br>The portion sizes obviously are massive, but they don&#39;t lack in flavor! Love this place.

I wish I could put zero stars!! I literally had the worst experience at this location and it disappoints me to have to write a negative review as I love and support this franchise so much. It&#39;s unfortunate that this location is closest to me and yet the worst I&#39;ve ever been too. Last week I came in for a nice dinner with my fiancé. We had such a long evening at work and thought we owed it to ourselves To head out for dinner together at one of our faves. Upon arrival, the hostess was very rude and unprofessional. She asked me if I wanted to sit inside or outside, opted for outside and then she laughs and says &#34; oh you can&#39;t sit out there, we&#39;re no longer servicing outside&#34; ... my first thought, was &#34; then why offer&#34; but I let it go. She then has me wait and when we get approached to finally sit inside, the gentlemen tried sitting us at this small table. I did not like it, my husband was not ok with the location but we noticed an available booth right next to it. When I asked the gentlemen if we could sit there he said he needed to notify the front and when he came back informed me that the hostess said we couldn&#39;t sit there and the area was closed. I looked at the time , more than over an hour before closing and yet you restricted me from sitting outside and now in this booth because it was in a &#34;certain area&#34; that is literally 2 tables away from where she wanted to seat me.  At this point my dinner is being ruined, the quality of service is poor, she had no care for my concern and I noticed her smirking when I asked to speak to the manager. The manager took forever to come talk to me which I find unacceptable and when he eventually showed up, I was more disappointed. He had know clue what was going on, never apologized , he just looked overwhelmed and had a face of a man who had just taken 1000 complaints. At this point my fiancé was pissed because it was evident why the employees deliver the service they do; look at the management team! I was just immensely turned off by the lack of concern. the hostess and manager made us feel like they simply could care less . We were just another complaint and they didn&#39;t care to see us stay or leave so we had no choice other than to request a company number to contact and go elsewhere. It&#39;s unfortunate but I&#39;d rather eat an establishment that appreciates my business any day!
It was a cake that taste like cheese and it was awesome. But I should&#39;ve gotten the nachos.. But the cheesecake was awesome.
