Service and food are so amazing!! Especially considering how busy they get, they still manage to get your food out in less than 15 mins, and make sure that you are satisfied. Our waiter was really fast and friendly. Portions of the food were huge even though we got the lunch sizes, I still couldn&#39;t finish it. I wish I could though because it was delicious. Prices aren&#39;t too expensive either, they are good for their portions.

Met here with a group of friends for a late lunch.  We were seated in the patio area which was perfect as we are a noisy bunch.<br><br>Our waitress was very efficient and helpful. Service was fast and the portions are huge.<br><br>I ordered Pasta Da Vinci - noodles were al dente, sauce was delicious.  I was just wondering why I wasn&#39;t offered freshly grated cheese.  Oversight or they just don&#39;t do that - not sure.<br><br>Passionfruit iced tea was refreshing and our waitress came back to refill without being asked.  (The place was crowded so again I must stress the service was good!)<br><br>The girls ordered cheesecake but I opted for coffee instead as I wanted cupcakes from next door.  Great place to meet up with friends!

I&#39;ve been to this place plenty of times and most of the time, it is really busy.  They don&#39;t take reservations, so if you are planning on dining here on a Friday or Saturday, definitely come early.  With recent additions of new business in the Americana or across the street from the newly remodeled Glendale Galleria, the Americana at Brand is sure to see a lot of people.  They seem to have done away with the paging system, and are now using your phone as a point of contact (via text messaging).  <br><br>The food here is usually pretty good, and I usually gravitate towards the specialties.  The salad could be a hit or miss... but I don&#39;t come here for the salad anyway.  Since their portions are all pretty sizable, with the complimentary bread, I usually skip the appetizers.  If you had to choose an appetizer, I am quite a fan of the lettuce wrap.  The cheesecake are all pretty amazing, that is if you still have room.  Anyway, all this stuff about the food is not news if you are a frequent CF customer, and they stay pretty consistent with any location.<br><br>Seating, I usually pick indoor, or first-available if I&#39;m hungry and desperate.  After eating there a few times, I realize I don&#39;t like dining outdoors.  The buildings surrounding the Americana can kind of make a mini wind tunnel.  It can get a bit cold during the fall-winter-spring months.  You might also experience napkins flying off your table.  Secondly, there&#39;s a lot of people walking around and if dining privacy/intimacy is something you might be looking for, then I&#39;d recommend indoor seating instead.  If you don&#39;t want to wait, you could always try the bar area and find the first available seat.<br><br>Service, I haven&#39;t really had any issues with the service of the several times I&#39;ve been here.  I think I can only recall 1 instance in which we felt neglected... that was when we were dining outside and there was a big planter that blocked our visibility of the staff and vice-versa.  It is either we were just fortunate to have received good service, or we&#39;re just easy going dinner patrons, but I haven&#39;t experienced terrible service as I&#39;ve seen in the other reviews.<br><br>Overall, I&#39;m quite satisfied with this CF location and have picked this place as a dining default while at the Americana.

To start, the food was good for The Cheesecake Factory. My meal was good compared to other times I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory restaurants.<br><br>As for the bad, this place seems mismanaged. When we got there, we were told it would be a few minutes before a table would become available. No problem. We are told the table is available but to stand off to the side. Okay, fine. Then, we move to another area and told that our table isn&#39;t ready yet. We wait a few minutes in this little walkway being constantly bumped into by employees and other people. Sure, the overall wait wasn&#39;t that long but it&#39;s incredibly annoying to go from seating comfortably out of the way to being right in the middle of everything and feeling bombarded.<br><br>The other problem was that a woman and her daughter were walking around begging for money. I feel bad for the woman and her daughter but when I&#39;m eating is really the last place I like to bother at. The woman went to a few tables and no one gave her money so other people don&#39;t seem to want to be bothered while eating as well.<br><br>With those two problems, it didn&#39;t seem like there was someone in charge at this Cheesecake Factory today.

We made a group order for work, and either due to miscommunication or misunderstanding (probably on our end), our order wasn&#39;t what we wanted. I didn&#39;t get his name, but the manager on duty made sure we got what we needed and even threw in an upcharge item for free for the inconvenience. Super impressed with the service, and the food was great, too!
Who doesn&#39;t love eating in a nice place with a view of a beautiful fountain and relaxing place . Great customer service like always . Love it love it . Not my first or last time coming .

It&#39;s been a while since we celebrated our SonDay FunDay at the Cheesecake Factory. We had a great time and the food and service were amazing. Next time you&#39;re here try their Falafel Salad or Crispy Chicken Sandwich Korean Style. #CBFreeLA
We went there with my friends . Food was delicious &amp; withers was friendly. Atmosphere restaurants was nice

Decided to stop by and grab a small bite around lunch time. I sat at the bar. The bartender Justin was great. He was very attentive and made me feel A1!! I&#39;ll be back on the account of how impressionable the staff was! Great JOB!! Keep smiling!

Awesome service Vanessa thank you! food and dessert suggestion was appreciated! Love the mango key lime cheesecake as a recommendation  Keep up the &#34;smile&#34; and good customer service... Cheesecake Factory thank you for all the good employees that you have. Good customer service keeps people coming back

This is about my visit about 2 weeks ago ....<br><br>I generally LOVE coming here! We always sit in the patio by the water fountain! Such a beautiful view.<br><br>It was dinner time ... We got our seat quick so that was nice. However, the waiter took FOREVER to tend to us. Once we finally got service, my and my guest began to talk and relax and unwind. About 20 minutes after waiting, I was starting to get irritated but luckily I had good company.<br><br>All of a sudden...A HUGE ROACH ran across our table. I started to panic cause I&#39;m deathly afraid of them. Idk if this has to do with us sitting outside or what but I was terrified! I made my friend kill it but I couldn&#39;t even enjoy my time there anymore. We just asked for the check (which took another 20 minutes to get), paid and left!

I came for brunch on an excellent day and had an excellent server, Alvin, who introduced himself as one of the chipmunks. <br><br>We came right before the rush so had plenty of their freshly baked bread (you know those sweet brown ones we all love) with butter. I think we asked for extra three times.<br><br>I ordered off the lunch menu and ended up with a beautifully prepared herb crusted salmon. Presentation was beautiful, taste was pretty darn  good, only problem was it wasn&#39;t hot.

I am writing this while nauseated with the food I ate half and threw away the rest in Americana&#39;s trash can. Cheesecake Factory has not been a eating place for me because of salty greasy food they serve.  I was given a gift card and instead of re-gifting it, I made the mistake of going there tonight with family. We waited 1 hour 45 minutes to be seated at 10pm. Took them a long time to bring my chicken marsala and again 15 minutes for my son&#39;s steak and my brother&#39;s burger; both burnt and bitter. I tasted both and lost my appetite for my subpar chicken dish.  Manager was called and their food was replaced, again with another burnt steak! The whole dinner was ruined for us. The server was a nice lady. The manager took the bad food off the bill, but our night was ruined. I will never go back to this place or any other Cheescake Factory.

After asking for a booth at check-in and told it would be an hour, waiting patiently they still got it wrong. I mention that to the host and all she could do was scream out it&#39;s not my fault, I told her I didn&#39;t say it was your fault.  We ask for the manager and he said we would be seated  soon but we still had to wait another 15/20 minutes so after waiting well over an hour we finally got a seat. Things have changed<br>But are waiter was great!

My all time favorite restaurant, ever!<br><br>Complimentary bread with butter is always a plus.<br><br>Favorites: (basically all their pasta, haha) <br>Pasta Da Vinci (all time fave)<br>Bistro Shrimp Pasta<br>Spicy Chicken Chipotle Pasta<br>Pasta Carbonara <br>Four Cheese Pasta<br>Steak Diane<br>Cesar Salad<br>Ahi Tuna Salad (their homemade house dressing is delicious!)<br>Ahi Tuna Poke<br>Mint Green Tea!<br><br>Cheesecake:<br>Red Velvet Cheesecake <br>Tiramisu Cheesecake <br>White Chocolate Raspberry Cheesecake <br><br>Overall: always satisfied!

Unlike the other Cheesecake Factory that I have ever been to, this location is by far one of my favorite. Besides the obvious fact that it is at The Americana, and although there is always a wait here, it is worth it. I always get great service here. The staff are always very polite and accommodating. They check on you often to see how you&#39;re doing, but not too often that its overwhelming. The food is always good, big portions and its worth your buck. Although this place is good for large parties, the ambience is also dim, very subtle lighting, romantic almost for an intimate night with your SO.
We ordered nachos but didn&#39;t realize they were so big ! We cancelled enchilada order and servers were so nice and accommodating about it , even tho the order was just about to come out !

Wow, had a great time here. It&#39;s rare to find a server like our server Jacob. He was amazing! Talk about knowledgable. He knew everything there was to know about the cheesecake factory. He was even very friendly to my mother-in law, who is a hard woman to deal with. Food was great too, but it&#39;s the first class service we got that will be bringing me and my family back!!

Considering it&#39;s in Americana, there is always at least a 30 minute wait anytime past 6PM. Huge portions, average quality, average price. Service overall similar fastfood restaurant, everyone running around due to large volume of customers. Unhealthy but tasty food!

Great happy deals! A lot of options for just $5! <br><br>Eventhough it&#39;s not on the HH menu I always get the Ahi tuna tartare ($6.95) and the tomato and basil flatbread pizza ($6.50).. <br><br>Always save room for their bread!

First off, after waiting 30 minutes for our table, we were sat and didn&#39;t have any menus or silverware. Once the silverware came, we had to flag someone down for menus. Then we waited another 25 minutes to order but no one seemed to care. Eventually we had to flag someone down again and order. We also didn&#39;t receive any of the brown wheat bread, the best bread, while every other table had some. We ate rock hard/stale white bread. Waited almost 35 minutes for our food to come out. Food was decent. My side salad had a tear drop amount of dressing. Might I add that I am a teen and was eating with another teen. I feel as if this was a teenage hate crime. Not coming back to this Cheesecake Factory location.

Hi everyone, if I could give 0 star i will, I think Cheesecake Factory need to reconsider their serveurs. I had me and my friends a horrible experience last night with one of the serveurs who showed racisme and discrimination and a horrible service with a lot of attitude. So I don&#39;t advise to go the Cheesecake Factory to celebrate something there. also I will be sending an email to the corporate.

Who doesn&#39;t love Cheesecake Factory!! Best fried mac n cheese, great pastas, yummy fish tacos, had the orange chicken and it was delicious!!! Best banana cream cheesecake!!! (Although they ran out on Mother&#39;s Day). Always satisfying!!!

The other evening my husband and I went to the CF in Woodland Hills.  We have been there dozens of times, and we generally order the same thing - Santa Fe Salad.  We always look forward to the bread.  That evening, the waitress took our order, and to our surprise never brought the bread.  The service was extremely slow, and half empty.  When we called over the waitress and inquired about the rolls, she sheepishly confessed there was no bread because the company that delivers the bread was on strike.  As their bread is a main feature there, she should have mentioned it up front, especially since the food took so long to come out.  When the food did finally come out, it had a hair in it, and the lettuce looked old and wilted, like it had been sitting around for days.  We got up and left.  We then went downstairs to Islands for dinner and found out that CF was borrowing food from Islands.  If they did not have fresh deliveries, they should have closed their doors and apologized rather than push sorry old food.  Shame on them.

So, I have been to Cheesecake Factory many times; however, this is the first time at the Glendale location.  <br><br>I am giving them an average 3 star rating.  I am not letting certain things influence my rating.  I am letting the beautiful Americana center influence my rating.  I am not letting the fact that Cheesecake Factory is one of the most unhealthy chain restaurants influence my rating...besides, I was the one that decided to go!<br><br>It was a Friday evening at about 6pm.  I put my name in, and they quoted me about 40 minutes.  I received a text message after about 30 minutes, so good job on the time quote.  <br><br>Things first started to get a little &#34;not so great&#34; after the host brought us to a table that was not yet cleaned and cleared.  There were dirty dishes all over. Despite the fact that there were many &#34;ready&#34; tables around us, he made us stand there for about 2 minutes while he cleaned it off.  <br><br>The server than came over; however, came over so quickly, that we weren&#39;t even fully seated, ready to take our beverage order.  I enjoy prompt service, but possibly a little too prompt.  Our server also seemed embarrassed, shy, and awkward during the evening.<br><br>The good news is that I had the Mac and Cheese Burger, which was pretty darn amazing.  Of course, always big portions, which means that I did not have room for Cheesecake.  :-(<br><br>So, if it was based on location, food and decor, I would give it a 5.  However, a few somewhat significant slip ups made me give it a 3.  A few better improvements, could up this score significantly.

Shout out to Matthew tbh his customer service is amazing!!! He knows the true meaning of customer service. As well as Marcus he treated us very well and respectful he was overall amazing!!! Both of you gentlemen need a raise bc you guys know customer service ! I will definitely come back and recommend people just because of you two guys!!!!!

Omg best service ever!!! GILBERT IS SERIOUSLY THE BEST WAITER IVE EVER HAD!! He truly cared about serving our every need and was sooo attentive the entire time! He has such a positive attitude and spirit (keep in mind it was 12am)!!! We left him a 40$ tip because he made our dinner 10x better!!!

I must say it started off bad but it takes one person to change all of the bad <br>David is awesome he was our waiter very professional quick and made sure everything was perfect I will come back because of David <br>Thank you David

Had to meet up with friends at Cheesecake. <br>Good thing I had a snack before coming here because the wait is long. <br>It took us almost an hour to be seated.<br>We were group of 7 and 1 child. <br>We requested a pizza t be served first for the child and they did. <br>Awesome waiter and awesome service who gave us 2 desserts for the 2 who&#39;s celebrating their birthday.<br>Cons: bathroom is filthy and ran out of toilet paper and seat cover - which we informed the waiter.<br>The place is big,lights are dim for a cozy feel and decor is awesome. <br>I enjoyed the food - had salmon n steak dianne plus calamari. <br>Happy tunny for happy people.
the cheesecake factory has great food and a great staff! they have gluten free pastas which is great for me. the staff is kind to children and are always there to help. love this place!!

Very disappointed at this branch.  Found a disgusting dirty spoon on my table when I arrived.  I stopped going to the branch in Santa Anita due to multiple hair strands were found on several of our dish.  I don&#39;t even feel like eating here again

Why is it that when you dine in the restaurant they make sure to serve you what you order but when you order (take out) every time it has to be something missing. My salad dressing was missing the salad was so dry and this is not the 1st time.

This place sucks, we were told to wait 15 mins or so, but we waited abt half an hour, we kept seeing people that came later than us got in before us. When i asked why they just say they send a signal to my device but didnt work!!!!!! Super badddddd service

1st and foremost, The Cheesecake Factory is a top-notch place to meet friends and family and to have dinner. Always has been and I suspect, always will be!  But the thing is... THE WAIT. Sheesh, we really have to wait almost an hour to be seated inside or out.  Fortunately, we are issued a device that alerts us when our table is ready, which again, is nice.  Thanks.

(Dined 11/27/11 SU): Yes, their namesake is truly the main reason for dining at this restaurant...although their burgers are pretty good too!<br><br>It was a glorious day with temperatures in the low 80&#39;s, had a gift card that needed to be used, and a good reason to catch up with a friend and grab a bite.<br><br>Amazingly, The Cheesecake Factory at the Americana in Glendale wasn&#39;t as busy as expected this noontime, which bode well for us, as we were able to get a table outside and do some people watching while we enjoyed out meal. There are plenty of tables and booths inside and a decent bar with several TVs to catch a game.<br><br>We each started with refillable lemonade (raspberry and regular [approx. $4.50 ea.]) and water. Then, we moved onto the avocado egg rolls ($9.95), she the smokehouse BBQ burger w/fries ($11.50), and me the wild mushroom burger w/substitute sweet potato fries ($12.50). Complimentary bread is also served. Disappointingly, we didn&#39;t leave enough room for dessert and their scrumptious cheesecake, which is truly a sin.<br><br>I usually like their lemonade, but this time it was a tad too sweet. I still contend that the best lemonade can be found at Red Robin. The avocado egg rolls (6 halves) are one of my favorite appetizers here and have never done me wrong. In addition, their burgers are also my favorite and one of the main reasons (along with the cheesecakes) why I dine here. The burgers are a good size and the side order of fries are plentiful. Needless to say, the portions are decent, thus, we just couldn&#39;t order dessert. <br><br>The service was shockingly good. I say this because historically I&#39;ve had pretty shoddy service at each location I&#39;ve dined at (e.g. Glendale, Beverly Hills, Pasadena, Sherman Oaks, The Grove, Woodland Hills). The hostess greeted us and immediate sat us down. And, our waiter (Daniel) was armed-and-ready to take our order. Our drink glasses were constantly filled, which is huge for me. A shutout to The Cheesecake Factory - please do whatever you can to maintain this type of service! <br><br>Parking is ample as there is an expansive parking garage (1 1/2 free parking then nominal fee after). Or, you can park at The Exchange (1 1/2 free parking then nominal fee after) a couple blocks away. Or better yet, park at the nearby Glendale Galleria across the street for free! Remember, I advocate walking whenever possible.<br><br>Overall, I&#39;m not a big fan of chain restaurants, and honestly, there are only a handful of chains I truly like. The Cheesecake Factory offers a borderline experience for me. Although they have an extensive menu and I&#39;ve tried items from all category selections, it really is about the cheesecakes. As much as I enjoy their burgers, I believe Red Robin&#39;s burgers are comparable if not better, at a better price and bottomless seasoned fries. Based on the prices quoted above (approx. $46.00 before tip), I feel the lack of value is prevalent. The atmosphere is casual, but please dress appropriately depending on the time of day you dine. Thankfully, they take my credit card of choice...AMEX!
Not a good environment for autistic children or adults. It&#39;s too loud and is in general an overload of sensory objects.

Has one of the best customer service experience anyone can ask for. The guy named Gordon was extremely attentive and knew the menu really well. He came back numerous times and gave bread and water refills with a smile on his face. Will gladly come back.

So everyone and their mom knows about Cheesecake Factory.  It&#39;s not the best food, but it&#39;s far from the worst.  It&#39;s tasty, consistent and offers almost too many choices on the menu.  Not always a bad thing.<br><br>The real review here goes to their star server Josh, who served us yesterday on a busy night, between the premiere of Avengers 2: Age of Ultron, and the Mayweather vs. Pacquiao fight.  The place was slammed as usual, but Josh not only provided the best, most attentive service ever, but his personality and sense-of-humor was amazing.  One of the members of our group was on a VERY strict diet, and when he had made mention of wanting an impossibly zero-carb/fat/gluten/calorie/taste carrot cake, Josh brought out a little ramekin of shredded carrots with a cherry on top!  It was the most hilarious (and charming) thing ever.<br><br>Seriously.  That made our night.
Like the food, love to seat outside enjoy the music and view in Americana, just a little bit pricey, could make the dishes smaller and more affordable, other than that love it.

Nothing to write home about. I&#39;ve been here only during non-peak times, but the service both times have been mediocre. Once, we arrived late at night, around 10:45 on a Saturday, and there was about a 15 minute wait for a party of 4. The hostess, when getting my name, wasn&#39;t particularly warm in her greeting. The hostess the second time I was there (this time in the afternoon on a weekday) was also simply there. The woman who showed us to our table was also cold and merely pointed to our booth and said, &#34;It&#39;s this one here,&#34; and then continued on her way. Basically, this place feels like a factory indeed - its employees going through the motions, distant and inaccessible. <br><br>Our waitress on this second trip was warm and interacted with the kids; unfortunately, she got my mom&#39;s order wrong. We asked for then salmon from the Skinny menu, and it arrived with the mash potatoes (the regular menu entre). She also got one of the steaks wrong: we asked for medium rare, and we received a medium well. She made other mistakes, but ultimately, she was pleasant and smiled every time she came by. <br><br>The pesto is good and so is the rib-eye steak. But I&#39;d say you could get similar-quality or better food at a lower price elsewhere.

Great service and amazing food! This location is very convenient since there&#39;s plenty of parking. There&#39;s always a wait, yes even on weekdays, so definitely don&#39;t come expecting to be seated right away.

I ordered the Sheilas chicken and avocado salad through door dash, there was basically 3 pieces of chicken in the salad.  I&#39;m really disappointed because I&#39;m still very hungry! Waste of 20 bucks.

I will give this big box chain a good rating because it does provide a wonderful place to meet, and this location especially if you sit outdoors near the singing fountains.  In this high-price area, it is an oasis because it offers up its traditional low prices.

It&#39;s worth the wait for this place! <br>Gilbert is an amazing waiter!! Great attitude, very friendly. Checks on you to make sure everything is just right. In addition to that, he made a great recommendation on what dish we should get. It is by far one of the best pastas I&#39;ve eaten which is called Chicken Bellagio!

This review is purely on the service. I love Cheesecake Factory food, and this location&#39;s food still lived up to its name. Anyway...<br><br>I don&#39;t care how busy you are, once you sit me down, please remember that I am sitting there. This location was probably the busiest Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been to, and considering how busy all the Cheesecake Factories I&#39;ve been to are like, that is saying a lot. The line to put in your name goes out the door. Waiting time to sitting down is about 45 minutes.<br><br>Once my friend and I were brought to our table, we sat there for possibly another ten minutes, fifteen minutes before someone came to ask us for our order for our drinks. In fact, other bigger parties were sat down and ordered before we were asked to. I&#39;m not usually an impatient person, but seeing others order before us despite being sat down a long time before they were does not make me very happy.<br><br>They did not automatically bring us bread either - we had to ask for it. The waitress, though very friendly, seemed to forget about us a couple of times, and then, when we decided to pack up our food and take it home since it was getting too cold out side to eat comfortably, they brought us boxes, but asked us to pack up our food ourselves. Normally, this would be fine, but seeing as every other Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been to packs up your food for you, this was irritating as it was easy to create a mess trying to pack fairly full meals into these tiny boxes. <br><br>The two stars are for the food. The minus three stars is for the lack of service. Since it&#39;s not my normal destination for Cheesecake Factory, it&#39;s safe to say I won&#39;t be going out of my way to go here.<br><br>A side note: My favorites are the luau salad, the tamale appetizer, and red velvet cheesecake. My friend also ordered the spring rolls with shrimp that was ultra delicious as well.

I love every cheesecake factory. From decor to the food and service. <br><br>Got the smoked bbq burger. It was so amazing!. Very juicy and tender. Love their bbq sauce. <br><br>Also the garlic chicken noodle has great flavor. But for $17.99 id expect more than 5-6 small pieces of chicken.<br><br>Complimentary bread is super good: ) <br><br>Awesome service. Def coming back

Had lunch with my mom and son. Ordered two items, California cheese steak sandwich that comes with regular fries but instead paid extra for sweet potato fries and a burger. Received the sandwich and burger but no fries. Let our server and the woman that delivered our food, on three times and still nothing. Finished our meal and asked them to cancel fries and they removed the fry upgrade from the check.  Servers were nice enough, but couldn&#39;t get an order of fries to our table in the hour we were there?!?!  Sandwich without fries?!?! Come on!!  Sandwich and fries were good enough, nothing to come back for. Not a satisfied customer.
Long wait and the last two times I got sick from the food. <br>It&#39;s good for happy hour and thats about it

Food was good service was terrible. Waited 10 mins for as servers walked by us. Finally I spoke to he manager who took our order. The manager tried her best but just couldn&#39;t make up for the poor service throughout our dinner.

50 minute wait due to it being a busy Sunday Christmas shopping night.  The hostesses were very organized and we were seated exactly when promised.  Food was prompt and delicious.  Our waiter could have been a little more attentive but he got the order correct without writing anything down.
The food is great as always... The wait is too long.. Sitting outside is a hassle the loud music and too crowded!! People stare at you eating.. Wierdosss

Pretty much everything I&#39;ve tried here is delicious. The wait and seating arrangements are always a hit or miss depending on the time of day, but it&#39;s the Cheesecake factory, there&#39;s going to be a wait! I love their lunch menu and of course their chessecakes.

Had a disapointed experience today...we arrived at 1:50pm with a party of 10. I understand it was around lunchtime so when they told us an hour we said fine. We checked back in at 3pm and they told us to come back at 3:30 and again they said come back in 15min. So when we checked again at 3:50, again they said we need it to come back in 15 min. <br><br>Soooo, in 2 hours they couldnt accomodate us and its truly disappointed becuase we were there to celebrate my brothers birthday and they wasted 3 hours of our time and were minimally apologetic and we had the sense that the whole situation was humorous to the female host and one of the african american managers. No sort of management attention and ultimately took our business elsewhere. NOT coming back to the Cheesecake Factory.

Its safe to say that all Cheesecake Factories are pretty great, but this location is especially good. <br>Izeem was my server the other night, and I couldn&#39;t have been more satisfied. He was knowledgeable of the entire menu, patient when asking specific questions, and a positive energy to be around! He was WONDERFUL, and I will be requesting to be sat in his section every time! Thanks Izeem for a pleasurable dining experience :)

I went to the location this past Saturday to celebrate my daughter&#39;s high school graduation. Location is busy, especially for big parties. Communication here between hostess sucks! When they take ur name down, make sure they take your right phone number and demand they give you a &#34;buzzer&#34; to indicate when your table is ready. Apparently the hostess took out number down incorrectly and our table was given away. The General Manager Leslie has no kind of hospitality skills. Instead of being apologetic, she wants to rebuttal why they do not go the extra step of giving parties 8 or more a &#34;buzzer&#34; or as to why a hostess will it call your name aloud in the waiting area if you are a party of 8 or more. Really disappointed on the service from the manager who is the person chosen to represent the Cheesecake Factory. She was rude and walked away with the attitude as though I should be grateful for seating me within the 90minutes quoted. She did not take any responsibility for her lack of communication with her staff and was not courteous at all. If you want this kind of service but at a cheaper price go to Sizzler. I definitely wouldn&#39;t expect it from Cheesecake Factory after we spent over $400.

So incredibly disappointed. My fiance and I came for dinner tonight. They sat us down and we did not have our waiter acknowledge us. He walked by us, looked at us, and did not say a word. I went inside to ask why we weren&#39;t acknowledged and the managed came out to apologize. My food came out cold, the plate wasn&#39;t even full to the top. WE NEVER MET OUR WAITER. He came by an hour later with some bread and didn&#39;t even apologize. Then we heard he was &#34;on break.&#34; I don&#39;t think I will be back.

Last 2 times we came here, service at this place became horrible. Waiters take orders without writing it down and they mess it up by forgetting what you ordered. It was a good place before but service is sh*t now. Time for new management.
A good first time. Definitely will be returning, the food was good &amp; hospitality was outstanding.

My wife and I went in for lunch.  I was amazed there was no line and we were seated within 5 minutes.  Our waitress, Stephanie, appeared nice.  However, the service went downhill from there on.  We waited a long time to receive our ordered food.  Once it came, our entrees were brought before our appetizer.  When I asked our waitress what happened, instead of apologizing, she replied, &#34;good question&#34; and walked away.  Not once did she come by to see if our food was OK or to refill our drinks.  Twenty minutes later, she showed up to let us know that Jonathan was taking over during her break. Jonathan was no better, he never came back.  We were forced to flag down another waiter to get the check. My wife and I have been here before and received good service.  This is the first time the service was this bad. In sum, my overall rating is based on the food (4 stars) and the service ( 0 stars).

You can NEVER go wrong with The Cheesecake Factory. <br>I&#39;ve been a fan for as long as I can remember, but just recently, I tried the Smokehouse BBQ Burger for the first time, and I found out that I&#39;ve been missing out all of these years! <br><br>It&#39;s possibly the BEST flavored burger I&#39;ve ever had!!! Instantly became my most favorite thing on their menu!!!<br><br>Give it a try!

Dear Glendale Cheesecake Factory management,<br>This review is written in regards to the table wait time. Let it be noted that our party of three entered your location during an off hour time today while your waiting area was practically empty (so empty that I was not given a pager and was only asked for my name). Customers who we knew were before us were being called by name and were taken to tables. As new customers entered the restaurant requesting for tables your hosts began handing out pagers. Still waiting for our table, noticing that now only customers who have pagers were being called to be seated, I approached a male host and explained that I was there earlier and not given a pager but only my name. He checked the computer, looked and me, then handed me a pager and told me it would be a 15 minute wait. I returned to my party and informed them of our status and we were in disbelief. Our party had already waited 30 minutes before the rush of new customers came in. Then to have the new customers seated before us, the apathetic attitude of the male host, and being told we had additional wait time for a table, our party chose to leave. Cheesecake Factory prides itself on customer service, and this incident has been both disappointing and unprofessional.

I really, really love the service at this Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>First of all, my waitress was super gorgeous. I mean, she was beautiful. Not only the way she looked, but the way she talked, she called us &#34;lovebug&#34; or &#34;hun&#34; or things that would make us feel special. Call it manipulation. Call it hospitality. I call it, &#34;OMG YOU ARE BEAUTIFUL I WANT TO BE YOUR FRIEND BECAUSE OF HOW NICE YOU ARE.&#34;<br><br>Water cups were filled and refilled again. I ordered a Midori Sour, which was made very alcoholicky (as alcoholic as Midori Sours come, anyway...)<br><br>They took really good care of my seafood allergy and made sure not to cross-contaminate anything.<br><br>Fried macaroni cheese balls are a MUST at this Cheesecake Factory--they really, really know how to do them (better than the other Cheesecake Factories, except for maybe The Grove.)<br><br>I got the Chicken Fettucini with the sun dried tomatoes and pink sauce--pink sauce was perfect, Fettucini was perfect and piping hot, and there was a generous amount of chicken. My friend (who insisted on taking me here for my birthday because she had never had Cheesecake Factory--it&#39;s okay, I gasped too--) had a roasted chicken thingy with mashed potatoes and carrots (which she bit into, and proceeded to sigh in contentment.)<br><br>We had to order the Original Cheesecake (since it was my birthday.) I got a very out-of-tune chorus from the staff and the nice table sitting next to us. Basically, I felt super uber happy.<br><br>I&#39;d come here again and again just for the service and the food. Who cares if the wait is 1 1/2 hours? Yum!

This place has lost its integrity. It has such a high volume of business with a wide variety of foods, it has lost its need to actually care. I refuse to go back. After years and years of patronage that hour wait is definitely not worth it. I&#39;d rather give my business to small businesses. No one really cares about relationships and service. It&#39;s really systematic, in and out. In addition DO NOT, DO NOT order to go especially via DoorDash. Horrendous experience. They essentially didn&#39;t pack 4 of the 9 items, spilled all the drinks because they ran out of cup holders and had patty paper in the burger. Best part of this is they took ZERO responsibility. A big no for Cheesecake.
Great service the food is delicious ! Our server was awesome she was very attentive and made sure we were pleased with the visit . I recommend this cheesecake . Awesome !

I rarely post on Yelp to complain. But I do want to share my experience at this place today. I came in on a Sunday and requested outdoor seating. Not too bad of a wait for the table. I was a party of two. We sat down and within 2 minutes was given a basket of their bread by the busboy. We waited 10, 20, and then 30 minutes without one single waiter/waitress greeting us. As we looked around we saw a few of them huddled to the side talking amongst themselves, with two of them looking in our direction. My guest and I waited an additional 5 minutes before we decided to let a manager know about the situation. We spoke with a manager (didn&#39;t get his name since he didn&#39;t introduce himself) and told him about what was going on. He seemed uninterested in our complaint and only asked if we wanted to be seated somewhere else. I really don&#39;t think that would have remedy the issue so we decided to leave. To future diners just be cautious if you do have a compliant and bring it up to the manager. You probably won&#39;t get the best response or remedy to your situation.

I&#39;m an occasional diner here at this location, but based on today&#39;s experience, I was a little disappointed. We came around 8pm or so and the wait wasn&#39;t too bad. Our waitress&#39; name was Hailey/Bailey and maybe it&#39;s an off day, but she claimed she misheard my order. My family already finished eating their food before my correct order came out. Plus she didn&#39;t check on us as we&#39;d hope for. At least to compensate for the mistake. Although she offered soup/salad while I waited, but she was nowhere to be found after. Overall, a not so good experience tonight.

We were at Cheesecake Factory yesterday and it was a big disappointment! Poor service. Glass of lemonade took 30 min to arrive at t table and WRONG flavor   Waitress was trying to push that it was what we ordered  Food was cold and undercooked ( we ordered fettuccine Alfredo, jambalaya shrimp , tomato basil pasta and burgers). Only caught 3 shrimps in pasta   With prices like theirs it was absolutely ridiculous. Was our one of favorite restaurant. Unfortunately last visit there. I will let all my friends and relatives to know how bad food and service are

The food and environment were great.  I love that they have outdoor heaters so that you don&#39;t mind eating g in the patio.  I had the veggie burger and if was definitely one of the best ones out there! However,  it did fall apart.  Sadly.  The service was actually really bad, which unfortunately reflects on the entire restaurant and I wish it didn&#39;t. I had to wave my hand after after minutes that our waiter didn&#39;t come by for a refill,  and he just did not give a friendly vibe the entire time.  His coworker however,  offered to replace my burger after I accidentally forgot to tell them no cheese.  That was really nice of her. Overall it was good food,  and a good setting.
Excellent service and good food!<br>I allow get their pizza and they never disappoint. <br>The coffee and crack r delicious

So disappointed in take out. I&#39;m a returning customer always just because I love their food, but this time they came short on their portions!!!!!!! The pepperoni on the pizza is burnt, the steak medallions is nothing compared to what I usually get which that is the reason why I ALWAYS GO BACK!

Worst worst worst management I&#39;ve ever seen in my life!! <br>The manager sucks (Asian guy who was on the floor on the afternoon of 8/5/15)...<br><br>I called two days in advance to make reservation and been told they don&#39;t take reservations.. This is the policy ok understood.. They asked me to be there on the day of the party at 5:30pm to make reservation for 7:30( this was told by one of the managers): so i showed up at 5:30 and all I was told was oh we can&#39;t make any reservations now, and I mentioned that I&#39;ve been told to be here by manager and guess what no f** was given. Manager asked me to check back at 6:30 again..So since already the plan was set for this location and didn&#39;t want to change it last min had to work around it and stayed till 6:30.<br><br>At 6:30 they put me on waitlist and it took them an hour and fifty minutes to give me a table for just 15 people (this wait is after 6:30 but in total I was there for 2.5 hours)!! This tables wouldn&#39;t be set if I hadn&#39;t set the tables myself!! They made my guests wait and because of their lack of understanding the surprise birthday party for my sister in law was about to be ruined if I had not took an action and start setting the tables!! <br><br>A manager should at least have a good planning, delegation, and communicational skills, and unfortunately this manager had none of them! <br>After causing all the inconvenience for his customers, he didn&#39;t even took the time to apologize. This is something that the dumbest manager would know to do as part of their job but this one wasn&#39;t even close to dumb... He was wayyyy bellow the level of dumbness!!

Worst Cheesecake Factory location that I&#39;ve ever been to. Took about 15 minutes after we were seated for our server to finally show up at our table. Our server didn&#39;t look like she was in a good mood, she had the &#34;Why do I have to work here&#34; look all over her. While she was taking our order, she kept rubbing her face and nose.<br><br>Good thing we checked our silverware before using it, one of the forks was dirty.<br><br>Our food runner grates cheese over our pasta and drops a giant chunk of the cheese on our table, all he said was &#34;oops&#34; and didn&#39;t even bother pick-up the cheese and just left.<br><br>I also saw another food runner dropped some pieces of chicken tender as he was deliver the plate to a table, he noticed that he dropped some of the food but just kept on walking. I hope that table get a discount on the chicken tenders because they didn&#39;t get their full size order.
Chicken Alfredo is amazing every time! Most of their pastas are very tasty. This is my favorite cheesecake location.

Best service that Jeffery gave to us. He made sure that our needs were satisfied and even offered more than an employee can offer. Will not forget my done with this Cheesecake Factory branch. Thank you once again Jeffery. :)

Between the atmosphere of the Americana and the classic cheesecake dining we always have a great time here. It&#39;s always clean and friendly and their menu selection is crazy. <br><br>I give it an extra star because there is no place in Glendale that is better for big parties at the last minute unless on a busy weekend. They have accommodated us so many times and are happy to do so.

Thumbs up for $1.50 Cheesecake <br>Thumbs up to our waiter for his attentive service at the bar area <br>Thumbs down for explosive diarrhea<br>Thumbs down for Cheesecake Factory, the whole chain/concept<br><br>Today Cheesecake Factory was offering their 30th anniversary special with $1.50 slices of cheesecake. <br><br>Lured by the gimmick (like those &#39;buy more to save more&#39; ones), we decided to take advantage on the discount on dessert.<br><br>My friends grabbed a table early at the bar and we had excellent service by our waiter.  Great directions to our friend on the road, meaningful answers to questions, complimentary extra guacamole, etc.  We gave the waiter a 25% tip.<br><br>I had the rye bread, a Factory Bellini, and nachos.  It tasted great going down, but within a short time of leaving, I started to feel sick.  <br><br>Let&#39;s just say driving while your intestines are about to explode + your exit from the freeway to go home is blocked off = not a good time.  I usually get the same explosive feelings when i eat kimchi from korean places.  I&#39;m just thankful that I made it to my bathroom before unleashing a bowl of fury.<br><br>In general, I&#39;m just not a fan of Cheesecake Factory.  Nothing in the menu excites me like the ones at hole-in-the-walls do, although I do find things I would like to try if I am obligated to eat there.  I just feel like it&#39;s an overpriced excuse to eat together.<br><br>see pics

So cheesecake  factory is my favorite place I love the food service is always a hit or miss but this time it was awful after being home sick after chemo I wanted to go here and enjoy my night but the server was just blah  I know we all have our issues I don&#39;t know if she had problems at home I try to put my self in her place ,, but she really made my night awful I didn&#39;t want to say anything but if a sever reads this please do your job you don&#39;t know what the table your serving is going trough  the server was just awful next time I won&#39;t expect good service I&#39;ll just go for the food  or maybe I&#39;ll just take it home

Worst experience at cheesecake! Now I see why they have 3 stars. I am a long time customer and honestly after todays experience I am officially taking Cheesecake Factory off my list permanently. We ordered dinner for take out like we have numerous times. Where do I begin with the problems. The chipotle pastas were the lunch portion definitely not dinner size. The Mexican tortilla salad which is supposed to have chicken had NO chicken! The beans were still frozen at the bottom and the tortilla was already shattered on the bottom. The chicken tenders were cold and soggy and soggy because the bright person who put the ranch sauce inside the tenders box didn&#39;t close it and it spilled all over the chicken. The infamous bread everyone loves was cold which is hard to understand since we all assumed is baked fresh. Hmmmm. And they didn&#39;t provide anyyyyyy butter to go with the cold bread. This is unacceptable and I will not tolerate it. When we called to speak to the manager the first manager put us on hold and I guess was speechless so left us on hold for another manager to handle it. So we had to explain ourselves again. The second manager instead of being professional kept asking us to dig into the trash to find a receipt that was never given to us instead of simply checking his computer for the order. This manager showed no customer service skills and in his own words explained he doesn&#39;t believe us but will refund us for the salad and the tenders only and we must show up for the refund now. Does he think it&#39;s a pleasant trip to make 2 times in 30 mins at americana? I guess this lack of professionalism in the kitchen must come from the managers training makes sense to me. With this experience our dinner was ruined since it went in the trash and our usual spot in americana is no more. There are many choices out there and with the continuation of there actions they will slowly push everyone away as they have my family and everyone I will be telling about this. It&#39;s a shame.

If you walked past 9021Pho, crossed the street, and walked into Cheesecake then you&#39;re on the right track. Even though the wait may seem long at times, but you can always enjoy the Americana while waiting and they&#39;ll text you when your table is ready. Yes, they use modern technology to make the experience better. I know!! Unheard of!!!<br><br>Love this place. Everything is great. A place to go with the whole family. It&#39;s a legit restaurant so expect to pay a little more than that crappy place across the street. <br><br>Favorite Foods: DaVinci Pasta, Steak Dian, Roasted Chicken. All great choices. <br><br>They&#39;re alcohol selection is pretty good. But I will say that this is not a place to go to if you&#39;re only interested in alcohol. Taste will be great, but you will be paying more for a drink here than you will at a bar. <br><br>5 stars all the way!!

Farm house burger is pretty good, the wait not so good! <br>As far as a dining experience it was very rushed, due to the busy nature of the Americana the wait staff were overwhelmed. <br>Prefer the Cheesecake Factory at The Grove, sorry Glendale!

The food here is no different than any other Cheesecake Factory.  I like Cheesecake&#39;s food.  Great portions, delicious food.  <br><br>But what I really love about this particular location is the service.  We brought our little puppy with us and happened to remember that there is happy hour M-F 4-6 pm.  We were gonna just give up because we remembered that happy hour requires you to sit at the bar, but my boyfriend went in and asked anyway.  They were gracious enough to allow us to sit outside and still get happy hour prices.  WIN!!  So if you have a dog and still want to enjoy HH here, don&#39;t be discouraged.  Only caveat is that you have to tie your dog so that your dog is on the outside, but that&#39;s understandable.  We were given no grief by the waiters and thoroughly enjoyed the HH.  Thank you Cheesecake Factory!!<br><br>Rejoice pet lovers!!! (:*

I love this place actually BUT today i was Sooooo dissapointed because of the waiter! Didn&#39;t pay attention at all, and it wasn&#39;t busy in the restaurant..he didn&#39;t bring bread, he didn&#39;t bring water!!! didn&#39;t ask how is everything, when we&#39;re done with the dinner he SAW US for another 20 min but he didn&#39;t come to us!!! we had to wait for the check 20 min what?!? we were nice, why should we get so bad service?! Don&#39;t wanna go there again.

Love Love Love cheesecake factory. Drinks are huge. Dishes are huge. Food is delicious. <br><br>My husband and I always get the Farfalle &amp; the Georgia Peach cocktail. And the free bread? Crack. The lines are usually long but we just sit at the bar so there isnt as long as a wait for tables.

Ah the cheesecake factory.  It doesn&#39;t matter which one you go to (I&#39;ve been to 4) they are all amazing!  The ambiance is good, the service is good, and the food is always good (especially the cheesecake).  Just be prepared for a wait.  This place always has a crowd, but it&#39;s worth it.

Had a birthday lunch for my friend here yesterday. I forgot the lady who served us but she was Amazing! Very attentive and nice. <br><br>Strawberry lemonade wasn&#39;t that good in my opinion, way too tart.<br><br>Calamari to start is the way to go. Both sauces that come with it are a must, mix&#39;em up for best results. <br><br>I got the Hibachi Steak dish, which was delicious as always!!!!<br><br>Bread is on point.<br><br>The Red Velvet Cheesecake is to die for. I haven&#39;t tried any other cakes here but I really don&#39;t feel the need because I have already found my match.<br><br>Service and Food is good for this price point.
Probay the best service ive had as far as restaurants. They dont look at you like theyre gonna kill u when u ask for extra bread and butter<br> :)

Had dinner with my wife on a busy Saturday night, November 3rd. I must say that they are very well organized and can handle the enormous crowd visiting them, very well. They told us one hour wait, but we were called in about half that time. I requested a booth, and they gave me a booth! Overall, my experience was very good, but with two big exceptions: <br>On the two margaritas we ordered, we had to complain about them; they tasted like juice, watered down. Almost no tequila taste in them even though we paid $11.25 for each! Very high price for not being a &#34;fine dining&#34; restaurant. It&#39;s more of a family place, full of kids and youngsters. The manager came over and had the margaritas redone for us. They were a little better, but not that good. <br>I ordered the steak tacos plate that is served with rice and beans. Though it was good, it was a big disappointment; the 4 tacos were miniature size tacos, a quarter of the size of a regular taco! <br>This was not specified in the menu, so it is misleading. We ordered bite size crab cakes as an appetizer and this was, in fact specified on the menu, so no surprises there. <br>On the other hand, my wife&#39;s plate was fabulous! She ordered the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta and it was abundant and delicious.<br>In conclusion...I would go there again but, would never order a margarita anymore. It is overpriced for this type of restaurant, and watered down.<br>We also ordered two glasses of Kendall Jackson Chardonnay which was good but, at eleven dollars each, for a half full glass of wine, once again...it&#39;s a ripoff! <br>If I were in La Scala in Beverly Hills, I could understand that. But not in a family restaurant in a shopping mall. Our bill for 2 was $106.00 but would have been about $44.00 less without the 2 margaritas and the 2 glasses of wine.

The only reason I deducted a star was because our table was so squished and the resturant was awfully loud! Also the forgot to give us a bread bowl! <br><br>Other than that the service was great! My ice tea, appetizer, and salmon came deliciously on time! Only wish I had room to finish my food or even try some cheesecake!

My elderly parents went to The Cheesecake Factory Saturday night. After waiting 45 minutes to be seated they were able to order. The waiter helping them told them he&#39;s going on a break and another person would he helping them. They waited 45 minutes and nothing! They spoke with the manager to find out their order had never even been placed. At that point they decided to leave hungry and upset. Very disappointed in the service. I hope corporate reads this and looks into this. Horrible customer service.

I know it&#39;s been said before (according to management) but Grant should be employee of the year. Outstanding service with a great smile. Anyone who can keep up with this early Saturday dinner party of 6 is pure gold. Hard to say if we ever had a better time. Take any average place with average food coupled with great service and you have a great restaurant. Food done well. <br>If there was any negative I would say the automatic dimming of lights at 5:15 pm. The night manager referred to it as ambiance lighting but we all agreed it was dark. I asked if we could pay for extra electricity. Maybe a hand generator at each table where guests could crank their own power would be an option. Couldn&#39;t read the dessert menu or see the faces of the others, good thing I know who was there. As luck would have it I had my trusty light meter and although I had a ceiling light directly over me showing about 10 lumens the rest of the table was less than 1 and it was a big table (in comparison a candle in front of you is about 12, the same candle 1 meter away is 1),. Jokes went around and we agreed that this would be a memory not soon forgotten. The day the lights went out at Cheesecake.

Yeah I know it&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory and we&#39;ve all been to one or two of them, but this one is unique with the outdoor patio facing the fountain in Americana.<br><br>Great people watching spot on any afternoon or evening. The service is normally great except for the one time mentioned in the last paragraph of this review.<br><br>My wife and I have been here dozens of times. The lunch menu on page 8 of the menu is perfect for those of us who don&#39;t wanna carry 10 extra pounds of stomach out of there after we eat.<br><br>Overall, the chicken madeira dinner is my hand down favorite. Have had repeat orders of Shepard&#39;s Pie (it&#39;s heavy on the meat) and most of their chicken/pasta dishes.<br><br>Wife is vegetarian and likes the menu, there&#39;s plenty of choices and if they aren&#39;t slammed, they will make her order however she wants to adjust it, except for the one time mentioned in the last paragraph of this review.<br><br>Only had one bad experience here. We were seated on a really slow early lunchtime and the server seemed like she may have had a bad audition that day or something. We weren&#39;t thrilled with the extra late greeting, we&#39;re easy going people, but the aloof attitude followed by no effort to get wifey a slightly altered sandwich to fit her needs, caused us to get up and walk out after taking a few sips of water. That dropped this rating one star.<br><br>I still say check out the patio and try to save enough room for dessert.

The most horrible service I have ever seen amongst Cheescake factory. Hands down THE WORST service, impolite staff and just CHAOS! And I have been to many many Cheescake Factories across the country. This one doesn&#39;t even deserve one star!
The food quality is horrible. I went there 2 days ago and had to use the restroom. It was so dirty that I washed my hands and left. I&#39;m very disappointed with this location

Very surprised that there was no crowd waiting for their turn to be seated. We are seated in less 2 minutes. That&#39;s great! It&#39;s been awhile that we never been here for that reason but because my daughter chose to eat here. We missed the wheat bread &amp; the usual pasta &amp; wraps. Happy with their new menu &#34;skinnylicious&#34; with calorie count ranging 590 &amp; below. Kids enjoyed their food &amp; of course the red velvet cake for their deserts .

I really think they do not care about their service at all because they&#39;re always so busy anyways. It is the most affordable place to eat in Americana so they have no shortage of customers, but that doesn&#39;t mean you can&#39;t care a little about your service. Every time I&#39;ve been here they&#39;ve gotten all of our orders wrong. I stopped going there after the story I&#39;m about to tell, and it was pretty damn funny actually.<br><br>So, I have a black pepper allergy. I ordered my meal and asked for no black pepper. Naturally it came out with a lot of black pepper. I asked to send it back and again explained that I have a black pepper allergy. <br>To which the server replied &#34;So why didn&#39;t you tell me that before&#34;. Then she followed it up with &#34;Is it an allergy or just a preference? Cuz a lot of people pretend its an allergy to get the sympathy just cuz they don&#39;t like something.&#34;<br>...I assured her I had told her the first time and that it was an allergy. Then another server came out and asked &#34;So about your meal, is the no black pepper thing an allergy or a preference?&#34; ....<br>Then my food was brought back out by a different server and IT HAD BLACK PEPPER ON IT. At which point I just found it funny, so I told the server who brought it out what was going on. She apologized and took it back. Then a manager came out and said <br>&#34;Just to clarify, is it an allergy or a preference?&#34; At which point I had a few drinks in me and started laughing so hard that I cried. I thought I was on one of those hidden camera comedy shows. I just ate the bread as a meal LOL.<br>Oh and my meal was a damn salad with shrimp like WHY WAS THIS SO DIFFICULT.

Ohh man. I don&#39;t even have the option to pick zero stars!!! Came here last night for dinner. And I was expecting better :/ I&#39;m up at 3am sick with diarrhea and just feel like throwing up now. All I ordered was a club sandwich and a slice of cheesecake! The club sandwich wasn&#39;t what I expected. My partner also got diarrhea. I don&#39;t know what it is but I have a feeling we both got food poisoning from this place last night. $90 spent for diarrhea NO THANKS!! Wouldn&#39;t recommend this place.

I will never ever come to this location again. I came here on Saturday at noon, and I requested if me and my fiancé could sit outside on a bigger table instead of this tiny table by the wall. <br> They said no that was for a party of 4 coming up. Ok...so i get my food, and i had to wait longer because some other waitress took my food, and then they sat 2 girls where I requested to sit. Totally NOT COOL. I am insulted and shame on u Cheesecake Factory to lie to me like that and have the nerve to not care and sit 2 people there right in front of me!!They got food and ate with only 2 people still while we got our check.You guys need new people in the front to sit everyone properly and be more courteous. This is not ok! Oh and by the way ... my chicken club was cold n soo bland ..it was the worst sandwich ever had at a Cheescake Factory.
Straight ass place lmaoooo easily never going back here. Chicken looked so bad that I didn&#39;t wanna touch it. I told my friends we shouldn&#39;t go here but they didn&#39;t listen to me. Smh

I just came out shocked once again! Like last time i asked for manager and told him that burger was burned fully and he smoothly replied that they had issues with kitchen ! They did not even apologize i think it was my last time stepping into this place again! Worse customer service ! Worse management! Need training with all management and employees!

So I&#39;m a fan... and in full honesty I&#39;ve only ever had cheesecakes from here, I&#39;ve never actually ate here. <br>So this past Sunday, we randomly did and the food was surprisingly really freakin&#39; good. For appetizer we got the fried zucchini, avadodo, and portobello mushroom basket. Seriously, no regret it was fantastic. I&#39;ve only ever had fried avocado at a bar in hollywood and it&#39;s been years, so I was pleasantly surprised when I saw this on the menu and had to get it. For dinner, my friend had the crusted salmon/ mash potatoes (they don&#39;t do roasted potatoes)/ and esparagus (lunch size). He loved it and it filled him up, so also surprisingly they were not at all greedy with their lunch portion. I had the mushroom burger with side salad. Vinagrette on the salad was light and not to sour or sweet, this is a total plus. my burger was B- because the bottom patty was soaked in grease and juice, however the texture was there for the rest of the burger and that&#39;s another plus. Even the bread they give you when you first sit down is really good... or maybe I was that hungry. Anyways, to sum this up, I would go again. Price was average for a $$ rating. <br><br>Why the 3/5 stars?  MENU needs to be edit down, a little overwhelming. <br>An even though they were way busy and not to blame our first server for ending her shift and the new server stepping in (though I felt like there shouldn&#39;t have been a 25 min gap from taking our drink orders and taking our food orders - - I get it, everyone was busy), it didn&#39;t help seeing a BUNCH of the waitresses just texting on their phones and socializing with each other. Why did I notice this, because I and tables around me were really waiting for a fair amount of time to be helped out. And trust me, they have a ton of people working there, maybe only a handful of the waiters looked stressed-out-busy.<br>Get your act together Cheesecake Factory... your staff needs a sit-down and training.

You do&#39;t really expect a lot from The Cheesecake Factory... it is, after all, a factory. You certainly don&#39;t expect great service, especially not on a Saturday afternoon when the place is inundated with stroller types. <br><br>However, Tracy, at the Americana at Brand location, was a marvel!!! She knew the (honestly way too extensive) menu backwards and forwards, had a great upbeat (and not overly perky) demeanor, was quick, was smart, dealt with the family next to us in a wonderful way...<br><br>She was one of the most professional servers I&#39;ve ever had, and certainly better than any of the arrogant, privileged and self-satisfied waiters at places like Grace, Comme Ca, and most recently, BLT.<br><br>Don&#39;t assume you&#39;ll get mediocre service at a casual dining restaurant (in the same way, don&#39;t expect you&#39;ll get good service at a high-end restaurant)... you may be lucky to be waited on by Tracy!!!

Always an amazing time with great customer service! They have been trying new things on the menu lately and I must they, they have all been delicious! The waiter we had was very willing to provide us with suggestions regarding their extensive dessert menu and notified us of the upcoming National Cheesecake Day! Will definitely be back!

11/23/2016. The day before thanksgiving. My boyfriend and I ate the Cheesecake Factory in Glendale. We arrived at the bar at 10pm (an hour before closing). We were waited on by VINCENT. Knowing the risks associated by sitting at the bar (low, minimum face to face interaction) we were ready to just order and eat. I myself ordered a Kobe burger and my boyfriend ordered chicken tikka masala, along with two pineapple Moscow mules. There was another couple next to us, also at the bar, who arrived AFTER us and got their bread basket arrived BEFORE us. That was the first red flag- starving as we were, we were quick to notice this discrepancy.  Brushing it off and attributing it to being &#34;rush hour&#34; for serving/dinner time, we disregarded this. <br>What really pushed our buttons was not being asked how our meal was AT ALL, NOT ONCE after receiving it. We are both servers, so we understand how it gets when it&#39;s busy, but when you ask the couple next to us who arrived AFTER US how their food is, we take it personally.<br>We usually tip 30% and LOVE Cheesecake Factory, but will probably NOT be back after this experience. Living in LA, there are plenty of better options. <br>Avoid the bartender VINCENT at the GLENDALE CHEESECAKE FACTORY.

I am never disappointed when I leave here. At this location I normally like to eat outside on the patio. If seated outside you have a full view of the large fountain which is always running, and the opportunity to &#34;people watch.&#34;  However today we choose to be seated inside (actually we told the host which ever seats were available first). I think being seated inside today was a great choice due to the heat. We came around lunch time on a Saturday, and although it was crowded we only waited 10-15mins. <br><br>I was delighted to discover their &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menu. They have organized the menu into four or five different sections based on calories in each of the following dishes. Ordering from this menu allows you to enjoy your meal guilt free. This was my first time ordering off this menu, I am not sure if it is a new addition for them, but I was left completely satisfied. <br><br>The best way to order, at any restaurant, is to order two plates to share. By doing so you have the opportunity to expand your culinary palate. We ordered the grilled salmon with vegetables and it was delicious. The carrots, offered on my plate, where huge and cooked to perfection; so moist and soft. The asparagus was also cooked perfectly and my favorite part was the absence of fatty oil.  We also ordered steak medallions (also on the skinny menu) and substituted the mash potatoes for more veggies. Delicious. Another friend ordered a salad from the same menu, it was huge! She could not finish it all... it looked very fresh and she said it was good. Today we opted for no cheesecake and I did not feel like I was missing out. <br><br>I will always love this restaurant and look forward to returning. In addition to the amazing food, the service is always great.

Great meal and excellent service from &#34;Ben&#34; our waiter. I am regular at this place and I must admit that our waiter today is one of the most wonderful and excellent waiter Ive ever had while dining at this place. Excellent food, great service and wonderful attitude!

The Glendale location is my second favorite location. That is because parking there is not the best. It is easier to park at the galleria across the street and walk to the factory. Wait times for a table are not that bad, average wait time is about 15 minutes with a full house. I think waiting for the food takes longer. Now the service I received the past few times I have gone is pretty good. There is a server by the name of Kevin who always gives great service. My big complaint about this place is the food. There&#39;s too much on the menu and I don&#39;t know what their signature dish is. I guess that&#39;s not a bad thing. Anyways this place is great and I would recommend anyone to go there.
I ordered cheesecake for my brother and it&#39;s delicious. Also, fun and casual place. I would like to visit again

Yesterday, I ate there with friends outside. I had a delicious meal of grilled salmon with white rice and corn succotash.  I am lactose intolerant so I asked for a substitute sauce instead of the tartar. I got the miso glaze which was delicious to eat by itself. I also had the Blood Orange Margarita on the rocks with a salted rim.  My friend had the Chicken Marsala where the waitress shaved cheese over it. Our waitress is from Maine and has a delightful personality and smile. We had a nice view of the water show at the fountain while we enjoyed our delicious meal.

We had a great experience at this particular Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s in a large area of Glendale called The Americana. The area is Simply Beautiful! The Cheesecake Factory Store itself as beautiful as well, very clean and very well staff. Everybody was overly nice and the food was terrific. This will be our go to Cheesecake Factory from now on.

I came here for brunch on Sunday with my wife <br>She ordered fish and chips witch was good , we ordered two coffees it was good, but I ordered the most disgusting Montecristo sandwich I&#39;ve ever had in my life , the bread was super dick and soggy , extremely sweet and it had scrambled eggs inside and a side of strawberry jam , are you serious ? , who the hell would eat scrambled eggs with strawberry jam that&#39;s just nasty , a Montecristo sandwich has already egg on the bread there is absolutely no need of scrambled egg inside , and the sweetness should be only the powdered sugar and maybe maple syrup not the bread soaked in extrasweet French toast batter , I&#39;m sorry guys but you need to balance that crappy plate , not everything in this world is sugar for god sake !<br>Whoever is the executive chef , i can&#39;t believe he allowed that to happen!, just because of that I would never come back for brunch !<br>Maybe I come<br>Back for a cheesecake some day! Or fish and chips LOL <br>Service was good by the way !

First off.... No wait when we came which is a plus.<br><br>Sat down and silverware was disgusting. Fork had leftover spinach, spoon had nasty spots with leftover food... And knives were broken with spots on it as well. <br><br>Our waiter is terrible. Takes 30 mins just to get our drinks....

Restaurant service  was mediocre and the wait time for a slice of take out cheesecake was terrible. Four employees in front of the house waisting time and  I&#39;m waiting for one slice of  take out cheesecake.

The review is mostly for the service and the overall experience.  I&#39;ve had good service and bad service. It&#39;s a hit or miss, busy or not.  The service from the host station is consistently bad.  The food is pretty good.  I tried their steak for the first time and it was surprisingly good.  I didn&#39;t expect it to be bad but since they&#39;re not a steak house I didn&#39;t expect it to be as good as it was.

Been coming here for years but the quality has gone done significantly. Service and food. If a customer has half a plate left or more of their food and doesn&#39;t want to take it home, a good server would ask if everything was okay with it. My Mil hated her appetizer and main entree but hates to say anything. But seriously when you spend $150 at a place this kind of crap shouldn&#39;t be an issue.

Super Gross day!! Purchased 3 cheesecakes 1 had a hair inside the frosting!!! Disgusting - my 10 year old got a mac-n-cheese &amp; a hair in there also! Today must have been a bad prep day ...... the manager &#34;Patrick&#34; refunded 1 cheesecake (where the hair was stuck in)!! Totally horrible

So I am reading all the recent reviews and I am basing my review on every time that we&#39;ve been here. I do know that if I show up on the weekend the wait will be very very long so I tend to come during the week and tried not to hit peak hours. Now if my family wants to come here for brunch on a Sunday then we try to be one of the first people there so we do not wait in a long line or a long waiting time. So this is like any other Cheesecake Factory with a big menu to choose from many choices of cheesecake and friendly service. This will always be my go-to when I am craving something delicious and a great piece of cheesecake.

I love the portion size. Get a lot of bang for your buck. The kale salad is my favorite from the entire menu and it&#39;s only 6 bucks. Oh and the servers are always really kind and offer suggestions. You can never go wrong with the Cheesecake Factory.

I usually don&#39;t write a review but it was disappointing to see a STAR get bothered during his meal by employees of the restaurant. I can understand patrons that aren&#39;t getting paid or are aren&#39;t on the clock but that shows such classlessness. Seeing how Corey Seager kept being interrupted by staff while he was eating made me not want to go up and say hello or ask for a picture or any of that. I was told that an employee caught wind of him being there and left the restaurant to buy baseballs and came back to have him sign it. REALLY?!?  Then I saw another employee SIT DOWN next to the person he was eating with so that she could take a picture of another employee. My server (I wish I could remember her name) told me that she really wanted to say hello but she refrained because she was working and she didn&#39;t feel it was appropriate. Well at least a few people knew this. FOOD WAS GREAT! My server was GREAT but I felt bad for him and any other STAR that would visit.

Worst experience ive ever had at a cheesecake factory before....... I mean horrible..<br><br>As a middle class father, I was on a short 1hr lunch when I decided to go to cheescake.<br>I was seated right aeay(which was great) and they brought the bread out for me to nimble on while Tiffany assists the other 19 tables outside. The bread? Cold, hard and bland.. did not tastle like the bread I had at any other cheesecake factory. The  black bread that they serve is usually phenomenal, but for some reason todays bread was very dry..<br>About 20 minutes after theu brought the bread, Atiffany came and took my order. I ordered 2 kobe beef patties on a plate of salad. I asked for medium.................. and asked Tffany to make sure it is medium.......... after 55 minutes waiting for 2 beef patties, Tiffany came by with the plate.. sure enough, it was well done. They tried telling me it was medium well, but it was clearly well done as there was not even a small hint of red.<br>I told her I hate it, and the &#34;manager&#34; came out..<br><br>Hello, whats wrong? Said the manager(like you would to a baby) i said I hate it.. i told him I would not eat a well done patty when I specificslly asked for medium.. his response?? Well your free to go.. and he walked away..<br>Best hour spent of my life.. hungry, tired, and annoyed.<br><br>I will NEVER return to this location. The place is run by a realtime doush....

Not impressed with the service. Appetizers took 30 minutes after the server apologized twice. Entrees came out two minutes after the apps. Again server apologized. I don&#39;t care about the money but she should have comped the apps. Only going to go back because I have credit on my gift card. After that probably not. Two stars because the burger was tasty.

This is a story of the last time I will ever give my business to a Cheesecake Factory. This review isn&#39;t about the food, it&#39;s about an item that was left at this particular restaurant. 12/17/17, has dinner here with my girlfriend. We leave the restaurant and once we&#39;re home we realize we left an item (cologne from Sephora) back at the restaurant. I immediately call once I realized it and luckily, one of the staff members set the item aside with my name and number. A day passes, I call the restaurant and tell them I&#39;ll be there in a couple days to pick it up. They assure me it fine, item is still set aside. 12/22/17 I drive to the restaurant for the item, one of the host says he can&#39;t find it, but he can take my name and number so he can speak to a manager later to locate the item...I explain to him I&#39;m not from the area and drove an hour and a half to pick up my item and I was told it was set aside for me with my name and number attached. After beating around the bush a little, a manager finally comes and speaks to me and says it&#39;s not in the managers office and it&#39;s not in the lost and found, there&#39;s isn&#39;t anything they can do, and it&#39;s gone. I ask if he can speak to the waiter from that night and he says it wouldn&#39;t be possible to find out who was working that night....he gives a corporate number for loss prevention, which I call and goes to a voicemail. Do not leave anything at Cheesecake Factory, especially if it&#39;s a gift for a loved one...unfortunately their loss prevention is negligible and they employ thieves.

New menu items for vegetarians/vegans are healthy and much appreciated as well as yummy!  Always busy at this location but service is good and prices are reasonable.  Love going to the Americana for lunch and a movie.

If I could give them zero I would,   After waiting for 30 min to sit we waited 20 for our waiter in a hot no air conditioned section. Flies were all around our table. We asked for side of sauce waited another 20 min. As soon as our food came we made it to go. I&#39;m not ever coming back. This resturant is overrated. If it was clean why would they have flies. BIG FAT ZERO.<br>The Cheesecake Factory is NOT what it used to be.

Sunday October 2, 2016 at 2pm my family and I (a party of 8 consisting of 4 adults and 4 children) arrived at the Cheesecake Factory for my early birthday lunch, 2:04pm we were put on the waiting list with an approximate seating time of 30 minutes. It was a beautiful sunny evening so naturally we waited outside to enjoy it. Surprisingly, by 2:18pm we received a call letting us know our table was ready. We rushed back, we were seated within 15 minutes.<br> Our server Nikki L was extremely pleasant and attentive. We ordered appetizers as soon as we sat down. Shortly after we ordered our Entrees. We were enjoying ourselves too much to notice any prolonged delays in food arrival, so I will say it was a moderate wait. Again, Nikki L came by checking on us numerous times being extremely attentive. Food was great, no complaints even from our most finicky eaters: the kids. Soon after finishing our food Nikki L graciously offered dessert we were so full of yummy food we almost declined, but who goes to the Cheesecake Factory and not have cheesecake? Simply Unheard of. Sometime after placing the order for dessert Nikki L and 2 of her best voiced coworkers came out to sing the awaited birthday song.<br>While working on dessert a man approached our table telling us to leave table, using offensive language.
