It is hard to describe the disbelief we were in after this, in total shock. We were frightened. The kids were nervous and confused. We asked for the check immediately after this. Nikki L picked up on the mood change at our table and proceeded to ask why. I described the incident, she immediately apologized. Grateful she did this, however she has no control on what goes on at the front desk. She went on to let her manager know. <br>Within a few minutes the Manager Bentley came over and sat next to me asking me to describe the incident. So I did just that; her facial expressions changed as I described what happened going from empathetic to &#34;Oh I know exactly who you are talking about, man in a white collared shirt low haircut. Yes, he did tell me he was going to come over here and tell you guys to leave as he also has a big party and is desperate to be seated we laughed about it ,but I am not going to seat him here anyway I am going to seat him there&#34; as she pointed to the tables behind us. I was not sure if I had understood correctly so I asked her directly, &#34;You knew this aggravated man was going to come to our table, and you didn&#39;t let him know that was unacceptable?&#34; to which she replied without hesitation &#34;Yes but it could have been a joke&#34; to which I responded with a simple &#34;Thank you&#34; She continued with apologies but again I said &#34;thank you&#34;. I was in utter disbelief that she knew beforehand and took it so lightly. Nikki L came by again bringing the copies of the receipts. She asked if the manager had come by and I said yes, went on to let her know Bentley already knew so it only made me feel worse. She was so upset on the manager&#39;s reaction to the event she insisted on letting the general manager know. Rick stopped by gave his apologies for the 2 incidents and assured me this is not a reflection on The Cheesecake Factory.<br> We are ready to go and move on with our day, as we are walking out the man in the white shirt is at the door and immediately begins to yell out offensive words and approaches the only male adult in our group calling him out to engage in a physical altercation. This causes havoc. Thankfully we were able to walk out without being physically hurt. <br>As I reflect on this I think perhaps if the Bentley would have taken a more serious approach and had not made a joke out of letting an aggravated impatient man approach our table. Why joke about something so invasive and downright rude. Is there a Policy in place for situations like this? Was this a racial issue? Why did she not care?<br><br>*****I sent corporate office a message the day after the fact a whole week went by and no response.*****

I go to cheesecake once in a while, and usually the one in Pasadena. But this time we were shopping at the Americana and my bf was hungry so we just decided to eat there. I gave 1 star for the wait time, which was only 2 minutes, which was great and 1 star for our waiter, read and find out why. I was not too hungry so we ordered a shrimp Alfredo to share, and while waiting I realized that my small round plate was dirty. I didn&#39;t make a big deal about it, I just didn&#39;t use it. Then we noticed our forks were dirty, so my bf asks for another set. He brings 3 forks, and I&#39;m assuming he didn&#39;t even take the time to check to see if they were dirty or not, because they were DISGUSTING. This all happened within the first 5 to 10 mins we were seated and that&#39;s how long it took for them to bring our food, which made me suspicious, is it fresh? Or not?  Usually the presentation of the food is nice but no not this time, because it seemed liked they didn&#39;t care that the sauce was all over the plate. Anyways, my bf asks for plastic utensils and our waiter forgets about that but he did bring 2 plates so we can share, and of course those were dirty as well. So our food is getting cold and my bf decides to go to the front and get the utensils. When we finally started eating,  the Alfredo sauce was very sweet and did not taste the same. I literally had 3 bites of it and I just couldn&#39;t force myself to eat more. This is why I probably will not return to this location, unless I&#39;m with a group and I just sit and don&#39;t order anything. <br><br>I&#39;ve attached 2 pictures of the plate and forks, zoom in and look at the dirt on the forks.

Terrible service.  I can understand they are busy but water and a basket of bread should be standard within the first 30 minutes of sitting at the table. Food was good but sadly the service really overwhelms the experience.  I probably won&#39;t be going back.

Saturday night I had guests. I was the Americana way cheesecake factory in Glendale at the front door they were not polite I had to say sorry to my guests because of them after that the waiter came to ask for the tip instead of saying sorry and he brought the check before we were done eating.
Disappointing and low quality restaurant in Glendale. Cold dishes, and dirty glasses.

We came here to celebrate my best friend&#39;s birthday. We&#39;ve always liked The Cheesecake Factory but this time, we were so annoyed and disappointed. We got seated a little after 6:30pm. We put in our order right away because I have my 5yo with us. We ordered the simplest dish for my kid -- spaghetti in pink sauce. To make the long story short, at 8PM, we still didn&#39;t have our food. We suspect that our waitress, Erin N., went on a break, completely forgot about us or didn&#39;t assign anyone who will check on us. She walked back to our table after 1.5 hours saying, &#34;where is your food?&#34;. Mind you, the spaghetti came last, several minutes after all 3 dishes and she said, they messed up the sauce! Of course, after we were done, it took another 20 minutes for her to bring back the check and another 10 minutes to run the card. <br><br>Let&#39;s not talk about not providing us with any water refill, not giving us the butter that we requested that we ended up not eating the bread because it was already hard, that we asked another waiter for extra forks and a different waiter for cheese for the spaghetti and she forgot the box after we handed her the payment :(<br><br>It was supposed to be a happy occasion but the service just ruined it all. We didn&#39;t have the time and the energy to order dessert or sing happy birthday. A 3-hour dinner on a not so busy Thursday night, especially when there is a kid, is just unacceptable.

FRONT DESK IS EXTREMELY RUDE!! Dude with a man bun is a D**K and ignored us as if we weren&#39;t valued customers. Waited in line for 20 minutes when there was no one else around! watched 4 groups walk in after us and got seated before we did, now there&#39;s something wrong with that. Terrible customer service, when we asked about our table they gave us the generic, &#34;just wait to the side they&#39;ll call you over.&#34; When we got seated they gave us a booth all the way in the back BUT, the booth seat was broken!! Cushion seemed to be ripped off by previous customers, along with dirty utensils By far the worst cheesecake location/experience I&#39;ve had yet.

The food was good the cheese cake was amazing but I saw 2 cockroaches and that was very disturbing. I didn&#39;t like the pizza but my sister said the hamburger was good so five star food but those cockroaches were disgusting!

Literally one of the worst dining experiences I have ever had. I would give cheesecake 0 stars if I could. I hadn&#39;t been here for a very long time because my experience prior to this hadn&#39;t been so pleasant; however, I decided to give it another shot.  As I sat down, I noticed our utensils were gross and covered with gunk, so I immediately asked for plastic ones. We were served the coldest plate of bland pasta I have ever ate in my life. The sandwich we ordered was topped with a piece of burned bread and our waiter provided horrible service, he did not even ask us if everything turned out ok or if he could grab us anything else. I will NEVER come back here again and I recommend everyone tries out one of the other many amazing restaurants in the Americana.

Cheesecake always has consistency going for it. It never really disappoints. The food is always good. The portions are huge. The service is almost always dependable and the prices reasonable. My regular order here is the crusted chicken romano. I opt for linguini pasta rather than the angel hair. It&#39;s a slightly breaded thin breast of chicken with a little cheese to its crust. The pasta is in a standard tomato sauce. It&#39;s my go to dish here. I also like the road side sliders. Perfect little burgers of ground beef &amp; onions served on dinner rolls. Already comes with ketchup. Genius! Hold the pickles, yo! The pizzas are good, the salads are monsters.... The most popular dishes are probably the jambalaya and chicken madeira. The bread is good, the butter is delish... The pulled pork sammich... was surprisingly disappointing. The chunks were too big. Couldn&#39;t eat it in that sandwich. It needed to be shredded or actually pulled apart more. <br><br>I had the fish &amp; chips before and I really liked it. I found myself craving it last Friday night. And being Lent, it was perfect for a take home dinner. Called it in, avoided the madness that is the Cheesecake Factory waiting area and took it home. It was crispy, delicious, the batter was perfect. It comes with coleslaw, tartar sauce for dipping &amp; french fries. A good serving of coleslaw, I might add. The only thing I would add is an extra container of tartar sauce. I&#39;ll ask for that next time. Good meal, nonetheless. I thoroughly enjoyed it.

I had the worst service experience at Cheesecake Factory this afternoon for lunch. Popped in while my car was getting serviced down the street and got there just as they opened. We were promptly taken to a table, and it took about 20 mins before a server ever came to the table. He didn&#39;t introduce himself, didn&#39;t even say hello.. he just said &#34;need something?&#34; And we ordered drinks. About ten minutes later, our drinks arrived and my cold brew coffee tasted like dirty coffee grinds. Took me about 5 minutes to see the server again to send it back. We ordered food; which came quickly, but we had wanted more bread and a few other things and the server never came back. Eventually another server stopped by and asked if we were okay, took our empty dishes and walked away. We had to waive this other server down to ask to find our original server to get us the check. The restaurant was pretty empty so I&#39;m super annoyed to get this level of service, especially from a chain restaurant where I have had good experiences before. Looks like this will be my last visit. No one even asked if we wanted dessert!

It&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory, so there&#39;s always a wait.  The good thing is that this is located at the Americana, so you can browse the area while waiting for your beeper to go off.<br><br>My daughter and I have gone here on occasions.  One thing about a corporate owned restaurant is that the food and service are generally consistent.  I had the buffalo wings this time.  My daughter had the rib eye rare.  The arugula salad is really simple yet exquisite.  The cheesecakes are a delight.  One slice can serve four people-no joke.

I love Cheesecake Factory ! <br>I have been coming here for years now and every time I&#39;ve come here the food and customer service has been great! They do not take reservations which sucks but their bar seating is almost always open. Their portions are so big, and every bite is so tasty!

Drove out to Glendale to go shopping at the Disney Baby Store and decided to stop at grab a quick bite to eat with my friends. I have to just say that our experience was beyond exceptional!!!!! From the moment we sat down until the moment we left. Ben, our server was so welcoming. He was great at everything, I mean everything! The customer service that Ben has cannot be taught. He has a servant&#39;s heart and that&#39;s something that you&#39;re born with. Ben didn&#39;t know that this was my fist day out after being really sick and in and out the hospital for the past week. He didn&#39;t know how much energy it took for me to even be there. All he knew was that he was our server and he wanted to make sure that we had a great experience. We order a cheesecake and he had them write &#34;Part of your World&#34; around the plate because I had an Ariel shirt on and we were talking about how much I loved Disney everything. He made my day!!!! P.S. PJ, the manager is amazing as well!!!!!!! Thank you sooo much!!!!
Cheesecake factory is perfect for a time when you don&#39;t know what to eat.. They have everything  on the menu...

Happy Birthday to me.<br><br>What should&#39;ve been a good time was marred by the service my friend and I received. We sat down and waited for 15 mins before our waiter finally acknowledged us. I had realized after he left that he was the same guy walking past us three times and he never once stopped. <br><br>He set down the napkins and walked away. Came back and half heartedly told us the soup special. Then asked if we were ready to order. Really? We can&#39;t even get drinks first?<br><br>Of course, with the way the night was going, it&#39;s not surprising our food was taking its time. <br><br>I should&#39;ve asked for the manager but I didn&#39;t because it&#39;s my birthday and I didn&#39;t want to ruin it further by being negative. <br><br>The two stars is me being generous. Just like the tip. I&#39;ve been to this restaurant before on a busy night and still had great service. Tonight however, probably won&#39;t be coming back for a long while. <br><br>Our waiter, Moses? I believe that was his name, needs more training. Just a heads up.

I&#39;m a big fan of the cheesecake factory, Went here just for dessert, and was not disappointed! Oreo cheesecake is always super delicious, server was very friendly and attentive even tho all we got was dessert. It was game time and they had football and baseball on in the bar area and could be seen part of the way thro the regular dining area but not heard, which is a great way to have the game displayed. <br>Good experience!

Their wait time is ridiculously long. We came in at 6:55 and were told the wait was an hour &amp; 10 minutes long. They took my phone number &amp; said they&#39;ll send a text as soon as our table is ready. An hour and 30 minutes later still NO text. We go to the front desk to complain and finally we get seated. Our waiter was running back and forth like crazy. We had to get her attention a couple times before she came to our table to check on us. However over all her service wasn&#39;t bad. Food came our pretty Quick &amp; it was delicious as always so the kitchen deserves an A+. I got the chipotle spicy chicken pasta, my usual and it was amazing. However they&#39;re not that sanitary. My fork had a piece of dried lettuce stuck to it. So our waitress brought me a new one. I hope the manager looks into how their utensils are being washed because this was just gross!

Went there today for desserts. This place is usually very busy but on a Wednesday it&#39;s pretty chill. We got seated right away and our waiter was very nice and friendly. I had the usual: Reese&#39;s pieces chocolate cheesecake! Loved it! it&#39;s truly a piece of art. Reese&#39;s crumbles on the side and a chocolate cheesecake filled with peanut butter. Delicious. You can&#39;t ask for anything better than that!! I also had the Oreo milkshake. the shake was good I enjoyed it.

Normally I would be giving this place a 5 Star rating but just got some of the worst customer service from a worker who claims to be the manager named Kevin. Though I believe that one worker should not determine the rating of an entire restaurant, let this be a wake up call to whoever decides to read my experience.<br><br>So to give a little detail on the situation:<br><br>I call in to place a take-out order for my little sister who works inside of the Americana, who at the time happened to be getting off from her night shift at 10:30. She was extremely hungry so I wanted to set up an order for when she got out to walk over and pick up. When calling in I spoke with a guy named Andre who kindly transferred me to the Bakery so I can place my take out order.  After waiting almost 5 minutes on hold, this guy Kevin picks up and right off the bat is rushing me to place my order. I tell him what I want and without giving me a chance to speak another word he goes ahead and puts my order into the kitchen. And this is before I could mention that I wanted it set for 10:30 pick-up. Following this just before he is about to hang up the phone I barely slip in my directions for the order , only then he claims that its late and that it will be ready in 10-15 minutes. Long story short, after an argument over the simple fact that I want the food to be prepared at 10:30 so it is not cold he rudely argues back saying it was my fault that I did not mention it before, and that he was going to see what he could do. I told him go ahead do what u can and hung up feeling disgusted with the service I just received. So I had to call back in and get a manager on the phone and sure enough he is the one to answer. When I realize this , I ask to be transferred to a manager, and he claims to be it. So I straight up let him know that is no way to treat a customer before I cut the conversation short and got off the phone.<br><br>To wrap things up without going in more detail, I am writing this review in disgust of the fact that someone like that answers the phone for take out orders. I feel sorry for the company if more situations like this happen to others when calling in to place an order.<br><br>Anyhow I will leave it at that . Take care !
The really long waiting periods can get annoying, however, the skinny menu has some tasteful options to choose from. We get the Ahi Tuna plate that comes with a salad.
Food was excellent. Service not so good. Waitress needs a lesson in time management. I always enjoy the ambiance.

Very beautiful restaurant. This large building has very lovely artwork and designs, great attention to detail and fitting for being in the luxurious Americana.<br><br>The wait is not so bad if you go for lunch, and for dinner, the wait is understandable. Cool how the hostesses can shoot you a text when your table is ready so you can shop around until then. That makes it very convenient.<br><br>I&#39;ve had some of the best service here. The waiters are very friendly, and they are very helpful. The food is amazing, and I crave eating here every now and then.<br><br>Oh, and the cheesecake...So yummy! So many to choose from, but I very much prefer the plain cheesecake.

Why say 30 minutes when you mean an hour plus?   Why make the buzzer go off and when I come in side I&#39;m waiting another 20 minutes to be called to a table that isn&#39;t even clean!  Now I&#39;m standing outside waiting...... Only advice I can give is if you walk in and see a line almost to the door walk out save yourself the headache and hunger pains and grab something else from the variety of other restaurants. Daniel and team tonight while your food may be great you failed in customer service.
Came here about 3weeks ago I dined with my boyfriend great food but our waitress Isis was above &amp; Beyond and the reason why I&#39;ll be coming back requesting her.

I came here for my 20th birthday and it was amazing I had a great time with my family and my boyfriend. They came to sing me a happy birthday and everything was awesome . But one thing was that the dishes were extremely over price my plate was about $25 but other than that it was a great experience.

I&#39;ve never left a review at yelp before, but I think have to leave one now. I have to say that I really like the cheesecake factory restaurants however I think this is the worst location. This is my second time dining in here at the Americana and I had the worst experiences for both. First time here, there was a roach on our table. We were so disgusted and lost appetite and so we decided to leave without finishing 1/4 of our dishes. We called the manager, but as he tried to catch it it disappeared behind the seat we were seating. He couldn&#39;t catch it and it made us to feel more disgusted. I didn&#39;t leave a review at that time because the manager told us that we didn&#39;t have to pay for our bill. That was about 6 months ago. <br><br>I thought I&#39;d never coming back to this store, but we came shopping yesterday to Americana and my friends wanted to dine here. So we dined here for the second time yesterday. This time, it was the quality of food and service we received that disappointed us. Our server seemed like he&#39;s been working for only few months and seemed very unprofessional. It took him forever to get what we asked for. We didn&#39;t even get the utensils until we received our first dish. We asked for new side plates since some of the plates given were dirty. He came back with wet dishes which seemed like he tried poured some water on them. We were really hungry and stressed by long waiting. We didn&#39;t want to get stressed by complaining and the attitude of our server made us speechless. So we decided to just wipe the dishes and eat. We ordered a pasta davinci and a hibachi steak. Pasta da vinci was very dry and tasted like nothing and very oily on the bottom. Hibachi steak was all burnt.<br>We were so disappointed because these two are our favorites from the restaurant and we know how it&#39;s supposed to taste like.<br><br>I really wanted to like this place because we come here often to shop and we really like the restaurant, but these two experiences, I think I&#39;ll never come back to this location.

I went here on a date. The food is good and it&#39;s located in a very pleasant little area/shopping center. Very pretty fountain right outside that lights up when it gets dark. Can be crowded on weekends, so the wait can be a bit long. Also, the table we were at was in an area that was a little darker than I would have preferred. Overall, a very pleasant evening/experience.

My dearest friend of 25 years was returning to England, so we ordered our proverbial Caesar&#39;s salad w/no chicken, when here came a server w/ the sweetest demeanor, Dominique D! She not only smiled sincerely, but frequently checked to see if we needed more lemons for our water/more hot water for my tea (she even brought me more than enough honey-smiles). On top of that, the bus-boy, DJ, who clearly did NOT need to get our respective parking tickets validated, nonetheless did w/out a moment of hesitation!! Now, THAT&#39;S what we call, SERVICE!! &amp; though it&#39;s a bit of a drive, we&#39;ve decided to dine at THIS location rather than the one at The Grove near Farmer&#39;s Market. Smiles.
Service was great, food was wonderful but the Lemon Meringue Cheesecake was heavenly!! I will never forget how amazing this Cheescake was!!

Yesterday during happy hour , the Arminian lady refuse to give us a booth , she said it&#39;s reserve for non happy hour clientele only !  I think this is another form of discrimination ! Just because we order happy hour we are subject to regular tables the left overs !  How sad discrimination existed because another party of her race was given a booth. Right away

This place sucks. I called five times to place a take out order. I finally gave up on trying to have someone from this moronic restaurant take my order for take out. Thanks for wasting 20 minutes of my life

I like this location a lot. They are very accommodating to large parties and the service is great. Had a family gathering the other night and everything was smooth. I had the herb crusted salmon with mashed potatoes and asparagus, all very good. <br><br>Also, they have Stone IPA on tap served by the pint or 22oz. Not too much craft beer other on the menu but they have a huge fully stocked bar. Validated parking and a lot of space to walk around for after your meal.

I love this location at the Americana. Try to grab a seat on the patio. You could slowly enjoy your favorite cheesecake with the coffee while watching happy families and kids walk around by the fountain. It&#39;s so amazing to see so many people to be happy at one place!
This location have a good service when not busy I go there weekdays and I avoid weekends because too crowded.
Horrible customer experience!!! And they completely forgot about my food and the waitress was so rude about it. Never coming to this location again!!

I usually love cheesecake factories and always go to the ones in Arcadia and Cerritos but since I was in the area shopping I decided to have a quick lunch here. The wait wasn&#39;t long (like 5 minutes) for 2 people. The food was just as good as the one at the other locations but the thing that ruined our lunch was the waitress. She was very passive aggressive and seemed like she didn&#39;t want to attend us. Mind you, she only came to our table a total of 5 times. To greet us and take our drinks, to bring us our drinks, to take our order, bring the food, and then for the bills. Not once did she ask if we needed a refill on our drinks nor did she check up on us. <br>I had ordered a San Pellegrino and my friend ordered an iced tea. My San Pellegrino didn&#39;t come with ice. At other locations, ice is always provided but this time it wasn&#39;t. Then when we got our food we never saw her come to us. She went to the other tables, started conversation with the other guests, but to us she wouldn&#39;t even look at us. 10 minutes past by after we were done with our meal and she came and asked if we wanted the bill. We wanted dessert but after playing the waiting game we decided to go to sprinkles instead of cheesecake. <br>The blonde waitress with tattoos introduced herself as sky but the name on the bill said Brittni, and another waitress said my waitress name was Tiffany. Sky/Brittni/Tiffnay or whatever her name is, should treat all of the customers with the same respect. Never coming to this location. I&#39;ll just stick with the Arcadia one.

It&#39;s funny, I&#39;m ok saying I quite like Denny&#39;s but I&#39;m embarassed to say I came here tonight!? Anyway, it was a easy choice for out-of-town vegetarians and me on a week night work colleague outing.<br><br>We got seated promptly in a comfy booth and I ordered the fish of the day cooked in spices. It was mahi mahi but was a bit bland and watery. The fries...well, you can&#39;t go wrong with French fries, right? The brocolli looked healthy, but lonely without a sauce to accompany it.<br><br>Overall, an ok $25 dinner and shared dessert, but nothing to write home about...or may be Yelp about either :) At least my colleagues now know The Cheesecake Factory does more than just dessert!

This review is solely based on their service and not their food. Some of the staff is very sweet and some are very rude, it&#39;s always a hit or miss. If you call them they either don&#39;t answer or when they do they put you on a hold for minimum 10-15 min. I have been here multiple times and I have ordered from them personally for pick up and also from multiple 3rd party companies like &#34;postmates&#34; and I have been fed up with them the last 2 times I ordered. I ordered a chicken Depana a while back when they were still serving this dish (very upset about that,) and when the item arrived it was missing the mashed potatoes. When I called to tell them that, they told me it was impossible and that the dish came with it. I explained I knew it came with it because that was the only dish I ever ordered but it was missing. They basically told me I&#39;m lying and hung up on me. The second time I tried to order through postmates. I ordered everything and got a confirmation and then 20 mins later my order has been cancelled due to &#34;merchant  being too busy to take orders&#34; what does that even mean? You open your doors at 11am how are you too busy at 11:30am to take orders? I order frequently so I know bread is complimentary so<br>When I ask for bread when I call to order for a pick up I would assume you would provide it but no. There service is just terrible!

Rude and mean server. Would not take our party of 25 and made it a big deal.  Told us the wait was going to be 2.5 hour even though we would sit in different area. If i could give no star, i would. Would definitely not come back. Will be in contact with corp soon

I really like this place but before not anymore I ordered to go cheese pizza,  steak Diane and another plate with chicken I think it&#39;s chicken Madeira. Plus cheesecakes...  The food was terrible... Frozen pizza really... After 45 min wait   I get a frozen pizza and cold food... The pizza goes straight to the garbage can... And same way the half food... No way.. If u want waste ur money... U got it..

Now I have to start my review by telling you I&#39;ve never been a huge Cheesecake Factory fan, HOWEVER, today was especially delicious. <br><br>My brother and I went during lunch on a weekday and sat down right away. We browsed through the menu for about 15 minutes before we made a decision. For those of you that are familiar with Cheesecake Factory, you know just how long it takes to pick one item, as there are 100,000,000 different dishes. <br><br>I chose the southern fried chicken sliders and my brother chose the chicken picante. My sliders was so yummy! It was the perfect lunch portion and I topped it off with a delicious strawberry lemonade. My brother was very pleased with his dish and gave it a 8 out of 10.<br><br>Then the dessert menu arrived... which is always a problem, as we are always too hungry for dessert, but order it anyways. We ordered the white chocolate blondie cheesecake and raspberry cheesecake. Both to die for!<br><br>Overall, we had a positive experience at Cheesecake Factory and will be back!

Service was excellent .. Just hated the long wait.. Then we got the text are food was ready and waited another 10 mins .. Food was also excellent.. Order the teriyaki chicken and a Georgia peach drink

I used to love The Cheesecake Factory way back when.  My favorite is the Marina Del Rey location with the patio facing the ocean.  But now I no longer go as much because it&#39;s just too much food, too heavy and too overpriced.  I usually just go once every year.  And then I usually regret it.  I no longer have a stomach made of iron.<br><br>Last night I was at an event at the Americana during rush hour, so I was basically stuck there.  There was a lot of free booze at this event--a VIP store opening--so I thought it would be best to suck up some food at The Cheesecake Factory.  My assessment:  1)  you always fill up on bread 2)  the portions are a good explanation of why America is filled with fat people  3)  the ambience and service is what you really go for.  <br><br>Will I go back?  I always seem to go back...but not for a long time...

First off I would like to say that it&#39;s chaos. I came in for Father&#39;s Day with my fam and it was a disaster. The host that attended was lost on everything that was going on and didn&#39;t even know where to seat us.Then the manager had extreme attitude and had the audacity to even roll her eyes at me with no care whatsoever. The service is very poor and I did not have a good experience.

Do NOT eat here! They served me a stale burger bun and the manager did nothing about it except tell me &#34;we will talk to the bakery&#34; ...but what about my food today? Incredibly rude and gross. Never eating here again.

The place is way overpriced. The cheesecake is better on other local bakeries. Also the waiting time was very long.  The Americana is very nice so i recommend going to Americans but not cheesecake factory.

Oh how I love The Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>I usually order the grilled chicken avocado club sandwich with sweet potato fries and it is always made to perfection. My wife orders either the miso salmon or their luao salad and swears by them both. Our favorite appetizer is the avocado egg rolls that come with some delicious dipping sauce.<br><br>The service here is great, but the wait times to get a table, particularly on the weekend in the evenings can run you about 45-65 minutes. Make sure not to arrive hungry!<br><br>They have indoor and outdoor seating with heat lamps. <br><br>I particularly like this location because it&#39;s located in the Americana so you get to enjoy the atmosphere, take a walk nice walk after, enjoy the water fountain show, go shopping or ride the trolly.<br><br>Guys, a great place to take your lady on a first date. You&#39;ll score points here!

The service was pretty slow...but the food was great! We ate the stuffed mushrooms and fresh guacamole was delicious!!!<br>And grilled salmon for main course was perfect!!! I guess we will come back soon...
I love this place. This is one of my best friend and I&#39;s fave restaurant in the area. Beautiful ambiance, food is really good and so are the drinks!

The host said that we have to wait for 15 minutes. Waited  1 hour and than he said that i have to wait 20 more minutes. Waiting system works terrible. He didn&#39;t even say &#34; I&#39;m sorry&#34;. Everything is messy. Plus there is awful smell‍‍

Service was amazing here ! Everyone was so nice and this cheesecake factory is way more classier than the one in Arcadia. When the waiter brought the food to us he claimed it was one of his favorite&#39;s here and he had quite a sense of humor. Later on during the meal he introduced to us a different waiter and omg we was mad hot xD he had blonde hair and blue eyes. not to sound creepy but he was real cute. Okay so anyways, the food was really good but if you ever decide to get the sandwich I got eat it first ! The bread gets hard quickly.

THIS LOCATION SUCKS<br>The outside looks amazing but the setup on the inside blows. Other locations are more spacious, but this one is is set up like a diner. What I mean is, it&#39;s cramped and you are packed in like sardines up against other tables and booths which are small. <br>Not only that, it&#39;s always packed so the service isn&#39;t good because they know they don&#39;t have to work so hard to get people to come. <br>It&#39;s not the cheesecake factory experience you usually expect, especially when paying this kind of money for food.
The Cheesecake Factory has always been my all time favorite place to eat. The  server seemed stressed n hurried. food handlers need to go back n watch &#39;like water for chocolate &#39;

Came here on a Sunday at 7:30 evening time I experience the most absurd service I&#39;ve ever had I&#39;ve waited 30 minutes just for my appetizer to get to my table my waitress was completely rude did not come to our table to check on us and keep in mind that there was only four tables that was being served on at the time in the whole entire restaurant it was very empty in there I wanted more napkins she did not bring me more napkins I want to be refilled she did not bring me a refill you want it more bread she did not bring more bread everything we asked for she did not bring and I could go on and on I have been a waitress in the past I own my own restaurant as well And would never treat people the way this waitress treat me every time when I would ask for something she would roll her eyes I&#39;m not that type of person that keeps asking for things to bother my waitress because I know the feeling I was once in the past I like to ask my waitress fo and would never treat people the way this waitress treat me every time when I would ask for something she would roll her eyes I&#39;m not that type of person that keeps asking for things to bother my waitress because I know the feeling I was once in the past. I waited an hour and 10 minutes for the food to arrive on my people I timed it. And when my food came to me it arrived ice cold. This will be the last time I ever come here

Cute place to eat when you want to break from shopping.  Sandwiches are good.  Salads too, but it can get quite bitter when they put too much arugula in them.  Soup is good.  Pasta? Could be better.  Sandwich? Alright.  Burgers? Yes I like their burgers.  Cheesecake?  Huge selection!  I think there are more than 15 kinds to choose from.
We had an amazing dinner here! Love the food Love the service Love the place ! I just can&#39;t ask for more. I enjoyed having dinner with friends and we had lots of fun and laughs.

Anything you order here is delicious! I usually go with the Americana burger, factory meatloaf or one of the pastas. The complimentary wheat bread and butter is second to none. I rarely grt the cheesecake because I&#39;m too full from the meal.

Worst Birthday experience ever! Went with 15 people for my little brothers birthday. We were with a baby and two little children and a mix of family members. I decided to take it upon myself to call to make a reservation (I know they do not take reservations) but I called because we were a big group just in case like any other person would. They said sorry we do not take reservations for big parties as well. I was totally OK with that every business has they&#39;re policies and we did not mind. They did say though we will seat you when you come in within 15-20 minutes, perfect right? So we got there one of my cousins was first to arrive so he walked in to ask for tables for 15 of us so this is where it gets really bad! They said to him &#34;well you should&#39;ve called for a big group to make a reservation.&#34; He informed them we called and I did and specifically because we were a big group so they told him well it&#39;s an hour and 45 minute wait! The place was empty on a Monday that&#39;s unheard of your food is not at all close to wait for 20 minutes! So I walked in and asked them for someone to help us because I called and asked in the morning and you guys said you don&#39;t take reservations they said you are correct and then I asked why you guys just tell my cousin you do? She&#39;s like with a smirk trying to talk back to me &#34;well you&#39;re wrong I didn&#39;t say that&#34; I literally walked in 30 seconds after my cousins walked out! We walked away and they called 3 minutes later saying your table is ready so we&#39;re like ok we went back and ordered the staff were really helpful and friendly but the food was absolutely horrible 13 of the 14 people did not eat we left our plates full of food, and not to mention they forgot two entrees! Everything was cold like my Rice and shrimp for the bang bang chicken and as well as my brother chicken parm sandwich. Horrible food we were not satisfied how they handled the situation and the food they brought out! The alcoholic drinks were mediocre as well!

I visited yesterday as we were waiting for our movie (The Promise) to start. We walked in around 6:45 pm. The wait to be seated was less than 10 minutes. Malia was our server. I was very pleased with her help. Other servers usually bother us way too many times, while all we&#39;re trying to do is eat. We told her we were in a rush so we wanted to order our dessert with our meal, so she independently decided to help out by bringing out our check early (with our dessert) as well. We tipped well to show our appreciation. Common sense is way underrated nowadays. I love it when people realize that bothering customers 10+ times to see if &#34;everything was alright&#34; is a little ridiculous. Thank you, Malia for realizing that.<br><br>Parmesan herb crusted chicken was to die for!<br><br>Fettuccine alfredo pasta was just okay.<br><br>Ultimate red velvet cheesecake was amazing!<br><br>My only complain: way, way too pricey. I would come in more often if the prices were a little more reasonable and the business would make more of a profit in the long run.

I loveee Cheesecake Factory and the Glendale location is one of my favorites, I love the Americana. <br>I finally tried Evelyn&#39;s favorite pasta, I had never tried any vegetarian or vegan dishes there and I loved it. It has brocoli, grilled eggplant, artichokes, roasted tomatoes and garlic. It comes with kalamata olives but I don&#39;t like olives so I asked for them to take them off and put mushrooms instead. <br><br>I also wanted to say how wonderful the staff is, I forgot my phone after dining there and did not notice until I was in the parking lot. I returned around 30 minutes later, gave them a description of my cheap phone and the manager looked for it and found it for me!! Great restaurant, great food and great people who deliver exceptional service.<br><br>There are restaurants that I want to try at the Americana and I always end up on Cheesecake Factory, now I know why.

I love this restaurant and come very often. Had the passion fruit mojito. Service is usually very good. Today i came had lunch and it wasn&#39;t what i expected. I love the Cobb salad lunch special, but today it was not good at all! The lettuce was brown and it didn&#39;t look like it usually does. No tomatoes didn&#39;t look like a Cobb at all and the waitress poured vinaigrette dressing on it. I&#39;ve had many cobbs here! Never with vinaigrette dressing I was very disappointed they only reason why I give it 2 stars is cause I like the drinks.

Today was by far the worst service i have ever recieved here. My husband and I sat by the bar so he can watch the game and when he asked to change the channel the bat tender lied to him and said they dont get that channel when we have watched it here before. Thats strike 1. Strike 2 we asked for bread and they gave us a stale batch. When we asked again they gave us another stale batch and it took twoce as long to come out. The food took just as long to arrive. The bartender did not attend to us even though he doubled as our waiter. I am very upset with the service here and i wont be returning. I would rather go to a farther cheesecake factory than be disrespected at this establoshment ever again. If i could give this place negative stars i would.

Food was awesome - at least dinner part. However, service sucked! Waitress forgot our utensils ... drinks ... never cleared our table so there were plates piled up.... never checked on us for drinks or anything and there was a fly in my tuna tartar

They have pretty great food but I mostly like their lunch special. I like it because the portions are smaller than regular dinner portions. Their mojitos are also really good. I always get Evelyn&#39;s favorite pasta, avocado egg rolls or Santa fe salad with no chicken (vegetarian).
An amazing place with a beautiful customer service!! Truly love the environment in here and the employees are so respectful and helpful. One of the best Cheesecake Factories locations in California
Staff was very nice, unfortunately my steak was over cooked. I asked for medium and received well done. Ci didn&#39;t want to send it back because I thought it wasn&#39;t worth the time to wait

Seriously they can never get an order right. Menu says mixed green salad and they bring out a salad with lettuce, even after I confirmed with them that it&#39;s not lettuce. This place use to be good but won&#39;t be back again. Still waiting for some ranch dressing after telling them 10 minutes ago. It is not even rush hour and not busy at all right now.

The customer service sucks especially when you try to sit a disabled person at a small table in the bar area and she does not drink!!! All we got from the manager Sam I am sorrythe waitress was very nice and pleasant after they finally move us to a bigger table,

Great restaurant, great service with tremendous menu. Nice design and atmosphere, <br>with exceptional cooked to perfection food! <br>Fire Roasted Artichokes, Ahi Tuna Tartar, Caesar Salad, Greek Salad, Beats with Goat Cheese, Herb Crusted Filet of Salmon, Shrimp Scampi, Chicken Madeira, <br>TRULY AMAZING.               Highly Recommended.!!!!!!!!!!<br><br>Your Every Day, Every Occasion Restaurant! <br><br>*****The Cheesecake Factory*****
Every Cheesecake Factory is blessed, I love it. I&#39;m always in the mood for their great food especially their mashed potatoes and lime rice.... I can eat it for days...

Love this cheesecake factory always choose it when I want a great meal never disappoints the orange chicken plate is a personal favorite of my husband and I enjoy the chicken enchiladas. Have recently tried some new things on the menu and really enjoyed the chicken and steak Diane factory combination. The kids many pasta was delicious for my baby ! And we enjoyed our service and time !

The worst service ever!<br>Placed an order 3 days in advance other then was on hold and disconnected for few times it was all wrong !<br>All they could say is sorry that did not help the party!<br>Workers there just to do the hours , nothing else !

Why write a review for a place that does not have any consideration for anyone or anything. Just surprised on a restaurant this magnitude does not take reservation. Place like Americana which is build for families to enjoy a night out. People with children have to wait an hour or even more to have dinner. It all comes from pure management, and you can&#39;t blame them, why take in consideration for their costumers comfort when the place is packed and makes money either way. If there was zero stars only!!!!!!!

The hosts or people who check you in are very rude seem and have an attitude. Every time I come here it takes longer than usual to get a table. The system or items given to hold your place in line are a joke. Even after being called you are standing in front of the desserts for an extra 25-30 minutes. The staff is not accommodating. This has not only happened once but on multiple occasions. Today it occurred again, and occurred again on Mother&#39;s Day. Seems this location can not accommodate parties of 4-6 people.

My girlfriend and I came at around 10:45 before us there was 10-15 people the lady upfront told us its going to be a 10-15 mins wait. After about 3 mins we were seated. Our waiter was great, nice, and brought everything out very fast. By far the best cheesecake factory.

Crazy selection of food.  I can&#39;t decide.  I usually end up going with the renees special.  It&#39;s a half sandwich soup and salad for under $10.  I LOVE their bread and butter.  It&#39;s the best!  Also great Martinis.  The service is generally good even though they are always packed.  I like that they give the &#34;baby plate&#34; for the kids to keep them happy and occupied while we are waiting for the food to come.  Only down side is wait time...<br>9 times out of 10 you&#39;ll end up waiting 15-20 min.

Came back with my group of friends tonight, the guy who served us (can&#39;t call him a server because I&#39;m above nobody.) GILBERT YOURE AMAZING! He has such a bubbly personality and he was full of jokes he got all our orders perfect with a splash of humor which is great. U can tell he loves what he does. 5 stars Gilbert !

Had a dinner with my friend Saturday evening . We arrived around 6:15 pm and they told us to wait 45 min, in fact we waited more then one hour . <br>The place was soooo packed it was crazy ...!!!!<br>The service was good I love the waitress who served us unfortunately I didn&#39;t catch her name .<br>As for the food , big disappointment. <br>I ordered Louisiana pasta and returned it , this is not my first time ordering this dish I don&#39;t know what was wrong this time .<br>We wanted the Toxido cheesecake after the server promise it&#39;s very good ... No !! It wasn&#39;t very good . Next time I will have dulche de leche

Where do I start? I absolutely LOVE this place. The customers are not my favorite, but the staff is excellent! <br><br>I came in last week with my grandmother to have the infamous Peach Bellini and salmon! It is OUT OF THIS WORLD. My grandma was visiting from out of state and always requires a trip to the Americana with a pit stop at Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>I have always been a fan, but last friday (6/20/14) was one for the books. Our server was one of the most PHENOMENAL people I have ever encountered. He made our experience well worth it. Not only did he suggest trying the salmon special (which we LOVED) he also complimented us on our taste of the menu! My grandma was beaming from ear to ear. Jason is one of a kind and he makes that restaurant glow! I hope management treats him like royalty. I wish I was a big wig in Hollywood so I could hand him everything on a gold platter!<br><br>Jason - if you read this, thank you for making my grandma and I&#39;s special dinner date the best we have had yet!<br><br>Also - if you love S&#39;mores, GET THEIR S&#39;MORE CHEESECAKE! out of this WORLD! We took it home and ate it later, it was incredible.

My go-to Cheesecake Factory! Honestly, I don&#39;t know of any Cheesecake location that I haven&#39;t liked, and even though I&#39;m not a huge Cheesecake person, my wife is and she loves this place! Love the selections, close to the Glendale Galleria, and the bread though!

This place is the best me my fiancee <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fcome.here&amp;s=3b0d97baded9ac1ad27a382c78aa21767a899c410cd86b716ed9a8836b026203" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">come.here</a> at least twice a week and last night I called them and talked to their manager and I asked for a favor to have a ice cream with a plate n write I love you on it n send to my fiances table a surprise and he said np I was willing to pay anything for it but he said its on the house and she got it ans she was soo excited n surprised I called back and thanked them I really love this people I work at a big mamas and papas pizzeria as a manager and I would love to help.out with special requests like this and they did it thank you cheesecake factory for what u have done for us she was havin a bad mood and.u changed that thank u soo much as I told the manager I love you guys cant wait to go there again.

I&#39;ve always had an infatuation with Cheesecake, so when my work sent me to Glendale on business, I just HAD to bring my coworkers for dinner, and of course, a slice of delicious cheesecake. <br><br>I&#39;ve been to a few of the other locations, but by far, the Americana location is my favorite. We were seated outside in the patio area that overlooked the fountain, and our server, Simon, was absolutely attentive to our every need. Our food was served promptly and our drinks were topped off almost immediately. <br><br>I would recommend this location to anyone visiting the Glendale area.

The Cheesecake Factory is a super popular place for special occasions so this place was packed on a Saturday night. There was an hour and a half wait for our group...the good news is this place is located in the Americana in Glendale so there&#39;s plenty of things to do/see while you wait for your table. You can go on ahead and get a drink from the bar or take pictures in front of the fountain or roam around the three-story Barnes. Cheesecake Factory actually takes your phone number and TEXTS you when your table is ready so that&#39;s really convenient! <br><br>It&#39;s really dim inside so it was kind of hard to read the tiny print on the menu or take any good pictures without flash. Well our group of 11 ordered an array of dishes...here&#39;s what we got:<br>- Avocado Egg Rolls (Appetizer: Avocado, tomato, and cilantro wrapped in a crispy wonton wrapper)<br>- Tex Mex Egg Rolls (Appetizer: Chicken, corn, peppers, black beans, onions, and cheese wrapped in crispy wonton wrapper)<br>- Spicy Chicken Chipotle Pasta (Chicken, asparagus, peas, peppers, garlice and onion with penne pasta tossed in Chipotle cream sauce topped with tortilla crisps)<br>- Hibachi Steak (Angus hanger steak with mushrooms and onions and bean sprouts served with mashed potatoes and tempura asparagus)<br>- Chicken Bellagio (Crispy chicken on basil pasta and topped with prosciutto and arugula) <br>- Spicy Cashew Chicken (Mandarin-style chicken served with cashews over white rice)<br><br>The egg rolls were superb! The outer skin was flaky and crispy and delicious while the inside was HOT and creamy and so full of flavor. They are both served with dipping sauces which complement the egg rolls very well. All the entrees, however, were disappointing. Everything was too salty! The cashew chicken and hibachi steak, especially. <br><br>My favorite item was the spicy chicken chipotle pasta! <br><br>Most items here range in price from $12.95 to $18.95. MOST items. I really liked that they had a &#34;Skinnylicious&#34; menu as well for those watching their caloric intake! <br><br>Service here was great! Super packed but we felt taken care of and attended to! Our server was very pretty too (: <br><br>Parking can be complicated because there are so many structures...but you can park in the Americana parking structure and Cheesecake Factory will validate for you! Or you can park at the Galleria and walk on over~

SECOND TIME ORDERING CATERING AND THEY MESSED UP AGAIN!<br><br>I expect you to be on your P&#39;s &amp; Q&#39;s when I call a couple days before to place my order, call to confirm order the day before, and I CALLED THE MORNING OF PICK UP TO confirm order....YOU GUYS STILL MESSED UP!!! <br>3 times I called to make sure the order was correct and this place never ceases to surprise me at how well they perfected the art of &#34;making an honest mistake&#34; <br><br>__________DO NOT ORDER WITH Paige OR Eric___________<br><br>ASK TO SPEAK WITH MATTHEW (RESTAURANT MANAGER day shift) DIRECTLY, he&#39;ll offer to give you ONE slice of cheesecake for an order that serves 6 people. you do the math.

I ordered the steak medallions and found them a little salty but the moment I said that, the manager and waitress did everything in their power to not only re-do the dish but to make me feel like a king. I have been a regular patron a love this place.

Spring break for my daughter and took her to one of her favorite spots in our area to have lunch. Wait was under 15 min which was great. It was raining pretty hard. The gentleman who walked us to our booth was tremendously rude. Called my name, no eye contact, no greeting, took us to our table which wasn&#39;t ready and had us stand there without saying a word while we stood just looking at each other while our booth was being cleaned. Ok figured maybe he&#39;s having a bad day. Service after that was ok. It would&#39;ve been nice if someone came by to ask us if we needed a refill. After paying I went back up to the front counter and the same gentleman that initially walked us to our table was there I asked him if he can please validate my parking ticket and he stood there without saying a word, took my ticket, scanned it, and gave it back to me without even looking my way or acknowledging me, not a word. I didn&#39;t get his name because they don&#39;t wear a name tag, just a black shirt. He was a white young male with short dirty blonde curly-ish hair. I would&#39;ve asked for the manager but my daughter just wanted to leave. Didn&#39;t want to wait any longer. The upside was the food was great and environment was clean. Unfortunately now a days when someone is nice it&#39;s more surprising rather than what&#39;s become the norm, rudeness.
Best fod in town love the whole grument style this restaurants provides. Workers are friendly and are always willing to fix any incoviniance.

Never coming to this location again. I&#39;m going to have to call cooperate on these guys, I ordered a chicken and avocado club and instead of the chicken I wanted a burger patty and they said they can&#39;t and if I wanted to they were going to charge me 6 more dollar to add a burger patty, add bacon and avocado on a normal burger instead of just substituting the chicken for a burger patty plan and simple Never coming here again rather spend my money somewhere else were I&#39;ll be happy and satisfied.
I came expecting a great meal and instead I got a flavorless bowl of pasta with no sauce and no seasoning. We waited for about an hour and a half for bland food and I was pretty disappointed
It started great service app, had the cashew chicken plus hair. Yes hair service was good not gret she forgot about us. Dessert was to die for

You can never go wrong with Cheesecake Factory!  I&#39;m pretty sure they have the largest menu I&#39;ve ever seen (especially for a chain restraint).  The food is amazing, there is something for everyone (variety), and the staff is friendly.  I usually visit this location every time I fly in/out of LAX.<br><br>I really can&#39;t think of anything I&#39;ve tried that wasn&#39;t delicious but the Crispy Chicken Costoletta is my absolute fave.  The Chicken de Pana runs a close second if I&#39;m looking for a smaller portion.  Speaking of portions... I could eat 2-3 meals off each order.

Service is not friendly at all. We started at the bar area while we we&#39;re waiting for our food and the waiter that was helping us was rude when he found out we we&#39;re waiting for a table. It&#39;s understandable that whatever we order there that we would need to close out the check first before moving to the main dining. But to make me wait almost 10 mins to get my check since he hopped from one table to another was unacceptable. <br><br>So then we moved to the main dining and it seems even our new waiter has some attitude and seemed snobby/irritated. But he was attentive and refilled drinks. Maybe he was just having an off day.<br><br>Here&#39;s my feedback on the food:<br><br>calamari - even though it was cooked right. way too much breading and too salty.<br><br>corn tortilla soup - was amazing<br><br>pepperoni pizza - crust was great but it was too salty<br><br>chicken alfredo - pasta was al dente and it tasted great.<br><br>I have eaten at this Cheesecake Factory before but first time in the Glendale location. The food was better at their other locations.

Love the Cheesecake factory. It&#39;s just a bummer the way they do substitutions. Asked if substituting veggies in pastas is tough. Waitress replied &#34;It&#39;s no problem at all.&#34;<br><br>Fast forward to the check. A pasta with asparagus mushrooms and tomato has been upped from $14 to $20... wow. Thanks waitress. Just came out of her tip though.<br><br>When we asked her she said &#34;my manager made me do it.&#34; FYI next time that happens tell your customer he&#39;s about to pay more than your streak price for some noodles and vegtables.

Amazing food, excellent quality, huge portions (always have to take home leftovers), great atmosphere, very friendly staff, offers the most time for parking validation (ask at the front), reasonable prices, always offer fresh-baked bread before meal (white &amp; brown respectively).<br>Only negatives (occur during weekends):<br>- the wait can be ridiculous (up to 1hr)<br>- air can be warm and stuffy<br>- can be incredibly loud (really hard to carry conversation)<br>- dark lighting may not appeal to most (but I like it)<br><br>Major advice: avoid going during weekends/holidays, otherwise weekdays are perfect

Every cheese cake I&#39;ve been had the worst service! Takes forever to get your food and always packed and not staffed enough. Been waiting 40 minutes to get our food! Grrr annoying! I always get chicken Madeira! My favorite! Georgia peach drink is Great!

We came to cheese cake factory in Glendale and checked in at 6:30 pm, 2 1/2 hour wait time for a party of 10 (2 of them with were 3 year old kids) I get it they are busy so you have to wait. Finally they call us in and we get seated, the waiter never brought us bread or refills, we had to keep asking  I ordered the Club which is turkey with bacon sandwich but they brought me something else so when I told them about it order being wrong they argued with me and told me what I ordered wasn&#39;t in the menu...are you serious????  So I asked nicely if they can please bring the menu so I can show them, after showing them the club sandwich on the menu they said they&#39;d bring me the right sandwich. 30 minutes later after everyone is done eating they finally bring the sandwich but they got it wrong again, they brought me an avocado sandwich.  Waiter never came back to check on us or refill our drinks during those 30 minutes, then a different waiter came and said he was covering for our original waiter but he has to go on break (normally they&#39;re suppose to let you know they&#39;re going on break and introduce you to new waiter. The new waiter offered us a free cheese cake for the trouble, are you kidding me??! free cheese cake???  I asked for the manager and waited for about another 15 minutes for her to show up, she didn&#39;t offer to make things right or even seemed to care she basically told me she would give me 20% off and that&#39;s all she could do.  I told her I wasn&#39;t asking for a discount but just couldn&#39;t understand what took so long to make a turkey club sandwich, I&#39;m not one to argue or ask for discounts but just couldn&#39;t believe the female manager didn&#39;t care about customer service this happened on Saturday 3/30/2019 at around 9:30 pm

We went to the cheesecake factory on a saturday during lunch. Waited for over an hour with 2 diabetics and a handicap. They kept telling us that they were waiting for a table when we asked 4 times how much longer. They told us that the manager was supposed to speak with us earlier and it wasn&#39;t until the wheelchair was blocking part of the hallway did he come out to us. When we complained that the wait had almost doubled from the estimate the hostess with the curly hair said well we are only 10 minutes over your wait ( in reality it was 20 minutes). The front desk was incredibly rude, unprofessional, and the attitude that was given to my aunts, mother, best friend, and myself was uncalled for. Cheesecake factory usually has a great friendly staff in their other locations around southern california and las vegas.

I grew up going to cheesecake factories with my family every so often, and I&#39;m sad that it&#39;s just not good anymore. <br><br>Literally every part of our dinner was flawed in some way. When they called our name to sit at a table, we walked to the table and it was taken, so our hostess had us wait while she walked around and looked for an open one. More waiting on top of our 45 min initial wait to get seated. <br><br>The food was even worse. We ordered the Korean fried cauliflower and the salmon scampi combo and they were absolutely horrible. The sauce on the cauliflower was choking. Granted, we didn&#39;t pick a grant dish. The asparagus in our salmon dish was cold and the shrimp was fried, but it had been soaked in the dish for too long because we had to wait so long so it had become soggy. The salmon was okay. <br><br>THEN on top of our already very slow service, their gift card system was down so it took another 10 minutes to process is by hand. AND THEN our waiter misplaced our parking ticket that we had given him to validate!!! <br><br>Horrible!

Pros: This was my second time here and I must say that the food and the service were 10+ rating in my book. I loved our waitress, she was friendly and was attentive the whole time we were there even though they were busy. They will text you while you wait for your seat to open which is kinda cool.<br><br>Cons: Takes about 1 hour to get a seat, so visit the Apple store or something while you wait

It seems the staff cannot keep up w/ the demands of this restaurant. Initially, I called to place a carry out order - I was put on hold, and the person never came back. I drove to the restaurant and placed an order at the counter. I was told it would take 20-25 min. An hour and 15 minutes later, I got my food -- a vegan Cobb salad, vegetarian pasta, and a slice of red velvet cheesecake (nothing too complicated). On top of that, I had to pay for parking since it took over an hour. The cashier was very apologetic and threw in an extra slice of cheesecake, but I won&#39;t be returning.

Haven&#39;t been able to eat here because there&#39;s never been any open seats in the bar area. It&#39;s first come first serve but nothing has ever been available. This is the 8th time it&#39;s happened. Never again.

Al though this is a chain restaurant, I give this particular one a 4.  It makes a difference how you&#39;re treated when you come in and I appreciated how our hostess and waiter  treated my sister and I.  First of all we were starving after hanging out at the mall and we didn&#39;t care if we sat inside or out.  <br>Luckily we sat outside because we had a chance to see The Americana, which was really nice at night.  We also had a chance to look out at the fountain that had opera music playing along with it.  <br>For the most part the food was quick and so was the service.  The waiter was efficient and gave us ETAs on when our food would come out.  Overall it was a nice and pleasant place to eat at. I ordered my chicken farfalle and my sister got her jambalaya.  There wasn&#39;t any variation from the flavor I&#39;m used to and I didn&#39;t get food poisoning so that was a plus.

A little disappointed last visit. Love to go here for weekday lunch and Sunday brunch but last Sunday we were the first ones in the door at 10am, so the place was not busy yet at all, we got our breakfast and the eggs were actually cold. Not room temp. But cold. My mom&#39;s eggs were too. Pressing for time we didn&#39;t send them back. And I got the wrong pancakes. Honest mistake but by the time I got new ones we had to get going. Hosts &amp; servers were nice as usual. Just expected better from TCF.

HUGE PROPS TO CHEESECAKE FACTORY- AMERICANA!!!!!<br>I went here on Monday because my mtg was cancelled, so it meant I had a whole day off! <br>My friend&#39;s birthday was on Tuesday, so I asked her if we can celebrate at the Americana w/ lunch, a movie, and a lil retail therapy... and we did!<br>Our first stop was the Cheesecake Factory... I&#39;m in a chair &amp; my friend is too.. <br>From the hostess (didn&#39;t get her name) to our waitress, Dina... this was customer service at it&#39;s best.<br>We ordered the Avocado egg rolls &amp; the Skinnylicious sausage &amp; ricotta flat bread (gotta leave room for dessert!)<br>Our food came promptly, and we ordered a banana cream cheesecake for my friends birthday.<br>I know that Cheesecake Factory sings to you on your bday &amp; most of the time it&#39;s just your server &amp; someone else... well, Dina went the extra mile and got 4 other waiters/waitresses to sing my friend &#34;Happy Birthday!&#34;<br>In a society where so many people don&#39;t understand individuals with disabilities or how to approach or talk to people in wheelchairs, Dina went above &amp; beyond for us...<br>Thank you Dina &amp; everyone who made my friend&#39;s bday so special... thank you for looking beyond the chair and treating us with dignity and respect... just like everyone else should be treated!!!

Today was my worst experience in this dump. All I did is order ahead for takeout and they had me wait for an additional half an hour besides their &#34;estimated&#34; 20-25 minute preparation time. The hosts do not have a clue about what it is to accommodate their guests/clients. I asked them for assistance and all they did is brush me off. If you do not want to work in a busy restaurant then find some other occupation. No one has to deal with your unhappiness. Moving on, if you know that Saturday nights are your busiest especially at a location like the Americana...why would you only have one person manning the cash register??? Not only is he getting bombarded by unexpected questions but he also has to receive the attitude and bitchiness of annoyed guests. I feel bad for the poor man. I&#39;m sure he&#39;s getting a pittance of wage. Lastly, I really don&#39;t understand what the point was of ordering ahead when by the time I got home...the food was as cold as dog&#39;s nose. Take a lesson from the Cheesecake Factory at the Grove and Pasadena and learn how to run a place. Oh, and let&#39;s not forget the angry waitress who dropped some glasses and yelled, &#34;what are you laughing at, nothing to see here&#34;.
Slow service, oily food and when we asked the server why the food took this long he responded &#34;beats me!&#34;..... Are you kidding me!!!!

My friend and I come here at least once a week and we usually have a good experience, but today when we came and they took us to be seated the table was dirty if that wasn&#39;t bad enough when we told them our friends were gonna be joining us they told us we could move our table but instead of moving our food they waited for us to move ourselves and then when u think it can&#39;t get any worse they bring my food with hair in it!!! SO FREAKIN NASTY. Our waiter kindly took it off my check but then gave me a comment like why didn&#39;t u just eat it, it was just a tiny piece of hair? LIKE UHM HELLO WOULD YOU EAT SOMETHING THAT HAD HAIR IN IT???? Worst experience ever

The wait is horrible! I hate going to this place on a weekend only because it&#39;s so loud and wait times are 20 minutes at best from my experiences here. The food isn&#39;t really 5 star quality but I guess you get what you pay for. In this case, it&#39;s semi good tasting with a great portion. I feel you can share a full plate with 2 if it weren&#39;t too awkward looking in public. To cut it short, food is 3/5, staff are always friendly 5/5, wait time is 1/5 which just evens things out with overall 3 stars.

I have been going to different Cheescake Factories for years and yesterday my husband and I went to the one in Glendale.  We were seated outside on a lovely day.  For a half an hour we waited without being asked if we wanted anything to drink or being served the customary bread. Others around us were getting bread and water.  We asked 3 different servers for bread and water.  After another 15 minutes, flagging someone else down, they finally brought it.  But, our bread plates were dirty from food that was baked on and so we asked for others.  Our waitress finally came and we ordered.  My husband got a pasta dish, I asked for a veggie burger without onion, wrapped in lettuce.  Another 20 minutes and we got our meals.  My husband&#39;s was fine.  My veggie burger had an onion right next to it.  I&#39;m allergic to raw onion and can&#39;t eat it.  We flagged our waitress down, and she took my burger away.  Ten minutes later she brought it, without onion, but this time wrapped in a piece of lettuce that had molted black from age.  I showed it to her.  She took it back to the kitchen and told me she&#39;d bring different lettuce.  I ate my patty without the lettuce because the wait was too long and I was hungry.  Upon finishing the the veggie patty, the lettuce was brought to me.  I asked for the manager and explained what had happened.  He said he would take care of the veggie burger.  We asked for the bill.  No apology from the manager or the waitress.  The food was less than satisfactory.  The service was horrendous!! NOT GOING BACK!!!

Been going here for many years and its still awesome.<br>Service here is the best. <br>A bit slower if it is packed. Prices really range, But to me its a 4 star chain so expect to pay a bit more.<br><br>Love the shephard&#39;s pie. Very creamy and yummy.<br>Recommend going to any Cheesecake Factory.

Worst experience ever....which is unfortunate because I love the cheesecake factory. My friend called to make reservations for my birthday and they said they don&#39;t take reservations. She said, ok, then we&#39;ll just show up but there will be 10 of us. The manager then said,  ok I&#39;ll write that in the book. So, we arrive and I try to explain that to the manager and he wouldn&#39;t give me the time of day. Wouldn&#39;t even look up from his iPad and kept rudely repeating as if I was incompetent &#34;we don&#39;t take reservations.&#34; Yeah dude, I know, I was just trying to tell him about the book that the person in the phone earlier stated. (Asian guy, didn&#39;t get his name but could care less at this point). Neither would the snotty hostess (also Asian) So,  we left and at elsewhere and had a FANTASTIC  time! The cheesecake factory in pasadena is way better and don&#39;t treat you like trash.

One spontaneous trip to Americana, me and my companions couldn&#39;t figure out what to eat for lunch. I finally just said to eat here and I don&#39;t regret it! <br><br>First of all this place is gorgeous! Of course its Americana-Glendale and not Riverside. <br><br>Second of all, the food was really good! I&#39;m glad I gave a chance to try the &#34;Macaroni Cheese Burger!&#34; I&#39;d rather get it than the &#34;Fried Macaroni and Cheese&#34; appetizer. Plus the fries were just...perfection! <br><br>Lastly, the customer service given to our group was just...GOLD (like what my cousin said). Our waiter Scott was on top of things always refilling our drinks, checking up on us while we ate, and just being an awesome human being. I&#39;m honestly speechless with this visit we had. I don&#39;t go to Americana every week but whenever I go back and eat here I hope to get him or request him. <br><br>So thank you Scott for your excellent service to us and for Cheesecake Factory inventing the Macaroni Cheese Burger! :D

Just got it a food poisoning yesterday who&#39;s ever cooked my burger from 8pm to 10pm almost killing me I Have diarrhea n vomit since I got home yesterday night make you a favor don&#39;t go eat here soon iff you want to spend 8hour add the hospital

I give you 2 stars because the food is not the issue. It&#39;s your process in seating people that sucks badly! You are the only restaurant on the planet that has a 2 line waiting system??? First we wait for the buzzer and then we wait for a table - WTF??? Wake up management the system is no good, after the buzzer goes off we all (multiple people) get pilled up by the main entrance waiting still another 10 minutes - Get it together and don&#39;t ring the customer unless the table is physically ready. The worst part is you have 4 to 5 people in the front and all seem to be running around with the heads cut-off!

First of all when we came, table wasnt cleaned enough,it was wet and there were some crops on it. knives werent clean.We ordered Choped salad with bacon separate, they brought it without bacon even, and forgot to bring bread and butter. Anyway we arent pleased of this service any more.We wont visit Cheesecake Factory at Americana .It was better before! We are disappointed

I ordered a $30 dollar rib eye steak and I honestly had better cheaper Steaks at Denny&#39;s or norms. I had the dynamite shrimp that&#39;s always a great appetizer!! The only downside this night was my steak and the server that almost spilled all the steak juice on me. Close call.. That&#39;s why I give my 2 stars...
Fabulous food and drinks.  Nice friendly atmosphere and quiet enough to carry a conversation without raising my voice.  Parking was convenient across the street and valet parking can be validated.

They are too busy to give good food or, service!  Asked to be sat in main dining room and as a result was put at the bottom of the list.  Watched as guests that arrived way after my party be sat in the main dining area as I was made to wait and another party took our seats...

This place never disappoints. With a menu as extensive as the wait on a Friday night, this place is well worth the price on your breakfast, lunch, or dinner. I love the pasta davinci, and the orange chicken plate - must haves - not to mention their pizzas and burritos! You have to try the spring rolls while you wait for your main course.
delicious food! I ordered fettuccine pasta with shrimp add ons. Meggan was our waitress and she delivered our food very quickly! 5 stars for Meggan!!

I came here in a group of 20 on a Sunday afternoon and we were very well accommodated. They sat us in a booth area with two side by side long tables. The only problem was that half of our group was running on Filipino time, so they were an hour late, but we didn&#39;t bother waiting because that always happens, so we just ordered all our food and appetizers. We got Thai lettuce wraps and calamari as appetizers. I split grilled salmon with my sister and my mom had fettuccine Alfredo with chicken and roasted tomatoes. <br><br>The Calamari came with Garlic Dip &amp; Cocktail Sauce. The Calamari itself was crunchy and perfectly cooked. I really don&#39;t like getting cocktail sauce with Calamari, so I stuck with the garlic dip. The lettuce wraps were very large and came with strips of chicken satay. I kind of wish the chicken would be more chopped up though. It&#39;d just make it easier for the lettuce wraps and make it so you can have more servings. They were very good though. It came with a lot of toppings which were all very fresh. The Grilled Salmon was delicious! It was a big portion and more than enough to split between me and my sister (<a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fs3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com%2Fbphoto%2FqIVhlfMiqgewFPMRnXaMJg%2Fl.jpg&amp;s=9aa50b7e628f1b13004ea38a4c6700ee68388738c8deb09b2833807e90cfbcc8" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com…</a>). We ordered mashed potatoes and green beans for our sides, but they have lots of other ones to choose from. Everything was perfectly cooked and so flavorful. It&#39;s definitely one of my favorite dishes here now.

This is my place to go to whenever I want to have a good yummy meal. I have tried several meals and they are all good. The customer service was really good today (Bahan) was really nice and made me laugh on a boring Tuesday so thank you for that .

Omg,  i love this place.  I had the best waiter ever! Please sit at Kevin section.  He was funny and made me try the fried mac n cheese burger, which was to die for. Thank you Kevin for you checking on us,. It was so good I instagram it. Plus the Georgia peach drink taste just like like a peach. Please go,  the area is beautiful and sweet. Even the manner Ashley was nice.  Thank you for the best experience.  Coming from orange County is wroth the drive. I&#39;ll be back!

Where do I begin.... As usual, the wait was about 35 minutes long, no big deal. The service was ok except for the fact that one of the servers dropped an entire appetizer all over the table. Not only did the Tater Tots go flying into my friends lap, but the plate that it was in shattered as it hit the table.<br>Accidents happen, this I understand, but they wouldn&#39;t have taken the food back had we not asked them to. The manager came by the table and had someone kind of wipe the table. There were still pieces of glass around the table, and our food was not ready at the same time. When my friend finally received her food, mine was cold and I was annoyed. <br>The manager didn&#39;t attempt to rectify the situation, they didn&#39;t move us to another table, he charged us for everything(no discounts), not even a free slice of cheesecake. I believe that anyone in the customer service industry knows to at least attempt and fix the problem with free dessert. We were completely disappointed, don&#39;t think we&#39;ll be coming back.

My one star reflects the poor service our party of four received tonight. When our food was served, the server spilled the sauce from the pasta dish on my mother! Sauce went dribbling down her sleeve, pants and arm. The server apologized but did little more than wipe the table. The sauce was not on the table, it ended up on my mother!<br><br>The server did tell our waitress what happened.
