At the end of the meal and after I paid the bill, we mentioned to the waitress that the server spilled on my mother and should her the stains on her sweater and pants. She claims she didn&#39;t know about it! Liar! Fess up and admit wrong doing. She did offer a slice of cheesecake to go but we declined. We just wanted to get out of there!<br><br>And on top of all this, we didn&#39;t get one dish comped for this sloppy error. I will be sending a formal complaint email to the general manager to ask for a comped meal and some cash to cover a dry cleaning bill.

Went here on Sunday for lunch...I get it, they&#39;re busy. Long story short...I asked for bread 3 times...never got it....and was never offered a refill on a drink, not even once! As a matter of fact, after we received our food (not from our waiter, someone else brought out the food) I didn&#39;t see the waiter again. Except when he brought the bill....like I said...I asked for bread 3 times...that&#39;s the service at this location.

Went there with my gf on not even a crowded day. Sat at the bar area. Ordered a beer and a wine then 2 small appetizers. 45 min went by still didn&#39;t get our drinks nor our appetizers. Finally reminded the waitress and she brought them over like she was doing us a favor. Food came about an hour after ordering. Next obstacle was trying to get the check, we had to go ask another waiter to bring it for us because our waitress was nowhere to be found. I didn&#39;t have a good experience.

Visited here on a Tuesday and this place continues to be my favorite restaurant. The location here is great because it is in the Americana which is a very cool complex and the wait was not very long. The service was top-notch and the food was amazing! The Oreo cheesecake is incredible! 10/10 would highly recommend!!
I had a great fun experience! Ashely P! Is an amazing server! Thank you for recommending the Oreo Cheesecake as my BDay dessert it was delicious ! And also for singing happy bday!

This place is so good, I can&#39;t believe it only has three and a half stars it should be five!!! I love the Oreo cheesecake and the burgers and fries! Maybe the only thing I have a problem with is the Mac and cheese was once very dry but it&#39;s ok!! <br><br> At this restaurant I always get shakes!! My fav is &#34;shake Dian&#34; with the mashed potato and onion rings. Also the Cesar salad is the best!!! So as I said overall this cheese cake factory is so amazing I am so speechless!! Can&#39;t wait to go again!!!

Poor customer service. Me and my husband were going there for couple years until recent experience. <br>Long story short. We have been asked to seat. Ppl next to us were very loud and we kindly asked to seat in a different place (there were plenty table empty during the day). The server refused and gave us a look. <br>We decided to change seats ourselves. The host came and told us to go back to the old seats. <br>My husband called the manager. The manager showed up and told us that if we don&#39;t seat at that table, we are welcome to leave..<br>At that point we were out of words...<br>Great job Cheesecake Factory... keep up the good work.. meanwhile we&#39;ll go to a better place!

Let me start by just saying i absolutely love the Cheesecake factory! There isn&#39;t a thing I&#39;ve tried here that i have not liked. Although it takes me like a good 20 minutes to decide what I want from the decent sized menu.. i usually always opt for my fav dish here which is hands down the &#34;jambalaya&#34;. Full size.. Eat half of it there and since Im a major fan of left overs.. I always have to save myself a good amount for my next meal.<br><br>Although , Ive always left room for a cheesecake.. The older i get.. I can&#39;t fathom denting my wallet with a $10 slice of my whole days calorie intake. But thats just my 2 cents..

Alright ima review this place in 4 simple things the seating, the food, the service and the cheesecakes:<br><br>3/5 for the seating, I&#39;m not a big fan of the decor of the place it&#39;s nothing special at all<br><br>3/5 the food is good but nothing that left me to crave it again<br><br>5/5 the service was amazing I loved out waiter he was nice and very helpful<br><br>5/5 the cheese cakes here are amazing ive had my share of cheesecakes here and they are defiantly top notch <br><br>So over all I&#39;ll give this place a 3.5/5  but I&#39;ll round it off to a 4 because I only go there mainly for the cheesecake :)

Always satisfying and delicious with generous portions and creative/delicious sides.  Ordered the chicken costoletta which has a crispy coating and a light, creamy lemon sauce, angel hair pasta and asparagus.  Some new flavors of cheesecake to try in the future...too full after this visit to try!

5 stars to Jennifer she was so friendly and kind she was our server. Food came out on time and was tasty. She turned my experience into a great one because I was annoyed before getting seated because the hostess failed to actually tell me that the bar was on a first come first serve seating which was so upsetting because I was waiting in the bar watching the basketball and a table became opened but I wasn&#39;t told we could just grab a table there once it was open. The hostess didn&#39;t seem to care that she failed to mention that some of the tables in the bar were self seating, but she remembered to tell the next few people that key detail which was again annoying. Then after waiting the pager goes off but then you wait another 15-20mins to be seated. Overall the dinner experience was great due to the wonderful service from the waitress Jennifer and she had excellent recommendations for food and dessert.

Food was the same as other factories however the service sucks.. The waiter didn&#39;t attend to us like she did to the table next to us and sadly it was due to our skin. Seemed upset that tip was not given but a tip is earned. Worst experience ever!

I&#39;m always craving the Hershey&#39;s Cheesecake and Fettucinie! BEST PART about this location??? Fech24 offers delivery !!! They are speedy and precise, not sure if Cheesecake delivers in-house bu I definitely recommend using fech24 for delivery, they are always so nice and never forget my complimentary bread

My husband and I have been going to this place for many years. Yesterday it was busy as usual.  We had to wait about an hour, which is the norm. When we got to our seat they placed us in the corner, with no room.  When ordered drinks, it took too long.  Our order was completely wrong, and we didn&#39;t even have time to say anything. Two different waiters had come by to give us things that didn&#39;t even belong to us, I really believe that they are getting too busy and not paying attention to details. We won&#39;t be going back.

This review is based on the plate I ordered. I had for the first time the chicken bellagio and it was good, the only down fall was the pest pasta was a bit too salty on top of that they prosciutto ham on top of the chicken so it can be a bit overwhelming with salt but the service was great and you can never go wrong with the cheesecakes

I&#39;ve truly never had a worse dining experience. We sat down and watched the waiters help every single table around us and for 28 minutes no one ever even came to our table. My guess is because no one realized that this table was in &#34;their section.&#34; (It&#39;s table 103 so you at Cheesecake Factory can maybe get your shit together) <br>Finally I grabbed a waitress that had just started her shift and told her it had been almost 30 minutes and no one ever came to take our drink order. She immediately took our order like nothing had happened. The people next to us complained because they didn&#39;t get an appetizer in time and the manager came over to apologize AND gave them a free loaf of bread. Then we ordered our cheesecake to go because at this point we had been sitting here for over an hour and we were DONE with this experience. Not to anyones surprise she charged me for the wrong slice of cheesecake and instead of comping it she quickly changed the bill and took the 55 cents off of our bill. 55 CENTS. No apology from anyone, no discount, nothing. I&#39;m never coming back.

Pretty much the same as any other Cheesecake Factory I have gone to.  If it&#39;s nice outside request a table on the patio and if your timing is right you&#39;ll get to watch the hourly fountain show put to music.  <br><br>Instead of pagers they ask for your cell phone number then send you a text once your table is ready.

I enjoy going to this Cheesecake Factory because it&#39;s spacious and has a lot of parking choices near by. My favorite dishes is the chicken Cesar salad, chicken piccata, and herd crusted salmon. Cheesecake Factory ales allows me to substitute any side dishes. Waiters are nice and friendly.<br><br>Cons: this location can be very busy at certain time if the day like lunch and dinner (6pm) so try to avoid those times.<br><br>Overall, great place to eat especially in trying different types of cheesecakes!

sorry i hate to slam a chain restaurant and i realize the futility of reviewing a corporate chain but we took grandpa here for a birthday dinner and the service was so appalling that i&#39;m forced to yelp.<br><br>I give this place my coveted BYOW rating (Bring Your Own Waiter).<br><br>there were 8 of us, which put us into the automatic 20% gratuity charge so the waiter completely ignored us for an hour and 45 minutes because he knows no matter what he does he&#39;s going to get his 20% so what&#39;s the point of doing his job??  bad policy, bad restaurant. <br><br>We sat down at 5:15 pm ordered drinks at 5:17pm.<br><br>at 5:30 another party of 8 people were seated near us.  They ordered their drinks.<br><br>5:35pm the table next to us received their drinks.<br><br>no sign of our waiter anywhere.<br><br>at about 5:40 pm i flag down a host to ask him to look for our waiter.  right as i finish talking to the host i spot our waiter walking towards us with our drinks.<br><br>i had ordered a hefeweizen without a garnish and a water and the birthday grandpa had ordered a coke with no ice.  I can&#39;t comment on the other orders because i don&#39;t know what they were.<br><br>i received a hefeweizen with a garnish and no water.  the birthday boy received a coke with ice.<br><br>happy birthday.<br><br>about 15 minutes after that 4 of the dinner orders arrived.  but the other 4 including the birthday boy&#39;s dinner and my dinner didn&#39;t arrive for another 20 minutes.<br><br>i am not exaggerating.  <br><br>this really happened.  <br><br>this place is a train wreck.  <br><br>get your cheesecake to go folks.  <br><br>Dine at your own risk.

I LOVE LOVE LOVE everything about this place. I love that it&#39;s in the Americana and I could walk around with my family. I love that it&#39;s family friendly. I love the food there. I love the portion. I love the service. I love everything about it. <br><br>Would I suggest coming here? Definitely. You could never go wrong. Bring your husband, wife, kids, family, in laws, everyone.

When you think about dine n shop, while at the Americana in Glendale, you think Cheesecake factory, right? Think again, while location is great and the food is fair for the price $$, waited 40 min to be seated, hungry and thirsty, we end up. With a sour experience my waitress, brought my food cold, disappeared for the whole time while we where there, only talking with other servers, how she already made 172.00 in 3 hours of only tips, while my wife and 5 year old, glass was empty from the time she dropped our food. I remain calm when she showed up, just to leave the check ignored our glasses where empty, then left again. When i read the check said, that I &#34;must&#34; tip a min 20% of the total, That&#39;s when I became outraged, took check paid directly to mgr explained and left, just to be confronted by my wonderful waitress at the exit asking that I need it to pay!!!! What!! I told her tip was In the check, she turn around an disappear. &#34;Lesson learned&#34; never again will go there, they&#39;re serving culture is to hustle money out of the patrons and not to serve with customer excellence. Be aware your service, could end up, very, very, &#34;selective&#34; if you know what I mean? :(<br><br>Who?? The store manager?? I talk to him, for 10min, even call him to update him on his waitress move, to face me, at the door. Manager acts surprised, his comments didn&#39;t assured my concerns about her Poor decision&#34; I have a daughter and a son and happily, married, for 20yrs, would never disrespect this waitress. But in today&#39;s society, you never know some people, that kind of behavior could get her, in a lot of trouble.

Drinks here are great!! Strawberry martini is really strong, Mai Thais are great, my favorite is the Georgia peach (great slushy drink for summer or Sunday brunch!) <br><br>Line is always so an long though so a little trick is: don&#39;t even both putting your name down. Head over to the bar and wait for a seat. <br><br>Always get the bang bang coconut and shrimp. Sometimes it&#39;s good other times it seems like they missed the mark but still edible. <br><br>Service is ok depending on who you get.

Our waiter Gilbert H was awesome during the first half of our meal. Very attentive, funny, and kind. Then all of a sudden we had a total 360. He became rude and very short with us. We tried to flag him down multiple times to tell him and also give him a list of our meals for separate checks. When we finally got his attention he said &#34;I&#39;m too busy to do that next time tell me at the beginning&#34;. So we were left to split the bill five ways by ourselves. So we get it all written out and give him EXACTLY what we want on each card, and he messed it up. He put $72 on a card that was suppose to have $20. How do you mess that up????? So we spent 1 1/2 with managers and the waiter figuring things out. A WHOLE HOUR AND A HALF. Really? All because he was too lazy to split the check. I understand it was National Cheesecake Day, but you don&#39;t let your customer service falter. Especially with  the comments he made &#34;All this fuss just for 10 dollars,&#34; &#34;I don&#39;t have time for that.&#34; He should have asked another employee or asked us to wait a little longer, we wouldn&#39;t have minded. Anything is better than waiting an hour and a half for something that could have been avoided in the first place.

I&#39;ve been to the Cheesecake Factory a handful of times and I always say, &#34;I&#39;m never coming back.&#34; Nothing special about this place, the food is subpar, rich and always over salted. I waited over 15 minutes to receive my check the last time. I can say I won&#39;t be returning, there&#39;s much better places to get a bite of food. The best thing about the Cheesecake Factory is probably their bread.
Great place for lunch. There is outdoor patio. View of the fountain and nice music. Great cheesecake but don&#39;t eat too much (I&#39;m watching my weight.)

I came in today to enjoy their foods but it&#39;s so frustrating when I got my order--Renee&#39;s special. The soup was served cold and no soup spoon with it.  Then since I ordered the chicken almond sandwich, the chicken wasn&#39;t cooked well!!!! I lost my appetite. Then my husband offered me his food (Chilaquines) and boy they&#39;re way so bad too, part of the chicken was cold and part was warm...yes the presentation was good but I guess they just microwave their foods here.  Can&#39;t even warm them enough.  I would like to give a 0/5 if possible.  The food quality in this restaurant is very poor. Their service is below average! In this certain cheesecake restaurant---I won&#39;t dare to eat again and I will for sure tell my friends about this.

Avoid this location! They are too busy to care about your business.  Tried to redeem my free cheesecake vouchers from the holiday promo and worker there gave me a hard time about it.  She counted that I had 4 people and told me I couldn&#39;t redeem 6 vouchers.  Made me feel like I was trying to take advantage of the promo.  <br>I came back and sent a complaint on cheesecake website and got a call back after a few days from Tamara.<br>She offers me a insincere apology and said they did what they are trained to do and they did nothing wrong.  I told her I never had this problem with other locations and why are they making a big deal about a small time thing as redeeming a voucher?  I explained, they make me feel like I&#39;m getting a hand out. I bought gift cards to get those vouchers. She just wanted to argue with me, and kept saying those vouchers were free!  I told her don&#39;t worry, I will go to the other locations next time since they don&#39;t give me a hard time. Then she pretends to say she was going to give me a gift card but since I&#39;m not going back, then forget it.

Yesterday my best friend and I attempted to have lunch here. The host offered us outdoor or indoor seating, the wait for outside was 45 minutes so we obviously picked inside. I made a joke about why she even offered outside as an option, she rolled her eyes. We opted to sit at a high top in the bar. We waited several minutes without being greeted so we went back to the host stand. Aaron seated up quickly and was SUPER friendly. We love Aaron. Shortly after being sat we were greeted by our disaster of a server. His tie was crooked and he seemed all out of sorts. I&#39;m a server myself so I understand a busy lunch shift but this was...different. Our drinks took forever, our appetizer(fried cheese) was cold and flavorless and worst of all; after an hour of being sat we finally got our food(Evelyn&#39;s Favorite pasta). It was also cold. So so cold. Like a sad orphan. Evelyn is either a lier or has very poor standards  We asked a bus boy for the manager because our server was nowhere to be found. The manager came over and would you guess what?! The manager and the eye rolling host were the same person! Twilight zone! No wonder the employees there are so unhappy! She seems like a beast. She was apathetic at best about our negative experience. We payed for our drinks (delicious mimosas) and left. Never to return. Save yourself the heart break and go to any of the other restaurants in the area. *Granville is a personal fave of mine*

If I could leave 0 stars I would. My husbands family is in town visiting from Illinois and we wanted to stop to have a good lunch and catch up. We ordered two salads, the salmon meal, and a burger. Our salads were brought out twice, both times still being wrong. We had to ask for refills on our drinks numerous times, and felt like we were basically just being ignored. We mentioned the issues to our server and the only response was she&#39;s sorry. We asked to speak to a manager and no one ever came out. Horrible customer service, it&#39;s not okay to make a customer feel as if they are an inconvenience, and that what we ordered doesn&#39;t matter.
Jennifer provided excellent service for my family and I tonight. We enjoyed the food and felt very welcome. Thank you Jennifer!

This Cheesecake Factory did have some good food, but it was definitely not delicious enough that I would wait for about an hour with my friends to eat lunch at. Granted, it was great that Americana had other stores that I could shop at while waiting, but when you are in a state of immense hunger, this doesn&#39;t satisfy. I don&#39;t remember the pasta dish I ordered, but it was spicy and had chicken (I think it was Louisiana Chicken Pasta?). The dish was pretty good, but again, it took quite a bit of time for the food to come out. My friends ordered other pasta dishes and theirs looked good as well. The food is quite heavy like other Cheesecake Factory restaurants, so ordering the minimum is a good idea. The Avocado Rolls are quite delicious and I would recommend these for appetizers.<br><br>Overall: delicious pasta and avocado roll, LONG wait, decent service

Wow I can&#39;t believe the service I had gotten at this Cheesecake Factory !!! I really like The Americana and I always come here to just walk around and do a little bit of browsing. The other day I was feeling like eating Cheesecake Factory since I haven&#39;t step foot into one in a long long time after many horrible experiences. <br><br>I don&#39;t know why or how it goes about but I always always end up with a kid that just started training! This guy needed a lot of help and his fellow staff members didn&#39;t help him one bit. <br><br>We were sitting for refills on drink forever and even ordering took forever. He already had three tables and seemed like it was too much to handle. People are demanding yes and people want things fast especially for lunch time. <br><br>Our Waiter was nice and sweet but I think if he is still new that they should also get help from another member of the staff. So things will run more smoothly. <br><br>I ordered a lunch portion meal which was huge and I ended up not finishing half of it. But the food was alright I  think it just was killed by the lack of service and attention to us. <br><br>I think I can live without coming to another Cheesecake for awhile.
Great experience before and looking forward to yet another amazing dinner and date night...

Too many options can give you a headache! Luckily though the food will be the medicine. Everything tastes like what crack must feel like because I am literally addicted!! After losing 85 pounds 2 summers ago I stopped going to CCF as I would call it in my texts. Gotta love the Orange Chicken, Oreo Cheesecake, Sweet Potato Fries, Calamari, Rocky Road Cheesecake, MexiCali Tacos and the Mimosas. I have my health in check and I used to think Cheesecake Factory being so good was the reason for my obesity but it was really my lack of selfwill and selfcontrol. I have gone through a very intense spiritual journey with my weight loss and the loss of my child but now I realize it is the finer things in life that make food and life fun. 5 Stars.

It&#39;s always a pleasure coming here! This time our server&#39;s name was Andrew, what a sweetheart! Very attention and he made sure he took good care of us and service like that is why we always come back! :) the food was INCREDIBLE like always, and the cheesecake, awhhhh to die for

I really hate to only give this place three stars.<br><br>im in LA for a longer visit and have been to 2 other cheesecake factory&#39;s and had a really good experience at these. <br><br>At this place they told us there was a 40minutes waiting time but after 50minutes nothing happened so i asked them how long time we had left. They apologized and told us that we would be seated in 5min.. After 10 minutes they called us on the beeper thing and told us our table was being prepared .. 10 minutes later we got to our table.<br><br>The food was not as good as it usually is which after an hour of waiting was disappointing. <br><br>But as always the cheesecake was great! i tried the kahlua and my gf tried the key lime.

I LOVE! the Cheeeeeseecakeee factory :)<br><br>I got the Crispy Chicken Costoletta!<br><br>You have to try it out! Dang, I want some now.<br><br>This place, like every other cheesecake factory, is CUTE!<br><br>Always busy, but that&#39;s good!<br><br>The servers always take care of us when we come,<br>our food always comes out on time!<br><br>Not to mention, I love the bread:)<br><br>It is so yummy! Especially when it comes out hot!

Called ahead on my birthday to see if small dogs were allowed on patio and they said they were. When we got there, manager came out and said that no they weren&#39;t allowed. Terrible customer service. I do not recommend this location. Check out Frida&#39;s down the street, they were pet friendly and offered our pup water. You need to do much better Cheesecake Factory at Americana!
Not a bad location, a bit busy, takes a long time to get your order but it&#39;s alright and the food is okay

My parents came into town for a week and we were in the area so we thought this Cheesecake Factory would be a good choice since it was so conveniently where we were but boy were we wrong! <br><br>The hostesses are horrendous and very mean! It was a very hot Sunday and we only waited 25 minutes inside which wasn&#39;t bad at all. The bad part was after out timer lite up we got up from our seats and thought we would be seated right away, but instead they made us stand off to the side and wait for our table to be ready. 10 minutes of standing time had passed and my dad (who has a bad knee) was wincing. Since they made us get up (for no reason) after our timer lite up we had no where to sit for the remaining wait time. There was also a woman who had to be 7 months pregnant and her husband waiting for their table to be prepared after getting up when their timer went off as well. <br><br>I got a little frustrated and went up to the hostesses and asked when we were going to be seated stating that my dad had a bad knee and the 7 month pregnant woman shouldn&#39;t be standing unless the table was actually ready to have us seated. She turned to me, looked me up and down, sighed and said &#34;Well the tables aren&#39;t ready and I don&#39;t know how long it&#39;s going to be. They can wait a little longer.&#34; She didn&#39;t even care at about the physical state of my dad and the poor pregnant woman! So appalling. I used to work in the service industry and that is not how you handle the situation at all. I then told her I just didn&#39;t understand why they buzzed us when they weren&#39;t even ready to seat us. She ignored me and just typed on the register. Then because I was annoying her they ended up seating me and my parents while they were still cleaning the table. The poor pregnant woman waited another 10 minutes to be seated and they were there before us! <br><br>Our waitress saved the day and made our meal more enjoyable but I still had a bad taste in my mouth that couldn&#39;t be fixed. I will never go to another Cheesecake Factory again and I will be advising my friends to eat at better managed places as well. The fact that the hostess thought she was better than everyone is just ridiculous. Maybe it&#39;s the LA complex but it made me never want to go back.
I love this place. Their chicken Alfredo is amazing! A plus is that the staff are super nice and helpful! I&#39;m always here for family events!

I love The Cheesecake Factory, and this location is no exception. It gets REALLY busy on the weekends, which can be kind of stressful and loud, but if you can get a table outside, it&#39;s a great place to eat, drink, and talk. You can&#39;t go wrong with the menu of drinks or food. It&#39;s packed with delicious comfort food and has a wide variety of options, depending on what type of food you feel like, and whether you&#39;re feeling healthy or not. ;)<br><br>I ate here last night and there was some kind of mix-up with the food that the people next to us had ordered. The manager came out and spoke with them, and it was handled very professionally. The service is always great. I have been nothing but impressed with the wait staff.<br><br>The only thing to be careful with when eating at TCF is that the food is so good it&#39;s hard to stop. The portions are really big and delicious.<br><br>Also, with this location in particular, it&#39;s located in a really nicely designed mall (The Americana), so it&#39;s fun to walk around and shop either before or after eating.

The food is good but I was extremely annoyed when they removed my favorite pasta dish from the menu. The service varies from each location. The waitress had a lot of attitude after I took a little longer to figure out what I wanted since I was so dead set on my usual meal. Will definitely never come back to this location.

I had the most traumatizing experience here. The hostess at the front desk was incredibly disrespectful and humiliated me in front of about 20 people. <br>Spoke to the manager... And he did nothing about it. Finally I had to call the corporate office, and he was quick to respond and was very apologetic. <br><br>Overall, I was so embarrassed that I would rather pass on this location and go to Pasadena instead.

Definitely not worth the hype, only thing we enjoyed was the cheesecake and our friendly waitress.  Host and seater were slow and rude!  Horrible inefficiency.  Burgers were average at best!  Save your money dont bother

We went to dinner the weekend before Christmas. You could tell the staff was extremely busy yet they were still able to execute excellent service. the food /drinks were really good. And the peppermint bark cheesecake was fantastic !

Everyone knows about the food. I would like to thank our waiter JOEL. We ordered only appetizers at 10 minutes to closing and you not only treated us with respect and friendliness but made sure our drinks were full, the food was right, and that we got it all fast. Thanks again!!

Came here for a quick lunch and my boyfriend and I shared this amazing sun dried tomato fettucine alfredo. It was to die for! We also ordered the J.W. Lemonade and it was so delicious. All of their drinks are amazing!

One of my favorite Cheesecake Factory restaurants. I always get good service here although there is usually a bit of a wait. Plus it&#39;s at the Americana and it has a good atmosphere. My favorite dish is the Louisiana chicken pasta. Never disappoints! Good place for date night as well.

The service was so bad tonight. I&#39;ve been to this location a few times before and it was never this bad. We had four adults and two kids under two in our party. Our pager buzzed and when we got to the counter they asked us to step aside and wait to be called. We waited at least ten minutes before checking again and they said we didn&#39;t make it in time when we were paged so they gave our table away to the next group. Not true. When we were finally seated the service was really really slow. No bread came out no drinks came out. When drinks finally came out they were served in plastic to go cups because they said they ran out of regular cups. Never coming back here on a Saturday night again.

We popped in here late evening, so it wasn&#39;t bad on a week night! The other restaurant we were going to had closed down &amp; this was in the area! <br>Noise level was ok for a business meeting, service was great! Our attentive server was Grant H, kept refilling our coffees &amp; iced teas. Very helpful in offering options on menu.<br>Tried Roasted beets w/Goat Cheese, Asian Lettuce Wraps, Salmon &amp; Chicken Madeira Combination. All were very tasty! Looking forward to another visit soon!

Pre ordered a whole truffle tower chocolate cake that my daughter requested for her bday Party. Ordered it yesterday for pick up today. Went to pick it up at 5:30 today and the cashier said they didnt have the cake. It was for my daughter&#39;s 15th bday and New Years Eve party. Spoke to the manager who was useless, unprofessional and unapologetic. Didn&#39;t even make an effort to call other locations to check availability. All he said pretty much is that the order taker messed up... oh really? Did she? Like I said , USELESS. I called other locations and Had to drive all the way to Arcadia to get one.

i was so pleased with this restaurant!   My bf and I go out and have dinner and so many times we are disappointed.  But not last night!<br><br>Our server Gordan, was so very attentive.  I&#39;m not the easiest person to get an order from.  I wanted something fruity and chose a vodka infused lemonade.  My bf wanted a peach smoothie.  Both drinks were great.  The peach smoothie had some raspberry in it and some fresh fruit garnish.  My vodka lemonade came in a sugar rimmed glass and was crisp and refreshing.  <br><br>I ordered the Crispy Chicken Costoletta and my bf ordered the Smokehouse BBQ Burger medium rare.  Our food came quickly and we were so satisfied!  Mine was 3 pounded chicken breasts with a delicious lemon sauce, a generous portion of smashed red potatoes, and crisp asparagus.  It was so good!  <br><br>My bf is pretty picky about his burger being cooked medium rare and his burger was perfect!  It came piled high with onion rings and fries.  It looked more like an art project and he loved it.  <br><br>We decided to have coffee and split a slice of Chris&#39; Outrageous Cheesecake.  We both like coconut and this dessert has a layer of chocolate cake, a layer of brownie, coconut-pecan frosting and chocolate chip coconut cheesecake.  It&#39; was the bomb!  Super rich and flavorful, we dug in!  <br><br>My bf got a phone call from a client and we had to split.  We asked Gordan for some to go cups for the coffee and a box for the rest of the cheesecake.  Now, I figured he would bring empty cups so we could pour our coffee into it.  No!  He brought us 2 fresh coffees in to go cups!  I thought that was really nice and considerate of him!  He didn&#39;t have to do that.  <br><br>I have to say the wait staff at this restaurant was exceptional.  This is a HUGE place with tons of tables and we were there on a Saturday evening so it was packed!  Despite that, our waiter was very patient with us and that was so refreshing.  He really cared about us and was very intuitive as to what we needed.  The table next to us had a different waiter and I made eye contact with her while she was talking to her table.  After she finished at her table, she came by and asked if I needed anything.  I didn&#39;t, but what if I did?  I liked that she was attentive and willing to help another table  that wasn&#39;t hers.  So many times it&#39;s like, pfft...not my table.  But not here.<br><br>I would definitely come here again.  The food and the service was fantastic!  <br><br>(I don&#39;t get the negative reviews about the food.  Especially that lady complaining about the calories and the fat content.  So don&#39;t eat here.  It&#39;s not that hard of a concept.)

Food&#39;s fantastic and this location&#39;s staff is amazing. They&#39;re friendly, helpful, and willing to cater to your dietary needs. As a vegan, my server helped me find an option that was satisfying and delicious (vegan cobb ftw!)

Awful... this has to be the biggest shame of a restaurant I have been to. Used to come here all the time... it&#39;s been a year or so. Today everything was crappy steak Diane overcooked... they sent it back brought a new one this one tasted old.... funny thing is my mom&#39;s tuna salad also tasted of old overseaoned fish.... so disappointing the only decent thing is the service... wow you guys lost your quality over the years tastes like a truck stop diner food... smells old and you eat it to get by....

If I could give no stars, I would.  5 people behind a counter, just 1 on the register, and it takes 45 minutes or more for someone to grab a premade cheesecake.  You would think a place called Cheesecake Factory could at least serve cheesecake quickly!

Food is fantastic but service is straight lousy. Every single time we&#39;ve gone there my fiancé and I have had to wait 20 mins, plus just for drinks. I&#39;m not talking popular nights like Saturday, and Fridays. <br><br>I&#39;m talking Wednesday&#39;s at 7pm. <br><br>But the service I had on May 28th has made the Cheesecake Factory OFF any potential restaurant list period. <br><br>I asked for lettuce and tomato to be removed from my burger and the waitress gave me attitude I&#39;ve never experienced. As if my request was truly ruining her day. Reb argued with me in how the burger was gonna be... Huh? I thought I was in the Twilight Zone, my fiancé even took note of it. So, for atleast a year, I will not step foot in this Cheesecake Factory. Maybe great to go, but no way will I ever done in there for a while. Never have I had such an aggressive and RUDE waitress. Maybe she was just having a bad day so I won&#39;t say the name she gave as it&#39;s pretty distinctive. <br><br>But wow.

Went here on my birthday with my boyfriend and ordered lemon herb crusted fish. The server was decently nice to us until the food came out. Apparently she put in the lemon herb crusted chicken. I told her I ordered the fish, (I don&#39;t even like chicken! I would never order it!). She called me a liar to my face. I didn&#39;t want to make a big deal (because I am a really tolerant person), but I asked her to fix it anyways and bring over the manager. Manager never came and the food came out THIRTY minutes later. By then my boyfriend already ate his food (because I told him to) and when my food came out, I was too upset to eat it (by being called a liar). On my birthday, I was upset, I will never forget what happened here and I tell everyone about what happened. <br>xoxo,<br><br>-Birthday ruined

HUGE &amp; BEAUTIFUL LOCATION!<br><br>...and HUGE and Beautiful Cheesecakes!  This is a great location at the Americana.  The biggest location I&#39;ve ever seen for the Cheesecake.  Because of their seating capacity, there&#39;s never a wait here.  The parking is not the best since it shares the lots with everything else at the Americana, but validation is offered.

Popped in super late the other night.  Although we were right before last call the bartenders were very nice.   We didn&#39;t get treated any differently.  I believe they went out of their way to make us feel comfortable and I really appreciate that.  You guys have a good thing going with good staff. Thank you!!<br><br>Drinks were great along with the cheesecake;)

Takes forever to order something... The tables weren&#39;t even ready and they were trying to seat us. Hostess was super rude and didn&#39;t look like she was trying to be nice. All the servers here suck! One looked at me and I tried to get his attention and straight ignored me. It&#39;s 1pm and it&#39;s not that full and they look like they are walking around aimlessly. This cheesecake is by far the worst I Have ever been to.
Bad service lady manager completely useless. Will rethink to go back<br><br>Going out to eat shall be a pleasure and a manager should be properly trained
Great food and great service!  I love their Happy Hour!  The menu is full of variety!  The cheesecake is yummy!

The Cheesecake Factory here in Glendale, beside the fountain at the Americana, is an ideal restaurant to dine at. Though it may seem overwhelming inside (like any good restaurant should), the customer service is beyond even a five star rating. Along with the excellent service, the Cheesecake Factory offers exotic, savory food. My favorite appetizer at the Cheesecake Factory, though there are many delicious varieties, is the wheat bread. The wheat bread has a nice texture to it and is served with butter to spread upon it. Oh, and don&#39;t even get me started on the dining! When looking through the menu, I had trouble deciding which meal to get. After scanning through it for a while, though, I stumbled upon the chicken Alfredo. The chicken Alfredo, served elegantly and cooked to perfection, was the best I ever had. I&#39;m not sure what it is, but the Cheesecake Factory has a way of making delicious chicken Alfredo. Finally, when I got to dessert, I ordered a Cheesecake (hence the name The Cheesecake Factory), and decided to order the strawberry cheesecake. When the cheesecake got to my table, I wasn&#39;t surprised that it looked better than it did in the image! I immediately dug in. My expectations, being the highest that they have ever been in a long time, were not let down. I&#39;m thankful for getting an opportunity to dine at such an amazing establishment. Thank you, Cheesecake Factory at Glendale, for such an amazing dining experience.
Delicious food... Extremely friendly waiters/waitresses... Chill enviornment... Love the outdoor seating area.. Patrick is the best :)
I always get the Carrot cheese cake or the pineapple upside down cake.  Nothing beats their cheesecakes!

TSK, TSK Cheesecake Factory!  Before I commence with my scathing review about our lunch yesterday, let me state that I eat here all the time and normally I receive the type of service I&#39;ve come to expect at a CF: excellent. That being said, yesterday&#39;s experience from top to bottom sucked. Big time. <br><br>The only positive was being warmly greeted by the hostess Maddy.  As a huge Laker fan, I recognized her right away as one of the Laker Girls. : )<br><br>Being that it was a gorgeous day, we asked for a table outside on the patio. Wish granted.  However, the girl who took the four of us to our table, brought us to a party of 10 people and started to put our menus down, which created an awkward moment where we were wondering &#34;who are these people and why do we have to sit with them?&#34; while said people were looking at us thinking, &#34;who are these girls crashing our party?&#34; So I told the girl, &#34;Hold on, you know we&#39;re not with those people right?&#34; Clearly flustered, she just sat us at the closest table, dropped the menus and bolted. Well, the table was as close as any table could possibly be to the huge party, &amp; we just wanted a nice, quiet lunch away from parties &amp; kids, so we asked to be moved. Little did we know, we were moving to a new area that would bring us to the worst service imaginable. <br><br>1.) Drinks came &amp; I had some foreign object floating in my iced tea. No harm, no foul as it was replaced.<br>2.) My friend decided she wanted a lemonade, so she ordered one at the time our initial drinks were being delivered (more on that later).<br>3.) Normally, we request a basket of that delicious honey wheat bread (no white bread) but a mixed basket was plunked down before we had a chance to ask. No worries, less carbs is probably a good thing.<br>4.) We order two Skinnyliscious Factory Salads, a Skinnyliscious Chicken Salad sandwich and a Grilled Chicken Sandwich.  After what seemed like an eternity, our food shows up. But, not all the food, only the TWO salads. One of the salads had a hair in it, but my friend wasn&#39;t sure if it was hers (her hair was in a ponytail) or not. She convinced herself it was hers (EEK). Surely, the other two dishes are right behind it, right?  Wrong.  It was about 10-15 minutes before the Grilled Chicken sandwich showed up, leaving one person at our table with no food. And not wanting to be rude, we all just sat there &amp; waited &amp; waited &amp; waited for the Chicken Salad sandwich to show up.  It was around this time, that my friend&#39;s lemonade showed up (30 minutes later!)  Our waitress never came by during this entire debacle until my laser beam glare caught her from across the patio and I motioned her over.  When informed that we were missing a dish &amp; that we had been waiting a really long time for it, she went to check it out &amp; came back with just the side salad in a small bowl and plunked it down. Honestly, it looked like mixed greens and dressing that would have taken 15 seconds to make. Well, finally, we can all get started eating... but by that time we were pretty much fed up.  We flagged down some random girl &amp; asked for the manager. Clearly, she goes and tells our server of our request for a manager instead of sending him directly over because after 10-15 more minutes the joke of a sandwich shows up, delivered by our waitress. Huge white plate, with a mid-sized sandwich sitting in the middle--not even a garnish. No joke, it was two slices of toasted white bread with premade chicken salad, lettuce and a tomato. THAT IS WHAT WE WAITED 40+ MINUTES FOR??!!!  I&#39;ve made sandwiches at home that looked better than that!  And mind you, it wasn&#39;t even crowded in the restaurant. Instead of apologizing, she asks &#34;Do you still want to speak to the manager?&#34;  Are you crazy lady? Of course we do! Even more so now.<br>5.) The &#34;Manager&#34; - Oh boy. I think his name was Julian or Justin and I&#39;m still not convinced that he was even a manager given his demeanor dealing with us. It was evident that our waitress had given him her (very skewed) version of events prior to his arrival because he comes over and very nonchalantly says, &#34;So, I hear there was a dish that took a little longer to arrive.&#34;  Really, dude?  Honestly, I think he apologized but I&#39;m not entirely sure as he spoke very fast and mumbly, which came off as totally insincere. He offered to give us a complimentary dessert, which we declined being that 3 of the 4 of us ordered from the SKINNYliscious menu (Hellooo, summer is upon us!).  I think that threw him for a loop and he looked unsure what to do at that point. Finally, he offered to comp the meal that took ages to arrive and he left. In summary, a nice quick bite to eat for lunch turned into an irritating, unsatisfying nearly 2 hour experience. Shame on you Cheesecake Factory, I really expect so much more from you.

Cheesecake used to be a good restaurant a few years ago, however, it gets worse day by day. Last time we were here there was hair in my food when I called the server to show it to him, he took my plate and didn&#39;t even even apologize for it. Then, came back and said I&#39;m sorry but we don&#39;t see hair in your plate. After that I just decided never to put a foot in this restaurant.

I placed my order over the phone and the  person that I spoke with, her name was Alicia was very rude. She was very condescending. Being in a service industry, I expected more customer service from her. This is The Cheesecake Factory and not some small restaurant. <br><br>I love their food, it&#39;s just this person that made my experience with the restaurant regretful.

For starters, the location of this restaurant is so convenient. Located at The Americana in Glendale California, it is a perfect place for a nice dinner and lunch. The service was exceptional and the food turned out great. I usually sit inside but this time I decided to sit on the patio. The only thing that bothered me was the flies. Although it was outside I do feel there are things  that can be done to help avoid the amount of flies around the food.

Great service.. We had a party of 12 and we waited a little more than 30min which was less than wait time they gave us.. Appetizers came out quick and the staff was very attentive and they gave us everything we asked for except for the bill..lol   ... Food came out delicious
I love this place first for its location in Glendale and second for some good food, but the waiting time and sometime careless behavior of the front desk is irritating.

Would of been a 5 star review but I gave it a 4 just because of the extremely long wait time. You would think they would build this place bigger.<br><br>On the other hand the food is always cooked perfectly and the portions are huge. They have a lunch menu, which is smaller portions.<br><br>OHH and their bread is so delicious. I think they make it in house.

Ordered a burger and the meat had no seasoning, it was bland overall but the fries were good but I didn&#39;t pay 15 bucks for some fries. Also I know we had a big party and separating checks is hard but she forgot to give my friend her check which is understandable since we were a big group  but when we  told her about it she was totally rude. She also forgot my check and I realize that my change was only three bucks but I wanted to make sure if it was enough for the tip or if I had to put more  I honestly forgot what my total was, when she gave me my check she was like your change is three dollars but emphasizing the three and when she gave my friend her 12 bucks of change she told me again &#34; I gave you back your three dollars right&#34; and again emphasizing the three. Before the whole issue with the check we asked  her if she could validate our parking and she said she would but when I used it I still had to pay the total amount for parking. This is my first time going to the cheesecake factory and honestly if they can&#39;t even get a &#34;classic&#34; burger right and having to deal with a waitress trying to make me feel bad for asking for my change I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll ever step foot in a cheesecake factory

The last time I went to The Cheesecake Factory was a few years ago and ppl absolutely love this place Mugabe it&#39;s because I didn&#39;t get the dessert (cheesecake). Well for my entree I had the Chicken Madeira which the waiter raved about and it was actually good except my mashed potatoes were drier and the Madeira sauce should of been poured over it to give it more flavor. As for my BF he has the Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp with chicken. He was very disappointed because his nationality is Jamaican and, it was nothing like a Jamaican dish because it was missing the flavor and spices. Instead it said it was on the sweeter side I guess with the mango salsa. He said the rice was hard and the actual best thing on the plate was the Plantains. For drinks we had a Caribbean cooler which was pretty good I just wish it was served in a bigger glass because by time my food came I was done. Overall nice atmosphere, friendly staff, and prices were reasonable in addition to portion sizes. My BF doesn&#39;t want to come back but I would love to try a few more menu items.
Eh.. place is a bit pricey for the service you get if you ask me.. nice decor. Food is very flavorful that&#39;s the plus side..
Only came for a quick appetizer and a drink before going to a concert, but Vince the bartender was great. Best martini I&#39;ve had in a long while. Thanks bro!

waited 15 minutes at the bar area for a menu and order drinks. Ordered bread, took another 15 mins for it to come. Drinks came, short of a straw. Ordered food- ahi carpaccio, crab cakes and a cheeseburger. 25 mins + and still no sign of food. Waiter, is clueless, introduces us to another waiter and tells us that was our waiter. SMH. Still waiting....#wow

I&#39;m here all the time and always love my experience. They have a large menu, in which you will be sure to find something that you&#39;d like. Did I also mention how divine their cheesecake is ? <br><br>Parking is great, because they validate if you park in the Americana or you can park in the galleria for free and cross the street. Every waiter/waitress that I had was skilled in knowing details about each dish and always make good recommendations. Overall, great place.

I am done with this corporate company. Every f****ing time I go here, the FROZEN,PACKAGED,STOUFFERS like plates are outrageous for such a high price. First time was in Pasadena ordered a pesto pasta was DISGUSTING! And the server even said &#34;yeah I wouldn&#39;t have ordered that&#34; at the end of my paid meal, well thanks for not warning me ahead of time! Then at this Glendale location, 3 days ago, I got the Pasta with Shrimp and sausage, tasted like frozen microwaved sh*t, I had to order a Dr. pepper to wash this frozen sh*t down, and later that day I kept THROWING UP the pasta, and had bad diarrhea, for a couple of hours, felt a mini food poisoning. Ugh why Cheesecake ? Why you gotta have 30 pages of food, but can plate it fresh? Why do you charge so much, I forgot you are a corporate money guzzling conglomerate.<br>The servers are always attentive and sweet ! I guess cheesecake needs that so the food wont taste as shit.
Extremely unorganized  very slow we were sitting down 30 minutes before they even try bring us water or any appetizer we ordered. <br>I rate this service as 0

My usual experience here is ok. Service is usually decent, and food pretty good for the most part. Thus time I was a bit grossed out though. Two of the dishes we got had hair in it. We were very nice about letting them know about it but all we were offered was a replacement plate. At this point two plates with hair in it didn&#39;t really earn our trust that other plates wouldn&#39;t have hair in it too. So declined the free food.<br><br>We had 3 birthdays on our party and really didn&#39;t want to spoil the mood so we just left it at that. I think if we had made it a bigger deal we would have not had to pay for those plates. But why do you have to be a jerk or corner a restaurant to do the right thing? I think they showed their true character by offering nothing else to make up for the hair in the food. Considering this place isn&#39;t the cheapest I&#39;d probably opt for a better place to dine next time.

Good place to have a normal lunch. Maybe I&#39;m not a big fun of those flavor, but the avocado egg roll was kinda weird with sweet sauce. The chicken salad was just a little bit chicken inside and I&#39;m not satisfied with that. Good location, located in Americana and the architecture are good like always.

Worst location, service is always horrible, imagine having to get up through out my visit to get myself water and silverware because the only time my table was approached was 1. When they took my order 2. When my food was brought to me never knew who my waiter was...I asked for my ribeye to be cooked medium rare it was brought to me medium well almost well done. Reallly poor service at this location compared to the rest I&#39;ve been too

The cheesecake factory has been great and not so great. It&#39;s a good go to restaurant and the food is delicious. The service is the only thing that lacks here most of the time. <br><br>I go here often, and they have messed up our orders more than once. We go later in the night always so not sure if that is a factor or not. The servers take a long time to return and our drink sit waiting for a refill most the time.<br><br>If you do come here I recommend eating at the bar if you can find a seat. They have the full menu and the bartends really work hard and are good at what they do. Plus from there you can see the water show behind the bar through the huge glass wall. <br><br>The bar and the quality of the food pushed this review higher then it should have been overall. I would honestly rate it 3 and 1/2 if I could. Some of the staff go the extra mile but there are those that are just there messing around with nothing to do sometimes. Its not enough to discourage me from coming back but its not my first choice anymore. <br><br>It will always be a good back up in my book for now

So this was a fail from every level. I came I after dinner, just to pickup a cheesecake, with the intent to eat it outside. They were closing, although I was the only person in line, basically the counter informed me until they figured I was not going to go away and finally took my order and waited an additional 5 mins for them to give it to me! The slice was in the box, all it needed was it&#39;s signature whipped cream. Although the guy that took my order walked away and when he came back, realized I was still standing there and then gave me my order! When I sat down to enjoy my slice, I had a runny whipped cream that was spattered all over the place and ruined the presentation and quite frankly the slice because it was basically milk pour over it!!! Mind you I just took the slice to table a outside, so just in case you thought it must of melted. Very different service from the Irvine Spectrum Cheesecake Factory.
Over all wait for 30 min it&#39;s worth it. Friendly staff and good food. I will recommend cheese cake to all hungry yelpers.

I came here recently and got some avocado egg rolls to go.  When I got home, I found the avocado filling to be kind of brownish/black!!  (The last time I had avocado egg rolls was at the Grove location and the avocados were so green and fresh looking)  I don&#39;t think the ride home from Glendale to L.A. would make the avocados turn color in that amount of time so I think they used overripe avocados...It didn&#39;t look very appetizing at all.<br><br>I called and spoke to the manager.  He was very nice and apologetic and offered me a gift card for my next visit.  I commend them for making things right.

I enjoy coming here once in a while, every time I come it&#39;s busy but I mean why wouldn&#39;t it be? BUT, Service wise I mean I expected more but it is what it is. The only friendly service I even get is from the host/hostesses. I love the food here! Maybe need to try another location?

I LOVE THIS PLACE! The  variety of food here is amazing, starting from salads, pastas, burgers, sandwiches, etc. Every time I&#39;ve came here my waiter/waitress has treated me in such good manner. I always get the spicy chicken chipotle pasta and it&#39;s amazing!  Also my go to appetizer is the avocado egg rolls, they are so delicious. Hands down best restaurant I&#39;ve been to in Glendale!

I love cheesecake factory! It is my family&#39;s favorite place to go. Great quality of food, large portions and very yummy.<br>I think we go there like twice a month. Not just this location but others as well.<br>Pastas: try the jambalaya or chipotle chicken pasta both are spicy but soo sooo good<br>Appetizer&#39;s: Try Lettuces wraps, Stuffed Mushrooms, or wings YUMMY<br>Salads: Luau Salad, BBQ Chicken Salad, Kale Salad, Cesar Salad All really good<br>I haven&#39;t had burgers or sandwiches but they look amazing<br>Cheesecake: Tuxedo or carrot cheesecake OMG amazing

Cheesecake factory is always good. One thing that gets me though is that their menu is so huge that it&#39;s kind of overwhelming. I really enjoy their lunch special that comes with a cup of soup and a half sandwich. It&#39;s definitely worth the price. Their service is amazing and I have to admit, they saved me a lot of money. I accidentally left my ticket validation there and also went over the free time (the penalty for losing your ticket is the max price for the day). I went back and found out that not only did our waitress save our ticket for me if I came back, they validated it for two hours so I didn&#39;t have to pay anything. I&#39;d recommend this place for their delicious food and friendly service to anyone that is in the area.

I went back twice recently for my birthday week. The first time on my birthday we ordered appetizers and drinks. The menu&#39;s were dirty, which was gross. My sister ordered the Fire-Roasted Artichokes which were not so bad and I wanted fries for the table. When we got them they were cold, tasteless, and not crispy at all. The next time I came we ordered fries again with the sliders hoping they would taste better and the Portobello Mushroom and Zucchini fries as well. The fries were again not crisp and tasted like they were leftovers, the sliders were bland like microwaveable frozen burgers, and the Portobello Mushroom and Zucchini fries were too fried and did not taste good. Both times our servers could have been more welcoming. <br><br>Next time I will stick to what I usually order at Cheesecake, which are the specialty plates and pasta&#39;s. The salads are not to bad either.

I asked for a table for 2 and a poppy for outside patio. They said sure. After waiting 20 min to be seated, they told us the poppy has to be outside the rail meaning outside the restaurant. We left and got so upset that they didnt tell us that from the beginning. So disappointing and unprofessional

First of all, a celebration for what is looking to be an establishment of a lifetime. What a year what a year. Truly and humbly, honestly what a  fucking year. What a fucking year it&#39;s been. And let me please, in your greatest regards, allow me to explain why. One word: Majid the host. Majid let us celebrate hand in hand and reach a high we&#39;ve never reached before. One base further from a grand slam. Majid you awre as my brother Big T says, Rat a tat a slam dat kat.

This location was just like every other. A long line, and a little too dim inside. Their food is good though, yet still expensive. Their house bread and butter is always nice though, because they have different types of bread. Our server was very nice and accommodating to our party. Overall, it was a nice experience even though the wait was almost an hour.
Love the food here, i always order the skinny hamburger.. Save some room for the vanilla cheesecake.. Really like this place after a full stomach always shop next door at the mall

Had lunch with my friend yesterday and enjoyed the food as well as the service. Josh R. Was amazing!! He was always checking on us, full of smiles and with a great attitude. We usually eat there once every two weeks and we had never experienced such great service. I also made sure the manager knew how fun we made our lunch time. Will try to sit in his section when we go back!!!

Review is not about the food, but the HORRIBLE service.<br><br>My mom and I asked the hostess to be seated outside since we had our dog with us. With prior notice from the hostess that our dog needed to be leashed OUTSIDE the fenced area, which we completely agreed to, we were seated out in the patio.<br><br>Everything was fine; my dog was behaving fine (with the leash tied to the black fence outside), my mom and I were served our waters &amp; bread, and we were waiting for our server to show up. Then comes a &#39;manager&#39; that tells us they couldn&#39;t serve us because we had our dogs with us and other diners had an issue with this. We were asked to leave the restaurant.<br><br>SERIOUSLY? ARE YOU KIDDING ME? Your &#39;competent&#39; hostess already knew we had our dog with us, and he was (as indicated), OUTSIDE the dining area. We only noticed two occupied tables that were far away from our table, so where did you get this &#34;complaint&#34; from? They didn&#39;t even notice our dog because my mom leashed him prior to coming in through the side door.<br><br>I wouldn&#39;t have an issue with this, and I&#39;ve seen diners at this particular branch at the Americana with dogs in the past. But there are so many things wrong with this picture. You could have refused to serve us FROM THE GET GO because we had our dog - when I walked in the restaurant to ask, my mom was waiting OUTSIDE by the side door so we wouldn&#39;t disturb diners. You also didn&#39;t have to disrespect us by wasting our time getting seated only to be kicked out minutes later.<br><br>I still have yet to receive a reply from you even after writing an email to explain the situation in a detailed manner. I&#39;m sure you guys provide your staff with extensive training on customer service, but please make sure the left hand knows what the right hand is doing, because apparently, our experience here turned out to be horrible because of your lack of competence in coordinating situations professionally.

Americana Glendale Location<br>Frustrating and a bit more  FRUSTRATING..specially after they make you wait 40 minutes just so they can give you that device which would buzz in another 45 minutes and then one server came and offered to seat us outside.. we are with a 15 month old and it&#39;s cold... its fine i get it you guys are busy.. but we&#39;ll since I asked for a booth I was handed that buzzer again.. now that it rings and approach counter I am asked to wait on the side and wait for my name to be called...now we are seated   in the aisle  which hardly fit us and we are in a way of every customer that passes by ... that&#39;s fine too but then after taking the order not even water came to the table for another 30 minutes.... WHY DO YOU GUYS TAKE CUSTOMERS THAT YOU CAN&#39;T HANDLE... OR HIRE A BIT MORE TRAINED STAFF For restaurant... rather than on call models...<br>Oh and our little one dropped our settings from the table ..so now we are without any fork or spoon to eat with and no one is going to ask anytime soon

Had relatives visiting from overseas and wanted th to try the food. Friday 730pm went in and was told the wait is 40 mins to one hr by two people one of them was the mngr. At 830 checked in to see how much longer and was rudely told &#39;I told you 1:40mins&#39;. There is a huge difference when you tell someone 40 mins to one hr vs an hour and forty mins. And I&#39;m not that old to need a hearing aid. So asked the manager to check if there were any possibility of it being sooner with less people since two were babies not needing a seat. She again brushed me off by saying &#39; if you want to wait now it&#39;s two and a half hr wait&#39;. This is a coming from the manager. I&#39;m not sure she understood my question but I just didn&#39;t want to deal with it anymore. So we went to Frida and they were attentive and professional. No thanks, will not be returning back to sleezecake factory.

How can you not love this place? Everything is delicious. Best appetizer ever: crispy crab wontons. And recently I tried the fried macaroni and cheese balls which were amazing, but nothing can compare to the wontons. There&#39;s usually a ton of people there especially on weekends. So don&#39;t go if you don&#39;t feel like seeing people =) The patio seating is great on a nice day because you get to see the water fountains and hear the music and people-watch. The wait is almost never as long as they say, so that&#39;s always great. Plus there&#39;s plenty of stuff to do while you wait for your table. The waiters are really cool, haven&#39;t had a bad one so far. And the drinks are the best! Tropical martini and key lime martini are the best martinis. Pumpkin cheesecake for dessert is a great idea, as is the strawberry shortcake.

If I had to whittle down my review to two words: farmhouse cheeseburger.<br><br>But here&#39;s the expanded version: go with someone, each of you get a farmhouse cheeseburger, try to walk around the Americana a few times to make sure your heart hasn&#39;t stopped from the burger, grilled smoked pork belly with fried egg on top.
Love the shrimp Scampi.... Love the strawberry lemonade love the ambiance I just hate the long wait. But at the end of it all I love love this restaurant .

Very disappointing visit... 45 min wait then they call our name and ask us to wait off to the side then 20 min to get walked to our table and leave us standing there because the bus boy wasn&#39;t finished cleaning it up (unprofessional) then we sit down and we have hot fresh silverware with food on the spoon. The bartender is terrible!!! We ordered a passion fruit mojito and a long island they were mehhh as if it was a happy hour at a whole in the wall place with a bartender in training.. so we tried the berry mojito... even worse! I had to ask the waiter to bring me the sweetener... I&#39;m a promoter for a nightclub so I know my drinks ;) I ordered the chicken madeira had no flavor but was ok after I added salt and pepper. My boyfriend ordered the cajun jambalaya pasta and it was terrible no flavor! Their was also a table accross from us who didn&#39;t even eat what she ordered and the waiter asked her if she wanted to take it home and she said no I didn&#39;t like it. They must have a new chef because we eat at the Cheesecake Factory frequently but it was really bad this time! We were there Dec 13, 2015 ordered about 4pm I would give the waiter 5 stars  he was amazing... but I forgot his name lol tall stocky guy brown hair with a beard...
One of my favorite restaurants at Americana! Great food, good service! The only downside is that it gets pretty busy on weekends and there is at least 15-30min wait time

Almost 2 hours into a &#34;30-45 minute wait&#34; and when we ask they say that the one table they had for us has people that won&#39;t leave. Terrible table management, if you had a party sitting longer than expected, juggle your other tables around and fix it, don&#39;t blame your other patrons.  I can&#39;t believe what a shit show of an operation you are running at your Americana location. I NEVER write negative reviews, this situation was so bad that I felt compelled to.  My advice, go somewhere else. I&#39;ll never return.

Honestly I never realized how good cheesecake factory was. Maybe I was just really hungry but it was really good. <br>Ordered shrimp scampi and a Monterey burger. <br>The shrimp scampi was okay. I didn&#39;t lie how the shrimps were fried. Pasta seemed a little over cooked and bit dry. <br>The burger was really good though. Had avocados. I had lettuce and tomatoes added on the burger though.

Food here is ok. Super high in calories. My main complaint is more about customer service. I can&#39;t believe places like this do not take reservations.... absolutely absurd. Actually they are just doing what dumb ass venues do in LA... try to make people wait in front to show they are busier and to create hype. Ugh. Pathetic actually. There is no reason for a restaurant of this size to not take reservations. #fail

I love the Cheesecake Factory but today was the worst experience just to buy a slice of cheesecake! Yes, one slice of cheese cake. The guy literally was ignoring us because he stated with attitude that he was backed up. I continued to be patient but my patience wore off after 25 mins of not being attended. It&#39;s unfortunate that the people are what make the experience a bad one. I hope the management can better execute time management for their employees because it was just a waste of my time...

Yes, for the fiftieth thousandth time, I have not been to Americana.  Until today of course.  :)  I&#39;ve been to a lot of Cheesecake Factories and I must say this one was similar to all other locations.  However, this location doesn&#39;t beat my favorite location in Fashion Island.  <br><br>My company took me here for my one year anniversary and I was excited to see Americana since I&#39;ve been wanting to go for quite some time now.  We had reservations for party of 10 and despite getting there on time, we still ended up being seated after all the individuals who had just walked in without reservations.....kind of lame and disorganized.  <br><br>I got a strawberry lemonade which I thought was too sweet and to top it off they sugar coat the rim of the glass....yikes!  <br><br>Starters:<br>Avocado egg rolls (So good!) <br>Spinach dip (How can you go wrong with this?)<br>Calamari (meh, just ok) <br><br>For my main dish I ordered one of my favorites, chicken Madeira topped with asparagus, melted cheese, and covered with mushroom Madeira sauce.  It also comes with their mashed potatoes.  Farfalle pasta is also another one of my favorites that I didn&#39;t order this time.<br><br>Despite how stuffed you are like our waiter, Sergio said &#34;You are at the Cheesecake Factory and have to get cheesecake!&#34;  So that&#39;s exactly what most of us did.  We all ended up sharing<br><br>Dessert:<br>Coffee cheesecake<br>Peanut butter cup cheesecake  <br>30th anniversary cheesecake<br>Chocolate cake<br><br>The last cheesecake we decided to get was by recommendation of another waiter who said it was so good it would make you cuss!  Let me tell you, DAMN it was FUCKING good.  I know most cheesecakes here are really too rich, but this one was actually the lightest one I&#39;ve had.  Ladies and gentlemen, the banana creme cheesecake is to die for.  I&#39;m not even a fan of bananas and it was so gooood!  My supervisor who had eaten his whole plate of pork chops, mashed potatoes, and spinach that was full size mind you was certain he wouldn&#39;t be able to eat any dessert.  Well, he pretty much killed that banana creme cake! hahahahaha.  <br><br>Americana is absolutely beautiful and Cheesecake Factory complimented it quite nicely.  I will be sure to come back some other time!

If I could give it negative stars I would.<br>Terrible customer service!<br>I don&#39;t care how good the food is, if the service sucks then I&#39;m not spending my money there. If you&#39;re at the Americana GO TO GRANVILLE INSTEAD! DON&#39;T GO TO THE CHEESECAKE FACTORY IF YOU ACTUALLY WANT TO EAT.<br><br>We were seated very quickly, and the place was actually pretty empty so I can&#39;t explain why the service was so awful.<br><br>Our waitress was very nice, Victoria, BUT AFTER WAITING OVER 45 MINUTES WE NEVER GOT OUR FOOD, and our very friendly waitress, Victoria, disappeared!<br><br>I left work early to take my daughter to a fun lunch at the Americana, and opted to go to the cheesecake factory.  My daughter ordered a burger, and I ordered a salad, simple enough.  Well, we got the appetizer fairly quickly; however, after the appetizer came we waited another 40 minutes and the food never came AND our waitress disappeared. <br><br>I flagged down a different waitress who then checked on our order, and a few minutes later showed up with the burger which had obviously been sitting under the heat lamps for a while since the cheese was all cold and puckered looking, and the beef was rubbery, um if I&#39;m paying $13.00 for a burger it better be hot and cooked correctly.<br><br>  After a few more minutes the manager shows up, and tried to make us happy, but by that point my daughter was crying because she was so angry, and she just wanted to leave.  I explained to the manager that I don&#39;t have issue waiting for food, but they should have at least checked in with us and let us know that our order was delayed.  A waitress shouldn&#39;t just leave the patron waiting...we were there so long someone even came by and packed up our appetizer before the food even came, that alone speaks volumes.<br><br>Anyway, I&#39;ve come here before and had a good time; however, this is the last time that I step foot in this location.

The ambience is casual. <br><br>The menu has too many selections. It should be trimmed down. Just because the menu is packed, it doesn&#39;t mean they&#39;re all good choices. <br><br>The food is not bad, but nothing sensational. The portions are huge.  I like the Sunday brunch best.  The Belgium waffle is pretty darn good!<br><br>The portions justify the price. <br><br>The service is usually good, but lags when they&#39;re busy.  The bartenders are awesome.  I try to sit at the bar whenever possible.<br><br>Notable mentions: Jamaican black pepper chicken, roadside sliders, and any slice of cheesecake.

Okay really? Why me...<br><br>I came in with a couple of my friends, ordered the Thai lettuce wrap; the lettuce came out dirty, not once but two times. What&#39;s going on? Okay... I have to agree that the Fried Zucchini appetizer I had ordered (along with the lettuce wrap) was delicious. After... when my entree of Bang Bang Chicken &amp; Shrimp came out... which was delicious (extra sauce please) hit the spot! Kind of paid off for the dirty Thai Lettuce Wraps.<br><br>Overall... the service was remarkable and the speedy sitting down service; including the entrees were delightful.<br><br>I do recommend coming here, since their foods are amazing, but do check your food before you eat. You may just be eating dirt!<br><br>C+<br>3 STARS

Love the Cheesecake Factory, what can i say its a perfect marriage for the American in Glendale.   I love almost everything on the menu, the decore and the service. We ordered filet Mignon and got a bad cut,  manager made it right by taking it off the bill.  If you wabt fine dinning and a place to walk around this place is the spot.  Perfect for date night.

Don&#39;t get me wrong, I love cheesecake and the restaurant is always a favorite. But the fact is that they&#39;re overpriced and their actual food is mediocre, especially their pasta. The best thing to do here is order apps and cheesecake and dig in. Don&#39;t bother with the real meals and expect more kids than the usual cheesecake factory since its right inside the americana.  On the plus side, you can wait to be seated and grab sprinkles next door before getting a table.

My favorite place to eat. Have had different dishes and have yet to be disappointed. Even the hamburgers are delish. Farfalle chicken with roasted garlic pasta is my favorite, the cheesecake with strawberries, and the tropical iced tea. My husband gets the pasta carbonara and the raspberry lemonade. You will not be disappointed.

Went here on a Sunday evening (first time at Americana) thinking that it wouldn&#39;t be crowded...boy was I wrong.  It was around 7:00pm and the place was full.  We put our name down for a party of 5 and requested the patio.  Wait time was 40 mins.  No pager was given, but they took down my cell number and texted me.  Luckily we found a table at the bar to hang out.  Server came right away to take drink orders.  Drinks were brought out right away.  Around 30 mins later, my cellphone went off and our table was ready.  There are 2 patios and both were nice.  The weather was perfect outside.  Our waitress was really nice and friendly.  We came for dessert and drinks.  We decided to try the new smores cheesecake and the traditional white chocolate raspberry cheesecake.  The smores cheesecake was really rich.  Too rich for my taste. <br>All in all, a decent place to hang out and chill on a sunday evening.  Validation gave us free parking too!

There&#39;s not much to say about the food here. Its pretty much the same in every city. It was a pretty chilly night, but we opted for patio seating to avoid waiting for a table. We had a heat lamp right next to us, so that did the trick and kept us warm. <br><br>The patio is actually a great place to dine. You can people watch, and listen to the Christmas music playing. Its a pretty nice little spot, and if you&#39;re there at the right time, you can watch the wannabe Bellagio water show. <a href="http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/DJkaX10eOjfRIM6P__6NMA/l">static.px.yelp.com/bphot…</a>

Been to too many cheesecake factories and this one is just about the same as the others. Pricey, semi elegant atmosphere, great location, big plates, big food, ok service and big menu. <br><br>Food is ok, most portions are huge and the menu is like reading a cookbook with ads. <br><br>And hey, they do have great creamy cheesecakes and many to choose from too.<br><br>Try to seat outside so you can catch a view of the water show that the Americana has. <br><br>You have to try this place at least once when you&#39;re at the Americana.

This restaurant does not even deserve a star rating. I don&#39;t even know where to begin with this train wreck of an experience. <br>First off the waiter could he be any more clueless?! He had to come back twice to keep asking how we wanted our margaritas. Secondly they came after my appetizer. Already irritated!! Where is my food? Who knows while individuals who came after us are already eating. I had to ask a different server to please check on our food, a couple minutes later they brought it out. <br>But where is our server? Who knows. <br>He brings the check which came out to $63. <br>I hand him $65 and my validation ticket. The nerve of this guy he comes back with only my validation ticket. How does he take it upon himself to keep my change. Never in my lifetime has something like this ever happened!!! What if I was going to tip him more? Or nothing at all. <br>I ask to speak with the manager who&#39;s a complete idiot. I tell him the situation and all he does is agree and apologize. Like go fucken bring me my whole tab you fucken idiot. It&#39;s not even about the change obviously, it&#39;s the principle!i ask for my receipt and this human being comes back with ONLY THE RECEIPT I ask where&#39;s my change his fucken reply OH IM SORRY I THOUGHT YOU ONLY WANTED THE RECEIPT. And to top it off the food rating is a B. Fuck you Cheesecake Factory. NEVER COMING BACK HERE. EVER.

Its been awhile since I&#39;ve been to the Cheesecake Factory, now they have a system where they text you when your table is ready which I find really nice so I always hated carrying around that beeper that you get. We didn&#39;t get paged for our table, I asked if it was ready since it was 30 minutes+ and they said it was only a 20 minute wait. <br><br>My friend got the surf &amp; turf (Salmon and Streak) while I got the spinach dip and the baked potato tots.
