My friend really liked her food while I only liked the dip.<br><br>Nevertheless, I will go back to the Cheesecake Factory.

We went to cheesecake factory because Outback was closed. I wanted to good steak and I found one! I thought Outback was the spot for steak but I was mistaken.<br><br>The wait was about 7 minutes long and we got a nice booth seat. I ordered a strawberry lemonade and I have to admit it was probably one of the best strawberry lemonades I&#39;ve ever had. They put a ring of sugar around the glass and fill it up to the top with fresh tasting lemonade. <br><br>I ordered a ribeye steak cooked medium and it came with an order of fries. Usually I have to ask the server if I can substitute for fries but I was delighted to see that it was already included in my meal.   <br><br>My steak was cooked to perfection and the fries were kind of cold but they reminded me of room service which was really good. The server was great, she kept filling up my strawberry lemonade to the top. I think I had about three or four total.<br><br>For dessert I had an epic tasting strawberry cheesecake topped with real strawberries and whipped cream. I could barely finish the cheesecake but me being me I had to push myself to it and I ate every single bite!<br><br>This is probably the best cheesecake factory I have been to in my life. Makes up for all the bad cheesecake factory experiences I had in the past.

A friend of mine and I ended up at The Cheesecake Factory, for no reason in particular, we just ended up there. The place is big and loud and dark as it is always in TCCF. We had to wait for 15min. unless we did not mind to sit outside. Heck no! Outside it is dark and loud too, so what is the difference?................15min, exactly you made my point!<br><br>We had to wait for a while for our orders, it was a bussy night and next to us, a couple sat down with a child that could make SOME NOICE! I got kids too, so I did not care that much about it, but it was LOUD!<br><br>We got our orders; I got the White Chocolate Raspberry Latte and was thinking about a Cheesecake, but went for the soup of the day (some Mexican soup) which was allright. <br><br>I come to the understanding that if the food is okay, the service is allright and the company your in is great! The whole experience overall not that bad is after all. So this time I am generous not because of TCCF, but because of the good time I had, so 4 stars.<br><br>Yay, I&#39;m a fan of The Cheesecake Factory when I am in great company.

Cheese cake factory. I was here a few hours ago. I love the food here. Today i felt that me and my family were  discriminated here. They gave me  a really bad service starting from the waiter through the manager.. boy i was really disappointed. I will never comeback to this restaurant again.

If you want to use your free cheesecake card. Good luck! Why would you give out free cheesecake gift cards if you don&#39;t want us to use it. The manager is very inconsiderate.  He needs to be fired. Doesn&#39;t deserve to be in a cheesecake factory team. He was on duty Feb 22, 2015 around 730pm...if you ask me fire him. A disgraced person

Here is a tip for sweet eaters.The best cheesecakes in America? I am normally not a  fan of chain restaurants but the cheesecake factory was one place that I  was sure to talk my Dutchman into trying out. He finally caved into trying a slice of cheesecake at  the Cheesecake Factory, which is known for their exceptional and special cheesecakes and deserts.  The Cheesecake Factory  without a doubt has the best cheesecakes in the world. Although, they are criticize for their large portions, it&#39;s  a perfect combination of plenty and sweet. I say manage what you eat through good judgement. Sweets are good for you in moderation. The problem is not sweets but how often you find yourself in here.You will find a Cheesecake Factory in almost every part of the USA.  Enjoy!

I have been here a few times and service has been ok. However, the last time I came here i found old dried spaghetti on my silverware, and my friend didnt have any silverware, napkins or anything. We had to request it - the waitress was definitely not on it.<br><br>Unlike other locations i dont think I have ever waited more than 5 minutes to get a table here. Its a huge spot with indoor and outdoor seating. <br><br>The food is what you would come to accept from Cheesecake factory

If I could give this place negative stars I would. Roaches, disgustingness unparalleled. The waiter even tried to squish one of the roaches, like that&#39;s going to make the meal any more appetizing. Not to mention the 40 min wait. Manager shrugged it off and acknowledged he knew of infestation. As another waiter tried to squish the many roaches practically flowing out of a bush. Never going to come here again. Disappointing for the standards of the Americana at Brand. And eating establishments that bear the name &#34;The Cheesecake Factory&#34;

This is second bad experience I had at this restaurant.  Yesterday, I ordered a $20 dish to share.  It came on a super hot plate, but the food was exceptionally cold.  So I asked for it to be heated. 20 minutes later, after most of my party had finished, I was still waiting.  When it finally arrived, they seriously just microwaved it. This I expect when I go to Denny&#39;s but when you are paying so much for a meal it&#39;s ridiculous.   The wait staff act like we are at a club and they, including the manager had no concern for this issues at the table.  They offered me a cheesecake which I declined as we had already been there so long and then they just carried on.  I get it they are busy, but they should have the same expectations that the other restaurants set for themselves.

The service is nice and timely, the food is delicious and the portions are large (at least the salads are), but the temperature in this place is unbearably low. It is so cold, that after a few minutes you literally want to run out! I had to put on the sweater I had just purchased at one of the stores before coming here. If not for that sweater, I wouldn&#39;t be able to finish my plate. I mean it is really very bad. Minus 2 stars for that stupid cold.

One of my favorite Cheesecake factory locations...<br>Doesnt get as packed as the one at the Grove, and its just as nice or maybe nicer,,,,<br>Service is always great, Foods always deicious, i always have a fantastic experience here whether im just having a casual lunch, out with the girls, or on a date with my bu.<br>...even if its too packed i just go on straight to the bar..

This is a great place if you want lots of choices. There are so many different appetizers, entrees, desserts and cocktails to choose from which is nice. My husband ordered the hot wings and be warned because they are blazing hot. My son ordered the nachos and popcorn shrimp. They skimp on the toppings on the nachos. It is a big plate of chips with a tiny bit of sour cream and guacamole. There are a lot of jalapenos which is good. The Popcorn shrimp very good. I had a chopped salad and that was great. It was quite large. Mojitos are good, but the alcohol content was minuscule. It&#39;s a great place to bring kids and it&#39;s nice to stroll around the Americana when you are finished. They validate parking which is nice.  Get there before 5:30 p.m. if you don&#39;t want to wait too long to be seated.  It is crazy after 6:00 p.m..

This is the ultimate restaurant. <br><br>I know you&#39;re not supposed to say that because it&#39;s a chain. But everything they make is delicious and the menu items are vast. It boggles my mind that it all tastes good.<br><br>You can never go wrong with the cheesecake factory. the cocktails are delicious, the appetizers are amazing and the entrees are as good as it gets! And of course the cheesecake is out of this world.<br><br>But for me, the dessert takes a back seat to all the other great things going on here. <br><br>I&#39;ll confess to eating here at least once a month. And lately, I believe I have the belt line to prove it.<br><br>Looks like I&#39;d better get in some extra golf sessions to burn off those calories!<br><br>Great job Cheesecake Factory!

I&#39;ve been to a few different locations of Cheesecake Factory and there&#39;s never been a problem or difference until I came to this one. It took forever for the waitress to get our drinks, our bread, our entrees, and the bill. And not only that but our drinks, we had ordered hot cocoa &amp; a cafe mocha (hot drinks obviously), they came to us almost room temperature. And even our entrees weren&#39;t even fresh since they were cold too. I&#39;m really disappointed with this one. I wouldn&#39;t come again.

I got a pasta carbonara and pepperoni pizza and shrimp gumbo which were alright. But the service was horrible! After getting our food, our server only checked up on us once right after to ask us about our food and after that it was a nightmare. I was here with 2 other people so once the shrimp gumbo was delivered, the server said she&#39;d be right back with a bowls and spoons for us to share. 15 minutes pass and she&#39;s nowhere to be seen and our server is nowhere to be seen. So we asked another server who then went and just brought back ONE spoon. So now, we&#39;re trying to find another person to ask for spoons and plates and when we finally flag down someone else, they said they&#39;d let our server know. Another ten minute passes and still no spoon or bowls. Finally, we see our server and after half an hour of asking servers for three spoons and bowls, we finally get it.
The food is incredible, but it can get quite busy at times. Other than that, I think it&#39;s a great place to go to enjoy a dinner with family or friends and has a large menu selection.

Don&#39;t order the Vietnamese summer rolls. They&#39;re cold!  <br>The serve was disappointed that we didn&#39;t order more food, although we also ordered a steak (which was tasty).  there is a huge selection of items to choose from.

Things have changed!<br>Yummy food is now blunt!<br>And serving size is smaller now.<br>And may I suggest LIGHTING SYSTEM is so horrible -you cannot appreciate the beauty of interior -because the dimness is too much. Feels like always Halloween.<br>Nevertheless, it compliments the room(s) for improvement because service is good.

The burgers are the best item on the menu (aside from the cheesecake). Trust me. Everything else is too salty/overdone/not-as-good-as-you&#39;d-like-it-to-be.<br><br>But enough about Cheesecake Factory! Let&#39;s talk about Americana. Or, an Armenian&#39;s vision of the Bellagio in Glendale. Geez, what a place. This place is so nice they should charge admission.

I love coming here specifically for the jambalaya pasta. It is by far my favorite thing on the menu and is just perfect. I have specific ways of eating it also like getting the sauce extra on the side and the waiter always brings some over. Price is fair but only complaint would be the pasta felt like it was microwaved the last time I visited. However im sure it&#39;s a one time occurrence.
My waiter Nester did a great job and made sure me and my friend were happy with our food and experience at cheesecake. The food was very good too. I would definitely recommend it to a friend.

Review: HAPPY HOUR (not dinner or any other dining time)<br><br>I love their HH. It&#39;s Monday thru Friday from 4-6PM. The servers seem like they are kind of out of it sometimes. There is this one girl...she takes forever. She will walk around your table like a dozen times and each time that you try to get her attention, she gives you that lil motion about oh i&#39;ll be back. Never mind her. Avoid that one. She isn&#39;t of any help. She&#39;s the reason that I give my review 4 and not 5 stars. <br><br>I like their vietnamese tacos. They are bomb, with the pork belly and sauce on top. SOOOO damn good. The buffalo blasts are HUGE. So, if you are looking for something to share, that would be perfect. The potstickers aren&#39;t bad in their tamarind sauce but there aren&#39;t that many of &#39;em in there. I think there were 5 in the order that was $5. I could get a whole bag of &#39;em for $4 at trader joe&#39;s. But, if that&#39;s what you&#39;re craving then go for it. They are tasty. <br><br>Drink Specials are $5.00. <br>They have mojitos, JW Pink Lemonades, Long Islands and probably a few others but those are the ones that our friends usually order. The JW Pink Lemonade is tasty and has a nicely sugared rim. It&#39;s like the minute maid lemonade with a TINY kick. The mojitos are muddled just enough and the bartender is a pretty good pour, same with the Long Islands. <br><br>I&#39;d suggest you get her a lil before 4PM. That way you should have a pretty good chance at getting a table or a seat at the bar. This is a good spot to catch the soccer game.

Never ever again! The service is extremely terrible here the Two female managers are useless and horribly rude. We waited two hours to get seated and they finally call us up . The host walks us to our table then says wait this isn&#39;t it let me check again... she leaves us waiting there like we don&#39;t matter at all. We then see the manager walking by and we tell her what&#39;s going on. She then says &#34;the table we wanted to seat you at is still dirty a baby threw up on it&#34; she sends us back to the waiting area. We are there waiting another 30 mins and see that they keep passing other parties to get seated after us. We are waiting and waiting and I went up to the rude host and told her that it&#39;s very wrong to have us waiting while others are eating seated after us. She has the worst attitude along with the manager and when they seat us, they roll their eyes at us. Disgusting service!!! I will contact HR .

As busy as it was last night, the service was excellent. We did arrive late and had food at the bar, which was alright. Had the chicken sandwich with veggies. The Old Fashion w/ Makers Mark was done perfectly. We had a great visit here. Coming back soon. #Marsphotoz

Ordered to go. All the staff I encountered was either rude, or took forever to acknowledge that I was waiting there. AND my food is cold. Not even warm. When I took it back, the guy got an attitude with ME for the food being cold. Smh. My food is currently being remade.

Ok we have been going to Cheesecake Factory in Passadena for a long long time when we didn&#39;t have one in Americana. We used to love this place and used to dine there on a regular basis, but I guess this time they lost us as a customer after giving it so many chances. This time took an hour to get us a table which is ok I understand  they&#39;re very busy. After that we ordered our appetizer and main meal @  the same time, and we asked the waiter specifically to bring our appetizer first, which didn&#39;t happened and he brought everything at the same time, ok no big deal then asked for a ranch ,10 minutes later I had to remind him again, and he sorry I&#39;ll bring it right now, that didn&#39;t happen ask another waitress and finally she brought it after my daughter Frech frys were cold. Then my wife asked for extra sauce on the side for her Fettuccine pasta ,after another 10 minutes they brought a disgusting bowl of oil which they called sauce. We didn&#39;t want the past anymore, and instead my wife asked for a bottle of mineral water and that took another 10 minutes to bring, and when I asked what was going on. Waitress told us he had to pick it up from the bar like any other drinks that&#39;s why it took a long time to bring it. Obviously they don&#39;t care since they are very busy, and since customer service does not mean anything to them. They will loose a lot of customer slowly but surely unless they do something about it. So sad that we are not going to go there anymore.

My husband brought me here for a romance and no regrets! Great place with nice service and wonderful menu ! We had a realy great time here! Get the salt caramel cheesecake! That&#39;s as delicious as you can imagine !! Thanks to my husband for making my day!!

Having bad luck with cheese cake factory. <br><br>Ordered a Chinese chicken salad, 2 ingredients were missing. Server took for ever to come back... <br>However we were in a rush to catch movie<br>I paid for the bill, expensive lettuce !! <br>When the main ingredient is chicken but no chicken in mine. <br>I did write on ticket, even tipped our server. <br>Will not go back

my best friend &amp; i love to come here right before work and just catch up. our waitress though, made the experience ten times better! Bethany, was beyond amazing. we never asked her for anything more than once and she had the best attitude. oh &amp; food was amazing :)

This Cheesecake Factory has one of the BEST outdoor seating areas of any of them. It faces directly into the water feature in the middle of &#34;Americana at Brand&#34;.<br><br>As a Vegetarian, they offer me many fantastic choices. <br><br>Be sure to put your name in early though as this place ALWAYS seems to have a wait.

THE ONLY THING COLDER THAN THE WAFFLES AND PANCAKES IS THE MANAGER!<br>I went to the Cheeze Cake Factory on Sunday and ordered pancakes.<br>They came and were predictably cold, an added feature, there was no syrup, my comment to the wait person &#34;by the time I get the Syrup these will be colder, she took back  the melted butter and the pancakes<br>I reordered, the pancakes arrived, no butter, I told the waitress, don&#39;t go to the kitchen just let me have  the butter you serve with the bread, I said why are you people so disorganized, she copped attitude and left.<br>This is just one of five episodes were food was delivered late and cold.<br>My standing joke to Chris the manager is &#34;If I order cold food I am never disappointed here&#34;<br>I asked to see  Chris, he came to my table and allowed me to vent and said &#34;You have a right to be angry<br>REMEDY, I believe in working with the situation, go to the kitchen with Chris watch them make your Nacho&#39;s, Waffles, Heuvos Ranceros or pancakes and have Chris bring them to you table<br>That&#39;s what one manager did after three tries cold waffle redalls

My first review was two stars because of the outside seating atmosphere - kids running around uncontrolled and throwing toys on the ground. This review is five stars because we ate lunch in the bar area late one afternoon and it was a completely different and really nice experience - because the bartender Katherine E and the guy bartender (whose name I didn&#39;t get) were friendly and fast and took great care of us.<br><br>Saturday afternoon about 5pm after a movie and the line of customers waiting to check in with the hostess was lined up to the doors. When we got to the front we found that the wait was over an hour for two of us and would&#39;ve been way longer for more people. Open seating is first come first served in the bar area but nothing was open. They were out of pagers so we were given a paper ticket to come back at a certain time. <br><br>We walked around the Americana for about thirty minutes and then wandered back to take another look at the bar area to see if anything had opened up in there. There were two stools at the very end of the bar top with a flat panel tv overhead and a good amount of space there, not crammed together. I have no clue why they were empty and why there was nobody else standing there waiting to snag anything that opened up. Lucky for us that we were only two and were glad to sit there. <br><br>When I went to take our name off of the list it was total chaos around the host/hostess stand -with the people with tickets trying to get to the stand to claim their arrival time right next to the people just arriving and trying to put their name on the list. I heard them saying to those just arriving that the wait was an hour and a half. <br><br>For our experience this time, it would&#39;ve been worth an hour and a half wait. Katherine was the bartender who greeted us and laid out two clean white napkins like a tablecloth on the bar top when she found out we were going to be eating there with them. She and the other bartender were so welcoming and super nice to us even though they were slammed and taking care of drink orders for (I guess) the whole restaurant as well as for people in the bar - and punching in the food and making drinks and getting refills for those of us eating. The food runner guy was also really nice. Even though they were so busy, all of them seemed to really care about making it as good of an experience as possible for us and the rest of the customers - and I think most of us at the bar that afternoon were eating food, not just getting snacks or drinks. <br><br>To add to a really great experience, the food we ordered came out absolutely perfect - especially/even the burger - which can be hit or miss almost anywhere when you request it to be grilled medium and especially if the kitchen is jamming. The bread and butter basket was given to us just as if we had been at a table or booth. Factory Burger on wheat loaf with swiss cheese, sweet potato fries with chipotle mayo on the side, Cajun Jambalaya Pasta - then we had two complimentary slices of cheesecake from gift cards so we got a slice of Godiva chocolate cheesecake and a slice of key lime cheesecake and took some of it home. <br><br>We live about thirty miles from here- this is the closest Cheesecake Factory to us - for whatever it&#39;s worth, we will totally come back here and try to get a spot at the bar top again !

One of 100 places alike. BUt this was IS newer, so the decor has been stepped up a notch.<br><br>Don&#39;t know if they still have it but the Chicken Bellagio soothed my soul. If not, Chicken MAdeira keeps me satisfied, every time.. especially after 3-4 rolls of free oat wheat bread/butter. Yum!
Today was a good night here. Server was Josh, and he was on top of it with a sense of humor. Had a glass of Mark West Pinot Noir with a vegan cobb salad w/ chicken. Absolutely would do it again.

I really never had a bad experience with the food at cheesecake factory because i really only order one thing from the menu, but the service really is a hit or miss. You either catch them in a good day or bad day. So lucky the last times i have gone the service was good. <br><br>Quick Tip- BBQ Ranch Chicken Salad... simply orgasmic
First time eating at this location. The wait was fast we arrived during Happy Hour. Our waiter Moses was very attentive and provided great customer service.

I have been coming here for years. These last two times I have had food thrown on my table almost spilling hot food on my kids. Then the manager offered me free dessert. Really how about firing the dame fool who doesn&#39;t know how to do his job. Then the second time one of the servers cleaning the table next to me spills juice on me and walks away never apologizing and the waiter witnessed it and he said sorry never had the lady come back and at least apologize. This is a hot and miss when it comes to service. I wouldn&#39;t go back ever again

I ordered lunch delivery from this location. Food was cold, almost if it had never been warm. I ordered a buffalo chicken sandwich, there was nothing Buffalo about it. No sauce at all. Very disappointing all around . Only stars because of speed ( however likely forgoing quality)

Just had our baby&#39;s party here.  We had 50 people, which they put us in the larger patio next to sprinkles.  I already picked out the food and they had it ready to go and right away.  We had two slight issues, the food was all coming out at the same time--which is difficult when people are eating family style. You run out of space.  And there was a small mix up of chicken Marsala vs pasta da Vinci (I ordered the latter for the party).  But both issues were resolved so well.  The manager was really great and he made sure to have a ton of waiters on hand for us.  I let the partygoers order their own cheesecakes at the end, the servers didn&#39;t give that many menus for people to look over, but overall the party was a success.  They can only host from 11-1 for a party this big, but if you ever needed a venue you could totally consider this.  <br>The patio was great because kids could also run to the fountain and hang out for a bit  as well. <br>And just FYI, we ordered our favorites.  Pasta da Vinci, Santa Fe salad, Thai lettuce wraps, and bang bang chicken and shrimp.  All were made well and crowd pleasers.
Oh no, nothing is fresh or tasty and the wait is too much to handle.  I&#39;m very disappointed and not going there anymore.  Don&#39;t recommend this to anyone and stay away from this place.

A BIG FAT 3 THREE! Only because our server was amazing. Other than that I would have given it a 1 Start rating because I have a few complaints... This was my very first time at a Cheesecake Factory. I though what better place to have my first time be somewhere I&#39;ve never been, The Americana. It was a Friday night so I was expecting a long wait time which by the way was supposed to be &#34;55 minutes&#34; that turned into 80! Finally we take our seat after 1.5 hours of waiting, yay!! Upon being seated we encounter Complaint Number 1: The table was sticky and clearly had someones meal still smeared on it. Luckily a busboy was near by and cleaned it right away. After meeting our server receiving our drinks and bread basket we encounter Complaint Number 2: We notice that one of us had some dirty silverware and asked to get it changed. After a rough start we receive some delicious food. Filling and very satisfying. After a great meal we head for a diaper change for Baby T. This is when we encounter Complaint Number 3: This restroom definitely set the bar. 4 small stalls and 1 big stall that has the changing table. World smallest restroom for such a big restaurant. No one is paying any attention to the restrooms at all because a teenage boy walked in to use the restroom with no problem. Not ok! The changing table had no liners as well as no way to safely retain my child to it either. The trash in the big stall and the paper towel wastebaskets were overflowing. There wasn&#39;t even any toilet paper the the big stall. The was hardly any soap the floors were filthy. We had the Lemon Merengue Cheesecake which was amazing and I highly recommend it if you love the sweet and tart taste.

I&#39;ve been to this location enough times to finally leave a review, vary mixed experiences here however I don&#39;t remember any of them to be that pleasant. It&#39;s Cheesecake Factory, workers scrambling for seats and taking us back 3 times to a booth to only realize it was still occupied. Service was okay, food was actually great like always. I&#39;ve personally never had an issue with the food except when I ordered Evelyn&#39;s &#39;Favorite&#39; Pasta, from then on I realized that it would continue to only be her favorite because it was pretty disgusting.

I would have given them zero star actually! Their service is horrible! I have three points to support my disappointment... <br>1) came with my best friends to this location- they brought order VERY late. Besides they had forgotten my friend&#39;s order and when they brought it, it was actually NOT the right food she had ordered! <br>2) came with the same friends months later, and they were experiencing some issues with their oven. Since we were going to order salad only we decided to still go in, specially that there was no wait time. So after waiting for 20 min i went to the register and reminded them that we were waiting for them to come take the order. Even though they said they are going to take our order NOW, we waited for ANOTHER 10 min and then left UNSATISFIED. <br>3) came here for a date and the waitress that was assigned to us had some sort of attitude. She did not smile or greed us at all! She then came to us to report that our order was going to take 20 min to be ready, because &#34;they were making it from scratch&#34; i mean c&#39;mon! <br><br>Regardless of how busy their business is, i think their management must consider that their loyal customers will eventually choose to not go to this place in Glendale because  of their service.

Absolute favorite restaurant. Food is always great! <br>Some of my Personal favorites - <br>Appetizer:<br>* Avocado Egg Rolls ( With ranch = to die for )<br>Entree/Main:<br>* Club Sandwhich w/ fries<br>* Chicken and Shrimp Gumbo <br>Dessert:<br>* Red Velvet Cheesecake!!!<br>* Original Cheesecake<br><br>Pretty much can&#39;t go wrong with anything on the menu.<br><br>Most of the time service is good, friendly waiters :)

Look, we&#39;re not living in easy times. The economy&#39;s in the shitter, both sides of the major political parties are equally frustrating, and I&#39;m fairly certain that with this crazy ass weather that can&#39;t make up it&#39;s mind (guess that&#39;s why it&#39;s MOTHER Nature) we&#39;re close to a major earthquake in LA any minute. So if you&#39;re a waiter at an established eatery like The Cheesecake Factory and you have a table full of paying patrons, then WHY THE FUCK WOULD YOU ADD TO THE STRESSES OF THE WORLD AND MAKE IT BLATANTLY OBVIOUS TO WANT US TO LEAVE?!<br><br>Asshole waiter (whatever your name is), I realize that maybe we didn&#39;t drink as much as you would have liked us to in order to raise the tab (thus raising your expected tip) but we DID ORDER FOOD, WE DID ORDER DRINKS, WE WERE EXTREMELY POLITE, WE WERE QUITE ACCOMMODATING TO YOUR BUSY SHIFT, and most importantly, WE PAID OUR BILL INSTANTLY PLUS A 20% TIP! Truth be told, it&#39;s a testament to our level of sobriety and manners that we left anything for this waiter at all. Cause folks, he was the very definition of an unprofessional, unpleasant employee of the service industry.<br><br>Look, I certainly don&#39;t fault people for having a bad day. Everyone has those and is entitled to vent. JUST DON&#39;T DO IT TO YOUR PAYING CUSTOMERS WHO ARE TRYING TO RELAX AFTER A LONG WEEK OURSELVES. It&#39;s sort of like our stresses and work week extended out past our clock out time at the office. Not cool.<br><br>Definitely NOT coming back to this particular Factory again and probably will not return to other cheesecakes as well. Factory, you sir, have lost a customer.<br><br>Over and out.

Went there for an early dinner around 3:30. Waited 20 mins for a table then we sat down and waited 20 more mins for a server. Guy came and we placed our entire order 2 appetizers and 2 entrees and 2 waters. Crab artichoke dip came after 15 mins and edamame came 10 mins later. Still no waters. Then 20 mins later my Asian salad and my girls steak medallions came. Still no water. Bread sat empty for about 30 mins before they finally brought it. Waters came....woo hoo!  Then about 2/3 way through the Salad I come upon across a 3 inch tooth pic. Told the waiter and he says &#34;Man you&#39;re having a rough day&#34;. Needless to say I expect a discount or something. He didn&#39;t offer so I didn&#39;t ask. But I was never a huge fan so I prolly won&#39;t be back......

I really enjoy the atmosphere.I tried the chicken alfredo, greek salad, and the calabrian pizza. The food was delicious. The only reason i would give this place three stars is because of the service. My waiter threw the napkins on my table and accidentally spilled water on me. He didn&#39;t even say sorry, he just said &#34;Thank god you&#39;re wearing shorts.&#34;
Celebrated my wife&#39;s birthday, service was great. Dina was very sweet and made sure we had everything we needed. Also enjoyed the cheesecake with strawberries yum.
Love the menu but the place has a long wait the servers are good and very helpful with their recommended selections love their  big serving of Caesar salad and great desserts

Had a wonderful experience. I made a phone order with Albert, and he was extremely efficient. I went on a Wednesday night, and it wasn&#39;t busy. The food was absolutely excellent, fresh and delicious. I will be back.

If I could give this Cheesecake Factory a negative star, I would.<br><br>At first my visit seemed like a normal one, I go to the Cheesecake Factory in Pasadena occasionally and enjoy it. I ordered my normal small plates, I really enjoy the small plates menu because then I can try a bunch of different things. So I ordered chicken samosas, crispy crab bites, and loaded potato bites to share with my mother. They were tasty as usual but we had small appetites so we decide to take some things home with us. We had a few crab bites left and the great majority of a LARGE plate of loaded potato bites left over. I thought &#34;Oh great I&#39;ll have an entire meal for later.&#34; The server offered to take the food and wrap it up for us, I replied yes and several minutes later he arrived with our take-home container. <br>The next day while at home I took the container out of the refrigerator, eyes filled with glee, excited about my lovely loaded potato bites waiting for me. This is where things took a turn. When I opened the container my heart dropped and my stomach growled. There were only 4 potato bites inside the container. I HAD AN ENTIRE PLATE LEFTOVER, I had been cheated. The server had taken my food to the back and either dropped it, eaten it, or just plain threw it out. I DO NOT enjoy paying for things I will never get to eat.<br><br>TOTALLY CHEATED. I won&#39;t ever be going to this Cheesecake Factory EVER again unless I am compensated for my lost Loaded Potato Bites. Thanks for NOTHING.

I came in today to celebrate my birthday with my family, and from minute Dina A. came to our table she was great.  Took care of us like family and made me feel special. She went above and beyond her job requirements. I will definitely come back here soon thanks to Dina.

This truly breaks my heart because this is so often my go-to place for good food with good friends and just a grand ole time, but today just really surprised me. <br><br>I ordered the Parmesan Garlic bread and the Asian potstickers. I really don&#39;t know what happened - just everything seemed so mediocre and half-heartedly prepared (as well as served). Perhaps it was my fault for ordering potstickers from this establishment, but I didn&#39;t think it was possible for them to be as awful as they were; the filling, chicken, was very dry, and the sauce seemed desperate to overcompensate for the other flaws in the dish, and honestly, even that was just all over the place, trying way too hard, and failing just as hard, if not harder. <br><br>The garlic bread, which I usually love so much, was mostly burnt at the ends, with just lazy presentation.<br><br>Now most of the time the food is pretty epic, so I believe (and fervently hope) that this was just one bad night. I&#39;ll let it slide this *one* time, Cheesecake. For old time&#39;s sake.

The food is horrible, and there is the most arrogant service I&#39;ve ever seen. I got pasta and noticed it was warmed in the microwave. When I asked a waiter to exchange it, he told me they can not. All managers in this building want to make costumers unhappy. Never go back and DO NOT RECOMMEND.

David the bartender gave exceptional service on all fronts. The restaurant was very busy &amp; we were patrons at the bar; he was so attentive and accommodating even though we were just there for drinks and apps. It was refreshing to have genuinely friendly service, especially in a large restaurant on a busy night.

We come 3 or 4 times a year for happy hour and appetizers and never disappointed. Today we tried lunch and from the hundreds of selections chose something we ended up not crazy about. We both ordered the Asian chicken salad. I ate about 10% of mine and my wife maybe 50%. When asked if we wanted it boxed I just mentioned we weren&#39;t crazy about it. I wasn&#39;t complaining as we were trying something we hadn&#39;t ordered before (my bad). When the bill arrived the server told me the manager had taken one of the salads off the bill. I&#39;m not used to restaurants taking food off the bills so we added most of the meal cost to the tip. I&#39;m dropping one star for a $14 martini with lunch. For sure we&#39;ll be back but no Asian salads and no martinis. They have lots more to offer.

Having been to mutiple locations, my visit today was pretty standard. Food was basic, the usual huge portions. Service was pretty meh - we were seated quickly but didn&#39;t get to place any orders for a long while. We came at 5 and noticed some servers leave so maybe the wait was due to a shift change. Otherwise we enjoyed our meal.

I won&#39;t go into details about the foods because we all know how great Cheesecake tastes; however, the service I received from Jeffrey was above and beyond. I don&#39;t think I ever felt like home at another cheesecake restaurant locations. I would highly recommend Americana Cheesecake Factory only because Jeffrey was amazing!!! Made my night :) Thank you Jeff!
Everything is awesome! I really liked the foods &amp; the employees were so friendly! I enjoy spending time there.
Good food and great selection but a bit pricey and the portions are way too huge. I rarely see waiters taking away clean plates. Food waste is massive here.

The Cheesecake Factory looked very impressive with its marble-like colonnades and standard beaded door handles at the entrance.  We got seated in minutes, but had to stand at our table for a few more because it hadn&#39;t yet been cleaned.  I hate having to see a table I&#39;m about the sit at be a mess. <br><br>For starters we got the spinach artichoke dip and the fried mac and cheese.  OMG, the friend mac and cheese was so amazingly good.  The cheeses they used in the pasta was strong and powerful, yet the dish still carried that delicious fried flavor.  On the other hand, the spinach artichoke dip was just so-so.  I thought it lacked flavor, but that might have been due to the mac and cheese being so strong.  Personally, I really like the spinach artichoke dip from Claim Jumpers the best. <br><br>My main course consisted of a delicious, well seasoned turkey burger and fries.  Don&#39;t be fooled by the word &#34;turkey.&#34;  Though, I picked this dish to be a little more healthy, it was far from it.  The turkey was full of flavor and tasted so juicy that I&#39;m pretty sure it was fried sometime during the cooking process. <br><br>My gf had the Pasta Da Vinci which was so sweet I thought I was eating candy.  Though sweet, the homemade pasta held its nutty flavor.  I didn&#39;t try my sisters chicken parmigiana dish, but she certainly thought it was good.  Pictures for all these dishes are on my blog. <br><br>I have decided that when going to the Cheesecake Factory for dinner, never get something healthy because nothing is ever healthy at this restaurant.  The Cheesecake Factory is a comfort food joint, and they are darn good at making that kind of food.  So fess up to the fatness and enjoy!!!

This is for the service my daughter and I received from David A. He provided excellent service and was extremely attentive. We have been there many times and have received just alright and good service but this time was exceptional. I think everyone knows the food is decent. We have had good food and bad food there before. My tacos were good and my daughters pasta was ok but it&#39;s the service that made me stop and write the review. I hope the restaurant  recognizes David&#39;s value. He is the reason we will go back again and request him as our waiter. By the way we took home a piece of snickers cheese cake and that was really good but still not as good as the service we received from David A.

Lacking good customer service.  I met up with some girlfriends for dinner the other night.   Izeem was our waitor, I felt he was in a rush to get us out because we didn&#39;t order alcohol, appetizers, and dessert.  He took away our small plates b4 we finished with our bread and asked if we wanted our food to be wrapped up to go.  My friend and I were still eating and had our forks in our hands when he came and asked.  I just felt we were not welcomed there and he wanted us to leave right away.   The food was good and that&#39;s why I gave a second star.  I had to give one star in order to post this review, otherwise it would had been a total of one star for the food because customer service was rude.

Pros:<br>1. Hibachi Steak was delicious and so tender<br>2. Mushroom burger was best ever<br>3. Calamari was bomb!<br>4. Service (Dominique) = A+<br>5. Architecture was beautiful<br><br>Cons:<br>1. Steak was a bit too salty and too dark (soy sauce?) so A-<br>2. Fries portion was too small<br><br>Bottom Line = A<br><br>Best value compared to other chains, and even fine dining Providence on Melrose.

I like this place, been several times, the service is always excellent and helpful! <br>Love drinks there!! Always fresh!) <br>But once had a meal which not exactly what i ordered, thats why only 4 stars)

Ok...so in all fairness, we visited on a Friday night (heavy dinner-out night)...but nonetheless, our food was prompt, hot and yummy. <br><br>The restaurant was crowded so we opted to sit outside.  Even though there was a light sprinkle and a chill in the air.  There were umbrellas and heatlamps...so we were great!  <br><br>I am mostly writing today about the service.  I realize that servers have to start somewhere.  I am hoping that, for our server that night, that is the case.  He was so attentive, observant, polite, charming, professional and on the money...he deserves a promotion!  Headwaiter?  A move to a more upscale restaurant (sorry Cheesecake)?  He was just so fantastic!  I wish I could have tipped him more...but because our bill was so reasonable he may have thought we were requesting &#34;favors&#34;. <br><br>Thank you for a great dinner.  Even in the rain!!!

Horrible long wait. Can&#39;t believe they would not take reservations on mother&#39;s day. We were told hour and ten Minute wait and it was an hour and forty minutes. But once we sat down for our meal, the waiter was great and our food was perfect.

Mixed feelings towards Cheesecake Factory. I don&#39;t think I have ever walked in and been seated right away. It seems as though there is usually a 40 minute wait and I would much rather dine somewhere else when I&#39;m hungry and don&#39;t want to wait. I don&#39;t get why they don&#39;t take reservations? Anyways, regardless of their long wait, everything else is pretty good. The waiters always inform me on new items on the menu and are super friendly. I have tried many items on the menu and my favorite appetizer has to be the avocado egg rolls and my favorite entree is the Louisiana Pasta. Would recommend this place if you don&#39;t mind waiting.

If it was possible, I&#39;d give this location a negative 100,000... I have ordered meals from this location several times within the past few weeks. Each time, my order has been wrong; it has always been missing something--cheesecake, beans, rice, bread, butter, etc. Grant it, when I order through a third party delivery service, that party should check my order before delivering it to me. However, it is The Cheesecake Factory&#39;s fault for plating and bagging it wrong in the first place. PLEASE train your crew better. Make them take their time and do their job to satisfy the customer and his/her palate.

We ordered:<br><br>WARM ASPARAGUS SALAD: this was very good... especially with the egg on top<br>FRIED ZUCCHINI, PORTABELLO MUSHROOM, AVOCADO: It was a little too breaded for me... the fried avocado was interesting... not sure I liked the texture<br>CAESAR SALAD: this was very good... slightly over dressed, but very good<br>NACHOS.. i liked this a lot bc it was very simple and clean tasting.. no beans<br>SKINNYLICIOUS SHRIMP CREOLE: not great.. did not like the texture of the shrimp and the sauce was meh.

45 minute wait, to get called up to say my table is ready. 30 minutes later to be sat at the worst table on the patio. The hostess couldn&#39;t have cared less about their mistake of seating numerous tables who had arrived later than us. Having previously worked as a hostess at a very busy restaurant, let&#39;s just say, I am not impressed by the level of service. To top it off, we were not greeted by a server for another 8 minutes.
Food was good but took for ever (35 min) service sucked very bad. Had to ask three different servers for a napkin.

Just had a 4 hour dinner at Cheesecake Factory. After waiting an hour and a half for a table the restaurant managed to lose my debit card while charging my card.  That&#39;s not the worst of it not only they lost my card another table used my debit card to charge their $98 bill to my card. We had to wait an hour for the managers to give us bunch of reason or ways our card must have gotten lost. Like I care how it got lost. All I care about is why they lost it on the first place and how someone else got to use it while I am still at the restaurant. The manager had the nerve to tell me something like this happened 2 weeks ago. REALLY!!! That only means someone that works there is obviously doing more than just serving food. All I can say DO NOT PAY WOTH CARD AT CHEESECAKE.  ESPECIALLY DEBIT CARD. The servers and managers handle the situation where bad.

The Cheesecake Factory was okay but the workers are so slow and when we ordered something they would always give us that awkward smile.  And the pizza I ordered the cheese was keep falling down.  But I guess it still taste good.

I hate and love the fact that this place puts calories... but it limits what you can eat. <br><br>FOOD:<br>I ordered the Vietnamese Tacos: Steamed Asian Buns with Roasted Pork, Marinated Cucumbers, Carrots and Onion with Chiles, Cilantro and Sesame Seeds.<br><br>They were good. I love the Asian buns (who doesn&#39;t?). You get three small ones because this is from the Small Plate Menu and it was the only one less than 500 calories - yes I was worried. <br><br>I&#39;m sure the other food is good and I&#39;ve had it in the past, but now with the calories showing... I am too scared to eat something over 600 calories in ONE sitting. <br><br>ALCOHOL:<br>Got some cocktails and they were ok. They weren&#39;t strong but I actually like that because I don&#39;t want to get drunk but for those who buy alcohol for the alcohol... this is not for you.<br><br>LOCATION:<br>Parking in Americana (3 hours free with validation)<br>Parking also at Target and Glendale Galleria for free<br>Around lots of shopping and Americana is pretty.<br><br>AMBIANCE:<br>Busy. This is a typical Cheesecake Factory look. <br>It&#39;s always busy! Always. <br><br>SERVICE: <br>Busy... this place is always busy and hence, they were busy... but good note, they do take multiple credit cards. <br><br>Why a 3?<br>I don&#39;t like waiting for more than 30 minutes at a chain restaurant... if it was a small popular non-chain, I&#39;d be ok with waiting. <br>Also, the calories - I&#39;m glad they post it but man... make some meals less than 500 calories pleaseeee.

There are few places that prepare fried calamari this well. Light, crispy batter outside, moist, tender inside.  I also recommend  fish tacos tempura style. I was delighted with the generous plate of four hearty tacos and spicy black beans. Attentive service, too.
The food is great. The nachos are a must so is the jambalaya dish. Everything is good there and if you don&#39;t like it you can send it back. The only negative is the wait!

Ordered the hibatchi steak, my date and friends food came out fine, however everything on my plate was cold. I told the waitress, she did not say one word, just took it and brought out another one and this one was just as cold as if it was sitting on a counter for twenty minutes. She never apologized, I downed as much as I could handle (which wasn&#39;t much.) and left. <br><br>Very dissatisfied with the service and her attitude towards me.
Everything was great including food and beverages. Service was a tad bit off... I would&#39;ve wanted just a little bit more attention for the money I paid to the restaurant and also the tip I left!

One dish that I ALWAYS go for, without fail: Farfalle with chicken and roasted garlic. <br><br>Seriously? This pasta just makes my day and lights up my life... :) <br><br>The gumbo is another personal favorite when I&#39;m sick.. Mmm..gumbo... I salivate just thinking about it... <br><br>Despite the long lines, I always got seated relatively fast, perhaps due to the fact that my parties are usually no larger than 5... so no complaints there~ <br><br>Yes, I am a fan :)

Horrible, disgusting hostess experience!  I came here with my two small children and a friend who also has two small children.  We were seated by a host and asked if we could keep one stroller at the table since my toddler was sleeping.  He was accommodating and said yes.  So while we were eating, another hostess (i.e. The horrible hostess), brought patrons to the table next to us.  She told us we needed to move our stroller that had the sleeping toddler to the &#34;designated&#34; stroller area.  When we said we weren&#39;t going to do that, she said &#34;I don&#39;t care.  Wake the kid up then.  The stroller needs to be moved.&#34;  And made a face.  Other patrons started to help us adjust the tables so we could keep the stroller with sleeping toddler with us.  The rude hostess laid the menus down and just watched until the people she was seating said they wanted to sit elsewhere.  I asked to speak with a manager after experiencing this hostess behavior and attitude and explained the situation.  All he did was say sorry but he didn&#39;t give me comfort that he was going to talk to her about her treatment.  As we were leaving, a couple of staff said they didn&#39;t know what happened buy apologized.  When I told them, the rude hostess interjected and said &#34;are you still talking about this?&#34;  The  manager came by and took her away while I was simply explaining that she was extremely rude and shaming us for having a sleeping toddler.<br><br>Wow!  I thought Cheesecake Factory was suppose to be a family/kid friendly restaurant.  But this person made such a terrible experience for me and the kids that I would never go back here again!

We were really looking forward to dinner here with the family, especially since it was my parents&#39; first time there. The evening turned into a 4-hr eternity. We checked-in and were told about a 40 min wait, after well over an hour we go check on status and we were told our buzzer hadn&#39;t been registered. They apologized and said they seat us right away. After another 15 minutes or so of waiting they went to seat us at a booth, but we had requested anything but a booth. They finally take us to a table, and the evening dragged on some more . By then my parents had already requested that we just leave and go somewhere else for dinner and maybe go back another day, but after so much waiting we figured everything would move along. Other groups came and went, and we were still there. We got out of there past midnight. The food didn&#39;t make up for all the waiting around. We don&#39;t plan on going back to the Glendale location.

This my go to place on my day offs. The service is way beyond exceptional. The best Cheesecake factory I&#39;ve been. The best Service, Food, Ambiance and Crowd. Good for all crowds.. kids, family, friends and couples. All week or day its always full. Weekends or weekdays. Brunch or Dinner. And ample if parking. The location is just great.. right in the heart of Glendale. Love this place. My favorite here is Calamari, Jambalaya pasta, Redvelvet and Tiramisu cheesecake.. Plus there coffee is so good..

I come here about once a month because it&#39;s walking distance and my mom likes it. Today&#39;s lunch experience wasn&#39;t as pleasant as our other visits. Once our buzzer went off, we went up to the front to get seated. They took our buzzer and had us stand and wait for another five minutes while they were seating others.. which defeats the purpose of the buzzer but whatever. When it was our turn we found out that they had inputted our information incorrectly (requested a table for 3, they inputted a table for 2). Instead of apologizing, he rudely told us that we&#39;d have the next table and just moved on to seating other tables. I&#39;m assuming he wasn&#39;t a host or waiter because he was dressed in more professional attire than the others. What a damn shame it is- you&#39;d think he&#39;d make an effort to be a prime example of customer service. The experience put me in an unpleasant mood and will impact my choice in whether I will visit this establishment in the future.

The one star is for the overall experience, like I said before, the food is ok, nothing special and not worth what they charge but it&#39;s location def adds a few dollars to the menu, which I understand. Service was slow, but friendly, but here&#39;s the kicker...I guess my 15 percent tip wasn&#39;t enough because they tacked on an extra 25 dollars to my bill. Now that won&#39;t break my piggy bank but I&#39;m not in the business of just giving away money. Told the waiter and the managers and they said their system was down, that they would fix it right away and it was a mistake. Again, mistakes happen and I understand. It&#39;s been weeks and still nothing. Enjoy the extra tip Cheesecake Factory because I am never eating there again, stay classy.

Ok, let me say the place is fine, the food is fine. My SERVER was horrible! Shy is her name. Here&#39;s what happened:<br><br>We were a party of 10. She greeted us, all was fine. She took our drink order, great. Then she asked for our order, instead we asked for bread. She responded, &#34;Let me take your order, then I&#39;ll get your bread&#34;. Awkward, especially since we weren&#39;t all ready, but ok. We asked if we could get separate tabs, she said she could do no more than 3. Fair enough. Then she said she could only do 1 credit card per tab. Eyebrow raise...since when?  She said it would take forever even if we wrote the info down. Oooookay. She precedes to think NOW is the time to split the tabs because it&#39;s a process &amp; asks that we settle who will be on which tab. Very awkward. She then asked if we knew whether or not we&#39;d be ordering dessert. We said we weren&#39;t sure.  She said she needed to know now because she can&#39;t add to the tabs after she splits em. Now annoying! Food comes, we eat, fine. She brings the tabs. We pay but not well because we&#39;re annoyed (no idea why gratuity for our large party wasn&#39;t automatic). She takes the payment, leaves, and comes back to address the tip, saying there are suggested amounts on the receipt for us to go by. Wow. <br><br>Shy, if I ever see you coming towards my table, I&#39;m changing sections.

Don&#39;t believe in the &#39;fake news&#39;. Cheesecake Factory&#39;s food doesn&#39;t taste well. A restaurant that puts too much effort on ambience is trying to cover for their unsatisfactory food.

Five Stars to Daniel the Manager and Jennifer our waitress excellent service.  Our appetizers came out a bit late understandable. They came over apologized and really demonstrate d superior customer service.  I love this location..

I have to agree with the bad reviews that I see posted over the past few days.  The service at this Cheesecake Factory is definitely not good.  We were seated and the waitress came over and said they were out of bread, which was fine, but 20 min later she brought bread to the table behind us who arrived later.  We ordered a cobb salad dry with blue cheese dressing on the side, they brought it out with dressing.  I ordered the Tuscan Chicken from the Skinny menu, which I order all the time and is usually good, it looked like they had put a teaspoon of farro on the plate, it is normally served with quite a bit of farro under the chicken.  There was no flavor in this dish, and we almost finished eating by the time they brought my husbands salad, we took the rest to go.  I asked to speak to the manager, Ashley, and told her the situation, she acted like she could care less and it showed in her body language.  It was not crowded at all outside, there were only two waiters for five tables, at least 7 tables were empty.  So I told the manager, you aren&#39;t even busy and there is no service out here.  I would think it would reflect on our bill but no they charged full price for less than adequate food, awful table service and careless management.  I will not make it a point to come back.  There are many restaurants in the area that actually care about good customer service and definitely have better quality food.
IT WAS SUPER YUMMY!!!!!!! The portions are huge you can easily share a plate!!!!  What I did not like was how dark it was, I could barely see me amazing food.
This is hands down my favorite restaurant. It&#39;s the one place where you always have to get an appetizer, entree AND dessert because their food is just THAT good.

Sigh. I was extremely saddened by my one and only time at this place. Our waiter was so bad that I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll ever be back. <br><br>First off, this place is a zoo. It is not organized, people here are rude too. Luckily our wait was not too long and the table accommodated my daughter and her stroller. We were seated outside and it was a nice, warm night. No complaints until we met our waiter.<br><br>This guy didn&#39;t seem to know anything and had zero personality. Granted, he could have been new, but really, he didn&#39;t know ANYTHING. <br><br>I asked if they validated, he said he didn&#39;t know. I ordered a to go meal for my husband and wanted to order a small cheesecake to take home, not a slice, and he told me that the small cheesecakes were $30 to $40. I really should have checked online (why the hell don&#39;t they list dessert prices on the damn menu?) because they really were $23. I wasn&#39;t going to spend the price that he stated on that cheesecake so I passed. But I have to ask, what kind of a waiter doesn&#39;t know what a small cheesecake is? Before our price conversation happened he actually came out with just a slice of cheesecake to go. That was NOT what I asked for. So much for listening skills. He also had major attitude when he was asked if we could have a side of lemon wedges for our iced tea, as he served us all iced tea without any lemons at all. I ask again, who does that? We were each given a side of lemon wedges on a cocktail napkin and not in a small dish or bowl.<br><br>Service was turtle slow, it took him a half hour to bring us our checks. When he was asked to put my to go order on a separate check, he got confused and put it all on the same check and asked us to put numbers by what was on each check. Really now.<br><br>Don&#39;t think I&#39;ll ever go through the trouble of eating here ever again.

57 degrees outside...the ac was blasting (guess they found a way to get guest swallow down the food and get out under 15 min).  After asking to adjust the ac, it was turned off for 5 min and came back on (to make the quick turnaround of &#34;customers&#34;)<br><br>Never again!

Dinner was fine, service was fine. But when my brother spits a dead fly out of his mouth after taking a drink from his beer all the manager offered to do was take the beer off the bill. Nothing more was offered. Most places with high standards of customer service would normally offer some type of gesture of compensation.  When I worked at in n out if a fly was found in the food we comped the entire meal. I&#39;m not asking for a comped meal but how about a scoop of ice cream?

The only reason I am giving The Cheesecake Factory 4 stars is because of the wait time.  It&#39;s not their fault, really.  In fact, it probably is a plus.  In the several times that I&#39;ve eaten at this location, I&#39;ve never felt rushed.  Perhaps that is why there is usually a crowd to get in to this restaurant.<br><br>One thing I can count on is good, consistent food.  The waiters are very nice, and accommodating to special requests.  Refills on drinks are ample, and without having to ask.<br><br>Good service - consistent food.  Servings are ample.<br><br>If you are able, enjoy dining on the patio.  Great &#34;people watching&#34; and a really pleasant atmosphere.

I was there last night 07/27/17 around 8 pm in small patio the service was ok but at the time of drinks the waiter came with 4 drinks and water .. about to put in the table he just service one .. the other ones were falling down from his try .. ending in my aunt cloths ,floor table, part of glasses every where.. they didn&#39;t bring more drink after 20 minutes .. plus they didn&#39;t map the water .. I didn&#39;t see no body around .. I have to call inside to send some one to clean .. we use what ever we had to wipe the table.. The manager never even to came to apologeze .. was bad .. my poor aunt was visiting bad experince .. Rose

I was here yesterday, so good! I recommend the lemon herb roasted chicken, I always ask for extra sauce on the side. If you love that lemony flavor, this dish is definitely for you! And also had the lemon meringue cheesecake, amazing!

Good time. Sat on the patio for dinner. When the sun went down it was a bit cool so we asked when the heaters would be turned on.  The waiter said it was by request. My daughter was getting cold so I asked to turn them on. They looked like I was asking for the moon and made a big show of trying to get the heater started, moving umbrellas, etc. 30 minutes later, numerous requests, and still no heater on. We received our bill and left.

Came here for lunch on the recommendation of a co-worker. Had a salad large portion, but was not organic, it was just okay nothing special..Bread was good. I did not like the fact that the silverware is just laying on the table instead of the napkin...gross..How do you know the table is clean????? I asked for a new fork. When I asked for a to go box the waitress gave me a bag and put it in the box, again how do I know the bag is clean? and I am supposed to eat food from a tainted box???I just threw out my leftovers when we got back to the office. Very unsanitary practices for a restaurant, I expected better, won&#39;t be back.

We&#39;ve celebrated a few birthdays at cheesecake factory before &amp; always had complimentary birthday dessert. So today we decided to go to this location for my sister&#39;s birthday. I told our server that we&#39;re celebrating her birthday &amp; he looked at us in a weird way. When were about to finish our food, he handed us our bill. I told him again that it was my sister&#39;s birthday, so we told him we would like to order a cheesecake. He told me that he charged my card twice &amp; that it&#39;ll be fine since the first transaction will be voided. We expected a better experience &amp; hoping we get what we paid for. If we only knew, we would have went to a different place &amp; paid about the same for a better birthday lunch. There are alao cheaper places with better guest service.

Very nice service &amp; good food! Requested a chicken type milanese plate and they got it exactly right. Cooked as it should be and very good taste.<br>-<br>I could go anytime at The Cheesecake Factory and is going to be a winner!

We came here about a two week ago for desserts and have been experiencing some really bad restaurant quality food. Why is this happening to me?<br><br>You would think that Cheesecake factory the home of the cheesecake and would have awesome cheese cake and desserts, right?  <br><br>When we first got here the wait time was a approximate 40 minute wait. I glanced over to the bar to see if there were any seats open cause if you didn&#39;t know you can sit their and eat too. <br><br>Minutes pass and I was getting agitated because I really wanted some sweets in my mouth. Bam! the vibrating thing a ma ding rang. we got seated and we ordered the Godiva Chocolate cake and two scoops of vanilla ice cream and the Red Velvet cheese cake. <br><br>Man I was thinking  we are in for some yummy treats. Well guess again. My chocolate cake was hard as a rock and the whipping cream was probably just taken out of the freezer cause it didn&#39;t move and it was so heavy I wanted to barf. <br><br>Neither the two desserts had a standing ovation or an applause. I felt so cheated. We left unhappy and hungry. <br><br>I probably won&#39;t be back anytime soon for their are other places to eat near here.
We ordered the original cheesecake 6&#34; to go. It was $18.95. Usually they have frozen and you need to leave 1 hour out before eat. It was great!

Sat at the bar waited 15 minutes just to get some bread and finally when the bread came the waiter gave me attitude and said, &#34;what do you want me to do about it.&#34; no apology no I&#39;m sorry for the bad service no nothing just additude and ignored me. Staff doesn&#39;t even care I would just eat somewhere else don&#39;t eat here.

Came here to celebrate a birthday... Sadly it was not what we expected. <br><br>The food was good but the service was horrible. The server had a HORRIBLE attitude. Not only did we have to wait tons of time to be seated, we also had to ask for EVERYTHING. The server had no intention of being polite.. Like I mentioned she didn&#39;t even bother to ask if everything was fine or if we needed anything. <br><br>What was very upsetting was that the server asked the other two tables next to us if they needed anything. Yes, we were a large group and we weren&#39;t speaking english all the time, but when it was time to order and ask for what we all needed we perfectly spoke english and we really tried to be as polite as possible even though the server had a nasty attitude and at ALL times had this ugly expression on her face. <br><br>Like I said, service was horrible and while everyone there had been singing happy birthday to their loved ones, we just sat there being <br>ignored by this nasty server.

Just left and iam so furious with our service and waitress kelly. She not once asked how were doing only came to us when we asked for her. And we found a bug in our lemonade and all she said was oh ill get you a new one. The management here is the worst. Already wrote an email to corporate. The service needs to be better and the manager should really take the time to train and discipline the employees

This is the second time I have tried this restaurant, the first time was not a good experience, and I figured I&#39;d give them another try because my family wanted to eat here. Once again It was a disappointing experience. I have eaten at many Cheesecakes before and by far this location at the Americana is the worst. The waitress had a pleasant personality, however our food took a long time to come out, and when it did, it looked as though it had sat under the food warmer for at least 8 to ten minutes. My pasta was gummy and dry, with the sauce sucked out, and my guests potatoes on her breakfast dish were very dried out. The last persons dish was the best out of the 3, but the tacos were overly crisp and the meat looked dried out. We didn&#39;t have time to exchange things out because we were headed to a concert and couldn&#39;t wait. After reading many other reviews on this locations yelp page, I would hope that the management would take a more active role in the kitchen and dining room. Many things in the restaurant industry are forgivable ie, screaming kids (parents fault not the restaurants), Long wait (Welcome to Los Angeles deal with it, part of living here), Parking (Also part of just living in LA). <br><br>Now the ones that just can&#39;t happen if you want repeat customers is inattentive waitresses, overcooked or cold food, poor organizational skills, and constant mistakes. It&#39;s really not that hard for a customer like me. I am understanding, as I have worked in the food industry for 8 years, but this location seems to just flat out not care about a guests dining experience. I hope management reads this, because I only write this to help them know whats going on in their restaurant.

Worst Cheesecake Factory location I&#39;ve been to. I made the mistake of bringing my nephew to celebrate his birthday here. Long wait, bad and superficial service. I asked for a birthday candle twice no one bothered to follow up . I asked for a table outside I been told the patio is closing , very disappointing to see after our dinner that they were still seating people outside.I expressed my disappointment to Lawrence the manager and he mentioned &#34;he &#39;ll make it up to us next time... Really?! The birthday was already ruined, it will never be a next time!!

My family and I go to Cheesecake Factory maybe 4 times a month.. now that&#39;s a lot... why because we really like it... but today I had the worst experience!!!! And on my mom&#39;s bday! A manger by the name of Tamra scolded my kids! In front of me! Instead of telling me what happened she yelled at my kids like they were hood rats! My son and daughter were coming back from the restroom and decided to run, my daughter stopped but my son didn&#39;t. The manager comes up to our table, looks at my kids directly and scolded them. She didn&#39;t even bother to ask who the mother was so she could of spoken to them directly. I spoke to the other manager that was there and informed him of what had happened... he stated that he would talk to her and have her apologize...when she came to our table it felt like she didn&#39;t even want to apologize and just said it to satisfy the manager. She even said that she thought that my daughter was the mom! Ok..my daughter is 10! She has so many excuses.. first of all she shouldn&#39;t have assumed anything... and second of all.. so if she thought my daughter was the mom... she thought it was ok to yell at the customer?? What kind of managers do they have and what training do they provide them. This lady TAMARA .. let me say has been the worst manager I&#39;ve ever ever had to deal with. Quality control sucks.  What was worst was the apology was not sincere.

The worst management and overall team. Hostess&#39; stated &#34;an hour wait&#34; which is understandable given it was a Friday night. They ask for your mobile number so they could &#34;text you when your table is ready&#34;. Well... hostess Jacqueline is very incompetent. It doesn&#39;t take rocket science to take a phone number. Had to give it to her twice because she got it wrong the first time (despite me speaking aloud). I returned to the restaurant 2 hours later (after having eaten elsewhere - because the wait was ridiculous) and still ... no text. I spoke with the manager who also is unqualified to be a &#34;manager&#34;. She offered to seat me [after 2 hours of waiting].  Seriously?! Oh and the best part...she comps me a free slice of cheesecake! Cheesecake factory management and staff at Americana needs major overhaul. Do not dine there.

it was the third time I was going to cheesecake Factory. I loved the fresh baked bread with butter that they always bring for the appetizer. I ordered roasted vegetable pizza, it was nice and bread was fluffy. My husband ordered Filet Mignon which was nearly $30, quiet pricy, and the quality was not as expected. The other negative point was that we waited for 30 minutes to get our table, it is always busy specially for dinner. All in all I would go over there for pizza but not steak anymore.

I wish I could give negative ratings. My biggest regret about going to this particular location is that I got FOOD POISONING from the four cheese pasta with added chicken. FOOD POISONING! I just went there a few hours ago and I haven&#39;t been able to leave my restroom. Now let&#39;s talk about their ladies restroom. There were 6 stalls 1 out of order 3 so dirty with used tissue all over the floor and the big stall literally has PISS on the floor. There was only one semi-clean stall to use. You can hear the staff chit chatting through out your entire meal. 3 staff members were standing maybe 8 feet away from my table talking about their car problems, bad mouthing their boss for being late, 2 guys hit on a female employee. I&#39;m upset I had to pay for my meal. Not returning.
The hostess are not friendly they make it seem like the wait is a drag. the waiter was nice but food took forever to come out. But it when it did it was delicious.

Fried Calamari $5 <br>Ultimate Nachos $5 <br>Getting wasted on $5 cocktails and 4$ drafts, Priceless! <br><br>Five stars to their happy hour (Mon. - Fri. 4pm-6pm) These guys dont play around, portions are HUGE. Went with a buddy for some snacking... ended up taking leftovers home. oh yesssssss.
Not the best service I much prefer the Cheesecake Factory in Sherman oaks service. I had a very bad service experience here at the amircana Glendale

So, of course I&#39;ve been here a million times before as a carnivore and also as a vegetarian but yesterday was my first time as a vegan. To start, I got the moscato wine (yum!!) and a guacamole appetizer with my boyfriend. I didn&#39;t eat the tortilla chips (wasn&#39;t sure if they were vegan) but the guacamole was satisfying. For my meal I ordered the Thai Lettuce Wrap with no chicken/portabello mushrooms instead. When I said &#34;no chicken&#34; to my waiter, his eyes nearly popped out of his head and he was in such a state of disbelief that a person could not want chicken in their meal that he had to ask me again, &#34;so, that&#39;s no chicken?&#34;.  None-the-less, it was surprisingly very, very tasty.<br><br>Sadly, thats about the only vegan thing on their menu! The Skinnylicious Veggie Burger sans the mayo and cheese might be vegan, but that depends on the ingredients in the bread.<br><br>Cheesecake Factory -- please, in the future, have more vegan items!
The cheesecake factory at he Americana is my families go to for dinner or desserts. My go to dinner here is the spicy cashew chicken. That meal is WOW good!!!<br><br>-Cheers-

Love this location... <br>Came here to get some appetizers and dessert... <br>Got seated within 15 min outside.... they were really busy it was very obvious that the waiters were running around like chickens with their heads cut off.... <br>I asked the waiter to turn on the heater as soon as we got seated, he said he&#39;ll get someone to come by and close the umbrellas down so they can turn it on. <br>He got our drink orders, and I asked him to bring us the balsamic vinaigrette with the bread... He forgot to bring it, but got it with the second basket of the bread when we reminded him. =] (we were nice about it too)<br><br>Ordered the Nachos.... <br>After about 20 min the waiter came by and said they had messed up the order so if we wanted a cup of the soup of the day while we waited, and he was very nice about it. We took his offer and got the lentil soup (he brought us a bowl instead of a cup)<br>Then the Nachos came... <br>WOW! Never have I had Nachos that taste so horrible. The cheese was not melted, there was barely any ingredients on it. It was just so bland.  The BF and I NEVER EVER EVER complain about the food that we get. It has to be sooooo horribly wrong that we MIGHT say something... <br><br>Bf said &#34;I don&#39;t mean to be sounding rude or offend YOU in anyway, but could you tell the chef that this was by far the worst nachos we&#39;ve ever had. It had no taste what so ever, so we were dipping the chips into the soup to get some flavor&#34;<br><br>Nice waiter apologized and came back saying the chef said he would be happy to make another one, we said it was ok and we just wanted to mention it. Then he left and came back and asked us to order something else so they could make it up to us.. .we just got a Tiramisu and IT WAS FANTASTIC.... we were planning on getting it anyways.. =] <br><br>Bill came, he had only charged us for the nachos... <br>soup, dessert, nachos  plus tax = $13!!!!!<br>We waaay over tipped him just for his service... <br><br>after we paid and got up they turned the heater on! =]

It was my step daughters 16 bday dinner so we went to. Go have dinner at the cheesecake factory we get there at 800 pm and its a 20 minute wait plus ten more after and 10 more after the first 10 so 40 minute wait which we don&#39;t mind this was Dec 15 a Thursday so as we are seated we order 4 waters with lemon wedges our appetizers and our plates of food not to mention the kid has school the next day her eyes are puffy due to going to bed early not to mention a waiter comes at 950 pm to let us know they don&#39;t have the food I ordered that they didn&#39;t have those ingredients no more so we asked for our bill to pay and leave then the manager comes with the server and all the dishes with food it had turn out it was a mistake .... I completely understand a busy restaurant but as busy as it gets they should be more organized with their order and tables.... We didn&#39;t pay for the appetizers thanks to the manager he was so polite and nice but I do apologize the service was so bad I had never ate so much bread with butter I was starving

This place is absolutely fantabulous!!! My son and I have eaten there four (4) times this week...the ambiance, the staff and just being in the &#34;mix&#34; of great company and please let&#39;s not forget the food...with such large portions, I had leftovers each time I frequented the establishment...a hearty &#34;thank you&#34; to Wendii who made our dining very special...<br><br>Best,<br><br>Tongie
I&#39;m a creature of habit here and always order the Thai Lettuce Wraps.  I also only eat about half because it&#39;s So Much . . . so here&#39;s my leftovers :)  btw, they&#39;re Awesome!!

What a huge mistake it was to go here! They couldnt do ONE THING correctly. First, I waited for a table for 30 minutes before i asked about it, and the dumb broad had crossed my name out already, so instead of getting the next table i went back on the bottom of the list.<br>Now we&#39;re seated and I cant get a server or a drink order to save my life! another 20 minutes goes by and he comes by asking if were ready to order. Sure! god knows we&#39;ll never see you  again. Ordered, and 35 minutes later, he comes and tells me they&#39;re out of my pasta and to order something else. I am ready to walk. He says he&#39;ll rush it. Fine.<br>we get our food... its not great, but edible and slightly above cold. I want coffee afterwards so another 10 minutes goes by before I get black coffee which is sooo burnt, i choke on it. Forget it! No tip and storm out.<br>NEVER AGAIN!!<br>P.S. he asked to validate my parking stub, gave it to him... Saw a movie and went to pay for parking, NO VALIDATION! PAID FULL PRICE! <br>I will be telling everybody I know about this God forsaken joke.
I love sitting in the patio area, such a great location.  I always get their Bite-Sized Little Crab Cakes Served with Mustard Sauce, Avocado eggrolls and their Caesar salad.

Typically I love the Cheesecake Factory...tonight the service at the bar SUCKED! It took forever to get a drink. The bartender (bearded guy) asked if I was having drinks? Dinner? I said both. He gave me a menu but never came back to ask me what I wanted to order. I was at the bar for over a half hour. I finished my beer...pint glass completely empty. I waited 5 minutes (there were only 4 other people at the bar) NO RESPONSE from bartender. Finally I had to flag him over to get my bill and get the hell out of there before I starved!!!
