I went to Cheesecake Factory with my friends and the waiter sits us down, then takes order orders for drinks 20 minutes after we sit, after we got our drinks we were waiting 30 minutes to just give him our orders, we asked other waiters if they can serve us and we even complained to the manager, all they can say is &#34;Your waiter will be right with you&#34;. It took the guy 40 minutes to take our order. We were there for 1 hour and 50 minutes after eating our food fast cause it was after our curfew and there were 2 different tables that came after us and left before us. We told the guy were not giving you a tip cause your a terrible waiter and you just lost a solid $20 tip. We didn&#39;t give it cause why should a person deserve $20 for righting down something on paper and bringing drinks. He also gave us attitude when he actually did serve us.<br>Hate Cheesecake cause of the workers having self-opinions on people because of there age and race.<br>The foods not even that good for being that expensive. I can go to Charley&#39;s and get chicken tenders there for $5 with much better service that I don&#39;t need to give a tip for with much better food. <br>Im never going back there and they should fire workers that take there time with different types of people.

I came here for dinner a week ago and got the BBQ chicken salad. Cheesecake has good food but this location is always super packed. There was an hour wait. We got seated inside and it was soo loud I could hardly speak to my friend.

Today is my birthday and not only did they forget my fiancé meal, but our waiter hardly provided a service. Later, some guy in a tie asked us about our experience and we explained our situation the lack of effort to have us leave as happy customer was his last priority.

This Cheesecake Factory is located at the Americana and it&#39;s very European.  Whether you sit inside or outside, it&#39;s always a great experience.  The staff are professional and friendly. <br><br>The food keeps up the great standards of Cheesecake Factory.  From the drinks to the meals to the deserts, they are all excellent!<br><br>Been here so much that I&#39;ve had everything on the menu over time and everything is excellent.<br><br>They validate the parking as well.<br><br>It&#39;s a great place for dates and families.  You can eat here then go to the Movie Theater or shop at many stores at the Americana.<br><br>Highly recommend it!

THE BIGGEST DOWNFALL of this location is the location itself.  It&#39;s too crowded &amp; unorganized!  This location is NOT a typical first date Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>You wait 10 min in line to reserve a table. -_-   Depending on time/day you wait a minimum of 15 min to sit.  So RESERVATIONS ARE HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.<br><br>Their food is good of course, service is decent.

I have been wanting to try this place since forever. And I like it. <br><br>My favorite dishes of the meal would be Pasta Da Vinci and the Wild Mushroom Soup! Actually, the BBQ Ranch Salad and Pecan Crusted Catfish were decent too. (: Overall, a great experience and good food.<br>$80 including tips and tax for 4 happy stomach (: Not bad.<br><br>A little disappointed on their Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake. Way too sweet and indulging. It&#39;s definitely meant to be shared with a party of 4 or more. There&#39;s no way one can eat this alone. One or two bite and your sugar level has reached the top!
Basil pesto with chicken tomato<br><br>Quesadilla with chicken and avocado eggrolls are a must !!

I really hate leaving two stars for restaurants. But came here to have lunch with my mom the waiter was rude with my mom so we moved to another section still our wait staff was indifferent I think it was the end of their shift so we got tired and bored employees ready to leave and had, had their fill of work! So stay away from coming around 4:00 pm you&#39;ll get grumpy tired staff.! The food was overlooked and cold when we got it. Overall not s good experience after expending over 80.00 for two

This is one of the bigger Cheesecake Factory locations. They have a great staff, food is always good, other locations can be hit or miss, they are consistent. They have a great year round patio that is always welcoming to pups. We will always support a place that respects and welcomes our 4 legged child. He&#39;s better behaved the most 2 legged ones!

This place is so good I love their jambalaya plate it&#39;s delicious also our server Courtney was so nice and helpful why can&#39;t everyone be like her as friendly will definitely be coming back thank you Courtney for your great service.
Amazing food and service, we loved our host Raymundo and the manager Matthew! They are just amazing and take wonderful care of their customers! :)

If I could rate my experience here a zero I would. Typically my &#34;cheesecake factory experience&#34; is delightful however at this location it was not even close. My father was from out of town visiting so I took him here for a nice relaxing dinner before his flight. We waited &#34;15 minutes&#34; which was 45 minutes. When we got seated half of us got our drinks and then 15 minutes later after we had to ask the waitress the rest of us got them. 3 out of 4 meals came out, at the same time as the appetizers I might add. My father&#39;s food came out a full hour later after hassling the waitress who was avoiding us. By far a horrible experience and will never go again, let alone this particular location may have ruined the cheesecake factory for me for forever.

I found a hair in egg plant Parmesan the manager approached me about it and I told him the situation and he offered me another batch of pasta and I said no but he didn&#39;t take it off my bill if some like this happens you compensate the customer this is very wrong a big company like cheese cake factory

I usually don&#39;t write reviews, and have never wrote a negative one, but the service here is horrible! The waiter had a really bad attitude and was extremely rude, I didn&#39;t even wait for him to bring the food to the table, his attitude made me want to leave as soon as possible and that&#39;s what I did. I didn&#39;t even finish my drink, took two sips and left.

I love it here.. Even though it&#39;s in a crowded area where people gather especially in the weekends but great place to eat.. It&#39;s next to the Glendale Galleria.. After shopping, why not go there to eat.. Service is excellent, not one of them had a problem with me yet.<br><br>Burgers and steaks aren&#39;t top notch but they are well known for their pastas and of course, their cheesecakes.. <br><br>Ambiance is great with a choice of sitting outside and enjoy the fountain scenery or inside where you can watch sports.. They have have a full bar there also..<br><br>Restrooms are very clean.. <br><br>Salads are good also with a variety of flavors.. Chinese Chicken Salad is excellent, I always get it when I&#39;m sick of pasta that day.. Their other desserts are yummy also.. I love the 30th Anniversary chocolate cheesecake.. Wide selection of good food in their menu.. <br><br> My wife loves it there.. She always gets the Chicken Marsala and the Crusted Chicken Romano..  There is a lot of parking spaces.. I would come here again for their great pasta, salads and desserts..  <br><br>I better stop talking about food, I drool every time I write reviews like these..

A friend and I came here for lunch on a Friday, so we experienced some of the &#34;rush rush&#34; atmosphere that others had mentioned but it wasn&#39;t to terrible.<br>Once seated we had a wonderful waiter!! I would go back here just for ALVIN.<br>He was so funny, and he would break out into song or dance out of no where. I didn&#39;t realize we would experience a show with lunch! <br>We each got a salad ( I got the skinnylicious chopped salad, and my friend got The Carlton salad) both were very tasty and had ingredients that paired well with one another.

I see a lot of bad reviews here, but Im going to review based on my experience. I came to this location twice (Americana cheesecake factory).<br><br>So it was my birthday, and we came here around 11 at night. This place is beautiful. It is a really nice looking cheesecake factory. Our server was really nice. He gaved us some recommendations and we asked a few questions about the menu.<br><br>The pulled pork sandwich is delicious! I know, it&#39;s hard to believe that a non bbq place has great pulled pork but I&#39;ve been to a lot of BBQ spot and this is by far my favorite pulled pork sandwich. It comes with coleslaw and french fries.<br><br>I got the Louisiana which is really good as well but I like it without the parmesan because I&#39;m not a fan of cheese. Also their da vinci pasta isn&#39;t bad too.<br><br>My next experience was a night out with my friend. The place was packed but I didn&#39;t care I wanted to try their salad.<br><br>I ordered the Sante Fe chicken salad and my friend ordered the spicy chicken sandwich.<br><br>DELICIOUS. The salad was huge! But the dressing was a little strong so I recommend asking them to put the dressing on the side so you can put as much as you want prior to your likings.<br><br>Her sandwich was great too. The chicken was larger than the bread which was funny but the chicken was really good. Tender and moist while nice and crispy on the outside.<br><br>Only bad side was they messed up on our bill. We wanted to split the bill say put 13 on my friends card and I will pay the difference with my cash. They rung up the whole thing on my friends card. It&#39;s fine I guess because our server felt really bad.<br><br>anywhos, great experiences overall! O and our waiter gaved us the brown bread instead of the white which was great because I love the brown bread they have!

My Family and I always have a good experience. We usually get an excellent waiter and do not have to wait long to be seated and served. my only complaint would have to be last few times we have come we have ordered the buffalo blast, which you used to be the best, but lately many tend to not be stuffed properly. So it just ends up being pieces of flat greasy wonton.

Sat for 20 minutes without a server and got a dirty spoon for silverware. Manager took 15 minutes to come after asking still no server. Manager finally comes and gives the same generic excuse that the servers switched shifts and didn&#39;t do a proper changeover. Than asked if she could get us anything to drink and proceeded to card us for the two Jameson mules we asked for which she had no clue of what a Jameson mule is. Finally we get a server after what seems to be 30 minutes into Taking our seats. We immediately place all orders from drinks to appetizers to main course for fear we might die waiting. Ben takes out orders and than we get another server because bens going on break. Overall just poor management. The manager did a good Job at fixing our lack of attention but didn&#39;t go out of the way to fix the whole experience we encountered. If your out of the area don&#39;t go out of the way to come here because it&#39;s at the beautiful Americana. You&#39;ll be disappointed with the wait, food,and service. There are several other reviews that I read earlier today that say the same thing. And the 3 stars they have currently should be worth observing before making the decisions to spend your money here. Sad sad sad. On father days too. All bad.

There are certain reviews one feels rather silly writing. This is one of those reviews for me. Not because funny things happen here, just because the Cheesecake Factory is the Cheesecake Factory. You know every time exactly what you will be getting, which for some is very nice because it&#39;s safe. It&#39;s a very corporate restaurant and well done at that. I mean lets face it, when is the place not packed? This location looks almost identical to other locations - aside from the lucky ducks at the Marina Del Rey location on the water. <br><br>I occasionally find myself here when strolling the Americana (aka I am obsessed with Anthropologie) and feel the need for a little bite or drink. For this it is perfect. Shopping, appetizer, drink. That&#39;s usually what happens. I do appreciate that they now have the small plates menu and healthy menu. That&#39;s pretty much that. End.

We waited 45 mins to get seated, but all in all it was a nice experience; Good customer service and delicious food. The bread was probably the best bread I&#39;ve ever had and the cheesecake was amazing. We ordered chipotle pasta and one plate was more than enough for us (two people).
food is always great! This place has a little bit of everything i like. Good Service, Great Pasta and cheesecake :)

Located in the Glendale galleria, this Cheesecake location is huge. Even on a Saturday afternoon at lunch time the wait wasn&#39;t very bad (less than 15 minutes). Our waiter was excellent and the food was what we&#39;ve come to expect from Cheesecake factory (good quality, large portions, and not very expensive). The outside seating is very nice. If you park in the adjacent garage of the galleria, they will validate parking.

By far the worst experience ever. Came in waited 25-30mins for a table when the hostess said it will be 5mins. As, I approach the hostess about our table. Three of the hostess had no clue about our table reservation. They stated the table was on hold. &#34;Are you serious?&#34; Then after waiting another 5min for our table. Once we arrived at our table. The table was not properly cleaned. The table was greasy and the utensils were filthy. Overall, management really needs to train their staff a lot better on cleanliness and customer service. Furthermore, train your hostess because they have no idea what they are doing.

My go to place for GNO, date night or a family get together. You can never go wrong at the Cheesecake Factory! <br><br>My favorites:<br>Appetizers- Fried Macaroni and Cheese &amp; Buffalo Chicken Blasts<br><br>Cocktails- Strawberry Martini &amp; Pomegranate Margarita<br><br>Entrees- Louisiana Chicken, Jambalaya &amp; any other of their huge salads! <br><br>Dessert- Red Velvet Cheesecake &amp; Oreo Cheesecake.<br><br>Just talking about these makes me want to go there right now!

I came here last night with my family for my Dads birthday (he absolutely loves this place) and we are seated immediately and get our drinks but our waiter was literally standing there waiting for our orders. This place has a HUGE menu. I had to go through this thing 5-6 times to make sure I knew what I wanted, I felt so rushed. He didn&#39;t have any personality, he didn&#39;t smile. It was one of the saddest waitering experiences I have ever witnessed. But I figured out my order. Cuban sandwich with a Caesar side salad. So yummy. When we were finishing up and the waiter asked if we would like boxes. I still had salad left and BOTH sides of my sandwich only one side was eaten half through. Handing him my plate knowing he will pack up my order for us and all excited for my salad the next day. BUT NOPE. Here I am at home looking at only one half of my sandwich while the rest of what was on my plate was discarded. What I payed for and didn&#39;t get to finish and was looking forward to got discarded. How lovely.

Surprising I have not wrote a review of this place yet. Well here it is. <br><br>Went here with my bff, bff&#39;s brother and his girlfriend for dinner. Normally this place is ok to eat out sometimes if I want to get some cheesecake or eat their bread. This location is kind of bad because well it gets extremely crowded on weekends except for when we came. I expected at least 10-20min wait but I was wrong it was more like a 5min wait. <br><br>Our waiter I think his name is Brandon/Brendon or something like that. He was nice and very patient with us when we were waiting for my bff&#39;s brother. He also had a very energetic feel (I like). Although it felt like we were a bit ignored when we wanted more bread or wanted to order some cheesecakes. <br><br>So I love love love their bread so fresh and so good lol. For starters the bff wanted some wontons, so she got &#39;Chicken Wontons&#39;. it was good but it was also way to salty. High in sodium anyone?<br><br>So here were our entrees <br>Mine-  The Stuffed Chicken Tortilla no cilantro smothered with cheese on top and tomatoes with black beans and a corn bread topped with sour cream. This meal was GREAT! Normally when I come here I get something fried or pasta good thing I did not make that move. I would gladly recommend this dish and would get it again when I come back.<br><br>BFF - Bang Bang Chicken &amp; Shrimp, she seemed to enjoy it a little except for the toasted coconut flakes on top. Although she kept staring at every ones food. It displayed with a massive amount of rice (brown) in the center than surrounded with fried chicken and like 5pcs of shrimp topped with toasted coconut flakes. In my opinion it looked good but I did not try. <br><br>BFF&#39;s bro gf - Grande Burrito Factory - this thing is HUGE, (I know because the bf got this before). So she seemed to enjoy it a little too. She complained that it had way too much rice in it which I kind of agreed. She gave my bff one end of the burrito and it contained mostly rice than anything else. <br><br>BFF&#39;s bro - the most expensive meal out all of us. Herb Crusted Salmon &amp; Shrimp, for a $20 meal I would find this as a disappointment. For that price you can get more for your buck elsewhere even with those options. Salmon was like 3 little pieces and well this wasn&#39;t your average size shrimp they normally serve - more like a little bigger and only got 4pcs. Mashed potatoes right on the center and asparagus on the side. I wish I could&#39;ve took a picture of this food. <br><br>After getting our grub on, we waited for quite some time for me get a to go box and for our waiter to let us order some cheesecakes. Was also another wait to get our check. It was busy but it was not extremely busy. <br><br>Overall our waiter was very helpful and happy to be there even though we got a little ignored. Pointers when he noticed our drinks and gave us new glasses. That was awesome! <br><br>P.S. I got the Red Velvet cheesecake to go and I was very disappointed. It was too sweet for my palette and the red velvet was not as red as I like it to be. It also did not seem so flavorful. That was a disappointment.

I know it&#39;s a chain but we&#39;ve had pretty good luck previously . Located in the Americana shopping center, you have to park in the garage to get there. Parking is validated. It&#39;s right outside the garage so it&#39;s convenient to get to. <br>Dinner was good as expected. My daughter had the orange chicken which could have been shared by 3 people! My husband had the full size chicken Caesar which could have been split by 2 people. I ordered a side salad &amp; ordered from their skinnylicious menu which is a normal size plate. The steak medallions was very good. We shared caramel cheesecake (  natch!!) <br>But the best of the night was our waiter Josh. OMG, what a character. He made our dinner so much fun. He was a cross between Roseanne Barr &amp;  Nathan Lane. Very entertaining. Thank you Josh.

Just like every other Cheesecake Factory expect a long wait time especially during weekends, which is fine because they give you a buzzer and since it&#39;s located at the Americana there&#39;s a lot to do. There&#39;s indoor and outdoor seating available, although for the outdoor seating there&#39;s limited seating and a longer wait time. By the way they do validate in the front where you pick up the buzzer. <br>One of my favorites here is the chicken piccata. its sautéed chicken breast with lemon sauce, mushrooms capers on a bed of angel hair pasta. Another favorite is the herb crusted salmon served with asparagus and mashed potatoe. Both dishes are light and are big enough to share just like most of their stuff. I must say the quality of the food isn&#39;t that amazing but then again you get what you pay for: cheap prices and large portions. <br>Anways, we used to go to the Cheesecake factory pretty often but we had a pretty bad visit this last time we went. My husband found hair in his Caesar salad and we got grossed out. The manager was really nice about it though, we weren&#39;t charged for the salad.

This place seriously has the worst workers. So far I&#39;ve called five times to place a pick up order I&#39;ve waited over seven minutes. I complained the girl said she&#39;ll go tell them to pick up right now. Currently been on hold for 6 mins and 48  seconds. Worst service ever! <br><br>Stuffed mushrooms is good tho

I brought my Girlfriend here for her birthday just to hang out and have dinner, she also LOVES cheesecake.  This isn&#39;t the first Cheesecake Factory that I have been to and for the most part its typical Cheesecake Factory.  The service was a little slow and it seemed that our waitress was spread a little thin.  Overall, typical Cheescake factory.
Longest wait ever! The dumb waitress forgot about my party had to wait longer! If you want Cheesecake Factory don&#39;t go to the Glendale one!

I love this place if i could put 10 stars i would, after having a bad service at a different restaurant  and coming here was all worth it. The service was Amazing the Service was also Amazing, we had an amazing waitress her name was Migalina omg she was fantastic. <br><br>At the end this place is a great restaurant you cant go wrong. I do recommend you come here.

This is my favorite place!!!!! <br>Food is great (there&#39;s always something for everyone), the staff is very friendly, and there&#39;s typically no wait. Being right in the Americana also makes it a great location!

Well wait was way too long tonight. Glass was dirty BUT service was great by Monica our waitress she change  it all food is great. Get the jambolya pasta the best dish for me here always. The mytie was unbelievable. Now lets  get the food. No matter what or how long you wait when u have a good service it changes everything. Great job Monica i hope they read this. Great night all together....

What:  Dinner &#34;to go&#34;<br><br>Price:  $35-$40<br><br>Recommended:   Yes<br><br>Reasons:<br><br>1.  Huge menu.  Tasty dishes for a chain restaurant.   <br><br>2.  You can hang out at The Americana while you&#39;re waiting for your food.<br><br>3.  Getting dinner &#34;to go&#34; means you can eat in the comfort of your home and avoid paying tip (though we occassionally leave a tip for the person at the counter if s/he is helpful).<br><br>Other comments:<br><br>They don&#39;t have a dedicated staff member to take phone orders.  It&#39;s a person at the bakery multi-tasking between phone orders, plating desserts, making change for the servers, and taking orders from customers at the restaurant.  So, calling ahead with your order can be frustrating sometimes because they place you on hold for a long time.  <br><br>A better option is to place your order at the restaurant and chill near the fountain or walk around outdoors until your order is ready.

My all time favorite restaurant! I love their delicious bomb cheesecake!!! The clam chowder is amazing. I am in love with the crispy shrimp platter I always order that specific plate.  It could get very crowded but it is definitely worth the wait. Also, the wheat bread with butter is awesome. I recommend this place to everyone.

Brittany is a really REALLY great server. She was super personable, offered lots of excellent choices and made so many modifications because we are trying to be good these days;). The food was fantastic (which is saying a lot because we got very basic, healthy and low fat food and usually people comment here for how amazing the pasta and cheesecake is!).

This place is amazing. Cheesecake factory&#39;s my favorite restaurant but the girl I&#39;ve been talking to for 3 months doesn&#39;t like it so we never go. If it were up to me I would go to cheesecake everyday for the rest of my life.

Really great cheeseburgers and cheesecakes and butter on bread. The bread and butter was very luxurious and has great soft, heat and sweet quality. I enjoy Cheesecake Factory bread appetizer more than the plain bread containing butter already inside by bakeries. <br><br>The Americana and the Macaroni and Cheeseburger was very very delicious, with fries on the side. For me, ketchup is required with this because the heavy meals are so needing it - ketchup to cheese, potato and pure ground beef all together is equivalent to milk to cookie. I had to pause for a bit after halfway eating it but after finishing both burgers I still ordered dessert to be full. CheeseCake Factory proves capable of various culinary tastes. CheeseCake Factory deserves praise for their hardworking efforts and superior talents for how they serve and make food. <br><br>The Oreo Cheesecake and the Hot Fudge Sundae were marvelous. <br><br>I am willing to judge all the other foods I have not ordered from the menu yet.

I have always liked the Cheesecake Factory. The food is consistent in taste throughout their chains. The food portions seems to be shrinking from previous visits.<br><br>White Chicken Chili-Delicious, tasty and rich with flavor. Served with white rice.<br><br>Tex Mex Eggrolls-Spicy chicken, corn, black beans, peppers, onions, and cheese. Great. <br><br>Portion size-aprox 2 cups of chili and 1/3 cup rice. Cost $12.50  <br>                    3 eggrolls cut in halves. Cost $9.95<br><br>Service-1 hour wait, quoted 30 minutes. Waitress was very pleasant, and cordial.<br><br>Parking-Free with validation. Very large parking structure. Choice of valet or self parking.

This restaurant is normally my fallback for lunch but today, I had a really bad experience. My companion and I tried to get a seat at the bar. A woman cut us off and took the chair. She had words with us.  The woman, who started all this, insulted me by saying that I was a &#39;purchased bride&#39;. I am Asian. She also called my companion &#39;old&#39;. She asked the waiter to call security. When the manager came, he took sides. He stood by during this conversation, then offered to seat us elsewhere. As far as I am concerned, the manager contributed to this situation in which we were discriminated against on the basis of age, sex and race. I have always liked the Cheesecake Factory and been here many times I will never come here again.

I have been to Cheesecake Factory for years and never had a problem. Sure the food has been mediocre but it&#39;s a good place for groups. However the service I received today was horrible. I went there for brunch ordered an egg sandwich. I got the whole second half to go because it was really big. I came home to find that someone had clearly taken huge bites out of the sandwich before packing it up. I can&#39;t believe someone would do that so disgusting. Never going back there again

I come here a lot with my mom. She really likes this place. I usually stick to the same thing cause some of the food is kinda on the bland side. The portions here are enormous so I usually split my order with someone. Their lunch specials are great and the portions are plenty as well. The waiters are friendly and try their best to accommodate to your needs. <br><br>P.S. This place validates parking.

B.E.A.U.T.I.F.U.L.<br><br>With Disneyland resemblances (waterfall &#34;show&#34; in the backdrop, perfectly manicured lawn resembling astro-turf, a local &#34;train&#34;, and picturesque stores...) this is truly a magical place to eat~<br><br>Well, all fairytales aside, Cheesecake is a successful :( commercial business :( that we all can&#39;t help but LOVEEEEEEEE.  Some get irritated at the pricing, but with the breadbasket (! -- what&#39;s your favorite, the wheat or french??), the goblets of water (!! fancy!!), the fiesta style plates of pasta (flakes and flakes of seasoning / peppers / flaky goodies), the freshest parmesan cheese in the world (sigh this is Italy huh), and the list goes on.... well one annoying thing is the cheesecakes that start at ~$7... sigh, so luxurious to those who order, ... but anyways, there lunch size portions are still *hefty* and *left-over friendly* (girls speaking).  <br><br>If you want a more authentic restaurant, I don&#39;t know what to suggest.  Cheesecake is like McDonalds.  It&#39;s the same regardless of the location, even though some locations are better than others, and it&#39;s a universally great place to celebrate any location~ happy birthday~ and you will never be let down by the wonderful white-clad staff.<br><br>** love the chicken chipotle pasta --- would be **perfect** with red pepper, but black peppers is alright, just wish they made it SPICIER.  the chicken is tender and not over cooked and not in huge SLABS that have no sauce and you have to cut.  so perfect~<br><br>** factory burger is GIANT, don&#39;t compare the burgers to mcdonalds please and how much value you could receive from there, because mcdonalds doesn&#39;t give free bread FTW!  <br><br>** fries are one of my favorite food(s) group(s) and these were a nice 7ish/10.

I love cheesecake factory, I want to make that clear, however this was a disappointing experience. We got a table relatively quickly, considering how busy it was, but then the service took a dive. We weren&#39;t offered bread, while the tables around us were. I ordered a kettle soda, which might as well have been water. Had to ask twice for glasses of water. Then the food, bland, under seasoned, boring. I ordered the chicken madiera, which I have had, and enjoyed, at another location. Here the chicken was cold, under seasoned, and literally drowned in an overly sweet wine reduction. My girlfriend had the Cajun shrimp jumbalaya, which was also under seasoned, she had to ask for salt. <br>Then the grand finale, the cheesecake...we ordered the lemon/raspberry cream cheesecake...a slice literally 1/2 the size of an average cheesecake factory slice, of course, why stop at mediocre food, might as well rip us off with their name sake item...poor management. <br>Unfortunately it is clear that quality has given way to quantity  at this location.

Came here with coworkers for happy hour around 4:00pm. We waited for about an hour for a table. One of my coworkers kindly asked what seemed to be the manager how much longer we would have to wait. We waited for 10 minutes, 20, 30 minutes turned into an hour. There were several empty tables on the other side of the bar but we had to wait to be seated by the bar. There was a group there who seemed to have already finished eating. The same coworker asked the same person if we could be seated in a table that was open. The lady manager got upset and started arguing with my coworker. Lady, we understand how much you must hate your job but please do not take it out on customers. It&#39;s really a stupid policy to have to be absolutely seated by the bar when other tables are available. Get it together Cheesecake Factory. You lost customers due to your organization and professionalism. The Cheesecake Factory at The Grove has way better service than this one at Glendale. This was our first time coming to this restaurant but will not be coming here ever again.

This review is for the carrot cake, which was unexpectedly dry.<br><br>The peanut butter cake, however, was fabulous! Decadent, but delicious. Totally worth the calories :) <br><br>Ultimate red velvet - too much plain cheesecake, red velvet layer was very thin.

Probably the worst experience at a Cheesecake Factory ever.  Came here the other day with a few friends.  Walked in and asked for a table outside and they said they would text me when our table was ready.  Came back when they texted me and when I walked in another party just came in and they got seated before I did!  They even sat outside too.  That was annoying.  Came to our &#34;table&#34; wasn&#39;t even cleaned yet.  We sat down and didn&#39;t have napkins or any utensils. I tried flagging down a few waiters but they took forever, I was even ignored!! When our bread finally came we didn&#39;t even have knives to put the butter on.  There was only sourdough bread (no wheat and wheat is always the best) the bread was rock hard I felt like I was gunna break my teeth!  The service was horrible. It constantly took about 5-10minutes to have a waiter bring back what we wanted (utensils, water, sauces, our bill...).  Our food almost took 45 minutes to bring to the table.  The food was decent but having experienced the poor service, my dinner was ruined. <br><br>Avoiding the Cheesecake Factory at all costs!  Not worth the time!

Probably the worst cheesecake factory experience I&#39;ve ever had.... I used to love this place I don&#39;t know what the heck happened to it. I decided to bring my cousins who are visiting here on vacation from a different country today for lunch and had the WORST service/food experience...... Our server, a mid age blonde lady, was so slow, lost and seemed like she had no idea what she was doing! This particular experience was beyond anything I&#39;ve ever had. We literally waited 20min for every single step in the whole &#34;steps of service process&#34;.... The Greet,  took about 10min, drinks 20min to get...... bread 20min to get after that, cocktails 20min AFTER that... already been here over an hour and STILL no food. Once our food came out, everything came out separate and we literally had to ask other servers for everything we needed, i.e. Ranch, napkins, refills......NOT ONCE DID OUR SERVER ASK IF WE&#39;D LIKE A REFILL ON OUR DRINKS! Beyond frustrated, I decided to ask another server if we could get our check because I wanted to leave and spare anymore embarrassment in front of my cousins... Another thing, not once did I see management presence and if there was a manager present they would have noticed how agitated we were with the horrific service we received and stopped by the table....never going back again.....

Drinks, food and service are all good. Visited this location in a crazy Saturday evening (line was super long..like those black friday sales line). Waited for a pasta for over 30 mins I guess.. Manager came to me and said kitchen has to remake it so pasta is on them.  Ohh it sounds good to me and then I ordered another drink.  Food came out.. it tastes good but still a little bit different from it used to be. But my overall experience here is good.
I love this great place always come with my family the food is delicious  sabroso lorecomiendo at

This place has been a Great Experience!!! And it was all because of Omar! He gave us great service! The manager was also a great help. It was crowded because it was the fist of new year. The food came out quick. We had lots of fun!
This place is magical. I always end up finishing my entire plate even though the portions are huge. This place is the best dam restuarant in town.

I went yesterday and it was horrible! We got our food really late to top it off our food was cold! They took another 20 mins heating it up at this point we were done eating and we told them not to bother. The waitress had the nerve to say they took it off my bill. OBVIOUSLY!

Let me start by saying that the food was not the problem, it was actually good. The problem was the service. The bathroom was really dirty, no seat covers and was almost out of toilet paper, also there was napkins all over the floor. I decided to let one of the employees know, and instead of being thankful that it was even brought up to their attention she seemed really annoyed and dismissive. <br><br>The waitress was just ok, hardly saw her. Maybe it was because it was a busy night. Anyway the wait to be seated was also long. Been here before and this is the first time the service was this bad.

Food is delicious. I always order the pasta with chicken, peas, pancetta. The garlic pieces in the sauce are so good. I recommend the lemon raspberry cheesecake and banana cream cheesecake. Always a delight. <br>Service is always pleasant with the exception of the host/hostess. One host there walks around with a stank face like he doesn&#39;t want to work there anymore. That&#39;s fine, but don&#39;t take it out on the customers by not acknowledging guests when greeting or seating. <br>Prices are reasonable. This place is always busy, but the food won&#39;t disappoint.

We went here because my daughter wanted to celebrate her birthday.  She ordered pasta and the menu stated it came with basil.  When it was delivered it had pesto and we checked to see if nuts were used to make it because my daughter is allergic to nuts.  It was, so we sent it back.  We had waited a long time for the first dishes to be served but did not know why.  We waited for the corrected pasta for almost an hour and guess what .... it was delievered EXACTLY LIKE THE FIRST PLATE!!!  Since the manager could not do anything and the waitress was completely embarrassed, we realized that the kitchen staff do what they want, when they want, and with what they want.  So we decided to leave.  If i were the manager I would comp the whole dinner, but she just avoided coming to our table even though I asked to speak with here twice.  HORRIBLE SERVICE AND HORRIBLE MANAGEMENT!!!

This location has worst service the waitresses are under experienced and make the Cheesecake Factory experience not worth my trip to the Glendale spot...our waitress today was slow, and probably lied on her application.

In December 2014, to celebrate the holidays I made reservations for my coworkers and I for a table of 20 for 4:00. The date of the event, on 12/18/14, I receive a call from a staff member/management stating that my reservations will not be honored as I requested because the staff member who took my reservation was &#34;not authorized&#34; to do so. (??? How was I suppose to know that and why should their problem become mine?) Instead she insisted that all 20 of us show up by 3:30 or the tables will be given away. This was unreasonable because as teachers having to work with parents and preparing lessons, it is VERY difficult to decide last minute to leave work early, not to mention the obvious: the difficulty of getting 20 teachers to leave early the DAY OF -as this call was made to me 4 hours prior to the event time.... At this point, it was necessary for me to asked to speak to the manager above, on site. Needless to say, I was feeling panicky and thinking, &#34;I can&#39;t believe this happening! CHEESECAKE would do it??! What they are doing is wrong AND will all 20 of my coworkers have a seat?&#34; So I basically begged the manager to honor the reservation that was taken two weeks prior, FOR 4:00, and that 20 PEOPLE SIGNED UP to attend and are counting on the reservations. I was stern but remained respectful. He was not empathic. I told him I was very disappointed and yet he didn&#39;t seem to care. He would not honor the original 4:00 reservation. W-O-W.<br><br>I will NEVER make reservations again at CHEESECAKE FACTORY. <br><br>OUTCOME of the event: After being stress out and scrambling with my committee members, we spread the word to our coworkers and told them the situation and asked them to please arrive at 3:30, if possible.... Fast forward to 3:30: our tables were occupied and were NOT available for us UNTIL 4. (Interesting, I was threatened that we would lose our tables if we were not present by 3:30.) the good news is, we all got chairs so I was relieved at that point and decided for the evening I will enjoy and forget management and deal with the upset later. At the time it was easy to be happy because I had good company, the holidays were approaching and the servers were friendly and prompt. <br><br>I was debating to write this review, however the two staff members/managers of Cheesecake treated me wrong and I hope they will not do the same to others.

Super super ordinary American food. We waited one hour and a half for our table and it&#39;s not worth it. I don&#39;t understand why it&#39;s so popular. It&#39;s loud and packed, I can&#39;t find myself comfortable in that kind of place. With that number of customers don&#39;t expect any good quality service.

I just wanted to mention the service, It was my little sisters birthday and we were a party of 17. I walked in at 4:40 and asked when we can be seated and they said 20 minutes, and they did seat us at 5:05 to be exact, I was actually shocked I thought we would wait so much longer on a Friday. However, they were fast! our waitress Lauren was the best waitress that i have ever encountered coming to Cheesecake. <br><br>I&#39;ve had another big party here before and two servers served us but they didn&#39;t do a better job than Lauren, who took care of everything by herself. She was patient, and always came by to ask how we were. <br><br>The manager was nice and helpful too.<br><br>So the five stars is for the service. Thanks Lauren!! <br><br>* Since we were a big party gratitude was 18%*

I love the Cheesecake Factory so much. I go here every week. There are so many options and great service and great locations. My experience has always been amazing. I would give it 5 stars but unfortunately they took away from the menu my favorite dish, the Linguarian Pesto Pasta. Bring back PESTO PASTA!!! If they do I will give this place 5 stars.

Always filled with great customer service, to whichever Cheesecake Factory I go to. Never once have I been disappointed.<br>It&#39;s always funny to see how the waiters/waitresses ask if you need refills on drinks, but you don&#39;t want to waste because you know you won&#39;t be able to finish the whole thing, and so you tell them it&#39;s okay. And they double check and ask if we&#39;re sure. I think that&#39;s very  nice of them. :)<br><br>Great ambiance!

ambiance//*****<br>as my tip says, i HIGHLY recommend outside seating...particularly if you can get a view of the fountain and its show for a mini bellagio experience not to mention lovely cali weather<br>it&#39;s what makes this cheesecake special~<br><br>the indoors are much more typical set up of cheesecake...and sometimes stuffy as well<br><br>service//*****<br>oh my goodness! i would give 6 stars if i could because our server, TAMARA just about blew us away<br>~we had a LARGE party, 8 adults and 3 small children and she handled it like the pro!<br>~constantly checking on us, bringing things by, making suggestions based on preferences<br>~her timing was impeccable whether to offer refills or to take group photos<br>~ brought a lovely birthday cheesecake and entourage to sing for my niece<br>~ and the list GOES ON!~ very impressive and personable!~<br><br>food//****<br>calamari is always a safe bet! =9<br>gyoza is pretty standard<br><br>what impressed me about them is that even though we were a large party with varying orders, they were able to bring everything piping hot and served everyone within 5 minutes of each other<br><br>~*~<br>as far as cheesecakes goes, what sets this one apart was mostly tamara~ if you get her, you&#39;re in the hands of an expert!^^

I had a really terrible expierence at this location. I got to the place 2 hours early as directed to do so for a party of 30. They took close to 4 hours and kept &#34;accidentally&#34; seating people in the space they had reserved for us. The manager was incredibly rude and so was the hostess.
The food is pretty bad.  It used to be better.    But the quality has gone down recently.

food is good, but utensils are always so filthy. I always ask for plastic utensils due to the lack of cleanliness of their china. <br><br>Sometimes the food is cooked to perfection and sometimes the kitchen totally does the opposite. <br><br>overall food is good, just need to work on the cleanliness of the restaurant

Don&#39;t know where to start. this place became one of my favorite restaurants. food quality is excellent, extremely tasty food of all kinds. Very friendly waiters,and excellent service. its may be busiest restaurant around there, it means they&#39;re good. always very crowded. ill recommend this restaurant to everyone.

This is one of my husband and I&#39;s favorite date night restaurants. The service has always been excellent, and the food is always delicious. <br><br>We love sitting in the patio by the fountain, the outdoor music is fantastic at the Americana, and the ambiance is great too.  Plus, you get a water show every hour from the fountain! :)<br><br>all in all, i love this place.

I go to Cheesecake Factory once in a blue moon. It&#39;s just not my style. It&#39;s a major chain that&#39;s always packed and with an absurdly large menu.<br><br>With that being said, we did end up dining here last night to use up a gift card. We waited about 10mins or so before being escorted to our table. It&#39;s a huge place - my husband said it best regarding the decoration: &#34;It&#39;s opulent but without being classy.&#34; So true! It&#39;s almost Vegas level, but even Vegas seems a little more unique.<br><br>We were taken care of by our friendly - probably a model on the side - waitress. We started with a MARGARITA and RED SANGRIA which were both really good. The sangria was mine and I enjoyed the hint of cinnamon in each sip.<br><br>We started our meal off with SWEET CORN FRITTERS. These came from the Small Plates &amp; Snacks section and I was surprised to receive 6 decent sized fritters that came with a nice spicy aioli. Quoting my husband again (who btw has his own yelp account - hmph!): &#34;These fritters would make a smaller restaurant famous!&#34; So true again! Crispy, savory and sweet. Excuse the drool.<br><br>Onto the entrees. Husband ordered the CHICKEN BELLAGIO - well-portioned and flavorful (especially the basil pasta). I had the GRILLED SHRIMP &amp; BACON CLUB - along with shredded lettuce and a cream sauce, the grilled shrimp and bacon were great, though I was intimidated by the size of this sandwich since they stick another slice of toast in between the 2 proteins! It was a bit much, but still good.<br><br>We were stuffed but decided to take home a couple of cheesecake slices - I got CLASSIC KEY LIME and he got the HERSHEY&#39;S CHOCOLATE BAR (0.25cents is donated to Feeding America). My key lime was yummy, but a little on the too-tart side. The Hershey&#39;s was just pure decadence. Both were impossible to eat in one sitting.<br><br>So though we wouldn&#39;t usually frequent a place like CF, we didn&#39;t have a bad time.

The fried macaroni &amp; cheese was cold. The cheesecake with strawberries was frozen. Our bill came to $94.94 before tip and was totally not worth it. I have never had bad food at any other Cheesecake Factory Restaurants - what a bummer. The only plus was the waiter. Ended up deathly sick all night. I found out that my daughter also got sick

+1 on the slowness and cleanliness @ this place. They had dirty glasses(2 of them) so had to request new ones. Waiter was a total jerk when we wanted to know where our drinks were as if he was doing us a favor. 20 minutes, more water comes in. Waited for 40 minutes to get 2 beers and a Tropical drink and an hour and 15 to get appetizers (Nachos) which were disgusting! The worst part honestly is the fact that it was a party of 4 and all 4 of us were sick the next day - All different dishes. Do yourself a favor and skip this place...

We were told it was a 30min wait but only waited 10min. Waitress was very nice. I had the Louisiana Chicken pasta... very good if you&#39;re craving semi spicy pasta. The chicken is breaded ane very good too. I also had an oreo cheesecake to go... yum!

What a beautiful space!  The decor and lighting in there are fantastic.  Very loud, but I like that.  It&#39;s lively, it&#39;s bustling.  Been here quite a few times and always enjoyed whatever I ordered - guess that&#39;s mostly why it&#39;s so hard to decide - everything is good.<br><br>The visit started out sadly, as I was starving, and there was a 40 min wait.  So we got our buzzy thing, and hit The Americana.  Good thing we didn&#39;t go far - we were buzzed in 10 mins!!  Oh sweet........<br><br>Tried a new menu item the other night - chile relleno burger.  Our waiter was honest and said it was &#34;different&#34; but that he like it well enough.  Sold.  I like different.  Oh yeah!  There was even crispiness to the relleno, and the flavor of the meat is great!  I saved half for the next day and it heated up just fine and I again got to enjoy it.  The waiter we had - Jason I think, was excellent.  He was never far away - and was nice, funny, and efficient.  <br><br>One complaint - the Ultimate Marg, which is not priced on the menu, but is $12 !!!!  - was good, but definitely not large, but was thankfully strong - two types of tequila, two types of orange liqueur. Mmmm....

Cheesecake Factory has never failed me. This one is in a great location at the Sherman Oaks Galleria. The first of is always great they give you enough to eat for the next thing which isn&#39;t a bad thing, there is a wait the later that you come and on the weekend but that just shows how great there food is. The staff is nice and always polite.

Very rude servers. I waited 85 minutes to get a fork as my fork was dirty. We were still working on our plates when the server left the bill on our table with attitude. I felt so embarrassed as I had guests from overseas. Very slow service. Very small portions compare to other Cheese Cake Factories.

Had an encounter with a real sweet and awesome manager I believe her name was Sara our meal was not what was expected and she very sweetly exchanged our dish for    The correct one which was awesome since we had encountered a lengthy wait and it was awesome to be taken care of.

I really don&#39;t understand why people wait for hours for this restaurant. Every time I try to dine here, the food is either flavored wrong, has too much flavoring, or just flat out tastes nasty. The only two things I&#39;ll order at this restaurant are the Fried Macaroni Balls and the Renee&#39;s Special. I went to this location with my boyfriend for lunch today and of course, I ordered the Fried Mac, the Renee&#39;s Special, and my boyfriend ordered the Bacon and Shrimp something Sandwich. We asked the waitress if she&#39;s ever had it and she said no. She also told us that a lot of people order it, so we automatically thought it would be good. She ALSO told us it&#39;s a pretty big sandwich, so I cancelled my Renee&#39;s Special so we could just half the bacon and shrimp thing. HORRIBILE IDEA! Let&#39;s review this disgusting sandwich real quick:<br><br>1. It&#39;s about 3 stories high ... it goes from toast, lettuce, tomato, bacon, toast, more lettuce, then 4-5 small pieces of overcooked, disgusting, &#34;grilled&#34; shrimp, in some nasty sauce that should be in a nasty coleslaw. <br>2. I gave that ugly thing a chance... I ate it. wanted to puke each time. <br>3. That thing was $13-$14 bucks with BURNT bacon ... and smart&amp;final shrimp... WTF <br>4. The best thing about that sandwich was the buttery toast, and the tomatoes. <br><br>Service was alright. She didn&#39;t ask if our meal was ok. The passion iced tea we had tasted like nasty lipstick...and the Manager walked by, mumbled something to us, and before we got the chance to answer, he walked away... Whatevs....Cheesecake Factory will, and always suck. <br><br>P.S. why in the world are there a million advertisements in their menus? As if they don&#39;t have enough money? <br><br>I&#39;d rather spend my money at a taco truck...That sandwich could have bought me a carne asada burrito, 4 tacos, and a quesadilla....

Food was great  <br>The service is great  actually while I had lunch there was a really rude lady made a scene aright next to my table bc they accidentally didn&#39;t have the table ready and yelled at one of the hostess. The lady was verryyyy rude and I have to say that the hostess acted so professional and apologized and acted so professional... I left pretty upset even though I had a great experience.<br>Simply bc people don&#39;t need to be rude and if they&#39;re that picky they should take their attitude/rudeness somewhere else . They are walking into a busy restaurant  it&#39;s not the end of the world .

I&#39;m going here very often. Love the good the service and location. If you have to bring done guest in here or have dinner with your loved one. Try it out. My favoring dish is chicken Romano and chicken Madera. Not to talk about cheesecakes. They are the best!!!
I got food poisoning last night from the lemon garlic shrimp pasta. My friend are the ahi tuna and got diarrhea. I&#39;m not coming here anymore. Stay away from seafood.

Man....the host counter sucked! They made table promise times of 10-15min outside; 55min inside! We actually sat down (after 40mins) outside, while it seemed that other parties of 2 were seated ahead of us with NO wait....wow! Manager/Management of Glendale is tremendously awful! Vanessa our waitress was a doll.....happy &amp; cheerful! It&#39;s lucky you have SOME very dedicated help!
I would like to say that this cheesecake is fast friendly and very on it the food is always great Courtney was my server she had great service and always came to check up on us ty!!
I just remembered why I stopped coming here years ago. Hour and half wait for garbage, overcooked frozen food and even worse service.

It&#39;s nice to know that they finally have the texting system where they will just text you once your table reservation is ready. We waited about 40 minutes on a Thursday night, which I thought wasn&#39;t pretty bad. Once we were called, we had to wait another few minutes for them to clean the table for us. As for the atmosphere of Cheesecake Factory, I&#39;ve always loved the warm feeling of the restaurant with its dim lights and candle lit. Unlimited breads were so addicting (got full before I got my order -_-) I always loved the brown bread, yum. I ordered Chicken Bellagio ($14.50), and it was very delicious. Its portion is huge and the quality is above standard! Crispy chicken breast topped with prosciutto and arugula salad with parmesan cream sauce over basil pasta. It&#39;s a big portion that I didn&#39;t even finish the pasta ;/ Cousins got two different kind of pasta, and I am not really a fan for their pasta specialties. However the Wild Mushroom burger ($11.95) was delicious. You can taste the sautéed mushroom covered with swiss and fontina cheese, ugh yummy! Service wasn&#39;t much of a problem: Sister and the cousins thought that our server was pretty hot, so they managed to handle the tip. Uh yeah, their thirst is reaaaal, haha.

I really really really enjoy their Shrimp &amp; Chicken Gumbo.  Spicy and creamy... always served HOT, lots of sauce... Jumbo shrimps... tender juicy chicken. I am always down for this dish.  Never disappointed.  Oh, never ever order the linguini jambalaya, gross!! <br><br>My boyfriend was starving.. you know how guys are, big portions matter at this point.<br>I like the option that we can sit at the bar without reservation, otherwise we would be waiting 30 mins

Cheesecake Factory never disappoints! Then why 3 stars you say....<br><br>Well..every entree i have is always so amazing, from the pork chops to meatloaf to the fish. The size is always enough to fill me and im a fatty! ha!<br><br>SOOOOOO why the 3 stars...its because everytime I get cheesecake to go..the slice is small and the toppings are skimp.Which sucks cause Im easy to please and love cheesecake!<br><br>I&#39;ll be back for the food...but many diners have better cheesecake.....

I&#39;m a huge fan of cheesecake factory. love their service and their food. specially the Louisiana chicken pasta / try it i&#39;m sure you would love this food (but make sure the food is hot before eating it :P ) lol

The Cheesecake Factory is a chain restaurant...you can&#39;t possibly come here for reviews on the food. It&#39;s the same great food you&#39;d get from any of the Cheesecake Factory restaurant...if however you&#39;re reading this review to gain a better understanding of the service you&#39;d receive at this particular one, look no further. This is the worst Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been to. The grove is far superior. The waiters generally don&#39;t make it a point to fill your water throughout the meal...is it just me or should water not be on my mind during my dinner?!? They make me feel like I&#39;m in a drought in some dessert and I have to ration my water out. The last time I went, I asked my server for a side of lemons and she literally brought me three lemons on a makeshift skewer she created out of those sticks they put olives on in Martinis....really? Look MacGyver, stop being lazy and grab a bowl or a cup!! She literally came to my table holding out a skewer of lemons and said to me &#34;you can grab the other side&#34; huh?!?!? Why don&#39;t you squeeze the lemon juice out for me since you&#39;re fingers have already familiarized themselves with the lemons while you were building a raft for them to ride to my dinner plate on.
Horrible service they never tell you how long do you have to wait you can&#39;t get my business with lying to me. Such disappointment for the cheesecake factory name.
Good place and good food. It&#39;s a bit crowded though but that&#39;s alright.

4.5 for the Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>I&#39;ve never had a main dish here, just appetizers. The avocado egg rolls and the chicken samosas are a must- have for sure. The last time I went I got the taquitos too, and those are pretty good. The cheesecake....need I say more? Its delicious and decadent. I&#39;ve had the chocolate raspberry and the chocolate tuxedo UGH to die for!!!<br><br>I am always seated quickly and served promptly, but both times I&#39;ve been to the Cheesecake Factory, the waiters/waitresses have changed during the meal. Also, the bathrooms are really clean.

If I could give this place zero stars I would... recently, I&#39;ve gone twice. The first time, service was horrible and I ordered a Cobb salad and found a plastic twist used to seal the plastic bag in which the bread is packaged in my salad. Second time going takes the cake. Never have I been treated so badly in my life. Was gonna order the steak tacos but wanted to substitute the steak for shrimp, and a Jamaican black pepper chicken and shrimp with extra protein. Not only did the waiter and the manager wanted to charge me the plate full price + the extra shrimp, he wanted to also charge me for a full pound of shrimp added to the Jamaican (one pound of shrimp is never gonna be served in a restaurant). I understand being charged extra for shrimp but I&#39;m not gonna pay for the steak that I&#39;m not going to eat. Then both the waiter and manager promptly proceeded to throw the prices in my face &#34;it&#39;s gonna be this much, can you pay?&#34; Cheesecake Factory is not a high end restaurant, it&#39;s a chain, it&#39;s preposterous to charge $30 for a plate. Not even high end restaurants charge $30 for a pasta with lobster. Now I wonder if I wasn&#39;t Latino would I still get treated like that.

I was traveling from Northern California and stopped by the Cheesecake Factory to enjoy a meal with my family.  It seemed the waiter josh and manager tried to get us out of our seats.  I would not recommend the cheesecake  factory in Glendale at all.  The staff was rude.   The cashew  chicken  cold and tasteless.  Ice cream was warm and melted.   The manger almost kicked us out while we were talking.  Do not go McDonald&#39;s has better service and ice cream
Had a Cosmo - ehhh not good at all. If your use to having Cosmo this is not the place for it.
Food is usually pretty good and service too. You can pretty much come here anytime u r craving anything, the menu is so extensive.

This review is a little overdue, but I&#39;m finally writing this now! I don&#39;t have too much to say about this place because it&#39;s really no different from the other locations I&#39;ve been to.  The service, food, and service (from my experience) has been pretty much on point with the other and haven&#39;t had a horrible experience yet.<br><br>My table wasn&#39;t up for a large meal, so we just opted for the appetizers and small plates.  This is definitely the way to go if you&#39;re not in the mood to eat a lot nor drop $20 for an entrée.  I ordered the Ahi Tuna Tartare, and it was delicious; however, they put way too much ginger in it, that it was more that than tuna.  I would ask they be more generous with the tuna, since you are paying for it and should get the most out of it.

Im going to start with the one negative i saw: sanitation. The utensils were not clean and the replacements were not clean either. Over all i love the atmosphere and the food. i live their burgers and pasta dishes. As the name goes, try their cheesecakes, those are amazing!

Really pissed off. I talked to the waiter &#34;Pete&#34; &#34;Peter&#34;. Something like that. I gave me an advance tip because it was my sister and dads birthday. I didn&#39;t want anything extra but to have a good dinner with the family and everything go smooth. The service was bad. In never got my food. He came and apologized, blamed it on the chef that he has been doing this all day. Blaming him that he has been missing plates and not finishing the orders right. The rest of the family ate. My dad just watched me sit there wait for my food. My mom offered me food and so did my girlfriend. It was awkward. They were just about done when I got my plate. Super hot, i took it home because f**k, I paid for the whole dinner. He took that plate off the bill.. that&#39;s ridiculous. What kind of service is this.. we pay for the food and service and it was crappy. I won&#39;t be going to this location anymore and I hope you don&#39;t get that waiter. Very disappointed.

The service here is horrible. The host tried seating us at a couple of tables that were not set up. The server took a long time to greet us and to bring our check. <br><br>The food also was not good at this location. The bread and entrees took awhile to come out, were not fresh and didn&#39;t even come out that hot.

This place is reliable. The food is always consistent. My boyfriend and I love sitting on the patio at the americana and people watch. I recently had their farmer chicken salad, I think that&#39;s what it&#39;s called. Anyway it was delicious! <br>All the pastas are great! Service is good. Not great but good. Our servers seem to forget stuff we ask for. But it&#39;s ok because the food is amazing. We both love cheesecake but tried the carrot cake last time. It was heaven.
Always good and fresh, and always line here:)) but it&#39;s ok :)) food is delicious and cheesecake!!! Yami, my favorite is tiramisu :))

Long lines, followed by kids in tantrum mode I&#39;m sure it&#39;s because the hour plus wait time. By the time we were seated and were served 2.5 hrs  was too hungry to notice that my bang bang chicken was missing shrimp. ugh well should checked this place out before going. Overall way way too long of a wait. skip!

The food and service is good but the wait is ridiculous. Only reason we came was to see the Christmas tree lighting and we were hungry. We had to wait 2 hours for a table. If it wasn&#39;t for how hungry we were we<br>Would&#39;ve never waited. I got the carpaccio and the fries so good. The waitress was super helpful and nice. Overall good place to eat if ur dressed casual and are hungry.
Food is delicious; especially the cheesecakes.  But the service is poor and slow.<br><br>No one approached our table till about 20 minutes after we were seated and it wasn&#39;t even a busy day.

Our service is always good, but it&#39;s also always loud. Even when it&#39;s not full it&#39;s like eating at Dodger&#39;s Stadium volume. Good food, good service, but not a place to go if you want a quiet relaxing lunch/dinner. Tip: order 1 cheesecake slice to share for two to three people as they are quite large.

I&#39;ve been to this place at least 10 times, and I never know what to get/what I&#39;ll like. The place seats large parties, which makes it convenient to go to, but I&#39;ve never had an amazing experience while there. I&#39;ve tried various things on the menu, and there has been nothing I&#39;ve loved. The food is average and is definitely not worth the price you pay, it is absolutely overpriced. Customer service is meh, it honestly depends on the waiter/tress you get. Sometimes they&#39;re extremely friendly and helpful, other times, well... All in all, this place is OK, could do a lot better.

This location has bad customer service. We have gone multiple times and each time the waiters hardly checked on our table. Tonight we went in for a cheesecake to go. They were not busy and after waiting 20 minutes at the counter we asked where are cheesecake was. The lady had it there behind the counter the whole time but didn&#39;t let us know it was ready and was rude when we asked for it.  Won&#39;t be going back.

This is the second time to this location, and I&#39;ve been to A LOT of Cheesecake Factory&#39;s, in California and other states... This is by far the worst service out of every single one of them! Seated fairly quickly and we were a party of 5...then the wait begins. We wait, and wait....and a waitress comes by to greet us and take drink orders. 4 waters and a Diet Coke takes 20 minutes to come back to us, and the waitress tells us she&#39;s handing us off to a colleague. That&#39;s fine, we&#39;d just like to order food please. He tells us he&#39;ll be &#34;right&#34; back. We shouldn&#39;t have let him leave. He returns another 15 minutes later to take our food order. Mind you, a few managers have shown up on the floor to start directing patrons to tables and put out fires between servers. I don&#39;t know what was going on, but it seemed extra chaotic and somewhat unprofessional being that we were watching these conversations unfold before us. <br>Food comes out half an hour later, no joke, and with apologies from the server and the manager who accompanied him to our table. We ate very fast as we had limited shopping time and didn&#39;t think this ordeal would take so long. <br>Asked for boxes to pack up what we couldn&#39;t eat and our waiter offered to do it for us. We politely declined since we assumed that would take another 30 minutes. Almost...we had to wait another 15 minutes for our boxes and the check.<br>Love Cheesecake Factory, but won&#39;t be coming back here anytime soon. Our first visit to this location wasn&#39;t exactly stellar, this second visit solidified the fact that sentiment.

We went in with a groups for a friends birthday an many of the people we went with have never been to this restaurant. Once we had to pay we asked the waiter, Josh , if he would split the check for us and he replied &#34; ill split it just make sure you give me my tip&#34; ....we were so shocked and thought that was so rude, we were obviously going to leave a hefty tip because we were a group but with that attitude he defiantly shouldn&#39;t have left one. IF next time we go ill make sure not have him as our waiter.

I Have been to many Cheesecake factory restaurants but this one gets the gold medal for having the worst front desk/host person ever! Andrew was rude and had no respect when he talked to me. First he told us - my family and I that the wait was 15 to 20 minutes. We waited 50mins. Andrew needs to know that when you are the face of the house, you as a host, must be pleasant, polite and nice to the restaurant customers and not ARROGANT!!! No matter what the situation is. Unfortunately, Andrew chose to have a bad attitute towards costumers that will no longer feel comfortable going to The Cheesecake Factory restaurants. It was a very disappointing situation!

I hope I don&#39;t sound cheesy saying I like the Cheesecake Factory.  This was my favorite restaurants years ago.  Though they have good food, and give gigantic portions of it, I&#39;ve learned to discipline myself in terms of food intake.  Guilty pleasures can get the best of us and, thank God, I haven&#39;t been guilty in a long time until recently.  My good buddy Miguel V, who is also a Yelper, and I decided to dine at the Cheesecake Factory, as we were both hungry and knew this place would satisfy our hunger.<br><br>This location in Glendale always seems to be crowded.  To our surprise, we were seated in less than 30 minutes.  The vibe in this restaurant is mostly young and fun.  However, it&#39;s hard to have fun on an empty stomach, so we started to place our orders immediately.  Miguel started by ordering a Stone IPA (Indian Pale Ale), which is a drink I&#39;d never heard of.  I ordered a Strawberry Lemonade.  In terms of food, Miguel opted for the Shrimp and Chicken Gumbo, which consists of shrimp, chicken, andouille sausage, tomatoes, peppers, onions, and garlic in a spicy cajun broth with steamed rice in the center.  All I can say is the food looked delicious when I saw it brought to the table, as it was totally devoured shortly after being placed on the table.  As for my order, I opted for the Spicy Cashew Chicken, which is spicy fried chicken with green onions and roasted cashews that&#39;s served on a bed of rice.  The spicy flavor of the chicken was guiltily pleasing to my palate, as it&#39;s been over a year since I&#39;ve had this dish.  Our meals were satisfying, plentiful, and affordable, as each dish was less than $20.<br><br>All in all, everyone can find something satisfying on the menu at the Cheesecake Factory.  Our server was friendly, the service was good and, again, the food was good.  Given the big portions of food, we couldn&#39;t fathom the idea of getting dessert.  The desserts alone can easily be a meal, as they&#39;re served in big portions too!  We enjoyed our visit to this Cheesecake Factory!   <br><br>*3.5 Stars

I used to love this place but I&#39;ll probably never come back. Shrimp scampi was so bad, each battered and fried shrimp still had the shell completely on, even my husbands was the same. I&#39;ve never had a battered shrimp that still had the shell. The sauce was sour like sour milk absolutely horrible. Also dirty silverware and a dirty table. The most pleasant part of our visit was the service. Other than that this place is to expensive to be lacking so severely.

I only have 2 stars cause my food was good. But  the service deserves no stars worst ever come here 1 month ago  and I had to get up and go ask for a waiter, came here tonight and once again service  is horrible, ide say don&#39;t come here unless you want to wait  almost two hours for food and not have any service.
I was in cheese cake factory in Americana in Glendale awesome customer service provided by Gilbert ... Best banana cream cheese cake ever..., suggested by him ....highly recommended

This was Hubs and I go-to for date night for a while. <br><br>I love that I have been there literally dozens of times and can still find new things to order. The service is great and the cheesecake is even better. There are tons of selections and options. <br><br>My Favorite is the Pumpkin Cheesecake that comes out around October! To-die-for! <br><br>The one time we had a poor experience we spoke to the manager and got a full refund for our meal. <br><br>Downsides - The wait is usually pretty long. Very noisy. Super expensive kids menu and sometimes the service can run pretty slow. <br><br>TIP if it is just you or 2 people check the bar area for an open seat or 2. All the tall tables and the bar are self seating.

Great food great bartenders fast service at bar for breakfast but my three star rate is for the ridiculous kids sitting at bar thing WTF ? when we go to have a great brunch early in the morning and spend well over a hundred bucks on drinks and food for 2 hrs it is very clean great atmosphere and then all the sudden people start bringing their screaming ill-behaved kids to sit at bar they kick the foot panel they cry they scream etc and the parents just set there in a daze not hardly spending a dime on food or drinks and most of the time they are just using the establishment for a place to sit while waiting for a movie at the theatre I&#39;m fed up with it and we no longer will go here every week. yes I know cheesecake factory had a permit for this but it is stupid as hell

The only positive experience I had here was that we did not have to wait for a table. Our waitress took forever to bring our drinks. We saw her chit chatting with other waiters and never payed any attention to our table. Additionally, I had to ask for some bread which is a first for me since usually it arrives without a request. I guess she forgot since she was too &#34;busy&#34; walking around chatting with her co workers. After some time, she came by with another waiter saying that the gentlemen would take over for her. The guy was really nice but he never came by for a drink refill which was very disappointing. Over all, the service at this location is very terrible. My advise is to go to the one in The Grove.

I love this place... Went to celebrate a,bday Saturday night..the,wait was an hour ...but here&#39;s the great part... Took my number down and text me when our table,was ready!!.. Love that... Bcuz,we,went to hang out at the place...shops... Lots of people... Love the,setting...love the,atmosphere... The,customer service ...how clean it is...and the food..  Love the food,... Definitely recommend this place for a,nice date family time or just hanging with the friends.

Went for lunch with colleagues.<br>1.waited to be seated<br>2. waited 45+ min for food<br>3. table and cutlery were dirty - sent forks away, they cleaned the table and brought the same dirty forks back. (gross)<br>4. When food finally came, we had to leave to get back to work, so they boxed it up.<br>5. got back to the office and one order was wrong, one salad had no dressing provided, and there were no napkins or cutlery provided.<br>6. Almost $60 for 3 sandwiches and iced teas.<br>7. Sandwiches were adequate at best.<br>8. Will never do that again.
Their Fettuccine Alfredo is very watery and strawberry smoothie is watered down, more of an icee than a smoothie
Love everything on their menu..some of favs are chicken samosas, spicy chipotle chicken pasta, chicken jambalaya, mango key lime cheesecake, hersheys chocolate cheesecake, godiva brownie sundae

I have honestly never had a bad Cheesecake Factory experience.  The food is always great, the portions ample and the service can&#39;t be matched.<br>I went with a couple of friends yesterday and we got a table right away.  The host was super cool.  Our waitress was prompt and lovely and took care of our every need.<br>My friend had the CHARGRILLED COULOTTE STEAK cooked medium.  The temperature was perfect and it was melt-in-your-mouth good.  My other friend and I both had pastas, which were also very good.<br>Overall, it was a lovely lunch and, provided I don&#39;t have to wait long, I will be back.

I don&#39;t understand why the workers here are so rude. I think the only reason this place is doing well is because of the location. It is very beautiful to sit outside and look at the fountain and the food is OK but they really need to hire new people. Waiters are very unwelcoming and are tired and cranky all the time.
Long wait and had to yell at the manager for forgetting about us. The food was good and the server was on point. You must be very patient due to the location.

My bf really wanted to take me here for Valentine&#39;s Day, so we went. We were told our wait would be 1 1/2 hours, which seems horrible, but they were able to seat us within 40 mins. We were seated outside &amp; 30 seconds after we take a seat a waitress comes around to our table with a tray full of drinks &amp; gives us the weirdest look. She stood there for 5-7 secs &amp; just left without saying anything. She than comes back &amp; asks us what we want to drink without introducing herself at all (which I don&#39;t mind, but it&#39;s polite). She leaves, brings us our drinks &amp; bread &amp; never came back at all. Since we were sitting outside I was freezing. They do have the heaters, but the wind was blowing the heat the opposite direction from us. We waited for our food out there for a LONG time. This whole time our waitress did not stop at our table once. Finally, our food came but was brought to us by a different waiter, even though our own waitress was still on her shift. I felt incredibly bad asking this, but asked him if it would be possible to move inside because we&#39;re freezing &amp; it was uncomfortable. He went to check the wait time &amp; came back &amp; told us it would be about 15 mins. He than tells our waitress our situation. Apparently she shrugged it off, as she still had not been at our table and we even have our food now! Right before a DIFFERENT waitress came to get us so we can move inside, our waitress comes to the table and just asks &#34;are you guys ordering dessert?&#34;. We said yes, &amp; she just walked away inside without saying anything. Right as we were seated inside, we had a WONDERFUL waiter who got us situated &amp; replaced our drinks for us. For the remaining time we were there inside this place, this guy filled up our drinks 4 times, was super attentive, bagged our food for us, brought our dessert within 5 mins of ordering it, and made sure we were just taken care of. I wish I remembered his name. We&#39;re not difficult people to serve at all, but there a certain standard servers should have when it comes to their guests. I&#39;m honestly glad I asked to move inside, &amp; even though our service for the first half here was horrible, I would come here again because our service inside was amazing.
Jason is an amazing waiter!! Definitely request him. He gave great advice on what to get for desert and has such a welcoming personality.

Chicken Louisiana Pasta my favorite. You also can&#39;t go wrong with the Hibachi steak w/ asparagus, mash potatoes, and a great sauce to go with it. The whole wheat bread is to die for. One of the best complimentary breads served out there haven&#39;t anything better than the one here at Cheesecake. Come here for brunch with my wife very often. Great pastas and a variety of very delicious salads.
My friend and I came in for a drink before our movie started.  I ordered the blueberry mojito and it was so refreshing and so yummy!  Too bad we had to go.  Staff was great!  Thanks!
