I want to rate this at least a four, because the food is good.  Not $$$$ fine-dining good, but well, for what it is, it&#39;s good.  Oh, and so is the bread.  But, the wait.  That dreaded wait.  It almost makes me want to bring it down to two-stars, but it was Mother&#39;s Day after all, and NO WHERE except their FRONT DOOR did it say that they would take reservations, the DAY OF, AT 9AM.  So since I don&#39;t sit outside this establishment every single day, I was not aware.<br><br>Moving forward.  J &amp; C get there first, and are told the wait will be 1 - 1.5hrs.  Okay, that&#39;s fine.  We&#39;re just pulling in to the jam-packed parking lot, and it&#39;ll take us maybe 20 minutes to find parking anyway.  Fast forward after taking some strolls, a little window shopping, and a quick nibble on something, the boys check in on our wait.  Well, despite the fact that we&#39;ve been waiting an hour and fifteen minutes, the boys come back and tell us that we&#39;ll be waiting another hour and a half.  Wait, wahhhhhhh?  2.5 hours?  For D&#39;s mom to order chicken alfredo?  No.  Not happening.<br><br>Well, we didn&#39;t end up waiting that dreaded extra hour and a half.  We were sat outside and repeatedly asked to have the heater turned on, the staff just kept on saying he would until finally we overheard him ask someone else how to do it because HE DIDN&#39;T KNOW HOW.  Why wouldn&#39;t you just say so?  Well, bottom line, we&#39;ll never return on a holiday.  D&#39;s mom just REALLY had to try it here, and hopefully we shall never return for such a dull experience.<br><br>Overall:  on a non-holiday:  parking is easy &amp; validated, staff is friendly, food is alright and you get sprayed by the fountain if you sit outside.

We went here yesterday for no reason just like why not and I gotta say the cheesecake was so good but thats for the end. The food here was price nice not to much not to little, for what we got it was a lot so if your not hungry don&#39;t come here big man big so much food I didn&#39;t even finish my stuff, it tasted OK not too good it was like stuff you make at home which isn&#39;t bad but not that good either. The waiter and people there where great man thats one of the reasons this place gets a 4. Last but not least I guess the cheese cake , it tasted great so good like I want more but the size of that was not like the size of the food it was mini and expensive, I remember not to long ago they used to have cheese cakes  the size of my head.

Went to CF on 3-18-2017 for dinner.  Busy as usual.  When the hostess took us to our table it was not ready and very dirty.  They cleaned the table but did not wipe down the seating area.  I sat down on some type of oily bread crumb and it stained my Theory shorts.   The stain will not come out, I should have stayed home....
I love the Cheesecake Factory! Be ready to wait up to an hour for a text message letting you know your table is ready..

Cheese Cake Factory is one of those restaurant chains I don&#39;t want to like.<br>It&#39;s always packed, the portions are enormous,  which are usually a turn off.<br>However, we were invited to join friends and honestly, aside from it being packed,<br>loud and Über family friendly, it was a good experience.   Our service was great.  I&#39;m always impressed when a server can take an order for 4 with requests, and not write it down.... everything thing came with all the specifics.  Amazing.  <br>The food was very good. I had the Ahi salad, dressing on the side, my honey had the burger, deliciousness with a grilled onion.  We unwittingly are able to save room for cheese cake.  Our piggy selves ordered 3 and shared and took the rest home.<br>Red Velvet,  just because we had too.... Enjoyable.  Classic Cheese Cake- really great.   Key Lime, nice and tart.      I can see why it&#39;s packed.  The food was good.<br>Servers were great, whatever screening/training they do, bravo!    <br><br>Note to Cheesecake Factory:<br> I think it would be AWESOME if  a cheese cake sampler plate was added.   <br>small bites so diners could have a taste of several varieties.  Maybe offer a selection of 4 that are about the size of a mini muffin or cup cake.  Diners would pay the same price for less cheese cake for the variety of having a small bite of several items.    <br>The sampler plate could have the classic original cheese as a staple, then rotate the specials on a monthly basis.  This would keep people intrigued and could be a hot seller..... not that you need any more business.  Well done!

Disappointing to say the least.   Should have known better than to pick this for my birthday lunch. But was hopeful for a good selection/ salad nearby. Mistake. Our waitresses were not attentive at all. She said she would bring bread while we selected our dishes. We waited. We reminded. She gave us some excuse about it being baked fresh and went over to chat with Jennifer B, another waitress. They gabbed, they bitched loudly about some customer, they checked their phones and receipts. After asking again, we finally got our soggy, cold bread after we got our meal. No apologies. No fresh baked bread. Our waitress never returned. No explanation that she went on break or wherever. We were just suddenly served by Jennifer B who gave us minimal attention.  Staff, Omar, was the only saving grace. He was kind, attentive when asked for something (mustard) and worked feverishly. Jennifer finally brought mustard but well after Omar had and after I had to flag her down. Ridiculous.  If I could tip Omar, over the waitresses, I would have. The food was mediocre at best. Tasteless, bland, yellow lettuce. Sad experience in service and food.

Saturday a friend was heading to Glendale on a shopping quest and bribed me to go by offering to buy lunch.  Free food?   Sure, where&#39;s my seatbelt?  <br> <br>So we schlep up to Glendale, hit the store and only find half of what he was looking for.   Now with a partial quest in the can, we hit Cheesecake Factory for some grub.<br> <br>It was a beautiful day so the outdoor seating was calling to us and who am I to argue?<br> <br>THE FOOD:  I order the soup of the day, a cream of chicken that is surprisingly very good.   Great flavor, nice diced veggies, chicken, etc.    I also order the Cobb Salad and I have say the salad was VERY good!<br> <br>My friend had the same soup and the Bang Bang Chicken &amp; Shrimp.   He let me have some and... I would definitely order this, it was very good!<br> <br>As much as I normally pursue cheesecake, I usually bypass it here.   They do have good cheesecake, but just give me the normal, plain cheesecake thank you.   You can keep all your cookie chunks, coffee or fruity swirls and 17 other flavors in the first bite.<br> <br>THE SERVICE:  We were seated pretty quickly and our server was very friendly and an absolute hoot!   However she didn&#39;t come by often enough as I had to ask another server for a beverage refill.<br><br>Yes Cheesecake Factory is a big nation wide chain.   I&#39;ve been to a handful of other locations and have enjoyed the food and rarely have complaints.   For some reason this one seemed to be a notch above the others... or maybe it&#39;s just me.

It took a very long time for the waiter to stop by our table. We asked for the wheat bread and he brought the other one. We ordered and 2 minutes later they changed the waiter (which was actually a good thing) and when our food came, we asked for THREE different waiters to bring an extra plate and parmesan cheese and it took them around 10 minutes to bring. The food tasted like old pasta that was heated in the microwave and there were around 6 waiters just hanging out in the patio area while many tables were pissed off waiting for someone to take their order. Our second waiter was nice but he was super overwhelmed, they are certainly needing more waiters and improve their food....And...the outside table had flies coming to our food.

T&#39;was  James (my grandson) 2nd birthday.  Had dinner with my family, wait was not bad, in 5 minutes we were seated.  We were given all the accomodations for the kids (high chair, coloring paper, etc.).  I had Hibachi Steak (medium well) it was done perfect and the salad was yummy. The server was very nice and everything we requested was with fast service.<br>My second time and it is worth it.

Usually I love this place but tonight was just horrible. Food was fine but the waiter&#39;s  (Izeem) service skills were terrible. I would understand if it was a busy hour but it was slow. I had to flag him down to get service, he didn&#39;t seem to want to serve us and when he came to give me the check he stood over my shoulder to see if I was going to tip. Usually I do but I wrote on the receipt, &#34;service was unacceptable!&#34; Right in front of him. This shouldn&#39;t reflect how great the Cheesecake Factory is most of the time but this is something that made me not want to go back
All i can say is YUMMMM!!! Cheesecake Factory is my absolute favorite place to dine out. Food is amazing with the best prices. Exceeds my limits :)

Loved it when the baker knew my drink and my wife&#39;s there was Zara , Maryanne and Daniel and Sonia  and Sebastian and Albert those are the only names I remembered then the servers there are amazing as well I would come in in the morning and they already had my table ready and my favorite servers as well Brandon and Myra,Damearis, Robert and they always new what drinks and entree I wanted. The tale out service is good too unless you get the full of attitude Nora I asked for extra napkins and she gave me a smirk and made some sarcastic joke about me (I couldn&#39;t understand her) but other than that it&#39;s amazing here I have spoken to the general manager Rock and he is so nice

Went here cuz they have outside seating and it was a nice day.  Hostess was little clueless and wouldn&#39;t seat us at the empty tables outside cuz she said the section was closed. <br><br>I asked for a manager, told him we&#39;d like to sit outside and he immediately sat us outside and got us a waiter. <br><br>Hostess needs work, but the manager knows how to treat customers, and that is like a guest that you want to make happy. <br><br>THunbs up for the manager!

I gave this location 5 stars because they have outside seating by the courtyard that has a fantastic water show, and our server Grant was amazing. We got in quick, and got our food quick. We got a Caesar salad which was delicious, the potato soup is kind of like a baked potato and is also delicious, and the steak and salmon plate is to die for! I couldn&#39;t have had a better dinner!

Great time at this restaurant. Food was good, great atmosphere but just a but too busy when I went so not the best service. Overall I would come back here and try other items on the menu. I recommend the pasta :)

***This location in the Brand at Americana seems like any other Cheesecake Factory out there; for dessert, it would probably be better to opt for one of their cheesecakes rather than their ice cream desserts***<br><br>We went here for dessert after a meal at nearby Raffi&#39;s.  I am not the biggest fan of cheesecake so I opted for one of their ice cream desserts instead.  I went with their hot fudge sundae, which was vanilla ice cream topped with hot fudge, whipped cream and almonds.<br><br>Everything about it was okay, but it was not one of the better sundaes out there.  The ice cream was a little too whipped and light and did not have the firmness and density I prefer.  The hot fudge was okay and the almonds were crunchy.  The whipped cream seemed similar to what you would get from a canned whipped cream.<br><br>I have had their cheesecakes (at other locations) and while they are very dense and filling, they are probably a better option than their hot fudge sundae.<br><br>Service was pleasant but a little slow and disorganized on our visit.  I haven&#39;t been to that many Cheesecake Factories lately so I am not sure if this is a common thing.  I remember the service at the Cheesecake Factory in Sherman Oaks being more efficient.<br><br>The atmosphere was like any other Cheesecake Factory (a more upscale atmosphere than a lot of the chain restaurants out there).  And like other Cheesecake Factory restaurants, it was very busy.<br><br>While I did not try their regular menu here, I imagine the overall experience would be similar to other Cheesecake Factory locations, which probably makes this a safe option for Cheesecake Factory fans.  If you are not a Cheesecake Factory fan but are in this area a lot, you may want to consider giving nearby Palate a shot (a good upscale Glendale restaurant).<br><br>This Cheesecake Factory is located right in The Brand At Americana There are many parking structures nearby (some are paid and some are not).  We opted for the Glendale Galleria parking structure, which is free.
My friends and I had a wonderful experience at this location. Great food, drinks and service. Our waitress was Jocelyn and she was super sweet! We will definitely come back soon!

we ordered from Cheesecake Factory. the lady cashier and the gay|guy near the cashier were both rude to us. i guess preferencial treatment and racial discrimination because maybe we don&#39;t look like middle eastern or white. but she gave them tip still. <br>we didn&#39;t deserve the kind of treatment they both showed us earlier. the food served to us, the shrimp scampy in angel hair - the noodle was not even cooked right, the dressing for the salad doesn&#39;t even compliment it. the QUE-SA DEA is the only thing that tasted right and the complimentary dark brown crusty in the outside but soft in the inside french bread. we waited for more than 30minutes for the order while the ones who came in later were already served theirs. <br>the gay|guy shouted to us when i jokingly said QUE-SA-DILLA, he yelled and sneered at us like he was talking to somebody stupid with raised eyebrows. i was so pissed, i turned away from him like he didn&#39;t exist. the lady cashier  was not even facing us when she was taking our orders, she was either doing something in the cash register or something below it so she couldn&#39;t hear us. she was just so rude and she was making faces while she reacted to us while we tried to figure out our order. <br><br>if they are saying that Americana is a high end place then they should get waiters and waitresses with high class sophistication and refinement that of a learned and educated individuals.
Best chicken I&#39;ve ever tasted!!! I ordered the cachou chicken.
The Renee&#39;s special was really good and definitely makes you full.  Plenty of food and hard to finish.

Went in for my grandmother&#39;s birthday last night (8/25). Our Hostess Lexi was very SO helpful. My sis and my grandma were kinda being a pain in the *** about the seating. As a restaurant worker for many years, Ill admit I was a bit embarrassed. Lexi was super accommodating, and at the same time, did an awesome job of taking control and being proactive. Of course they had to have a table that was just used and super dirty, but we were sat within 3 minutes. She continuously stopped by to check up on us as she was passing. Bianca was our server. Outstanding, prompt service from beginning to finish. Loved Bianca&#39;s upbeat, friendly attitude. Never had to wait long for anything. Took care of our needs before we had to ask for anything. She did a great job of making my grandmother feel special on her night. My grandma couldnt stop talking about how impressed she was. (Believe me, that says a lot.) We were all so very pleased. Thank you so much for everything!!

My work partner and I eat lunch at the bar at least once a week here, and really, these stars are all for my girl Amy.  <br><br>Amy is a wonderful gal and super-server-bartendress, and she seriously has turned this place into Cheers for us.  You wanna go where everybody knows you want a water with lemon, a little house salad (easy dressing) and white bean hummus with warm pita wedges.  Thanks Amy :)<br> <br>Also, as much as I dislike the naming of it, the new Skinnilicious (see?) menu is pretty great for lunch.

Yeah, it&#39;s pretty much like any Cheesecake Factory you&#39;ve ever been to. Noisy, lots of larger parties. A menu with way too many choices. A bar with over-priced mixes of top-shelf choices. Ties on the servers. Noisy. <br><br>You know, the garlic noodles were tasty ...and maybe too hot out of a microwave?<br><br>It&#39;s just noisy and lots of people eat here. I don&#39;t really know why...<br><br>predictable...
Super good food. Patio area is romantic. Music and water show. And the dessert is super Yum. And the wildberry mojitos are the best
Great Kale/Quinoa Salad. Delicious Garlic Noodles. Good Service.

Went here for lunch on Saturday, August 31st. Service here was bad. Food was good. I ordered a veggie burger and they gave me a turkey burger. When he assured me that it wouldn&#39;t take more than 5 minutes it finally arrived when my friends were almost completely done with their lunch. They never came over to refill my friends water or to even ask how our meal was. They didn&#39;t remove the veggie burger off of our bill and it just seems like they don&#39;t care about service at this location. Won&#39;t be back.

Depending on the time you come to this location it&#39;s usually very busy. We decided to come here for Sunday brunch and it was no different. Even though there were a lot people waiting our party of 3 got a booth right away. Restaurant is always clean and the service is about B+ in my opinion. We ordered a pasta dish, Kobe burger and I had the brunch special Green Chilaquiles with Carnitas and Eggs, which was very good! Honestly I thinking it was more like a 3 1/2 star experience because nothing was really spectacular but a 3 star wouldn&#39;t have been fair. Overall the staff and food was good and we will defiantly come back.

We went to Cheesecake Factory at Americana location on the 31st of March to celebrate my Birthday. Once sited the waitress named Tamara aproached with 3 glasses of water one of which she dumped half of the glass on the table. She tried to clean it by dabbing it with a cloth that didn&#39;t absorb a drop of water. Left the table wet and served us the bread. I took the tissue paper that was under the bread and dried the table myself. I asked for some more tissue paper , she threw some on the table while passing by. We had to repeat our orders 3 times , she still forgot to bring my cocktail.There was white stuff stock to my spoon, when mentioned it to her, she took it away very mad without appologizing or saying anything. She gave us someone else&#39;s check with a credit card that didn&#39;t belong to us. Our check came with the charge of the cocktail that i never got. We didn&#39;t want the leftovers because didn&#39;t want to carry them around, but she gave us two boxes so we were stock with and didn&#39;t want to be rude and not take them. She thanked us with a fake accent . At home when opened the boxes , the left overs were not ours. We had pastas, she gave us stake and salad. Will not be back there again.
Love Cheesecake Factory as always. But there is an extra star for Mathew ..... Thx dear .

It&#39;s not he same anymore. The food used to be very delicious and service was excellent. Lately, this branch seems to be screwing things up. Last few times we were there, the service was very substandard. The very last time, the server was all over the place, didn&#39;t get plates to share, tables were not being cleaned, just an overall mess. The food was not that great either. I remember their chicken littles being so soft and juicy, the last ones were hard and tasted like the ones you would get at a pizza delivery place. Another example is their ranch dressing, it used to be so good, however, the last time it was so salty, we barely touched it. <br><br>I hope the management is reading these reviews. I used to love this place as evident by my prior reviews, but that is slowly changing.

I had a delicious lunch at the Cheesecake Factory. <br>Crab cake appetizer, then for the main course Salmon and Asparagus and an Iced Tea to drink. <br><br>The restaurant was really busy with customers even on a weekday for lunch. <br>The people across from me seemed to be business people having a lunch meeting. <br>And the people next to me were obviously tourists who were taking lots of photos of each other. <br><br>The waitress was really nice and helpful. She brought my Ice Tea and Crab Cake Appetizer right away, and validated my parking for me. <br>I was debating about a slice of cheesecake, but I was way to full from my appetizer and meal. <br><br>One thing I noticed as I was leaving, was that the bar area seemed to be busy with many people hanging out. It looked like a popular place, so I will have to go back and check it out some time soon.

This location has good service and consistently good food. Most of the waiters are courteous and knowledgeable about the menu. We&#39;ve been coming here for several years and have tried lots of items on the menu but my favorite is the Miso Salmon. The bar does a great job too. Portions are very large and enough to share.

The wait was only 10 min fir a Saturday afternoon, not bad. We had a margarita with moctezuma tequila while we waited very good. For appetizers we had lettuce wraps which don&#39;t come as a mixture like pf changs and other restaurants, you have to build your own. The chicken, carrots, cucumber, etc come individually on a platter and you add whatever u want which is cool I guess. We also had crab cake bites, delicious.<br>For our main entrees I had chicken Romano, my bf had jimbalaya with chicken n shrimp. The Romano was good it is served with spaghetti in a tasty sauce but I always order marinera on the side because I find it a bit dry. The jimbalaya was spicy and tasty. <br>Overall the food was great, the server...meh. We only saw her when we ordered and when we paid, oh yeah and she refilled my ice water with water only and no ice, it was kind of gross. A fresh cup of water with ice and a new lemon would have been nice.<br>The busser brought us our boxes and removed our plates. <br>Sometimes it&#39;s unfair that a server doesn&#39;t do much and takes home all the money and the hard workers just get a cut. In this  case I believe it to be true. I love it when your server is there to take ur order, refill drinks, brings napkins, takes ur plates away, checks on u but isn&#39;t overwhelming. <br>We still left a tip though, we understand there&#39;s a lot of people involved in our experience and for them we tipped today.
Food was really good but the service was strange. All the waiters were really stiff.

Definitely like this location better then the Sherman Oaks one. The service is MUCH better and last night our waitress, Tasha, was really outgoing and made our experience very pleasant. The food always tastes fresh and their &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menu is EVERYTHING.

My weekend regular, I recently tried their Beef Kabobs and WOW! a new favorite appetizer that I will order on the regular. Despite this expansive menu, I have had the opportunity to explore a majority of the dishes. I love this place and their cheesecakes (A LA MODE) are epic. Call me crazy, but I always look forward to dining here each week.

I came here last night and was very disappointed with the service. I am a frequent customer to this location and every time I come, something always goes wrong. We were seated within five minutes and our waitress was very prompt. But as soon as our food came out, she didn&#39;t even bother to check on us once. It was a Wednesday night and it did not seem very busy. The person I was with is new to the area and he even asked me why the workers seemed so miserable. Next time, I will make the drive out to Sherman Oaks.

Love their menu and food! Love their affordable prices and their drinks! But this particular location is just too busy! I don&#39;t like the wait and then after we&#39;re seated wait again! Just way too much! Time is off essence and there are plenty of other restaurants I&#39;d prefer.

This place was so busy all the time like every other cheese cake factory stores.<br>We checked in, the host told us 45 mins wait and they will text us when it ready.  55 mins later still waiting.  We checked back she said she tried to text us but did not get through... I think she trained to says this to everyone,  so DON&#39;T WAIT FOR THEIR TEXT.<br><br>They DO VALIDATED your parking ticket for the MAX of 3 HOURS.<br><br>Good food except my husband did not like the factory burger it used dry/hard bread for the burger,  luckily my husband had very good teeth. <br>Otherwise,  our others food were good. <br><br>Our server was extremely nice even though I know she was tired because end of the day. <br><br>Less one star for them because the text did not come as they promised and the hard bread burger.

Instead of waiting for a normal table my husband and I opted for the bar where there were tables available. It was a great choice we had excellent service and the server gave great recommendations. The shepherd&#39;s pie was the best I have ever had. The flavor was great and so was his recommended strawberry cheesecake. Definitely going back.

Here is a place that can satisfy everyone&#39;s cravings! Their menu offers a international verity of food. Also if you are too full to order a cheese cake, you can take it to go and it still tastes good the following day! Due to the fact the Americana can get crowded, don&#39;t always expect great service. Also the mixed drinks aren&#39;t the greatest.

Where to start? I had 3 guests on a Friday night. We ordered food for dinner and waited around 55 minutes till the food arrived in to our table. The food was OK but what made me leave 2 star review on this visit was when the waiter brought the check. Since we had waited for a long time to receive the food, I left a 5 dollar tip. The waiter, Andrew J, came back right away to our table and with a loud voice he yelled at me in front of my 3 guests saying that I can&#39;t leave 5 dollars. The minimum is 15 percent which would be 16 dollars. One of my guests told him if it is mandatory to leave at least 15 percent and he say yes, you have to tip me at least 15 percent. Since I did not want to bring a negative vibe to my table, I left 16 dollars tip in total. Shame on this waiter for making me embarrassed in front of other customers. I will never forgive this waiter. He put me down in front of my guests. Not to mention that next day I called and complained and the manager apologized many times. But the manager did not compensate me anything.

This place blows balls. Their happy hour is undeniably good (which reflects on this Glendale location not at all), but the service is enough to make me want to patronize one of the zillions of other venues in Glendale. Not only was service poor (our server Kenneth demanded my girlfriend pass him the menus when he simply could&#39;ve rounded the teeny tiny table to get em. He also slammed the plates as he collected them after our meal, and REALLY??? we could&#39;ve done without the FIERCE ATTITUDE- not in the good way). When we went to complain afterwards, the super crappy (and tubby) manager barely apologized, barely took us seriously, and in essence, ushered us out the door. Good job cheesecake. GOOD JOB SUCKING!!!

Its a great place with great food. My only advice is to be careful with the person taking your order. They will try to add this and add that to your bill. Just be clear with them and you wont have a problem.<br><br>The waitress tried to get my 2 year old daughters to get their own dish! Its like come on!The portions are huge! If the girls can share the womb, they can share a plate.
Overrated, overpriced. Food is not bad, but nothing to write home about either, honestly. Serving time is also a bit on the slow side, but the servers are friendly and accomodating.
Always a good experience when going here for lunch.  The menu items are extensive. They are a kids favorite. Thank you.

Went to Cheesecake Factory at Americana for lunch with a couple of friends.  The waiter, who was absolutely fantastic, suggested we try some of the new additions to their menu.  We agrees to order a few and split them among us.  First was the Eggplant Parmesan.  Was the closest recipe to my grandmother homemade eggplant that I&#39;ve ever had!!  Amazing!!  With a side of Angel Hair pasta with pesto that is to die for!!  I cannot recommend this enough!<br><br>Next we tried they new pulled pork sandwich with bacon!  The meat was juicy and lean.  Melted in your mouth with a BBQ sauce that had just the right amount of &#34;bite&#34; to it.  The thick cut, smoked bacon just added to the flair!!  A must order if you&#39;re a fan or BBQ or pulled pork!<br><br>Next up we the Imperial Chicken and Shrimp dish.  This is very similar to their version of Orange Chicken and Shrimp.  Big generous pieces of both and the rice was very flavorful .  This was yet another winner and was completely devoured!!<br><br>Finally we had the Herb Crusted Chicken Filets with a side of mashed potatoes.  Made to perfection!!  You could cut the chicken with your fork and the lightly crusted herb topping was perfect!!  The mashed potatoes were home style and chunky!! <br><br>With such a huge selection to choose from it&#39;s always nice to try something new!!  I highly recommend any of the four items above and out service could not have been any better!!  An all around enjoyable experience and one that will keep me coming back many times again!!!

The Cheesecake Factory is a good place to go when you don&#39;t know what you want since their menu is endless. The food never really blows me out of the water, but it&#39;s good. The reason I go back is because there&#39;s something for everyone, the staff is very friendly, and there&#39;s typically no wait. Being right in the Americana also makes it a great location. If I&#39;m already there shopping, it&#39;s easy to stop by and grab dinner.
The best cheesecake period. Place has a huge menu so pretty sure everyone in your party can find something they like. One downfall is there is always a wait to get in this place so expect it.

Went to eat for Sunday brunch and the manager tamra was just absolutely horrible to us. She raised her voice at us and told us if we didn&#39;t like the food we could always leave and not come back. How dare she say that to us!! I was very, very, angry. Asked for another manager, Chris was his name and he showed up and took care of our bill and after explaining to us that we aren&#39;t the first to report a problem with tamra, we told him it&#39;s just a matter of time before she&#39;s looking for another job.

I normally love the cheesecake factory, but this time, not so much!  <br><br>We get there for lunch &amp; fortunately didn&#39;t have to wait too long to be seated. They just opened up a section &amp; we were the first ones seated in that section. Now cut to 20 min later when we still haven&#39;t been waited on... Not even our drink orders taken!  I looked around &amp; saw all the other tables around us were now filled, with drinks &amp; some of them beginning to get food!!!!!  We were soooo mad &amp; it didn&#39;t help that we were so very hungry!<br><br>Finally I had to stop a waitress &amp; ask where ours was. He finally came. We ordered. We ate. He was pleasant &amp; did apologize for the wait, but that NEVER shoulda happened in the first place!<br><br>To boot, I LOVE the avocado egg rolls &amp; they really weren&#39;t that great this time. <br><br>All in all, this was not a great dining experience!  Hope yours is better!

I love the Cheesecake Factory. Pretty standard to every other cheesecake. Nothing special other than the beautiful outside seating with the water fall. Kinda romantic if you are into that kind of thing.

I went with a group of 10 last night for a special event and this was not a good experience. We waited for one hour to be seated.  Our guest of honor got her dinner after we finished our dinner...the waitress never figured this out and was not around to do more than get orders.  Then I go into the ladies restroom and it is full of hand towels all over the floor and NO TOILET PAPER in the stalls!  This restaurant needs to think about their costumers!!!  DO NOT GO THERE WITH A LARGE PARTY!!!
Always great experience here never had a bad choice great food great service the only thing is the long wait for a table because they dont take reservations

The wait time is 30 min on a busy <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fday.holiday&amp;s=71b15be2ecf6447f432aaf8e25f8ab0f65795f8795dd92f851163013e36ca59b" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">day.holiday</a> is always crowded. as soon as we got seated  we got our bread  and butter right away and that is  great esp after a long day of walking /shopping at the mall .our pasta Alfredo, is good.and i like their passion tea its refreshing. service is great. if you go here on weekdays they have happy hour  appetizers are good and they are about  price right.weeknd just be prepare to wait a little longer.. been here a few times and we always get a good service.next stop FRIDA next door.

I know it has been here already for a really long time but it was a very good idea to make this in the Americana. You can&#39;t really go wrong with the cheesecake factory. They have a HUGE selection of different kinds of foods which makes it very easy for someone who pretty picky. I&#39;ve been here many many times and never had a problem with the staff, everyone is pretty friendly (some more then others).<br><br>I&#39;ve tasted a bunch of different stuff on the menu. Some I wasn&#39;t a fan of, most are okay, few are great. My absolute favvvvvv is the Louisiana chicken pasta, it&#39;s a little on the spicy side and I like how the chicken is breaded. The avocado egg rolls are the best from anywhere else I have tried. I was not a fan of the orange chicken. Oh and the drinks :) yummmm! Pretty much all the drinks are good, but if you like rum you MUST get a mojito (any of them are amazing).<br><br>In the end the cheesecake factory isn&#39;t the best but it&#39;s not bad either. If you do come here it&#39;s best with a group, and if you come for dinner on the weekend arrive early because there is at least a 45 minute wait.. even if it&#39;s just for 2.

I love this place since I&#39;m such a cheesecake fan! The raspberry lemon cheesecake is my favorite so far. The food is great too just as long as you order right. I&#39;ve been unlucky a time or two before so choose wisely!

I came here for lunch on Sunday and ordered the Original Hamburger with fries.  I like my burgers well-done and they did an amazing job.  It was still juicy and tasty; just the way I like it.  I felt that their french fries were too salty.  Next time I will tell them &#34;no salt&#34; on the fries.  <br><br>My sister ordered from the Sunday Brunch menu.  She enjoyed their waffles because they were fluffy and light :)

I seriously hate the lighting here. I know, it&#39;s for mood/ambiance, but really, I can&#39;t see the food that I&#39;m eating. Also, it&#39;d be nicer if it were a bit quieter (it&#39;s like Bottega Louie).<br>We were seated at a table that was so tiny I wasn&#39;t sure how it would fit even one plate. And sure enough, it could barely hold our food on the table, and my elbows were banging into the wall by me.<br><br>The food and service, though, are GREAT.<br><br>I believe our server&#39;s name was Omar? He was really kind: went through all the specials, soups, etc.; and came to check on us often enough that we didn&#39;t have to wait around to order or ask questions, but not too often that he was breathing down our necks.<br><br>For starters, the bread is amazing. And the butter. YUM.<br>We ordered the appetizer Avocado Eggrolls and the Spicy Chicken Chipotle Pasta. They were both delicious! The eggrolls had a perfect crunchy outer shell with a contrasting soft and ripe avocado filling. This dish is like a classy level up from the regular eggrolls. And the sauce/dressing/whatever was delicious too. It brought a sweet tanginess to the slightly insipid flavor of the eggroll itself. The Spicy Chicken Chipotle Pasta was sooo good. It&#39;s not like the other pastas that make you feel like barfing after a few bites because the sauce is too creamy or bland. And the pieces of chicken were grilled nicely too.

First off, i&#39;m the very last person to post a bad review unless I feel strongly obligated to do so. My family and I came in on a Wednesday (which is usually not a busy day over here seeing that we live within the americana community, and we&#39;re pretty familiar with their busiest hours) seeing that the weather is lovely and my youngest feeling a little nauseous, I didnt want to be seated inside so we walked up to the reception and asked for a table outside. We were told that the table would be ready within 40-50 mins (which I understand is only an estimate &amp; inaccurate), ignoring the fact that the two ladies who we spoke to were immensely rude. An hour and 15 mins later, we get a call notifying us that the table is ready, we get there and had to wait ANOTHER 15-20 mins even though the table was obviously ready. Unprofessional, blood boiling and downright unacceptable.

Do you like to eat? Never diet? Gain weight?  Then this is for you.   Amazing place where every item on the menu is appealing,  without cheese or cake.  Orange chicken with brown rice yummy as mac and cheese.

I came here because of drake. It&#39;s a nice spot for a Saturday evening date. Yes, the wait is long but I didn&#39;t mind it. I ate the shrimp and sausage pasta, so delicious!! And service was friendly.

Came here for An early dinner on a date place was packed so decided to eat at the bar was served by Justin but all the bartenders helped out. All the bartenders were very clean cut and they were also very professional and tentative. The only reason I have 4 stars was because the steak Diane I ordered with the salmon, (which was perfect) was a bit overcooked. Will definitely be visiting this cheesecake location again

Last time I went to a Cheesecake factory was about 5 years ago in Boston, I had a bad reaction  from the smell of the cheese and decided not to eat there ever again. However I was given a gift card for my birthday this year so I decided to stop by for happy hour. We walked straight to bar and were seated immediately. We did not make a reservation and finding a table was a breeze. Service was slow but our server Kelvin made it a pleasant experience. Let me start by saying they have one of the best happy hours in town! Drinks (selected margaritas, mimosas and couple more)were $5.50. Drinks were well made and strong. They have a bunch of appetizers 1/2 off and big portions too. I had the happy hour burger and my girl had the buffalo chicken. Everything was delicious. Kelvin also brought us 2 complementary bowls of clam chowder soup :) made my day because it was unexpected. Happy Hour is Mon-Fri 4-6 and they validate parking for up to 2 hours.

We went there to celebrate my son 14-th Birthday around 7:30 pm on a Thursday night. The host informed us that the patio is closed and the wait should be no longer then 20 minutes. We got are table around 8:15  45 minutes of waiting. Around 8:28 our clueless server came to take our orders. 3 sodas at $3.50 each took almost 15 minutes to arrive. I asked her can you please clean our table its greasy and sticky she said she will send some one to clean it but no one ever showed up. Dirty tables and booths and I guess no one cares and finally our food ( 2 pastas and a chicken sandwich) arrived at 9:15 after 45 minutes of waiting. When I asked her again no one cleaned our table yet she said sorry we are busy there is nothing I can do. Ha what a nice answer any way she dropped off our food and we didn&#39;t saw her until  she dropped off our check. Funny thing is first thing you will notice is percentage of tips already printed on the bill for you but guess what how about a 0% tip for not showing up and checking up on us young lady. The quality of food was horrible they didn&#39;t even use fresh garlic in pastas they used jar minced garlic which tasted bad really bad. And the chicken in the sandwich was dry and cold like been cooked hours ago I know a lot about food business you can&#39;t fool me. I used to go there a lot but lately in my past 3 visit I noticed that the service is going down and I&#39;ll not go there ever again. Over price poor service low quality food Rude servers. I don&#39;t know what has changed but this place is not what it was used to be.

It really shocks me when someone tells me they&#39;re not a fan of Cheesecake Factory. Seriously? how could you not be when they have such a HUGE menu to choose from? There&#39;s gotta be something on there that you&#39;ll like ;) One of my friends who used to hate Cheesecake Factory is a huge fan now after she started going with me and learning which dishes to order. I&#39;ve tried many different items from the menu never once had a bad meal but my favorites would have to be the Endive Salad but it comes in small portions so i usually order 2 or 3 of them. Yeah It&#39;s that good. The fried calamari are so good and so are the Thai lettuce wraps and the firecracker salmon.<br><br>Usually for a main course I like to order the grilled salmon special with broccoli and asparagus. It&#39;s the perfect meal, nice and light and not to mention this dish doesn&#39;t have tons of calories like so many other dishes on the menu. The Baja chicken tacos are really good too. Chicken madeira and their pasta dishes are also recommended. I&#39;ve even tried this place for breakfast and was surprised to find out they have good omelets.<br><br>Also, you can&#39;t forget about CHEESECAKE of course :P My personal favorites are the fresh banana cream and the brownie sundae. They&#39;re to DIE FOR. ok I should really stop now ;)
My fave here is Herb crusted salmon, bang-bang chicken &amp; shrimp and orange chicken, of course the tempura roll appetizer and the wide-selection of cheesecakes! best place for big parties!

So disappointing!<br><br>We ordered the Fire Cracker Salmon, the Thai Lettuce Wraps and Herb Crusted Salmon w/ Shrimp and Angel Hair Pasta<br><br>The Fire Cracker Salmon lacked flavor. So I tried to use the dipping sauce which was too spicy and salty.<br><br>The Thai Lettuce Wraps had way too much garlic and was over seasoned with soysauce.<br><br>The Herb Crusted Salmon was overcooked and the herbs  didn&#39;t help the salmon either.  <br><br>The shrimp with angel hair pasta was a little better because it was the only thing we ordered that wasn&#39;t over seasoned. Then again, it was bland.<br><br>Unfortunately, the best part of the meal was the complimentary bread. And that&#39;s why I&#39;m even giving this experience 2 stars.<br><br>Will we go back??? Nope! Sorry!
I love this place, I always get great service and I love their burgers.  Ive only been there On weekends at night and it&#39;s really packed, sometimes 2 hour wait but it&#39;s worth it.

Honestly not that great compared to the price. Went for my sister&#39;s bday and they gave us a free chocolate layered tiramisu kind of thing which was cool :) the wraps (?) were pretty good, but you have to wrap everything yourself x)

Worst experience ever! Decided I&#39;d give this place the benefit of the doubt and try it again and nope! Bad experience yet again!<br><br>Came here about 3 weeks ago with my sister, we live in the area and I was craving pasta so we said why not. After coming here I was reminded why I NEVER come here..... It was a Thursday night, we went in and there were about 3 or 4 parties ahead of us waiting to be seated but they were big parties. We walked up to the host at the counter. He completely IGNORED us. It was an African tall guy, not sure what his name was. We were literally right in his face and he was ignoring us, no hi, no how can I help you. Hell, even just saying &#34;I&#39;ll be with you in a moment&#34; would suffice. NOPE. Ignored us for about 2 minutes until my sister got upset and said &#34;Hello? Can you help us????&#34; and he was like &#34;What do you need?&#34; WTF? You saw us walk in, what do you possibly think we need? We want to be seated! My sister asked how long the wait was and he asked us how many, she said two. He said &#34;No wait, I&#39;ll seat you guys in a minute&#34;. 5 minutes had gone by and my sister was raging pissed and she walked over and said &#34;Are you going to seat us now?&#34; and he was like &#34;There&#39;s 2 parties ahead of you it&#39;s going to be about 20 minutes&#34;. Why did you lie and say it would be a minute when you just came back with saying a 20 minute wait. What an idiot. We walked out pissed off and ate somewhere else. Worst service ever. OK, there was no one at the counter when we approached him, he couldn&#39;t acknowledge our existence? Worst attitude ever too &#34;What do you need&#34;. Whatever. If you hate your job no one is forcing you to work there - just quit.<br><br>A week ago I ordered through Uber Eats because I was craving pasta and my sister wanted a burger. Order came in an hour. I ordered the Cajun Shrimp and Chicken Pasta because supposedly it&#39;s like the &#34;Best thing on the menu&#34; NOPE. Disgusting. Probably the worst pasta I have ever tasted in my entire life. Bland, and something I could have made for $5 bucks getting all the ingredients at a store. The noodles were nasty and the chicken had so much cartilage I wasted every piece of chicken. It&#39;s still lingering on my palette honestly. $18.50 for this pasta has got to be the most insulting joke ever. $18.50 for something that tastes like a wet diaper. No thanks. NEVER AGAIN. I will not support or give my money to any Cheesecake Factory establishment moving forward. Worst experience twice, and disgusting food.  Wish I could give zero stars. Everyone who works here should be embarrassed because they are supporting crappy food and have the worst attitude makes the reputation twice as bad.

I hate to admit, but Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite chain restaurants! I LOVE where this one is located, right in the middle of the Americana. We were seated outside with an awesome view during dinner. The fountain show was happening with music and the lights everywhere just made everything look so much more beautiful here. I had my pomeranian with me so one of the servers outside went out of her way and got us seated near her in the outside patio section because she thought she was such a cutie(she is and she knows it too, which is why she usually gets her way lol). We were seated right next to a heat lamp so we had a warm dinner. <br><br>FOOD:<br>Pasta da Vinci: sautéed chicken, mushrooms and onions in a madeira wine sauce in penne pasta..my favorite pasta to get here! It was a little undercooked this time and can sometimes the wine sauce feels a bit heavy and greasy but this time it was made just right! A must try! :)<br><br>Crispy Crab Bites: Bite sized mini crab cakes that come with a mustard-tartar sauce, it was crispy and real crab inside, so good but only 5 small pieces since it is part of their &#34;small plates&#34; menu :(<br><br>Chicken Madeira: their most popular chicken dish and always recommended by all servers..for a good reason! Its sautéed Chicken Breast topped with asparagus and mozzarella cheese, covered with mushroom madeira sauce and a side of mashed potatoes. You get a HUGE portion so its plenty to share or take home and the chicken is not dry, the mushroom sauce is delish and so are the mashed potatos! <br><br>We didn&#39;t have room for dessert but I love their Banana Cream Cheesecake :)<br> <br>Total tab was about $50 something before tip. It was a good experience, and my first time eating outside on the patio. Service was excellent! We got special attention because of my dog but hey, whatever works! Don&#39;t forget to have your parking pass validated before you go!
Really not that impressed with the quality of the food for the price we paid smh even the drinks were watered down down down

One of the worst customer service I experienced. First of all the wait time for your food to get there is ridiculous it&#39;s a Tuesday why does it take so long, I understand if it&#39;s a weekend but a Tuesday. Second the people next to me an behind me got there food before I did. Can I say I don&#39;t think it takes long to make 2 plates of spaghetti with meatball. Third I was trying to get someone&#39;s attention so I can ask why my food was taking so long while a server was looking my way that individual failed to acknowledge me despite me waving at them. After they arrived to our table she still came with an attitude and quickly brushed us off. Not until my husband stopped one of the waiters and requested to speak to the floor managers. Once he arrived he apologized and tried to make the situation better but the damage had already been done. I explained to the manager that the waiter that had approached our table was really rude and instead of coming to our table with an attitude she should had tried to make her best to find our waiter. Let me tell you this I will never come back to this location. Mind you I always go to the one at The Grove and never experienced this. They should maybe hire or train the waiters and waitresses how to properly speak to a guest and how to handle a situation that was so simple as to saying &#34;I&#39;m sorry let me go find your waiter&#34;.

Going back to basics was a pleasant surprise. While this is a very busy place, the service was excellent. The food absolutely delicious. I didn&#39;t expect it from a chain restaurant. The cook prepared my piece of salmon rare to perfection. And to be noted there is a gluten free option for the mashed potatoes.

Labor Day weekend sitting outside at Americana in lovely weather. There pina colada was amazing. They don&#39;t have my favorite sandwich ( Navajo) anymore which was a disappointment but the chicken  avocado sandwich was really good. You can never go wrong at cheesecake.

This review is purely on their customer service. <br><br>My boyfriend and I went to this restaurant and was greeted by our friendly waiter. He was very helpful, patient, and attentive. An overall nice guy. <br><br>But the thing that really made me write this review was, I had forgotten my phone in the bathroom, and either some customer or employee gave it to the manager. I called and they had my phone the next day and were willing to give it to me while they were still closed. <br><br>We&#39;ve almost always been satisfied with this place. We will definitely come back.

came here for dinner last night. all the review is true. bad service, but the worst is their manager. we came here at 5;20 and were told the wait would be 15-20 minutes.   I asked the manager if they would help out those who are handicapped. he said there are no policy but he would see what he can do. His allitute was poor and did not seem to care. we were not seated until 45 minutes later so he didn&#39;t &#34;help&#34;.....hate it when people lied! I would understand if the staff was not professional, but a manager should be nicer!

The service was horrible, had to wait 30 minutes for the food to come out so my food came out mushy/dry/stuck together, charged me for something unnecessary, and the waitress was giving attitude. Such a disappointment.

Nice Patio.... But service is so unprofessional.. There was a silver knife on the floor., after 4 employes stepped on it the 5 the one picked it up., we had to ask for every item we needed.. Manager needs to take notice of these things!!!

I don&#39;t think Cheesecake Factory ever has good service. <br><br>Garlic noodles with chicken taste like shit. It tastes like the chef boiled the pasta and put it on the plate, straight from the pot.. and then he steamed up some chicken and placed that on top of the pasta and served it to us. Seriously, I&#39;ve never tasted pasta at a restaurant so PLAIN before. <br><br>Buffalo chicken was good... until my cousin bit into one that was COMPLETELY RAW and STILL BLEEDING! Fucking disgusting. We stopped eating that shit and called our waiter over and told him. He called the manager over and they took it off our bill. <br><br>I think the only part our waiter was excited about was singing happy birthday to my cousin, lol.

Let&#39;s start off with the rude waitress Britney, she was nasty, absentminded, confrontational, and unprofessional. She had a horrible attitude. I was not going to tolerate it, so I asked for the manager, whose name is Chris. I told him about the Britney&#39;s despicable behavior and the cold pasta I was served. He was very helpful and understanding. He was apologetic and replaced the cold food and rude waitress. Josh, the replacement waiter, was the best. He was fantastic and provided great service. We were more than satisfied after the Britney drama. Watch out for her. Avoid her. Thank you.

Happy hour - Until 6pm. Select appetizers for $5 is the business! The calamari plate was big and stacked; they didn&#39;t try to cheat just because it was happy hour - i love it! HH is only good at the bar, I believe. <br><br>They still give you the bread, though! No worries my carb-loving friends!

No thank you.<br><br>After watching a movie the girlfriend and I wanted to get something to eat, and we choose to come here.<br><br>BAD IDEA.<br><br>Aside from the fact that cheesecake factory food is subpar at best, the service here was worse than usual. At first it felt like one of those Russian gulags, with only bread to sate our hunger. When it felt like all was lost, a guiding light appeared, our server! It was false hope though, because after ordering we didn&#39;t see our food for what seemed like forever. We actually had to go get the manager, and he went back and got our food for us because our server was off doing god knows what.<br><br>The final nail in the coffin was that our server apparently didn&#39;t know the difference between the different types of cheesecake, because he got us the wrong kind TWICE before he finally got it right, third time&#39;s a charm right?<br><br>Honestly, I&#39;d never come back here, I&#39;d rather go to the mall across the street and eat at the food court there.

Went here to for an early dinner and had one of the absolute worst experiences ever!<br><br>I broke my tooth on a foreign object in my salad. The company is actually refusing to pay my dental bills which included a root canal. I will never set foot in another Cheesecake Factory and encourage others to do the same.

I decided to give it a 4 because of the awesome service we got. I read some other yelp reviews where they had really bad experiences, but our waiter was really good. He was very polite, friendly, and attentive. He always seemed to come just at the right time, right before we even realized we needed refills. When he went on a break, he let us know ahead of time and introduced the &#34;relief waiter&#34; to us. By the way, we came on a Tuesday evening.<br><br>My friend got the BBQ Ranch Chicken Salad ($13.95), and judging by the way she devoured it, I think it was good. She kept raving about it. She washed it down with a Diet Coke ($2.95).<br><br>I had the Strawberry Lemonade ($4.50) which accompanied my Grilled Fresh Mahi Mahi ($19.95). This normally comes with mashed potatoes and choice of vegetable, but I requested two vegetable sides instead (steamed broccoli and green beans). It was good as far as grilled fish with no sauce/dressing goes (it came with tartar sauce, but I didn&#39;t use it).<br><br>For dessert, we shared the AMAZING red velvet cheesecake ($7.50). It was pretty close to perfect as cheesecakes come.<br><br>I wasn&#39;t aware of the new law that restaurants have to be upfront with the nutritional information of their meals, but the waiter gave us a booklet with all the nutritional info along with our menus. My friend refused to look at it because she didn&#39;t want her meal ruined. I was planning on ordering something else (particularly the combo of shrimp scampi and grilled salmon), but when I saw how many calories and grams of salt it had...oh. my. gawd. It was pretty scary. And that was how I ended up with the mahi mahi with steamed vegetables. I didn&#39;t REALLY want it, but I didn&#39;t want to die of a heart attack either. Seriously, after going through the nutritional info, I doubt I&#39;ll be coming back anytime soon.<br><br>On the plus side, eating outdoors was great because we got a nice view of the water fountain in the middle of the Americana. And for mid-August, it sure got cold by 7 pm. The heat lamps they turned on were necessary.
Great food, great cheesecakes (I love the Red Velvet).<br>It&#39;s basically The Cheesecake Factory. You&#39;ve heard about it. It&#39;s great. Just go there.

Been here too many times to even count.  Why do I come here?  I don&#39;t know!  Maybe because they have killer cheesecakes...maybe.  Or, is it that I like to wait and wait and wait for a table (when they are busy). Or, is it the good service...Or...and the list goes on...<br>Seriously, folks, this is your run of the mill Cheesecake Factory restaurant.  Nothing special, nothing great...well, maybe their cheesecake...which I really like.<br>Actually, the one in Rancho Mirage is alot better!
OMG this place was so noisy, the service was terrible. My salad portion was small and i left there still feeling very hungry. They are way over priced too!

Came for lunch with two friends. We were STARVING but didn&#39;t want to go to in n out or any of the places in the Americana (and the walk to Granville was far too far) <br><br>I&#39;m used to a long wait here, I expected a long wait here. Our buzzer rang in a finely matter, and we headed to the hostess table. We literally (not exaggerating) stood at the hostess table for at least another ten minutes. The hell? My buzzer rang, seat me! <br><br>Eventually got seated. My waitress asked us what drink we wanted and...well...disappeared. Didn&#39;t hear from her for another fifteen minutes. Finally got our drinks and bread, and we chowed down  faster than you can say carbohydrates. Didn&#39;t come by for another fifteen, but we were in such bread heaven and gossip central that we didn&#39;t mind. <br><br>I got the lunch portion Caesar salad, which was better than usual! It was actually pretty delicious, and I would definitely go back for just that! <br>I also got the lunch pasta Da Vinci, with fried eggplant. Couldn&#39;t even finish it, there was NO fried eggplants, just an overall weird sauce. <br><br>Friend got the turkey club and loved it. Other friend got the kale salad (which she said was awesome) and chicken bellagio, and was satisfied. <br><br>Overall, it was ok. Waitress was just a bit unorganized, but whatever. Mediocre is all I expect from this place.

I can&#39;t remember the server&#39;s name, but he provided pretty good service.  A nice young man with dashing blond hair.<br><br>I ordered the orange chicken which I haven&#39;t had in years.  The last time I had it was probably 7 years ago and I didn&#39;t like it, but I decided to try it again out of curiosity, to see what it was I didn&#39;t like about it back then.  Oddly enough, I enjoyed it.  It had a slight taste of orange to it, stronger than what you&#39;d find at Panda Express.  The chicken was tender and the batter was not too tough or hard.  They give you a good amount of rice which I wasn&#39;t able to finish. <br><br>We also ordered my favorite dessert there, or at least it used to be.  I haven&#39;t had it in awhile either since I don&#39;t come here often, but I had it pretty hyped up in my head.  Strawberry Shortcake.  Vanilla ice cream, a biscuit, strawberries, strawberry glaze, and way too much whipped cream.  I think it met my expectations.  It was good.  I had to move the whipped cream aside, though.

I&#39;m writing my review in this particular location b/c it&#39;s where I discovered this......<br><br>Red Velvet Cheesecake: better save extra room for that, folks!  Who would&#39;ve thought that a Chain Restaurant not only has one of the best cheesecakes, but it has the best red velvet ever (in a chain restaurant!) WITH the best cheesecake in America.<br><br>Although I do prefer referring to local eateries, I do dreadfully recommend this for starters...those who NEVER tried red velvet cake o_o.
This place sucks ass. They told me I&#39;d be seated in 45 minutes. I&#39;m currently writing this review after 70 minutes of waiting. Very unsatisfied with the service here.
Great location, typical cheese cake factory with always the best food and service, love to sit in the patio there. We had our 1st day and date over  ever there with my husband several years ago

Jessie the bartender was extremely rude, unapologetic and beyond unprofessional. The worst cheesecake experience ever and I will not get into detail. However, Ashley the manager turned the whole situation around. She turned my friends birthday from a nightmare to a fairytale .. We appreciate awesome customer service and managers who could be leaders and about customer satisfaction. Thank you Ashely! True definition in upmost management. You&#39;re the best!!!
Terrible service, extremely long wait, inattentive waiters, average food, won&#39;t come back.

Went as a big group and got seated quickly. Food was great. The only reason why I wouldn&#39;t go back to this specific one is because the waiters tend chase after you and harass you about how unhappy they are about the tip we left. That&#39;s so uncomfortable and honestly rude.

The Cheesecake Factory started a Happy Hour! And what a great deal their Happy Hour is. Select drinks and select appetizers for $5 each from 3-6pm at the bar. I`m sure we all know that The Cheesecake Factory`s prices can be kind of steep, so to order something for $5 with a generous portion is right up my alley.<br><br>Originally, the boyfriend and I wanted to order from the full menu, but when he saw that they had a happy hour, we ended up walking towards the bar and sat in they`re high tables. It was literally a minute past 6:00, but the waiter was so nice to let us order from the Happy Hour menu if we decided quickly.<br><br>I got a Cosmopolitan to drink while my boyfriend stuck to water (he`s not much of a drinker). He ordered the Southern Fried Chicken Sliders, Buffalo Blasts, and the Factory Nachos from their Happy Hour menu. I still wanted to order something from the full menu because I was craving their Chicken Bellagio, which I ordered.<br><br>I got my Cosmo and it was yummy. I wanted to get another drink, however, the Happy Hour was over and the Cosmo was really strong. I don`t think I would`ve been able to handle another one. All the appetizers came out at once and my boyfriend underestimated how much it was going to be. I told him that they`re full-sized appetizers and that he had it coming. I pointed to all the food and told him &#34;this is all you, honey.&#34;<br><br>The Southern Fried Chicken Sliders I liked a lot. They use the Chicken Littles from their entree menu and put them in between two buns with shredded lettuce, tomato, and onions with a side of mustard and pickles. I`ve had the Buffalo Blasts before, and I didn`t really like them, but my boyfriend enjoyed them very much. He loves buffalo wings, so this appetizer was totally made for him. The Factory Nachos were huge, but there wasn`t really anything special to them. Chips, melted shredded cheese, jalepenos, sour cream, and guacamole.<br><br>When my Chicken Bellagio came out, I was really excited. The last time I was at a Cheesecake Factory, my cousin had ordered it, I tried it, and I said to myself that I was going to order that the next time, and I kept to that. And it was as good as I remember. Crispy chicken breast on top of basil pasta in a parmesan cream sauce topped with thinly sliced proscuitto and arugala salad. Oh my god, so yum! I have added a new favorite to the many favorites I have from the Cheesecake Factory.

So I&#39;m not going to write a review about the food so much just because it&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory, and if you&#39;ve eaten at one then you already know what the food is like. Although I do have to say that the sheer size of the menu is ridiculous because I can never decide what to get. <br><br>Anyways...I had a business lunch here today with some colleagues and vendors. First of all we had a reservation at 1pm and were there 10min early. We checked in with the desk and they rudely told us that if the entire party was not there at 1pm on the dot we would lose our reservation. Suffice it to say, we were all there on time and 15min later when asking if our table was ready yet, they informed us that they were waiting for another party to leave before seating us. Another 15min roll by and our table is still not ready and for some reason they don&#39;t think to find another open table for us. So we speak to a manager who ends up seating us in the bar area which is fine at this point since we&#39;re all starving. <br><br>So we sit down and wait another 20min before the manager brings us spinach dip and avocado eggroll appetizers on the house and tells us our drink orders will be coming soon. To which we reply that no one has come to take our drink orders. <br><br>After this point, service did get much better. Most likely because the manager made it a point to assign one of their best servers to us and frequently checked if everything was alright. It wasn&#39;t a horrible experience but since it&#39;s a huge chain, if I was going to go to Cheesecake Factory, I&#39;d try another location and avoid the one at Americana.

Went to the Cheesecake Factory on a fri. Night. Amazing food, staff and evening. Will definitely go back. The bartender made the best Mint Julep for me - tomorrow is the Ky Derby. Thank u for a great evening with my husband.

Ok let&#39;s start with the lemonade! My friend ordered the Strawberry lemonade, which looked amazing (and didn&#39;t have the bits of strawberries that get stuck in the straw - which i cannot stand). He made it look like he was drinking the best thing ever! So I had a zip (mind you they rim the glass with SUGAR) and I was in love I had to order one for myself, and then another one after that haha. The food was great - good portions and surprisingly delicious. 4 stars, because at the end of the day - their menu is so overwhelming - too many options.

I&#39;ll keep this short.<br><br>The cheesecake: 5 stars, especially the seasonal pumpkin one. OMG.<br><br>The entrees/food: 2.5 stars. Eh, it&#39;s AIGHHHT. It&#39;s more like I come here for the cheesecake and just get food because it seems like the right thing to do.<br><br>The service: -992489083409832 stars. They have TERRIBLE service. TERRIBLE TERRIBLE SHITTY TERRIBLE. Our waiter was Kevin and he took FOREVER to do anything. We actually had to get up and ask the manager to find our waiter for us to take our order. LAME. Then, after delivering our food, he disappeared for the rest of the night although he would tend to all the tables next to us. DOUCHE. <br><br>Worst thing? We order a slice of pumpkin cheesecake. He asks &#34;original or pecan?&#34; We say original. Then, he brings us a slice of normal original (non-pumpkin) cheesecake. We send it back--we figure, honest mistake. He takes literally DAYS to get us another slice. This time we ask for it to-go. He asks again &#34;original or pecan?&#34; We say original. He puts it in a bag for us and we (stupidly) did not check the bag since we figured theres no way he&#39;d screw up twice. WRONG. We got home and it&#39;s a slice of pecan cheesecake. WOW. REALLY?! REALLY?! WTF! <br><br>UGH.<br><br>Go here if you want, but seriously, if you get Kevin as your waiter...get moved to another section.

This is by far my favorite Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s so much prettier than most of the other Cheesecake Factory&#39;s I&#39;ve seen. <br><br>The 2 times I&#39;ve been there, I had a pleasant experience. The first time, my server was Ben, and I love Ben. Omg. He&#39;s so awesome. I was trying to try new food because I&#39;d promised my best friend I would, so I asked Ben to help me out. I described what I liked to eat and we concluded with the Pasta Di Vinci w/Fettucini (because I love fettucini). And when I had it, it was the best thing I&#39;d ever had @ Cheesecake Factory. And after I got my food, he came back and asked to see if I enjoyed it and it really seemed like he cared. He was very friendly &amp; prompt. After that, our server switched and she wasn&#39;t nearly as awesome as Ben, but she still made an effort.<br><br>The second time I was there, the server was also good. The food was delicious. And despite my party being a bit difficult, our server managed to pull through with a smile. Food was also delicious this time too. <br><br>All-in-all, my favorite Cheesecake Factory.

Service is always good here. The food is mostly good. The quality is consistent. In my opinion, everything is good except for the tex-mex items (just go to Frida if you are in the mood for mex, also in the American)<br><br>For breakfast/brunch, I would recommend omelet or the hanger steak (cooked med-rare) with eggs.<br><br>For the rest of the menu... salads are perfectly dressed, chops and steaks are cooked to perfect doneness as you desire. <br><br>But items heavy with sauce can be on the salty-side... The sauces seem over-seasoned.

We got seated right away (that&#39;s for the stars).<br><br>Next we ordered food and I ordered a beer. The beer arrives right when I barely had two bites left of my meal. Gee thanks!<br><br>Later, our waitress brought in a sub, so she could take her break; which in itself is fine. But when the sub brought back the credit-card slip to be signed, she left the check-holder and dashed off, but forgot to leave us a pen for signature and tip. Seriously?! Is that code for not wanting a tip? I should have just left instead of having my friend look for a pen in her purse.
First option to my family, great service and food but better to go early on the weekends.

A bug was in my glass of Chardonnay tonight but things happen, and we were super nice and understanding about it. I guess that&#39;s where we went wrong. We told our waiter and the manager came over to apologize; however no other courtesy was extended to us. No comped drink, no discount, etc... Really disappointing, because it is quite disgusting to find bugs in your food, some act of kindness would&#39;ve been nice. Guess we should&#39;ve been bitches and made a bigger deal about it. Not returning.

I usually love going here for any type of food, but after yesterday I must say it was so dissapointing. I ordered the club chicken sandwhich i asked for wheat bread. They put it in the rolls you get when you first sit on the table. I dont think my dog would eat it. It was so small and so not worth the $14 i paid for. Also got the chinese chicken salad, it tasted like I was eating fish. Im not sure if its just this location, usually I dont have problems with cheescake.
The wait is nothing I&#39;m a fan of.  The food is good but service is always challenging.

Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp is awesom! Black beans, mango salsa and spicy shrimps are perfect match.<br>I&#39;m not a cheesecake fan but still their Hersey Chocolate Cheesecake is rich and unforgettable.

So we were getting lunch there, right? Since we were in a hurry, we ordered something simple. I noticed a young couple sit at the table across from us about 5-10 min. after we ordered.The next thing I know the couple is served. Are we served? No! We even told the waiter we were in a hurry! But of course he didn&#39;t listen! And yes, we were almost late for our prior engagement. Based on this information, you should take our advice and NOT go to &#34;The Cheesecake Factory,&#34; EVER AGAIN!!!

Awesome place to eat @ the Americana!!!! The wait time to be seated for 4 people was 7 mins!!! Im guessing we came @ the right time hahaha Our server Brittany was awesome. Very helpful in deciding with foods and drinks. Overall, I would recommend this Cheesecake Factory location to all :]

Eat there today and thought the avocados in the avocado egg rolls which I usually love and turns out it made my girl and I an upset stomache.  Disappointed  to say the least. It&#39;s been a fav place on mine.

DIRTY DIRTY DIRTY!!! Just because the lights are dimmed doesn&#39;t mean the customer is blind &amp; can&#39;t see the filth of this place. I don&#39;t care how busy they are the customers health comes first. When they first opened it was nice &amp; clean but now it&#39;s nasty and dirty! Hey Health Dept it&#39;s time you drop by this place &amp; shut it down!

Another amazing experience at Cheesecake Factory. The service was spot on, the portions were just right, the quality of the food was superb, and the menu prices are very reasonable for what it is. Great bread for starters..<br><br>Can&#39;t wait to go back.. =)

Good overall food and service; cheesecakes are obviously bomb(though a bit on the sweet side). The cons would have to be long line and large portions. They give too much food so I always end up feeling full at halfway and no matter how yummy I can never finish. Usually it&#39;s the three of us sharing two meals but even then we only finish half. I guess this could be a good thing for those who like to eat once a day or something.

I was very disappointed  because this was my first time going and I don&#39;t think I want to come back gist my salad was over cheesy and plain then I open up my silverware and it was disgusting it had food and hair on it and I think they should have given us one of our meals for free and the waiting service was horrible

**Reviewing their service<br><br>Gotta love their cheesecakes right? If you&#39;d give me the right order, then maybe I would!<br><br>My brother and I came here for lunch. Service was fine. Our waitress was friendly in an &#34;okay why are you still staring at me and smiling, just go do your job&#34; kinda way. Everything was fine until it was time to order desert. I told my brother he could pick the two cheesecakes. He decided on the choc. chip cookie dough one and the other was a brownie sundae, or something like that. We get our order and I dig into what was supposed to be the choc. chip cookie dough one. Why does it taste like peanut butter? I call the waitress over and ask if my cheesecake has peanut butter in it. She says yea it&#39;s the choc. chip peanut butter cookie dough cheesecake. I said, that&#39;s not what we ordered, we wanted it without peanut butter. She told us that&#39;s how it comes. So I pointed out that my bro and I were sharing and he is allergic to peanuts. All she has to offer is an I&#39;m sorry. Okay, this didn&#39;t make sense to me at all because why would someone who is allergic to peanuts order something with peanut butter. We checked the menu as we left, we ordered correctly and she fudged it up.<br><br>She could have done a number of things to redeem herself like offer us another slice or admit that she was wrong. It&#39;s not my fault you don&#39;t know your own menu. We even pointed at it on the menu when you took our order. But nooooo. <br><br>Well that&#39;s my story. Unfortunately for the Cheesecake Factory, they have some horrible employees. Otherwise, they would have gotten about a 3.5 star rating. Try again next time!
The quality of the service, the food, the vibe and the neatess is unsatisfactory in comparison to other visits to other branches with way much better experience. Very disappointing

Waiting can be a hassle but a least you can walk around the shops  while you wait. I had the Factory Nachos, which to my surprise were very good. Had a Stella, like always. They toast the chips before they put the toppings on which make for good Nachos in my opinion. The thicker chips can handle all the toppings without getting soggy.

When to Cheese Cake Factory for my son&#39;s birthday, as always I ordered the Fish &amp; Chip, to my disappointment I only got 5 fish nuggets and fries with coleslaw.  I realized times are tough but for $16.95 I should at lease get 2 decent size pieces of fish. The fish looks like it belongs in a kid&#39;s meal ! After all its the &#34;FISH&#34; that makes the fish &amp; chips, not the frozen fries or the coleslaw, they are just sides. REALLY !!

I came with a buddy and were promptly seated outside. Once seated, i ordered a Blue Moon and it came out cold and refreshing. I ordered a Jamaican shrimp plate which was flavorful. Our waitress, although very sweet and nice, was wearing sunglasses and not checking in frequently. <br>We ordered several cheesecakes to share and taste...banana creme which was suprisngly my favorite, mango lime which was tarty but forgetabble, and godiva which was heavenly

I will NEVER understand why we keep eating here under the Eye of Sauron. There&#39;s always a long wait. One does not simply walk into a Cheesecake Factory and find seating right away. <br><br>The place is always super packed, the seating is always uncomfortable and the food is always mediocre and boring. <br>Every Cheesecake I&#39;ve ever been to has been a disappointment. <br><br>Why?! Why do we do this to ourselves!? From now on when someone suggests this place I&#39;ll just go ahead and stab myself in the eye with a fork. <br><br>Every single dish I&#39;ve had has been boring and bland. I&#39;ve never gotten sick from it like some people have, but then again maybe I&#39;m part goat. I can digest almost anything. However, I still have taste buds and enjoy a tasty meal. <br><br>Also, you can NEVER find your waiter/waitress when you need them. They&#39;re probably all hiding from possible Orcs. Ugh.<br><br>I&#39;m not even a LoTRs fan, but seriously..... have you seen the light fixtures over the booths. That&#39;s evil staring at you while you eat your crappy meal.

I usually just grab a slice of cheesecake or two than I am out and I don&#39;t know why I am never in the mood to dine here, not once. But with the opening of Glendale Pacific Cheesecake nearby it loo. <br>I dine, once in a blue moon, at the Old Town Pasadena location but never here. <br>It must be the bougie environment, that must be it!
This place is heaven!!! I got the Kobe burger and it was the best ever!!! I want to come every day!! I love the service is the best!!!

I have only eaten here for weekday lunch. They have half salads that are great portion. They serve breakfast all day, which I love. Its usually too busy to eat at on the weekends, so I recommend to avoid.  The service is okay, and the parking in the plaza is okay.

Literally the absolute worst cheesecake factory location i&#39;ve ever been to. I live in the area but would make the DRIVE to the Grove location just to avoid this awful service. I ordered two identical four cheese pasta dishes to go. One of them was great, the other was plain without any cheese and the pasta was FOUR cheese pasta. How do you let an order be sent out without the main ingredient? My order came out to $35 and i got what tasted like high school cafeteria style spaghetti noodles with marinara sauce. All was fine until i called to complain and the man at the front desk told me he would connect me to a manager. I stayed on the line for 10 minutes and still no one said a word.
