I have to listen to their hold songs on repeat starving because i can&#39;t eat this crappy pasta because i do not want to get sick. So beyond upset. I feel like they are keeping me on the line just so i give up and they don&#39;t have to refund me!! DONT GO TO THIS LOCATION!!! Get your pasta somewhere else

The customer service at this place is awesome. Came here for my boyfriends birthday dinner. Our waitress was Jessica. She was super friendly and welcoming. We did have an issue with our food order. I had order ordered an everything pizza and when I finally got it and was burnt all over. When we complained to the waitress; without hesitation she apologizes and takes the pizza back. A few minutes the manager Bryan  comes comes to our table and apologizes himself about the pizza. He then tells he himself is paying for my dinner and I get a brand new pizza. I was in impress with the customer services

The location is great. Outside sitting has advantage of nice view of Americana and the fountains. The wait is a little too long. 45 min of wait and bout 15 after you have been texted. We waited bout 20min for burgers that were ordered well done. It&#39;s fun but the wait is too long sometimes. Food is good.

O.K.; I&#39;m a little...HUMILIATED...by how much I tried but...<br><br>Here&#39;s a brief breakdown of what I thought...(scale is five stars like Yelp)...<br><br>Buffalo wings: 5 (best I&#39;ve had anywhere honestly)<br><br>Arugula salad: 2<br><br>Asparagus salad:2.5<br><br>Medori sour: 5<br><br>Pasta marinara: 4.5<br><br>Scrimp scampi: 5<br><br>Garlic noodles with shrimp: 2.5<br><br>Weight management chicken medallions:5<br><br>Stuffed olives: 1<br><br>Spinach (side): 1<br><br>Low carb cheesecake: 5<br><br>Ceasar salad: 2<br><br>Mushroom pizetta: 3<br><br>Shrimp crostini:3<br><br>Wasabi ahi: 3.75-4<br><br>I KNOW!  I KNOW!  <br><br>It&#39;s kind of...a little bit...sort of...A LOT!<br><br>My head is low, believe me.<br><br>Service was good.  Bathroom was clean.  We got served quickly.  On balance a good experience.

Slow and horrible service. Make sure you check your spoons, forks, and knives. We had to request for a new set 3 times because they had food on it. Their water glasses are old and should be replaced at least every couple of months. We had to ask for new glasses because they looked so gross to drink out of. Expect slow service because the place is just too busy with too many people. Very disappointed with this Cheesecake in particular. All the ones I&#39;ve been to don&#39;t have this problem. Good Luck!

There are hundreds of chain restaurants that I can sit here and hate on w/ these good ol yelp reviews, but I instead choose to write about the really great ones,<br><br>Cheesecake factory is no exception...having the backdrop of the americana fountains when u sit on their patio doesn&#39;t hurt the review either.<br><br>Went to lunch with the family here, and decided to venture away from my usual cobb salad (which is fantastic) and try the chinese chicken salad...yet again a wonderful option at the factory.<br><br>Topped with mandarin oranges, chicken breast, crispy noodles, and a mixed in sometype of tangy vinagarette...this salad nails it, and was plenty for dinner.  The portion was huge and priced at 12.99.<br><br>The service was pretty accomodating and I was equally impressed with the grt view that we had of the &#34;water show&#34; at the americana...the ppl watching that comes along with it...doesn&#39;t hurt either:)<br><br>We also ordered some type of jambalya dish that my aunt was hundred percent pleased with and my little cousin got some type of chicken bacon club with avacado slices that was fantastivc..<br><br>Never a dissapointment here...

This was the perfect late night meal. The only place in the area open past 10pm on weekday.  Closing is listed at 11 but when we walked out after we were done eating at 11:15 there were still other customers lingering.  Being out late after watching the sunset and viewing the stars at the Griffith observatory, we jumped on bus line 180/181 which dropped us off right in front of Cheesecake Factory.  Due to the late hour, we had no wait time for a table.<br><br>Our waiter Robert was very pleasant, attentive, and very knowledgeable about the huge menu.  His recommendations were spot on.<br><br>The food was delicious and well portioned for hungry tourists like us.  We all enjoyed our food:<br>Sliders and fries from kids menu (fries crisp on outside, fluffy in center)<br>Chicken Littles - large pile of crispy chicken strips with corn mix and mashed potatoes<br>Chicken Madiera - moist thin chicken <br>Lemon Herb Chicken

I&#39;ve never EVER been to this restaurant. I&#39;ve heard so many good and bad things about this place.<br>So my co worker and I finally took me during lunch time and OMG. I am a fan of cheesecake. We got the Beer Battered Fish &amp; Chips and The Smokehouse BBQ Burger. OMG, sooo delishhh....<br><br>The food was fabulous and the portions are huge<br>The staff&#39;s are very friendly and very professional and always with a smile<br>The ambiance was great<br>The view of the fountain was beautiful<br>Restrooms - cleaned<br><br>The place got crowded by 1230.<br>other than that this place is GREAT!!!<br>would definitely come back again.........

I went for Brunch and the manager Chris was called to deal with our food that was made wrong.  The manager Chris gave horrible customer service with an attitude.  It took twice as long to bring the food out and when we asked Chris how much longer,  he raised his voice and said &#34;I don&#39;t know! &#34;

I heart Cheesecake Factory! But I never seem to venture off and try something new from the usual 2-3 dishes I rotate from. I love the Shepherd&#39;s Pie with ground beef, mushrooms, peas, carrots, zucchini and onions in a yummy gravy topped off with mashed potatoes.  This last time, I for the Louisiana Chicken Pasta-it was mmm mmm good! Breaded and seasoned chicken breasts with red and yellow peppers, red onions, and mushrooms in a mild cajun sauce on a bed of farfalle pasta.  My friend had the Crispy Chicken Costoletta that looked equally good.<br><br>For dessert (heck, you are at Cheesecake-you HAVE to save for dessert!) my friend had the dulce de leche caramel.  It was light and delish all around!  I had the chocolate raspberry truffle cuz I wanted one with chocolate ganache.  It sure did not disappoint.<br><br>This is a really nice location to take a date, especially if you sit out on the patio overlooking the water fountain that dances to music every 15min or 1/2 hr.  Service was prompt and pleasant for a Thursday night.

It&#39;s aug 2nd 10:13 pm. I&#39;m waiting to be seated and it&#39;s such a packed house. So many people making orders and requesting tables. Lots of people being demanding and rude. You guys are doing great. Vanessa at the front is handeling the traffic very well. There&#39;s no way I could take or handle all of this mayhem. You guys are awesome. Keep it up!

I have been waiting to get a table for almost 2 house. The workers keep on giving me stupid excuses. I wish that I could give -5 stars. I went to the worker and she said about 10 minutes so I went back 10 minutes later and she said 10 more minutes. It&#39;s really pathetic that I have to wait 2 hours to get a table.

For Food you would get a 4.5 review but because I had so many bad experiences I only give a 3.<br><br>I love the food (Pasta Carbonara my FAV!!!!) I get and that&#39;s why I continue to go back but maybe it&#39;s time to find a different location.<br><br>I LOVE the Americana at Brand and I love Cheese Cake Factory my complaints come from staff and bad service.<br><br>The first time I went there the staff didn&#39;t seem friendly or attentive. They seemed like young kids who didn&#39;t care too much about the job. I felt customer service training was needed.<br><br>The last time I was there I don&#39;t feel welcomed when I&#39;m there, feel rushed and the last time I was there the dishes were dirty and food under the table and all they did was switch the dishes out, I guess I expected more when you serve me with dirty dishes and filthy floor.

Normally I don&#39;t like the Cheesecake Factory, but somehow the ambience at the Americana improves it tremendously.<br><br>I was particularly appreciative of our very attentive and accommodating waitresses who were able to help us make a dish agreeable for my husband&#39;s various dietary requirements.<br><br>No sugar, no flour, no balsamic...<br><br>He ended up with a Cobb Salad, and we had to specially request Olive Oil and Red Wine Vinegar on the side - with success!<br><br>The Pasta Carbonara I had was delicious too :)

Their menu is good and they have plenty of options to choose from. <br>I love their salads!!!  My personal favorite is the French country salad - it&#39;s just very well put together. <br>I also Love their salmon dishes! They prepare them in several ways and I, including my family like them a lot. <br>The last but not the least is the bar!<br>Their drinks are good and their mojitos are the best in town!

Sometimes you want to go<br>Where everybody knows your name,<br>and they&#39;re always glad you came.<br>You want to be where you can see<br>our troubles are all the same.<br>You wanna be where everybody knows<br>your name.<br><br>... Only you don&#39;t, since everybody knows your name because<br>you all went to the same high school. Gag me.<br><br>And shame on you if you think Cheesecake Factory is fine dining.

I had lunch with my daughter yesterday, she &amp; I love to dine here. I like the fact that there are many dishes to choose from and any one you choose won&#39;t leave you broke. Yes, the wait can be a bit long at times, but i feel it is worth it. My faves include the chicken bellagio(delicious), pasta cabonara, farro salad, and turkey burger from the skinnylicious menu. For dessert, you must try the fresh banana cheesecake, it&#39;s like heaven in your mouth. I will continue to take my family there, food never disappoints and you always get service with a smile.:)

Went on Monday night, very crowded. Wait was about what they said it would be. Food was good, consistent with other Cheesecake Factories I&#39;ve been to. Service was good, not great.<br>Vanilla bean cheesecake is out of this world as always.

For a chain (should I admit I hate chains), this place has pretty good food.  Normally chains have tasteless faire for the masses but Cheesecake factory just gives you masses of food.  The portions are huge.  This is the perfect place to share with a friend or a crush.  <br><br>It was 3:00pm on a weekday afternoon and there was a wait at the door so my friend and I went to the bar where we scored a small table. Why do hostesses tell you there is a 5-10 minute wait when there are 3 open to the public tables in the bar.  Hello.<br><br>One of the hostesses had a banner across her chest like Miss America that read Miss Cheesecake. She said it was a pretty slow day?  Really a wait at 3:00.  Maybe she wasn&#39;t the brightest (recall the open tables) but she sure was cute.<br><br>My waitress was just as bright.  My friend asked for a salad with something other than Salmon, waitress looked purplexed said there wasn&#39;t another option, I said how about Tuna, she said no.  Then I ordered the Ahi Salad.  Note to Waitress:  Ahi is Tuna.<br><br>I feel like I am picking so I should play nice. The waitress handed us off to another waiter (thank goodness) who was as cute as a bug and gave us marriage advice to boot.  I just wanted to pinch his cheeks.

I have been here a couple of times. 1st when it opened. that was okay it was busy and basically I had a kick ass server, I remembered I ordered the lemon chicken it was bad. Okay moving on like a year later I had to meet up my mom because she was shopping and got hungry so we meet up and it was 4;30, she was doing the happy hour thing and the waiter was shit. Then like a year later I was coming with a classmate of mine who was nice enough to buy me dessert and the waitress kept flirting with her manager and ignoring us after a few minutes she came over. My classmate was indecisive so I told her to come back in a few, she took our order the second time, proceeded to flirt with her manager again, dropped off the check and it took her like 15 minutes.(Obviously it wasn&#39;t busy so customer service should have been awesome but it sorely lacked.) Now I won&#39;t even come here because of the fact that the servers are mainly shit and the only time they give decent customer service is when they are packed. NOPE instead I dive to Pasadena much better service.

It&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory. The food is consistently good. Large selection of menu options to choose from, each one as good as the next. <br><br>The seating situation is often disorganized and it is always best to request a booth otherwise you may end up elbow to elbow with complete strangers and unable to hear anything.<br><br>A bit pricey considering it&#39;s a chain that advertises in it&#39;s menu.

Went there on 7/22. Worst experience ever. I ordered the mushroom soup, ribeye steak, and pasta with shrimp and sausages. It was multiple screw ups tonight. First I cut my lips on a chipped glass. Then they drop off a steak 30 secs after my soup came with wrong starch. Later to find out that it wasn&#39;t my steak. Then my steak came and brought me the wrong starch again. I order my steak rare and it came out med/rare and dry. I was so hungry I tried to eat it but I only can  finish half the steak because it was so salty and dry. Later on manager came by ask me what my opinion is and I gave her my 2 cents. Obviously the steak and the pasta was fire at the same time. So the steak dried out under the heat lamp hence all the juice came out. That is why the steak was swimming in plate. What kill me even more after the night of horror is the manager. She came up never introduced herself and said I ate too much of the steak lol. came back with the check and said &#34; try to run a business here so I only charge you for the steak and wine&#34;. Cheesecake factory is one of my all time favorite because of the consistency. The kitchen and the front of the house has successfully made me not want to go back to any Cheesecake Factory again. One bad apple makes the bunch look bad

We came to this restaurant because of the skinny-licious menu options. We had to wait about 45 minutes to be seated, and then were seated right next to the server computer station. Our server (Chad) was great; friendly and helpful. However, when we got the menus, they were incredibly grimy, with dampness, visible food smears and food remnants. This dirtiness did not inspire confidence in the overall cleanliness of the restaurant. Despite the disgusting beginning, our food was very good. I loved the warm asparagus salad and the grilled artichoke. My mom loved her mini crab cakes. Good food, a bit too expensive, good service. Way too busy, too crowded, and please clean the menus.

The food here has always been a decent 4 and I don&#39;t usually review big chains, but I had to give them mad props for a recent change to their wine list. They started offering half glasses - brilliant!  With a few dozen wines to choose from, they essentially turned their bar into a wine tasting spot (for me anyway). Love the idea and I hope more place do it.  Got the Stump Jump Shiraz and Wild Horse Pinot Noir...and the Lakers are winning. Feeling pretty good.

This is a go to date night restaurant for my boyfriend and I. We have been coming here for years and absolutely love their food. The calamari here is our favorite calamari for sure! The service is great, and even though the wait is about an hour on the weekends it&#39;s okay because there is so much to do in the Americana that that hour passes by so quickly. Will always be a returning customer!
Good prices, good food, good service !! My favorite thing to get is the Santa Fe salad!!! Deliciousness! Also the avocado egg rolls are a must! Fried zucchini is really yummy!!

Their National favorite dish is, I believe, the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta.<br><br>It was a bright and sunny Wednesday. I felt like taking my father to lunch plus it&#39;s been months since I had the Cajun Jambalaya.<br><br>My order came and it was the most bland and uneventful taste I&#39;ve ever had. I say uneventful because y&#39;know when you&#39;ve had a wonderful mix of all those spices, you feel like a mini roller coaster exploded in your mouth. <br><br>No roller coasters this time. I ordered a Cosmopolitan thinking maybe I need a drink for this. Nuh-uh. Did not work.<br><br>This lady, I don&#39;t know if she&#39;s the manager, but she was going around asking patrons how their food is. Lucky that I haven&#39;t touched much of my food but she did look at my dish and told me it was odd looking.<br><br>Now, that doesn&#39;t really appease me that someone said it was odd-looking. I immediately thought about my stomach and an image of frequent bathroom breaks.<br><br>The lady immediately took my food and brought me a menu. She insisted on replacing my meal but having lost my appetite already, I just settled for the bread and butter... and downing my Cosmo.<br><br>I was really pleased when we got the bill and they didn&#39;t charge me for the pasta. I thought they would and I was ready to get upset.<br><br>Pleasurable experience overall.<br><br>Oh and no bathroom trips when I got home! =)

I&#39;ve really never understood the national fascination with this place.  Back in the college days at the University of Oklahoma in Norman, there was no Cheesecake Factory, but in Dallas, TX, a short 2 1/2 hour drive away was one of these chain restaurants that somehow fall under fine dining... in the freshmen year if you wanted to be the best date around, you&#39;d drive your girl to Dallas and take her to the ole&#39; Factory of Cheesecakes.  It was such a big deal...<br><br>Well, it seems the people of Glendale, CA feel the same way.  This new Cheesecake Factory is always crowded, always has a ridiculous wait, and the food isn&#39;t that incredible, it wasn&#39;t in Dallas and it&#39;s not here.  I mean yea, it food is &#34;good&#34;,  yeah the cheesecake is &#34;good&#34; and yes the servers have to go through some crazy server training to work here, but goddamn, it&#39;s not fucking Morton&#39;s!<br><br>It&#39;s the same as them all...  if you like Cheesecake Factory you&#39;ll like this one.

Food&#39;s good for corporate joint.  Can&#39;t complain about anything else except for the fact that it&#39;s the second time I&#39;ve gone there with the kids and was seated at the bar.  I&#39;m pretty old school and I don&#39;t think kids should be at the bar.<br><br>Not cool so you get a 3 star.....

I came here with my girlfriend for my birthday and had a great dinner. I got the Louisiana chicken pasta and she had the da Vinci pasta. The food was amazing but when we were seated we didn&#39;t not get any bread and butter until we asked for it. Other than that, service was great and food was on point. Definitely a great cheesecake factory. <br><br>Also they surprised me with a cheesecake and sang me happy birthday! Awesome staff!

I don&#39;t really like the cheescake factory. The ambiance is ok but the food is way over rated. I&#39;ve eaten the food a few times and really can&#39;t/wouldn&#39;t suggest anything. I mean it&#39;s an ok place to take a date if she doesn&#39;t know any better. if you haven&#39;t eaten here, try it but don&#39;t go back. <br><br>This location is nice, big, if you eat outside you can see the water show at the Americana. If you do decide to eat here I suggest to eat outside on a warm night, the whole atmosphere of the Americana and with the water show it can be quite beautiful. <br><br>I usually just go in and get a drink, maybe an appetizer. I go here mostly just because it stays open later than any restaurant in the Americana..

This restaurant really isn&#39;t bad, I just was not extremely impressed by it.<br>It&#39;s a really large space and if you come at the right moments the wait time for a table isn&#39;t longer than 10 minutes. The menu is super humongous so it&#39;s ridiculously difficult to decide what to order. I ended up ordering Pasta with Chicken and Scampi Sauce. It took a while to arrive at our table (about 30 minutes or so). The pasta and sauce were so heavy, but delicious. They went crazy with the chicken and the garnish though. There were so many pieces of chicken that I started thinking that I ordered Chicken with Pasta and Scampi sauce instead. Normally I wouldn&#39;t mind such a generous helping for the price paid, but the chicken was weird and bumpy looking on the outside (as if it still had skin on), not sure why. The herb garnish was so thick that it started to get in the way of the pasta at one point. Of course I had no room for dessert after that large plate of pasta--I couldn&#39;t even finish it! <br><br>The service here was alright. My friend and I split the bill--I paid part of it with card and she paid her portion with cash. The server made the mistake of assuming that my friend&#39;s change is his tip so he kept it and just brought back the receipt. I mean, there wasn&#39;t much change so it probably would have all been his tip, but assuming that right off the bat and keeping it is kind of annoying. He should have waited until she left the tip at the end instead. <br><br>Not a bad place for dinner once in a while, but the service and overindulgent portions of heavy food will probably keep me away from here for a while.
I love this place! The four cheese pasta is the best I get it every time. Let&#39;s not get started on their cheesecake they are delicious.

The people here are extremely rude and unfriendly.  We were first greeted by a host that seemed like he was about to quit.  He was the dark tall guy with bleach hair.  The management here also didn&#39;t seem friendly at all.   I could go on and on but what&#39;s the point.  I won&#39;t be coming back.

For something like the Cheesecake Factory, you would expect a better quality product. The food was dense and left me feeling empty, both physically and emotionally. The food lacked a sense of creativity, and when they truly tried- it failed. The guacamole was still left in hard lumps and needed salt; while their fries were unnecessarily soggy. I do have to say however, that their service is good -and the bread is always a plus.

For the prices I pay at Cheesecake Factory, I expect to get great service.  What we got today was far from it.  We asked for bread twice and finally got it with our meal.  We asked for refills for our drinks and ended up refilling them ourselves since the refill station happened to be located behind us.  Our fries were cold with our burger.  And the spicy crispy chicken sandwich had no flavor unless you covered it with the blue cheese dressing.  <br><br>After all that, we waited 10 minuted for the waitress to come back to charge our credit card for the bill.  I ended up taking the bill to the manager to pay.  He was nice enough to take one of the entrees off of the bill, but it didn&#39;t make up for the terrible service.

There were people coming into Chessecake Factory every few minutes, but the wait was not long... about 10 minutes. The host was extremely professional, polite, and helpful for our big group. <br><br>Our server however, possessed such plain service. Not good nor bad, just plain. She brought our drinks, orders, then our check. She never checked on our side of the table to see if we were okay, nor did she bring refills. Not once did I see her smile or say you&#39;re welcome. <br><br>Bathrooms are small for such a big restaurant with capacity 500+ so you&#39;ll be elbowing other women around the sink area.<br><br>A friend and I split a steak diane and shrimp scampi with mashed potatoes, which was good the last time I tried it. But this time it didn&#39;t hit the spot. It might have been because of the cold temperature of the food.<br><br>Parking can be validated at the hosts&#39; desk.

Quick Tip: They validate your parking ticket. <br><br>Good service, our waiter was friendly, food came out faster than I have expected (they were extremely busy), drinks are strong. <br><br>I had the Evelyn Pasta w/chicken and my friend ordered the Spicy Jambalaya Pasta, both dishes were delicious.

Try their Appetizer Rolls! you&#39;ll like their tiramisu and yum cheesckakes for sure!!! I like the Americana&#39;s view when you are on the patio! I&#39;ve been there recently with my professor and classmates celebrating successfully passed finals. We were about 15 or more people with different orders, and without any previous reservation, our table was ready in about 15 mins! and were well and on time served with one waitress only!  who actually was very nice and patient indeed! :)

Not surprised the wait was long, but I love the Cheesecake Factory. We didn&#39;t have to wait the whole 30 min to be seated, which was good, but it took forever for the waiter to acknowledge us. When he finally came, we ordered our drinks and told him we were ready to order. My fiance ordered water with no ice and to add a lemon wedge and I asked that when we got our bread, if we could only get the wheat and no white. When he brought our drinks, he forgot to bring the lemon, and we had both kinds of breads. It didn&#39;t  bother me, I was hungry and just wanted to eat. My fiance asked for lemon again, and even by the time they brought out the food, we still hadn&#39;t gotten lemon. Finally, he asked again, and he brought it. He didn&#39;t apologize or anything, even after we had already asked a couple of times. Then, before we finished our food, we ran out of our drinks, but he we wouldn&#39;t come to ask if we needed anything or to refill our drinks. By the time we finished our food, he ended up coming and we asked him for water but we were all done with our food. Wasn&#39;t so impressed with the service. I usually get pretty good waiters but this last one wasn&#39;t so great.

Ridiculously rude service. This location needs an attitude check and management/HR refresh. Long wait times are understandable but bad attitudes, unprofessional behavior and employees mumbling under their noses is absolutely unacceptable. You should stick to the Pasadena location. This Americana location needs a lesson in American Hospitality Services.

One of the best experiences I&#39;ve had. I enjoy going to Cheesecake Factory especially the one in Americana. The waiters and waitresses are so friendly and always on top of their game. They make sure everything is in your favor. They give you honest opinions of all the dishes and you never leave unhappy. This is my GO-TO
Great place for a dinner date and open pretty late.   Ask the waitress for her recommendations if your indecisive like me!

Everything on their menu is good. And they have an extensive menu. I love this location because after a good meal you can go out and take a short stroll around the sweetly clean and family-friendly Americana.<br><br>They have the best margaritas in town. I always order the insanely delicious pomegranate margaritas. It&#39;s a combination of sweet and sour, and the salt on the rim just gives it that extra bang. <br><br>The last time I ordered the Steak Diane and Shrimp combo, boy did I not anticipate the tender steak and crispy shrimp that just blew me away. Definitely one of my favorite of the many items I&#39;ve tasted.<br><br>It&#39;s a great place to take family and friends. Service has always been top-notch and place is always immaculate.
Great place to have dinner. My favorite meal is their Santa Fe salad! Also great costumer service.

My son, daughter-in-law, her niece (adult) and I had a meal here on Sunday, Oct. 1,  late afternoon.  When we got here we waited for about 15 minutes before we were seated, no problem, but then the &#34;fun&#34; started.  We waited for 20 minutes before any waiter or waitress appeared.  Finally one waiter came who said that he wasn&#39;t really our waiter - our &#34;real&#39; waiter hadn&#39;t shown up, he said - but he would take our order anyway.  So we waited for our meal for about 20 minutes.  Then three of us were served but not the niece..  She had to wait 20 more minutes for her dish.  The manager came over and said he would comp a piece of cheesecake for her.  After we finally finished eating we waited another 15-20 minutes for the bill which had to be adjusted because of the comp.  So more wait.  This was one of the worst restaurant experiences I have ever had.  It was a memorable meal, for all the wrong reasons.

Came here with my sister on a busy Saturday night. We waited about 10 minutes to be seated and our server Kelly came to our table right away. She was really friendly and brought our drinks fast. After we ordered and our food was brought out she came to check up on us and made sure everything was good. As we were finishing she offered to pack up our leftovers. I will definitely be going back soon.

This is by far the worst Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve ever been to in my entire life. The food was not all that great but even worse , our waitress, Hallie was her name was completely horrible. I work in customer service so I know exactly how it&#39;s suppose to be done. Professionally and respectfully. She was very sarcastic with us. She came to the table to bring us our drinks and threw the napkins at us. That was just for starters. What really took the cake she brought us the bill and we split the bill 4 ways .. So we paid the bill and left a tip. She comes back to us and says &#34;Was my customer service not okay , because of the gratuity you left me&#34; first and foremost you don&#39;t ask customers about your tip. A tip is NOT mandatory how dare she disrespect us in that way. Then she continued to keep fighting it. &#34;You guys didn&#39;t leave a good tip and I was wondering why&#34; we felt harassed because she kept going on and on and we were tryna leave! I&#39;ve never felt so  disrespected in my life. We were fuming we were so mad and disgusted by her actions. Never again will I eat at this location. EVER AGAIN! Yes the Americana is nice but it&#39;s worth having your night ruined by a disrespectful waitress like that. Disgusted.

Strawberry Cheesecake with less than 4 half slices of strawberries on it. I thought it was strawberry season.   Also very light on the strawberry glaze.  Didn&#39;t get my money&#39;s worth and definitely not worth the wait.  Also got our order wrong. I think employees are over worked and dropping the ball.

I average going to the Cheesecake Factory about 2 times a month, my most recent being last friday. You can never go wrong with cheesecake factory. They have a HUGE menu, and serve huge plates, so we always come home with a guaranteed meal for the next day. Service/servers is hit or miss- like any other place. They dont take reservations so have at least one person from your group sign up ahead of time to get you seated. High peak nights and weekends are BUSY so come early.<br><br>Everything here is good. My usual order is wheat bread only, an appetizer, a pasta i can split with someone, and a strawberry shortcake. Every appetizer is good for whatever taste youre looking for. The Sliders are really good! (Add cheese!) For pastas- we love the shrimp bistro pasta- except that recent yahoo article had it being the WORST pasta in terms of calories to order- so we now get the garlic noodles. Still GOOD and im sure still calorie loaded. Oh well.   on a random day- i even tried the orange chicken and it was surprisingly GOOD! It tasted like fresh chicken with the orange chicken flavor, but without the oily bread shell of a typical chinese restaurants&#39;- kinda PF Chang&#39;s Status where the chicken is more than the breaded batter. <br><br>Every time i have a family or friend get together, we eat at Cheesecake- everyone always comes out happy.<br><br>Bonus: Come during happy hour. The appetizers and some items are 5 bucks when usually they&#39;re like 9 or 10 bucks. WORTH IT!
Worst service ever they pass by without asking if you need anything or not i would recommend bj&#39;s foods better and better service

I&#39;m well aware it&#39;s a corporate restaurant with pre frozen food and boxed sauces of all kinds. Yes, I know better than that.<br><br>  Here&#39;s the thing though, but I feel like you can&#39;t take yourself too seriously and you have to bend upon a society filled by those corporate restaurants... At least sometimes...:)<br><br>  That being said, I always go the one at the American in Glendale after a shopping spree with either familyor friends. There is a really cozy patio perfect for people watching and enjoy the mini Bellagio type of water show right by it...:)<br><br>  The food: I always order thir Miso Salmon for lunch and it&#39;s surprisly tasty, along with an Apple Martini, even tastier! Which by the way I love for lunch time since they add Midori to it.<br><br>  I never had a problem with service there, they are always right on it, but again, I always go on down time for a late lunch.

DO NOT EAT HERE<br><br>It&#39;s the only warning you will get. I hadn&#39;t ate at a Cheesecake factory for 2 years because of poor service. This time the service was great but i got the pleasure of chewing on a large piece of plastic hidden in my food. I will never, never, never walk into another Cheesecake factory for as long as i live.

horrible! I dont think I will every go to cheesecake factory again. We had to wait for 50minutes, people were just crawling all around the restaurant. service was horrible and food was worse. I ordere a sandwich and my bread was toasted for so long that it was so hard to chew on it. will never go there again.

I keep going here because my Dad is forgetful these days and he doesn&#39;t remember he is always disappointed when we go here, in any case I order what I feel to be one of the simplest items to make in the kitchen &#34;Cheezburger&#34; and while the content of the Americana Cheeseburger was done gracefully and it was delicious it was also not hot... or warm... it was room temperature at best. I guess I&#39;m weird in that I feel hot food should be served hot but apparently the servers at Cheesecake feel your dish should sit on the service counter for a good 10 minutes before they bring it to your table, how is it that the servers at Apple bee&#39;s manage to bring your food while it still sizzling but they can&#39;t master this craft at Cheesecake factory. You might think I expect too much but the burger cost 13 dollars so maybe yeah I should expect a certain level of performance from the service crew but at this point I&#39;ve written so many bad reviews for Cheesecake in Glendale that if no one has taken notice then it really isn&#39;t effective to continue; five star restaurant this is not.. or four star or even 3.

We came at dinnertime on a Tuesday night and there was a 20 minute wait. Not a big deal. But the service was terrible. They talked a good game, everything we asked for they would say &#34;oh, yes, excellent, right away, of course I can get that for you&#34;. And then never bring it. <br><br>My partner choked on a piece of bread, and I asked 3 people for water, none brought any. When we finally got our waiter to bring some, he brought one glass. There were two of us at the table, but only brought one glass. <br><br>He brought a beautiful garden salad for a starter, but no dressing. Each time we asked for it we were assured it was &#34;coming out of the kitchen now&#34;. What? is the kitchen staff making dressings for individual salads? <br><br>After waiting 45 minutes for entrees, our waiter handed us off to another waiter who also assured us that anything we wanted, he would bring it right away. Which he never did. He did clear the salad plates along with all silverware, and then brought the cheesecake we ordered in a to go container after the meal. When we pointed out that we had not received our entrees yet, he really had a hard time comprehending that fact. When he brought the entrees, I thought it was pretty obvious that he had cleared the table of all silverware, but he didn&#39;t catch on to that fact, so we had to go through another round of asking for something and not getting it. <br><br>Food was okay, but I seriously needed water or some kind of drink, maybe I should have brought some with me.  I will not go back there again

This place deserves a 0 for service. They are very unorganized, it took us 2.5 hours to get a table. When we were finally seated, three people were crammed into one small table. If you can, I encourage you to avoid this place.

Shocked....!<br>A family of 4 with two 6 year old kids and the parents kicked out for NO REASON.....<br>I&#39;m not setting foot in that institution anymore.<br>I was at the Cheesecake Factory at Americana at Brand in Glendale California last Friday. <br>It was a Zoo.... Over 30 parties of 2 to 6 people waiting in line, all frustrated because of wrong information the reception was giving to customers. Telling people the wait is 30 minutes and providing the table in 90 minutes.<br>We were seated at last, witnessing a shocking experience of 2 hungry and thirsty kids crying terrified of the police officers that were denying them service..... For no reason... Imagine that! <br>The gentleman was not aggressive at all; he was mad at the situation and all he was asking was &#34;I need to know who&#39;s kicking me out, I need his business card&#34; <br>I overheard the officer say &#34;this is the only Brian here and we&#39;re not obligated to give you his last name...&#34;<br>The family was escorted out.....<br>Do you wanna have a taste of Cheesecake Factory?

Decided that I needed a side order of sweet potato fries for dinner so my sister and I headed off towards the nearest CF. My Garmin Nuvi is retarded but it brought us to a parking lot right next to CF --- sweet! We went in and asked for a table for two, and were told it&#39;d be about a 35min wait (standard on Saturday nights I&#39;m sure). We went to the nearby B&amp;N with our pager thinking it&#39;d be too far and planned to head back in 20 minutes, but the pager went off in the bookstore around the 20 minute mark and we were stoked! <br><br>We were seated in a four person booth near the bar .. Not bad, as I hate those little two person tables. Not enough room to move, talk, or have a place for my plate. <br><br>David was our server, I believe. He looked REALLY busy but he made sure we were attended to and came by regularly. I LOVE the wheat bread at CF, and after I devoured the first loaf, he brought me two more! Sweeeet! I love the bread! <br><br>We ordered and got our food. The portion of fries was disappointing (got nearly double the amount at a different CF) but it was good nonetheless. My sister got the Thai lettuce wraps and she loved them.<br><br>Lighting was a little too dim in this restaurant, it hurts my eyes but it seems to be the norm. <br><br>Overall great experience! Got to enjoy the fountains outside while waiting as well. Definitely a plus!

I happened to have some guests visiting from another state and we chose the Cheese Cake factory at the Americana to relax and have some lunch at the patio.  The &#34;hostess&#34; gave us an estimated wait time of 10 minutes after which she texted me that our table was ready.  I went to the front desk only to be told: &#34; step to the right with your party&#34;.  When we did, she simply and nonchalantly informed me that: &#34;your table was given to someone else. Anyway you did not wait the entire &#34;15 minutes&#34;, so another 10-15 minutes is not a big deal&#34;.  I was floored by the unapologetic and unprofessional  attitude I was addressed with.<br><br>I get it that the restaurant is busy, but that does not give anyone the liberty of discounting customer treatment and making them feel like herd of cattle. This is exactly how I felt when I stepped to the right and observed that same hostess asking the restaurant&#39;s patrons to &#34;step to the right&#34; and wait there until someone escort them to their respective tables! There was no courtesy or a simple &#34;please&#34;. This is when I had it.  I approached her and asked to speak to a manager; whom did not come until I asked another associate to get me one and after another good 15 minutes had elapsed. Finally a person came and said that he was one of the managers. His explanation was that they are a busy restaurant but he will talk to her.  He also had mentioned that he will personally check on us during our lunch time; but of course it was just talk to shut me up. I never saw him again.<br><br>Well guess what?  I work with the public and I am a consumer myself.  I treat my clients with respect and I do not discount or ignore them. Their perception and feedback mean my success and therefore I take them very seriously.  i will never go back.

I am outside the Cheesecake Factory. I just had dinner with my family. Outside, at central street waiting for an Uber a waiter disrespects me saying to me are you waiting for me baby? I wait for my Uber and while I&#39;m getting in he yells baby why are you leaving me?! And gets back in the restaurant with his white uniform that with very clear logo and letters says Cheesecake Factory. They were two of them. One was dark skin and the other one was white skin with a mustache (I think he looked Mexican). It was an awful awful feeling how can they treat women like this just getting out of the restaurant? Anyways I was hurrying up to get in the car while they yelled at me and got back in the restaurant through the central street door. I feel terrible writting this review. I&#39;ve never been a &#39;snitch&#39; but if I don&#39;t do something about it who will? Are workers at Cheesecake Factory supposed to treat like this to women? Gross.

Like some other establishments, CF will bring you a marguerita that has virtually no tequila in it, in the hope that you will order more drinks to make up for the lack. This is what they did yesterday and I complained to the waitress. I asked her to bring some tequila that I could pour into the drink, explaining to her that the drink was weak. Then she charges me extra for the tequila. I objected, and she sends the manager over who then argued with me. What an unclassy place.

We recently ate at the Cheesecake Factory in Glendale with my aunt, my mom, my nephew and my sister in law.  The food was quite good, especially the salmon salad.  The bread they served before the meal was very tasty.  Service was nice and the waitress was friendly.  We will definetly return here.
There was a piece of cardboard in my food. NEVER coming here again. Been feeling sick ALL day after. I feel like throwing up constantly.

I would give it a 3 star but the wait time to be seated was not worth it. It was an hour and a half wait on a Saturday night (kind of expected judging by the older reviews). With that said the waitress was great but the food not so much. I&#39;ve never tasted fettuccine alfredo so bland before. Such a huge disappointment. The sauce was watery on both the fettuccine and the marina sauce for the mozzarella appetizer, which I wasn&#39;t impressed with either. I&#39;m willing to give it another try just not during prime time and maybe next time I&#39;ll try a steak plate.

Their food is really good. and the portion of their food is the perfect amount to satisfy you but the wait is terrible and very long. I had to wait an hour and a half till my buzzer rang.. i was frustrated, but the pasta i order was amazing!!!

Never again will I go back, took 25 mins to get our appetizer out after the server asked us if we ordered when she was the one who took our order and then I grabbed the manager because it took too long after the server saw us! Then the food took another 15 mins after the appetizer came by that time I wasn&#39;t even hungry anymore. After, when we took a few bites we asked for the check and I wrote down that the soup and salad was on my card and the burger on another, she still got it wrong and I had to get the manager for the second time to charge us the correct amount, I&#39;d get it if we were a big group but it was literally just us two and the soup was cold by the time I got it but after waiting 40 mins for it, I didn&#39;t even want to wait anymore. Never again, this location&#39;s service is always terrible and I&#39;m a server so I have a lot of patience when it comes to servers but this place is just terrible!

Good family spot.  I love having a big meal with my family on the weekend and this is the place to go.   Even though the menu is giant, the food never is bad.  The service is normally great.  <br><br>I would recommend anyone in the mood for a big portion and some good food, come here.

I love the atmosphere. I love that they give you two types of bread to eat as you wait for your meal. I love the diversity of the menu. And of course, I love the cheesecakes! <br>Only downsides? Well, it&#39;s almost always busy. They don&#39;t accept reservations. And it&#39;s a little on the pricey side.

Crowded, the hostess doesn&#39;t know much about her job. They told us we would have to wait 40 minutes, then 40 minutes passed, I ask the hostess and she says another 40 minutes; that&#39;s ridiculous. Spoke with the manager, straightened it out, food was good. Overall pretty good restaurant.
food is good service is need work. Takes to long to see a waiter. They always seem to be too busy.
+Great for groups!<br>+Cheesecake was amazing.<br>+Waitstaff was friendly.<br>-Very busy and weekends.<br>-Food sometimes takes a while.
What is the point of preordering a cheesecake if when you get there they have no record of anything and are a disorganized mess?
Big portions and a never ending menu.  <br><br>The food is alright, I&#39;ve never had anything hear that I craved.  It&#39;s just an Ok-restaurant.
Had lunch and was waited on by server: &#34;Bahan Z&#34; - awesome service and the food was good!

Cheesecake factory is cheesecake factory- great food, wonderful customer service, and big portions for a great price. <br><br>The menu is BIG which can act like a double edge sword so I hope you are decisive! <br><br>Appetizers are so big they can be a meal! Salads and sandwiches s are wonderful.  There pasta dishes are GREAT! BBQ Chicken pizza- Delicious! Steak dishes- yummy! Salmon dishes- Yum- melts in your mouth! Ahi Tuna-- OH MY GOODNESS- my favorite thing to get if I want to splurge! <br><br>I haven&#39;t had much of their &#34;specialty&#34; dishes so I can&#39;t comment much on that. <br><br>But from what I see most people order salads, sandwiches, pasta, and pizza - the things on the menu that are the biggest bang for your buck! <br><br>If it is warm out I recommend sitting out on the patio by the fountain- it  makes your experience that much better. <br><br>Overall great place!

Why is the Cheesecake Factory so damn popular?  <br><br>Without a doubt, I would bet that every Cheesecake Factory consistently has a wait around dinner time around the country...... what is the fascination?  I don&#39;t get it.<br><br>Personally, I think that they have a major staffing issue.  I have been to numerous locations where there was a wait, but yet plenty of empty tables.....  Also, since this one in Glendale opened near my home, I tend to walk down there late at night for a slice of cheesecake (bad, I know) -- and yet, at 9:30 on a Monday, there is still a freakin wait....<br><br>As for the review....<br><br>If you really want to eat at the Cheesecake Factory -- expect a wait.  No you can&#39;t call ahead.  No you can&#39;t make a reservation.  They simply don&#39;t care.  <br><br>The menu is so huge that is puts a Jersey Diner to shame.... you can really eat anything you want.... most of it is pretty good.  If you&#39;re easily overwhelmed, I suggest opening the menu and ordering the first thing that catches your eye.... if you keep looking... you could be there all day long .... holding that table... keeping me waiting...<br><br>I have never had bad service at one..... other than waiting for a table..... forever....... but hey, the weather is nice ... enjoy the fountain show... or something.<br><br>That&#39;s about it.  <br><br>It&#39;s really not worth it.... it&#39;s close... it&#39;s everywhere.... food is fine.... but there are plenty of other places where you can get good food without waiting forever...<br><br>BUT -- The cheesecakes are AMAZING..... but you can just walk up to the counter to get a slice of those.... (but yet, still, you end up waiting longer than you think you should)..... interesting....

What more can I say, it&#39;s Cheesecake Factory. I came to this one because it was close to the Glendale Galleria.<br><br>I would totally come to this one instead of the one in pasadena for two reasons... 1. plenty of parking 2. way more seats/tables.<br><br>Service wasn&#39;t bad at all, our waiter was Max. Orders came quick, food tasted great, drinks were always full, the list goes on. Good work!
Food is always yummy, service lacks due to over crowding. Be ready to waste half your night waiting for a table.<br><br>Great menu!

If you&#39;re a fan of this place you won&#39;t be let down. Solid service and quality of food just like the rest of their locations. A plus here is the location. Once you&#39;re done dining you can stroll along the mall and enjoy a day out.

They really need to come up with a different system for seating, like the buzzer or a text notification letting the customers know their seat is ready. I think it would go a lot smoother that way people won&#39;t have to sit here hoping for their name to be called and instead, shop while they wait. This place is always so crowded and can use a little help.

This review is solely on this specific location of The Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;ve been to dozens of other locations and always had a good experience but this location is ......................... Everytime I&#39;ve come for lunch (work lunches so I can&#39;t turn down), my food has taken FOREVER, it comes out cold, and undercooked (hard pasta, hard chicken). Without fail, this location always fails!

The waiter was ok the manager who i complained to was even nice but the &#39;server&#39; guy who brought my tea was a total creep! He was cocky and appeared to be &#39;high&#39; on something. I&#39;d rather spend my money with someone who appreciates my patronage. Tis the season to lack customer service.. I really hope the manager addressed this situation because this was an extremely uncomfortable encounter.

Im a loyal client of cheesecake factory but Im slightly disappointed at the service i received.. It took the waiter 30 minutes to take the order and about another 20 minutes to bring me the check to check out .

So I&#39;m not really going to comment on the food here, since it&#39;s a chain and the food is pretty good, across all their locations.  Sure their menu is way too big for its own good, but at least you know that there will be something for everyone you&#39;re eating with.  The bread is always nicely warm and the cheesecakes decadent albeit many cloyingly sweet - the best ones that I&#39;ve had that aren&#39;t as sweet are the Vanilla Bean and the Tuxedo.<br><br>The main issue of this review isn&#39;t even the food service, because that was just fine as well... the stinker was the management/logistics.  We came here with a party of 9 for a staff holiday lunch.  The problem: they don&#39;t take reservations!  I understand that they don&#39;t take reservations for smaller parties since they have many smaller tables and booths, but they really need to reconsider their reservation policy for larger groups... especially during the holiday season where many offices are doing their staff holiday appreciation meals.<br><br>Apparently, they only have a few tables that can be assembled/used for large lunches and since other groups had beaten us to the punch, we were told that it would take about 45 minutes for us to be seated.  As we debated waiting, we stood around for 5-10 minutes when a manager came over and informed us that we could split our group into to smaller booths, which he said were next to each other.  He took us to look at the booths and yes, they were next to each other, but they were back to back, so we decided that if anything, we would rather wait for one of the group tables to open up (they &#34;had just gotten their entrees&#34; and &#34;would probably be done soon&#34; - HA, right.. because eating expeditiously is so typical of holiday lunches).  After another several minutes (and my attempts to really make things work), I asked about the patio that we saw other people sitting on, and they said that we couldn&#39;t sit there because the patio was too small and large groups are considered a fire hazard.  I figured this went for their second patio as well, so I didn&#39;t bother to ask.  As we stood outside for another 10 minutes trying to decide what we wanted to do, what our other options in the area were, the manager came over and offered to set up a table on the second patio which was significantly larger, where we ended up having our meal.<br><br>While it was nice and we had a great lunch, I just don&#39;t understand why it took them so long to (point blank) get their sh!t together.  You would think that their managers would be prepped on what to do in these situations, but they obviously aren&#39;t.  I remember when I worked at another similar chain restaurant, the managers there would bust their a$$es and bend over backwards to accommodate large groups because they knew that customers = money and more customers out the door meant more money out the door (what a novel concept!!).  I hope this place pulls it together because while I&#39;ll probably go back to Cheesecake at some point in my life, I&#39;m pretty sure it&#39;s not going to be this one.
Worst place ever. Overrated to the maxxx. Waiting close to 2 hours just for frozen food. Bleh
exelent!! lots of food. You better come very Hungry.
I hate that they don&#39;t take a reservation.  You can&#39;t get in there without waiting 30-45 minutes!  <br><br>But their food it good and the service has always been good!

Okay so I&#39;m a sucker for special deals and today was Cheesecake Factory&#39;s 30th Anniversary... a slice of cheesecake for $1.50 so family treat was on me! <br>We sat in the bar area because it was happy hour time and I didn&#39;t want to wait for a booth but lo and behold this location doesn&#39;t have happy hour... wth??!! Next, the service was horrendous. I think I got a neck cramp from  continuously turning my neck in all sorts of direction looking and waiting for our server to come. The other servers and busboys passed us by many times with a &#34;I&#39;m going to smile at you, but that&#39;s it&#34; look. Fifteen minutes in and our order hasn&#39;t been taken and the complimentary bread  and utensils were still MIA.  Mind you free parking at the Americana is only for 1 hour and after the first hour you gotta fork up 3 buckaroos.  <br><br>We eventually got to order some grub and thank God the wait for it wasn&#39;t too long but geez, the lady who brought our food was a BIG grouch. No &#34;hi, enjoy your food&#34; or a smile. We didn&#39;t get checked up on and the water refills came right before we got our cheesecake.<br><br>Overall, it was one of the worst experiences I&#39;ve had in a LONG time. The only thing that saved the day were the delicious slices of cheesecake that left a huge smile on the fam&#39;s face. <br>Count me out for a comeback and if you decide to come here avoid the waiter that looks like Perez Hilton. But seriously, dont&#39; come here and instead take your cheesecake happy self to the Old Town Pasadena location where they have happy hour and better customer service!

its been ages since i&#39;d last eaten at the cheesecake factory and so i came here with my family after my graduation ceremony.  located in the beautiful americana mall, this is one huge restaurant!  lucky for us it was a friday lunch time and so there was practically no wait to be seated.<br><br>first thing you really notice is how extensive their menu is.  good god they serve all kinds of food... mexican, asian, american, italian cuisines are all represented here.  whether that&#39;s a good thing or bad thing, i don&#39;t know as i&#39;ve only really been to a cheesecake factory a few times... i try not to order asian food from non-asian restaurants.  i go for their most popular dish (according to the menu) which is a cajun jambalaya pasta which is supposed to be very spicy... i was even warned by the waitress.  i&#39;m not a big fan of very spicy food but i figure, i could give it a try.  it wasn&#39;t even spicy a little bit.  nevertheless the pasta itself was delicious.  i had some of my mom and sister&#39;s shrimp bistro dish and the shrimp was awesome!  <br><br>but this being cheesecake factory... you know we had to order some cheesecake.  they have a lot of options but i always go for the fresh banana cream cheesecake... oh my god that thing is divine!  they really don&#39;t disappoint on that front.  best cheesecake i&#39;ve ever had.  <br><br>we had a pretty good experience, we had a really nice waitress and so definitely no complaints on that department.

I really like Cheesecake Factory and now I&#39;m glad that there is one close to me! I live in Burbank and before the closest one used to be either Sherman Oaks or Pasadena, but Glendale is SO much closer. Plus, it is in the Americana and just outside the restaurant is the big fountain with the pretty displays.<br><br>I have been here a few times and so far everything has been great. The only problem I had here was when this place first opened, the waiter gave me the wrong order. However, the mistake was quickly corrected and I left full and happy. I always make sure to save room for cheesecake by eating only half of my meal, if even that much.<br><br>I have always had to wait for a bit to be seated, but it has never been too terribly long. Plus, unlike some locations, this location has plenty of seating in the waiting area.<br><br>This is a place that I frequently go to on my birthday, and while I have been sung to, so have many others on that day. Who knew that my birthday was so common? The fact that I heard a birthday song every 10 minutes should give you an idea how popular this place is!<br><br>If you&#39;re in the mood for a gut-busting meal and if someone wants to take you out for your birthday or another occasion, you should suggest this place. Just plan a workout for the next day!

This location is now in the running to be my fave Cheesecake Factory Location (Sorry Brentwood!).<br><br>The waiting area is by far the biggest I have seen for a CF.  Usually the crazy amounts of people that are usually waiting are crammed into small area and spill out to the exterior, but this was not necessary here as there was ample sitting and standing room.<br><br>Our server, Alex (with the ponytail), was awesome and funny.  Made sure we were completely taken care of.<br><br>Food is great, as with all CF in my opinion.<br><br>Will most definitely be back!

Cheesecake Factory is pretty much the same at each location, but this one didn&#39;t have the same experience. Maybe it was a busy holiday weekend, but I felt like we didn&#39;t have very much contact with the staff once we sat down. Also, we didn&#39;t want bread, but they didn&#39;t ask if we wanted any. We visited this one on a mid-afternoon weekend and it was really busy. <br><br>Thankfully the lunch sized portions are available until 4 pm or so. We ate the barbecue ranch chicken salad and chicken parmesan sandwich. The sandwich came with some lovely fries that were perfectly crisp and seasoned. They were the highlight of the meal for me. <br><br>We finished the meal with lemon raspberry cheesecake, one of my favorites b/c you can finish it in one sitting vs the chocolate ones that are too rich.

My family and I, a group of 10, went out last Sunday to celebrate the anniversary. The best service ever. The waiter( sorry I didn&#39;t get his name) was really enthusiasm and energetic. My family were very happy with all the experience on that night. I bet we made his night too cause we gave him the big tip too.. Well, he deserved it!!
Service was barely there and food took FOREVER! it tasted good, but not impressed with service at all.
Worst service ever. Waited 1.5 hours for a &#34;55 minute wait&#34;. Manager was horrible. Refused to help and lied. Left without eating. Poor staff.

I came here for its soft open and everything was terrible.  I thought, &#34;How are they possibly going to be ready on time?&#34;  I gave it several weeks, and it seems like they&#39;ve ironed out the kinks.  <br><br>There was a 20-30 minute wait on a rainy Friday at one, so be prepared to wait probably longer than that, on average.  (We got a high-top table in the bar area after waiting only ten minutes, though.)  Service was a tad slow, but accurate, considering our orders were a little &#34;high maintenance.&#34;  <br><br>This location is more &#34;spread out&#34; than the Beverly Hills or Grove locations.  MUCH less claustrophobic.  And it&#39;s a nice view, what with the fountain and trolley.  All in all, an A-okay experience.

I have been a fan of cheesecake factory for many years. I always leave feeling satisfied! I don&#39;t usually like chains, but this is by far my favorite one. Everything is delicious! My favorite items are the thai chicken lettuce wraps, avocado eggrolls, santa fe salad, and spicy chicken chipotle pasta. I came to this new location tonight with my mom and we had a lovely time. We got seated outside and it was really nice. I like how this cheesecake is bigger than the one in pasadena. It wasn&#39;t crazy crowded like it usually is. I can&#39;t wait to go back and get one of my favorite dishes! <br><br>P.S. The iced tea is amazing

No. Don&#39;t. Turn your car around and go to Cheesecake Factory in Pasadena or Sherman Oaks. I&#39;ve eaten here on different occasions and only once has it been a good experience. I don&#39;t often give out 1 star, but this place deserves it. I don&#39;t understand how one dish from a restaurant chain can taste so different between locations.<br><br>Don&#39;t get me wrong, I love Cheesecake Factory. My favorite dish is the Seared Tuna Tataki Salad. When I get it at the Sherman Oaks CF, the tuna is always a fresh pink with a nice sear and well-plated salad. The tuna I got last at Glendale CF was almost a gray color with plenty of tendon to chew through. If I&#39;m consuming raw fish, I don&#39;t want it to be the color of the old laces on my shoe. On top of it all the there was salad in my dipping sauce. WHY DO YOU SEND OUT A PLATE WITH RANDOM SALAD IN THE SIDE SAUCE??? When you&#39;re spending $20+ dinner, tip, parking... you&#39;re better off going to another location for the quality.<br><br>The host/wait staff have always been good and accommodating - no complaints there.<br><br>If you&#39;re looking for good eats at the Americana, you&#39;re better off going to Granville Cafe on Brand (check out my review for Glendale Granville Cafe on my profile).

One of my favorite places to eat for lunch or dinner. My boo and I came here the other day. I had the Santa Fe salad. OMG sooo good. The lunch portion was huge, I actually thought it was the dinner. So it&#39;s prefect for sharing. My boo got the fish tacos which were also good. But not as good as my salad, lol. <br><br>In the past I&#39;ve gotten the 4 cheese pasta...it&#39;s very rich and great as leftovers. <br><br>I am also in love with their small plates and snacks. A great place to go out for drinks and appetizers on any night : )

I LOVE Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s one of my favorite restaurants. This is a great location, though on packed nights they really should open up the other patio area. We waited for over an hour to get seated when the seating problem would have been easily solved by opening the other patio. <br><br>They don&#39;t take reservations which is understandable, but it would have been easier for parties of eight or more. <br><br>We had a GREAT server and our food came out quickly. A+ Cheesecake. Only docking stars for the weird seating plan.
Always fun, electric atmosphere. Staff are always professional and courteous at least so far.

Always a good experience coming to this chain. No matter how many times I&#39;ve came here, there&#39;s always something new to try. However I always have the usual staple.... Jambalaya, miso salmon, hibachi steak and steak diane, along with the honey wheat oats bread for starters.  Could never go wrong with those. I wouldn&#39;t get their steak though.

Definitely go there for happy hour.  Mojitos are yumm. We just order the $5 appetizers. For myself, my babe, and our boy we get 3-4 appetizers and it makes for a good dinner. The dumplings are good. Chicken sliders are great. The buns are super yummm &amp; nicely toasted to perfection (most of the time). It&#39;s not the most flavorful stuff I&#39;ve ever eaten but ketchup or soy sauce go a long way for me and I don&#39;t mind.<br><br>Parking is validated for 2hrs I think. Restrooms are pretty clean. There are a couple tv screens in the bar area so I can see some ESPN from wherever we sit (almost everywhere). The servers are hit or miss. Sometimes they&#39;re really nice &amp; attentive and other times, not so much.<br><br>The big plus for us is the water fountain and water show outside the restaurant. Our son could watch it all day if we would let him. If you wanna see the show, it&#39;s on once every hour on the hour (give or take 4mins).

MMMM goodie. Loved the blackened Chicken sandwich. Beautifully blackened, juicy, and enough for 2. Instead of fries my roomie and I asked for steamed Broccoli (which was all right). The chicken comes out on this Texas toast that&#39;s buttered and crispy.  Have a side of the Raspberry Mojito or a glass of White Wine and  you are good to go. I enjoyed the food and so did my friend, but we couldn&#39;t stand the fact that people were eyeballing us hard and kept asking us every 2 seconds are you almost done because we want your table. I ended up snapping at some lady because she was harasser number 12 and we just couldn&#39;t stand it. <br><br>The Cheesecake factory at the American is crazy busy at all times throughout the weekend, so I would try to go on an off day like Tuesday morning.
Let me keep this short and sweet....<br><br>ORDER THE THAI LETTUCE WRAPS.<br><br>Seriously, you won&#39;t regret it. C&#39;est délicieux!

&#34;What I love about the cheesecake factory:<br>Atmosphere, service, food and drinks.<br>My main dish of all time is Chicken Marsala its delicious, trust me I&#39;ve been to other restaurants for Chicken Marsala and none so far can top cheesecake factory. I have tried so many different dishes and cheesecakes and have no complaints. BUT my #1 cheesecake is Kahlua yummy. About drinks my favorite Georgia Peach I can&#39;t leave before I have my Georgia Peach.<br>So, if I love the cheesecake factory so much why didn&#39;t i give it 5stars-- long wait specially on fridays and wknds and the fact that they don&#39;t take reservations. Reservations would be an &#34;A+&#34; That&#39;s really the only reason. Best time to go is lunch/dinner time on weekdays...&#34;

I&#39;m not the hugest fan of the Cheescake Factory at any of their locations.  I ordered their Clubhouse Salad off their Specials menu which apparently means &#34;let&#39;s go skimpy on all the toppings because the patron is paying slightly less than for a salad off our permanent menu.&#34;  It was pretty boring.  <br><br>Service was standard, highlight was the Cucumber Martini I had, very refreshing, I&#39;d definitely recommend that.
I got to go behind the scenes and into their kitchen!  Awesome restaurant, consistent food, and outstanding staff training and teamwork!

Went on a Friday night, expected it to be busy, but it took at least a good ten minutes before we had a waiter come over or even start us with drinks. Our waiter was Dusty, very friendly but we were all surprised at the fact that most of our empty dishes weren&#39;t taken away after we finished eating. In fact some of them were still there when we were eating desert, cheesecake of course. (Which was amazing.)<br><br>So as far as the food goes, *at the time* it tasted good. I had a small dinner salad, no dressing, a personal cheese pizza, a water and a coke. <br><br>I ate nothing else that night besides the cheesecake.<br><br>Went straight home around 9pm.<br><br>And by 11pm, my stomach started acting up.<br><br>*****And yup, I threw up.*****<br><br>Food poisoned???<br><br>I also called them not only once, but twice to let them know what happened. They actually questioned me on what I ate the DAY BEFORE?!  Horrible customer service. I had to speak with 2 managers. Both of them who did not return my calls. All I wanted was to be reimbursed for my food or at least a slice of cheesecake. Jeeze. I really should have written a letter to corporate, but time has passed.<br><br>Thanks Cheesecake Factory.

Brought my parents here for their anniversary during lunch and it was a great experience. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. <br><br>The portions were huge and this was LUNCH only!<br><br>I highly recommend coming here for any occassion. I also recommend the Factory Nachos. <br><br>I had them at another Cheesecake location and they weren&#39;t as good.

Our server was really nice, which is why I&#39;m giving 3 stars. However, it was not so busy when we came in, and two other tables received their bread before us even though we were seated before them. My gf also ordered a lemonade which was somehow completely forgotten. Then once again, the food for the other two tables came WAY before ours. I understand servers can get busy. But the fact that we were there first and got served last sucked. Isn&#39;t that the reason there are food runners in the first place?

I must say I have dined at 10 different cheesecakes and Glendale is the worst experience I have ever had. Took my mom for lunch for her birthday and announced we are celebrating. The waitress not only forgot the birthday but didn&#39;t even ask if we want dessert. The food came out cold and it was Just an utter disappointment.

Good food, many choices. Even though they have a lot of things on the menu, they all are good. I have been to this restaurant at least one a month and the food has always been consistent. The customer service given by the waiters has always been great. All the waiters and waitresses I have come across were very nice, friendly and pleasant. The takeout/dessert counter employees have also been very nice.  Great customer service, but SOME of the hostesses should smile a little. Some of them tend to give an attitude when you initially approach them.

Food was ok but the reason I give it 2*&#39;s  is because a friend and I each spent over $30 on our meal and appetizer, each, and since the appetizer I got was big I was actually full &amp; only took a bit or 2 of my entree. <br><br>We each asked for a to go container and the bags came stapled up &amp; the waitress handed each of us our containers. She goes home, I go back to my hotel, now getting hungry again, open up my container and it&#39;s her food (which I id not want)! She is an hour away from me &amp; while she has a fridge at home I do not in my hotel room! She didn&#39;t want mine either so we each wasted about $20 thanks to the waitress&#39;s mistake!

I don&#39;t know what it is about the Cheesecake Factory (in general) that keeps me coming back even though I know it&#39;ll be the most crowded restaurant of the evening and the average wait time to be seated is at least 40 minutes to 1 hour; but, nevertheless, I came back, this time, to the Americana in Glendale location. <br><br>The food is standard. It&#39;s the same as with other Cheesecake Factories, so there&#39;s nothing on this menu that stands out from the rest. I will say; though, that Avocado Egg Rolls are an all time fave...YUMMY!! I had the Farfalle Chicken &amp; Roasted Garlic. It was tasty, and the portions were HUGE, so needless to say, there were lots left over.<br><br>The service is OK. It was so crowded inside, that the hostesses didn&#39;t really greet anyone walking in, and quickly asked for names, how many were in the party, gave out pagers, told them their wait times and along they went. On the other hand, the bar tender was quick to make our drinks, and didn&#39;t water down our drinks either so that made our wait just a tad more comfortable. Our server was also really nice. She checked back a few times to make sure we were still doing ok.<br><br>OK, so I keep coming back to the Cheesecake Factory for the humongous portions. Come for dinner...have enough for lunch the next day. Most of all, I keep coming back for the consistency. No matter which Cheesecake Factory you go to, you always know what you&#39;re getting, and, so far, the service also seems to be consistent. I have yet to receive bad service.

I used to work for the Cheese, at a different location. I can say I&#39;ve been to a handful of locations, and I would honestly put Glendale near the top when it comes to the steps of service. I have never had bad service at this location. I would ask though why their bathrooms are so small, especially because this is the busiest location  of all of them in the US. <br><br>For food options, it&#39;s endless. If you&#39;ve never been to the Cheesecake Factory, I&#39;d highly reccommend it. Especially for bigger parties. There&#39;s always something for everyone. <br><br>My suggestions are to start with the Avocado Eggrolls and the TexMex Rolls. Order a pasta dish, a steak dish, and a salad for the table. Share all the plates. Then finish off with coffee from the coffee bar and a mudpie sundae and a slice of fresh strawberry cheesecake. You won&#39;t go wrong. Promise!

The Americana pipes in music throughout the property, an excellent sound system with great musical standards.  <br>The Cheesecake Factory has different music on their patio, classic rock I believe, and a really, really poor sound system. <br>I really wish the patio music didn&#39;t exist, it really spoiled a beautiful Sunday afternoon outside enjoying cheesecake and beer!

Cheesecake Factory. Always nice.<br><br>Whether your in the Venetian Hotel in Vegas or Marina Del Ray (my mother&#39;s favorite one), expect to have great food with great atmosphere. <br>I always look forward to The Cheesecake Factory on my west coast trips because The Cheesecake Factory (opened 2003) in Honolulu, Hawaii does not feel the same way.<br><br>This is my first time to the Glendale&#39;s location. I must say the restaurant and everything about the Americana is different. Having just finished a day with my family at Universal studios, it was great to leave the crowded areas to a nice sit down place in a district that is relaxing and seemingly away from the touristy areas (I ate at the one near Disneyland later that week and though food was the same, it felt different). Found Glendale&#39;s CF thanks to the GPS.<br><br>The service was adequate. The food and the ambiance was well worth it and made me feel at peace which was what I was going for when I set out on vacation.<br><br>I thought Avocado Eggrolls  was a peculiar combination. I would not considered ordering it until I asked for the waiter to suggest an appetizer.<br><br>Avocado Eggrolls is different and I was surprised. It was very good.<br>A taste I have not experienced before!<br>I like different as eating out should be an adventure at times.<br><br>Overall, The Cheesecake Factory is a name that I trust whenever I&#39;m on vacation.<br>Word of caution, do not expect the same type of atmosphere in Honolulu, Hawaii.
Great place but the utensils have been pretty dirty lately which makes me wonder how clean their kitchen is :/

Disgusted!!!! <br>I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory before and never had any problems other than the wait. <br>I went there today and there was no wait, they sat us down right away. <br>We ordered the Lemon Herb Roast chicken, it comes with mash potatoes and carrots. So our food arrives and i started splitting it up for me and my bf and guess what!!! A fucken Pubic hair is in the carrots! Can you believe that??!!! I was so Disgusted!<br><br> I call the waiter over and she takes the plate and calls over one of the Managers. They both apologize and tell me they&#39;ll make another plate right away! I wasn&#39;t even hungry at that point but my bf still wanted to eat....  So our second plate comes and I inspected as much as I can. So my bf eats they kept checking on us making sure we were fine and they bring the bill over and come to find out they charged us twice!!! Wtf... The waitress apologizes and says she&#39;ll take it off, then comes back and they still charged for one! <br>I asked to talk to the Manager and she talks to him instead, they finally take  both off the price! But seriously the fact that I had to tell them to take it off the bill is annoying! Really?<br>I shouldn&#39;t have to ask them to comp it, I could have caused a scene Or something! So pissed never going there again! Does anyone know if I can report them to the health dept. or something?

I like the atmosphere, the area, and the of course the food. I usually get the crab cake bites and a lemon drop martini. I also get the seared Ahi tuna salad. Food is always delicious here. No complaints.

I had bad service here: no drink refills, no clearing of dirty dishes, long wait for the bill, then given the wrong bill and a waiter that looked irritated at my requests for the bill and a question I had about validating my parking ticket. I complained to the manager on duty, Meagan, who covered the whole bill because she saw our table with the empty water glasses and the mess of dishes. She was awesome and I will be returning.

The only reason I&#39;m giving this place 4 stars is for our waiter grant h his service was the best I went yesterday with a co worker for lunch we had 3 hrs before we had to go back to work first the hostess was a little rude asked my name how many told us to wait as we sat their for them to call our name I kept seeing people come in and right away being seated after the 3rd family being seated my co worker went to ask how long the wait was the hostess said oh let me have them seat you now that meant if we would have not said anything we would just have waited we the get seated in a small table just enough to have our drinks I felt I was sitting on the guys lap next to me Lol! When our waiter grant arrived we asked if we were able to move to a booth which he help us do his service was the best !!! A little tip for the hostess if you are not a people person or having a good day you should not work with people  as for good it was average

This was my first time to the Americana. We were able to actually get an outside seat and observe the water show. however the service outside was horrible! I had to figure out who our waiter was, had to get up and ask for water  (after being seated for 10 minutes). Didn&#39;t take our order for another 15 minutes! Food was served cold, had to get up again and ask for refill of my drink! So not the Cheesecake Factory experience I am accustomed too!
